title: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: This is a big, sturdy, and firmly textured wine that smells like oak spices, tastes like raspberries and milk chocolate and has a relatively easy mouthfeel for this notoriously tannic varietal.

title: La Storia by Trentadue 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Tropical and voluptuously full bodied, this wine is oak-laden and ripe in apple, pineapple and mango, with a lemony aftertaste of uplifting acidity.

title: Gracianna 2015 Estate Mercedes Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Cherry, grenadine and rose petal mix on the nose of this vineyard-designate, which is creamy and fully rich on the palate, with a touch of gravel. Vanilla shows through on the grip of oak.

title: Hoopla 2015 Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: Melon and fig mark the fruity nature of this wine, which offers a generous helping of oak alongside intense, up-front acidity. Tangerine slices brighten the thick concentration of other fruit and medium-bodied texture.

title: Oberon 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Dried herb and a twist of lemongrass provide an exotic edge to this light white, which is moderate in acidity and fruity in melon and kiwi. The freshness persists with ease on the finish.

title: Pomar Junction 2014 Mourvèdre (El Pomar District)
description: Plump blackberries meet with roasted meat, rosemary, spearmint, dried rose petals and cherry cola aromas on the plush nose of this bottling. There's strong energy to the sip, with tart black plum skin flavors alongside purple flowers and a growing caramel element on the finish.

title: Rendarrio Vineyards 2016 Baja-Ha Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling explores a richer tropical side of the grape, with aromas of plumeria, guava, coconut oil, passion fruit and fresh tangerines. The palate combines mango and coconut flavors that are cut by zesty Key lime juice.

title: Rolling Plains 2013 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A perfumed nose of rose, lavender and forest floor gives way to velvety texture and light-bodied notions of red cherry, strawberry, rhubarb and dried herb. The acidity is wrapped in citrus tones.

title: Sierra Starr 2014 Old Clone Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: This attractive medium-bodied wine has dried cherry and plum aromas, late-picked fruit flavors and a fairly smooth texture. It has subtle, spicy, tea-like nuances that add complexity.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2016 LoverGirl Late Harvest Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's potential to this as a regional dessert wine. Aromas of honeysuckle, ripe Asian pear and Gala apple lead into a palate of honey glaze, lemongrass and pear syrup. It's a fresh after-dinner sipper.

title: Auburn 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: Fruity smelling, smooth and mouth-filling on the palate and full of ripe plums flavors, this full-bodied wine sourced from multiple northern California counties emphasizes richness.

title: Berryessa Gap 2014 Tempranillo (Yolo County)
description: This enjoyable wine is complex and intricate in flavor, blending ripe plum and sour cherry notes with black olive, black pepper and bay leaf nuances. It's medium-bodied, smooth in texture and not very tannic.

title: Butter 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: A smoky, charred aroma and buttery, heavily toasted flavors clearly define this full-bodied Chardonnay. It's going for the full oak treatment with no apologies. Ripe pear and pineapple lurk underneath the smoke, clove and nutmeg overlay, and a bit of oak tannin combines with good acidity to give a welcome bite to the texture.

title: Cinque Capre 2014 Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: This massively structured wine from a new AVA within California's Contra Costa County is extremely oaky and extremely tannic, so people who love those attributes should love it. The aroma is like cedar and pencil shavings, and the wine tastes very concentrated, spicy and smoky. It has a grippy texture due to a high level of both wood and grape tannins that leave a drying sensation on the palate. Best after 2024.

title: Hagafen 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Coombsville)
description: A subdued nose opens the door to a thickness of cranberry and cassis-tinged tartness in this densely tannic wine. There's a hint of brightness from underlying acidity that peaks on the midpalate before a modest finish.

title: Hoopla 2014 The Mutt Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend is Merlot-driven, with 87% of it represented, the remainder 7% Malbec, 4% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's fun and fruit-driven, heartily well-made for an attractive price. Cinnamon, blackberry pie and charred oak mix well on the palate within a soft herbaceous backbone.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Super Tuscan Red (San Diego County)
description: Bright cranberry, earthy herbs of oregano, thyme and dried sage and toasted wood show on the nose of this blend of 78% Sangiovese, 14% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 3% Lagrein. Herbs and smoke play with red plum and strawberry on the sip, which is framed by squeaky tannins.

title: La Follette 2015 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This wine is straightforward, refreshing and non-oaky in style, offering citrus aromas, rather lean and savory flavors and a nice underpinning of acidity to keep it crisp and appetizing.

title: Matchbook 2013 Tempranillo (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This is a substantial wine with a spicy, lightly herbal aroma and lots of fruit flavors that spread across the palate. It is medium to full-bodied, has a smooth texture and a good dose of raspberry-like acidity that keeps it fresh.

title: Montage Vineyards 2016 Rosé (Malibu Coast)
description: This wine, which is a beautiful shade of pink, shows buoyant aromas of strawberry, Key lime pith and baking soda, making for quite a classic nose. Watermelon and melon rind flavors show on the sip, which has compelling texture and a cotton-candy finish. It's a strong showing for the new region.

title: Dante Robere NV Two Cellar Rats V Red (California)
description: Charred oak and wood smoke aromas make this full-bodied wine a two-note song. It tastes as toasted and oaky as it smells, not letting much fruit flavor show through.

title: Sepal Estate 2017 Soft Red (California)
description: This is a light and lightly sweet wine that looks like a dark rosé, smells very fruity and tastes like cherry juice. It is simple and soft: something to please people who don't like dry wines.

title: French Bar 2016 Gold Dust Red (California)
description: A strong aroma of cedar wood and fresh-cut oak lead to smoky cranberry, blackberry and wood-ash flavors and a flood of tannins. The wine is deep in color and aggressive in flavor.

title: Millésimé 2012 Bleu Saphir Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot is very extracted on the nose with strong blackberry, pepper, roasted beef and balsamic aromas. It's tart and tangy on the palate, with a hint of black plum and mint chocolate chip.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Barrel Select Classico Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Merlot, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Syrah all make it into this moderately ripe blend, which is aged under a year in American oak. Herbal with a taste of black and red currant, it finishes with a mouthful of tannin.

title: Collier Creek 2016 Front Coach Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Green aromas like pine needles and celery are followed by rather tangy apple and herb flavors in this medium-bodied, basic and refreshing wine.

title: Gen5 2016 Ancestral Red (California)
description: This soft but full-bodied wine smells like maple syrup and brown sugar and tastes ripe, almost sweet, due to low acidity and plenty of oak treatment.

title: Melt 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This wine is buttery all the way through. It starts with an aroma of buttered popcorn, proceeds to Butterfinger candy flavors and has an almost sweet finish. Not for dry wine diehards, but it's a fun thing to sample.

title: Simi 2017 Dry Rosé (Sonoma County)
description: Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec, Syrah, Zinfandel and Graciano, all stainless-steel fermented, this wine is earthy and rough, with a diluted palate of peach fuzz and blueberry.

title: David Bruce 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is creamy and hugely oaky, with a sweetness of candied marshmallow.

title: Winery by the Creek 2012 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)
description: Earthy aromas and herbal, iron-like flavors of mineral and tomato highlight this medium-bodied, lightly tannic and mature wine.

title: Millésimé 2014 Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Extremely extracted aromas of blackberry juice veer toward vinegar on the nose of this bottling. That balsamic aspect dominates the palate.

title: Millésimé 2014 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Extremely extracted and concentrated aromas of cherry syrup and grenadine show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is sweet and syrupy with cherry-balsamic flavors.

title: Sevtap 2013 How You Doin'? Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Candied blackberry runs into a strong vinegar kick on the nose of this blend of 51.25% Merlot, 26.75% Malbec and 22% Cabernet Franc. It's extremely tangy on the sip, with sharp black-plum-skin flavors.

title: Millésimé 2012 Lumiere Du Fleur Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 54% Merlot, 38% Cabernet Franc and 8% Cabernet Sauvignon is extremely dense and yet tangy on the nose, and cloudy in the glass. The palate is overly tangy and muddy.

title: Simi 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Reductive and sulfurous, this wine tastes of big oak, baked pineapple and hazelnut.

title: Larkmead 2015 Salon Red (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Cabernet Franc, this is a tremendous wine, offering grippy red-currant, tobacco and graphite components around a full-bodied core of weight and breadth. Powerful yet elegant, it retains and celebrates much of the Cab Franc character in its unabashed embrace of dried herb, clove and violet. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Schramsberg 2000 J. Schram Late Disgorged Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Both delicate and flavorful, this exceptional wine defines elegance. It starts with a subtly spicy ginger-cookie aroma that leads to layers of citrus, baking spices and toasted bread on the rich palate. After 18 years since the vintage, this still offers persistent, fine bubbles, bracing acidity and a fresh mouthfeel.

title: Larkmead 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With a tiny 3% addition of Cabernet Franc, this wine is defined by aromas of violet and crushed rock. Oak, clove and graphite dot a landscape of bold structure on the palate, with bright acidity balancing the concentration and grip. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Roar 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The Franscioni family is making some of the best wines on the Central Coast, as evidenced in this bottling, which shows tremendous concentration without being overripe or overextracted. Aromas of purple and red flowers meet with minty tarragon and pine needle on the nose, while the palate's black cherry and boysenberry flavors are lifted by touches of eucalyptus and pine needle.

title: Callaway 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Stewed red fruits, sweet sagebrush and anise show on the nose of this bottling. Rustic flavors of cooked boysenberries and pomegranate are cut by a slightly sour funkiness.

title: Merriam 2013 Gloeckner-Turner Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Rockpile)
description: There's not much on the nose of this wine, which is made from grapes grown at 1,300-feet in elevation in the wilds above Healdsburg. On the palate, features of leather, big black currant, graphite and oak combine around sizable tannins that pucker on the finish.

title: Wayland 2016 Red (California)
description: This wine has a lot of candied-fruit aromas and almost-sweet cherry flavors accented by vanilla and butter. It has a soft texture and very little tannin or acidity.

title: Fallon Place 2015 Landa Vineyard Zinfandel (Chalk Hill)
description: From a small 40-year-old site in the appellation, this wine presents as stewy and overly ripe in ways that don't complement. Plum and leather poke through sizable sticky tannin.

title: Lucinda & Millie 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a basic, sturdy wine, medium to full bodied, smelling meaty and herbal, and tasting like blackberries. It has good heft on the palate due to moderate tannins.

title: Three Thieves 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine tastes fresh and grapey and has a grippy tannic texture. A wallop of deep black-fruit flavors comes off as a little bit green and tight but at this price who is complaining?

title: Big Six 2015 Whiskey Bourbon Barrel Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An assertive wood-smoke aroma and pervasive sweet-oak flavors dominate this full-bodied and heavily spiced wine.

title: California Square 2013 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Red fruit, asphalt, dried herbs, cola concentrate, prune and animal skins show on the nose of this wine that comes in a square-shaped bottle. Caramelized blackberries and caramel show on the syrupy palate.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Zephyr's Block Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is simple in a mix of marshmallow and vanilla, its oak speaking loudly and with a whiff of sulfur.

title: Paso Ranches 2015 Bourbon Barrel Aged 3 Months Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bourbon barrel-aged expression shows stewed red fruits, dried ginger and mace spice on the nose. The palate starts smooth, plush and full but then the extremely powerful acidity is almost painful, leading into a vanilla and white-chocolate finish.

title: Reyes 2011 Muscat (California)
description: Smoke, ash, sandstone, candied lemon rinds and a touch of botanicals show on the wild nose of this bottling. The palate is sweet and thick with tropical fruit-salad flavors of pineapple, pear and maraschino cherries.

title: Callaway 2013 Wild Yeast Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Underripe black plum, wet clay and exotic Indian spices show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit simple and muddy, with flavors of cooked blackberries, pencil shavings, wood spice and baked earth, packing in both tannins and acidity.

title: Eagle Eye 2013 Proprietary Estate AlphaWolf Vineyard Reserve Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: Huge puckering tannins make it hard to decipher the fruit imparted by this blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon with 14% Cabernet Franc and 5% Petit Verdot. Oak, cedar and pencil shavings make it through the hearty ripeness.

title: 2Plank 2015 Piste-Off Red (Amador County)
description: This wine has attention-getting cedar and spice aromas followed by extremely oaky flavors and a quite tannic astringent texture. The woody spice-cabinet element is very strong and nearly overwhelms the mild black-cherry flavors underneath.

title: Big Smooth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Obvious spicy and smoky oak aromas lead to equally strong oak flavors in this fruity two-dimensional wine. It has medium body and moderate tannins that give a little support to the otherwise sweet-seeming flavors.

title: 2Plank 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: An overt, almost raw oakiness overwhelms the grape flavors in this full-bodied, tannic and tight wine. It smells strongly like cedar and toasted oak, tastes spicy and woody, and feels astringent on the palate.

title: Big Vine 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This older vintage wine is dusty in red cassis and currant with a dullness to the palate that makes it hard to decipher or recommend.

title: Auburn 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Raw and smoky oak aromas and a drying mouthfeel make this an extreme-style wine. The texture is astringent and gives the low-level fruit flavors a bitter edge.

title: Domenico 2012 Syrah (Amador County)
description: This is an unusual take on the grape varietal. The wine has an aroma like sunbaked earth and mature, almost sweet flavors of maple and toffee.

title: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)
description: Puckering and somewhat green, this wine is black in color and too muddled to recommend.

title: Newton 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Freshly turned earth underlies burly grippy tannin and integrated oak in this complex and concentrated appellation wine. Cedar, graphite and currant provide nuance along a tension of acidity and moderate ripeness.

title: Tessier Winery 2016 Saveria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Tightly wound aromas of red currant, rose petals and carnations show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is full of hibiscus and other red-flower flavors, with a touch of cinnamon spice and cedar, all wrapped in a soft mouthfeel.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Pilgrim Vineyard Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a rich warm mouth-coating wine that's packed with ripe, almost late-harvest, berry flavors, and that feels smooth and dense on the tongue. It is inviting, layered, concentrated and full bodied, showing moderate tannins and a long finish.

title: Écluse 2015 Ensemble Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted wood, dense but not overripe black currant and crushed slate show on the nose of this blend of 32% Petit Verdot, 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 26% Merlot, 13% Cabernet Franc and 3% Malbec. Rounded and rich blackberry meets with dust and fennel pollen on the palate, which is vibrant with acidity.

title: Écluse 2015 Insider Red (Paso Robles)
description: There are hints of thyme, pepper and roast game on the nose of this blend of 25% Tannat, 25% Petit Verdot, 25% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc, yet it's mostly framed by crisp blackberry and lavender aromas. The full-bodied palate blends fresh acidity with sage-like seasonings and a roasted-plum flavor, set against thick yet polished tannins.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2017 Estate Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light in color, this perennially lovely white is fragrant and varietal, lush in white peach, lychee and vanilla. Ginger and lemongrass give an intensity on the crisp, complex finish. It starts and ends dry.

title: Hanna 2013 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: With the richness of blackberry cobbler, this wine dually offers complex structure and layers of earth and spice, from clove and black pepper to dried herb. It has substantial power and length on the midpalate and through the finish, ending in a linger of gunpowder and sage.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Beatty Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Earthy notes of turned earth lead the way to cassis and cherry coulis amid a background of dusty crushed rock and mineral in this impressive, ranch-specific wine. Bright streaks of acidity lift the grippy tannin. This is built to age, so enjoy 2024-2029.

title: Stewart Cellars 2017 Rosé (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Robust with a floral nose, this is juicy and generously fleshy, with strong flavors of blood orange and strawberry. The acidity is balanced and uplifting, with just enough heft to pair effortlessly with food.

title: Adaptation 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 22% Merlot, this wine is made by Odette's winemaker, part of the PlumpJack group. It's a crowd-pleasing wine, concentrated and structured, yet floral, rich and round, with length and freshness on the finish.

title: Babcock 2016 Eye of the Beholder En Tirage Rosé of Grenache (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is an inventive and stunning bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard by Bryan Babcock. A beautiful shade of hot pink and extremely cloudy in the glass, this wine shows lush aromas of strawberry cake, vanilla and caramel on the nose. The mouthfeel is creamy but the flavors are tangy with kumquat, and that compelling combo holds until baked goods arise on the finish. It is a really fascinating wine.
designation: Eye of the Beholder En Tirage Rosé of

title: Beauregard 2015 Coast Grade Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: There's an intriguing and somewhat thick forest-spice element throughout this bottling, with juniper, pine and menthol aromas decorating the cooked red-cherry nose. The palate is also rich with herbaceous elements, offering bay leaf, black pepper and Indian spices against rhubarb, beet and stewed plum flavors.

title: Caliza 2014 Sympatico Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Star anise, caramel, black plum and black currant show on the rich nose of this bottling, which is enhanced with 12% Grenache and 12% Monastrell. There is solid acidic energy to the palate, lifting up the cassis and gingerbread flavors that ride polished tannins into the finish.

title: Marimar Estate 2015 Don Miguel Vineyard Dobles Lías Estate Grown Estate Bottled Unfiltered Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Named Dobles Lías because it is given extended lees contact to add richness and texture, this wine impresses in its heady tones of honey and brioche. Tropical pineapple and a touch of brine give it a complementary yin-yang spirit that works.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Dobles Lías Estate Grown Estate Bottled Unfiltered

title: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Nearly pitch black in the glass at first glance, this is a meaty, gooey Petite Sirah, offering aromas of caramel, blueberry and fudge. The flavors are also lavish and thick with black currant, roasted meat, black plum, vanilla, caramel and fudge, surrounded by mouthcoating tannins.

title: Saracina 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: Concentration and depth are the hallmarks of this fresh, flavorful, bracing wine made from organic grapes. It matches bright citrus and grassy aromas with deep, layered melon, fig and prosciutto flavors that seem to expand on the palate.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tangy and delicate, this coastal wine is dominated by vibrant acidity and an Asian spice tone. Teases of orange peel, red cherry and gravelly forest floor flavors emerge on the well-balanced palate.

title: Windstream 2014 Sarmento Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light, delicate and lovely on the nose, this single-vineyard expression offers fresh and clean aromas of light pear and lemon rind. The palate picks up toast and toasted nut flavors, with rounded pear flesh, honeysuckle and tangy tangerine rinds as the backdrop.

title: La Folia Winery 2014 Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a very distinctive, aromatic and enchanting wine that successfully evokes the magic of its Italian relative, Chianti Classico, in the heady mix of black olive, sage, tamarind and new leather aromas followed by tangy, savory, cranberry and tea flavors. The texture is grippy and lightly astringent, while the balance feels perfect.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 Rocky Knoll Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy tight-grained oak dominates in this rich and structured red, that is thick in tannin and buoyant brambly black cherry and blackberry. Its full-bodied concentration is rich and layered, supported by a thread of persistent acidity that refreshens.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Rio Vista Vineyard Dijon Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rusty earth aromas of shiitake, soy, dried cranberry and muddy soils show on the nose of this clonal study by Norm Yost. Dried red-plum flavors provide the backbone to the palate, where earthy sagebrush, forest moss and tangerine rind aspects combine for an intriguing sip.

title: Graveyard 2015 Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: This is a winner for fans of gamy Syrah. Loads of black pepper, roasted lamb and charred beef show on the nose. The palate is zippy, with acidity and pepper that surround more hearty flavors of roasted pork, stewed black plum and grilled fig.

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Forty Two Red (Central Coast)
description: This jammy and likable blend of Petite Sirah, Mourvèdre and Syrah shows blackberry and applewood smoke on the nose. There is great layering and depth to the palate, where rich blueberry and black-currant flavors are cut by firm tannins and bright acidity.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 Bailey Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling offers prominent aromas of boysenberry and blackberry, as well as turned earth and spearmint. Medium bodied and framed by polished tannins and zesty acidity, the palate shows the same berry and mint mix, making for a flavorful and balanced feel.

title: Sea Smoke 2015 Southing Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft aromas of strawberry and grenadine meet with a subtle wild mint on the nose of this bottling. The polished palate shows similar touches, with a strawberry-mint sorbet flavor as well as tangy cranberry skins.

title: Eden Rift 2016 Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: Rather light in the glass and shy in aromas at first, this bottling eventually reveals its delicate streak of pomegranate and dried rose petals on the nose. The fresh lightweight palate offers cranberry, pine needle and rosewater flavors, proving subtle, mellow and a great start for this new project on a historic chunk of land.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of boysenberry, leather, juniper and pine needle show on the minty nose of this bottling by Norm Yost. It's full and fairly powerful on the palate, with ripe black raspberry and loads of clove and allspice flavors.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The four years of age is giving this bottling quite an aromatic depth, with juniper, clove, tea and turned earth spicing up the stewed red-fruit backdrop. The acid is still solid on the palate and the texture is grippy, with flavors of roasted cranberry and star anise, showing lots of life left in the bottle.

title: Groth 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Barrel-fermented with 19% Sémillon, this white impresses in light flavors of peach, apricot and lime. Citrus-driven acidity and a tease of wet stone creates a buoyant feel to the fleshy palate. It's complex and undeniably delicious.

title: Sea Slopes–Fort Ross Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an impressive selection from Winemaker Jeff Pisoni. A hint of forest-floor spice and strong flavors of dark cherry and orange combine on a light, silky texture. This offers a great sense of finesse within a framework of structure and freshness.

title: Baileyana 2016 Firepeak Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Damp forest floor, dark berries and campfire aromas kick off the nose of this twist-top bottling that's always a solid Pinot Noir for a fair price. The palate is rich with earthy flavors of juniper and turned loam, and there is a rich mulberry component in the background leading into the acid-washed finish.

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Aromas of bursting boysenberries, sweet mint and dried flowers make for an exciting and fresh entry to this bottling. There is decent weight to the palate, where dark berry, licorice, sage oil and lavender flavors play out.

title: Newton 2015 Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Slightly reduced and with a robust flavor of toast, this wine offers steely acidity beneath its core of apple-led fruit, remaining balanced and complex in the glass. Lasting elements of anise and lemongrass tease on the finish.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 Willow Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: There's great depth and complexity on the nose of this bottling, which offers blackberry, gravel, hot earth, pepper and thyme aromas. It's full on the palate, but the tannins are firm and tight, offering elegant flavors of dense plum, dark chocolate and asphalt. Persistent acidity carries through to the finish.

title: Pulchella 2016 Mercenary Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling, which includes 3% Tannat, is very fruit-forward but in a measured way, starting with red-plum jelly and red-cherry candy that benefit from sprinklings of licorice and sagebrush spice. The palate is lush and soft, cut by steadily rising acidity, and showing flavor of dark-red fruit and cinnamon.

title: Roar 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Golden apples, lime zest and lemon blossoms show strongly on the sunny nose of this bottling. The palate offers a tangy lemon-lime acidity and a chalky texture, proving racy and almost spicy with citrusy acidity.

title: Tolosa 2016 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Leathery tannin leads the way to a feral, wild quality in this wine—a savory persistence that intrigues and provokes the palate. Dense notions of dark cherry and black tea mingle around a forested spice that's part crushed rock mineral, part earthy mushroom.

title: Cinnabar 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This appellation blend starts with a rich, inviting and impressively layered nose, showing singed Meyer lemon rinds, roasted nuts and crème brûlée, but also a refreshing touch of honeysuckle. The palate is framed by fresh lemon spray that gives vibrancy to the chalky palate, which also offers creamy butter richness.

title: Dovecote 2015 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Deep and candied blackberry aromas are lifted by violets on the ripe yet elegant nose of this bottling by the new owners of Thompson Vineyard. There's a solid core of blackberry to the palate, but hints of sweet thyme, purple flowers and vanilla on the finish. The structure is classically stiff and the acidity is buoyant.

title: Eric Kent 2015 Kalen's Big Boy Blend Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: Big tannin and oak become smooth and integrated in the glass as this burly, intense wine opens. Tasting of blueberry pie and brioche, it leaves a lasting impression of rich rounded goodness that's sure to please and impress.

title: Jax 2016 Calesa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A rich, rounded entry starts off this voluptuous, layered and clove-spiced wine that offers length and breadth on the palate. Baked orange and cherry flavors exude warmth and complement tones of forest floor and white pepper.

title: Jayson 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A whole-cluster pressed white aged in both French oak and stainless steel, this wine is richly woven in lemon verbena, pineapple, quince and grapefruit, its structure complex, lengthy and moderate in acidity.

title: Terre Rouge 2017 Vin Gris d'Amador Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: This fascinating wine blended from five Rhône grape varieties—both red and white—has enough character and body to pass as a full-fledged red, and in fact the color is much deeper than most rosés today. A plethora of plums and raspberries fill the aroma and spread richly across the palate.

title: Ancien 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Candied boysenberry fruit, dried sagebrush, pepper spice and a pinch of purple flowers show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate combines earthy and herbal tones of bay leaf and pine needle with black-plum flavors, wrapped in tense tannins.

title: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Crisp and creamy in Meyer lemon meringue and grapefruit, this lovely white also has flavors of red cherry and is acid-driven, with ample body to complement the freshness. It finishes in a lingering taste of wet stone.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Gran Reserva Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Central Coast)
description: Deep and hearty in the glass, this built-to-last bottling shows black currant, roasted coffee, cocoa powder, new leather and cola on the nose. Chiseled yet sticky tannins and powerful acidity frame the palate, where dark-berry, root-beer and chocolate flavors reign. Drink 2021–2034.

title: Decades5 2012 Stagecoach Vineyard Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: From the wilds of Atlas Peak this is a 100% varietal wine, aged nearly two years in 100% French oak. Dusty and bright, with lingering waves of toasted coconut, it offers persistent freshness and tamed tannins around strong flavors of mocha and raspberry.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 McDonald Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This tightly wound, dense wine shows a touch of reduction on the nose. It's tart and spicy, with layered flavors of tangerine, mint, cardamom, tobacco and white pepper that intrigue and delight.

title: Justin 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Rather boisterous on the nose, this bottling shows fresh aromas of black cherry alongside pencil shavings and milk chocolate. There is solid depth to the palate, where flavors of smashed blackberry and boysenberry meet with tangy black-plum skins and roasted coffee notes on the finish.

title: Lang & Reed 2017 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)
description: This medium-bodied wine offers depth and complexity that are unusual for the varietal in California. It has lightly earthy, mineral, figgy aromas, a palate-coating texture and layers of flavor that unfold from apple to almond to fig, giving it the substance to be a main-course wine, not just a pre-dinner beverage.

title: Lichen Estate 2016 Moonglow Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This nicely balanced wine poses tantalizing, bright fruit flavors against relatively full body and wraps them in a velvety blanket of fine-grained tannins. Red cherry, cranberry and light earthy notes give it welcome complexity.

title: Loubud 2017 Cebada Vineyards Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Pale pink in the glass, this rosé shows very subtle aromas of thin lemon-skin ribbons, raspberry water and a whiff of cotton candy on the inviting and fresh nose. There is extreme grip to the sip, which is all about texture and freshness, showing delicate touches of lime, chalk and pink-fleshed fruit.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Pratt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is exotic on the nose in rose and white pepper, as it opens into a palate of thick rich cherry-cordial flavor and enduring acidity. The freshness complements the lushness of the fruit and maintains a lively aspect of brightness.

title: Terre Rouge 2016 Viognier (Fiddletown)
description: Full flavored and rather full bodied, too, this wine exudes vivid and spicy aromas of pears, browned butter and toasted almonds, feels broad and mouthfilling and has softly ripe flavors. Light baking spices add complexity and a nicely viscous texture combines with good acidity for a lingering finish.

title: Treana 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted blackberry, soft vanilla and rich milk chocolate aromas start off this suave blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Syrah. Polished tannins frame flavors of black-cherry and caramel on the palate, resulting in a rich and pleasing wine.

title: Waits-Mast 2015 Deer Meadows Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Aromas that are slightly earthy at first become spicy, complex and fruity and lead to good red-cherry and rhubarb flavors in this medium-bodied elegant wine. Moderate tannins and good acidity balance it out well.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Inception Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 83% Cabernet Sauvignon and 17% Syrah shows dark, roasted black plums and berries as well as charred beef and green peppercorns, proving both very ripe yet still a tad green on the nose. It's thick on the palate with elderberry and black-currant flavors, wound together by rigid tannins, and finishing on caramel, vanilla and pepper.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2014 Laetitia Vineyard Tempranillo (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Bursting aromas of black raspberry, bright blackberry, lavender and chaparral scrub make for an intriguing nose to this single-vineyard Tempranillo. There's a leathery Old World vibe to the palate, where gamy dusty touches give depth to dried berry and herb flavors.

title: Buck Shack 2016 Small Batch Sustainably Farmed Red (Lake County)
description: Ssaturated flavors of dark fruits are framed by firm but velvety tannins in this mouthfilling, pleasing and full-bodied wine. It has well-integrated oak aromas and flavors that hint at nutmeg, cinnamon and wood smoke but stay in the background.

title: Buttonwood 2017 Carbonique Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)
description: Definitely falling into the sessionable and chillable reds category, winemaker Karen Steinwachs had fun with this carbonically treated wine, which shows sour red cherry and a touch of smoke on the nose. The lightly bodied palate is not particularly complex, but the tart red-fruit flavors are playful, quaffable and extremely refreshing.

title: Bee Hunter 2015 Merlot-Cabernet Sauvignon (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Focused black-fruit and flower aromas and flavors are wrapped in a lightly tart texture that amps up the volume of fruitiness on the palate. Having been aged in used, neutral-flavored barrels there is little oakiness to interfere with the powerful ripeness of the black-cherry, black-plum, black-tea and violet flavors.

title: Belden Barns NV Estate Late Harvest Viognier (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This is a smooth, balanced and lovely dessert wine, moderate in sweetness and heat, with lovely aromas and flavors of rose water, fresh and dried apricot and honeycomb. It will do well on its own, or as an accompaniment to a wide range of cheeses and spicy desserts.

title: Black Kite 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a rugged and burly quality to this single-vineyard expression, starting with aromas of roast pork in a pan sauce of cranberry, mulberry, dried herbs and cracked pepper. The hearty palate layers pomegranate and plum alongside chai spice, bay leaf and sage.

title: Boich 2013 Wall Road Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This wine is thick and reduced, with sizable tannins and a generosity of black and red currant. Leather, clove and pepper round out and season the fruit, contributing to its overall complexity and intrigue. This wine is structured and bursting in power. Enjoy best 2023–2033.

title: Frank Family 2016 Lewis Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Lush and exotically spiced in nutmeg and rose, this wine is expansively complex and beguiling in its big-boned, full-bodied richness. It displays bold flavors of dark cherry and cola.

title: MacRostie 2016 Manzana Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Juicy, with a medium-built backbone of intense fresh acidity, this wine is savory in spirit and style, with large helpings of black tea, cardamom and forest pine. The fruit component is defined in cherry, cola and vanilla.

title: Prospect 772 2015 The Brawler Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Smoky aromas and potent meaty earthy smoky flavors make a powerful statement for this full-bodied, concentrated and firmly tannic wine. It's one of those wild feral singed-sage wines that combines obviously intense grapey fruity flavors with other earthy influences.

title: Raymond 2015 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Brawny and thick in richness, this wine evolves in the glass and softens, its tannins going from grippy to polished. Coconut and vanilla flavors emphasize the role of oak as blackberry gets jammy and seasoned in nutmeg and sage.

title: Saucelito Canyon 2015 1880 Old Vine Zinfandel (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Intense aromas of black fruit, savory meats and dried flowers provide a complex entry to the nose of this wine, which comes from vines planted in 1880. Buoyant acidity and ample structure uphold the palate, where bright flavors of blackberry and elderberry meet with mocha and anise.

title: Small Vines 2016 Estate Cuvée Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Fresh and forested, this wine has tannin weight and spice to match and complement buzzy acidity and ongoing freshness in the glass. With 35% new French oak, it allows the pomegranate-tangy fruit and Asian spice to take turns speaking.

title: Peltier 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is big and bold, offering a ripe black-fruit aroma along with complex nuances of black olive, sage and black pepper. These tones carry to the full-bodied palate and are supported by a firm tannic structure. Drink after 2022.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Family Reserve Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine is big but balanced as it delivers copious amounts of ripe fruit flavor, full body and tasty accents of black pepper and sage to convey that brambly brushy personality of Zin. Some of that spiciness can be attributed to aging for 20 months in 50% new oak barrels.

title: Beckon 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dried red cherry, wild thyme, sagebrush and an underlying hint of game show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard first planted more than four decades ago. The palate is herbaceous at first before delivering flavors of roast pork in a mulberry-thyme sauce.

title: Bee Hunter 2016 Mariah Vineyards Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Harmonious and beautifully integrated, this supple and flavorful wine feels seamless and tastes rich, complex and complete. The palate subtly combines flavors of ripe apple and pear with hints of honey, butter and vanilla.

title: Jarvis 2014 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Tempranillo (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft, well-integrated and moderately tannic wine, juicy in brawny black fruit and smoked meat. It offers a dusting of tannins that are offset by the fruit flavors, finishing with aspects of lavender, licorice and black pepper.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Black-plum sauce, Chinese five-spice and a hint of black olive linger behind the prominent pine-oil and wood-spice aromas on the nose of this bottling from the acclaimed producer. The palate is also very woody and savory, with oak and pine forest flavors slipping into baked blackberry and dark plum.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Black Chicken Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Made mostly from Oak Knoll District fruit, this perennial favorite offers rich tones of mocha, blackberry and cinnamon toast that are balanced by underlying acidity. It's a crowd-pleasing style that strikes a harmonious chord between fruit and structure.

title: Saracina 2016 Skid Row Vineyard Malbec (Mendocino County)
description: Ripe grape and plum aromas fill the nose in this exuberant and fruity wine. The palate brings a rich blackberry-jam flavor that seems to coat the tongue in a velvety texture, ending on a delicious dark-grape tone on the finish.

title: Schramsberg 2012 Brut Rosé Magnum Sparkling (North Coast)
description: A bright copper color and citrus aromas are followed by tart cherry and pink-grapefruit flavors in this fruity and crisply balanced wine that is a late release in magnum only. It has a refreshing, vibrant mouthfeel and clean finish and an unusually strong stream of bubbles that keeps going 30 minutes after pouring. In this large format, it will certainly keep improving through at least 2022.

title: Siduri 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Somewhat reserved for a vineyard that often shows unbound power, this bottling begins with rounded red-cherry and boiled pomegranate aromas on the nose. The palate offers cooked cranberry, oregano and earth, wrapped in balanced acidity and tannins.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Rustic cherry, rhubarb and turned loam, along with a touch of fresh thyme, show on the nose of this fancifully labeled twist-top bottling. It's a bit thin on the palate, with sour red fruit, bay leaf and anise flavors.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine pulls from all over Sonoma County to create a tannic, oaky and fruity combination of lush black cherry and cassis wrapped around vanilla and dried herb. Bold and brawny, it holds its ripeness in check.

title: Firefly Ridge 2016 Pinot Gris (Central Coast)
description: Extremely light on the nose, this wine eventually shows pleasant aromas of nectarine and orange peel. The palate is also inoffensive but mild, with poached apple and pear flavors, a touch of seared orange and the taste of a lemon juice on sweet squash.

title: Pra Vinera 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: A pumped-up oak and spice character dominates this medium-bodied wine in terms of both aroma and flavor, so it sings a two-note song of nutmeg and vanilla. The texture is smooth and the finish seems sweet from the baking spice tones.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley R.E.D. Vineyards Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Very shy aromas of red berries and wet mud make for an earthy muddled nose. There is a flash of acid on the sip, followed by dust, more red fruit and a slightly woody spice.

title: Sand Point 2015 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Sweet-seeming oak aromas and flavors grab the attention in this medium-bodied wine, while moderate tannins and rather soft acidity make it easy to sip.

title: Shooting Star 2015 Pinot Noir (Lake County)
description: This wine tastes quite mature and savory and feels soft, showing some complexity of sun-baked fruit and earthy undertones.

title: LangeTwins 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Clarksburg)
description: Soft and almost sweet, this medium-bodied wine has a rose perfume, stewed plum, cherry syrup and nutmeg flavors. It is smooth on the palate, showing little acidity or tannin.

title: Sisters Forever 2016 Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Apple blossoms, ripe pears, toasted coconut and squeezed lime show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is flat, with not much acidity or structure, offering green apple, Anjou pear and peach-syrup flavors.

title: The Vice 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Toasted oak and a huge concentration of tannin dominate in this burly, full-bodied and highly ripe wine, which finishes in a bittersweet and sour taste of leather.

title: Beringer 2015 Founders' Estate Merlot (California)
description: This straightforward and fruity wine is relatively light bodied, offering juicy black cherry and strawberry flavors and a hint of sweetness. It's soft and easy to sip.

title: Firefly Ridge 2015 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Very shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and baking spice aromas with patience. The palate is flat and dull yet inoffensive, with flavors of sweet red fruit, herbs and char on the finish.

title: Gracianna 2016 Suzanne's Blend Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Assertive oak wraps around substantial richness and body weight in this highly ripe wine that lacks somewhat in structure. Tropical vanilla and coconut linger longest.

title: Geyser Peak 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Medium-bodied and pleasant to sip, this unassuming wine has subtle plum flavors and a smooth texture. The mouthfeel is soft and the finish is short.

title: Tin Barn 2015 Ricci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is thick in barrel imprint yet somewhat thin in texture, with a syrupy backbone of black cherry and almond. With moderate structure, the finish is flat.

title: Vinum Cellars 2015 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: This extremely dark and concentrated wine has aromas like smoked ham plus peppery smoky flavors that push the limit of style, along with very obvious tannins that leave a drying impression on the palate.

title: Firefly Ridge 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Slightly weak aromas of pomegranate-laced fruit punch, herbs and dust show on the nose of this bottling. Strawberry and fennel flavors are evident on the palate.

title: Firefly Ridge 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: A very light nose conveys purple fruit, dried herbs and a bit of bell pepper on the nose of this bottling. Pasilla chile shows on the sip alongside boysenberry, thyme and wood spice.

title: Uptick Vineyards 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy cranberry and an herbaceous underbelly ride along this somewhat thin yet ripe wine, which finishes in a bitter twinge of cardamom and oak.

title: Cannonball 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Built to be simple and cheery, at a solid price point, this wine is indeed simple and soft, with flavors of charred oak, soy, black cherry and an intensely herbaceous character.

title: Wilson Foreigner 2017 Del Barba Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Very ripe, rich and almost syrupy, this full-flavored wine has dried-fruit flavors like raisins and prunes, a soft broad mouthfeel and very full body.

title: Grayson 2017 Lot 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Rich, full bodied and oaky, this wine offers jammy fruit aromas, ripe and almost candied-cherry flavors that are generously accented by vanilla, maple and coconut. It is lightly tannic for a good firm texture.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine is rich with fruit and spice flavors, very oaky in character and has a almost soft texture in spite of pretty thick but fine-grained tannins. Vanilla, nutmeg and black-cherry notes dominate.

title: Lava Cap 2016 Barbera (El Dorado)
description: A smoky sage-like aroma and fruit flavors tinged with earthy, woody accents make this full-bodied wine a bit of a wild card, but an enjoyable one.

title: Oberon 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with just over 9% Syrah and a touch of Zinfandel, this is a thick, densely structured red, offering flavors of mocha, cherry and plum. The secondary aspects dive into herbal territory, a mix of dried herb, cedar and pencil shavings.

title: Portalupi 2017 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)
description: Aromas of white flower open the door to integrated acidity and a grainy texture in this nicely made white from the cool-climate site. Tangerine and lime speak loudest on the palate.

title: Resign 2016 G-S-M (California)
description: This is a full-bodied grippy wine with deep black-fruit flavors and a very firm texture due to significant tannins and good acidity. It shows black-cherry, sour-cherry and cedar aspects that are tightly wrapped.

title: Schug 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Turned earth and baked strawberry highlight this lightly ripe wine, which is seasoned distinctively in mint and dried herb.

title: Spicy Vines 2017 Rosé of Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This bold and bright wine has a hot-pink color that's almost fluorescent, followed by fruity candied aromas and ripe cherry flavors.

title: Benessere 2016 Estate Sangiovese (St. Helena)
description: With a nose of brioche and smoky oak, this is a well-made, light-bodied version of the variety with 3% Syrah blended in. Dried cherry, leather and black pepper all appear along a high-toned, tannic texture.

title: Broadside 2016 Margarita Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Tight aromas of dark berry, cedar and wet lumber show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the southern reaches of Paso Robles. Twiggy, herbaceous flavors meet with red fruit on the palate, which is framed by chunky tannins.

title: Etude 2017 Grace Benoist Ranch Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: This is a light, floral white that takes on medium-bodied weight and ripeness on the midpalate. Jasmine and apple highlight a viscous finish.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a pleasing petrol character on the nose of this medium-sweet bottling, along with grapefruit and orange peels and rainy cement. There's a flash of sweetness on the palate, with pear syrup and orange-blossom flavors.

title: Folie à Deux 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, woody and flavored in anise, mango and pear, this is an approachable, attractively priced and well-made wine that will work well with food or on its own.

title: Gen5 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of plummy flavors and a spicy streak of black pepper and smoke running through it from the aroma to the finish. It's smooth in texture, moderately concentrated and is 100% estate grown, very rare for a wine this inexpensive.

title: Mark West 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This affordable wine is a little obvious in terms of oaky spices in the aroma and flavors, but it backs them up with good cherry and berry flavors to complete the package. It's medium bodied and smooth in texture.

title: Meiomi 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Obvious oak spices including cedar, clove, cinnamon and wood char fill the aroma of this medium-bodied, extroverted wine and continue in the flavors, giving a sweet edge to the fruit component.

title: Miro 2016 Reserve Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an earthy brawny red wine with bold ripe characteristics of leather, espresso and black cherry. It broods intensity and big flavor.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: This is a good wine that balances ripe berry flavors with lively acidity and medium body. It tastes like sour cherries and raspberries and has a lightly tart mouthfeel.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Chui Vineyard Reserve Malbec (Fair Play)
description: Slightly earthy aromas lead to good fruit, black-pepper and smoke flavors, solid structure and a firm moderately tannic texture.

title: Brick & Mortar 2016 West Block Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a new offering from the producer, sourced from a cool windy site in the Petaluma Gap. A whiff of violet rides atop dense concentrated blackberry and dried herb. The wine offers a brushy dusty character and long polished tannins, showing cool-climate balance and elegance.

title: Brutocao 2014 Coro Mendocino Red (Mendocino County)
description: A light floral note in the aroma joins up with layered and ripe fruit flavors that are handsomely accented by cedar, cocoa and balsam, for a complex and lasting impression on the palate. Full body and firm tannins provide good structure to balance the rich flavors in this Zinfandel-based, traditional Northern California blend.

title: Locations NV CA 5 Red (California)
description: Tempting aromas of dark chocolate, wood smoke and black pepper lead to rich, concentrated layered fruit and oak flavors that are hard to resist. The wine has firm tannins to support all that concentration, but not so much as to dry out the otherwise plush, mouthfilling texture. Made from Petite Sirah, Barbera, Tempranillo, Syrah and Grenache.

title: Shokrian Vineyard 2015 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Babak Shokrian is the new owner of what was once the Melvilles' Verna's Vineyard, and he hired Morgan Clendenen to make this Syrah. It's rich with stewed black currants and black plum, with hints of licorice and cinnamon on the nose. The well-structured palate shows blackened blackberry and just a glimpse of bacon and maple.

title: Beauregard 2016 Oeuf en Beton Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: This experimental lot was made in a concrete egg, and it's a fascinating wine. Strong aromas of honeysuckle, lemongrass, chalk and lemon curd show on the nose. The palate is zippy with acidity, offering flavors of lime, wet river stones and a hint of flint. The finish is quite sour.
designation: Oeuf en Beton Bald Mountain Vineyard

title: Château Souverain 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a flavorful wine that combines vivid fruit flavors and judicious use of oak for a great sense of balance and composition. Butter, vanilla and pear aromas precede almond and baking spice flavors that are nicely backed by more pear and apple.

title: Etude 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: The appellation shows well in this wine, sharing full-bodied concentration within a cooler-climate personality of woody graphite, chalky tannin and floral, dried herb. Cassis and currant accentuate the burbling acidity. This will do well in the cellar. Best 2020–2030.

title: Fulcrum 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Earthy, meaty, oaky, aromas and rich ripe cherry and strawberry flavors give this full-bodied and plush-textured wine plenty to appreciate. It tastes generous and feels smooth and mouthfilling.

title: Kitá 2015 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light and airy in the glass, this bottling shows exotic red plums, fresh cherries, rust, bay leaf and wild mint on the lively nose. It's also lightly bodied and energetic on the palate, where tart cherry fruit is enhanced by pinches of red Mexican spices.

title: MacRostie 2015 Champlin Creek Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is an earthy wine, funky in rose garden and compost, with a demure entry that develops into a more full-bodied sense of thickness and dense tannin over time. There's a nice flourish of strawberry and rhubarb that takes on a compote-like lushness.

title: Matchbook 2014 Estate Bottled Syrah (Dunnigan Hills)
description: Savory aromas of burnt sage and black pepper along with beef, anise and carbon flavors make this an adventurous wine. It's medium bodied, not overly ripe or rich and has a tight mouthfeel due to moderate tannins and lively acidity.

title: On Point 2016 Christinna's Cuvee Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This wine is warm and welcoming, starting with ripe plum and cherry-compote aromas, then presenting rich cherry-pie flavors that are generous but not sweet and a soothing smooth texture with just a touch of tannin.

title: Verde 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This new winery is showing lots of promise early on, and this bottling may be the best yet, with elegant aromas of blackberry jam, charred beef, smoke and dense purple flowers. It's lively and fresh on the palate in tones of elderberry and lilac, bolstered by stiff tannins and a chalky backbone. Bittersweet chocolate shows on the finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Fanucchi-Wood Road Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a layered, full-bodied red, thick in baked bread, cherry and vanilla flavors. It has underlying elegance, with balanced acidity and polish tannins that keep it fresh and succulent.

title: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Petit Verdot (Sierra Foothills)
description: Great fruit flavors and an especially smooth and creamy texture make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. It smells delicious like black cherries and tastes rich, almost jammy, with blackberry-pie notes. Moderate tannins add some good structure for all that fruit.

title: Anaba 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Sonoma Valley)
description: Copper orange in color, this is a meaty, complex quencher, with a metallic edge of steely wet stone. Citrus and peach give it a restrained fruitiness that never becomes heavy or anything but refreshing.

title: Big Basin 2014 Odeon Red (Santa Cruz-Monterey County)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon (from Santa Cruz County) and 47% Syrah and 3% Viognier (from Monterey County) is still tightly wound on the nose, with crystalline purple-fruit and lilac aromas. The palate is elegant, energetic and clean, with firm tannins framing the purple-fruit flavors, with a touch of oak and chocolate on the finish.

title: Brick & Mortar 2015 La Perla Vineyard Pinot Noir (Spring Mountain District)
description: From a high-elevation site where the vines enjoy volcanic calcareous soils, this lightly ripe wine is high toned in pomegranate, rhubarb and orange peel, textured with a sense of crushed rock, and easy to love. It is Gamay-like in its delicate brightness and retention of acidity.

title: Carlisle 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black pepper and blueberry meet with tarragon, sweet mint and beef char on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers a range of minty herbal qualities, but is dominated by a black-plum-sauce richness. The structure is solid but soft enough to enjoy now.

title: De Loach 2015 Vineyard Designate Marin Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: This classy wine starts with cinnamon stick aromas that lead to a warm cherry pie flavor. It gains grip and complexity on the palate and finish, with moderate tannins and fresh acidity alongside a nip of sour cherry for good balance.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Pence Ranch Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Mulberry, forest floor, moss, thyme, incense and rainbow peppercorns show on the dynamic nose of this bottling by second-generation vintner Drake Whitcraft. Rounded boysenberry fruit meets with herbal freshness on the palate, which is slightly richer than many of his bottlings but still very much in the lighter house style. The tannins are sturdy.

title: MacRostie 2014 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bold and ripe, this wine traffics in earthy wild raspberry, strawberry, mushroom and nutmeg. Ethereal despite its weight and breadth, it's made in a classic style and is deliciously varietal, a showcase of a great site in a great vintage.

title: Davies 2015 Hyde Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: The producer's second release from this famous site, this wine is beautifully balanced and bright, with nuanced layers of depth. Cherry, cola spice and forest floor mingle effortlessly in the glass, as the palate remains silky soft.

title: Foxen 2015 Tinaquaic Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hearty black plum and blackberry sauce show on the nose of this excellent bottling along with black pepper, lilacs, black cardamom, lamb and rosemary. It's soft and polished on the palate, with a creamy texture that tightens toward the finish, showing black currant, plum skin acidity and leathery game flavors.

title: Hawley 2015 Reserve Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This well-made wine tastes of berry crumble, lifted by a persistent freshness of acidity that's welcomed and welcoming. Dusty tannin adds to elements of black pepper, leather and cigar, finding a balance between fruit and undeniable power.

title: Benovia 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Vibrant on the nose and expertly put together, this is a well-made appellation wine, expansive in dark cherry, pomegranate and plum. Generous in oak and tannin in its youth, it shows a full-bodied finish that settles smoothly into velvety waves of cardamom and rose.

title: Briceland 2014 Phelps Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: This substantive, well-structured wine has a classy, light French oak aroma and plenty of Bing cherry on the palate as well as firm tannins and good fruit acidity to make it feel lively. Its concentration and grip bode well for pairing with roast birds or beef.

title: Calluna 2014 Calluna Vineyards Cuvée Red (Chalk Hill)
description: Lean and strong, with a well-hewn balance of pungent compost, pencil shavings and dried herb, this Merlot-driven blend contains all five red Bordeaux varieties. Graceful and elegant, it's ready for the table, finishing in a twinge of tobacco and fennel.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Happy Birthday! Larner Vineyard Mourvèdre (Ballard Canyon)
description: Concentrated red cherry and grenadine aromas meet with essence of red rose and carnations on the nose of this bottling by Scott Sampler. Soft and polished tannins carry flavors of tart yet dark cherry, black plum skins, thyme and rosemary, making for a palate that's full of perfectly dried fruits and herbs.

title: Davies 2015 Goorgian Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Beautiful seductive fruit aromas and flavors make this wine practically irresistible, and a soft silky texture reinforces its luxuriousness. Red and black cherry notes mingle with mild vanilla and cinnamon on the palate and finish.

title: De Loach 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Reduced oak settles in the glass to unleash juicy flavors of Gravenstein apple, lemon, grapefruit and white flower. Gravelly texture gives it context and complexity that buoys the full-bodied frame and allows for persistent acidity.

title: MacPhail 2015 Wightman House Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Full body and very ripe fruit flavors give a lot of impact to this deeply colored and concentrated wine made from the heritage Martini clone and aged in 50% new oak. It packs in the black cherry, blackberry and clove flavors, wrapping them in a firm blanket of fine-grained tannins and good acidity, so that it should improve with age. Best after 2019.

title: Sanguis 2014 Pilgrim Red (Central Coast)
description: Tight aromas of blackberry, lilac and tar meet with burnt toast on this blend of Syrah, Grenache and Roussanne. There is a solid grip to the sip, where blackened blackberry flavors combine with tar, juniper, soy, pepper and caramel on the finish. Savory, this also has a strong acidic energy.

title: Sanguis 2014 The Eighth Veil White (Central Coast)
description: This atypical blend of Chardonnay and Marsanne presents a very smoky nose reminiscent of roasted poultry but cut by rosemary, yuzu, green tea, pomelo pith and fortune cookie aromas. Sandalwood, pluot, yellow melon and saffron flavors show on the exotic palate, which is tense with acidity and tannins and utterly distinctive.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Reserve Malbec (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a luscious, oaky and smoky red wine, with firm integrated tannins. Spicy acidity provides a freshness against the ripe fruit, leaning floral on the nose and offering plenty of length.

title: Walt 2015 Blue Jay Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This suave and complex wine has all the classic flavor characteristics like red cherry, black tea and cinnamon along with light oakiness and a luscious texture, a full body and a lingering finish. It feels on the soft side in terms of low acidity and light tannins, but its concentration is impressive.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 459 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very woody and herbal aromas of wild thyme, sagebrush and bay leaf meet with rust, orange rinds, blistered tomato and crushed hibiscus on the spicy nose of this clonal selection. Wild red currants and cranberry-orange compote make for a sour tangy sip, with minty herbs in the background.

title: Jaffurs 2014 Upslope Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Pencil shaving aromas kick off this winery's top-shelf bottling, and then come hints of char, delicate but strong purple flowers and a core of blueberry on the nose. There is a tarry grip to the palate, where flavors of charred boysenberry, lilac and burnt caramel are very clean and elegant.

title: Lynmar 2015 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy wisps of rose garden and wild strawberry invite one into this estate wine, that's brawny and strong in imprint. Concentrated and extracted fruit dominates with highlights of cranberry, raspberry and tan bark with a nod of cola and cardamom adding spice.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Nunes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is vibrantly bright and coiled in acidity. Leather, cola spice and dark cherry mingle effortlessly on a light, smooth and silky palate, ending in balanced nuance.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Peppery, smoky oak influences dominate the aromas and flavors of this dramatic, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. It adds beefy, grilled herb nuances to underlying blackberry fruit for a bold and appealing profile.

title: Davis Bynum 2015 Jane's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is well-made while subdued on the nose, opening slowly to reveal forested spicy notes of cardamom and nutmeg. Full bodied and ripe, it offers inherent tension and bold flavor—a mix of dark cherry and vanilla.

title: Fenestra 2016 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A strong baking-spice component dominates this full-bodied, broad-textured and indulgent wine. It's big and bold, oaky and very ripe tasting. Aromas of vanilla, clove and nutmeg lead to pear nectar and melted butter flavors and a lingering vanilla finish.

title: Ferguson Crest 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Tightly wound aromas of honeysuckle, lily and Key lime pie are fresh and crisp on the nose of this bottling by pop star Fergie and her father. The racy palate sizzles with acidity, offering bright flavors of tart lime skin and chilled apple flesh.

title: Fidelity 2015 Crazy Creek Estate Red (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a well-made, value-driven wine—a blend of 80% Merlot with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Petit Verdot. Full bodied, it offers tight-grained tannins, hearty oak and plenty of rich red fruit, clove and granite.

title: Lake and Vine Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This is a very good well-polished wine that's alive with black-plum and red-cherry flavors and has a firm texture. While moderately tannic, it has enough good richness in the mouthfeel to round off any rough edges.

title: Las Positas 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Driven by fresh tangy fruit flavors and lively acidity, this wine was fermented in large oak barrels (puncheons) and represents a change in style for Las Positas. It offers lots of refreshment and palate-cleansing attributes. It has a lightly earthy and floral aroma, vivid lemon and fresh herb flavors and medium body.

title: Leoness 2014 Fitzpatrick Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Peppercorns, black plum, crushed thyme and anise show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate offers plenty of shaved black licorice spice alongside charred plum flavors.

title: Robert Renzoni 2017 Lyric Rosé of Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: One of the first 2017 wines submitted in California, this beautifully labeled rosé shows sugared pink-grapefruit skins, ripe nectarine, strawberry-lime soda and a touch of cotton candy on the nose. The palate is crisp, dry and tangy with lime skin, but also opens up toward watermelon and is tied together with a clay-like minerality.

title: Seven Angels 2014 Grace Red (Paso Robles)
description: As a blend of 43% Zinfandel, 29% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Syrah and 6% Merlot, it's no surprise that there's a lot going on, with aromas of blackberry, black cherry, thyme, pepper and more. Baked strawberry and black plums form a fruity core, but the chalky tannins and well-primed acidity provide serious framing.

title: Tolosa 2016 Apex Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A rich take on the grape, this bottling shows tons of cola, sarsaparilla and hickory spice atop the rhubarb, red fruit and crushed earth minerality. The oak influence shows on the sip too, where caramelized red currants, baking spice and roast pork flavors converge for a hearty experience.

title: Torial 2014 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a mixture of old-vine Zinfandel, Grenache and Carignan, that confronts one's senses with a sizable presence of fruit-forward voluptuousness. Lush, it punches the palate in hearty waves of blackberry, mocha and vanilla.

title: 2Plank 2015 Quiver Red (California)
description: Cooked black currant, cocoa nibs and a mix of red and purple flowers show on the nose of this blend of 50% Mourvèdre and 50% Tempranillo. Dried berries, nutmeg and cola show on the sip.

title: Chacewater 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a good, sturdy wine with jammy fruit aromas, rich berry and black-cherry flavors and a smooth soft texture. The addition of 15% Petite Sirah adds some underlying tannins to keep it well balanced.

title: CULT 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Seductive aromas like chocolate-covered cherries, plenty of ripe fruit notes and good balance make this wine easy to enjoy. Blueberries and black cherries fill the palate and moderate tannins give a slight lift that counters the richness.

title: Eagle Glen 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced and tightly wound, this affordable red is oaky and soft, with a rich earthiness at its core. Dried herb and baked plum complement each other well within its medium-bodied structure.

title: Electra 2016 Muscat (California)
description: Honeysuckle aromas meet sweet jasmine flavors in this effusive, low-alcohol and exotically floral wine. Unabashedly sweet but not necessarily a dessert wine, it seems perfect for hot summer days and spicy food.

title: Grayson 2016 Lot 12 Zinfandel (California)
description: This wine has earthy, mineral, petrol aromas and black pepper flavors for an untamed personality. Oak nuances lend a hint of sweetness, and a firm texture features good, grippy tannins.

title: Labyrinth 2014 Freebird Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fruity blackberry, concentrated grape, black plums and sweet oregano show on the nose of this blend of 40% Tempranillo, 20% Cabernet Franc, 20% Touriga Nacional and 20% Petite Sirah. Nutmeg and vanilla spice start the sip, followed by candied strawberry sauce and a orange-rind tang. The tannins are firm, if slightly odd, and the acidity is brightest on the finish.

title: Orange Coast WInery 2014 G-S-M (California)
description: There's a strong woody character to this blend of 40% Syrah, 34% Mourvèdre and 26% Grenache from the Temecula area. Fresh boysenberry, dried earth and cedar aromas lead into a palate where fairly rigid tannins make for a chalky texture.

title: Pence 2015 Fugio Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Playing to the tangier side of the grape, this bottling offers dewy sagebrush, barely ripe red currant, white pepper and a hint of tapenade on the nose. The flavors are more rounded with tart cranberry and tangy red-plum skins, enhanced by thyme, dill, green peppercorn and exotic coriander spice. It is very well structured.

title: Black Kite 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine presents as weighty and broad on entry, a successful exploration of juicy black cherry, toasted oak and cardamom that is both succulent and complex. It develops nuance and balance in the glass, with an exotic floral quality that's hard to resist.

title: Carlisle 2015 The Derivative White (Sonoma County)
description: This is yet another stellar vintage of this unique blend, a mix of Muscadelle, Sémillon, Colombard and Palomino. Floral as a garden brimming in gardenia, it's dry and gravelly, with distinct flavors of quince and melon. Light on its feet, it's well worth seeking.

title: HammerSky 2014 The Party Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Merlot and 25% Petit Verdot is all about richness, starting with aromas of vanilla, caramel, milk chocolate, licorice and black-currant crème brûlée. Soft and plush on the palate, the butterscotch, candied blueberry and black plum-syrup flavors are laid across slices of hot spice cake and lifted by mulling spices.

title: Hertelendy 2014 Signature Mountain Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a Merlot-driven blend at 82%, with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon, 4% Malbec and 2% Petit Verdot. The Merlot is from an older site on Howell Mountain. Spicy nutmeg seasons a soft, rounded palate of integrated tannin and full-bodied but balanced weight, the fruit flavor crisp in cherry, raspberry and cassis, just a touch of butterscotch revealed at the wine's end.

title: Adelaida 2015 Twenty Three Twenty Red (Adelaida District)
description: This is a delicious, dark and suave blend of 32% Syrah, 22% Petite Sirah, 20% Mourvèdre, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Viognier. Roasty aromas of cocoa and coffee mesh with elegant and rich black plum on the nose. The palate is wrapped in polished tannins, full of both power and finesse, with black currant, espresso, loamy earth, pepper and chaparral herb flavors.

title: Ancien 2015 Musque Chardonnay (Coombsville)
description: From the Haynes Vineyard, this is a beautifully floral wine on the nose, dripping in honeysuckle. Green apple and Bosc pear are deeply interwoven into the softly structured fabric of its balanced ripeness, as ginger and nutmeg highlights provide depth. The acidity is lasting and well mannered through the finish.

title: Birichino 2014 Lilo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a fascinating and lovable rustic quality to this single-vineyard bottling, which is slightly cloudy in the glass and shows aromas of red cherry, hickory smoke, dust and a feral gaminess. That foxy element is prevalent on the sip, with hints of animal hide and dried chaparral set against pomegranate and wild strawberry flavors.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Flax Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Baking spice and baked plum highlight a juicy, velvety explosion of sultry fruit in this well-made, full-bodied wine. Toasted oak wraps around hints of pine forest and mushroom, with a layering of dried herb and a tart rhubarb-kissed finish.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Bootlegger's Hill Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salt rock, caramel and quince combine effortlessly in this medium-bodied wine with a wealth of elegance and structure. The soft texture provides a framework for its balanced complexity and length of baking spice.

title: Sirius 2013 Eaglepoint Ranch Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: A deep color and thick aromas of blackberry and black fig lead to opulent mouth-filling dark-fruit flavors and a velvety substantive texture. This wine ranks with Turley and Carlisle Petite Sirahs at the top of the quality pyramid in California. It has all the expected tannin along with oodles of fruity, smoky richness to stand up to it. Best through 2028.

title: Spottswoode 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa-Sonoma)
description: This stunning white is sourced from a handful of sources, including the producer's estate, but also Hyde Vineyard in Carneros, Stagecoach on Atlas Peak, and several sites on Sonoma Mountain. It offers a demure nose of honeysuckle and peach before allowing room for lemon, quince and dried herb to come forth on the creamy palate, finishing bright and fresh in acidity.

title: Adelaida 2015 Anna's Estate Vineyard Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Almost black in the glass, this rich and dense bottling impresses immediately with aromas of black currant, caramel, spearmint and wet slate. It's soft and velvety on the palate and loaded with flavors of roasted coffee, shaved chocolate and black plum pudding. Tannins uphold the weight perfectly.
