title: Ashes & Diamonds 2015 No. 1 Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: This is the first release of this wine from this new producer based in Napa. Made by Steve Matthiasson, it is a bleed of Cabernet Franc grapes grown in Carneros, Oak Knoll and Yountville that's both exuberant and expressive in candied cherry and tart orange. Barrel-aged in steel barrels, it offers fully realized acidity in a tightly wound package of pure quenchability.

title: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Merlot (Howell Mountain)
description: Blended with 10% Petit Verdot, this age-worthy beauty is impressively oaked and tannic in its youth, with a concentration of densely packed red and black currants. Coconut shavings and vanilla appear from the background alongside black pepper and cinnamon. This should drink best from 2024–2034.

title: Pence 2015 Sebastiano Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark and dense aromas of blackberry and black currant meet with tar, black pepper, tapenade and plush violet on the nose of this fascinating wine, which treads the line between piquantly savory and richly ripe. The palate shows sour black plums, crushed peppercorns and seared lamb flavors against a dense black-fruit background.

title: Phillips Hill 2015 Cerise Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Charming, just-ripe fruit flavors and a silky texture make this wine elegant and polished. It has a lighter color than average, but that doesn't make the generous black cherry and rose petal flavors any less gorgeous, or the medium-body and good acidity any less appetizing. It's a beauty from one of Anderson Valley best sites.

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Block 11 Mount Eden Clone Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Toast, crushed slate, crisp jicama, sliced Asian pear and squeezed tangerine show on the nose of this block-designated bottling from the historic vineyard. There is a salty kick to the sip, where the rounded and full mouthfeel delivers flavors of hot toast, lemon marmalade, the lightest touch of marshmallow and an iodine-laced finish. Incredible depth overall.
designation: Block 11 Mount Eden Clone Bien Nacido Vineyard

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Vista Verde Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Benito County)
description: This 35th anniversary vintage bottling is as excellent as ever, with aromas of black cherry, boysenberry, wild thyme and sagebrush on the nose. The palate treads the same balance between dark fruit and chaparral spice, with baked red cherries, nutmeg and star anise flavors.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a prime vineyard along Westside Road, this is a restrained take on a warm site and concentrated vintage, with beautiful floral aromas at its heart. Gravenstein apple and stone fruit play well against each other, alternating in tartness and succulent fleshy flavor. The acidity is buoyant and focused, offering a bit of precision to the palate.

title: Hahn 2015 SLH Orchestral Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a delicious bottling from Winemaker Paul Clifton. It opens with beautiful aromas of crisp pomegranate, red plum, sweet bay leaf and sagebrush, combining fresh fruit with sultry, earthy spice. A flash of ripe fruit kicks off the palate, followed by dried fennel fronds, rhubarb, wild thyme and tobacco, making for a fresh, herbal experience.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 The Leap Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Highly expressive and elegant, this classic wine offers tones of red cherry, cassis, cinnamon and cola. It is a layered, high-toned yet balanced red that is understated in its ripe character.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Olivet Lane Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the heart of the appellation, this vineyard-designate wine starts off with heady violet and black tea aromas. The juicy palate offers a tremendous depth of flavor in tones of citrus, black cherry and strawberry, with a supple, silky texture.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Westside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Perennially delicious, this is a thick, structured wine with underlying elegance and finesse. A baked cherry flavor is enveloped in sweet spice, cola and lavender, uplifted by lively acidity. It is a crowd-pleasing wine that offers plenty of complexity.

title: Falcone NV Annaté VIII Red (Paso Robles)
description: This solera, multi-vintage blend of Petite Sirah, Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is extremely delicious in this eighth iteration, offering rich blueberry, blackberry, vanilla and baking spice on the nose from its dark, viscous body. Soft and lush but with the edge of firm tannins, the palate shows blueberry, pepper, minty herbs and strong acidity.

title: Janzen 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: The famous site delivers its classic grace and power, this producer's rendering an exploration of sanguine black olive and pungent, floral violet. With toffee, coffee and chocolate components on the midpalate, make no mistake this is a rich, concentrated wine, plush in tannin weight and texture.

title: Massican 2017 Annia White (Napa Valley)
description: This is a refreshingly stunning blend of 55% Ribolla Gialla, 39% Tocai Friulano and 6% Chardonnay, the latter (from Hyde Vineyard) finding unexpected companionship with its Napa-grown Italian counterparts. Waxy and floral, it tastes of green apple and white peach, with a plush midpalate and lasting tension of vibrant acidity.

title: Cade 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a deliciously elegant wine with robust Napa Valley fruit. Reduced on the nose, and showing a depth of oak, it offers sage, blueberry and black-currant flavors wrapped in chocolate-covered espresso beans. Tightly concentrated it has tremendous structure and a hint of dust on the finish.

title: Calera 2016 Chardonnay (Mt. Harlan)
description: This delicious bottling from the iconic estate is clean and taut on the nose, with aromas of lemon peel, Pink Lady apple, honeysuckle and a hint of toast. The palate is extremely well rounded and deep, showing fleshy flavors of ripe apple and white peach before savory sea salt and zesty lemon rind cut through the buttered sourdough midpalate.

title: Ladera 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This reserve-level wine offers impressive extraction and concentration within a full-bodied, complex package of tobacco and sage. The fruit is classically mountain-grown in its intensity, black and liqueur-like, with touches of coconut and dark chocolate.

title: Lynmar 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Cranberry colored, this is an earthy wine, substantial yet balanced, with a mix of dried herb, strawberry, blood orange and lemon-lime flavors. Vibrantly fresh and dry, it delivers a refreshing experience.

title: David Arthur 2014 Three Acre Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the Pritchard Hill producer's estate within an estate, this is dusty in currant and sinewy leather, with a lingering note of resin, violet and graphite. Full bodied and concentrated in black cherry and currant, it shows a density that's complex yet beautifully balanced. Enjoy 2024–2030.

title: Enkidu 2015 Diener Ranch Petite Sirah (Red Hills)
description: This wine is exceptionally concentrated and flavorful, but retains a hint of restraint in the very firm texture. Aromas of charred wood and black pepper waft up from the glass before concentrated, quiet but deep flavors of black olive, blackberry and oolong tea coat the palate. A massive layer of fine-grained tannins creates a velvety texture that helps carry all the opulent flavors through a lingering finish. Best after 2024.

title: Idlewild 2017 The Bee Flora and Fauna White (North Coast)
description: The Bee is made of 50% of Muscat Canelli, which is blended with 47% Arneis and 3% Cortese. It refreshes and intrigues, offering pure pleasure and a challenge to the palate in its tension of acidity and stony earth. It indeed evokes honeycomb and wildflowers, with a salty brininess that keeps it in the brain long after it's gone.

title: Las Positas 2015 Estate Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: This big and bold wine fills out its tannic frame with gorgeous, ripe exotic-fruit and floral flavors. It practically overflows with boysenberry, Kalamata olive and black-pepper flavors that flood the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth for a long ripe finish, finishing with good overall balance. Best from 2020–2030.

title: Idlewild 2017 The Bird Flora and Fauna Red (Mendocino County)
description: A light, bright expression of 60% Dolcetto, 35% Barbera and 5% Nebbiolo, this offers tones of wild strawberry and dark cherry, uplifted by tenacious acidity. It changes in the glass to show complexity and verve, with a splash of tannin on the finish.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: With a healthy, welcoming intrigue of spice, this estate-grown wine is dusty and leathery in approach and texture, with lovely layers of red licorice and dark cherry. The acidity is interwoven throughout the full-bodied concentration of flavor, with a finishing touch of white pepper.

title: David Arthur 2014 Old Vine Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 12% Petit Verdot, this comes from spot picking the estate site for older estate vines atop Pritchard Hill. Floral in violet, it's smoothly textured and lightly spiced, with a delightful brambly note of black raspberry. The tannins are expansive and slightly sweet in mint chocolate, complementing the peppery, spicy elements well.

title: Paper Planes 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made entirely from Pinot Noir sourced from throughout the appellation, this is an infinitely quaffable, well-made wine, with tons of structure and grace. Watermelon, strawberry and a kiss of lemon combine effortlessly and with lasting acidity.

title: Paradise Springs 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of the John Sebastiano, Hilliard Bruce and Sanford & Benedict vineyards excels in fruit and earth, showing black cherry, muddy loam and fennel on the nose. Forest floor and moss are front-loaded on the palate, which gains mushroom, juniper and tangy plum skin toward the complex finish.

title: Shokrian Vineyard 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling comes from what was once Verna's Vineyard, whose new owner employed Drake Whitcraft for this bottling. Quite dark for a Pinot Noir, it shows very concentrated blackberry sorbet, strong mint, cola and vanilla bean aromas on the nose. The palate is lush and thick with boysenberry paste, clove, star anise and vanilla dust flavors.

title: Amador Cellars 2014 Reserve Grenache Noir (Amador County)
description: A relatively light color leads to spicy aromas, a firm gripping texture and very tasty, complex but restrained flavors including red cherry, cardamom and beef tartare. The wine has great balance due to firm tannins and good acidity, and tastes incredibly fresh and appetizing.

title: Anaba 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fresh aromas of framboise, hibiscus and rose petals make for a very lively and floral nose on this bottling. The palate is also alive and vibrant with flavors of red-currant sorbet, yet mint and tarragon hold that fruity aspect at bay enough to add intrigue.

title: Black Stallion 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With a woody nose of toasted oak and dried herb, this impressive wine is structured and bright, with fresh cassis and red cherry. Balanced and well integrated, it shows depth of flavor and complexity.

title: Cass 2014 Backbone Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe and rich aromas of black plum are cut by savory, gamy and peppery qualities on the nose of this complex Syrah. The cohesive palate is quite delicious, showing roasted plums, pepper-crusted beef and touches of oregano, marjoram and rosemary. Acid keeps it lively.

title: Chaix 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This has a pretty floral nose, a delicate aspect that is in contrast with the thick integrated tannin and depth of baked cherry tart, caramel and oak. Black pepper and dried herb season the full-bodied density well.

title: Cobden Wini 2016 Dalton Vineyard Marsanne-Roussanne (Sierra Foothills)
description: Great concentration, full body and an almost thick texture make a big statement in this no-holds-barred wine that was barrel-fermented in old barrels that don't add oaky flavors. It smells like honey, cream and vanilla, tastes nutty and buttery and coats the palate with a richness that continues to linger even after the last sip.

title: Croix 2015 Narrow Gauge Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Creamy and lush, with warmth of baked pear and fig, this wine fully embraces a ripe fleshy style and does it justice. Supportive, integrated oak adds to the full-bodied voluptuousness as jolts of acidity settle things down and make the wine complex in underlying freshness.

title: FEL 2015 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a light, floral red, aromatic in rose petal and white pepper, that evolves to show a wealth of balanced red fruit, from rhubarb to strawberry. A hint of cola is contrasted nicely against a plushness of cola and sweet tannin.

title: Holly's Hill 2015 Patriarche Red (El Dorado)
description: An aggressive smoky earthy tobacco aroma precedes rich berry and chocolate flavors that drench the palate in this full-bodied, concentrated and almost feral wine. It's an adventure to drink and far from boring.

title: Jackson Estate 2015 Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a fruity wine that overflows with cherry, plum and raspberry aromas and beautifully ripe pure flavors along with some rhubarb and herbal accents that add complexity and interest. It's full bodied, and has a silky-smooth texture.

title: Rusack 2016 Mt. Carmel Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in color, this bottling of the Wente clone from a historic, wind-whipped, hilltop vineyard shows soft aromas of white peach, creamy melon and key lime, all dusted by ample sea salt. The palate starts with a touch of toast and caramel, but then grabs the palate with a grippy texture and flavors of lemon and lime juice.

title: Tognetti 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Nobly reduced on the nose, this is a savory, leathery red, tart in cherry and cassis. Full bodied, it imparts elegant seasonings of cedar, dried herb and woody tannin that grip and structure.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Tart, focused and bright in acidity, this unoaked wine doesn't hold back in richness, allowing the fruit to speak freely for itself in lemon, Mandarin orange and melon. Asian pear and peach play supporting roles as lingering aromas of jasmine weigh in.

title: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Barbera (Alta Mesa)
description: This is a compelling take on a sometimes simply fruity and lively varietal from risk-taking winemaker Kevin Luther. It's medium bodied, well balanced and has a complexity in the aromas and flavors that is fascinating to taste. It blends tasty cherry and raspberry notes with accents of tamarind, black tea and clove.

title: Comanche 2015 Chareva Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Aromas of cherry kirsch and framboise meet with star anise, allspice and a welcoming French toast element on the nose of this bottling from a new producer based in Monterey. The palate is very fresh and spicy, with ginger snaps, tart pomegranate and cranberry flavors, riding an acidity that simmers low and long.

title: Fess Parker 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rich black fruit meets with a touch of roasted lamb and rosemary on the classic nose of this Syrah, which was planted in 1989 as a memorial for Fess Parker's late son-in-law. The gamy qualities are much stronger on the sip, with charred lamb and more savory herbs, yet the backdrop is all boysenberry.

title: Kitá 2015 Spe'y Camp 4 Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light in the glass, there is freshness and tension to the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 25% Carignane and 23% Syrah, with aromas of mulberry, red plum and hibiscus but also cinnamon, sumac and rose petal. Its light weight sails across the palate, mixing pomegranate, sage and cracked pepper flavors.

title: Opolo 2015 Maestro Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry, thyme, anise, maple and a prominent hickory smoke show on the nose of this blend. That smoke extends throughout the firmly structured palate, giving savory depth to flavors of boysenberry paste, pound cake and vanilla. Slick acidity carries it all deep into the finish.

title: Paradise Springs 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From one of the country's first bicoastal wineries, the Virginia-cum-California is off to a strong start with this wine from John Sebastiano and La Rinconada vineyards. Aromas of lemon curd, sweet cream and lime pith are soft yet attention-grabbing. The palate is clean, crisp and tightly woven with tangy citrus flavors and great textural grip.

title: Labyrinth 2014 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Concentrated black plum reduction sauce, tarragon oil and baking spice show prominently on the nose of this bottling from a remote vineyard north of the Santa Maria Valley. There's an impressive softness to the palate, where cooked licorice, elderberry jam and black-pepper flavors thrive.

title: Sequum 2014 Kidd Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a substantial concentrated 100% varietal red, leathery on the palate at first and quite tannic. It settles in the glass to show more nuance and grace—a mix of herbaceous seasoning and light cranberry and cassis.

title: Sleeping Giant 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Herbal and floral, this wine offers a depth of muddled, baked strawberry and rhubarb. The fruit is wrapped around a full-bodied core of earthy underbrush that's well structured.

title: Writer's Block 2015 Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Gutsy and structured, this wine has more grip than many of its peers, as firm tannins underpin an abundance of black cherry and raspberry flavors. It is concentrated, has enjoyable layers of fruit and good balance.

title: 2Plank 2015 G-S-M (San Diego County)
description: Intriguing and fresh aromas of black cherry and wet concrete meet with a caramelized kick of raisin, chocolate and mint on the nose of this blend of 50% Mourvèdre, 25% Grenache and 25% Syrah. Dark-plum flavors and more minty spice decorate the dust, clay and crushed gravel flavors on the palate, with a strong spice kick all around.

title: Callaway 2014 Special Selection Mourvèdre (Temecula Valley)
description: Baked strawberry, leather, dried herbs and a salt-and-pepper spice make for an intriguingly savory nose on this bottling. The palate is light in body but tense in texture, showing more strawberry as well as rustic red plum, light tobacco and vanilla on the finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2016 la bombe Merritt Island Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: This light-bodied wine has a steely crisp-green-apple quality and an array of flavors that are more savory than fruity. Hints of vanilla and wet stone in the aroma are followed by a tangy, rather lean palate impression. It should be brilliant for food pairing.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2016 Luke's Selection Rosé of Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Thirst-quenching, this is a light, bright wine, dark in color and meaty in flavors of salami, strawberry and orange zest. Lightly ripe, it's lovely and memorable.

title: Potek 2015 Kick On Ranch Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Green-orange pith, tart pear flesh and hints of orange blossom show on the nose of this clean fresh bottling. It's grippy on the palate, where the texture is more compelling than the easy flavors of pear flesh and white flower blossoms.

title: Smith Devereux 2016 3 Red (California)
description: Smoky oaky accents give a little extra muscle to the nice ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine. It has just enough lip-smacking tannin and acidity for a refreshing feel on the palate, so it's well balanced.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 Z Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of candied strawberry and cherry jelly bean meet with elegant touches of nutmeg and baking spice on the nose of this bottling. Those elements are nicely woven on the palate, where red currant mixes with mint and fennel frond.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Kick-On Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This young bottling is light and a bit cloudy in the glass, and shows tons of underripe fruit character, including tomato leaf, light cranberry and tapenade, and also intriguing incense ash and crushed slate minerality. It's vibrant with acidity, showing flavors of cherry tomato, white pepper and more tapenade, sure to fascinate geeks but likely too challenging for most.

title: Red Electra 2016 Muscat (California)
description: Medium-bodied and quite sweet, this aromatic and flamboyant red wine drinks like a light Port and could taste great with dessert or a cheese course. It will also be good to pour for friends and family who don't appreciate dry wine.

title: Steelhead Vineyards 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: Enjoy this wine for its light, fruity black-cherry flavors enhanced by hints of cinnamon and black tea. Good acidity and mild tannins balance out the fruit and spice flavors nicely.

title: Theopolis 2015 Symphony White (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This is an excellent dry and light-bodied wine from a relatively new grape variety that is often made sweet. Honey and orange zest waft up from the glass, while crisp white peach and white pepper highlight the flavors. This will be a fun wine to serve blind and stump your friends.

title: Bee's Box 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This bold wine is a promising new offering from Francis Ford Coppola. It has the classic notes of vanilla, apple and butter in the aroma, followed by full body and ripe fruit flavors that are nicely backed by some crisp acidity.

title: Crawford Family 2016 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Tangerine rind, strawberry and plush peach tones show on the nose of this bottling by winemaker Mark Horvath. The palate is very grippy with a chalky texture, framed by sharp tangy citrus yet offering broader strokes of melon and strawberry in the midpalate.

title: Holly's Hill 2014 Classique Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: Darker in color than usual for the varietal, this wine offers ripe, generous fruit aromas but more restrained fruit flavors bolstered by smoky, peppery accents and supported by firm tannins. It has plenty of personality and very good balance.

title: Leoness 2014 Signature Selection Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Dark boysenberry, plum sauce, gravel and wet asphalt aromas show on the well-restrained nose of this bottling. The palate offers a peppery spice and dark-purple fruits alongside roasted beef and hints of vanilla.

title: Longoria 2014 Tempranillo (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of strawberry fruit, carnation and a touch of charred meat make for a soft and approachable nose on this bottling. It's softly textured on the palate, where cranberry fruit and peppery spices ride leathery tannins that are not too thick.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2016 Force de Fleurs White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache Blanc and 45% Viognier is one of the zippiest white wines you can find. It's restrained on the nose with honeydew, yellow grapefruit peel and wet slate aromas, and then the wound-up acidic power explodes on the sip, where tart apple and pear flavors linger behind the sizzle.

title: Lumen 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling by Winemaker Lane Tanner offers plum, red cherry, baked earth, shredded slate and a hint of vanilla-laced croissant on the nose. The palate shows energetic acidity and a grippy texture, with underripe strawberry, plum skin and green-peppercorn tones.

title: LXV 2015 Bootjack Ranch Reserve Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Cherry syrup and a roasted meat element are revealed the nose of this bottling from a winery with a popular tasting room in downtown Paso Robles. Vanilla and baked good flavors show right away on the palate, where chalky tannins and rich cherry fruits arise mid-sip to ride a bountiful acidity and touch of pepper spice into the finish.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 Todd Brothers Ranch Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Peppery, this old-vine wine is well integrated and thickly restrained, with a lip-smacking taste of blackberry cobbler and dark chocolate. Gritty tannins give it texture and ample weight, while a freshness of acidity persists.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty plum, tobacco and dark chocolate play against a soft texture in this varietal wine with a Merlot-like sensibility. Black and red currant and cherry mix well on the fruity palate, seasoned in appropriate measures of cedar, black pepper and clove.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)
description: Sanguine and smoky, this wine has a welcome herbal component that keeps it fresh and complex in the glass. Thick and densely concentrated in blackberry and plum, it persists in an underlying vibrancy that helps balance and complement its more luxurious tease of dark chocolate.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2013 Tresor Red (Sonoma County)
description: This classically styled Cabernet Sauvignon-driven blend shows power and structure in equal measure, with a backbone of integrated oak. Raspberry, black cherry and cassis flavors are succulently displayed along a carpet of thick concentrated richness.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Reserve Alexandre Winemaker's Reserve Meritage (Alexander Valley)
description: Fully concentrated in dusty black fruit and tobacco, this blends 79% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petit Verdot, 3% Merlot, 2% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc. Mellowed in terms of ripeness and body weight, it offers sizable tannins that provide structure along the midpalate.

title: Landmark 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a potent smoky character on the nose of this bottling, with hickory and oak aromas wrapped around the strawberry and plum flavors. The palate is fresher in a note of red plum, yet smoke, salt, peppercorn and oregano tones pervade. It's savory without being rich, showing a strong backbone of acidity.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: A touch of smoky, spicy oak flavor gives this ripe and berry-soaked wine a nice twist of complexity. It has strawberry and boysenberry aromas, and full, almost jammy, flavors riding on a smooth texture that shows soft tannins.

title: Bailarin 2015 Love Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is thick and sinewy, ripe and soft in texture. Spicy clove, pepper and cinnamon highlight a richness of strawberry puree and mocha chocolate flavor, the oak subdued in the background.

title: Brander 2016 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a very young but already fully enjoyable twist-top bottling from a unique site in the rugged mountains north of the Santa Maria Valley. Fresh aromas of blackberry and black currant meet with rosemary and tarragon on the nose while the easy-to-quaff palate shows flavors of freshly plucked boysenberries, oregano and marjoram. The high alcohol is completely hidden.

title: LangeTwins 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Full of yummy, ripe plum, boysenberry and black-pepper flavors, this full-bodied and smooth-textured wine is a great value. It's very mouth filling, soothing and delicious and has a deep color, lush and fruity aromas and soft tannins on the palate.

title: Ledson 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From a vineyard recently replanted and coming into its own, this offers dusty weavings of tobacco, clove, tar and leather, as burly and brawny as a humidor. Big-boned and ripe, the tannins are seamless on the palate and soft on the finish.

title: Fritz 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A shy nose belies a simplicity of green apple and fennel in this full-bodied fleshy wine that satisfies in freshness and complexity. Toasted oak marks the lengthy finish.

title: Gallo Signature Series 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Graham cracker and vanilla wafer aromas entice on the nose. This is a ripe, dense wine which boasts a sinewy backdrop of leather among a broad expanse of rich fruit flavors. A cinnamon note lingers on the finish.

title: Holly's Hill 2016 Patriarche Blanc White (El Dorado)
description: Crisp and dry, this light-bodied wine has vivid acidity and fresh Bosc pear and white peach flavors along with a lightly astringent texture that's very appetizing. It will be just the thing as an apéritif with toasted almonds and olives. Blended from Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Picpoul and Viognier.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Estate Bottled Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This soft-textured, mouth-filling wine has woodsy, fallen leaf aromas, gentle flavors that combine savory and fruity accents and mild acidity and tannins. It's medium to full-bodied and soothing to sip.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2014 Cote Del Sol Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Bolstered by a splash of co-fermented Syrah, this wine's soft and inviting nose shows black cherries, smoke, bay leaf and crushed rose petals. This bottling contains more hickory smoke seasoning than past vintages, which surrounded the red cherry and purple flower flavors. It's a great pairing for a barbecue.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Sublime in texture, all smooth and velvety contours, this fruit-forward wine has a medium-bodied frame rich and ripe in white peach and vanilla. The peach turns to guava and mango as it develops additional fleshy creaminess in the glass.

title: Eberle 2017 Mill Road Vineyard Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: There's a tight weave on this bottling, which offers grapefruit rind and pear flesh on the nose alongside flint, steel and white-flower aromas. It's clean and crisp on the palate, with grassy flavors that are unusual for Viognier but quite welcome.

title: Kessler-Haak 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Apple blossoms, zesty lime sorbet and a flash of honey show on the nose of this bottling. There is just enough grip to the sip, where honey, lemon rind and yellow-apple flavors arise.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Lively acidity helps balance a wealth of concentrated red and blackberry fruit in this thickly tannic wine with sizable body weight and breath.

title: Shannon Ridge 2015 Buck Shack Red (Lake County)
description: This wine is big in flavor and offers lots of oak character along with very ripe berry, cherry and chocolate notes. The aroma has toasted bread, baking spices and cedar that continue on the palate matched by generous fruit flavors.

title: Simi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Inviting in floral and lemon peel, this large-production white is textured and balanced in acidity, with a depth of tangerine and apple blossom.

title: Terragena 2017 Wiley Vineyard Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: A chalky, mineral aroma leads to a very dry, crisp and tangy flavor that shows a lot of restraint and firm acidity. Fermented in neutral (used) barrels and steel tanks, the wine is practically steely and certainly palate-cleansing.

title: Epiphany 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Concentrated red-cherry aromas meet with sweet wood oil to offer a pleasant entry to this bottling. There are eucalyptus and pine-oil flavors drizzled across the palate, where dark elderberry fruits dominate.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Private Reserve Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Loads of anise and licorice aromas meet with blackberry jam and loamy earth on this bottling. Rich black-currant paste flavors meet with black licorice on the well structured palate.

title: Pull 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Red-cherry, wood-smoke and crushed graphite aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft and luxurious on the palate at first but then come more rigid, chalky tannins, carrying flavors of black cherry and oak.

title: Siduri 2016 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Woody oak and elongated tannin mark this powerfully built wine, which is angular in acidity. Juicy citrus amplifies the freshness, lingering in cola and cardamom.

title: Vinum 2016 Red Dirt Red (Paso Robles)
description: Very strong smoky aromas of hickory and a solid pepper spice give a savory background to the backdrop of blackberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. That smoke carries into the palate, where roasted wood, campfire and bacon flavors meet with black currant and caramel.

title: Joseph Jewell 2017 Ryan Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Humboldt County)
description: The rather deep salmon-copper color of this wine is eye-catching. Each sip has all the energy and zest of a rosé sparkling wine without the sparkle. The flavors are ripe but crisp, combining raspberry with a touch of earthiness.

title: Andis 2015 Painted Fields Red (Amador County)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine shows hints of mint and cedar on the nose, with lively, concentrated flavors of blackberrry and black cherry on the palate. It has a smooth texture and just enough tannins to firm up the mouthfeel.

title: Briceland 2017 Ishi Pishi Ranch Gewurztraminer (Humboldt County)
description: Earthy waxy aromas meet crisp and bracing but subdued grapefruit and lemon-zest flavors in this taut, unoaked and medium-bodied wine. It has a slightly austere appeal and good acidity that will liven up food pairings from fish and chips to roast pork.

title: Broken Earth 2016 Sotto Voce Grenache Rosé Sparkling (Paso Robles)
description: A subtle shade of pink-yellow in the glass, this bottling shows light strawberry and a touch of sourdough on the nose. Framed by laser-sharp bubbles, the palate offers rounded plum flavors alongside grapefruit rinds and the sour kick of green-apple skins.

title: Brooks Note 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: This crisp and appetizing wine offers herb and apricot aromas, lip-smacking acidity and tempting flavors of dried herbs, apricots and mineral water. It is medium bodied, shows no signs of oak and will be very versatile with food.

title: Byron Blatty 2015 Agenda Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Lilac buds, caramelized black-fruit and sweet tobacco-leaf aromas show on the nose of this blend of 75% Syrah and 25% Tannat. It's a bit tangy and fruit-powered on the palate, where candied boysenberry and black raspberry meet with a touch of balsamic sauce and a chalky structure.

title: Ghost Pines 2016 Winemaker's Blend Pinot Noir (California)
description: An abundance of fruit flavors and generous dashes of baking spices give this full-bodied wine from the E. & J. Gallo folks an extroverted personality. Ripe berry and cherry flavors meet lavish oaky notes of nutmeg and vanilla for an easy, pleasing profile.

title: Hearst Ranch 2016 Lone Tree Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated red cherry aromas meet with peppery spice and coffee on the rounded and classically styled nose of this bottling. The palate balances flavors of roasted fruit with darker berries, a hint of pepper and dried herbs, framed by squeaky tannins.

title: Lula 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is well-saturated with dark-berry flavors and has a velvety, slightly tannic texture. Hints of dark chocolate and toasted oak add some complexity to this firm and well-structured wine.

title: Midnight 2014 Capriccio Italien Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted red cherries, clove and sweet wood aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Sangiovese, 33% Malbec and 17% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is a dusting of herbs on the palate, but it's primarily roasted red berries, cherry juice and smoke flavors.

title: Shannon Ridge 2017 High Elevation Collection Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Well-concentrated but still lively and fresh, this medium-bodied wine is just what many people look for. It smells grassy and grapefruity, tastes more ripe and full like honeydew melon, and has a pleasant richness on the palate.

title: Zanoli 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Rows RR & SS Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Deep black-plum and blackberry aromas make for a hearty nose on this bottling, which comes from two specific rows. The mouthfeel is thick and the palate is framed by a strong acidity, carrying flavors of ripe boysenberry.

title: Cline 2017 Viognier (North Coast)
description: A bright blend of honeysuckle and mango flavors give plenty of personality to this medium-bodied, well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lifts the mouthfeel for a refreshing, but still rich flavor profile.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Nefarious Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which includes 7% Grenache, shows rich aromas of black currant and boysenberry with touches of charred wood and thyme. The palate is tart with black-plum-skin flavors and shows a good amount of energy, though the finish is a tad tarry and woody.

title: Bellante 2016 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Roasted blackberries, black-plum skins and woody smoke make for a fruitful yet savory entry to the nose of this wine. Hearty smoke flavors show prominently on the palate, where tangy plum flavors otherwise reign.

title: Broken Earth 2015 Sotto Voce Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Though this red bubbly wine may explode all over the kitchen, the hassle is worth the effort. Aromas of black cherry, tart boysenberry and clove lead into full-flavored palate of blackberry and baking spice. The mouthfeel is quite lavish and there's the slightest sense of sweetness.

title: Bucher 2017 Bucher Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged in 100% stainless steel, this will appeal to fans of the style—a sleek, straightforward expression of tropical fruit and floral aromas. It has a smooth rounded palate of easygoing texture and light-bodied ripeness.

title: Cochon 2017 Old Vine Rosé (California)
description: A light-salmon color and rather generous peach and cherry flavors give this medium-bodied wine made from Rhône grape varieties more substance than many rosés. A generous mouthfeel adds to its appeal.

title: Davis Bynum 2017 Jane's Vineyard Virginia's Block Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site on Woolsey Road in the appellation, this is a sulfurous, lemony white, aged in both neutral French oak and stainless drums. Textured, it offers powerful concentration, rich tropical flavors and body weight.

title: Della 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Grainy and dense in caramelized oak, this robust wine shows ample ripeness and body on the palate, with a lasting taste of vanilla.

title: Epiphany 2016 Rodney's Vineyard Marsanne (Santa Barbara County)
description: Grapefruit pith and tangy citrus aromas are quite strong on the nose of this bottling, which also shows walnut aromas and a touch of wood on the nose. The palate is quite pithy with mandarin flavors, but there is also a touch of cashew and honey mustard spice.

title: Kunde 2014 Drummond Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Earthy forest notes meet a rich succulent midpalate of mocha and red cherry in this wide-angled, chewy wine from an estate-grown site.

title: Maison Areion 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Fresh aromas of apple and pear juice meet with a touch of lemon rinds on the fruit-driven nose of this bottling by winemaker Nicolas Vonderheyden. It's crisp on the palate and easy to quaff with touches of seared lemon and peanut brittle.

title: Nola Grace 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Flinty wet-stone aromas and subtle mineral and fig flavors mark this wine. It tastes clean and crisp, boasting a well-balanced, medium body.

title: Pali 2016 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Ripe apple and honeysuckle aromas meet with gunmetal on the nose of this bottling. Fresh citrusy flavors meet with toasted hazelnut, a hint of flint and chilled apple flesh on the palate.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Lime blossom, orange sorbet, apple rinds and grapefruit zest make for a very fresh and inviting nose on this bottling. There's a strong botanical kick to the sip, with hints of juniper, as well as interesting and likable orange and apple flavors.

title: Roblar 2017 Gold Collection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Loads of pear and a lean hint of guava show on the nose of this bottling. Fleshy aromas of ripe pears and apples meet with a touch of tropicality on the clean palate.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: This Trinchero-made bottling shows lemon sorbet and Pink Lady apple on the clean and easy nose. It's easy and likable on the palate, offering lime sorbet with tangy lemon-rind flavors.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Oaky, big and bold in flavor, this appellation wine is textured with highlights of lemon peel, pineapple and stone fruit.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2016 Spring Hills Vineyard Flora (Russian River Valley)
description: Described as a cross between Gewürztraminer and Sémillon created in 1938, this unique white is exotic on the nose in aromatic apple blossom and honeysuckle, its texture dry and salty. It has a strong flavor of fig complemented by green apple.

title: Foley 2015 Bar Lazy S Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cola, Montmorency cherry juice, star anise and sagebrush aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's soft, easy and familiar on the palate, with clove spice giving depth to the cooked raspberry and strawberry flavors.

title: Heritance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a youthful wine, softened by tiny additions of Merlot and Petit Verdot. Peppery black spice, leather and cedar accent compressed black fruit on the palate, bolstered by a sizable tannic structure.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Petite Sirah (San Diego County)
description: Cassis, roasted chocolate, pepper and buttery pastries show on the nose of this bottling, which is thick and dark in the glass and shows great potential for this grape in Southern California. It's dense on the palate, with soft violet and blackberry flavors, wrapped in a tarry structure with hints of nutmeg and cocoa on the finish.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Syrah (San Diego County)
description: Cooked cherries, wild chaparral and toasted oak aromas show on this estate bottling from a promising project in San Diego County. It's a classic, down-the-middle Syrah on the palate, where savory herbs of sage and thyme spice up the boysenberry fruit, with vanilla, star anise and mint arising toward the finish.

title: Kokomo 2015 Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: This hearty red is made from nearly equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Grenache, with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah and Merlot. Juicy and structured in black and red cherry and currant, it offers sizable tannin weight and a grip of toasted oak, remaining succulent and bright in the glass.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Intensely oaky and robustly built, this young white mellows in the glass to reveal a voluptuous citrus core. It offers vibrancy on the finish that plays well against bold flavors of pear and melon.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2014 Tempranillo (Lake County)
description: This is a big full-bodied wine that packs a bounty of ripe bold fruit flavors into a firm frame of tannins, alcohol and moderate acidity. It has a big impact on the palate with the concentration to back it up. Big proteins will pair nicely with it.

title: Phillips Hill 2016 Boontling Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Earthy aromas and a smooth texture drive this unorthodox but attention-getting wine, which is the entry-level wine from Phillips Hill and named for the local dialect in Anderson Valley. It has funky reduced aromas at first, then meaty stemmy spicy flavors and a mouth-filling texture that's very smooth.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Alverd White (Yolo County)
description: An abundance of floral and savory flavors drives this full-bodied, dry and mouth-filling wine. It's not fruity per se, but has a good core of white peach along with almond and white-tea notes. This 50-50 blend of Albariño and Verdelho will bring a welcome change of pace to the table.

title: RouteStock 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This perennial value delivers again in a juicy and elegant expression of concentrated black fruit, black olive and tomato leaf, a nice complement of succulent and savory. Stock up.

title: The Federalist 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This is a bold wine, showing smoky, toasted oak aromas to bolster ripe pear and apple flavors that are accented by vanilla and cream. It's not something delicate for fresh seafood, but will taste great with a roast chicken or pizza bianco.

title: Madrigal 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Dark black color gives way to brooding ripeness and density of black fruit, with a huge presence of oak and tannin. Aspects of leather, black pepper and tomato leaf figure into the mix, saved by a brightness of acidity that helps complement the wine's concentrated tendencies.

title: Birichino 2016 Saint Georges Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling from an old vineyard shows candied pomegranate, sage and thyme on the delicate nose. There is solid grip to the sip, with tangy cranberry and a pinch of white pepper. It is a great red wine for a sunny day.

title: Captûre 2016 Les Pionniers Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Grass, melon and peach highlight a texture that's creamy and fleshy, with a well-honed balance of lingering acidity. Medium bodied, the wine offers additional flavors of dried herb and nutmeg.

title: Carmel Road 2014 North Crest Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's a great amount of minerality on the nose of this bottling, with crushed slate and muddy soil aromas overcoming the mint herb and red-fruit scents. There's minty lift right away on the sip, with bay leaf, fennel pollen and dusty leather flavors decorating the boysenberry fruit.

title: Angeline 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Generous flavors and full body give this wonderful and affordable wine a warm feel on the palate. Rich black cherry, black tea and cranberry notes offer a lot of complexity. The texture is broad and full, but infused with moderate tannins and subtle acidity that keep it fresh.

title: Baehner Fournier 2014 V3 Red (Los Olivos District)
description: Dark loamy soil aromas meet with packed violets, red rose petals, crushed gravel and dense blueberry on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 20% Petit Verdot. The palate is quite tangy for the grapes in involved, with hints of balsamic reduction sauce, black pepper and underripe black fruit.

title: Lloyd 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cooked red cherries, sharp cranberries and butter pastries meet with a touch of campfire on the nose of this bottling. There's a tannic firmness to the palate, where sticky tannins carry flavors of tart red fruit and baking spice.

title: Gershon Bachus 2013 Auster Syrah (California)
description: Clove, allspice and black cherry juice show on the nose of this bottling from the heart of Temecula. Tangy wild berry fruit pops on the sip, where a chalky texture carries vanilla cookie, wild fennel and, toward the finish, and mocha flavors.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Orange Muscat (California)
description: Strong lemon-peel, Pink Lady apple and orange-blossom aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts slightly sweet and grows much sweeter toward the finish, with ripe pear and apple flavors, but not much acidity.

title: WindVane 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A broadly defined, simply structured white, this has expansive richness on the palate and measured acidity on offer. Green apple, lime and lemon custard provide varietal character.

title: Telios 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine has good fresh fruit flavors that verge on jammy, boosted by a sweet-seeming oak character that includes vanilla, maple and brown sugar accents. It's smooth in texture and light in tannin content for this varietal.

title: Balderdash 2014 49 Mulberry Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Overextracted aromas of tangy black plum and blackberry jam show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe flavors of black-plum juice prove too tangy and nearly vinegar-like.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Estate Grown Musqué Clone Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This light-bodied wine is grassy in aroma, has lean veggie and lemon flavors and a fairly crisp mouthfeel.

title: Moss Roxx 2015 Ancient Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: An abundance of sweet-seeming, spicy oak fills the aroma and smothers the fruit flavors in this spice cabinet of a wine. It has lots of vanilla, ginger, nutmeg and maple flavors and full body.

title: Olelo 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Light-red fruit, crushed gravel and a hint of gunmetal aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied on the palate with lots of turned soil flavors and just a touch of red fruit.

title: Ballard Lane 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: A slightly darker shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling shows dried apple, wet hay and orange touches on the nose. The palate offers apple, pear and lime flavors, but without much texture or energy.

title: Dirt Diva 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: There is beautiful packaging on this bottle, yet it contains less-than-beautiful wine. Aromas of vinegar-laced cranberry sauce leads into tangy cooked cranberry flavors on the sip.

title: Farmhouse 2017 White (California)
description: This wine has a pink tinge in the color and strong floral and fruity aromas. It is peachy in flavor, light in body and slightly sweet, making it an aromatic, picnic-style wine.

title: Kenwood 2017 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: Golden in color, this wine opens bright and fresh on the nose before providing a lush, creamy and fruit-forward experience of indelible ripeness on the palate.

title: Kula 2017 Rosé of Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: A rusty shade of pink, this bottling, which includes 10% Picpoul Blanc, shows cooked cherries and baking spice on the nose. The palate is full of watery cherries.

title: Viaggio 2016 Buttercup Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is a good, basic wine with modest amounts of fruitiness and butteriness mingling on a medium body. A chalky, earthy note comes in on the midpalate and lingers.

title: Fetzer 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Light in color and flavor, this wine smells tangy and citrus-like, and tastes lean and low in fruit and acidity. It's clean and simple in character.

title: Jack's House 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine seems sweet due to candied-fruit aromas and flavors and oaky spices like vanilla and maple. It is medium bodied and soft in texture for the varietal.

title: Hailstone Vineyards 2017 32 Degrees Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is viscous and sweetly ripe in baked apple and honey flavors, with a thickness that persists.

title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Jessie's Collection Orange Muscat (California)
description: This is a good picnic wine to serve with cheese or salty snacks. It's sweet, smooth and very fruity, with medium body, low alcohol and soft acidity.

title: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is simple in structure with a medium-bodied richness of juicy red fruit.

title: Seven Daughters 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has an earthy overtone at first sip and then generally ripe and plummy flavors that are straightforward but lightly accented by vanilla. It feels smooth in texture.

title: Doren 2015 Doren Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine tastes slightly underripe, with herbal elements of bell pepper. It is made entirely from one variety, and its oak is subtle and supportive.

title: Wrath 2015 3 Clone Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Roasted nuts, hot buttered toast with lemon preserves, sea salt and a touch of chalk show on the layered nose of this bottling by winemaker Sabrine Rodems. The flavors are classical and clean, with lemon wedge, cashew, more salt and a hint of butterscotch, all riding atop a strong acidity.

title: Black's Station 2015 Malbec (Yolo County)
description: Great structure and vivid fruit flavors make a winning combination in this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. Powerful but well polished, it has blackberry and dark chocolate flavors, a solid, grippy texture and is nicely dry.

title: Carmel Road 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: This vintage of a widely available bottling is a solid everyday sipper for the price, with aromas of star anise, fresh red cherry and snappy hibiscus punch. The palate is fresh and vibrant with raspberry fruit, thyme and white pepper dust, with a warm baking-spice note on the finish.

title: Enkidu 2014 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Seductive in black raspberry, this wine has sizable walls of tannin to burst through and is hugely concentrated in cherry cola and an herbaceous streak. Interlaced acidity saves the day and keeps it relatively fresh in the glass.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Pluto's Fury Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Forested tree pine, soy and cardamom greet the nose in this intriguing, inviting wine, which is brooding in baked cherry and concentrated strawberry flavors. Velvety and luscious, it's made in a fuller, lusher style that works within its balance of supportive acidity.

title: Graziano 2013 Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)
description: This is an unusually drinkable Petite Sirah, considering the varietal's reputation for massive tannins. It has lots of jammy fruit flavors, firm but not drying tannins, and a sense of richness that counters the tannin for a soothing mouthfeel.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Baked leather rides over flavors of black licorice and pepper in this perfumed, older vine wine. Gritty in texture, it's full bodied and densely packed in tannin, with a streak of acidity that keeps it fresh in underlying strawberry and cherry cola.

title: Jeff Gordon 2012 Joie de Vivre Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 47% Syrah, 40% Petite Sirah and 13% Cabernet Sauvignon, the nose on this wine at first is shy, but slowly warms to reveal complementary flavors of spicy cedar, pencil shavings, sage and herb. Fully ripe, rich and rewarding in red currant, it has a meaty undertow of varietal character.

title: Karine 2013 Laurie's Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Madera)
description: This is a tasty dry wine with effusive flower and honey aromas and mouth-filling mango and banana flavors, all supported by tangy acidity for good balance. It has interesting pairing options, from tapas to shellfish to cheese.

title: Benziger 2015 De Coelo Abore Sacra Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from biodynamic-certified grapes grown on a coastal-influenced property, this wine is bright in cherry and cardamom spice, with fully realized elements of forest pine, gravel and pomegranate. Fully oaked and somewhat tannic in its youth, it shows vigor and vibrancy as it finishes.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Malbec (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine smells just like blackberry jam, and tastes wonderfully rich, fruity and full. It has a very deep purple-black color, expressive dark fruit aromas and ripe, almost-sweet, flavors that spread across the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Seven Sinners The Ransom Old Vines Petite Sirah (California)
description: Very seductive and spicy, this full-bodied wine has enticing aromas of baking spices and toasted oak, with lavish flavors of chocolate and blackberry jam that seem to coat the tongue. The ripe feel seems to soften the thick layer of tannin, so it's approachable now.
designation: Seven Sinners The Ransom Old Vines

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a thick, herbal red wine that's tannic in bittersweet tobacco, tomato leaf, black pepper and gunpowder elements, rounded by ripe rich blackberry fruit.

title: Titus 2014 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is both herbaceous and densely thick in chocolate and raspberry liqueur richness, concentrated in flavor and soft in integrated tannin. The oak presents as somewhat charred and toasted, but plays well ultimately with others.

title: Titus 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a taut sinewy wine, generous in oak, with a bite of powerful ripeness. Cherry cola, vanilla and biscuit add richness to the flavor profile, with streaks of black pepper and cinnamon chiming in.

title: Wilderotter 2014 Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine has more concentration than average, adding accents of black pepper and smoke to the varietal's famously fruity flavors. The texture is nicely firm, having support from moderate tannins, so it invites a pairing with substantial proteins.

title: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Conte Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is made from a field-blended vineyard planted in 1995. Ripe, juicy and dusty, it's a well-integrated wine that holds its high level of succulence and concentration well, showing a sweetness of vanilla oak that's nicely offset by black pepper and leather accents.

title: Hoopes 2014 Maya's Block Merlot (Howell Mountain)
description: A slight reduction on the nose gives way to a brawny full-bodied expression of leather, black pepper and meat—the fruit elusive at first. Soft and sinewy, it shines on the finish in more discreet elements of cassis and red currant.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a crispness on entry that develops a fleshy texture and medium-bodied weight on the midpalate. Subdued notions of apple, pear and pineapple ply a vibrant layering of stony acidity, with a finish of richer honeycomb.

title: Lion Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Tightly wound aromas of crisp Asian pear, pomelo pith and talcum show on the refreshing nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely grippy, fresh and texturally compelling, with racy flavors of grapefruit pith, Key lime rind and a hint of melon.

title: MCV 2015 1105 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this Petite Sirah-dominant blend offers aromas of pure blackberry jam on the nose with hints of dried wild fennel and charred plum. It's rich and dense on the palate, but vivacious with fresh black-fruit energy and lifted by clove and purple-flower flavors. The acidity is bright, and tannins are firm but set in the background.

title: Trinchero 2014 BRV Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is richly layered, offering a density of brick, toasty char and dusty rock flavors and aromas—a muscular showing from a warm vintage. Black pepper, leather and dried herbs provide additional complexity around a full-bodied core.

title: Wrath 2015 115/667 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Lots of herbs, dried red currants and cranberry compote aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which has an earthy, gamy undercurrent. The palate tastes like it has more age on it, which is a good thing for now, with flavors of charred wood, damp forest floor, dried fruit and allspice, all riding a squeaky texture.

title: Heritance 2014 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a densely packed, powerful and ripe wine from a tremendous site in the heart of the appellation. Black cherry, dark chocolate and coconut shavings make for a rich impression on the velvety palate, with plenty of toasted oak for support. This wine will do well in the cellar. Enjoy from 2024–2034.

title: Nelle 2015 Syrah (California)
description: Rounded black currants and a hint of prune mix with chocolate and black pepper on the nose of this very rich and powerful bottling from Paso Robles. The palate is thick and gooey with pepper spice cutting through the black-plum-cake flavors. Firm tannins and enduring acidity hold everything in check.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Landmark Collection Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Full body and lots of toasted oak character give this reserve-style wine plenty of impact in the aroma, flavor and finish. Tempting scents of toasted almonds, vanilla and grilled baguette lead to concentrated pear, butter and cream on the palate, while the texture is powerful and velvety.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Red cherry, rust, cinnamon, vanilla and wet herbs make for a crisp and compelling nose on this bottling by winemaker Tim Slater, who manages to elicit cooler climate properties from a warmer region. A wide array of herbs, including thyme, oregano, marjoram and sage, decorate the firmly structured hibiscus, red currant and cranberry backdrop. The acid goes deep into the finish.

title: Trinchero 2014 Mario's Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Chewy and intensely herbal, this bold, powerfully built wine is bittersweet in tobacco and cigar box elements. The fruit leans into dark cherry and cassis, with a dusting of cocoa powder seasoned seductively throughout.

title: Talisman 2014 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Exhibiting all that one could hope from a coastal site, this wine offers earthy rose petal aromas around a tightly wound core of forest and tea. Structured tannin provide a framework for secondary characteristics to develop in the glass, from cranberry and orange peel to Asian five spice.

title: Whistler 2014 Estate Grown Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a light, ethereal and hugely satisfying wine, delicately layered and soft in texture. Huckleberry, Asian five spice and forest floor figure prominently along a succulent persistence of acidity and salty freshness.

title: Ashes & Diamonds 2014 No. 1 Grand Vin Merlot-Cabernet Franc (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is an inaugural blend of 75% Merlot and 25% Cabernet Franc made by Dan Petroski of Larkmead for the new producer. The grapes come from vineyards located near the winery in Oak Knoll. Dried herb de Provence aromas invite one in to mingle with aspects of cedar, pencil and red currant, the style subdued and soft. Layers of quiet power and oak lie beneath the fruit.

title: Badge 2014 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied black cherry, rosebuds, violets and a minty tobacco quality all show on the nose of this countywide blend by Bruno D'Alfonso. It commands attention on the palate, showing black currant, blueberry, black-pepper-crusted beef and candied violet flavors, balanced by strong acidity.

title: Bishop's Peak 2014 Elevation Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted cocoa, espresso cream and caramel provide richness to the nose of this Cabernet Sauvignon-led blend, but there's also bright black raspberry fruit and hints of pepper and fennel to give complexity. The palate starts with a zip, which dissipates into flavors of lilac, blueberry and anise seed.

title: Jarvis 2013 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a smoky and herbaceous version of the variety, with big, bold flavors of black cherry, blackberry and cured meat. Powerfully built in brawny tannin, it finishes soft and seductively.

title: Joseph Carr 2014 Revelist Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a classic nose of pencil shavings, cedar and ripe black plum, following through on the palate in similar fashion. Full bodied and highly concentrated, it layers in flavors of cherry compote and dark chocolate.

title: Ledson 2014 Estate Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From the winery's Mountain Terrace Vineyard 1,700-feet up, this is a floral, subdued and brightly woven red wine. Vanilla and milk chocolate flavors provide a richness and likability, with a pronounced bite of oak and tannin on the finish.

title: Martinelli 2015 Bella Vigna Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has inviting caramel-apple aromatics, which follow along a subdued palate of ripe texture and oak. A brightness of orange blossom and tangerine add freshness and vibrancy to the lush fig-filled surroundings, dotted in nutmeg.

title: Morgan 2015 Metallico Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This is a stainless steel bottling done right. Citrusy aromas of lime peel, orange pith, just-ripe Asian pear and a flash of sweet butter show on the nose. The texture is phenomenally grippy on the sip, where flavors of crushed chalk meet with yuzu zest, nectarine and white peach, remain brisk throughout. Pink-grapefruit zest carries the finish.

title: Benziger 2015 Signaterra La Reyna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Demeter-certified biodynamic grapes go into the making of this light and delicate wine—a fine example of coastal cooling. Layered in earthy rose petal and cardamom, it shows length and breadth around a quiet core of tart rhubarb and pomegranate.

title: Cedarville 2016 Estate Viognier (El Dorado)
description: In the opulent, concentrated school of thought this wonderful luxurious-tasting wine is shaped by very ripe fruit flavors and generous helpings of suave oak. Flavors run from marzipan to honeysuckle and poached pears, and a nicely viscous texture fills the mouth and helps the finish linger.

title: Potek 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rather deep and hearty on the nose, this bottling shows dark berries and black cherries as well as lighter, fresh aromas of wet slate and crushed pepper. The palate offers boysenberry, anise and dried thyme aromas, riding a straight-forward texture that could use a little acidic pop.

title: Robert Renzoni 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: This special clonal selection shows extreme promise on Robert Renzoni's estate. This vintage begins with inviting aromas of caramelized strawberry, rhubarb, vanilla and baking spice, with a rock-laden backbone. Hickory smoke, red plums and rich strawberry show on the palate, framed by firm structure and decent acidity. Full of flavor yet relatively light on its feet.

title: Sentivo 2013 Tribute Reserve Red (El Dorado)
description: So rich and tannic that it's almost chewy, this full-bodied wine is very solidly built on blackberry, black pepper and charcoal flavors. Lip-smacking tannins give maximum grip on the palate. Best after 2022.

title: Steele 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Winemaker Jed Steele keeps his groove going. Full body and a lot of flavor richness make this wine a winner. It nicely combines ripe black-cherry and blackberry notes with a subtle oak spiciness like vanilla and cinnamon on a creamy texture backed by moderate tannins.

title: Benziger 2014 Signaterra Sunny Slope Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: From certified-Biodynamic grapes, this wine impresses in its structured grasp of tight-grained tannin and full-bodied succulence. Cherry, vanilla and dust are integrated into the whole, showing a balance of fruit and power.

title: Crawford Family 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black currant syrup, licorice spice and a touch of black pepper show on the nose of this cooler-climate expression of Syrah. It leaps upon the palate with zesty cracked pepper and anise, yet the core flavors surround an elderberry jam richness. It is bold and built to last.

title: Fenestra 2014 Estate Mourvèdre (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has a mildly spicy, gamy aroma and meaty, savory flavors that are intriguing and subtle. Medium to full in body, the wine offers firm tannins, good acidity and a texture that's smooth and gripping. It's a great choice when you're tired of too fruity or too oaky wines.

title: Kunde 2016 Magnolia Lane Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is an estate-grown wine that's refreshing and memorable, with screaming yet well-integrated acidity that provides a high-pitched vibrancy along the palate of lemon zest, grapefruit and melon flavors.

title: Longoria 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rusty aromas of raspberry and cranberry meet with dust, turned earth and a slightly gamy funk on the dynamic nose of this bottling from veteran vintner Rick Longoria. That feral quality extends to the palate, where chaparral herbs and peppery spices add intrigue to the wild cranberry flavors. It is well structured with lots of depth to the finish.

title: Riboli 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the heart of Rutherford, this hearty red blends in 6% Petit Verdot. Soft, smooth and ripely full bodied, it offers a wealth of spicy red fruit and classic characteristics of dried herb and pencil shavings. It is well integrated and in balance despite its bold grasp of power.

title: Rock Wall 2015 Vigna Monte Nero Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This twist-top bottling plays up the region's riper styles yet in a tightly chiseled fashion, starting with aromas of lychee, Asian pear soufflé, brioche and the lightest touch of marshmallow. Salt, cream and exotic white-fleshed fruits show on the palate, which finishes with a touch of butterscotch.

title: Tercero 2013 Larner Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Concentrated aromas of violet, black currant, elderberry jam, plum syrup and nutmeg make for a very ripe entry to this bottling that spent 34 months in French oak barrels. The palate is still a tad sticky with tannins, but carries impressive flavors of lilac, lavender, cola and blackberry jam.

title: Writer's Block 2015 Pinot Noir (Lake County)
description: This engaging wine is nicely complex, not overly ripe or too full-bodied. Aromas of black tea and red cherries precede tangy rhubarb and intricate spice flavors backed by a good structure of light tannins and juicy acidity.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Full bodied and fleshy, this 100% varietal wine offers polished tannin and toasty oak, the flavors lean and classically defined in pencil, cedar and soy. Notes of black pepper and tobacco etch themselves onto a lengthy finish.

title: August Briggs 2014 Old Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: Smoky and earthy, this wine has an underlying vegetal character that works against its old-vine, grippy and full-bodied nature. Smoky char, pencil and black-cherry and berry flavors add to the well-made whole.

title: Bellante 2016 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)
description: Red pear skins, poached pear flesh, white peach and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a winery that makes a lot of Viognier. More peach, mango, tropical fruits and pencil shavings show on the sip, which is woven together by tight tannins and a pithy grip.

title: Benessere 2014 Phenomenon Red (St. Helena)
description: A hearty, rustic and well-made blend, this combines 39% estate-grown Merlot, 26% Syrah, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Sangiovese. It tastes of blackberry and blueberry cobbler and dusty plum, with light touches of mocha that give it additional richness among its soft layers.

title: Benessere 2016 Estate Grown Moscato (St. Helena)
description: Sweet jasmine and honeysuckle aromas invite one into this dessert-wine experience, made from the producer's estate-grown Moscato di Canelli grapes. Thick viscous waves of floral orange blossom, honey and apricot contribute a rich rounded palate of light flavor.

title: Cannonball 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Fleshy and lightly ripe, this wine embraces fresh flavors of nectarine, quince and melon, with slight teases of lemongrass and honeysuckle. Bright, persistent acidity supports just the right amount of body and breadth.

title: Chalk Hill 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)
description: Salty and briny around a fruity core of green apple and Meyer lemon meringue, this approachable white is full bodied and wholly concentrated, with plenty of integrated oak. A steely ring of acidity keeps it from becoming too rich, with a finish nicely polished in vanilla.

title: Geyser Peak 2016 Water Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Fleshy and robust in oak, this wine offers a rounded ripeness of tropical fruit and butterscotch, flavors that work well with each other and take on added richness in the glass.

title: Hearst Ranch 2017 Glacier Ridge Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Bruised apple and poached pear aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Hearst family. It seems a bit sweet on the palate, with ripe apples and pears as well as a touch of roasted nuts.

title: Joseph Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine has a sweetness of brown sugar underlying jammy black cherry, soft tannin and robust oak. Richly round and approachable, it's a crowd pleaser for fans of a big jammy style.

title: Roblar 2017 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft aromas of nectarine and lemon zest show on the nose of this appellation blend. There is decent grip to the sip, which is rather light in flavors, offering apple blossom and fresh pear flavors alongside a touch of tannic tension.

title: Sand Point 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Rich fruit and peppery spices combine in this full-bodied smooth-textured wine, giving it a rather bold earthy effect. The aroma shows black pepper and ripe plum while the flavors give black-cherry notes.

title: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Grigio (Central Coast)
description: Tangy pear, lime skins and lemongrass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a decent tension to the palate, where Bartlett pear and soda-like flavors of 7-Up arise.

title: Alara 2015 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Light nectarine and vanilla cookies aromas are coated in a damp oak aroma on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a bright lemony edge to the palate, where the core is mostly dried apple and sandalwood flavors.

title: Clark-Claudon 2017 Wild Iris Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, rich and moderate in acidity, this full-bodied white is fleshy and robust in lemon, lime and grapefruit flavors.

title: EOS 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Pungent aromas of candied raspberry meet with rose petal and cinnamon on the fresh, vibrant and somewhat sweet nose of this bottling. There's a sweetness to the palate as well, where candied cherries and red currants make for an easily enjoyable fruit-punch profile.

title: Joseph Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Fermented in stainless steel, this wine opens in lime salt and stone, with a light texture and minimal structure. The oak takes on flavors of butterscotch and crème brûlée.

title: Lula 2016 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Concentrated dark-fruit flavors are slightly over-matched by a prominent oak character in this full-bodied spicy wine. The aroma shows plenty of baking spices and charred wood, while the flavors have black cherry and black pepper with nutmeg. It's a big tempting wine but unusual for the varietal.

title: Proximity Twenty Six 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Deeply colored in the glass, this wine shows blackberry, elderberry and light smoke on the nose. The sip starts with fresh black-raspberry and plum-juice flavors, and the tannic tension is strong and sticky, though the mouthfeel is somewhat thin.

title: Reynoso 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Lighthearted and moderate in ripeness and oak, this wine is plummy and round in dark chocolate and a lasting note of tobacco.

title: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This moderately ripe, affordable wine is fruity in cherry and berry flavors and has a soft rounded structure of unfussy richness.

title: Carson Ridge 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked meat, black raspberries and gamy aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is somewhat tight and sticky, with underripe blackberry flavors as well as dried herbs and roasted meat.

title: Flower Child 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fruity and full bodied, this white is densely concentrated in pear, nutmeg and a confectionery core of vanilla crème brûlée.

title: La Crema 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Hibiscus, sumac, pepper and vanilla aromas show on the nose of this widely available bottling, which works as a midweek sipper. The fruit is fairly ripe and extracted, showing flavors of orange-cranberry juice, although the mouthfeel remains a bit thin.

title: Ledson 2015 Estate Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Reduced and tightly wound, this wine features generous helpings of tannin and oak around juicy brambly blackberry and a component of dried spicy fruit and nut.

title: Lula 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A very pale color and equally subtle flavors come with a tart mouthfeel and very crisp balance in this light-bodied and refreshing wine.

title: Lyeth 2015 Red (California)
description: Spicy smoky pruney aromas lead to chocolate, raisin and baking-spice flavors in this full-bodied rich-textured wine. It's quite dark in color, very spicy and flavorful, but relatively soft and easy in texture.

title: Oceano 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Lime pith and sharp apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the extremely coastal Spanish Springs Vineyard, and there is a touch of a vinous quality as well. Ripe pear flavors show on the tip of the sip, where acidic energy cuts through the somewhat sweet characteristics of the midpalate.

title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
