description: This full-bodied wine has toasty, peppery aromas and rather smoky flavors, for a personality that's more oaky than fruity. But the wine pulls it off well and is flavorful, mouth-filling and yet well-balanced.

title: Peju 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth, rounded and easygoing on the palate, this is an approachable wine that's well-made, a study in tobacco, black currant and cherry-vanilla swirls.

title: Reyes 2015 Amber Chardonnay (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: A bronze-orange in color, this “orange” wine is quite interesting, with burnt orange peels, light maraschino cherry and liquor-like aromas on the nose, which is reminiscent of an old-fashioned cocktail. Rusty, sherry-like flavors show on the sip alongside more burnt orange and toasted barley. It's unique but worth trying.

title: Tangley Oaks 2015 Lot #15 Merlot (Mendocino)
description: Seductive cinnamon aromas lead to ripe red-cherry flavors in this attractively oaky wine. It adds nutmeg and clove to a pleasant and almost sweet fruitiness, while the texture is smooth and just lightly tannic.

title: Lois Rae 2014 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)
description: Whole-cluster pressed and cofermented with 3% Viognier, this wine is brawny in leather, tobacco and white pepper. Moderately ripe, it offers a slight richness that remains balanced, with a floral hint of lavender on the nose.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry jam, milk chocolate shavings and an asphalt minerality show on the rich and inviting nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is soft and elegant, with noticeable tannins serving as the backbone, and flavors of bright blackberry and mocha ride a deep lasting acidity.

title: Portalupi 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Intensely forested, this wine's fruit is compressed and tightly packed on the palate, with the texture somewhat gravelly in nature. Spicy nutmeg rides alongside cranberry, raspberry, plum and orange flavors, all wrapped in a medium-bodied frame.

title: Sanguis 2014 The Hat-trick White (Central Coast)
description: This blend of Marsanne, Chardonnay and Roussanne is hard it pin down. Aromas of salty nuts, honey mustard, dried apples, hay and orange rind are fairly shy. Unique flavors of popcorn, fermented tropical fruits, citrus peel and sandalwood show on the sip.

title: Smith Devereux 2015 Ibex Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a combination of 85% Merlot and 15% Petite Sirah. Shy on the nose, it slowly reveals aromas of pencil, bittersweet tobacco and clove, unfurling a juicy core of plum and dark cherry on the lengthy full-bodied palate. A strong presence of tannin and oak is felt.

title: Tin Barn 2014 Gilsson Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Richly developed flavors of dark chocolate, pretzel, leather and cedar with dried herb mark this big darkly concentrated wine, that is substantial in tannin.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Blend 150 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very plummy, hibiscus-laced aromas show strongly on this blend of 50% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre, which is enhanced by a pinch of dried herbs and some cola spice. There is chalky depth to the tannins on the palate, which is easygoing overall, with more red plum and light herb flavors. It is a solid everyday sipper.

title: ZD 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Fresh melon aromas lead to more buttery, pear-like flavors in this fruity, well-rounded and rather soft-textured wine from a well-established Napa Valley brand. It's medium bodied and easy to sip.

title: 29 & Oak Wines 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from half Merlot and nearly equal amounts Petite Sirah and Zinfandel, this is a brawny broad-shouldered blend rich in black fruit, oak and sturdy tannin. Full bodied, it shows secondary tones of graphite and tobacco.

title: Ampelos 2014 Delta Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the producer's estate vineyard, the fruit certified biodynamic and organic, this is a rustic, daring wine, ethereal on the one hand in body and spirit, while biting in tannin. Ash and earthy strawberry provide the core of flavor.

title: Barton 2016 Broken Road Viognier (Templeton Gap District)
description: Bright aromas of melon, strawberry guava, lemon blossom, tuberose and ripe apples show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines citrusy energy and decent tension with ripe pear and guava-cream flavors.

title: Benessere 2016 Pinot Grigio (Napa Valley)
description: Floral, this wine offers voluptuously sizable weight and body around a soft texture of lasting acidity. The fruit leans tartly into grapefruit and lime.

title: C R Graybehl 2015 Mounts Family Vineyards Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Smooth and tannic, this wine from Grenache specialist speaks loudly to a core of dried cherry, almost liqueur-like in its richness and density, given savory companionship by thickets of leather.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Soft and varietal in nature, this wine offers dusty plum, leather and black currant and cherry, its structure simple and richly round. There's a hint of black licorice on the lengthy finish.

title: Firefly Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This is a solid reliable wine for the price, with aromas of chamomile, seared lemon peels and butter-poached nectarine. The palate is well rounded with lemon wedge and white peach flavors, presented with decent zip and structure.

title: Talley 2015 Monte Sereno Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Unfortunately, this very tiny vineyard only makes three barrels of Chardonnay, because this bottling is fantastic in every way. The lively nose shows lemon-lime soda, honeydew, gardenia and sea shells, while the palate is framed by a stunning chalky tension and sizzling acidity. Flavors of honeysuckle and green melon meet with salty ocean spray toward the finish.

title: J. Lohr 2014 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is the second vintage release of J. Lohr's Signature wine, first produced to commemorate founder Jerry Lohr's 80th birthday. Rich aromas of stewed black plum, blackberry pie, vanilla, clove and prune cake show on the nose. The mouthfeel is rich overall, but with firm tannins in the background that lend structure to the strawberry and blackberry flavors, graced by hints of wood smoke, peppercorn and licorice. Drink now–2029.

title: Sanguis 2014 1/1 Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Interesting and intense aromas of baked bread and coffee syrup combine with deep plum fruit, shaved chocolate, toasted wood and hints of caramel and white pepper on the nose of this excellent Syrah. The palate is framed by suave, chalky tannins, carrying dynamic and delicious flavors of black currant, blackberry, black pepper and roasted espresso beans.

title: Calluna 2014 The Colonel's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: This is from a small block of the proprietor's vineyard and made entirely from one variety. It's gorgeous and perfumed, grippy and hugely structured, with a bright exuberantly complex midpalate of intriguing plum and peppery clove. Gentle and balanced, it's enjoyable now, but will also age. Enjoy best 2024 through 2034.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Sunshine Valley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is a firm wine, bombastic in tannin structure and oak, with a nuanced hint of noble reduction. Youthfully grippy in a thicket of tar, it bristles in black currant, black cherry and sage, dusted in mountain rock, black pepper and a delightful sniff of violet. Entirely barrel-fermented, it should do well in time, enjoyed best from 2023 through 2033 and quite possibly beyond.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a beautifully understated and refined wine, savory in character with complex layers of black olive, lavender and black tea. Secondary characteristics come into play on the silky smooth palate, a mix of old-world cedar, pencil shavings, graphite and gun smoke.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Era Red (Napa Valley)
description: A conservative 4% Cabernet Franc adds floral aroma and subtle herbaceousness to this Cabernet Sauvignon, which bristles on the nose in sandalwood and hibiscus. The rounded rich flavors tend toward red cherry and cassis—big bold layers of concentration supported by well-integrated tannin.

title: Black Kite 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Beautifully oaky and unctuously voluptuous, this is from a tremendously farmed site in the throes of the Petaluma Gap. Richly layered in tones of butterscotch and brioche, its length and breadth are punctuated by sharp teases of wild fennel and nutmeg.

title: Westwood 2015 Wendling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This first effort by Westwood from an Anderson Valley vineyard favored by Copain and Littorai is a stunner. A deft touch of spicy oak lifts the aroma, and meets compelling, intricate notes of red and black cherry, rhubarb and mushroom on the palate. This elegant, memorable wine has great structure due to firm acidity and lightly gripping tannins, which surround and support the wonderful, exotic and complex flavors. Best after 2020.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Hapgood Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: More like a focused fruit missile than an indiscriminate fruit bomb, this bottling shows flashy, vibrant waves of pure strawberry, red cherry and black raspberry that are edged by hints of dark earth, light spearmint and sweet bay leaf. The sip offers tart and exotic plums wrapped up in an herbal cape of thyme and potpourri. This will please many palates.

title: Jarvis 2008 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This aged wine shows the worth of waiting—an Old-World expression of balance and grace with plenty of California power. Spicy and exotic on the nose in floral, mushroomy complexity, it has secondary characteristics of cedar and pencil shavings that ride along a gripping yet velvety carpet of texture.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Entirely barrel-fermented, this deliciously crafted wine is a powerful embrace of grace and beauty, smooth and velvety thick, with a depth of complex layering. Blackberry and black cherry shine brightest amidst a dusty, rocky underbrush of sage and mineral. Built to age with its elegant structure, it will be hard to resist enjoying this wine now.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Goldrock Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a concentrated and robustly ripe wine, spicy and velvety with a powerful punch of toasted oak. Forest floor elements and a depth of earth provide varietal character as rich interwoven flavors of baked cherry and rhubarb give it a warmth that's expansive across the finish.

title: Sanguis 2014 Bossman Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Extreme amounts of roasted beef and grilled lamb aromas meet with rosemary, bay leaf and crushed rainbow peppercorns for a deliciously savory and spicy nose on this bottling, which uses a touch of Viognier but doesn't offer any overt fruit. Those meaty qualities ride into the palate, where burnt bacon flavors meet with tar, black pepper and a hint of black currant.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a powerfully tannic and oaky wine from a warm site and a warm vintage that doesn't deny its ripeness and concentration of flavor. Clove, red currant and pencil shavings wrap around a gravelly core of midpalate weight and power, as specks of dust and pepper reveal themselves on the lengthy finish.

title: Calluna 2014 Estate Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This expertly blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec, in that order. Grippy, it's quite savory, highlighted in cedar and pencil shavings that dot a sublime, supple core of tannin, seasoned in dried herb.

title: Davies Vineyard 2014 Red Cap Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is an expansively rich, generous vineyard-designate from the high-elevation appellation. A wealth of plum, cherry, cassis and cola spice mingle effortlessly around a core of integrated tannin and oak, with handfuls of welcome floral aromas and spicy black pepper.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Machado Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The stunning aromatic profile on this bottling compellingly combines candied fruit with the lift of crushed herbs, while blending cherry and grenadine with mint, bay leaf, a hint of green olive and a touch of crushed gravel on the nose. That lovable core of plush red fruits rides tight tannins on the palate, where bay leaf, thyme and green peppercorn flavors complete the sip.

title: Jarvis 2012 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a beautifully integrated, layered and soft wine, completely fulfilling in its grasp of smoky char, cherry, berry, currant and black licorice. It remains supple and succulent on the palate from start to finish, offering complex acidity and earthiness.

title: Lynmar 2015 Summit Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a spectacular block within the estate Quail Hill Vineyard in the heart of Russian River Valley's Laguna Ridge, this wine is taut and tightly wound, youthfully exuberant in cherry and blueberry compote. Bright and fresh in lifted acidity, it offers length and balance within a velvety complex texture.

title: Stolpman 2016 Hilltops Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Intense aromas of black currant, violets and white pepper make for an extremely purple expression on the nose of this bottling by the family-owned winery. Snappy black-plum and boysenberry flavors are lifted by peppercorns and crushed herbs on the palate, which offers both tart and ripe elements for a dynamic experience.

title: Alara 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Deep and concentrated aromas of black plum and red currant meet an earthy core of herbs and forest floor on the nose of this bottling. Fresh and snappy flavors of raspberry and pomegranate are framed by a chalky texture on the palate, where sagebrush and incense flavors also arise.

title: Baca 2016 Tug O' War Maffei Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Beautifully inviting in aromas of baked bread and cherry-berry fruitiness, this is a well-integrated, soft and rich wine that delivers plenty of vibrant flavor and complexity. A note of charred oak provides complexity on the finish.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Delfino Malbec (El Dorado)
description: Rich aromas of blackberry jam and equally concentrated fruit flavors give a lot of enjoyment to this deeply colored, full-bodied wine. It has lots of fine-grained tannins that enrich the texture while nuances of black pepper and boysenberry flood the tongue and linger on the finish.

title: Crosby Roamann 2014 Crosby's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy blue fruit is wrapped in expansive tannins in this complex, nicely structured, reserve-level wine. Clove, nutmeg and black pepper dot a well-textured palate accented in ample acidity and lovely length and breadth.

title: Davies 2016 Nobles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Soft in wild blue fruit, black tea and stemmy earth, this wine has a brooding earthiness that's exotic and beguiling. It invites with a perfume of violet and rose as well as coastal salt and crushed rock, mineral components that accent a grainy texture.

title: Domaine Anderson 2014 Pinoli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Deep ripe fruit flavors give this full-bodied wine a big personality, while moderate tannins and brisk acidity add a nice textural touch. It has plenty of ripe black-fruit aromas and flavors, and light spicy accents like cinnamon and black tea.

title: Easton 2015 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Smooth and supple all the way through, this concentrated and powerful wine nevertheless has great layers of ripe fruit and velvety tannins. Grown at 2,000-feet in elevation, it has black cherry and blackberry that blend with hints of black pepper and toasted oak as the flavors roll across and linger on the palate.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Grant Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Black raspberry, red plum candy and a hint of hibiscus show on the nose of this bottling from a new winery owned by Andy Busch of the Anheuser-Busch family. There are intense streaks of red flowers and rosewater on the palate, alongside notes of plum and cinnamon.

title: Jessie's Grove 2014 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A velvety texture based on a wealth of fine-grained tannins sets this high-octane wine apart. That structure supports good ripe fruit flavors and lots of spicy oak accents so the wine is layered and long on the finish.
designation: Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Old Vine

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Dolcetto (Lodi)
description: Lavish dark-fruit flavors meld with moderately spicy oak nuances for a rich, layered and delicious combination. The wine is deeply colored, redolent of black cherries and blueberries in the aroma, and practically gushing with rich fruit and spice notes on the palate and finish.

title: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)
description: This wine is powerful but well-balanced, showing a ripe black-fruit aroma and rich black-cherry flavor. Moderate tannins and bright acidity yield a lip-smacking texture. The appealing fruit flavors are lightly accented by subtle oak spice.

title: Le Casque 2017 Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)
description: This charming wine offers richness backed by well-honed acidity, so it stays fresh on the palate through the finish. Light baking-spice and honeysuckle aromas lead to subtle vanilla and white-peach flavors that enhance the smooth mouthfeel.

title: Lion Ranch 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Plush aromas of white peach and honeysuckle are cut by wet gravel, river stones and rain-on-cement elements on the tense nose of this bottling. There is lots of acidic zip and grippy tensions to the palate, where lemon-lime, grapefruit pith and nearly petrol flavors play out.

title: Margerum 2017 D Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This blend of fruit from the McGinley and Grassini vineyards is fermented in cigar barrels, and shows rounded aromas of passion fruit and nectarine on the nose alongside lime, grass and chalk. There is a smoky quality to the smoke, with red pear, chalk and grass flavors wrapped in a creamy texture.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine tastes delicious, honest, full of fruit flavors and has a velvety texture that carries blackberry, black cherry and light oak spices over the palate and hangs on to them through the finish. It is full bodied, lightly tannic and quite concentrated.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Root 49 Syrah (Nevada County)
description: This is big but agile wine that deftly balances an earthy, wild-herb character with vibrant red-cherry and plum flavors and has just the right amount of fine-grained tannins and good acidity for grip and freshness on the palate. Best after 2023.

title: Neely 2016 Home Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Nutty aromas of walnut and hazelnut meet with sandalwood and a cream pudding touch on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong citrus pith tension to the palate alongside the roasted nut flavor, and the finish is waxy in texture.

title: Shannon 2015 Home Ranch Reserve Malbec (Lake County)
description: An alluring spicy aroma and generous, opulent fruit flavors pack this full-bodied wine with pleasure. It has a velvety, almost-thick texture, blackberry, blueberry and oak spice flavors that are concentrated and deep, plus a good structure of fine-grained tannins.

title: Via Romano 2015 Moscato di Nero Black Muscat (Sierra Foothills)
description: An amazing floral aroma lights up this supersweet and fortified red wine before vivid, ripe and grapey flavors flood the palate and a good viscous texture coats the sides of the mouth. It's ultrarich, decadent and syrupy.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Bootlegger's Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens with a rustic forest element of garrigue, before unleashing its full embrace of crisp red fruit. Rhubarb, strawberry and cherry combine within an oaky, tannic framework of power that falls away slowly in the glass, refreshed in acidity.

title: Summerland 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lavish aromas of black cherry pie, clove, vanilla, warm brioche, almond croissant and loamy earth show on the nose of this bottling by Etienne Terlinden from the historic vineyard. Hearty and wild blackberry flavors mix with thyme, tarragon, juniper and black tea on the palate.

title: The Vineyard House 2015 Chardonnay (Oakville)
description: This is a fully realized, expertly made wine, robust in apricot and peach on the nose. Balanced in richness and concentration, it's gritty and textured, beguiling all around, with additional highlights of vanilla bean, anise and lemon rind.

title: Walt 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the winery's Bob's Ranch vineyard primarily, this is a beautiful white wine, and an inaugural release, that is floral and voluptuously creamy in texture. Despite its fulsome nature, it retains balance via a thread of persistently bright acidity amidst rich tones of candied pear, peach, anise and vanilla crème brûlée. It has length for days.

title: De Loach 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an expansive, vibrantly alive and buzzy white that's floral in apple and orange blossom aromas. Its freshness is complemented by richer deeper undertones of baked quince and tangerine, with a gravelly stony quality to the texture that makes it hard to resist.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this countywide blend is extremely elegant and lovely, with light rose petals, pressed black plums and crushed violets. There's a tremendously grippy texture to the sip, providing a pure tension that delivers flavors of purple fruit and rosewater. It's a testament to the versatility of the variety.

title: Lynmar 2015 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with incredibly floral aromatics—a perfume of rose and lavender that shines along a delicately layered and textured wine. Cherry pie flavors provide juicy succulence and delight. The freshness lasts and lingers, dotted in cardamom and black tea.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is Greg Brewer's appellation blend rather than his single-vineyard expressions, but it's still incredibly dynamic and delicious. A fresh and fruity strawberry-slushie aroma is met with notes of crushed slate and star anise-spiced cookies on the nose. The palate is bright in flavors of slightly tart cherries and ripe cranberries, but then come juniper and pine needle on the midpalate. Acidity pumps into the pomegranate and menthol finish.

title: Sanguis 2014 Verve Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Roussanne by Matthias Pippig makes for a unique, amazingly integrated aromatic profile, much like a cake made of roses, black plum, muddy clay and salumi. The loamy and rose-laced quality extends to the sip, where spice cake, game and hearty purple fruits make for a cohesive quaff.

title: Kaena 2015 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Mikael Sigouin extracts the rich side of Grenache in most of his bottlings, and this is an excellent example. Deep and stunning aromas of lilac, cola, red cherries, strawberry-balsamic glaze, black cardamom and sharp sandalwood lead into a palate that's lavish with chai spice, dried ginger and cherry-cordial flavors. Tannins pile up toward the finish and the acidity sings through it all.

title: Bookmark Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This 100% varietal wine is dusty and gritty, a showcase of rich full flavor and balanced ripeness. Clove, cedar and red and black currant are prominent and well-integrated within a framework of tight-grained tannins and supportive oak.

title: Casa Dumetz 2015 Thompson Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light in color, this wine's beautiful nose shows freshly pressed raspberry, dewy tarragon, fennel and lavender aromas—a showcase of aromatic elegance. Immensely fresh and inviting flavors pop on the palate, from tart strawberry and green fennel to rose petals and rosewater, all framed by a long-simmering acidity. It would work well with either white fish or roasted pork.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2012 Names White Hawk Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Scott Sampler sources from White Hawk Vineyard for this bottling, which offers hearty aromas of cooked red cherry, smoked meats, sweet tar, stewed figs and condensed coffee. The palate is fresh with pressed blackberry and violet flavors, but it's the velvety texture that's most compelling. The finish shows spice cake, black pepper and soy.

title: Daou 2015 Seventeen Forty Reserve Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: This elegant blend of 65% Cabernet Franc and 35% Merlot is still very wound up on the nose, and yet already amazing in aromas of crushed gravel, tar, condensed black currant, black pepper and earthy bay leaf. On the palate, the acidity and tightly woven tannins are pitch perfect for long-term aging, which will allow the black fruit and dark spice flavors to mature. Sit on it until 2019, and drink through 2035.

title: Davies Vineyard 2014 Winfield Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Spicy and wooded, this is a balanced wine, exotic in tart, tangy cranberry and dialed-high in firm acidity. Supportive supple tannins give it finesse and medium-bodied power.

title: Eric Kent 2015 Luke's Grove Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Resplendent in youthful reduction, this is an ultimately bright, lemony and beautifully integrated white, complementary in creamy vanilla and baked pear. A thread of honeysuckle adds aromatic intrigue that persists through the lengthy finish.

title: Furthermore 2014 Eden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: An expansively juicy and soft velvety wine, this delivers coastal influence in droves, balancing earthy cardamom, cola and forest floor with tastes of tea leaf and bright cherry. Light-bodied and silky, it rewards in flavor, texture and complexity.

title: Jaffurs 2014 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a compelling amount of freshness and vivacity for a Syrah in this bottling, starting with aromas of boysenberry juice, wild thyme, wisteria and sweet peppercorn sauce. Crushed lilacs and lavender meet with black-currant jam and black pepper on the palate, which deftly combines ripe fruit with a savory side.

title: Justin 2013 Isosceles Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: There's an impressive fresh quality to the nose of this blend of 84% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Cabernet Franc and 5% Merlot, with aromas of blackberry, juicy black plum, dill, lilacs and a dusting of vanilla. The fruit-forward palate grabs the attention immediately with black currant, pepper dust, roast beef crust and more purple flowers, with tannins and acidity rising strong on the finish.

title: MacRostie 2014 Thale's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a vineyard in the Middle Reach area of the appellation, which is relatively warm, this shows an intensity of earthy forest and black tea as well as cardamom. Velvety thick, it has a freshness of acidity that buzzes along on the palate, prompted by flavors of cranberry, cherry and tangerine.

title: St. Francis 2015 Tres Viejos Old Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Juicy, smoky and exuberantly fruity on the nose, this wine is smooth and integrated, with rich lush layers of crushed rock, mocha and blackberry that burst on the robust full-bodied palate.

title: Stasis 2015 Murmur Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe cherry, star anise and boiled plum aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is also rather ripe but enjoyable, showing cranberry, hibiscus and a hint of orange rind, wrapped in compelling structure and acidity.

title: Vezer Family Vineyard 2017 Arlene Chardonnay (Suisun Valley)
description: Richness of flavor and an especially creamy, melting texture help this wine stand out in a crowd. The wine is 80% barrel fermented and aged on the lees. It has concentrated and ripe pear, peach and apple flavors and a silky mouthfeel.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Family Reserve G-S-M (Temecula Valley)
description: There's a dried fennel note that shows on many Temecula Valley wines, but this blend of 48% Grenache, 34% Syrah and 18% Mourvèdre uses that spice note to its advantage. Plump red-plum and hickory-smoke aromas touch on that anise-like note on the nose, while the palate shows cherry wood, elegant red-fruit and roasted fennel-bulb flavors.

title: Ziata 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied white brings a stony mineral texture, with fleshy flavors of guava and mango. It offers complexity and nuance against a full embrace of ripeness.

title: Newton 2016 Skyside Claret (North Coast)
description: Mint, chocolate and cherry flavors intermingle in this dry, full-bodied and firmly tannic wine blended from Bordeaux grape varieties. It offers plenty of blackberry notes shaded by black pepper and smoke and will stand up to the juiciest protein you can order.

title: Ancien 2016 Musque Chardonnay (Coombsville)
description: Fleshy in defined flavors of peach and pear, this is a bright white wine, defined by perfumed aromas of jasmine and white flower. Fresh acidity supports a moderate structure of balanced ripeness.

title: Au Contraire 2014 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens with a nutty, woody nose that delves quickly into a brazen blue-fruit flavor. Clove and pepper season it well and contribute to its length and depth.

title: Balletto 2015 18 Barrel Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A departure for this producer who tends to focus on its single-vineyard sites, this wine combines the best of several sites, with longevity and complexity in mind. It showcases the best of the coast's savory qualities, offering muted spice, firm tannins, orange, currant and a velvety midpalate.

title: Balletto 2016 Winery Block Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy, grippy and expansive in red and black cherry, this medium-bodied wine is smooth and seductive, an ideal representative of its reasonably warm site. It finishes on tones of black tea and rose petal.
designation: Winery Block Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Belden Barns 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Made from grapes grown at 1,000-foot elevation, this wine is velvety thick and concentrated, with a decadence and grip to it that intrigues. Black licorice, black cherry and blackberry dance around each other with intent, providing a warm, full-bodied explosion of flavorful beauty.

title: Bouchaine 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: With a slight edge of reduction on the nose, and a leathery, earthy entry, this wine opens nicely into waves of soft, round and rich black-cherry, strawberry and blueberry. It maintains its exuberance through the succulent midpalate and quiet finish.

title: Corley 2014 Proprietory Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend is nearly a third each of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, with a deep, dark oak profile and plenty of firm, chalky tannins. The flavors lean toward licorice and cherry, with a bit of coffee and toffee richness.

title: Covenant 2016 Zahav Late Harvest Botrytis Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Made in a Sauternes-like method, this dessert wine is balanced and smooth, its interwoven layers a celebration of salted caramel, green apple and dried apricot. Not too sweet nor rich, it will classically reward with blue cheeses, spiced nuts or on its own.

title: Geyser Peak 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Excellent fruit concentration and very good balance make this full-bodied wine a winner. Minty cedary aromas accent the vivid black-cherry and pomegranate flavors as moderate tannins and fresh acidity add appetizing structure.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Crisp waves of cherry vanilla are complemented by citrus-driven acidity in this light bright wine that's well made and memorable. Textured, it is lengthy and has ample body to work on its own or with food.

title: Grace + Vine 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Red-cherry compote, balsamic-glazed berries and a pinch of dried sage show on the nose of this bottling from a new label that's made by a secret group of winemakers. It's relatively light on the palate but full of flavors, from sour cherry and cranberry to pepper dust and dried marjoram.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2015 Solo Barrique Malbec (South Coast)
description: Deep, dark and lush aromas of blackberry, black plums, lilac and smoked meat show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is well rounded and cohesive, showing berry, plum and espresso-bean flavors.

title: Jordan 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tense, tart and crisply mineral-laden white wine, thick on entry in peach and melon flavor. The midpalate finds peace and balance, allowing a slight bit of reduction to linger and the finish to focus in acidity.

title: Joseph Jewell 2014 Starscape Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This vineyard used to be called the Floodgate Vineyard and has been a consistent source of grapes to the producer. Soft, plush and brimming in dark rustic cherry and cardamom, this wine is also plenty earthy, a mix of turned earth and dried herb. The tannins are thick and strong.

title: Tamber Bey 2017 Lizzy's Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Oakville)
description: Pea shoots, lemon and wet stone contribute graceful flavors to this wine, which has a metallic edge to its medium-bodied texture.

title: Line 39 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: The ripe berry exuberance of this medium-bodied wine is undeniable as it oozes blackberry aromas and black-cherry flavors uncomplicated by much oak influence. A smooth texture, low acid and tannins make it easy to sip.

title: MacLaren 2017 Aida Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral and brimming in green apple on entry, this wine takes on a confectionery air of candied ginger and tropical mango as it opens in the glass.

title: Belden Barns 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Strong flavors and aromas of pea shoots, peach and sweet vanilla give this wine a richness and full-bodied, fleshy personality.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light and quite bubbly in the glass, this bottling offers lots of chalky, key lime and botanical aromas. The bubbles are also very present on the sip, with lime rind and flint flavors.

title: Ballard Lane 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: Apple flesh and watery lemon aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's flat on the palate, offering lime zest and more sliced-apple flavors.

title: Pezzi King 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine has a jalapeño spiciness on the nose that intensifies into the lush, round palate of buttery cream that accentuates the unctuous ripeness overall.

title: Rotation Vineyards 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine leans toward sweetness and offers flavors like grape jam and maple syrup. It is generally soft in texture but does have a touch of grippy tannin.

title: Verde 2017 Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Strawberry, watermelon and red-plum aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows nicely zippy red-fruit flavors but is somewhat muted and vinous overall.

title: Bellante 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)
description: The nose on this bottling is seriously tropical, with candied honeydew, coconut oil and guava paste. The palate is oily and also tropically heavy, with mango and banana flavors.

title: Leese-Fitch 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: A matchstick aroma leads to crisp lemon and apple flavors in this tangy medium-bodied non-oaky wine.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Wildwood Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: This wine has a slight metallic edge to it, a twist that muddles the heartiness of its tropical fruit and creamy texture.

title: Dusty Nabor 2017 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A yellowish shade of pink, this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Grenache and 15% Petite Sirah is a tad oxidative on the nose, showing tangy lemon rinds, roasted nuts and reduced watermelon. The palate offers lemon pith and more of that nutty kick, proving almost sherry-like.

title: Europa Village 2015 C'est La Vie Winemaker's Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Reserved at first on the nose, this bottling slowly shows red cherry, dried cranberry, spearmint and tarragon on the nose. The palate is tremendously ripe and thick with flavors of overcooked cranberry, more mint and a touch of anise.

title: Shooting Star 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Thick in texture and more savory than fruity in flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a streak of sweetness like meringue on the palate

title: Château Souverain 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine offers jammy aromas and a softly textured palate that boasts rich berry-fruit flavors. This is a simple, straightforward pour.

title: Van Ruiten 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Fruit flavors take the lead in this medium-bodied, lightly sweet wine. It gushes cherry and raspberry aromas, coats the palate with a pleasant jammy character and feels soft in texture.

title: Landmark 2016 Overlook Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Green-olive tapenade makes for a zesty backbone against which a confounding confectionery flavor takes over on the palate in this uncertain wine.

title: Crooked Path 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Very pruney aromas kick off this quite over-extracted and overripe bottling. That leads into a palate dominated by raisin flavors as well as a roasted meat touch, while the acidity is persistent.

title: Suveg 2014 Problem Child Syrah (Lodi)
description: Blackberry and cedar highlight this full-bodied but quickly aging wine. A sunbaked balsamic character in the aroma is followed by lots of fruit and moderate spices wrapped in firm tannins.

title: Azios 2017 Born Like This Calf Canyon Vineyard Dry White Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)
description: A yellowish shade of pink, this very restrained, fresh and bright bottling shows steely aromas on the nose alongside tightly woven lemon-rind and Rainier cherry notes. The palate is wrapped in a chalky texture, carrying citrusy flavors as well as touches of red apple, nectarine and, on the finish, a touch of toast.
designation: Born Like This Calf Canyon Vineyard Dry White

title: Carol Shelton 2016 Monga Zin Old Vine Lopez Vineyard Zinfandel (Cucamonga Valley)
description: This bottling is always a fun taste of Southern California's wine-growing history. Exotic plum and alpine strawberry aromas mix with sweet juniper and herbal cola aromas on the nose. There's a menthol-like spice to the palate, giving depth to the plum jelly core, with tannins rising toward the finish.
designation: Monga Zin Old Vine Lopez Vineyard

title: Lloyd 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cinnamon, star anise and strawberry aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate carries flavors of dark pomegranate and black raspberry, bound together with a tightly wound acidity and layered with mossy earth elements.

title: Long Meadow Ranch 2015 Ranch House Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine in red and black currant, this is a smooth, richly concentrated red with a backbone of dried herb and clove. It finds balance in its fruit-forward embrace of complementary oak and approachable tannin.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Coeurtina Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Tight-grained buttery oak forms the framework around which deliciously integrated flavors of Granny Smith apple, fennel and white flowers pique the palate. Medium-bodied and elegant in approach, this is a pleasant white with ample complexity.

title: Matchbook 2016 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This wine blends subtle spices with rich fruit for a seductive flavor profile. It maintains a velvety texture on the palate and through the lingering finish. Flavors of blueberry and baking spice give it plenty of personality.

title: Scheid 2016 Riverview Vineyard Estate Grown Dolcetto (Monterey)
description: While plum-driven on the nose, aromas of carnation and hibiscus round out the bouquet. There's a chalky texture to the palate, with light tannins and piercing acidity, showing flavors of plum and black pepper.

title: Strala 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Lush, plush and thickly wrapped in flavors of black plum, mocha, chocolate and coffee, this wine is made in a big, effusive style and appealing in its full embrace of bold ripe power.

title: Zinke 2015 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: There's a great deal of thyme and tar to the nose of this single-vineyard expression, alongside black currant and charred meat aromas. The palate is redolent in burned blueberries and more roasted beef, proving quite toasty and charred in a very compelling way.

title: Anaba 2015 WestLands Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This comes from a range of vineyard sites, including O'Connor and Mariani, all within the West Sonoma Coast. It's light and earthy in forest floor, cardamom and exotic stemmy licorice, with hints of raspberry and strawberry. Grippy tannin gives way to a silkiness on the finish that's lovely.

title: Arista 2015 U.V. Lucky Well Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a perfumed, floral wine that confounds in complementary richness and power. Dark cherry, berry and pomegranate combine to tame a force of intensity and strong tannin, with forest floor and black tea savory elements within.

title: Bella Luna 2015 Glenrose Vineyard Nebbiolo (Adelaida District)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers rounded strawberry, hibiscus and plum notes set against red spices of sumac and cinnamon. There's a rusty earth component to the sip, where dried strawberry and rose petals play with dill. It is lightly bodied but firmly textured.

title: Blair 2015 Delfina's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Ripe orange pith and lemon zest show on the very fresh, chalky nose of this bottling. Lemon rinds dominate the palate, but warm toast also comes through in the midpalate, giving broad depth to the sip.

title: Brecon Estate 2017 Albariño (Central Coast)
description: Albariño shows great promise on the Central Coast, and this appellation blend is a strong argument. Aromas of red apple, yellow pear and a hint of chalk lead into a palate that's clean and crisp, showing flavors of Gala apple, Rainier cherry and Asian pear.

title: Chronic Cellars 2017 Pink Pedals Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Light raspberry, cherry, chalk and faint cola spice make for a compelling nose in this rosé of 87% Grenache and 13% Syrah. It's tightly wound on the palate, where a chalky minerality carries watermelon and berry flavors.

title: Domenica Amato 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: The vineyard shines in this white, a focused, fresh and fleshy expression of stone, mineral, lemon zest and peel. Light bodied and fresh in the glass, it has a bite of power and tannin on the finish.

title: Earthfluence 2017 Vermentino (Santa Barbara County)
description: Wet cement, lime, apple and green-pear aromas emerge slowly from the very light nose of this fresh bottling by Michael Larner. The palate is focused on an extremely grippy texture and zesty acidity, showing delicate flavors of underripe pear, apple and wet stone.

title: Estancia 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: This widely available wine offers warm aromas of white peach, hazelnut and almond that are cut by a pink-lemonade scent. Lemon-lime acidity fires up the palate immediately, but then settles into stone fruit and oak flavors.

title: Kobler 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Candied cherry meets quenching acidity in this impressive wine, which is full bodied and fleshy in tangerine and Meyer lemon. It finishes crisp and dry.

title: MCV 2016 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Almost opaque in the glass, this blend offers deep and focused aromas of black cherry, açaí, purple flowers and a hint of tar, proving dense but not gooey. The palate is also dense with flavors of blueberry, peppercorns, charred meat and a touch of asphalt.

title: Robert Biale 2015 EBA Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: An extended barrel-aged red, given 30 months to settle in French oak, this wine remains thick and chewy on the palate, a fistful of red raspberry and blackberry finding supportive acidity to boost the fruit. Bark, oak and graham cracker characteristics add richness and complexity. Enjoy best 2025 through 2030.

title: Robert Biale 2015 Like Father, Like Son Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth and velvety with a taste of black pepper, leather, fig and gravel, this wine integrates its tannin and oak well, allowing room for complexity and freshness to flourish. It has aspects of violet and lavender and a richness on the finish that speaks to blackberry jam.

title: Siduri 2016 Clos Pepe Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Red-cherry compote, star anise, red licorice and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling from one of Adam Lee's longtime sources in the region. The palate offers rusty and earth flavors of baked cherry, but is quite snappy and crisp, enhanced by oregano, pepper and dried flowers.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2014 Elivette Red (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a lovely, structured blend half Cabernet Sauvignon with 17% Petit Verdot, 15% Malbec, 14% Cabernet Franc and 4% Merlot, from the mountainous estate. Opening in a sweet nose of sage and vanilla, it's savory in red currant and cassis, with grippy tannins. Enjoy best from 2024–2030.

title: Talisman 2014 Gunsalus Vineyard Dijon Clone 114 Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, light and grippy on the midpalate in toasted oak and firm tannin, this is moderately structured and fully ripe, brimming in black cherry, cola and clove.
designation: Gunsalus Vineyard Dijon Clone 114 Méthode Ancienne

title: Atrea 2016 Old Soul Red (Mendocino County)
description: Bold in flavor and stiff in structure, this full-bodied wine is laced with strong tannins and will need rich, fatty food to pair with. Still, it reveals nicely concentrated blueberry and blackberry flavors, subdued oak accents and a well-concentrated and layered composition.

title: Baker Lane 2015 Sonoma Coast Cuvée Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a great value for 100% varietal, cool-climate Syrah, a super earthy funky experience of confounding dried herb, lavender and grilled meat. Thick shocks of white pepper hedonistically dot the landscape.

title: Bernardus 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lighter aromas of pomegranate-based fruit punch and raspberry jam met with wild herbs on the nose of this bottling by the Carmel Valley-based producer. The punchy, fruit-forward flavors are easy to enjoy on the sip, although remain a tad simple and juicy.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Rachael Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Named for estate owner Charlie's mother, this is an intense and powerful white, fiercely strong in acidity and lingering layers of Gravenstein apple and a squeeze of lemon. The lasting finish of integrated oak takes on a characteristic of hazelnut that's hugely pleasing.

title: Entrepreneur 2015 Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a thick red wine, spicy in acidity and lengthy in waves of dark cherry, blackberry and cola. Full bodied and lush on the palate, it shows the strength of the appellation, site and vintage with ease.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Hallberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tart in rhubarb and strawberry and bushels of dried herb, this is a light-bodied delicate wine, restrained and balanced in ripeness and tone. The oak is well integrated and supportive.

title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark red and purple fruits meet with caramelized and brown-sugar touches on the rich and lovely nose of this bottling. The palate is more tart than expected, with black-plum-skin flavors, and a dusting of white pepper, all framed in a firm dry structure.

title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Rosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of strawberry and peach flesh are cut my lime pith on the nose of this sparkling wine. Full raspberry and cherry-juice flavors on the palate are cut by a strong streak of sour and tart citrus spray, offering a balanced bubbly sip.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 West Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: Creamy and lush in texture, this boldly ripe white flirts with tropical flavors of pineapple, guava and mango. Its full-bodied complexity is additionally marked by exotic elements of anise and fig.

title: LangeTwins 2015 Red Tail Vineyard Nero d'Avola (Lodi)
description: A distinctive and powerful fruitiness that's as rich as blackberry jam without being actually sweet gives this medium-bodied wine a big personality. Hints of spearmint and blueberry join the fun, and there is very little tannin or oakiness to get in the way.

title: Langman Estate 2015 Raymond's Rows Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine is saturated with dark fruit and dark chocolate flavors while complex aromas of toasted oak, damp earth and new leather add to the enjoyment. It feels solid and firmly tannic, but velvety in texture. Best now–2025.

title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety and full bodied, this is a robust, ripe wine, high-toned in notes of rhubarb, black tea and turned earth. It presents as lush and persistent on the palate, with a fruit-forward flavor and an impressive underlying complexity.

title: Michael David 2016 Petite Petit Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: This admittedly huge wine offers tamed tannins, with a generous dose of spicy oak and a hint of sweetness that seem to absorb some of the astringency. It comes off as very concentrated and flavorful, showing an almost velvety texture.

title: Navarro 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This barrel-fermented wine from an Anderson Valley institution has very nice balance, lots of juicy, fresh and ripe apple and peach flavors and a lightly tangy texture due to good acidity. It's medium bodied, easy to sip and will please a lot of different palates.

title: Paraduxx 2014 X2 Estate Red (Napa Valley)
description: Generous tannins present as chalky and grippy in this wine, which offers an herbal wrapping of cedar, graphite and red currant. Boldly flavored and built, it's substantial on the palate.

title: Weibel Family 2015 Archgate Cellars Reserve Bottling Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Spicy, savory elements supplement the generous fruit flavors in this full-bodied wine, giving it more than the usual personality. There are white-pepper, dried basil and blackberry flavors and a smooth, moderately tannic texture.

title: Zocker 2016 Paragon Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Edna Valley)
description: Broad aromas of Anjou pear, wet cement, red apple and scratched guava skin show on the nose of this bottling. Rounded flavors of ripe pear and mandarin orange are framed by strong acidity and a chalky texture that goes deep into the finish.

title: Brick & Mortar 2017 Red (California)
description: Winemaker Matt Iaconis sources Cabernet Franc, Syrah and Pinot Noir for this partial whole-cluster canned red, the fruit coming from Napa Valley, Sonoma Coast and Clarksburg. He then stainless steel and barrel ages the wine, creating a refreshing quaff that will travel well and hold its own against bottled reds that aim equally for easy approachability.

title: Brutocao 2014 Estate Bottled Contento Vineyard Primitivo (Mendocino)
description: This medium-bodied wine is more lean than is typical and has great balance. Good acidity and moderate tannins come to the fore while the fruit flavors are rather crisp ones like raspberry and red cherry. It has light oak spices in the aroma that continue through the flavors and finish.

title: Midnight 2015 Nebula Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry sorbet and mint aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers more of a dried fruit experience, with black currants and plums, but there is also dark-chocolate spice and a pine-like minty element adding complexity.

title: Sketchbook 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: Generous fruit flavors make this well-balanced wine a crowd-pleaser. It carries aromas of fresh black cherry, nutmeg and cinnamon that transition to the full, ripe palate that is balanced by moderate tannins.

title: Zaca Mesa 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Exotic aromas of yuzu, quince sorbet, peach and mandarin orange show on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the region's Rhône pioneer. That quince flavors holds strong into the palate, where it's cut by lime juice.

title: Clone 7 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh aromas of framboise, boysenberry, crushed slate and purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling. There's an easygoing freshness to the palate as well, with a juicy black-raspberry flavor that is nuanced by chopped herbs.

title: Clouds Rest 2013 Egoiste Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Fountaingrove District)
description: Eucalyptus, mint and bay tease the nose of this soft, supple and nicely structured wine, high in supportive acidity and a strong taste of currant and red cherry. The ripeness is balanced and oak well integrated.

title: Eighteen Miles 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine builds complexity in the glass, showing a full-bodied, concentrated expression of green apple and Meyer lemon up front, before teases of salty oak and stone come into play.

title: Fess Parker 2015 The Big Easy Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this thick and heady bottling is quite reductive, with tar, roasted lamb and a bit of black-currant syrup. The palate is the same, with more roasted meat, tar and asphalt flavors, but it is also balanced by acidity and held up by firm tannins.

title: Graveyard NV Paso Tombstone White (Paso Robles)
description: This kitchen-sink white blend works quite well, with tightly woven aromas of cherimoya and crushed gravel. The palate is zesty with lime-rind and pear-skin flavors, proving refreshing and flavorful at once.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Los Osos Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Plush aromas of dark strawberry, blueberry and lilacs make for a very full nose on this extremely well-priced bottling, which is available across the country. The blueberry flavor extends to the palate, yet the smoked meat, char and pepper-spice flavors give savory depth to the wine.

title: Lumen 2016 Garey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Bright aromas of candied pomegranate meet with rust and river stones on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is full of dried cranberry, rose petals and more rust, proving rather light but refreshing.

title: MacLaren 2015 Moaveni Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a leathery earthy wine from a cool climate, lingering in black pepper, turned earth and cured-meat flavors. It finishes lightly wrapped in acidity, never letting go of its savory complexity.

title: Andis 2017 Estate Rosé (Amador County)
description: This is a light and refreshing wine that shows a pale pink color, cherry-like aromas and zesty light tart-cherry flavors. An appetizing texture of acidity and very light tannins give it a palate-cleansing grip.

title: Buttonwood Farm 2017 Zingy Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: A pleasing combination of riper passion fruit and reductive grassy notes show on the nose of this bottling, which also offers green grapefruit rinds and kiwi aromas. The palate is zingy with acidity as advertised, carrying lemongrass and wild lime flavors.

title: Mill Creek 2017 Gewürztraminer (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Listed by the producer as dry (no residual sugar) and from its estate, this white is fragrant in jasmine and rose petal, the full-bodied style unctuous and ripe. Lemon peel and peach play prominent roles.

title: Privileged 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy and fruit-forward, this is a tiny-production wine, its fruit defined in dark cherry and cassis. Soft supple tannin meet integrated oak for a medium-bodied expression of the variety.

title: Sassoferrato 2015 Giannecchini Ranch Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: A deep color and very concentrated fruit flavors make this a bolder than usual Sangiovese. The black-cherry and cranberry flavors are quite ripe, the body is full and the mouthfeel is broad and smooth.

title: Joseph Cellars 2015 Ramazzotti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dusty tannins are at the center of this boldly ripe, brawny wine, which offers soft plush texture and a depth of rich plum. Dark chocolate waves are complemented by a savory twist of cigar box and pepper.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Leras Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an extracted, lightly woven together wine that's ethereal in style. Candied orange peel and strawberry-rhubarb mingle softly on the palate, as seasonings of Asian five spice and cola wander by.

title: Peltier 2016 Prééminence White (Lodi)
description: Dry, tangy and appetizing, this wine has lightly floral, appley aromas and flavors, great acidity to cleanse the palate and a sense of brightness and clarity that's refreshing to taste.

title: Ravenswood 2014 Big River Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: From vines planted around 1893 on a high bench on the south-eastern edge of the appellation, this 100% varietal wine shows plenty of power and concentration, teasing bold cherry, cinnamon and pepper out of its substantial core.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Clean and slightly restrained on the fresh and vibrant nose, this single vineyard expression shows lime syrup, citrus zest, wet stone and chalk aromas. There is great lime skin tension to the sip, where bright, lemony flavors meet with hints of guava and crushed slate.

title: Scheid 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Thyme-laced pomegranate juice aromas, enhanced with baked earth, white pepper and tarragon, makes for an intriguing entry to this bottling. The texture is light and delicate, combining dried garden herbs and buoyant red-fruit flavors, and finishing on clove. This is an easy afternoon sipper.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Well-balanced, this coastal wine is deftly integrated in acidity and floral aromas of apple blossom. Its exotic flavor profile leans into quince, fig and classic Gravenstein apple.

title: Viluko 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is a smoky, spicy and robust red, full of oaky brawn and ripe bluster. Cedar, graphite and wild sage play into bold notes of black cherry, blackberry and cassis, as wisps of tobacco and chocolate wander by.

title: Bailarin 2016 Black Knight Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an exotic, elegant and restrained coastal wine, that is tart with lemon and lemongrass. Light and bright, its texture is fluffy and creamy, with a lingering hint of biscotti.

title: Birichino 2014 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)
description: There's a rather extreme minerality in play on this old-vine bottling, with wet gravel, scree and crushed slate leading the nose alongside crushed carnations, rose petals and touch of dark-plum fruit. Muddy chalky clay tones carry that vibe into the sip, only allowing a slight berry flavor to rise above.

title: Bodkin 2014 Peaceland Vineyards Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Red-fruit-driven, this is a light, elegant version of the variety, unexpected in tight tannin and with a grainy dry carpet of texture. Cranberry and currant dominate and maintain a fresh tangy quality to the taste.

title: Dowdell 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a blend of two well-regarded vineyards, Lucky Well and Silver Eagle, both farmed by Ulises Valdez. It casts a considerable shadow of brawn and beauty, balancing strawberry-puree flavors with an earthy undertone of forest pine. Big-boned, it alternates between richness and freshness.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Fiorella Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Textured in baked apple and pear flavors, this wine is ultimately creamy and lush, with a rounded approach to oak. A tautness in structure helps keep it fresh, with a lovely floral undertone on the bouquet.

title: Glenwood Cellars 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark in color and consisting of considerable oak, this wine is sublime in texture, with aromas of matchstick and floral apple blossom. Savory in apple pie and cinnamon, it has elegance and impressive length.

title: Kaena 2015 La Presa Vineyard Grenache (Los Olivos District)
description: Swarthy aromas of cooked black cherry, root beer, vanilla, cinnamon, clove and shaved eucalyptus show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are very minty with sweet bay leaf, juniper and more eucalyptus, proving quite a mouthful.

title: LXV 2014 Secret Craving Red (Paso Robles)
description: This is a rich unctuous blend of 38% Syrah, 31% Cabernet Franc and 31% Merlot, with aromas of baked plums in a buttery crust and hints of scarlet roses. The flavors are presented elegantly with a soft mouthfeel that shows violets, blueberry, oregano and pepper, with a long-lasting acidic backbone.

title: Old Soul 2015 Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: Quite rich in texture and generous in flavor, this medium-bodied wine has notes of black cherry, toasted baguette and pomegranate. These flavors mingle with the broad mouthfeel, offering depth and layering that leads to a lingering finish.

title: Pali 2015 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's bountiful red cherry on the fruit-driven nose of this bottling, alongside loamy soil, dried sage and mint. The flavors are fresh and bright, with red fruit and lifting herb tones that are completely integrated so that no component stands out above the others. The tannic structure arises on the finish.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Pommard Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny red fruit savory in pomegranate and cranberry highlight an earthy core of light-bodied ripeness and quiet richness in this clone-specific wine. The texture is crisp and velvety on the palate. The vineyards involved include Bucher, Peters and Leras.

title: Paratus 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This wine offers a significance of herbal undertones and wild exotic brush, a nod to its mountain growing location and this particular appellation. Pencil shavings, flowers and leathery texture bookend strong firm tannins and smoky oak, the core braced in black currant and cassis.

title: Lynmar 2016 Susanna's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tight and tannic, this is a bold coastal-influenced red. It's thick and richly layered in dense flavors of pomegranate, dark cherry and blood orange. The oak and spice elements are well integrated and add complexity.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a rich, layered wine offering sizable notions of oak within a powerful backdrop of Meyer lemon, melon and apple. It has dense concentration and richness that finds balance in underlying acidity and a mineral tease of crushed rock.

title: Summers 2016 Villa Andriana Vineyard 20th Anniversary Charbono (Calistoga)
description: This obscure variety thrives in small amounts in the appellation and is done justice by this bottling. A fruity palate of cherry, vanilla and strawberry is complemented by lavender and white pepper. Soft in texture, it's lovely and lingering on the palate.

title: Alara 2016 Tempranillo (San Benito County)
description: Ripe aromas of black plum, cocoa, cinnamon and turned loam show on the nose of this bottling from a newer winery in the Gilroy area. Thyme, marjoram and oregano play against red plum on the herbal palate.

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a succulent, textured white that's vibrant in tones of Meyer lemon and blood orange. The acidity is lively and refreshing, accentuating the fruit without distraction.

title: Cebada 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Dark hibiscus and rose petals meet with cooked cranberry and earthy aromas on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate shows sage, dark berry, wild mint and turned earth touches, framed by tense tannic depth.

title: Demetria 2017 Estate Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Soft strawberry aromas meet with wet cement and pink-grapefruit rind on the nose of this vivacious rosé. Chalky texture and flavors consume the fresh palate, loaded with sour lime, pink lemon and nectarine flavors.

title: En Garde 2014 Le Bijou du Roi Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Brawny in enveloping tannins, this is a mountain of a wine, showy in its mountainous provenance and grip. With a touch of leather, it offers coffee, mocha and a juicy, lasting layering of blackberry dusted in dark chocolate.

title: Giornata 2015 Gemellaia Red (Paso Robles)
description: This Super Tuscan-style blend, which includes 75% Merlot from two vineyards and 25% Sangiovese from a third, offers aromas of plum skin, baking spice and crushed asphalt on the nose. There is a strong earthy and rocky flavor to the palate, which is very dry and lifted by solid acidity.

title: Kunde 2015 Reserve Century Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Big, brawny waves of blackberry and mocha dot the landscape of this full-bodied wine that's tense in structure and thick in rich tannins. An earthy note of forest floor complements the bold fruit and gives depth to the wine.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Rosé (El Dorado)
description: This wine has almost enough color and flavor to be called a red. It shows a deep pink or light ruby color, aromas like rose petals and flavors like black cherry and pomegranate seeds. It's unusual, vivid and fun for adventurous drinkers.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe and fruity aromas of cherry pie with vanilla-laced crust make for a delicious and hedonistic if not entirely complex nose on this appellation blend. It's also rich and fruity on the palate, with black-cherry and warm croissant flavors.

title: Michael David 2016 6th Sense Syrah (Lodi)
description: This lavish wine matches loud oak spice on the nose with equally bold jammy fruit on the full palate, without the tannins becoming too oppressive. It has aromas of vanilla, nutmeg and toasted bread plus tasty blackberry, blueberry and dark-chocolate flavors.

title: Neely 2015 Hidden Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of black cherry, cola, ginger and damp wood show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in Portola Valley. Baked cherries, nutmeg and clove flavors show strongly on the fuller-bodied palate, with a dried hibiscus finish.

title: Quady 2016 Essensia Orange Muscat (California)
description: This powerful dessert wine offers heady aromas of orange peel, almonds and honey followed by sweet, vibrant and concentrated fruit and nut flavors. It's full bodied, fully sweet but not sugary, and well balanced by acidity.

title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Excellence Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Mendocino County)
description: This enticing and supple wine starts with aromas of bread dough and toasted almonds. The palate brings flavors of both fresh and baked apple on a plush, softly sparkling texture.

title: Sheldon 2017 Las Brisas Vineyard Vermentino (Carneros)
description: Made in tiny amounts, this vineyard-designate is stainless-steel fermented and aged and shows a spritzy, nervy personality of freshness and focus. Floral gardenia and jasmine give way to bright, developed flavors of Meyer lemon and blood orange.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Miller Vineyard Malbec (Fair Play)
description: Ripe and saturated fruit flavors and moderate tannins come together nicely in this full-bodied, lightly spicy wine. It has a good sense of concentration, lots of ripe blackberry and blueberry flavors and a lingering finish.

title: Wolff 2015 Dijon Clones Selection Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Tangy aromas of sour cherry compote, exotic mulberry and spice cake show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located less than five miles from the coast. Roasted cranberry and red-cherry flavors meet with strong spicy elements on the palate, which is quote concentrated.

title: Wolff 2015 Riesling (Central Coast)
description: Very classic in style, this bottling shows aromas of petrol, rainy cement and guava peels on the nose. There is grippy tension to the palate, with lime-pith flavors meet with chalky minerality.

title: Hall 2014 Jack's Masterpiece Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a sturdy, grippy and youthful 100% varietal wine, from vineyards planted in mountainous locations. Bright focused acidity lifts dense flavors of black cherry and sage that are wrapped in spicy, clove-driven oak. Enjoy best from 2024–2034.

title: Hall 2014 The North End Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an inaugural release, blended with 7% Merlot and aged 22 months in French oak, 65% new. From vines grown predominantly in the northern end of the valley (Calistoga and St. Helena), it features a grainy texture of bold dark cherry that's granular and focused on the palate. Tobacco and leather add to the savory nature of the billowy tannin power. Enjoy best 2020–2030.

title: Ashes & Diamonds 2014 No. 1 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This new producer offers the first vintage of this wine. Made by Steve Matthiasson in a classically restrained style, it was given plenty of room to develop varietal character, with 25% Merlot adding softness. It shines in a texture of dense black raspberry dotted in black pepper and pencil—its herbaceous character in balance. An underlying freshness keeps it compelling and bright.

title: Blue Rock 2016 Baby Blue Blanc White (Sonoma Coast)
description: This delicious white combines 87% Sauvignon Blanc, 8.5% Viognier and 4.5% Sémillon. Together, they are as compelling as a garden in jasmine and gardenia aromas. Smooth and sublime on the palate, it offers a succulence of peach and pear within a refreshing core of medium-bodied fleshiness.

title: Carlisle 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dense black currant, lanolin, leather and vanilla aromas are lifted by sagebrush and dried mint on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the famous vineyard. The palate is jam-packed with herbs, from oregano and thyme to juniper, with blackberry rising in the midpalate and spearmint and more vanilla carrying through the finish.

title: S.R. Tonella 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: From a producer making small amounts of wine from Rutherford fruit—much of it estate and farmed by hand—this powerhouse is impressively crafted and memorable, offering smoky oak, graphite and clove. The palate is concentrated in black berry and plum tones, and broadly expansive on the palate, finishing with a welcome succulence.

title: Turnbull 2015 Black Label Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This bold, beautifully made wine is sizable in tannin while imparting an old-world entry of herbaceousness and classic notions of pencil shavings and cedar. Gritty on the palate, it flirts with black cherry, currant and cassis before offering a rounded lengthy finish of clove and tobacco.

title: Williams Selyem 2011 Vista Verde Vineyard Port (San Benito County)
description: Rich and roasty on the nose, this excellent Port-style wine shows aromas of cherry cordial, charred fennel, black sage and roast beef. The dense sip offers black cherry, espresso, blueberry jelly and thick chocolate flavors, enhanced by a hint of menthol and Scotch-like elements.

title: Ken Brown 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pioneering winemaker Ken Brown is still making excellent wine 40 years on, including this bottling that's full of deep red cherry, scarlet red rose petals and dark hibiscus on a nose that's veiled by loamy soil and slate. The palate is tightly wound, with crushed herbs, sandy soils, cranberry and fresh purple-flower flavors that sail across the palate into a vanilla-kissed finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Holder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a bright, acid-driven wine, citrus-laden alongside crisp, tart red fruit and a light-bodied approach to ripeness. The nose is exotic in rose petal and lavender, with streaks of cardamom and cola spice that persist for a long time on the finish.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Meredith Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, velvety, lush and broad, this is a full-figured, darkly brooding wine, steeped in concentrated flavors of strawberry and blackberry. Baked bread, milk chocolate and rose petals accent it well, with supportive, measured oak adding a touch of toast.

title: Mike and Molly Hendry 2015 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)
description: From a historic site planted in 1905, this impressive wine is defined by well-crafted layers of black pepper, tomato leaf and blackberry. Its sizable length and breadth is laced in cinnamon spice and ample acidity that reins it in from becoming overdone.

title: Miraflores 2013 Tempranillo (El Dorado)
description: A super dark color and oodles of dark fruit in both the aroma and the flavor make this a rich and seductive wine. It packs in notes of black cherry, blackberry jam and dark chocolate without obvious oakiness even though winemaker Marco Cappelli aged it 20 months in 50% new oak. The wine has good firm structure from lots of soft tannins, full body and moderate acidity making it very impressive, concentrated and layered.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salted caramel oak is met by pineapple upside down cake in this rich, rewarding and crazily complex white from a well-farmed site. Focused acidity keeps the more voluptuous aspects at bay, settling them into refreshing layers of texture and vibrancy.

title: Pedroncelli 2015 Mother Clone Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is aged in American oak and blended with 12% Petite Sirah. Concentrated blackberry fruit rides a foundation of soft, silky and well-integrated succulence, with touches of leather saddle, black pepper, smoke and brick. While full bodied, it manages to drink light on its feet.

title: Rasi 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Big and ripe black fruit is bolstered by sweet thyme, bay leaf and mint on the nose of this powerful bottling by Rachel Silkowski. The wine lands with power and aplomb on the palate, blending star anise, nutmeg and licorice flavors with tangy black plum fruit and a strong acidity to carry it all.

title: Renwood 2014 Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: A generous influence from new oak barrels works beautifully on this full-bodied spice-saturated and richly concentrated wine. It has everything from subtle cinnamon and cardamom to ripe and lush black cherry notes to a lingering finish that echoes spices and dark fruit. Fine-grained tannins shape the mouthfeel and add welcome grip.

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Seven Leagues Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Sea salt, mandarin zest, fresh white spring flowers and lemon balm make for a very appealing and fragrant nose on this vineyard blend by Mikey Giugni and Michael Brughelli. The palate is zesty, fresh and savory, with flavors of salted apple slices, preserved lemons, toast and a hint of roasted wood.

title: Shafer 2014 Relentless Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This perennial powerhouse of a wine is a blend of 89% Syrah and 11% Petite Sirah, aged 30 months in 100% new French oak. It offers a hard-hitting intensity of stewed plum, cherry and buttery vanilla, with thick, structured tannins that are firm and integrated. Meat, black licorice and black pepper combine effortlessly and should shine bright after aging. Enjoy from 2029 and beyond.

title: Stolo 2015 Hillside Reserve Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Though a bit lighter than in years past due to the tough vintage, this wine is still gamy and feral as usual, with aromas of creosote, roasted lamb and rosemary layered atop a soft red-currant base. It's light in texture, with bright raspberry compote flavors as well as pine oil and juniper.

title: Velvet Bee 2013 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blend of grapes from Rita's Crown and Radian vineyards delivers a unique nose of wet wood, lemon verbena, macadamia nut and nectarine cream. The mouthfeel is zippy and the backbone is quite chalky, carrying flavors of poached Asian pear, sea salt and lemon zest, with touches of pecan and browned butter.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Strong spice aromas and ripe, bold fruit flavors make this a powerful, extroverted wine with a lot of flavor impact. It seems to represent a style shift at Williams Selyem. Nutmeg, ginger and clove leap from the glass and laser-focused black-cherry flavors fill the palate, supported by firm tannins and acidity. Best after 2021.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)
