description: Black currant, elderberry, charred beef, dried violets and cedar show on the nose of this dark, complex bottling. The energized sip delivers tart black plum before offering more elegant and woody flavors of sandalwood and myrrh, with leathery tannins and savory meat flavors throughout.

title: Ampelos 2014 Gamma Ampelos Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Burly red fruit meets charred oak and a soft supple texture in this medium-bodied wine that's made entirely from estate-grown grapes. A pretty undertone of violet provides floral flourish as white pepper teases on the lengthy, earthy finish.

title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Substantial fruit flavors and good structure highlight this medium- to full-bodied, concentrated wine. It has a straightforward, no-nonsense approach and offers great value. Enticing black cherry and raspberry flavors are supported by fine-grained tannins and crisp acidity. The fruit notes are pure, clean and linger nicely on the finish.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This is a traditional dry, full-bodied and well-balanced Zin that's made to go with a hearty meal. Ripe but not sweet boysenberry flavors are shaded with mineral, wood smoke and light baking spice accents, while firm tannins lend grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Clos LaChance 2015 Estate Vineyard Proprietary Red (Central Coast)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows deep blackberry and black currant aromas alongside baked goods and a touch of violets. There is impressive density to the palate, where black plum flavors blend with lavender and baking spice on the finish. The tannins are still quite firm.

title: Flanagan 2015 Platt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Low yields from a cool vintage make for a delicate nuanced experience in the glass in this perfumed velvety wine. Plum and cherry flavors are crisp and tart, with the acidity persistent. White pepper and ocean spray contribute context and complexity.

title: Heitz 2013 Ink Grade Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a puckering sensibility of tannin on entry but settles in the glass to show a fresh core of strawberry, black cherry, cedar and soy. The oak is buttery and spicy, good at playing a supporting role to the density of mountain-grown high-toned fruit.

title: Adelaida 2015 HMR Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)
description: Paso Robles isn't known for Pinot Noir, although this historic vineyard has been growing it successfully, and with plenty of aging ability, since 1964. Aromas of light berries, tarragon and sandalwood lead into a palate full of mint, fennel pollen, mulberry and dried plum, altogether exhibiting a li hing mui sort of character.

title: Carmel Road 2014 South Crest Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Soft red rose petals, cranberry, wet slate and dust show on the nose of this bottling, one of the first new-block designates released by this producer. The palate's plush texture carries strong soil flavors of crushed gravel and turned earth, which give depth to the background of ripe raspberry and pomegranate fruit.

title: Michael David 2014 Inkblot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)
description: This lush, plush and almost syrupy wine has oodles of blackberry and chocolate aromas, a full body and ripe fruit flavors. A subtle layer of oak spice intermingles with all that fruit while soft tannins make it feel broad but not astringent on the palate.

title: Miller Wine Works 2014 Naked Vine Vineyard Grenache (El Dorado)
description: This is an extremely smooth, mellow, complex and interesting wine. From the first whiff of cedar and cinnamon in the aroma, to intricate flavors of raspberry, black tea and clove, it brings a lot of nuances to the palate and wraps them in a soft blanket of mild acidity and light tannins.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a full-bodied, well-balanced and mouth-filling wine that offers ripe berry and cherry flavors enhanced by subtle baking spices. It has a good framework of fine-grained tannins and supportive acidity to keep it lively on the palate.

title: Parducci 2014 Small Lot Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)
description: Parducci has been making great-value Petite Sirah for decades and here's another super example. This is an unusually complex wine for the varietal, offering hints of violet, anise and black pepper, along with rich blackberry aromas and flavors. The mouthfeel is big and tannic, but not overly so, and the rich flavors melt over the palate and linger a long time on the finish.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: Cofermented with just under 5% Viognier, this varietal wine was aged in neutral French oak, the better to let its earthy core speak loudest. Mushroom, pine forest and black pepper highlight a broad brawny plate that's densely packed and moderately structured.

title: Westwood 2015 Legend Estate Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a proprietary estate-grown blend of Syrah, Grenache, Mourvèdre and Zinfandel, aged in French oak (45% new). Savory flavors of earth, black licorice, tobacco, meat and leather are lifted on the palate by fresh blueberry and blackberry tones, dusted in chocolate shavings.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Wanderlust Red (Templeton Gap District)
description: Tangy plum skins and mulberry sauce meet with salt and pepper and roasted duck aromas on the nose of this blend of 50% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre. The palate is full of brambly fruit, lifted by smoke and sagebrush.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lovely aromas of exotic red cherries, sultry mace, spicy cinnamon and white sage show on the nose of this fresh and crisp bottling. There is ample peppery spice to the palate and a strong tannic tension, with flavors of Earl Grey tea, cranberry and pomegranate. Cherry compote shows on the finish.

title: Davies 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This lovely wine has a baked aspect to the fruit that makes it warm and welcoming. It's otherwise edgy in high-toned characteristics of rhubarb, cranberry, orange and forest floor, with bolts of cardamom throughout. Complex, the oak is prominent yet integrated.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Donnelly Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A floral and flinty aroma leads to rich black-cherry and mushroom flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine from one of California's earliest Pinot Noir specialists. It emphasizes complexity more than pure fruit and gets extra credit for a savory, mineral thread and supportive tannins.

title: Vasco Urbano 2015 Henry Hayes Ranch Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: Tightly packed blackberry, wood-smoke and black-pepper aromas are remarkably vivid in this full-bodied, rich and creamy-textured wine. It's big in structure, attractively oaky, and filled with ripe, exotic but classic meaty spicy gamy flavors.

title: Von Holt 2015 Heintz Family Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a depth of flavor and length that's rewarding within a richly balanced, focused and tightly textured ring of acidity. There's an imprint of lemon oil that's slightly viscous and completely compelling on the palate.

title: Hartford Court 2013 Outer Limits Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a coastal site overlooking the Pacific Ocean near Annapolis, this is cool-climate yet brawny in its grasp of cherry cola, black pepper and black licorice, that is wild and densely packed with power. Wild blackberry and blueberry come along for the ride, adding to the succulence of the midpalate, a nice contrast to the underlying gaminess and tobacco.

title: Holus Bolus 2016 Franc De Pied Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cola, blueberry and red fruits meet with sweet tobacco and peppercorn-crusted beef on the nose of this foot-stomped bottling. Though young, it's very accessible now, with smashed berries, tar and savory flavors of black, white and green peppercorn riding a strong acidity.

title: Kukkula 2014 Sisu Red (Adelaida District)
description: Deep aromas of caramelized black plum, elegant lilacs, brown sugar and roasted beef show on the nose of this blend of 50% Syrah, 30% Mourvèdre and 20% Grenache. The palate blends rich boysenberry with beef char, smoke and savory herbs, wrapped in a brilliant acidity that drives long into the finish.

title: Kukkula 2015 Aatto Red (Adelaida District)
description: Here's a wine that puts Counoise in the driver's seat to great effect. Bolstered by 36% Mourvèdre and 19% Grenache, the wine starts with candied cherry, tangy cranberry, red flowers, white pepper and potpourri on the nose. Exotic spices, familiar herbs and bright red fruit shine on the lively palate.

title: Croix 2015 Old Manzana Slope Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This newcomer to the appellation is boldly styled and hearty in blue fruit and baked cherry, the experience on the palate warming and complete. Concentrated and powerfully built, it shows a wealth of cola spice and vanilla on the lengthy finish.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 McDougall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: From a site neighboring Hirsch and Martinelli, this beautifully structured wine is abundantly earthy, savory and spicy in forest floor and cardamom. The blustery spice is contrasted nicely against a wall of crisp, fresh acidity and a finish of black tea.

title: Hartford Court 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is an impressive barrel selection of several vineyards across the appellation. It opens with a nose of charcuterie and brined olive, with a palate that is textured and rich in flavors of tarte Tatin and baked mango.

title: Keller 2014 Rotie Syrah-Viognier (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made in homage to Côtes du Rhône, combining 94% Syrah and 6% Viognier, this opens in lavender, violet and garrigue, inviting and smooth. The velvety texture continues, with a spicy savory edginess of white pepper, blackberry and cured meat.

title: Novy 2015 Sierra Mar Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very savory and dense on the nose, this bottling by Adam Lee shows smoky roast beef and smoked-pork-shank aromas as well as concentrated black currant and dried purple flowers. The palate is fresh, lively, tense and dense all at once, and needs a bit more time for the black-plum flavors to unfurl and acidity to mellow. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Malbec (Livermore Valley)
description: Powerful and earthy, this rich and concentrated wine is full bodied, broad in texture and has envelope-pushing spice and leather aromas backed by well-concentrated wild-berry and plum-compote flavors of significant depth. It's seductive and lavish in character.

title: Sol Rouge 2014 Mourvèdre (Red Hills)
description: This wine is bold but nuanced, too, showing a blend of very ripe black-fruit, oak-spice, black-pepper and roast-beef flavors on a firm structure of moderate tannins and good acidity. It turns creamy in texture on the palate and lingers on the finish.

title: Stolo 2015 Hillside Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Dark cherry, sweet sage, rust and moist earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just miles from the coast behind Cambria. Dried cherry and pomegranate show on the sip, but that earthy kick carries through, with more sage, juniper and bay leaf. The finish is lively and mouthwatering.

title: Textbook 2014 Page Turner Red (Oakville)
description: This Right Bank-inspired blend allows Merlot to take the lead at 60%, combined nicely with 25% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Cabernet Franc. Sanguine, its richness muted and well-integrated, the flavors lean into black currant, clove, leather and black licorice, with a softness to the texture.

title: Vie Winery NV Mélange Maison IV Old Vines Red (California)
description: Not your average fruit bomb, this medium- to full-bodied wine blends generous earth, game and leather aromas with raspberry, beef and savory flavors on a smooth, broad and moderately tannic texture. It's very engaging and concentrated. Don't let the nonvintage status scare you off.

title: Vinum Cellars 2015 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado County)
description: This is a seriously delicious wine that's packed tightly with fruit, floral and spice flavors and has a firm but velvety texture that makes it a pleasure to sip. It has a deep dark ruby color, expressive aromas, generous black-cherry and dark chocolate flavors and a lingering finish. Best after 2022.

title: Aperture 2015 Oliver Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Juicy black cherry, crushed rock and dried herb combine with ease in this site-specific wine blended with 11% Cabernet Franc. Grainy oak and powerful concentration on the palate make it hard to forget. Enjoy 2020–2025.

title: Beauregard 2016 Bald Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Strong aromas of flint and crushed chalk meet with hints of hazelnut and preserved lemons on the nose of this extremely coastal bottling. There is a tremendous tightness to the palate, where a grippy texture presents racy flavors of lemon, grapefruit rind, nectarine and sea salt on the finish.

title: Chimney Rock 2015 Elevage Estate Grown Red (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a blend of 77% Merlot, 13% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot from the producer's estate in the heart of the appellation. It is driven by a velvety texture, with plush wrap-around tannins running the show. Oak, sage and cedar define the flavors alongside layers of plum and red currant.

title: Combe 2017 Chenin Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: The Stolpman team is pushing the usual boundaries on many fronts, which makes this bottling, a partnership with superstar somm Rajat Parr, both compelling and challenging. The nose combines smoked almonds with preserved lemon aromas, while the acid-loaded palate is tangy yet nutty all at once.

title: Conclusion 2017 Rosé (California)
description: This wine is a fine example of the current trend in rose. It has a beautiful light-pink color and fresh aromas of strawberry and cherry that lead to crisp, appetizing berry flavors. A good balance between acidity and medium body makes the mouthfeel fresh and smooth.

title: Cuda Ridge 2016 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: All warm and rich and ripe, this expansive and very fruity wine expresses the pure fruitiness of the grape variety with minimal noticeable influence of oak. It has good concentration, an almost-thick texture, generous alcohol, light tannins and a lingering finish that echoes the fruitiness.

title: Daniel 2015 Sangiacomo Vella Ranch Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Golden in color this white offers big flavor and high-toned freshness, a broadly expansive and contrasting palate of lemon, and lime and green apple dipped in nutmeg and clove.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and smaller amounts of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this wine is thick, dense and dusty in tannin. Flavors of mocha, cherry and clove dominate on the well-integrated, full-bodied palate, finishing in dried herb and coffee bean.

title: En Garde 2014 Adamus Red (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Brawny in toasted oak and grippy ripeness, this blend is softly layered in plum and black cherry. The secondary characteristics complement the fruit in cinnamon and black pepper.

title: Gehricke 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Blended with 11% Malbec and 2% Petite Sirah, this wine offers leather saddle and earth aromas on the nose. Generous helpings of oak and tannin give it power on the palate within a framework of briary red- and black-berry flavors.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Light aromas of lime and apple lead into a more supple tone of honeydew on the nose of this widely available wine. There is a compelling grip to the palate, where a chalky texture carries flavors of Anjou pear and lime pith.

title: Grgich Hills 2014 Violetta Late Harvest White (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 46% Sauvignon Blanc, 37% Riesling and 17% Gewürztraminer—all left to develop botrytis on the vines—this wine shows a petrol character that's intense on the nose. The palate is viscous and rich in flavors of hazelnut, pineapple and honey. It winds its way to lingering, balanced finish.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Reserve Albariño (San Diego County)
description: Almost certainly the best white wine tasted from San Diego County this year, this bottling starts with rounded pear flesh, tangy lime skin, wet stone and a hint of peach on the nose. It's clean and crisp on the palate with strong tension, offering lime leaf and apple flavors.

title: Keller 2013 Late Harvest Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)
description: This tiny-production dessert wine delights in its richly wound layers of cherry, candied orange and rose. Light orange-pink in color, it invites one in and delivers an intense experience buoyed by impressive underlying acidity.

title: Luna 2015 Sangiovese (Napa Valley)
description: Jammy in rustic dried cherry and blueberry, this is a likably soft, rounded and full-bodied red with a leathery finish dotted in black pepper and clove.

title: MacRostie 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Full of melon and crème brûlée richness, this is a delightfully lush white from grapes grown across the appellation. It shows layered concentration and strong, lingering flavors of pineapple and caramel.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2017 Alegría Vineyards Rosé of Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Meat, sage and lavender highlight the light yet complex body of this dry rosé. Fresh acidity and fruity components of raspberry and blood orange persist from start to finish.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Olivet Lane Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This lush and rounded wine is brimming in tones of golden delicious apple, mango and pear. The palate is viscous in texture and shows robust flavors of crème brûlée and baking spice that finish with a touch of crisp acidity.

title: Michael Mondavi Family Estate 2016 Emblem Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a barrel-fermented white that fully embraces its richness in the form of a baked pear, caramel and crème brûlée. It's full bodied and ample in fruit, with an underlying crispness that brightens the finish.

title: Navarro 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: Very fruity, very ripe and very full bodied, this wine practically oozes a jammy berrylike character from the first whiff to the lingering finish. Dried fruits like fig and raisin dominate the flavors while a rich lush texture coats the tastebuds.

title: Nola Grace 2017 Dry Rosé (California)
description: This wine offers spicy cinnamon and toast aromas that are followed by tasty red cherry and nutmeg flavors. Good acidity and a medium body give it a full, vibrant mouthfeel.

title: Oro Bello 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Ginger, toast and butter aromas are followed by full-flavored butter, apple and nutmeg notes as this generous and spicy wine pushes all the right buttons. It is medium- to full-bodied, with good concentration and a lingering spicy finish.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Intense Figone Syrah (Fair Play)
description: This is a very deep-colored wine that has a laser-focus on ripe black-currant and black-cherry flavors and very firm tannins to shape those flavors. The texture is dry and astringent but the fruit component is so focused that it softens the tannic blow somewhat. Drink now with rich, fatty proteins or cellar until 2022 by which time it may mellowed.

title: Cochon 2015 Pape Rocks Red (California)
description: Richness, depth and layering all contribute to this full-bodied, Grenache-based wine's considerable appeal. It has lots of ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors, nicely firm tannins and a mouth-coating texture. What else does a GSM-C (for 5% Cinsault) need?

title: Covenant 2017 Mensch Roussanne (Lodi)
description: This wine is seductive and delicious yet well balanced, from an aroma of pear tart to substantial but not showy flavors of kiwi, apricot and guava that coat the palate. The texture is generous and mouthfilling but backed by subtle acidity that keeps it lively. Vintner Jeff Morgan is doing great things with Lodi grapes.

title: Eighty Four 2012 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This is reduced and robust in oaky char and strong flavors of barbecue meat, coffee and leather. Full bodied, it's surprisingly graceful, too, with mouth-filling complexity and structured jammy blackberry fruit.

title: Grassini 2015 Articondo Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot is a great way to see what's happening with this family-owned estate. Aromas of roasted coffee, toasted oak, ripe black plum and blackberry lead into a palate full of charred cherry, black raspberry and cedar. A rocky earthy minerality is also apparent throughout.

title: JCB 2015 No 22 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This coastal wine has a feral element of exotic fruit, rhubarb and blood orange mostly, with touches of rose petal around its edges. Silky smooth and unabashedly ripe and full bodied, it has an underlying freshness of lively acidity and integration.

title: Landmark 2016 Overlook Pinot Noir (California)
description: Sourced from 72% Monterey County, 15% Santa Barbara County and 13% Sonoma County, this bottling starts with red cherry, clove, vanilla and star anise on the nose. The palate combines sharp baking spice with baked cherry, all framed by powerful acidity.

title: Lichen Estate 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Attractively tight in structure, this intricate and well-balanced wine pours red-cherry and raspberry flavors on the palate, backed by firm tannins and acidity and medium body. It will be fascinating to see how this develops. Best after 2020.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Gamy aromas of lamb meat and asphalt lead into violet and elderberry touches on the nose of this proprietary red blend. The palate shows elegant touches of dried purple flowers and black-plum skins, finishing on a riper black-currant flavor.

title: MacRostie 2016 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers an explosive entry of tangerine and rock salt within a context of light, integrated oak and moderate ripeness. Still, it has plenty of power and full-bodied textural complexity that makes it memorable in the glass.

title: Melhill 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Los Angeles County)
description: Though quite expensive, this is an interesting argument for growing wine in the heart of West Los Angeles, as these grapes hail from Brentwood. Aromas of nectarine, lemon rind and key lime meet with a rich woody background on the nose. The sip is quite bright and refreshing with flavors of lemon and mandarin orange.

title: Roblar 2016 Triomphe Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark red-currant, dried herbs and cigar-box aromas make for an Old World-like elegance on this blend of 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc, 24% Merlot and 12% Petit Verdot. Oregano, marjoram and peppercorn meet with elderberry and black plum on the palate, which is deep in loamy flavors and finishing on a hint of carnation.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Fruity in dark cherry and cola spice and cinnamon, this is a moderately ripe, textured wine, toasty in oak and fulfilling in its balanced richness.

title: Sidebar 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is from the Alegria Vineyard, originally planted in 1890 and then partially replanted in 1950. It blends within 10% Alicante, 10% Petite Sirah and 2% of a dozen other varieties found in the field. Burly, dusty tobacco is accented in cedar notes and graphite, with powerful concentration and structure at its core.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Envoy Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Floral and with notes of crushed rock and salty sea spray, this wine is richly round and complex, with a balanced approach to ripeness. Exotic lemon peel and lemongrass play well with the toasted oak and candied-apricot finish.

title: Waits-Mast 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: A generous dash of oak spice joins rich black-plum and black-cherry flavors in this extravagant wine. Aromas of baking spices, pencil shavings and cedar are followed by warm fruit flavors and a soothing silky texture and a lingering finish.

title: Byron Blatty 2016 Tremor Red (Los Angeles County)
description: Aromas of candied blackberry, thyme and a bit of gravel make for a compelling nose in this blend of 65% Grenache, 30% Merlot and 5% Syrah. Rounded and dark yet lively in character, flavors of pomegranate, black cherry and black raspberry are framed by zippy acidity and lifted by a pinch of dried herbs.

title: B Side 2016 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: Focused and well concentrated, this medium-bodied wine starts with hints of smoke and earth, then delivers ripe, well-defined flavors of red cherry and black cherry. Bright acidity and moderate tannins offer balance and length on the finish.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Suave and well-mannered, this medium-bodied wine is like suede in feel. Flavors of red and black cherries give an overall impression of breadth and gentleness that's hard to resist. It has attractive oak nuances of baking spices and light-roast coffee to add complexity.

title: Bella Luna 2013 Grosso Siletto Vineyards Sangiovese (San Benito County)
description: Dark cherry and cranberry scents mesh with wood-spice and forest undergrowth aromas on the nose of this bottling from a region that's starting to gain more attention. Chalky tannins provide a very firm structure on the palate, certainly due to the 28 months of French oak aging. Strong acidity slices through the red-fruit and allspice flavors. Drink 2019–2028.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 Sentinel Oak Vineyard Pyramid Block Syrah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: A wild funky streak of grilled herbs and dried meat adds intrigue to this deep-colored, rich-textured wine even before a taste of the ripe blueberry, espresso and clove flavors that are saturated with an appealing earthiness. The texture is broad and viscous on the palate, drenching the tongue with ripe fruit and encouraging a lengthy finish. Best after 2022.

title: Wayfarer 2016 Wayfarer Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Moderately structured, complex and balanced in weight, this is a tremendous white, coastal in briny salt breeze and oak. The fruit profile is savory and crisp, a mix of lime zest and tangerine that brightens and lengthens the well-integrated palate.

title: Bob Cabral Wines 2015 Cuvée Anne Rose Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A tiny production from former Williams Selyem winemaker Bob Cabral, now also making the wines for Three Sticks, this is an entirely barrel-fermented and rich white wine made with focus and intent. Crème brûlée, brioche and a reduced nose highlight the slow evolution in the glass, which is joined by exotic notions of mango and clarified butter.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Greengate Ranch & Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: From a vineyard situated amongst ranchettes near the winery, this wine begins with extremely beautiful scents of black cherry, rosewater and sharp nose-tingling cola spice, proving juicy but elegant. The palate is full of brilliant flavors, from snappy black raspberry to more rounded strawberry sorbet, lifted by allspice, clove, vanilla and plenty of fresh acidity.

title: Skinner 2015 Estate Grown Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: Elegant and silky, this medium-bodied wine is carried by aromas of cinnamon and dried currant. The palate brings tones of mineral, plum and black tea, with a lightly tannic texture and a good dose of acidity. The wine has a distinct personality and showcases the high-elevation El Dorado appellation's suitability for Rhône varieties.

title: Byron 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a prominent but relatively restrained sense of cherry juice on the nose of this bottling alongside gamy meat, sagebrush and composting rose-petal aromas. The palate is framed by strong energy, which delivers red fruit, sharp red spice and tinges of spearmint and tarragon.

title: Challen 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lean and light aromas of pomegranate, tart strawberry and sour cherry mix with plenty of clove on the elegant nose of this botting by the actress Challen Cates. There is a strong spice quality to the sip, where loads of star anise and clove play against the darker cherry and mulberry flavors.

title: Hug 2016 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Edgar Torres tapped Zotovich Vineyard for a stunning cool-climate Syrah in this bottling, which starts with aromas of elderberry, tar, charred beef, pepper dust and dark violet. The palate is firmly structured, showing white pepper, black currant and more beef and purple flowers. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Schramsberg 2014 Querencia Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Perennially delicious, this vintage holds up tradition by offering fresh, strong flavors of strawberry, raspberry and vanilla cookie. Blending 70% Chardonnay and 30% Pinot Noir from several vineyards, including Tognetti and Hyde, it's floral and softly interwoven—a fresh, focused delight. A portion of proceeds goes to Napa agricultural land preservation.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2015 Raschen Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Effusive black-cherry and raspberry aromas lead to more tightly wound rhubarb and red-cherry flavors in this attractively restrained, medium-bodied and fascinating wine that has the nervy energy to age well. It has a good sense of balance due to firm acidity and light tannins that keeps it refreshing sip after sip. Best after 2022.

title: Chappellet 2017 Signature Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Beautifully floral in jasmine and apple blossom, this is a dry, mineral-laden expression of the variety that shines in wet stone, peach and lemon, while delivering sticky, refreshing acidity. Well integrated and light in approach, it will work beautifully on the table as a white with body and elegance.

title: Folded Hills 2016 August Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cracked white and black pepper meet with elderberry and violet on the stunning nose of this blend, which is at once savory, juicy and floral. The palate picks up that savory touch with strong pepper spice, then come the black plum-skin flavors, all riding into a long finish.

title: Iron Horse 2014 National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: Rich and round with underlying notes of wet stone, apple and lemon peel, this beautifully made wine benefits National Geographic's Ocean Initiative, helping to support sustainable fishing and establish marine protected areas. It finishes crisp and dry with lasting elegance—as good to drink as it's doing good.
designation: National Geographic Ocean Reserve Blanc de Blancs

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Elk Prairie Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: This wine is vibrant, elegant, and abundantly flavorful while maintaining a lean nervy mouthfeel. It has very expressive black-cherry and cranberry aromas, almost-tart cherry and raspberry flavors and a combo of firm tannins and fresh acidity that give the texture a nice grip.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 DTR Ranch Syrah (Fiddletown)
description: This wine is not too fat and not too lean, finding a great balance point between vivid fruit and black-pepper flavors and firm tannins and acidity. Little or no oak comes through in the taste, but an engaging earthy, funky, sage-like element does, making it unusually complex and interesting to sip.

title: Wait Cellars 2015 Devoto Garden Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is from a prime site in the Sebastopol Hills and it shows plenty of cool-climate provenance. Earthy pine needle, sage and mushroom are complemented by savory strawberry, tangerine and tart cherry—the flavors blending well with fresh sparks of acidity and spice.

title: Brooks Note 2015 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Rich and generous fruit flavors mingle with deft touches of sweet, spicy oak in this full-bodied and mouthfilling wine. Black cherry, ripe plum and a touch of raspberry meet cinnamon and black tea accents. Moderate tannins add good structure in this standout wine from a relative newcomer.

title: Clos de la Tech 2004 Domaine Lois Louise Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Cola, loam, mint and dried black cherries show on the nose of this library release from the boundary-pushing winery owned by tech mogul T. J. Rodgers. The tannins are very refined on the palate, easing in the earthy flavors of bay leaf, pine needle, fig and black plum, which is nearing prune.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Mellow and relaxed in texture and extremely ripe in flavor, this full-bodied wine oozes jammy blackberry and black cherry on a mouthcoating structure of soft tannins and acidity.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: El Lugar 2016 Rincon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Voluptuous aromas of dark strawberry, rose and hibiscus are set against strong cinnamon spice and slate-like minerality on the nose of this bottling from a Talley-owned vineyard that doesn't sell much fruit. That minerality is strong on the sip, with gravelly, soil-laced flavors framing the dark cranberry fruits.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Bucher Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This fleshy medium-bodied red from the Westside Road site tastes of cherry liqueur, cassis, stemmy black tea and forest floor. This is a pretty wine that's also powerful, with undeniable balance.

title: Ancien 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Layered and expertly textured, this impressive wine offers focused flavors of apple, pear and more exotic earth and spice components of anise and nutmeg. Medium bodied, it's defined in complex acidity and a marked length of integrated oak.

title: Balletto 2016 Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From an estate-grown property, this is acid-driven and beautifully tart, persistent on the palate in whirls of blueberry and boysenberry. It offers the right amount of ripeness for its frame, finishing with complex structure and freshness.
designation: Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Benovia 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From several of the producer's estate sites, as well as the Zio Tony Ranch farmed by the Martinelli family, this wine exudes rich, velvety blue and black fruit flavors within a context of firm tannins and integrated oak. Dots of white pepper and cardamom complete the complex experience.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Parker West Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Ripe black cherry kicks off the nose of this bottling from the family's westernmost property, but then comes the more elegant touches of clove, chaparral and bay leaf. The palate is savory and complex, showing shiitake mushroom, sour cherry, ripe cranberry and a pinch of oregano.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens thick and rich, but evolves to show an underlying spark of brightness that persists through the midpalate and onto the finish. Raspberry and sage contrast against each other as a fleshy element of wild strawberry comes into play.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Piocho Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very plump aromas of dark strawberry, lilacs, jasmine and a hint of gingerbread show on the nose of this blend of 33% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 7% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot. The elegant palate rolls out flavors of candied raspberry, elderflower and black plum, growing more intense with acidity and tannins into the finish.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This study of Clone 2A begins with big aromas of boysenberry jam, black tea and minty chocolate elements. There is decent weight to the palate, where rich and ripe flavors of blackberry meet with firm tannins and buoyant acidity. Dashes of star anise and all spice give further depth.

title: Lynmar 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This delicious appellation wine is a tremendous testament to all it has to offer, from juicy strawberry and blueberry fruit to savory edges of black tea and cardamom. It excels in its depth of evolved flavor and complex balance and approachability.

title: Lynmar 2016 Summit Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has an ethereal quality to it, buoyed by thickets of bright citrus, pomegranate and strawberry. Full bodied, it retains a heightened grip of acidity that remains beneath earthy characteristics of forest floor and clove.

title: Melville 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Red cherry, dried rose petal and cinnamon-spiced melon show on the unique and alluring nose in this bottling. The palate offers a complex blend of earth and fruit, combining sour cherry with wild thyme, red flowers and dried sage.

title: Pali 2016 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted in 1986, this twist-top bottling is fresh and lovely, starting with aromas of grapefruit pith, nectarine, Pink Lady apple, orange and chalky minerality. The sip is bright, energetic and snaps with flavors of tangerine, chilled peach and light hazelnut, all wrapped in citrusy freshness and taut tension.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Grande Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Farmed by the grande dame Dorothy Rossi, this wine opens with a touch of matchstick reduction and smoky wood. Rustic, concentrated layers of leather, tobacco and crushed rock provide a savory core of depth and complexity, buoyed by a richness of graham cracker and blackberry jam.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2013 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Extremely concentrated, flavorful and full bodied, this brawny wine has an inky dark color, exotic aromas of cedar, clove and blackberry followed by dense, ripe fruit flavors and mouth-coating tannins. It will be fun to drink soon with a fatty chop or steak but will easily age and improve through at least 2023.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Steely on the nose, this always impressive bottling by a San Francisco accountant-turned-winemaker shows delicate aromas of lime blossom, chalk, sea salt, Asian pear and blanched almond. There is a tense grip to the palate and laser-sharp acidity, delivering flavors of lime sorbet and nectarine with a flash of light marshmallow on the deep finish.

title: Townley 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and floral in rose petal, this is a soft, supple and plush red with ample acidity to support and complement the texture. Strawberry, rhubarb, clove and black tea are met by a rewarding dash of white pepper.

title: Vermeil 2015 XXXIV Frediani Vineyard Red (Calistoga)
description: This blends 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Cabernet Franc, 23% Zinfandel and 14% Petite Sirah. Together, they harmonize into one whole of broad, leathery and complex texture and flavor. There's both softness and grip beneath the dark-black fruit and peppery spice.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2014 Judge's Verdict Judge Vineyard Red (Bennett Valley)
description: Blending 80% Syrah with 20% Grenache, this fine wine is earthy and velvety in violet, black plum and a bright thread of integrated acidity. Soft, supple tannins provide power and quiet grip, while the finish is textured in a lasting tease of leather and white pepper.

title: Calluna 2015 Estate Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This is another stellar blend from the estate. At 47%, the Cabernet Sauvignon dominates, but the wine also has 20% Merlot, 19% Cabernet Franc, 10% Petit Verdot and 4% Malbec. Balanced and moderate in ripeness, it doesn't hold back in concentrated black fruit, earthy spice, robust oak and tannin, the varieties finding harmony and structure.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Volcanic Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Sanguine and earthy, this is a thick, concentrated wine marked by its ash-laden soils—the texture and taste influenced mightily by this fact. Leathery on the palate, it offers a mix of mountain-grown berry and plum, with a twist of cassis and violet. This shows aging potential; enjoy best from 2025–2035.

title: Ballard Lane 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of tar, kelp, turned earth and dried berries show on the nose of this bottling. Damp campfire and tarry fruit flavors show on the sip.

title: Scott Family 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine has offbeat flavors of fig and green olive. It is full in body and ripe in feel.

title: Merriam 2017 Danielle Vineyard Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a harsh fuzziness to the texture and a strong aroma of grass and canned pea.

title: Suveg 2014 Table Dancer Syrah (Lodi)
description: The fruit flavors of this full-bodied wine are very ripe and also mature to the point of resembling balsamic. The wine shows earthy sage aromas, cherry and raspberry vinaigrette flavors.

title: Rotation Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This light-bodied wine is drinkable in a pinch. It has a slightly murky, brownish tint in the color, earthy and herbal aromas and a light veggie flavor.

title: Barber 2017 Belle Marie Black Knight Vineyard Chardonnay (Petaluma Gap)
description: There's something off-putting about the acidity in this wine—a disjointed experience that's bracing on the palate.

title: DeLorimier 2017 Spectrum Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Barrel-fermented in acacia wood, this wine is reduced and quite harsh. It lacks in fruit tones.

title: Wayfarer 2015 Wayfarer Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: Even in its youth this wine packs a punch and delivers unbelievable beauty, opening in aromas of perfume and game. Seductive, supple and spicy, it is undoubtedly full figured and hauntingly complex, with layers of dark cherry, charcuterie, sea breeze and forest floor. The tannins are firm yet polished, intense yet behaved. The salty, briny, beguiling minerality is what lingers longest on the finish.

title: Venge 2012 DLCV Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Extra time in bottle has benefited this wine and brought out its inner beauty. It's balanced and complex on the palate, with concentrated flavors of jammy blackberry, clove and white pepper that are supported by polished tannins. Hints of vanilla and nutmeg ring on the finish.

title: David Arthur 2014 Elevation 1147 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Named for the producer's high-elevation on Pritchard Hill, this is 100% varietal from one clone, aged in a wealth of French oak. Juicy, extracted berry flavor (both red and black) make it expansive on the palate, with elements of cocoa powder, sage, crushed rock and gravel adding intrigue and invitation. The tannins are sweet and polished. Age a bit and enjoy 2024–2034.

title: Plumpjack 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is a complex, concentrated and crowd-pleasing wine, blended with 7% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec. Pencil shavings, crayon wax and a juicy core of blackberry pie give it a savory richness, succulence and length, with enough underlying acidity to keep it fresh and behaved despite its density and structure.

title: Heitz 2013 Martha's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: From Tom and Martha May's famous, organically farmed site in the heart of the appellation, this is a blockbuster vintage of the 100% varietal wine, immaculately structured and full of fresh acidity. The menthol is there, subtle, heightened by delicate, silky layerings of orange peel, red currant and cinnamon. Drink 2023–2033.

title: Wayfarer 2015 The Traveler Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: From an estate-grown plot that has produced consistently spectacular wines, this vintage is no exception. It's densely packed and concentrated in blackberry and black cherry, with touches of rose petal and orange peel that give it freshness and underlying complexity in its youth. Over time, it should only be more beautiful. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Venge 2015 DLCV Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Winemaker Kirk Venge makes this small-production offering as a memoriam to his mother. Made in a robust, richly layered style, it's thick and rich in waves of soy, meat and blackberry jam on toast. The grippy, youthful tannins provide a firm structure, with finishing touches of coconut and milk chocolate.

title: Eighty Four 2017 Albariño (Carneros)
description: Bright freshness rules the day in this delicious vintage of Elias Fernandez's side project with Doug Shafer. Green apple, Meyer lemon and lime flavors provide pleasure, with a tense vibrancy and focused acidity filling the palate.

title: Odette 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: From the producer's 45-acre estate vineyard in the heart of the appellation, this contains 16% Merlot and small handfuls of the other Bordeaux red varieties. Together, they offer a harmoniously racy, rich and round experience and soft silky tannin. Juicy up-front black and red raspberries linger into lilting spice components, sage and violet. This will age well. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Venge 2014 DLCV Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: A sinewy nose leads the way to extracted flavors of red cherry, sage and rocky mineral. Offering length and breadth for days, the minerality is accentuated by graphite and crushed stone, while a rich red-currant flavor rules the midpalate. The toasted oak imparts a taste of coconut macaroon. Best from 2024–2034.

title: Venge 2015 Bone Ash Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Perfumed and pretty, this tastes of cherry cordial, with additional supple, well-integrated tones of fresh red cherry and cassis. Persistent in bright, underlying acidity, it has a powerful midpalate of weighty tannin and oak. The succulent finish is densely packed in black pepper and clove.

title: Rusack 2014 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This excellent bottling blends power with finesse, showing fresh red and black cherries, a smoky earthiness and pretty hints of red rose petals and hibiscus on the nose. The flavors are very cohesive and expertly woven on the palate, where bright red fruit is lifted by star anise spice and framed by a taut texture and uplifting acid. Stunning depth.

title: Venge 2013 DLCV Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This small-production offering is defined by a nose of nutmeg and clove. It explodes handsomely on the palate in jammy blackberry and dark chocolate, with a plush texture and concentrated, rich fruit that lingers. It balances that richness in bright, well-defined acidity.

title: Pessimist 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense blueberry, purple-flower and caramel aromas are laid across a rocky gravelly minerality on the nose of this red blend. Fruity blueberry flavors meet with more bitter espresso beans on the palate, which benefits from well-layered tannins.

title: Silver 2013 Cabernet Franc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dried carnations, tangy red fruit and a fruit-punch-like kick show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 14% Sangiovese, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Petit Verdot. The palate is complex with candied cherry, tobacco leaf and juniper, feeling lighter weight but zesty on the palate.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Relatively light in the glass, this bottling offers plump ripe pomegranate, hibiscus, pepper and thyme on the nose. The palate is a bit rusty and tangy with red-cherry and roasted tomato flavors.

title: Larner 2017 Malvasia Bianca (Ballard Canyon)
description: This bottling is expressive in aromas of lime blossom, lemon verbena, wet cement and grapefruit peel. The acid-driven palate offers grip and texture, delivering flavors of citrus peel, underripe stonefruit and tangy apple.

title: Midnight 2017 Aurora Reserve White (Paso Robles)
description: Loads of pear, nectarine and Meyer lemon peel show on the chalky nose of this blend of 42% Grenache Blanc, 21% Picpoul Blanc, 21% Viognier and 16% Roussanne. There is a great tightness to the palate, which carries flavors of pear preserves on toast and tangy citrus, leading into a creamy finish.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 Mustang Springs Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Floral aromas of red and purple petals lead into a juicy red-currant and raspberry streak that's cut by orange rind on the nose of this bottling. There's a hops-like herbal kick to the lighter bodied palate, which gives depth to the dark-red-fruit flavors.

title: Foxen 7200 2015 Range 30 West Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Condensed rose petals, dark red currants, sage and a hint of forest floor show on the nose of this blend of 57% Cabernet Franc and 43% Merlot. The herbal tones are more pronounced on the palate, where marjoram and cracked pepper decorate the zesty boysenberry core.

title: Allan Hancock 2015 Captain's Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black-cherry liqueur and a touch of brioche show on the nose of this promising bottling by students at Allan Hancock College. The palate's flavors of red cherry and earthy sagebrush are evenly distributed and framed by fresh acidity.

title: Balletto 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Dried herb and lavender highlight a smooth, rich and round palate of wild strawberry and blueberry in this well-made light-bodied wine.

title: Bonny Doon 2015 Le Cigare Blanc Beeswax Vineyard White (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache Blanc, 36% Roussanne and 9% Picpoul starts with broad aromas of Asian pear, tinges of Meyer lemon and tangerine rind and a lot of chalkiness. It's tightly wound on the palate and quite reserved in flavors, until a ripe yellow-pear element starts to come through toward the finish.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Grenache (Temecula Valley)
description: This bottling is quite floral on the nose, but there are also strong aromas of juicy red fruits and a pinch of pepper. Tangy black-plum and dark-blackberry flavors show on the sip, where the tannins are still rather stiff.

title: Crooked Path 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark plum, red currant and cocoa dust show on the very expressive, quite ripe nose of this bottling. There is thickness to the mouthfeel and the flavors are lush with dark red berries, peppery spice, a hint of sagebrush and a fresh acidity.

title: De Loach 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Wild strawberry dominates in this thick, concentrated wine, that is full bodied in mouthfeel and ripeness. The texture and weight is supported by moderate acidity and a finishing touch of Meyer lemon chiffon.

title: Fulcrum 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a thick, dense white with earthy floral and herbal characteristics. Stone fruit and vanilla make themselves known on the palate, evolving in the glass to show a richness of tropical flavor.

title: Hawley 2017 Hawley Vineyard Viognier (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Strong flavors of crunchy apple with hints of cured meat ride along an unctuous texture in this estate-grown wine that holds its acidity well.

title: Mill Creek 2017 Santa Rosa Estate Dry Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Stainless-steel fermented and made entirely from Merlot, this wine is bold in orange, raspberry and lime flavors, with an accent of rose petal on the nose. The finish is creamy and lushly full bodied.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Rich and fruity, this wine pours almost syrupy black-cherry flavors over the palate while hints of cocoa and nutmeg add complexity. It feels very smooth, is light on tannins and acidity but generous with pure Cabernet flavors.

title: Rideau 2016 Enchevetré White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Broad peachy aromas meet with a touch of crushed chalk on the nose of this blend of 43% Viognier, 28% Grenache Blanc, 15% Roussanne and 14% Marsanne. Nectarine flesh shows on the palate, but it clings to a compellingly steely edge.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Tondre Grapefield Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very shy on the nose, this bottling offers light pomegranate and cherry aromas. Dried herbs and turned earth flavors show on the palate against the cranberry background. It's a restrained take on the rich region.

title: Barton 2017 River Clare Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Templeton Gap District)
description: Rounded aromas of melon and pear are cut by a key-lime spritz and Meyer lemon pith, and a flash of tropical bubblegum comes out as well. The palate is pretty tight at first and then come the guava and banana flavors, all held up by racy acidity.

title: Croma Vera 2017 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Made from Tempranillo grapes grown on Pomar Junction Vineyard, this bottling starts with broad aromas of melon, peach and a bit of chalk on the nose. It grabs hold of the palate with a decent grip, and then releases into red berry and stone-fruit flavors, proving clean and easy.

title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dense, earthy and forested, this red offers compressed condensed flavors of dark cherry cola and blood orange. Intensely rich, ripe and fruity, it's well integrated in oak and tannin.

title: Ex 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Rounded Pink Lady apple aromas meet with pear blossom and chalk on the nose of this stainless steel wine brand by Wrath and winemaker Sabrine Rodems. Ripe apple and pear flavors show on the chalky sip, which is a solid option for lovers of the style.

title: Husch 2017 Chenin Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Apple skin and pine-needle aromas waft up from this light-bodied wine, while crisp apple and mild floral accents dominate the fresh and quite fruity flavors. It's helpful that the label reveals a 11 g/L residual sugar, which means it is a touch sweet.

title: Husch 2017 La Ribera Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)
description: This is an especially aromatic wine in a particularly aromatic varietal category. Aromas like cut grass, grapefruit and snap peas rush out of the glass, leading to equally vivid veggie flavors and a nice, crisp texture.

title: JCB 2014 No. 24 Brut Sparkling (Los Carneros)
description: Made from 51% Chardonnay and 49% Pinot Noir, this is a broad and rich sparkling wine with ample mousse and body weight. Peach, apple and almond paste mingle on the midpalate with ease.

title: MacLaren 2015 Heather Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: This wine is earthen in ash, stems and a thickness of up-front tannin. Black cherry and berry dominate on the balanced midpalate before giving way to bubbling acidity on the finish.

title: Rock Wall 2017 Blanc de Noir Loney Ranch Sparkling (Suisun Valley)
description: This fruity wine made from 100% Pinot Noir has a light-peach color, powerful effervescence and frank flavors like red cherries that make it refreshing and tasty. It comes from an under-the-radar appellation just east of Napa County.

title: Rotation Vineyards 2016 Red (California)
description: This full-flavored and full-bodied wine leads with smoky peppery oak notes in the aroma and ladles more oak on the palate but also backs it up with generous fruit flavors and a smooth texture due to fine-grained tannins. This will be excellent with a wide range of proteins.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Sangiacomo Green Acres Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Upfront oak is tight-grained on the palate, before allowing layers of fennel and pear to come into focus. Medium bodied, the vineyard site shows both the character of a warm, even vintage and the excellence of the site.

title: San Simeon 2016 Estate Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Standard aromas of Pink Lady and Gala apples meet with seared pear on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of sweetness to the palate, where pan-seared apples, butter, sea salt and warm peach tones make for a fairly rich experience.

title: The Archivist 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Slightly simple but pleasurable aromas of pomegranate, black raspberry, light cocoa and caramel candy show on the nose of this bottling. The structure is also airy, but it's easy to enjoy with ripe strawberry and boysenberry flavors.

title: The Archivist 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Clean and familiar aromas of butter and lemon preserves make for a somewhat simple but very straightforward and crowd-pleasing take on Chardonnay. The same goes for the palate, where the buttery middle is cut by lemon rind on the edges, making for a mellow but tasty experience.

title: The Vice 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and creamy in texture, this wine offers lasting freshness from start to finish. The palate is dotted in bold flavors of fig and green apple.

title: Van Ruiten 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: A light spearmint aroma and lively, subtle spiced-apple flavors make this medium-bodied wine very engaging. It has good lively acidity, a sense of freshness and a clean tangy finish.

title: Double Black 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Woody spices rule on the nose of this bottling, but there are also elements of blackberry jam, thyme and anise. The palate is quite smoky with oak, which frames the dark fruit and baking-spice flavors.

title: Estancia 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Shy aromas of red cherry and wet slate show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Its palate is down the middle for an affordable Pinot Noir, with cooked cranberry, a hint of pepper and the slightest touch of star anise.

title: Line 39 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine is smooth and supple, attractively fruity and well-balanced, making it easy to sip and savor. It shows black-cherry and red-cherry aromas followed by tasty cherry and berry flavors that are lightly accented by baking spices.

title: Lula 2016 Costa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Toasted-bread aromas and a tight tannic texture give a definitely oaky profile to this full-bodied wine. Its cherry and raspberry flavors are surrounded by a gripping mouthfeel and spicy oak notes that keep emerging on the palate and finish.

title: Sevtap 2015 Owen Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Hearty aromas of black currant, Concord grape and grape seed show on the fairly extracted nose of this blend of 43% Petit Verdot, 28.5% Malbec and 28.5% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is a lot of acid and pepper spice on the sip, but the fruit remains tangy and somewhat primary.

title: Montevina 2016 Glass Falls Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This wine gets its charm from a refreshing mouthfeel and clean light flavors rather than from richness or concentration. It is light bodied, tangy and well balanced.

title: Obvious 2012 No. 01 Dark & Bold Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon and 49% Merlot is quite reserved on the nose, showing dark red cherry, damp pine and earthy, wet campfire aromas. The wood spice shows strongly on the sip, where cigar box meets with mulberry and sweet berry flavors.

title: Roger Roessler 2015 Big Bend Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is shy on the nose at first and simple in approach, showcasing a mix of rock salt, ocean air and floral-herbal components. It is medium bodied and fruity in pear and tropical papaya.

title: Smashberry 2016 Red (Paso Robles)
description: This widely available blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Syrah, 25% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc is a great house wine for parties or as a midweek sipper. Ripe plummy aromas of baked black raspberry and strawberry lead into a juicy palate of pomegranate, cranberry, candied red apple and darker fruits, enhanced by a pinch of herbs.

title: Smith Devereux 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Baked tropical flavors highlight a broad, expansive and full-bodied white with a buttery oaky component that works well with the rich robust fruit.

title: Tuli 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Pineapple juice and baked mango mark this pleasing, straightforward and approachable wine, which takes a full-bodied approach to its ripeness, with minimal oak.

title: Volatus 2015 Pinot Noir (Adelaida District)
description: Extremely dark and dense in the glass, this is a cleanly made and flavorful wine, it's just so ripe and extracted that many won't recognize it as Pinot Noir. Stewed berry, black plum pudding and campfire smoke aromas lead into a palate full of tangy boysenberry syrup and baked licorice.

title: California Roots 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a good wine and a terrific value. It has no sharp edges and a nice interplay between ample fruit flavors and touches of butter and baking spices. It's medium bodied, has some acidity to make it refreshing and also has a lingering off-dry finish.

title: Labyrinth 2014 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Candied black grape and black currant aromas make for a rather sweet nose on this bottling. The palate is much more complex, with layers of blackberry preserves, thyme, dark chocolate and violets, cut through with a fairly searing acidity.

title: Benziger 2014 Obsidian Point Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This blend contains most of the main red Bordeaux varieties, as well as a splash of Zinfandel. Dry tannins and sizable oak support estate-grown fruit that takes on flavors of dark cherry, waxy plum and pomegranate.

title: CK Mondavi 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a refreshing, palate-cleansing wine that blends crisp apple and white peach flavors on a tangy texture that's supported by good acidity. It's light bodied and appetizing.

title: Montemar Wines 2014 Stolpman Vineyard Sangiovese (Ballard Canyon)
description: Aromas of pomegranate, fruit punch and carnation show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite fruity all around. The palate offers candied red plums and rosewater flavors, set against a sticky tannic structure.

title: Montemar Wines 2015 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A strong aroma of toasted hazelnut shows on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, along with hints of scratched orange rind and cashew cream. It's broad and a tad flat on the palate, where baked apple, rounded citrus and a hint of marshmallow flavors arise.

title: Red Car 2014 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This wine is lightly stylized, made to showcase a baseline of fresh tart acidity, which it does well. The flavors are elusive, a mix of fig and brine.

title: Reyes 2015 Oso's Blend Red (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: This blend of 54% Merlot and 46% Tempranillo is quite quaffable, starting with aromas of candied berries, light oregano, dust and anise. The palate is rustic and earthy, with red plums, light tobacco and a pinch of pepper dust.

title: Sonoma Port Works 2014 Petit Verdot (Clarksburg)
description: This Port-style wine has dried fruit and toasted-walnut aromas, sweet plum and prune flavors and a nutty finish. It's quite full bodied and the alcohol and tannins give good backing to all the flavor and sweetness.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Zinfandel (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Dark-purple fruit, brown sugar and sweet wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers elderberry jam with dried herbs, riding a slightly sticky structure.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 Bell Ranch Vineyard Viognier (Monterey)
description: There's a strong sense of restraint on this cleanly made, fresh bottling, which is better than overripe and yet leaves a bit to be desired. The faintest of peach aromas on the nose lead into light flavors of nectarine and coconut on the palate, which offers decent textural grip.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: Jammy flavors and a sense of sweetness are appealing in this full-bodied, ripe and rich wine. It is expansive on the palate, light in tannins and brings a little heat on the finish.

title: CK Mondavi 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has frank, open fruit and spice flavors, with a slightly boisterous, grippy texture that will wrap very well around all kinds of protein dishes. It's medium bodied, moderately tannic and has a touch of lively acidity.

title: Raymond 2014 Salon Privé Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made predominantly from Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this bold full-bodied blend is invitingly floral in cherry blossom and coconut flakes, the oak showy and present. Cherry and cassis flavors are rounded and rich on the palate and the body brawny and broadly defined in tannin and oak.

title: Salvestrin 2013 Three D Dr. Crane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a lightly spiced 100% varietal wine from a famous site, a showcase of burly black cherry seasoned in cedar, graphite and vanilla. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, integrating the weight into a graceful package of understated power.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Hirsch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: As the last bottling of this vineyard from this producer, this is a fine way to go out. It's a salty, gravelly and complex red, aromatic in rose, lavender and orange blossom. Tart acidity uplifts the weightier aspect of the present tannins, as dried herb, sea spray and black tea season the fruit.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Williams Selyem Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the site around the winery on Westside Road—which is planted to heirloom clones—this wine has a refrained, balanced approach to ripeness, showing focused black cherry, black tea and baked rhubarb tones. The moderate structure allows for a soft, layered texture that could use more time in bottle. Enjoy best from 2020–2025.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Knucklehead Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: There's an impressive density of aromas on this bottling, with black pepper, roasted meat, black currant and tar, yet with a fresh violet kick as well. The concentrated black currant and elderberry flavors are thick on the palate yet cut by tangy black plum skins, salt and pepper and dried herb flavors.

title: Last Light 2015 Derbyshire Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This well-named project comes from a seaside vineyard that may get the last direct sunlight of the entire Central Coast, and the cool-climate aspects thrive. Aromas of dewy sagebrush, shaved pine and myrrh mix with mulberry and underripe raspberry on the nose. The mouthfeel is full while the flavors are tart with tangy cranberry cherry tomato and Kalamata olive, leaving the palate refreshed.

title: Scratch 2014 Janaca Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a lot of snappy energy to this bottling by Sabrine Rodems, with fresh garden herbs, blackberries, shaved licorice and a dark chocolate touch on the nose, with a lingering, exotic Indian-like spice throughout. Wild sagebrush and pine oil show on the sip, giving depth to the tangy purple fruit. Squeaky tannins rise toward the finish.

title: Artezin 2016 Old Vine Family Farmed Sustainably Grown Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Saturated with dark, almost jammy fruit flavors, this is an extremely flavorful and nicely dry wine that also has great structure. An intensely dark color leads to blackberry and boysenberry aromas, distinctive blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a rich mouthfeel that is well-laced by fine-grained tannins.
designation: Old Vine Family Farmed Sustainably Grown

title: Bonterra 2015 The Roost Blue Heron Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: A deep gold color and bold buttery aromas set up an expectation for rich flavors, which come in the form of butter, butterscotch, vanilla and cream, with some tasty Anjou pear underneath. The wine was made from biodynamic grapes and matured in French oak barrels, making it full bodied, mouthfilling and indulgent.

title: Cutruzzola 2014 Giacomino Reserve Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Thick blackberries, wet slate, sweet anise and a touch of purple flowers show on the rich nose of this reserve wine from a vineyard tucked into a seaside canyon above Cambria. It's quite dry on the tip of sip, with tons of rose petals and lavender, and then the black cherry and vanilla flavors arise. Chalky tannins and refreshing acidity complete the picture.

title: Davies 2015 Piedra Libre Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a concentrated, fleshy coastal wine, weighty in oak and tannin. The vibrancy comes via well-defined layers of cherry, wild strawberry and forest, with wisps of black tea and cardamom knocking on the door.

title: Ken Brown 2014 A Cuvée Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling, which includes 5% Viognier, shows aromas of concentrated black currant syrup, vanilla, nutmeg and a bit of bay leaf on the nose. The palate is extremely flavorful, with tons of licorice, blackberry jam, rosemary and thyme. Vanilla rises on the finish.

title: Mi Sueño 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a variety of vineyard sources, this 100% varietal wine highlights deft winemaking in its ability to offer plenty of power within a context of vibrancy. Raspberry, cherry and milk chocolate meet savory touches of clove and cinnamon, with plenty of structure within its rounded richness.

title: Nellcôte 2016 Rosé (Mount Veeder)
description: This wine is made from nearly equal parts Malbec and Syrah, grown on Bald Mountain Ranch atop this feral appellation. It succeeds in offering dry complexity around a core of refreshing and lightly spiced raspberry and Rainier cherry. Lengthy, it lasts for days, offering medium-bodied power.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Del Arroyo Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Livermore Valley)
description: An exotic treat, this dry wine overflows with mango and marshmallow aromas, has tasty lemon meringue flavors and a soothing, viscous texture that coats the palate. Winemaker Shauna Rosenblum kept the juice on the skins for four days during fermentation, adding to the wine's concentration, layering and complexity as well as a lingering, honeyed finish.

title: S.R. Tonella 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Quince and grapefruit flavors rise to the top of the palate in this well-made estate wine, aged in a mix of French oak, Acacia and stainless steel. While smooth and round in feel, its acidity has impact, providing stony refreshment around a lingering white peach flavor.

title: Silverpoint Cellars 2013 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 62% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petit Verdot, 15% Cabernet Franc and 8% Merlot, each aged separately in French oak for three years then blended and bottled, the varieties come together effortlessly in the glass. The full-bodied palate offers flavors of leather saddle, spicy vanilla, clove and blueberry. Densely concentrated, it's hearty and complex, dotted on the finish in a cinnamon tone.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 ReZerve Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a real standout wine from the Sobon family—established as winemakers in Amador County in 1977. The wine is ripe, full bodied, firmly structured and dry. It starts with whiffs of white and black pepper and aromas, carrying to the juicy palate of blackberry and cedar flavors, with soft tannins offering a mouthcoating feel.

title: Vinum Cellars 2013 The Scrapper Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)
description: Very rich and ripe, but also very firm and well built, this full-bodied wine has all the elements for great balance: robust and dry fruit flavors, good acidity, firm but not harsh tannins and appropriately strong alcohol. It's great to drink now with something rich and fatty, but will be best after 2020.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Burt Williams' Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Lots of spicy oak aromas and vivid, ripe, concentrated fruit animate this medium- to full-bodied wine that nevertheless has great acidity and firm tannins to support all that showy flavor. It smells like cinnamon and cherry tart, and tastes full of black cherry, sour cherry and cranberry. Best after 2021.

title: Millésimé 2014 Touriga Nacional (Paso Robles)
description: Very ripe aromas of black currant, black plum and grape seed are intensely concentrated on the nose of this wine. The palate is very ripe with a seriously strong streak of acid.

title: Raymond 2016 LVE Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a simple, moderately structured white that veers into overripe, tropical flavors and sweet oak.

title: Black Box 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a drinkable, basic version of the varietal that offers light plum and spice aromas, canned-cherry flavors and a very smooth velvety texture.

title: Decoy 2016 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This is a big, juicy and somewhat astringent red, the tannins sizable and intrusive.

title: Hayes Valley 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has lots of jammy aromas and flavors but also a dry palate impression and enough tannin and acidity to give it a lean finish.

title: The Federalist 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is brimming in blackberry and vanilla flavors, with an earthy quality that rides below the intensity of the fruit. The acidity is elusive.

title: Michael Pozzan 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a mild wine that tastes gritty on the palate and sizable in tannin. The fruit is a mix of strawberry and blueberry with teases of baking spice.

title: Three Pears 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has mild fruit aromas, a very soft texture and fruity, almost sugary flavors. It's a straightforward sipper that could be good for a crowd.

title: ZinPhomaniac 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Strong smoky oaky aromas and flavors pervade this full-bodied wine, nearly covering the plummy, almost-sweet fruit flavors that lie underneath.

title: Lewis Grace 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: A strong spicy oaky aroma is followed by equally strong oak flavors, so this medium-bodied wine is one-dimensional, without the fruit character that most people like to taste in their wines.

title: Binz 2016 Hanna's Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Charred wood-smoke aromas and raw oak flavors nearly overwhelm the taste of this heavy-handed and medium-bodied wine.

title: Black Box 2016 Rosé (California)
description: This is a basic, straightforward wine with light watermelon flavors, a soft mouthfeel and short finish.

title: Millésimé 2016 Orange Muscat (Santa Barbara County)
description: Melon and candied lemon meet with oxidized, vinegar-laced aromas on the nose of this bottling. Cooked lemons and apple-cider flavors show on the palate.

title: Reichwage 2015 Twin Hills Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoked cherry and tea flavors become somewhat stemmy and green, with a touch of leather and barnyard-like earth.

title: Black Box 2016 Red (California)
description: This wine has a brothy veggie aroma and fruity flavors that are slightly sweet and overripe like raisins and prunes. It is medium bodied and a bit syrupy in texture.

title: Millésimé 2014 Orange Muscat (Santa Barbara County)
description: Nutty and oxidized on the nose, this bottling offers an apple-cider aroma. Sour yellow apples show on the sip.

title: Viaggio 2014 Outta the House! Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: This is a basic table wine, light and a bit brownish in color, that tastes a little tired and has flavors like tea and raspberry vinegar.

title: Butternut 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Piney, petrol aromas and smoky, oaky, herbal flavors give an unusual profile to this medium-bodied wine. It's not what most people expect in a Chardonnay.

title: Melville 2016 Sandy's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Aromas of snappy pomegranate, smashed pine, dewy chaparral and dried carnation show on the epic nose of this bottling by Chad Melville, who took over winemaking duties on this vintage. It's crisp and bright in feel, where sour cherry, thyme, sage and blistered tomato flavors engage all parts of the palate.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Outland Ridge Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Concentrated, exotic and almost earthy, this wine from a single vineyard in Anderson Valley has a wild edge of smoked fruit, singed rosemary and black pepper, with a core of deep black-cherry and clove flavors. It is full-bodied, mouthfilling and layered, with nuances that continue to unfold on the evolving finish. Best through 2024.

title: Cosenza Cellars 2012 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Black olive dominates on the nose of this lightly textured wine, which offers smoothness on the palate amid a quietly rich backdrop of black currant and chocolate.

title: Hawley 2016 Hopkins River Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Robust ripeness and oak rule the day in this hearty white, big on flavors of butterscotch and caramel.

title: Seven Daughters 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a good weekday wine that smells and tastes fresh, uncomplicated and quite fruity, feels smooth on the palate and has a clean finish.

title: Sand Point 2015 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Peach and pear notes fill the aroma of this soft and extremely fruity wine, while the palate adds marshmallow and butter impressions. It's a soft, lightly sweet wine with low acdity.

title: Séamus Wines 2014 Pearl Pinot Gris (Lodi)
description: This wine has an unusual amount of flavor concentration and body, and it's already well aged. Interesting to smell the honeysuckle and taste the peach and earth flavors while a rich texture grips the palate

title: Sentivo 2014 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: This is a full-bodied but not very concentrated wine that smells meaty and cherry-like, has mellow, mature spice flavors, a smooth, broad texture and slightly hot finish.

title: Truett Hurst 2015 The Fugitive Red (Dry Creek Valley)
