description: This is a big, juicy and highly ripe red wine, simple in structure and tannin profile, its core of fruit a density of baked plum and cinnamon.

title: Volatus 2015 Cavu White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 64% Viognier, 18% Grenache Blanc and 18% Roussanne starts with aromas of sour citrus and smoke, blending underripe tangerine, yellow peach and creamy pear. Apple rinds, nectarine and sweeter citrus elements show on the sip, which is a tad disjointed.

title: Callaway 2014 Profonde Winemaker's Reserve Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Tar, stewed black fruits, dill and peppercorns show on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Syrah and Petit Verdot. Sour plum flavors meet with anise candies and potpourri spice on the sip.

title: Callaway 2014 Wild Yeast Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Freshly pressed berries and red currants lean more toward red than purple fruit on the nose of this bottling, which also offers licorice spice and a hint of funky game. The palate is a tad sour with underripe berries and plum rinds, and doesn't uphold the nose's promise.

title: Cuda Ridge 2015 Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)
description: Extremely full bodied, this boisterous wine punches the palate with roasted herb and late-harvest-fruit flavors as well as some alcoholic heat. It feels big and tannic in texture.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Griva Vineyard Therese Vineyards Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lemongrass, oak and green fruit show on the restrained nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh with underripe grapefruit and orange flavors yet there's also a streak of warmer walnut, which makes for a slightly disjointed experience.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Dark Red (California)
description: Fresh and lively, this medium-bodied wine smells like white pepper and raspberries and tastes extremely fruity like blackberries and strawberries. It has a brisk mouthfeel with moderate tannins and a hint of sweetness to round off the edges.

title: OZV 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: With a semisweet balance and loads of chocolate flavors, this wine is more of a dessert than a dinner wine. The aromas are packed with blackberry jam and raspberry syrup, while the flavors are lush and sweet and the texture soft.

title: Allen Estate Wines 2013 Audacieux Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Waxy cranberry and currant combine on the nose and entry of this wine, which shows a bitter twist of tannin midway through. Graphite, dried herb and a strong streak of cedar characterize the taste profile, with full-bodied ripeness packing a punch.

title: Avaler 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This moderately priced wine offers restrained acidity, opting instead for soft approachable flavors of baked plum and black cherry. The oak is pronounced.

title: Boston Winery 2015 The Black Dog Great White (California)
description: This wine is nice and dry, tipping toward acidity in terms of balance and tastes fresh and citrusy. Its flavors are pretty subtle but it has a good quenching factor and no distractions.

title: Educated Guess 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Partially fermented in barrel and partially in stainless steel, this is a likable white with plenty of ripe tropical fruit, vanilla oak and grainy texture that's made in a full-bodied robust style.

title: Kunde 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a thick herbal effort wrapped in tart red fruit that has been blended with a small portion of Grenache. The flavors lean into strawberry and raspberry, with rich oak and baking spices adding to the full-bodied picture.

title: PRIE Vineyards and Winery 2014 Hux Vineyard Petit Verdot (Lodi)
description: This relatively light-bodied and pleasant wine has mild fruit and spice aromas followed by gentle cherry and clove flavors that drop off quickly on the finish. It tastes soft and easy.

title: Friedeman 2015 UV Lancel Creek Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Caramel apple and big-boned oak show upfront richness in this boldly concentrated white from a Ulises Valdez-farmed site. Intense and robust, its underlying acidity complements and refreshes.

title: Lang & Reed 2014 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)
description: This is a well-balanced and rather intense wine with very focused black-cherry and tobacco flavors and very little oak influence. It is medium to full in body, and has moderate tannins for a welcome slight bite in the otherwise smooth texture.

title: Little Giant 2014 Lamonica Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Richly round and filling on the palate, this wine is complex and layered, with flavors of ripe red cherry, cassis and vanilla. Hints of leather and earth provide contrast and additional intrigue.

title: Markham 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy and soft, this wine is blended with 3% Petit Verdot and 2% Cabernet Franc. It weaves together black cherry, leather and tobacco within smooth layers of nuance and medium-bodied weight, finishing in splash of refreshing acidity.

title: Peltier 2012 Schatz Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Brawny and beefy, this full-bodied wine smells earthy, smoky and meaty, and tastes rich, packed with extra-ripe fruit flavors and well-seasoned with oak. It has appealing depth and complexity and tastes fully mature now.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Brandlin Vineyard Zinfandel (Mount Veeder)
description: Baked earth, mocha and vanilla characterize this field blend of 90% Zinfandel with a rough mix of 10% Mourvèdre, Charbono and Carignan. Robust on the palate with a textured mouthfeel, it's full-bodied with bright, underlying acidity and black peppery finish.

title: Roth 2015 Heritage Estate Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a seriously ripe, concentrated wine—a combination of 51% Syrah with Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Petit Verdot. Lively acidity keeps it from getting bogged down in its innately robust tannins and concentrated layers of leather, tobacco and baked plum.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2014 Especial Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: A spicy perfume, good flavor concentration and a firm texture all add up to a very nice wine. Deep black cherry is shaded by baking spices in the aromas, while the flavors are focused on black fruits and dark chocolate. A velvety but moderately tannic mouthfeel completes the attractive picture.

title: 2Plank 2015 BDX Red (San Diego County)
description: Bright and yet concentrated blueberry-paste aromas meet with vanilla and freshly dug loam on the nose of this blend of 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 15% Cabernet Franc. The tannins are nicely polished on the sip, where black cherry foam and soft vanilla flavors make for a compelling wine.

title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Sin Zin Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is aged in American oak for 10 months. It offers a commingling of strawberry jam, tree bark, black pepper and smoky flavors set on a brawny, rich palate.

title: Benziger 2014 Tribute Estate Grown Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: From certified-biodynamic grapes, this blends percentages of all five major red Bordeaux varieties, imparting bold full-bodied flavor and texture. Dusty clove, black cherry, blackberry and milk chocolate flavors combine for a soft fruity expression of moderate complexity.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Reserve Estate Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Fair Play)
description: This is a jazzy wine with vibrant aromas and great acidity that is crisp and appetizing to sip. Orange zest, apple skin and almond flavors come out on the palate for a lean but satisfying midpalate and finish.

title: Dashe Cellars 2014 Florence Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Pruney dried fruit dominates on the nose of this wine, which is smoothly textured and roundly rich. Black cherry and mocha ride up against a worthy foundation of dried herb and cedar herbaceousness.

title: David Clinton 2015 Mounts Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A bare-knuckled punch of barnyard compost gives this wine an earthy edginess straightaway as bright, lively acidity builds up on the palate to support red fruit and licorice flavors. Medium-toned in ripeness and structure, this is a nice spicy well-integrated wine.

title: Domenica Amato 2016 Gusto Bianco White (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is made primarily of Grenache Blanc (59%) and Roussanne (40%), with 1% Viognier for good measure. Clear, focused acidity streaks throughout a light-bodied palate that tastes of green apple, white flower and stone.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an affordable crowd-pleasing white, bright, clean and medium bodied, with some heft from the oak. Made in a creamy textured style, it's grainy and full of apple and crème brûlée flavor.

title: Halcón 2015 Esquisto Red (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Full body and spicy peppery flavors make this wine feel a little fiery as it delivers smoky flavors and a rather tight structure of tannins and acidity. Made with 40% whole clusters and native yeast, it shows more savory than fruity notes and delivers an earthy untamed sort of complexity.

title: Hawley 2017 Rosé of Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Medium bodied and moderately pink in color, this wine is fleshy and creamy on the palate, with body to spare. Cherry and raspberry flavors highlight the experience.

title: Hendry 2014 Hendry Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A waxy nose of violet and earth leads to a savory exploration of cedar, pencil shavings and black cherry. The wine is no-holds-barred ripe and robust in tannin.

title: Labyrinth 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Concentrated black currant and candied red fruits meet the tiniest bit of peppery spice on the nose of this lush bottling. The palate combines black fruit, vanilla and caramel before more of that classic Cab Franc pepper spice emerges in the midpalate, all framed by sticky tannins.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Olivet Lane Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This memorable white offers flavors of mango, pear and crème brûlée, with a seductive richness to the feel of the palate. The oak is integrated—it shows power and grace within a balanced body and touch of brine.

title: Hanzell 2015 Ambassador's 1953 Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a gorgeous wine made in minuscule amounts, fermented in both stainless steel and one-third new French oak before aging in neutral French oak. The subtle touches give it a chance to speak softly in lemony quince, with a steely nose of jasmine. Fleshy and full bodied without being heavy, it has a succulence of apple skin on the midpalate.

title: Hanzell 2016 Sebella Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Stainless-steel fermented and aged in neutral French oak, this well-made wine offers crisp acidity and supportive oak, with highlights of fennel, green apple and wet stone. Its grainy texture is layered and complex while also being deliciously drinkable now.

title: Ladera 2015 Pillow Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a finely made wine, with tones of herbs, smoked black cherry and blackberry. Thick, velvety smooth and concentrated, it finds its balance in high-toned, underlying acidity and sparks of cardamom and black tea.

title: Larner 2013 Reserve Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Lively aromas of smashed black currants, caramelized berries, lilacs and açai make for a very inviting and pretty nose on this bottling. The palate is vivid with smoke, blueberry paste, violets, lavender and a savory charred component, finishing with a kiss of vanilla.

title: Limerick Lane 2017 Estate Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: This refreshing wine is a blend of 62% Syrah and 38% Grenache. It quenches in notes of strawberry, peach and a hint of gaminess. Velvety smooth and dangerously easy to enjoy, it's light and brightly layered in acidity.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Califa Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: A rich and spicy take on the grape, this bottling combines dried red plums with juniper, forest moss, spice cake and a fascinating mushroom-laced umami kick on the nose. The palate is taut with raspberry flavors and well integrated exotic Middle Eastern spices. The acidity is lively and the mouthfeel is soft yet grippy on the finish.

title: Talisman 2014 Red Dog Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Thick and concentrated in baked blueberry, cherry and strawberry, this wine has substantial tannin and weight to it, a powerful backbone that's balanced by bubbling, nuanced acidity and mineral earth tones that linger gingerly on the finish.

title: Venge 2016 Maldonado Vineyard Dijon Clones Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Golden Delicious apple is the star of the show in this beautifully oaked, aromatic and lushly textured white. Caramel and nutmeg rise on the nose, leading the way to fleshy full-bodied concentration and richness, tamed by bright bursts of quince and Meyer lemon.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Rued Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: This wine is bright in acidity, with a wealth of freshness in tones of Meyer lemon and lime. Quenching on the midpalate, it develops more and more complexity in the glass, where a stony texture meets crisp green apple and fennel.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Hartford Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's own backyard site, head-trained and planted a century ago, this wine is from the lowest yielding of all their sites. Earthy forest, leather saddle, fennel and a whiff of meatiness highlight a dense brightly layered wine, offering structure that is lifted in red-berry flavor with a spicy tobacco finish.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Marin County Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: Bold dark-fruit aromas and mouthfilling flavors make this full-bodied wine taste generous and concentrated. A deep core of black plum and black cherry fills the palate and lingers nicely on the finish. It is both ripe and savory but doesn't go over the top, maintaining good balance and a fresh dry aspect.

title: Mabera 2013 Amadeus Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This blend of Mourvèdre, Grenache and Petite Sirah is big and brawny, with aromas of roast beef, black pepper and wood smoke. The palate is concentrated and layered in flavors of blackberry, coffee bean and blueberry, framed by fine-grained, gripping tannins. Made by the Bekeris family, who emigrated from Lithuania. Best after 2021.

title: Landmark 2015 Escolle Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling from a vineyard at the cool northern edge of the appellation starts with a wildly intriguing nose of dark elderberry, bay leaf, roasted boar and dark violets. The palate throws tons of bay leaf, peppercorn and thyme before settling into boysenberry and game. It could be mistaken for a cool-climate Syrah.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 Elie O Syrah-Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: A new wine from the producer, this combines 85% Syrah with 15% Viognier, and it is a whirlwind of intriguing flavor. Blackberry, waxy plum, dried herb, cedar, clove and black pepper highlight a rounded dense beginning that evolves to show lengthy tannin structure and complexity. Still, the wine's just fun.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Dina's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Planted more than 100 years ago by her family, this head-trained vineyard is still looked after by Dina. The wine's tart focused acidity zeroes in on candied-cherry and strawberry flavors. Sumptuous and brightly rich, it has undeniable structure and a lasting mineral element of oyster shell and brine.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Highwire Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Named for the way part of the vineyard is planted, the vines trained on a high wire, this is a dense earthy red. (The site is also field planted to Carignane.) Juicy with plenty of acidity on the midpalate, it oozes blackberry, black cherry and white and black pepper, with a lasting hit of texture and freshness.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Muldune Trail Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Abundantly flavorful and full bodied, this wine has lots of dark berry and black-cherry aromas, a big rich mouthfeel and deep layered fruit flavors sprinkled with spices from cinnamon to bay leaf to black pepper. It tastes extra ripe and has the moderate tannins and good acidity to support that ripeness.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Velvet Sisters Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a distinctive and detailed wine that starts with floral and spicy aromas, follows with generous fruit flavors and intriguing accents of tea, rhubarb and wet stone. It's ripe but not overly so, and that little bit of restraint gives it an appealing structured mouthfeel and fine sense of balance.

title: Holus Bolus 2016 Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Loads of chaparral spice, peppercorns and dried herbs dominate the nose of this appellation blend from one of California's cool-climate Syrah stars, but there is also a dark-fruit background of blackberry soda. Buoyant acidity carries the palate through chopped dill, juniper and more peppercorn flavors.

title: De Loach 2015 Pennacchio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site within the cool Sebastopol Hills, this light-bodied wine is earthy, minty and spicy, with length and grace. Smooth and silky on the palate, it shines in dark cherry, cassis and cardamom, and has a memorable, lasting finish.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 22% Petite Sirah and 2% Carignan in the mix, and the vines averaging more than 95 years in age, this is a memorable wine. Structured and powerful, it boasts flavors of raspberry jam, graham cracker and cinnamon, with integrated tannins that impart richness and length.

title: Firestone 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a very savory and quite compelling Cabernet, starting with aromas of black pepper, tar, dried olive and yet also a bright fresh boysenberry kick. The palate is framed by lavish, silky tannins that envelop flavors of cassis, black cherry and baking spice, with continued layers of Sichuan peppercorn and plum arising into the finish.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a backbone of tannin and dense fruit that offers power. Flavors of rhubarb, pomegranate and strawberry meet added complexities of cherry liquor and earthy spice on the palate.

title: Husch 2016 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Savory sage and black tea are top notes for this well-balanced, nicely fruity and medium-bodied wine from one of the pioneering wineries of Anderson Valley. Hints of black pepper and clove meet solid, ripe black-cherry and raspberry flavors as moderate tannins help shape an appetizing mouthfeel.

title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuvée XB Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: This blends 61% Pinot Noir, 35% Chardonnay and 4% Pinot Meunier. Dry and crisp, it offers flavors of Gravenstein apple, stone and lemon peel. It is refreshing, layered and complex.

title: MacRostie 2016 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright and fresh in Gravenstein apple, fig and citrus flavors, this full-bodied wine is balanced and well integrated, with a depth of texture and complexity. It lingers gingerly in Asian spice.

title: Siduri 2016 Barbieri Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers a depth of aromatic intensity and is expansive in velvety tannin. Spicy cherry, strawberry and a compelling thread of cola highlight a succulence on the midpalate that lingers leisurely on the finish.

title: Siduri 2016 Ewald Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tart in complex acidity and subtle flavors of strawberry, pomegranate and orange, this is a light-bodied, lightly ripe wine, that's angular and elegant.

title: Ten Acre 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Baked red cherry, star anise, gingersnaps and purple flowers show on the fruity but elegant nose of this bottling. Those strong fruit and hearty spice flavors show on the sip as well, which is framed by powerful acidity. That acid needs more time to mellow, so drink 2020–2030.

title: V. Vineyards 2014 Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine offers a fruity core of plum and dark-cherry compote, with elements of spicy clove and forested earth. It has a backbone of acidity that contributes freshness against a powerful backdrop of ripeness and intensity. The finish is dusted in chocolate.

title: B.R. Cohn 2016 Silver Label Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: An earthy, figgy sur lie character sets this wine apart from the crowd, while a supple texture and good balance make it easy to sip and enjoy. Plenty of cherry and raspberry flavors emerge on the palate, seeming to fill the mouth and then lingering on the finish.

title: Baker Lane 2016 Ramondo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy and floral with an inviting nose of cherry and tangerine, this is a deft, lithe, focused and fresh wine with a lasting thread of tangy acidity. It is delicious in its understated elegance and delicate fruit.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2015 E2 10th Anniversary Kimsey Vineyard Syrah-Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Loads of earthy aromas of thyme, cracked pepper, rosemary, lavender and loamy soil add intrigue to the dark elderberry core of this blend of 60% Syrah and 40% Grenache. That array of savory herbs also decorates the black-plum flavors of the palate, which is bolstered by pepper spice and tea leaves.

title: Carlisle 2016 Compagni Portis White (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a field blend of Gewürztraminer, Trousseau Gris, Riesling and other mixed whites that invites in its perfumed aromas of green apple and lychee. With a grainy texture and lifted acidity, it refreshes in a lingering taste of lime zest with an oomph of body.

title: Cinnabar 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Smashed red currants, rose petals, roasting pork and baking spice make for a very inviting nose on this appellation blend. There is great tension and freshness to the palate, where cranberry, raspberry and pomegranate flavors meet with rosewater for a lively experience.

title: Della 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Strong flavors of lemon, lime and salty oak permeate the opening of this dense concentrated wine, which retains moderate acidity and freshness. The brightness comes from a lingering sensation of wet stone and citrus that intrigues.

title: Folded Hills 2015 Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: A rusty red color in the glass, this light but layered bottling shows dried cherry, pomegranate, carnation, hibiscus, cinnamon and vanilla-dusted toast on the nose. There is a strong grip to the palate, where flavors center on rose petal and Montmorency cherry, proving quite firm and yet delicate.

title: Halter Ranch 2016 CDP Estate Bottled Grenache-Syrah-Mourvèdre-Tannat Red (Adelaida District)
description: From a large estate located in the western foothills of Paso Robles, this blend of 75% Grenache, 10% Syrah, 8% Mourvèdre and 7% Tannat shows dark mulberry, plum, elderflower and sandalwood on the nose. It's rich on the palate, with black plum, dried purple flowers and more elderflower touches.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2017 Chukker Cabernet Franc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This bottling has been a lighter, chillable red long before those wines came into vogue, and it's still a leading option. Aromas of smashed raspberries and white pepper drop into an energetic sip, where fresh cranberries, carnations and a zippy acidity reign.

title: Sanguis 2015 Sprezzatura No. 5 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A dark shade of rusty pink, this bottling shows red cherry, wet stone, muddy loam and baking spice on the unique and dynamic nose. Cherries shine on the sip as do clove, fennel and baked good flavors. Rather complex for a pink wine.

title: Seagrape 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright lemon and orange rind aromas meet with sea salt, nectarine and a yellow grapefruit pith on the nose of this bottling by Karen Steinwachs. Tightly wound on the palate, this single-vineyard expression shows fresh and lively flavors of citrus pith, yogurt and Brie rind. Could use a bit more time in bottle to fully shine.

title: Briceland 2014 Alderpoint Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: Firm acidity and a sour cherry flavor make this medium-bodied wine very palate-cleansing. It emphasizes liveliness and a light tannic grip over pure fruitiness, but it still delivers complex and attractive cherry and rhubarb flavors.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Predator Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Dried blueberries and plums, leather, tobacco, tar and baked goods show on the nose of this bottling, which is enhanced by 15% Petite Sirah and 10% Monastrell. The palate also shows a somewhat dried character of blueberry and Concord grape, with a touch of tar, framed by decent structure and fine acidity.

title: Imagery 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This California appellation Pinot is a debut from Imagery. A natural at the dinner table, this shows a firm structure of fine tannins, bright acidity and ripe black cherry and tea flavors that round out the structure. Good concentration meets a medium body as it gets more complex with each sip.

title: Webster Cellars 2013 Right Bank Red (Napa Valley)
description: A proprietary blend of 40% Merlot, 25% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 15% Cabernet Franc, this wine is juicy in cassis and red currant with a quiet embrace of toasted oak. Seamless in structure and tannin, it finishes with focus.

title: Renwood 2014 Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Big but balanced, this wine from one of Amador's higher elevation districts. It has a nice deep color, spicy sweet oak aromatics and generous juicy fruit flavors backed by moderate tannins and full body.

title: Scheid 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Sugar-cured grapefruit rinds, sour Granny Smith apple slices and wet concrete show on the nose of this bottling from one of the larger growers in Monterey. Green apple skins mix with guava, passion fruit and green grass flavors on the palate, which is lifted by white pepper.

title: Hawley 2013 Hawley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 13% Merlot and 12% Cabernet Franc, all the grapes organically grown, this red is hugely concentrated in flavors of chocolate and graham cracker. Red currant comes to the fore of a grippy chewy texture of tight-grained tannin.

title: Birichino 2015 Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)
description: Extremely light in the glass, this bottling explodes with orange blossom, lemon oil and beeswax on the nose. It's very dry and tight on the palate, where jasmine and apple blossoms dominate.

title: Birichino 2016 Pétulant Naturel Malvasia Bianca (Monterey)
description: Cloudy in the glass, Pétulant is redolent with yellow grapefruit aromas, as well as some cut pear. The foam is very aggressive upon sipping, with lots of creamy qualities that are soft rather than sharp. Flavors of sour grapefruit and lemon rind are fun rather than funky.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of white peach and nectarine are lifted with hints of Key lime zest on the pleasant nose of this bottling. There is impressive zip to the well-structured and grippy sip, where fresh citrus juice keeps the tropical passion fruit and guava flavors in check.

title: Ty Caton 2014 Tytanium Caton Vineyard Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This multi-variety blend is made largely of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah, with smaller amounts of Syrah, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Merlot. Boldly ripe, dry and tannic, its dense flavors are wrapped up in black currant, tree bark and cinnamon.

title: Webster Cellars 2013 Left Bank Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot, 15% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Heavy on the palate, it has elements of black cherry, black licorice and sage that ride a velvety texture of rounded richness.

title: Dracaena 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Plenty of pepper and dark red cherry aromas meet with crushed asphalt, beef char and a touch of tar on the nose of this bottling. There is decent energy to the sip, where roasted black cherry, pepper-crusted beef and hints of rosewater and oregano make for a very quaffable wine, perfect for backyard barbecues.

title: Kokomo 2015 Timber Crest Vineyard Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Juicy red fruit is powerfully wound around a core of toasted oak and blueberry cobbler richness in this vineyard-designate, which finishes ripe and round.

title: Muscardini 2014 Unti Vineyard Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the well-known vineyard in the appellation, this is made entirely from the variety, and it has a texture and flavor of fruit leather, plum and dried cherry, as well as an herbal earthy note of tomato leaf. The tannins are a tad harsh, but mellow in the glass.

title: Pali 2015 Highlands Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fairly showy white flower aromas meet with melted butter, lemon rind candy and match smoke on the nose of this appellation blend. There are a good amount of smoky oak and roasted marshmallow flavors to the sip, but they are cut deftly by fresh citrusy acidity.

title: Pomar Junction 2016 Viognier (El Pomar District)
description: Fairly reserved on the nose, this bottling offers Condrieu-esque aromas of honeydew candy and creamy tropical fruits without going overripe. There's a citrusy, Key lime freshness at the tip of the sip, and then come more plush flavors of nectarine in the midpalate, finishing with a creamy texture.

title: La Honda Winery 2015 Salinian Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Heavy cedar and incense aromas meet with blackberry and dark chocolate on the nose of this block-designated Cab. The palate is dominated by savory wood flavors of charred oak along with bay leaf, oregano, cocoa dust, black olive and a red-fruit core.

title: Bogle 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: Another great value from Bogle, this wine is very polished and smooth. Blackberry and blueberry flavors abound on the full-bodied palate, with fine-grained tannins. There are no rough edges, just wonderful fruitiness and light salt-and-pepper spices.

title: Bravante 2012 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Bright succulent waves of red cherry, blackberry and plum play along a continuum of full-bodied style and substantial weight in this mountain-grown wine that offers plenty of complex flavors.

title: Carlisle 2015 Papera Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site planted in 1934, and blended with 4% Carignan, this is an earthy pungent wine that is concentrated and approachable. Tobacco, dark cherry and dried herb mingle well along a velvety smooth palate of full-bodied ripeness.

title: Carpe Diem 2015 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This appealing and medium-bodied wine has a light earthy, buttery aroma and plenty of butter, lemon and vanilla flavors underpinned by good, lively acidity that keeps it fresh through the finish.

title: FEL 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a delicious, no-nonsense wine that features pure fruit flavors, little obvious oak influence, good zingy acidity and excellent balance. Its strength is a slight sense of reserve that is refreshing and mouthwatering.

title: 13th & Third 2015 NMR Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dried herbs, dark red strawberry and cherry and dried rose petals show on the nose of this blend of 48% Grenache, 27% Mourvèdre and 25% Syrah. The texture is chalky and the acid is solid, carrying flavors of rounded red fruit and well-integrated herbs.

title: Allen Estate Wines 2014 Audacieux Stanford Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft in texture, this wine features rounded, dry tannins and showy wood, revealing its 24 months in new French oak. Graphite, cedar and red currant give it herbal earthiness and a brightness of tangy fruit.

title: Armida 2015 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Floral like a rose garden, this wine appears deeply extracted and dark in color, its style intensely full-bodied. Black cherry, rhubarb, blueberry and dark-chocolate flavors make for a taste experience that's both tart and richly concentrated.

title: Marimar Estate 2016 Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled Chardonnay-Albariño (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral in aromatics—think lemongrass and jasmine—this estate-grown wine is creamy yet light in feel. The palate brings distinct flavors of crisp green apple, apricot, lime and wet stone.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled

title: Medlock Ames 2015 Heritage Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine has a fruity entry of dark cherry and plum: flavors that are dusted in a lightness of cinnamon spice. Well put together, it's soft and round on the palate with a full-bodied ripeness that minds its manners and plays well with its more elegant intentions.

title: Noceto 2011 AX1 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: A spicy cedary minerally aroma leads to bright raspberry and cranberry flavors in this medium-bodied, complex and appetizing wine. It has good acidity and fine-grained tannins to help the grip, and pleasant light flavors that will be great at the table.

title: Peachy Canyon 2015 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Plum jelly, sarsaparilla and cola aromas show on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is great freshness and liveliness to the palate, where white pepper spices up the grenadine flavors.

title: Piña 2014 Ames Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Dusty concentration and big oak offer a lasting impression of power and body in this wine, followed by a depth of rich red cherry and cassis, a sprinkling of dried herb lingering on the finish.

title: Red Car 2014 Platt Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light in color and made to be acid-driven and fresh, this wine succeeds with a slightly carbonic expression of stemmy earthiness and intrigue. Strawberry-jam aromas are followed by a layering of citrus that persists through an understated finish.

title: St. Francis 2014 Lagomarsino Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a smooth, round and likable wine, richly interwoven in baked cherry, cassis and cinnamon bark that's somewhat smoky in a good way on the lengthy finish.

title: Stolpman 2017 Love You Bunches Carbonic Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)
description: Released each year around Valentine's Day, this carbonic experiment was an immediate hit. Served with a chill and very light in the glass, it shows primary aromas of strawberry, cola and rosewater. The playful palate is zippy with acid and dances across the tongue with flavors of tart red fruit. A great sunny day wine, but buy multiple bottles because they go fast.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 bCS Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bountiful dark red-fruit aromas meet with cocoa and herbs on the nose of this bottling, which leans toward slightly stewed fruit. The palate is framed by chalky tannins and lively acidity, carrying lavish fruit flavors and making for a very tasty if straightforward sip.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 PS Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and fresh black currant aromas meet with dried fennel on the nose of this bottling by a winery based in Los Angeles. A penetrating acidity kicks off the sip, where solid tannins carry dark fruit and rosemary flower flavors.

title: The Calling 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is lovely and expressive in stony mineral, lemon rind, apple, quince and bread. It's medium-bodied, with a pleasant lushness that unfolds on the midpalate.

title: Vie Winery 2013 L'Imaginaire Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black-plum sauce, star anise, concentrated rose and strawberry-jam aromas make for a luxurious and inviting, if a bit powerful, nose on this bottling. Strawberry paste, white pepper and a gravelly minerality show on the sip.

title: The Debate 2014 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal, 100% barrel-fermented wine, given nearly two years in French oak, 70% of it new, this shows off the St. Helena site well, in its tight-grained intensity and smooth sizable tannins. Dried herb, lavender, black licorice and dark cherry coulis complement each other well, providing complexity and balance against the full-bodied concentration. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Ryan Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: This extraordinary wine sets a high standard for California's Humboldt County. An intriguing tension between ripeness and tartness gives this wine great balance, while red and black cherries, rhubarb and subtle oak spices provide plenty of complexity. The wine is medium bodied, has firm tannins to stiffen the mouthfeel just enough and is quite concentrated without being heavy.

title: Rochioli 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From six blocks of the storied estate, this stunning wine is made cuvée-like, blending the best of the best. Rich and full bodied yet mindful of graceful complexity, it features layers of lush, focused red fruit, clove and a touch of white pepper. This is a beautiful showcase of the appellation and the diverse, historic site.

title: Sunshine Valley Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy, grainy and decisively herbal, this wine integrates its wealth of tannin and oak well, allowing for a soft palate of rich round cassis and forest pine. Exotic, it intrigues in its mix of refinement and robust power, allowing air for the acidity to breathe. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Massican 2017 Hyde Vineyards Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Spicy lemongrass, ginger and high-toned acidity immediately invite one in to this vineyard-designated white, a study in grainy texture and a light touch of oak. Green apple and lemon-drop flavors tease the palate effortlessly, evolving constantly in the glass.

title: Migration 2016 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Focused and fresh, this lovely white from the coastal site is enticing on the midpalate in flavors of olive and fig, with a lingering thread of honey and Gravenstein apple. It holds its ripeness in check, finding balance and elegance within a fleshy core of fruit.

title: Oakville East 2014 Exposure Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Silky tannins complement a wealth of structured, luscious cherry and cassis in this wine, blended with nearly 13% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. Amidst an undercurrent of toasted oak and vanilla are length and complexity for days. This is drinking nicely now but should do well with cellaring; enjoy 2024–2030.

title: Roar 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This appellation blend is a wonderful look into the stunning wines being made by the Franscioni family. Beautiful aromas of candied black cherry and black raspberry are wrapped in bay leaf, violet, lavender and forest floor. The palate is rich and soft yet with powerful acidity, carrying lavish flavors of baked fruit, strong florality and tarragon spice.

title: The Debate 2014 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Black licorice, ripe red cherry and dustings of graphite and clove contribute to this mighty, 100% varietal wine from the famous site. Concentrated power gives way to a streak of crushed rock minerality and hints of tobacco and cacao. Enjoy best 2024–2029.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2016 The Other One Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: A tad shy on the nose at first, this bottling from Glenrose Vineyard offers aromas of dark plum, smashed elderberry and elegant purple flowers. The palate combines smashed black plum and black raspberry with dark chocolate, bay leaf and dried chaparral herbs, making for a really wild and layered experience.

title: Byron Blatty 2014 Contingent Syrah-Cabernet Franc (Los Angeles County)
description: This is one of the most impressive wines to emerge from Los Angeles County, starting with pungent aromas of black plum, boysenberry, thyme, tarragon and bay leaf. It's lavish and layered on the rich palate, offering black cherry and crushed slate as well as penetrating acidity and chalky tannins.

title: Clos de la Tech 2004 Domaine Valeta Sunny Slope Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This nearly 15-year-old bottling is the most interesting of the winery's latest library release series. Wet earth, spearmint, dried strawberry, mulberry and shaved dark chocolate make for a dynamic nose. The palate is framed by firm tannins that are smoothing out to reveal flavors of chocolate-covered cranberry and dried mint.

title: Goldeneye 2015 Ten Degrees Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Lush, ripe fruit and a broad, posh mouthfeel make this wine almost irresistible. It has abundant black cherry and blackberry flavors, hints of wood smoke and cedar, plus moderate tannins and good acidity to hold it all together.

title: Koehler 2015 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rather light in color, this bottling shows candied-cherry, alpine strawberry, sumac, rose-petal and baking-spice aromas on the fresh nose. The palate offers red plum, star anise and allspice flavors, proving pleasantly light, refreshing and extremely layered.

title: Laurel Glen 2014 Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Earthy in forest, pine and mushroom, this wine is slightly reduced and youthfully concentrated. Lively acidity supports a strong tannic structure, with a sturdy toasted oak flavor matched by a mix of black and red currant. It shows potential for aging. Enjoy from 2024–2029.

title: Lynmar 2016 Adam's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a voluptuous, fully formed and fleshy wine, tangy in rich rounded red fruit, a mix of wild strawberry and cassis. With streaks of earthy crushed rock and cardamom, the complex layering of fruit and spice is lifted by buoyant background acidity.

title: Paradigm 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Smooth, youthful and concentrated, this wine offers earthy graphite and tobacco around a midpalate of well-developed, lively acidity and fresh black fruit. Tenacious in oak and tannin, it needs time to develop further; enjoy 2024–2029.

title: El Lugar 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There is a gamy, roasted pork element to the nose of this rich savory bottling by San Luis Obispo-raised Coby Parker-Garcia, yet there is a fascinating touch of brooding black currant fruit as well, unusual for a Pinot Noir. The palate starts softly and then tightens around laser-sharp acidity and grippy tannins, delivering red-fruit and cinnamon flavors.

title: Larkmead 2015 Firebelle Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 71% Merlot with 21% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Petit Verdot. Earthy, it evokes wild truffle and fresh compost, with highlighted flavors of dark plum and cherry. Its soft silky texture is inviting and a complement to the gritty backbone of tannins, which though in check, are plenty powerful.

title: Schramsberg 2009 J. Schram Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Quite complex and subtly spicy, this elegant wine gives a full array of flavors, a crisp but polished texture and a wonderful lingering finish. It has a light-copper-gold color, aromas like ginger cookies and freshly baked bread and flavors of peaches and delicate rose petals accented by light baking spices.

title: Vokel 2016 SHV Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, concentrated and strongly built with tannins, this wine is made in a big full-bodied style. It has a generous helping of blue fruit that is lightly spiced in nutmeg and cola.

title: Clos LaChance 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Freshly pressed blackberry aromas are paired with hints of violet and herbs on the easy and likable nose of this bottling. It's quite dry and framed by firm tannins on the palate, so those floral and fruit tones have a tough time breaking through that tight structure.

title: Complicated 2015 Red (Central Coast)
description: Light and fresh, dark strawberries meet with wet gravel and dried earth on the nose of this red blend. There is a subtle elegance to the palate, where spice overtakes the dark plum fruit and lilac flowers.

title: Parducci 2016 True Grit Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied wine is a bit subdued in character. It offers moderately ripe black-fruit flavors and a lightly tannic texture that makes it extra appetizing.

title: Tobias 2016 Blue Oaks Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Tantalizing baking-spice aromas and ripe fruit flavors that stop just short of sweet make this wine an attention getter. From the vanilla, lemon and nutmeg aromas to buttery, creamy apple and pear flavors, it has plenty to like.

title: Cinnabar 2014 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: It's hard to argue with the quality and likability of this wine, a grippy, tight and structured showing of dusty mocha and leather. But the ripeness is quite something, an elephant in the bottle that takes over on the palate and should be considered before enjoying.

title: Dante Robere 2015 Roberitage Cabernet-Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: This 50-50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Syrah brings concentrated fruit flavors to fill out a good firm texture that will be quite appetizing with a meal. It has plenty of black-cherry and blackberry notes plus light baking spices for complexity.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Hill Springs Chardonnay (San Diego County)
description: A strong floral kick of gardenia and lily aromas mesh with Asian pear flesh and lime juice on the nose of this bottling. There is a rounded ripeness to the palate that is very approachable, offering red-pear and lime-skin flavors.

title: Mauritson 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From an estate vineyard and aged in both stainless steel and foudre, this wine has strong elements of peach and lychee, with underlying floral components of white flower and jasmine. Medium bodied and balanced, it's fresh and fruity.

title: Riley's Rows 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine delivers plenty of bang for the bucks, combining 25% Merlot to the mix, which adds undeniable softness and approachability. Tart and sinewy, it's complex in leather and tobacco, offering plenty of ripe red fruit along the way.

title: Siduri 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This appellation blend is a straightforward take on Pinot Noir that's perfect for midweek enjoyment, starting with aromas of black cherry and cola. The mouthfeel is full and the palate is loaded with ripe flavors of bursting berries as well as baking spice.

title: Upshot 2016 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a fun, easygoing blend of 37% Zinfandel with 30% Malbec, 27% Merlot and 3% each of Petit Verdot and Riesling, the latter added to freshen the bigger bolder profile of the reds. An oaky entry gives way to a smooth, supple midpalate of red plum, dark cherry and rounded tannin.

title: Art of the Cooper 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Broad peach, guava jelly and ripe apple aromas meet with botanical touches of gardenia and jasmine on the nose of this bottling. Crisp apple and edgy lime flavors show on the sip, which is pleasant but doesn't demonstrate as much barrel influence as the brand's name implies.

title: Au Contraire 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Big boned and fruit forward, this is a sizable wine in style and weight, with waves of cherry and strawberry greeting the palate. It shows its coastal provenance in its savory seasonings of clove, black tea and sage.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Fumé Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This remains one of the best wine values on the planet: a Loire-style, stainless-steel fermented beauty that the winery has been making for 46 years. Guava, peach and apricot surround buzzy acidity in a crowd-pleasing quaff of undeniable quality and freshness.

title: Emerald Hare 2016 Red (Mendocino)
description: This is an elegant, dry wine with great balance, a sleek texture and plenty of black-cherry and dark plum flavors. Equal parts Zinfandel and Merlot plus a dash of Cabernet Sauvignon form the blend. Good acidity and moderate tannins give it some nice heft on the palate and there is little oak influence to take away from its fruit focus.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2014 Cold Fusion Red (South Coast)
description: This blend of Grenache, Syrah and Petite Sirah starts with tart red-currant aromas mixed with marjoram, oregano, light licorice and soil. The lighter-bodied palate is strongly herbal and minty.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: Sonoma County provides the majority of the fruit for this multi-appellation red, a bold, richly layered wine with grippy, gritty texture. Full-bodied boysenberry flavor upholds seasonings of licorice and cardamom, remaining velvety on the finish.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Thérèse Vineyards Victoria Denice Vineyard Carignane (Santa Clara Valley)
description: The wood-spice aromas are prominent on this bottling, starting with cigar box on the nose, alongside black-plum fruit. The palate also shows a lot of cedar as well as dark-plum and clove flavors.

title: Monte Volpe 2014 Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: Winemaker Greg Graziano put a smooth polish on this medium- to full-bodied wine, adding light oak-spice notes to good, ripe red- and black-cherry and black-olive flavors. A smooth, mouth-filling texture makes it soothing to sip.

title: Seagrape 2017 Buttonwood Farm Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Los Olivos District)
description: Soft and very restrained aromas of melon, bubblegum, cotton candy and chalk show on this bottling by Karen Steinwachs. The rounded and mellow palate offers watermelon and more bubblegum flavors, proving very pleasant and excellent for a hot day.

title: Swank n Smith 2014 Laureate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This robustly ripe red contains 7% Zinfandel in addition to 4% each of Merlot and Petit Verdot. Dusty in tobacco, it invites aromatically in violet before unleashing a fury of smooth rich blueberry and blackberry flavor.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Bold Move Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Don Lorenzi came up with this kitchen sink blend of seven varieties after contemplating his dump bucket one day, and the result is compelling. Aromas of earth, black cherry, crushed slate and dried cranberry lead into a tense palate of dried red fruits and licorice spice.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Old Vines Merlot (San Francisco Bay)
description: This old-vine bottling is soft and ripe on the nose with blueberry and black-currant aromas proving delicate but inviting. The palate deftly balances acid and tannins, with more currant flavors as well as turned earth and dried herbs.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Camelot Highlands Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of Gravenstein apple, marmalade on warm toast and fine-grained oak show on the nose of this bottling. It's clean and very classic on the palate, offering roasted apple, crushed nut, lemon rind and seared orange flavors.

title: Kitá 2015 Camp 4 Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fresh-pressed blackberry-juice aromas meet with herbal elements of dried sage and sweet mint on the nose of this bottling. A dried herb quality carries the palate through its black-currant and boysenberry core, with more minty freshness and fennel bulb toward the finish.

title: Amador Cellars 2014 Aglianico (Amador County)
description: This grape variety is unusual in California, but it makes a good impression with aromas of roses, very ripe black cherries and cloves followed by ripe late-picked fruit flavors and a firm texture. It is full bodied but well balanced by good acidity to keep it from feeling heavy.

title: Belden Barns 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Tightly wound, dense and savory, this mountain wine shows hints of violet and lavender before unfurling full-bodied flavors of tar, leather, tobacco and cured meat.

title: Bliss 2016 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This is a ripe and relaxed wine that smells and tastes like red cherries and stewed cherries, has a broad mouthfilling texture and light tannins for a bit of grip. It's easy to drink and should be a crowd-pleaser.

title: Bonterra 2017 Organic Grapes Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: Light, lean and charming, this delicate wine has an airy aroma that hints at cherries, a brisk mouthfeel and very light, nicely tangy raspberry flavors.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Otelia's Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Reduced on the nose, this offers a nutty, earthy introduction into big oak and tangy tannin. Relatively light in style in terms of fruit, there's a hint of huckleberry that's juicy on the palate, followed by vanilla and nutmeg spice.

title: Calerrain 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Reserved aromas of lemon cream, lime blossoms, a hint of white lily and a pinch of crushed chalk show on the clean nose of this bottling. Blanched almonds and cashew cream bring nutty flavors to the palate, which is cut by racy lime zest.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Family Reserve Generations Red (Napa Valley)
description: This wine leads with 84% Cabernet Sauvignon, blending in 9% Petit Verdot, 4% Merlot and 3% Malbec. Red currant and baked cherry flavors ride along a thick, richly concentrated midpalate that finishes robustly juicy and rustic.

title: Cline 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
description: Waxy peach and apple soften a medium-bodied build and managed acidity in this estate white, which is aromatic in honey and flowers. Juicy throughout, it finishes in mango and melon.

title: De Loach 2016 Heritage Reserve Pinot Noir (California)
description: Pure fresh fruit flavors shine through this uncomplicated, affordable and very enjoyable wine from a Pinot Noir specialist. It is medium bodied, not perceptibly oak, and has good fruit acidity.

title: Dime 2016 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 70% Cabernet Sauvignon and 30% Merlot shows fruity but focused aromas of boysenberry and black pepper on the nose. Rounded and ripe flavors of black-plum jelly and sugar plums show on the juicy palate.

title: Kenwood 2013 Artist Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Adorned in label art by San Francisco-based artist Clare E. Rojas, this robust wine tastes of black licorice and fennel, moderately structured within walls of rich, concentrated baked plum and cherry.

title: Kenwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is a bright, fresh and layered white at a spectacular price that offers just enough heft and body weight to keep it lively and deliciously pair-worthy with a range of foods.

title: Murphy-Goode 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine bridges the gap between mass-market wines that are soft and sweet, and more serious dry ones that have better structure and more powerful fruit. It is nicely fruity but dry, has generous aromas and flavors supported by light tannins and good acidity.

title: Niner 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Raspberry, poached strawberry and wet slate show on the nose of this pink bottling. The structure is so tight that it's almost sticky, grabbing the palate with candied-raspberry flavors.

title: Écluse 2015 Rendition Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of black currant, packed purple flowers and tarry asphalt show on the nose of this blend of 46% Syrah, 38% Grenache, 8% Mourvèdre and 8% Petite Sirah. It's rather thick on the palate, where tangy black-plum skins meet with baking spice flavors.

title: Europa Village 2015 C'est La Vie Counoise (Temecula Valley)
description: Elegant aromas of black plum, elderberry, dried flowers and pepper show on the nose of this bottling of a relatively uncommon Rhône Valley grape. Dried anise, pepper and roasted plum show on the rustic palate.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Jackal Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Plump and bursting aromas of boysenberry and black currant make for a very fresh if rather fruity entry to the nose of this bottling. It's relatively lightweight on the palate, with fresh strawberries, lilac and violets flavors, framed by delicate tannins and decent acid.

title: Hailstone Vineyards 2013 Impact Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This blends in small amounts of Syrah, Merlot and Cabernet Franc from several appellations within the valley, aging the whole in French oak for 22 months. Tasting of blackberry and blueberry pie, it's juicy and grippy with a smooth mocha-dusted finish.

title: Kirkland Signature 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This offers a mix of delicately wrapped red cherry, pomegranate and currant that meet an herbal spray of mint and laurel. The lightness of the tannins covers a full-bodied richness beneath.

title: Koehler 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A darker shade of pretty pink, this bottling offers aromas of roasted plum, wet cement and lemon balm. It's fairly juicy on the sip, where berry and cherry flavors are clean and set against a chalky texture.

title: Cline 2016 Estate Grown Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: Velvety and grippy on the palate, this is a well-made, fairly priced red that tastes of smoky earth, leather and cured meat. A touch of reduction highlights a tannic backbone of power and intensity.

title: Europa Village 2015 C'est La Vie Cinsault (Temecula Valley)
description: Light red-fruit and carnation aromas meet with a savory touch on the nose of this bottling that features a grape rarely used alone. Sandalwood, myrrh, eucalyptus oil and cannabis flavors spice up the tangy red-fruit flavors of the palate.

title: Millésimé 2013 Lumiere Du Fleur Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Slightly reductive on the nose, this blend of 58% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Franc and 14% Cabernet Sauvignon offers aromas of roasted coffee and beef, tar and charred wood. That woody character extends deep into the palate, which also shows roasted berries and espresso bean.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Due Rossi Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: Tight blackberry, dried purple flowers and baked earth aromas show on the nose of this Sangiovese that includes 25% Merlot. Somewhat tangy black-plum and violet flavors show on the palate.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 G-S-M (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend of 40% Grenache, 40% Mourvèdre and 20% Syrah is jam-packed with floral aromas of wisteria, hibiscus and jasmine, and also shows hints of licorice and ripe fruit on the heavy nose. Rich flavors of black-plum pudding and North African spice appear on the palate, which is tasty albeit extremely powerful.

title: Pulchella 2016 The Fallen G-S-M (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Candied-red-currant and strawberry aromas meet with rose, carnation and lavender on the nose of this blend of 51% Grenache, 28% Syrah and 21% Mourvèdre from Pipestone Vineyard. Balsamic-laced berries meet with savory touches of pepper and herbs on the palate, finishing with crème brûlée.

title: Riley's Rows 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This wine has juicy apple, lemon and lime flavors with a touch of tangerine-laden acidity that helps keep the balance in check. Moderately structured, it's an enjoyable wine with texture and length.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Smoky oak and chewy tannin provide a stiff backbone to this rich dark-fruited wine, made to be enjoyed in its youth. Tobacco, black pepper and turned earth add complexity to a rounded midpalate of lush black cherry and plum.

title: San Simeon 2017 Estate Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Hibiscus, carnations and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a strong fruit-punch character, with layers of fennel pollen adding complexity.

title: Zaca Mesa 2014 Z Cuvée Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cola, black raspberries, lilacs and a hint of tar show on the nose of this blend of 45% Grenache, 44% Mourvèdre, 9% Cinsaut and 2% Syrah. Dense flavors of red and purple fruit lead into chipped asphalt and gravel on the palate.

title: Ballard Lane 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: A broad pear aroma meets with lemon blossom, chalk and a steely minerality on the nose of this fairly priced bottling. There's a flash of ripe apple on the tip of the palate, then it fades into zesty melon rind. The acid is also strong in front, but flatter by the end.

title: Blair Estate 2014 Delfina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Rusty aromas of wet dirt, cherry syrup and pomegranate reduction sauce show on the nose of this bottling. The red-cherry flavors of the palate enjoy an herbal enhancement of oregano and pepper, but there's also orange rind and smoke to complete the experience.

title: GrapeHeart Vineyards 2013 The Thrill Cabernet Sauvignon (Suisun Valley)
description: Sunbaked fruit aromas and very ripe flavors saturate this full-bodied wine. Intense dried plum and raisin notes shade black cherry and chocolate while mild tannins firm up the palate.

title: Ancient Peaks 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows strong amounts of guava and tuberose on the nose, but also touches of chalk and citrus pith. There is racy acidity on the palate, where loads of bubblegum and lily flavors are quite powerful.

title: Portalupi 2016 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a nicely dry, flavorful and firm-textured wine with a good layer of tannin for structure and moderately ripe berry and black-cherry flavors. The balance and mouthfeel are tailored for the table: this is not a cocktail or dessert wine as many seem to be.

title: Shroud Mountain 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine is charming, fruity and lightly oaky. It has more than the usual dose of cherry and berry flavors, medium body, a firm enough mouthfeel and clean fruity finish.

title: Wilson Creek 2015 Distinction Vineyard Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)
description: Candied black fruit and pungent potpourri aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Southern California. The palate offers pleasing floral flavors as well as black plum and mulberry, framed by solid acid that cuts into the finish. It's unlike other Petite Sirahs, but interesting enough.

title: Alara 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Ripe red plums, mulberry and baking spice make for a rather rich nose on this reserve appellation blend. The palate is fleshy and full with loads of red plum, strawberry, cinnamon and dried herb flavors, finishing with a flash of light vanilla.

title: Alara 2016 Sangiovese (San Benito County)
description: Dark strawberry, gingerbread spice, toast and gravel show on the nose of this relatively light bottling. Rounded and ripe plum and boysenberry flavors are lifted by cinnamon spice on the palate.

title: Balletto 2016 Cider Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy in white pepper and black tea, this is an effusive, intriguing and fruit-shy wine that's strong in tannin and power.

title: Bianchi 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean aromas of pear flesh, citrus skins and creamy white fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Broad flavors of poached pome fruit are cut by tangy grapefruit elements, proving quite complex for an often simple grape.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Zinfandel Rosé (Amador County)
description: This wine tastes mellow and feels smooth, bringing white peach and light raspberry flavors to the palate. It has medium to full body and a pleasantly rich mouthfeel.

title: Margerum 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Bright and chalky aromas of orange blossoms and lemon-lime soda are nearly effervescent on the nose of this bottling from Kick-On Ranch. There is solid tension to the sip, where slightly sweet apple, peach and candied-lemon flavors ride buoyant acidity.

title: Peltier 2017 Estate Grown Vermentino (Lodi)
description: Herb, chalk and white-pepper notes make this light- to medium-bodied wine unusual and interesting to taste. It shows that Lodi has a hipster side. There is a lean texture, a little nip of mineral flavor and a nice touch of bitterness on the palate.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2016 Barrack Family Estate Blanc White (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Sémillon in California is an interesting play that's still finding its footing. This blend of 68% Sémillon and 32% Sauvignon Blanc plays to the lighter, rather than to the unctuous side of the grape, with zesty aromas of grass, pear flesh and gardenia on the nose. The palate offers tart green-apple, lime skin and honeysuckle flavors.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Gesture Mourvèdre (Paso Robles)
description: Earthy on the nose, this bottling shows tobacco, cigar box, crusty brioche and purple-flower aromas. Rounded and tart berry fruits meet with pencil shavings and crushed graphite flavors on the palate.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has pleasant red-cherry and sour-cherry aromas, a plush mouthfeel and mellow ripe fruit flavors. Moderate acidity and tannins give it some good heft in the texture.

title: Peju 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a robust, ripe varietal wine blended with 24% Cabernet Sauvignon. Soft and lightly spiced, it imparts rich dense flavors of black cherry, blackberry and plum.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a soft, full-bodied wine made in reasonable quantities, its flavor profile marked by a wealth of caramelized cola flavor and blackberry jam. Dried herb, espresso bean and clove last on the finish.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Cabernet Franc (Oakville)
description: With a strong addition of 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers sizable tannin weight and herbal components of dusty earthy minerality. It is full bodied and tightly woven in black plum, violet and anise.

title: Schug 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Effusively floral, this is a soft, earthy wine sourced from several sites within the appellation. Baked cherry and raspberry elements are accented in mint and turned earth, with a grainy underbelly of texture and acidity.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2017 Anthony & Dominic Dry Rosé (North Coast)
description: This low-alcohol wine has plenty of crisp fruit flavors, good balance between body and acidity, and a fresh, gripping texture. Light raspberry and red cherry tones lend plenty of substance on the palate.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Filigreen Farm The China Block Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Plush and full-flavored, this ripe and fruity wine tastes like black cherries and red-cherry jam, has a smooth, lightly tannic texture and soft acidity.

title: Tantara 2015 Mateo Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Los Olivos District)
description: Very plump berries are cut by underlying aromas of stinging nettle and uncracked peppercorns on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Classic flavors of boysenberry with white pepper dust and dried herbs show on the palate, where acid cuts into a thicker mouthfeel.

title: Ruby Cellars 2014 Syrah-Petite Sirah (Central Coast)
description: Fairly thick on the nose, this blend of Syrah and Petite Sirah shows black currant, fudge, caramel and licorice on the nose. It's also concentrated on the rich, ripe and heavy palate, but the hoisin sauce and black-currant-paste flavors are enlivened by fresh acidity and vanilla spice.

title: Sans Wine Co 2017 Soda Pop Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is more than likely the first vineyard-designate of this variety that's been put in a can—the size of the can the equivalent of half a standard glass bottle. It works in the way a white or lighter style red would, laying low on the tannin and oak (there's actually zero oak, the wine fermented and aged in stainless steel) and preferring to effuse a fruity essence that refreshes.

title: Tanner 2015 Petite Sirah (Calaveras County)
description: Black cherry and dried plum aromas and flavors give this deeply colored wine more lively, juicy fruit flavors than usual for the varietal. Aged for 17 months in previously used French barrels It has firm tannins, good acidity and medium to full body.

title: The Crusher 2016 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This a big and proudly oaky wine that's aromatic, full flavored and concentrated. It shows scents of cedar, clove and cinnamon, with blackberry and maple syrup on the palate. The texture is velvety and smooth.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Black Sears Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Peppery, meaty and herbal, this wine is well rounded and concentrated in structure, with a lasting note of sandalwood and cedar.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Estate Grown Sangiovese Rosé (Lodi)
description: This vivid, seductive wine has a bright pink color, exotic floral and plummy aromas and opulent fruit flavors that are concentrated and layered. It's light bodied, well balanced and delicious.

title: Baldacci 2016 Frederich Dry Gewürztraminer (Carneros)
description: Creamy and lush in peach and swirls of vanilla, this is a textured and expansive example of the variety, floral and indeed dry, made in a full-bodied, more explosive style.

title: Barber 2017 Rougissant Keller Vineyard Pinot Gris (Petaluma Gap)
description: Interestingly floral and high in acidity, this white was given three hours of skin contact after the grapes were crushed, the wine then fermented and aged in stainless steel. Wet stone minerality and floral earthiness abound around sizzling freshness and peachy flavor.

title: Black Stallion 2014 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Leather and tobacco tones add to the savory, grippy aspect of this boldly ripe, rich wine. Concentrated in blueberry and blackberry flavors, the palate is supple and succulent, leading to a finish of brown sugar and clove.

title: Broadside 2016 Wild Ferment Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Light and fresh aromas of lilies, kiwi and mandarin orange show on the nose of this bottling, which is reminiscent of a dewy spring morning. On the palate, the body is also lightweight and refreshing, with rounded apple and Asian pear flavors.

title: Brutocao 2013 Estate Bottled Bliss Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This is a well-balanced, well-structured wine that will be great to have on hand for almost any occasion. It is attractively dry, medium bodied, has hints of oak spice in the aromas, is full of red-cherry and blackberry flavors and has a lightly tannic texture.

title: Carlisle 2016 Papa's Block Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Peppery and thick in cured meat, game and smoked oak, this has violet undertones and a powerful grasp of brambly blackberry and blueberry. The tannins are well managed and supportive, showing ability to age with grace. Enjoy best 2025–2028.

title: Carol Shelton 2015 Florence Vineyard Rocky Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: An intensely broad-shouldered red blended with 13% Petite Sirah, this has plenty of power within a full-flavored array of brambly blackberry, cherry and dusty cinnamon. The oak (a blend of French and American) is supportive and integrated.

title: Chappellet 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 9% Cabernet Sauvignon, 8% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot, this is a thick and concentrated showing of the variety, plush and lushly spicy in clove and cinnamon. The fruit is plummy and rich in dark cherry, toasted oak and vanilla tea.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Spanish Creek Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Fair Play)
description: Plump and ripe, this fruity exuberant wine was made from vines planted in 1979. It has plenty of vivid raspberry, cherry and raspberry flavors, a lush, almost soft texture and a lingering finish.
designation: Reserve Spanish Creek Vineyard Old Vine

title: Amador Cellars 2014 Martella Vineyards Montepulciano (Fiddletown)
description: This is a very tasty, vivid red wine that sends up chocolate, cherry and berry aromas and equally expressive flavors tinged by an appealing earthy meaty note. While full bodied it is not heavy, due to good acidity that lifts the mouthfeel.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Strawberry-cream flavors give this wine a lush broadness on the palate, with a grippy backbone of tannin and freshness of acidity. It's youthful and shows plenty of promise to unwind further and impart additional structure.

title: Christophe 2015 Explorer's Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Undeniably ripe, this tastes of chocolate mocha and cinnamon Red Hots, with a softness to the structure that will please a wide range of palates.

title: City Winery Chicago 2017 Morgan Station Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine is exceptionally fresh and vibrant in mouthfeel, driven by great acidity and modestly flavored with crisp apple and lemon notes. It is light bodied and lean, in a good way, and seems perfect to pair with shellfish or goat cheese.

title: Clos La Chance 2016 Estate Vineyards Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Fairly light and restrained on the nose, this bottling from a winery founded in 1987 offers pleasant tones of vanilla, red cherry and baked cranberry on the nose. The palate is fresh, with tight red-currant and baking spice flavors that are framed by grippy tannins.

title: Taken Wine Co. 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, 28% Zinfandel, 15% Merlot and 13% Petite Sirah, this delivers soft, generous flavors of graham cracker, plum and blackberry. A framework of dusty tannins is counterbalanced by approachable lushness on the palate.

title: Tenshen 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A slightly orange shade of light pink in the glass, this bottling offers very clean aromas of bubblegum and crushed chalk. There is a strong grip to the palate, where baking soda and citrus rind flavors envelop the light strawberry, watermelon and bubblegum core.

title: Zanoli 2017 Jurassic Park Vineyard Block CW-X1 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is richness as well as briskness on the nose of this bottling, starting with tightly wound aromas of orange cream, citrus rind and cantaloupe. The palate offers chilled apple and tangy lemon-rind flavors, but it's the chalky texture that is most compelling.

title: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Los Carneros)
description: This wine offers lively acidity broadened by flavors of fig, peach and green apple. Stainless-steel fermented, it remains crisp and focused in the glass, finishing in lemongrass, Meyer lemon and a hint of ginger.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: This wine has the slightest hue of pink in the glass, and shows aromas of chalk, tangerine pith and botanical elements on the tightly wound nose. The palate is zippy with acidity, offering both red-apple and citrus flavors.

title: Eric Kent 2017 Cuvée Renee Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Grassy with lengthy acidity, this is a robustly fresh, focused and fruity white, with highlights of kumquat, fig and apricot. The midpalate and finish veer into creamier, buttery flavors that provide a welcome lushness of mouthfeel.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Rio Vista Vineyard 2A Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite rich on the nose, this clonal selection from a vineyard on the eastern edges of the appellation shows licorice, kirsch and tangy sumac aromas. A baked sour cherry flavor shows on the palate alongside red-plum skins and orange rind.

title: Frontier Justice 2015 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: Thick and syrupy in jammy blueberry and plum, this wine offers a generosity of tannin and oak, strong, boldly defined flavor and texture. Around the powerful grip are complex elements of clove, cedar and graphite.

title: Koehler 2017 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light on the nose, this bottling shows honeysuckle, honeydew and ripe pome fruit on the nose. It's crisp, clean and grippy in texture on the palate, offering rounded flavors of pear and gardenia.

title: Baldacci 2015 Elizabeth Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Tannic and highly concentrated, this is a big bold wine full of succulent blackberry and black cherry. The complementary accents are defined in dried herb and a hint of mint.

title: Baldacci 2016 Sorelle Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Entirely barrel-fermented and aged in French oak, half of it new, this is made from estate-grown fruit. Pear, Gravenstein apple and oak flavors are integrated well, with a bite of acidity twisted around the wine's powerful concentration.

title: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Rounded aromas of cantaloupe and daffodil approach a buttery element on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great grip and fresh acidity on the palate, where mango cream, smoke and crushed sandstone flavors arise.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Pistachio Lane Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: An earthy toasty streak and good acidity characterize ths full-bodied and vibrant wine. It shows little or no oak influence but shades the underlying lemon and crisp apple notes with hints of fresh bread and almonds.

title: Felten Cellars 2015 Old Casteel Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Very jammy and hedonistic on the nose, this bottling shows strawberry preserves, framboise and clove. The palate is somewhat light and goes down easy, with flavors of strawberry jam and tannins that firm up toward the finish.

title: Foxen 7200 2015 Los Portreros Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Candied blackberry, loamy earth, licorice, dill and oregano show on the nose of this bottling. It still tastes quite young on the palate, with tight tannins carrying flavors of berry, pepper, soy and an espresso bean finish.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Recon Red (San Diego County)
