description: This blend of 56% Grenache, 28% Syrah and 16% Mourvèdre shows solid potential for this region of San Diego. It's light in color with very fresh and inviting aromas of red berry, red flowers and wet slate. The palate is loaded with chaparral spices such as sage and thyme, which give depth to the tangy black raspberry fruit flavors.

title: Rideau 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Subtle aromas of lemon cream and ripe nectarine slowly arise on the nose of this bottling. The palate is broad and dense, with apple cream, pear syrup and strong lemon elements throughout the sip. The finish is laced with vanilla and caramel.

title: Tenshen 2017 White (Central Coast)
description: Restrained aromas of Asian pear, peach cream and wet stone show on the nose of this white blend. There is lots of zip to the sip but also a ripe richness, carrying flavors of lemon peel and dried apple flesh.

title: Andretti 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is intensely savory and compressed in texture, grainy in tannin and a large presence of toasted oak.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Salacious G-S-M (Paso Robles)
description: An elegant and relatively mellow nose of red cherry, thyme, dried sage and violet arise from this blend of 64% Grenache, 24% Syrah and 12% Mourvèdre. Dark strawberry, dried plum and fruit-cake flavors show on the palate, which finishes with a minty lift.

title: Robert John 2013 RJV Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A 100% varietal wine given 26 months in new French oak, this is a well-integrated richly concentrated showcase for the appellation. It is impressive in cinnamon, black pepper and jammy black cherry and plum.

title: Roblar 2017 Estate Fumé Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Loads of yellow peach, lemon pith and a kiss of wood show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe yet restrained enough, offering nectarine and lemon flavors, set against a tight structure and zesty acid.

title: Rusack 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 75% Bien Nacido Vineyard and 25% Sierra Madre offers sea salt, lemon rind, honeysuckle extract and a hint of blanched almonds on the nose. There is fresh and tightly wound citrus on the tip of the palate, and then it warms up toward almond and orange-cookie flavors.

title: Sans Wine Co 2017 McGill Vineyard Riesling (Rutherford)
description: This stellar wine can from husband-and-wife team Jake Stover and Gina Schober is made from 60-year-old dry-farmed vines found, unexpectedly, in the heart of the famous appellation, known much more nowadays for Cabernet Sauvignon. Stainless steel-aged, it rocks in balanced acidity and stony mineral freshness, as a good can should.

title: Scheid 2015 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fairly light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows a great deal of sagebrush and chaparral spice on the nose, which gives depth to the cranberry and turned-earth aromas. The palate is also very earthy and herbal, with crushed thyme, oregano and dried sage peppering the zesty red fruits.

title: Sottomarino 2013 Sopraffino Red (Mendocino County)
description: Deep fruit flavors and full body give this wine a lot to explore. It tastes as if it were drenched in blackberry and raspberry syrup without being literally sweet, has light tannins and acidity so the texture is soft, and enough concentration for a lingering finish.

title: MacLaren 2017 Lee's Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Gritty lemon and salty wet stone give this wine a welcome complexity and texture, amid a tart precision of citrus zest and grapefruit. Lithe, blended acidity keeps it fresh and focused in the glass.

title: Matthew Gibson 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: This mouth-filling wine starts with spicy cedary aromas that are vivid and attractive. It is rich in texture and deep in flavor. A full body and a thick layer of fine-grained tannins give plenty of structure for the chocolate and black-cherry flavors.

title: Morgan 2016 G 17 Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Dried earth, thyme, sagebrush, potpourri and boysenberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which is bolstered by 8% Grenache and 4% Tempranillo. Tart purple fruits and herbal elements arise on the palate, which is fresh with acidity and framed by tightly wound tannins.

title: Obscurity 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Nice and fruity, nice and dry, this full-bodied, pure and concentrated wine offers brilliant black-cherry aromas, delicious cherry and raspberry flavors and a polished texture. It's a fine example of old-vine composure and balance.

title: Picayune 2017 Rusty Gate Farm Albariño (Russian River Valley)
description: The producer's first vintage of this white, this shows medium-bodied ripeness and texture, nearly no oak, and strong aromas and flavors of green apple and mango. It's a fine wine for the table, picnic basket or front porch with friends.

title: Prima Materia 2017 Rosé
description: Smooth and supple, this medium-bodied wine is beautifully polished in texture and poised in terms of balance. It shows light peach and canteloupe flavors, a touch of red-wine grip on the palate and good concentration that contributes to a lingering, snappy finish.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Barrel Select Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Burly yet structured, this robust varietal wine, blended with 3% Cabernet Franc, is supple with underlying grip. Big boned in style, it offers a wealth of bold cassis, dark cherry and sage.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Black olive marks the opening of this soft, spicy and ripe wine, well integrated in its marriage of fruit, acidity and oak. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, showing a lasting balance of clove and dark chocolate on the finish.

title: Pulchella 2015 Gathering Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh aromas of black raspberry sorbet, sage, violets and toasted oak show on the nose of this blend of 55% Tempranillo, 36% Grenache and 9% Petite Sirah. The wine enters the palate quite smoothly, offering lighter bodied boysenberry flavors with touches of marjoram, black pepper and bay leaf.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2016 Antle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Young wines from the rugged Chalone appellation tend to be a bit closed in the early stages of life, and this is no exception. Black plum, wet slate, light vanilla and black peppercorn show on the nose, while the palate proves more shy, with plummy fruit and dark spice. Expect more cohesive flavors with time.

title: Sonoma Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: With a noble sense of reduction on the nose, this wine is taut and tart in acidity, focused in Meyer lemon and balanced oak. A grainy texture adds complexity to the light-bodied ripeness.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Hints of black pepper, clove and cedar waft from the glass, followed by ripe and generous fruit flavors on the palate. This wine is dry, well balanced and has a mouthwatering texture stiffened a bit by light tannins.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2014 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Full of sage and earth tones, this robust, full-bodied wine is brimming in black cherry and cassis flavors that are bolstered by a firm grip of tannins. Toasted oak finishes things out, with lingering notes of clove and vanilla.

title: Addendum 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dust, sage and crushed rock show well in this appellation wine, inviting in its opening aromatics of dried herb and violet. Chalky tannin and pronounced oak accentuate its ultimate power, evolving to reveal plush chalky tannin.

title: Justin 2012 Eighty One Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Bold in ripeness yet layered and complex, this bottling shows plush blackberry, fresh raspberry, sugar plums, caramel-soaked coffee cake, light coconut and mint on the nose. The palate oozes with juicy flavors of black currant, coffee, cocoa nibs and roasted beef, set against a chalky but firm tannins frame and a buoyant acidity. Dried mint lifts the finish.

title: The Hilt 2015 The Old Guard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Soft and mellow on the nose, with aromas of lemon cream, Meyer lemon pith, sea shells and a stroke of wood, this is a bottle to lay down and drink over the decades to come. The fresh, citrusy and layered palate focuses on bright acidity and textural tightness, making a perfect pairing for shellfish and white fish. Drink now through 2035.

title: Longoria 2015 Block N Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's an epic play between ripe fruit and earthy elements in this block-designated bottling from a block planted in the 1970s, showing candied cherry and raspberry on the nose along with crushed mint, moist creek bed soils and a hint of game. Black raspberry and black plum make for a hearty start to the sip, which is leveled by cherrywood smoke, spicy bay leaf and sagebrush.

title: Potek 2014 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Tangy red-plum, rhubarb, cranberry and tart hibiscus aromas show on the light-red fruit-forward yet stylistically reserved bottling from this historic vineyard. It's extremely lively and way more complex on the palate, where flavors of rose hips, rose petals, potpourri, tarragon and dried mint mix effortlessly with snappy pomegranate fruit.

title: Rochioli 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Rich and creamy, this is a standout wine from the great vineyard owner and producer. It shines in a wealth of golden honey and salty oak, a well-balanced sensibility streaked through in a memorable, ying-yang of lushness and crisp Gravenstein apple.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Pommard Clone Pence Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Another great example of Drake Whitcraft managing to shoot low on ripeness and yet deliver a wide array of flavors, this clonal selection is very light in the glass and shows aromas of piquant raspberry, sagebrush and candied red fruit. The palate is zesty yet full, with more raspberry and lifting tarragon flavors, proving rather refreshing.

title: EnRoute 2015 Les Pommiers Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Lush and velvety, this is a robust wine, richly layered in baked strawberry and huckleberry flavors. The palate is seasoned in tones of clove, cinnamon and orange, with a vibrant backbone of acidity and taut tannins that keeps it fresh in feel within a powerful context of ripeness.

title: Kutch 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This focused wine has a beautiful nose of integrated, pungent oak that presents as caramel apple—a quiet richness that complements its delicate layering of Meyer lemon and salty wet stone. The acidity is both fresh and complex, supportive and subtle.

title: MacRostie 2015 Goldrock Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This impressive wine is luxurious in candied strawberry, dark cherry and meaty game—a full-bodied expression of earthy goodness that stays within a varietal framework of lasting acidity. Lushly textured, its freshness is buoyant in orange citrus and cardamom seasoning.

title: Markus Wine Co 2015 Zeitlos Red (Lodi)
description: Very sophisticated and complex, this wine is one of Lodi's very best. It has great balance and intriguing flavors ranging from black pepper to blackberries, to sage and smoked meat. It is full bodied and firmly tannic, but everything is in good proportions, making it mouthfilling and ever so slightly reserved at the same time. Made from 76% Syrah plus Carignan, Petite Sirah and a touch of Viognier. Best after 2023.

title: Mirror 2014 Moulds Family Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Very lush in texture and concentrated in flavor, this full-bodied wine combines power and grace. It has a mélange of subtle aromas from tobacco to sandalwood and nutmeg that meet rich deep black cherry, anise and dark chocolate on the palate. The wine is mouthcoating but gentle and has a wealth of fine-grained tannins. Best after 2024.

title: Halcón 2015 Alturas Syrah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This fascinating high-elevation wine brings out the wild side of Syrah, from the earth and leather aromas to the black pepper and wood-smoke flavors. It is nicely dry—tannic but not biting—and holds its fruit flavors in check while letting the feral nature of the grapes grown at 2,500-feet take over.

title: Three Sticks 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: The mighty Durell shows its combination of power and grace in this lovely white, which opens in Asian spice, salty brine and lemon rind. Boldly full bodied and textured, it finds freshness in green apple and orange-zest crispness and complexity.

title: Three Sticks 2015 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From different blocks of the producer's estate, this is a bright beguiling wine with a fruity nose that invites one in with ease. Grainy texture supports well-defined layers of cranberry, strawberry and rose petal that become velvety smooth and cohesive on the finish.

title: Acaibo 2014 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a blend of 85% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Merlot and 6% Cabernet Franc, made by Bordeaux winemakers Gonzague and Claire Lurton from their Chalk Hill property as well as other sites around the county. Leathery and earthy at its core, it's possessed of a soft grip of cassis and violet, structured and smooth on the palate with a light touch to the ripeness.

title: Daou 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Thick in the glass, this study of concentration still allows the grape's nuanced character to shine through. Aromas of black currant and black olive meet with wet cement, ancho chile and bittersweet chocolate on the nose. The palate begins with candied black cherry before blossoming into a more elegant portrayal, showing complex hints of olive, cocoa dust and the slightest green hint. Refined, chalky tannins and expertly measured acidity round it out.

title: Etude 2015 North Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Plump red-cherry and bursting pomegranate aromas mesh with cinnamon, grape Jolly Rancher and crushed violets on the deliciously dynamic nose of this bottling. There is great freshness and zip to the sip, where a cohesive medley of cranberry, raspberry, Earl Grey tea and peppery spices unite. The tannins are firm but hidden until the finish.

title: Markus Wine Co 2015 Sol Red (Lodi)
description: This is a rich, multi-layered wine from a Lodi winemaker who loves to push the envelope. It is full bodied and mouthfilling, ready for something equally indulgent like osso buco or Peking duck. Made from Petite Sirah, Syrah and Mourvèdre, it exudes black plum and milk chocolate in the aroma, and brings ripe red cherry and blackberry to the palate. Broad and mouthcoating in texture, the wine has a long finish, too.

title: Tolosa 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lovely aromas of candied red cherry and pomegranate are enhanced by mace, allspice and wild forest scents in this stunning wine that effortlessly blends fruit, spice and earth. The palate shows black cherry, but then focuses on fresher hibiscus and carnation flavors spiced by dark nutmeg, clove and wild mint. A chalky texture and balanced acidity complete the picture.

title: D.R. Stephens 2014 Moose Valley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Rich and grippy, this medium-ripe red is 100% varietal, offering solid, firm acidity around a core of concentrated flavors that delve into lush milk chocolate, brushy sage, blackberry and toasty oak. Structured, this is an agreeable wine. Enjoy best 2024 through 2034.

title: Kula 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Light and clean with even aromas of peach syrup, concentrated honeydew and a hint of wood, this fresh and bright bottling from a winery whose name means “gold” in Hawaiian includes 6% Picpoul Blanc. Citrusy flavors start the palate as the tropical touches linger in the background, wrapped in a racy texture with lots of zing into the finish.

title: Old Ghost 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Ripe fruit flavors, a firm texture and generous spicy oak make this full-bodied wine a winner. The color is deep and dark, while the bouquet emphasizes blackberry and blueberry aromas that segue to a palate of baking spices and concentrated berries.

title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Generous in dark-fruit flavors and rounded in texture, this full-bodied wine is mouthcoating in concentrated tones of black cherry and blackberry. A spicy oak note don't intrude, while this feels moderately tannic and well balanced.

title: Quivira 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a heck of a value, well-made, well-integrated and structured. Baked bread and dark-cherry flavors are supported by thick tannin and complementary high-toned acidity, the finish a rich, rewarding end note of dark chocolate and coffee.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Valsecchi Vineyard Zinfandel (Carneros)
description: This has both high-toned acidity and strong tannins, with corresponding flavors that contrast from cranberry and cherry to vanilla and fresh bread. Along the powerful midpalate are highlights of leather, dried herb and peppery oak.

title: Siduri 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Both gamy and sweet aromas show on the nose of this bottling, with cranberry, pomegranate and candied strawberry touches offset by meaty funk. The palate is lightly bodied, with long simmering acidity and herbal touches enhancing the dark strawberry core.

title: Viaggio 2014 Outlaw Malbec (Lodi)
description: Aromas of black pepper and grilled beef lead to rich black-cherry and blackberry-jam flavors in this full-bodied and densely flavored wine. It has firm tannins and good acidity for a rather stiff texture that needs a bit of time to soften. Best after 2021.

title: Wente 2015 Charles Wetmore Single Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has a big, spicy presence backed by a lush fruit flavor. Cedar, clove and cinnamon aromas fill the nose followed by ripe black-cherry, blackberry and dried plum flavors that are wrapped in a blanket of fine-grained tannins. The mouthfeel is generous but balanced by good acidity.

title: Albatross Ridge 2015 Cuvée Vivienne Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from a dramatic vineyard atop the Carmel Valley shows light pomegranate, tart red-fruit and sarsaparilla aromas on the nose. The palate is quite tangy and tart with raspberry, cranberry, fennel frond and nutmeg flavors.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino)
description: Full flavored, well structured and well balanced, this is a handsome wine that carries its ample black-cherry and blackberry flavors on a muscular frame of fine-grained tannins and full body. The natural, concentrated grape flavors come shining through with little obvious oakiness to get in the way.

title: D.R. Stephens 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick and rich in baked plum and toffee flavors, this is a robust, well-made wine that is integrated, supple and pleasantly direct in focus and flavor.

title: Easton 2016 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Smooth and creamy yet firm enough for good grip, this is a big but well-balanced wine that offers plenty of ripe berries and plums along with hints of black pepper and sage. Moderate tannins seem to build on the palate and add a good bite to the finish.

title: Giornata 2016 Il Campo Rosso Red (Paso Robles)
description: Light in the glass, this extremely quaffable twist top table wine is perfect for a wide range of foods and casual sipping, showing easy aromas of strawberry, baking spice and gravel on the nose. The palate is fresh with framboise, red plum, orange rind and white pepper, offering great complexity in a lightweight package.

title: Justin 2015 Isosceles Red (Paso Robles)
description: Snappy aromas of boysenberry and black raspberry mark a somewhat lighter, brighter spin on this classic blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 13% Cabernet Franc and 11% Merlot. Smashed plums and berries run into tobacco and herbs on the palate, where bright acidity pushes into the finish.

title: Left Bend 2017 Redwing Vineyard Riesling (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Riesling is not a common grape from the Santa Clara Valley, but this bottling makes one wonder why not. Chalky, energetic aromas of lemon blossom, citrus rind and nectarine lead into an electric palate with a waxy texture, offering flavors of sour apple, lemon and petrol.

title: Westbrook Wine Farm 2015 Laurie's Vineyard Barbera (Madera)
description: This bold wine is very ripe in terms of fruit flavor, and shows generous oak spices like cedar, clove and black pepper that meld nicely with its almost jammy blackberry and blueberry flavors. The mouthfeel is broad and velvety.

title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This is a full-bodied, fleshy and oaky white, intense in flavor and grippy power. It delivers tones of anise and lavender amidst succulent layers of white nectarine and green apple.

title: Ackerman Family Vineyards 2015 Alavigna Tosca Cabernet Sauvignon-Sangiovese (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Sangiovese made in a well-integrated rustic way, this reflects both varieties in its embrace of soft, round flavors, including a mix of blueberry, dried cherry and clove.

title: Balletto 2016 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine shows cherry and strawberry flavors that wrap around a succulent, delicate core. The acidity is nuanced and delicately balances an earthy undertone.

title: Bodkin 2016 Unto The Breach Sandy Bend Vineyard Muscat Canelli (Lake County)
description: Nutty, woodsy aromas give way to savory and fruity flavors in this unusual and complex, dry and light-bodied wine. It has a pronounced yellow-gold color and a tantalizing earthy aspect in the flavors along with a rich texture that belies its rather low alcohol.
designation: Unto The Breach Sandy Bend Vineyard

title: Muscardini 2014 Alice Vineyard Sangiovese (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a plush, rustic and somewhat impenetrable wine in terms of tannins and ripeness. It offers a strong taste of tobacco, leather, earth and dried fruit.

title: Sean Minor 2016 4 B Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Vivid celery aromas and flavors ride a moderately crisp texture in this medium-bodied wine before a hint of sweetness completes the picture.

title: Temecula Hills 2016 Estate Roussanne (Temecula)
description: There's a slight effervescence to this bottling, which shows fresh banana, mango, wet stone and a subtle yeast on the nose. There is decent energy to the palate, where the tightly wound flavors of lemon juice and chalk arise.

title: Treasure 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This wine has a distinctly strong element of cured meat and salami on the nose, before it lunges wholeheartedly into chocolate, cedar and tobacco tones. Soft significant tannins wrap around the flavors in an impenetrable way.

title: Gershon Bachus 2013 Erato Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling is a good stab at lesser ripe fruit from Temecula, although the aromas are still very primary, with Concord grape and grape seed most prominent. Black-fruit flavors meet with black licorice and clove on the palate.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2013 The Neighbor's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Lush and accessible aromas of ripe cherries, strawberries, lilacs and cigar box show on the boisterous nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit more simple, with dark red fruit, sandalwood, a hint of star anise and a purple-flower flavor that's a bit over the top.

title: Everhart Cellars 2014 Proprietor's Reserve Red (El Dorado)
description: This wine is packed with fruit flavors and has a lightly tannic texture to carry them along. Focused raspberry and sour-cherry notes are accented by dashes of wood smoke and pepper.

title: Falkner 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Light aromas of mowed lawn, ripe peach and wet concrete show on the mellow nose of this bottling. It's fairly simple on the palate, with ripe pear and seared lime flavors.

title: Save Me San Francisco 2014 California 37 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This aromatic wine exudes smoky spicy oaky aromas that continue on the palate, joining good cherry and blackberry flavors and mingling on a smooth texture. It's overtly oaky but has enough fruit to provide counterbalance.

title: Sean Minor 2016 Four Bears Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: White peach, caramel and browned butter aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is soft and easy with flavors of roasted apple and cinnamon, though it could use a more acidic boost.

title: Lucky Rock Wine Co. 2016 County Cuvée Pinot Noir (San Benito County-Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: A heavy obvious oak component meets good ripe fruit flavors in this full-bodied mouth-filling wine. The aromas are charred and smoky, leading to almost jammy blackberry flavors.

title: Luna 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This combines grapes from St. Helena and Yountville appellations, as well as 15% Petite Sirah. Dull on the nose, it has an herbal persistence of cedar and sage backed by plenty of tannin and planks of oak.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine could pass for a cherry cola, with its fruity aroma, rather tart balance and flavors like cinnamon and cola.

title: Grayson 2016 Lot 5 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This smooth wine has a soft texture, candylike fruit flavors and an earthy element that stretches from the first whiff to the lingering finish.

title: Portalupi 2015 Marcucci Farms Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Sweet berry-cherry flavors meet a fleshy rounded midpalate in this simple and easygoing red that has a substantial taste of dried fruit and leather.

title: Sean Minor 2016 Four Bears Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Subtle aromas of baked earth and pomegranate are very shy on the nose of this bottling. A slightly tart red-currant flavors pops on the sip, along with a touch of cinnamon.

title: Y Rousseau 2014 Pépé Cavedale Vineyard Merlot (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is from a site 2,000-feet high in elevation, and made in tiny amounts. It opens with a massive concentration of plum and up-front tannin, imparting heady oak aromas and power. The finish is simple and bright in cassis.

title: Pope Valley Winery 2013 Tre Uve Red (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 63% Sangiovese, 32% Cabernet Sauvignon and 5% Merlot, this wine tastes slightly overripe, with a candied nose of rustic fruit and thick heated tannins.

title: Santo Stefano 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fairly green and astringent wine, with full-bodied concentration and thick tannin.

title: Old Soul 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Syrupy oak flavors dominate modest fruit notes in this medium-bodied, ripe and almost sweet wine. Tart cherry and raspberry flavors underneath give some fruity support.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2008 Estate Dessert Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This dessert bottling kicks off with the boozy aromas of port, but also shows lively fresh fruit reminiscent of concentrated blackberry syrup with hints of cola spice. It hits the palate with undeniable sweetness, but then come strong sandalwood and cedar flavors and a rush of vanilla and clove. It is soft while penetrating, like a dagger under silk lace.

title: Etude 2015 Ellenbach Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy and bright in brooding dark cherry and strawberry, this wine persists in earthy dried herb and dry toasted tannins. The full-bodied concentration is well-managed and intriguingly complex.

title: Holdredge 2015 Rolling Thunder Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dense and richly interwoven, this wine is made in a substantial style, with polished yet hearty tannins that need time to resolve in its youth. Black licorice and cherry meet nicely in the middle to offer well-balanced fruit and spice tones.

title: Lafond 2016 SRH Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lemon peels, sea salt, hazelnut and honeysuckle aromas play up the more voluptuous side of Chardonnay, and hint at marshmallow without going so far. The palate is surprisingly zippy with acid and Meyer lemon zest, but also shows richer hints of browned butter and toasted almond toward the finish. It's a crowd-pleaser for many tastes.

title: Combe 2016 Stolpman Vineyards Trousseau (Ballard Canyon)
description: Peter Stolpman is up to some wacky stuff on his family estate, with eye-opening and delicious results. Cloudy, cranberry-juice-red in the glass, this starts with rustic, lively aromas of tangy strawberry, plum, fruit punch and crushed spice. Then the zingy palate, which is nearly effervescent, picks up with pomegranate, citrus rind and white pepper. It goes down too easy.

title: Drew 2016 Mid-Elevation Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Floral, savory aromas and good, juicy red and black-cherry flavors are lifted by racy acidity and moderate tannins in this medium-bodied wine. It has a tangy lip-smacking texture, fine balance and reveals more nuances with each sip. Best after 2022.

title: Holdredge 2015 Judgment Tree Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a fresh, exotic and beguiling wine, with youthful tannins and nice concentration. The rich, bold flavors are marked by cherry, cola and a touch of smoky char that lead to highlights of clove and forest floor.

title: Holdredge 2015 The True Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a soft, succulent wine that's focused and full bodied, richly rewarding in perfumed aromas of rose and lavender. Made in tiny amounts, it offers a depth of concentrated blueberry and huckleberry that's entirely delicious.

title: I. Brand & Family 2014 Monte Bello Road Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Elegant aromas of black raspberry, blueberry, violets and black pepper show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from grapes located adjacent to the historic Ridge winery. Sandalwood frames the palate, which offers the region's typical herb and spice-rack flavors atop a rounded blackberry core. The tannins are firm now, and need some time to resolve.

title: La Barge 2014 Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Surprisingly concentrated in style for such a coastal vineyard, this bottling shows boysenberry syrup, black-plum pudding and spice cake on the nose. The palate is intense with dark fruits of blueberry and roasted black plum, with nutmeg and gingerbread flavors as well as firm tannins framing it all.

title: Marimar Estate 2014 Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled Unfiltered Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: The third vintage of this bottling from the producer's cool-climate site shows exotic and subdued undertones of wood, dried herb and white pepper. The palate is substantial yet softly layered.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Estate Grown & Bottled Unfiltered

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Sangiovese (Sierra Foothills)
description: Not many California Sangioveses are this good. It's impressive how a core of great fruit flavor fills up this well-balanced and full-bodied wine from the first whiff to the lingering finish. It starts with cinnamon, nutmeg and black-cherry aromas, brings clove and more cherry on the palate and wraps it all in a texture of velvety tannins.

title: Potek 2013 Tierra Alta Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Roasted black currant, char and a hint of pepper show on the deep, dark, elegant and yet somewhat reserved nose of this bottling. There's a flash of black cherry on the tip of the sip and then comes waves of black pepper and roasted beef. The texture is full and grippy, with tangy acidity and a long peppery finish.

title: Renwood 2015 Jack Rabbit Flat Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a firmly textured, well-balanced wine that offers aromas of black pepper and grilled beef. The palate brings a fresh blackberry flavor, with a gripping mouthfeel framed by good tannins. Made from 100% Zinfandel, it comes off dry and concentrated. Best after 2023.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2016 Split Rail Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon pith, buttered toast and honeysuckle make for a familiar and pristine entry to this bottling from a single vineyard that sits at 1,700 feet. There's a strong Chablis-like grip to the tip of the sip, leading into crisp Pink Lady apple, Asian pear and, toward the finish, flashes of pineapple and more opulent fruit.

title: Sentivo 2012 Estate Syrah (El Dorado)
description: This is a rich, concentrated and ripe wine, but one that doesn't go over the top. It offers enticing aromas of blackberry and dark chocolate, followed by satisfying blueberry and espresso flavors, with a firm texture from a healthy layering of fine-grained tannins.

title: Textbook 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Dark gold in color, this is an inviting white wine, light and fresh with highlights of peach Melba and honeysuckle. Tahitian vanilla adds a note of balanced richness that rewards the palate with substance and grace.

title: Blue Farm 2015 Laceroni Vineyard Estate Farmed Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salty seasonings of wet stone ride along a brawny texture of mineral-laden earthiness and tightly wound layers of green apple in this lovely lush white. Made in small amounts it shows balance and graceful elegance.

title: A Tribute to Grace 2016 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is the most affordable and easiest-to-find take on Angela Osborne's uniquely light style of Grenache. Cranberry, hibiscus and crushed gravel show on the nose, while the palate carries her typically lively texture, persistent acidity and fresh flavors of pressed raspberries.

title: Andis 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This wine offers expansive aromas of lavender and rose on the nose. Ripe plum, fig and cassis mark the softly textured palate, with a rich finish almost like a late-harvest wine.

title: Addendum 2015 Skellenger Lane Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Sticky tannin and a thickness of blackberry, sage and herb are the defining characteristics of this full-bodied youthful wine from a great site and great vintage. The hearty presence of fruit and weight give it a density and length on the palate.

title: Altvs 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Lavender and licorice tones give this wine a savory touch. The fruit comes from Oak Knoll and Coombsville, relatively cooler appellations within the Napa Valley, and includes the addition of 20% Petit Verdot. Rich, thick layers of blueberry, blackberry and cigar box meet dried herbes de Provence and sweet spice.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Ottimista Vineyards Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: This excellent wine has tempting aromas of new leather, sandalwood and dried earth, plus complex, savory flavors like dried herbs, prosciutto and green olives complemented by dried cherries. It captures the varietal characteristics very well and avoids being oaky or overly ripe.

title: Aerena 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This is a beautifully balanced, medium-bodied wine that goes beyond the basic black-fruit flavors and adds hints of dried earth and bay leaf on the nose and light wood smoke and black pepper flavors. Moderate tannins and persistent acidity complete the picture.

title: Baldacci 2014 Black Label Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: A 100% varietal wine from estate-grown grapes, this impresses in its soft supple texture and rich red fruit, while a note of crushed rock underlies the fruit. The structure is impressive and well able to support the power.

title: Carol Shelton 2015 Peaceland Vineyard Zinfandel (Fountaingrove District)
description: From a vineyard planted to three clones of the variety, then blended with 12% Petite Sirah, this sees 18 months in oak, a mix of new American and neutral French. It works in its bramble of wild berry and banana, the body softly layered, rich and sumptuously lush.

title: Castello di Amorosa 2017 Morning Dew Ranch Rosato (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is made from Pinot Noir grapes grown on a single-vineyard hillside site. It has a light-pink color tinted with salmon, fresh peach-skin aromas and nicely dry, crisp yellow-plum and white-cherry flavors that sit on a smooth, substantial texture.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from grapes grown at Three Palms Vineyard, alongside other valley floor and mountain fruit, including 10% Merlot and smaller percentages of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Smooth, lush and robust in dark cherry and plum, it's fruit forward and full bodied, with considerable ripeness.

title: Flora Springs 2015 Hillside Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Leathery cigar box and a thick, rich backbone of tannin and oaky char give this wine a robust definition and hearty quality. Entirely varietal, it comes from one steeply sloped block of the producer's hillside vineyard, and finishes in a dusting of chocolate and fig.

title: Folktale 2016 Le Mistral Single Vineyard Syrah (Monterey County)
description: Wild and animalistic aromas start the nose of this bottling, with roasted lamb leading into tangy blank plum. The palate carries those meat jerky flavors as well, alongside roasted coffee and fresh purple flowers, making for a complex experience.

title: Kelleher 2013 Brix Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Thick and chocolatey, this wine is voluptuously lush and big in style, with unctuous waves of baked plum and dark cherry. Dusty crushed rock and earth lie beneath the bold fruit, finishing moderately in length.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2015 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is a large-production wine that spares no attention to detail or quality. Winemaker Randy Ullom created an expression of thick, rich, grippy power that's available for an attractive price. Baked plum, clove, mountain sage and black cherry all figure into the mix, with a lasting touch of mocha on the lengthy finish.

title: Bonny Doon 2017 La Bulle-Moose de Cigare Fizzy Pink of the Earth Sparkling (Central Coast)
description: This bubbly pink blend is one of the better canned wines on the market, regardless of style. A blend of 57% Grenache, 18% Grenache Blanc with bits of Mourvèdre, Roussanne, Carignan and Cinsaut, it shows rounded watermelon, nectarine and grapefruit-rind aromas on the nose. The palate is crisp with strawberry, melon, red-apple and tart plum-skin flavors.
designation: La Bulle-Moose de Cigare Fizzy Pink of the Earth

title: Cedarville 2015 Estate Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: A peppery, herbaceous aroma and savory spicy flavors make this full-bodied wine, grown at high elevation, a bit edgy but full of personality. The flavors, at first, resemble grilled fruit and beef juices, then ripe black plums flow in, complementing a texture that is firm and moderately tannic.

title: Refugio Ranch 2016 Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling walks a fine line between ripe peach and more reserved elements of lemon and key lime. There is a strong stony and chalky kick to the palate, where tangy lemon-rind flavors meet with yellow apples.

title: Refugio Ranch 2017 Malvasia Bianca (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rather than the typical orange-blossom aromas, this bottling is more Sauvignon Blanc-like, with cut grass, lime peels, rainy cement and botanical elements on the nose. The palate is very acidic and stony in texture, with candied kiwi and passion fruit flavors.

title: Shannon Ridge 2015 Buck Shack Small Batch Sustainably Farmed Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: This wine has classic mint and cedar aromas, deep black-cherry flavors and a full yet soft mouthfeel. The flavors follow suit and are accented by a milk-chocolate tone. It's a tasty, approachble wine that's easy to like even if buck hunting is not the occasion.
designation: Buck Shack Small Batch Sustainably Farmed

title: Silver 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dried cherry, fig and intriguing star anise spice show on the nose of this wine, which is starting to show its age a bit via complex secondary elements. Dried mulberry, crushed peppercorn and balsamic fig flavors show on the sip.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Menthol, minty eucalyptus greets the nose of this wine, not uncommon for the appellation. A soft midpalate of soy, cherry and cassis meets leather and grippy tannin on the finish.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Quaglia Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Silky smooth, this vineyard-designate offers a high-toned streak of acidity within a substantial framework of powerful ripeness. Cherry, blueberry and coffee-cake flavors and aromas play nicely with one another, with a lasting finish of black licorice.

title: Angry Bunch 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Grainy, thick and concentrated, this wine offers structure amidst its big-boned richness and ripe flavor. Sizable tannins surround a core of brambly black fruit and toasted oak that lingers on the finish.

title: Bee Hunter 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Yorkville Highlands)
description: It's not usual to age Sauvignon Blanc, but this late release and the companion Mariah Vineyard bottling are nicely concentrated wines. In the buttery oaky spectrum, this medium-bodied and nuanced wine smells lightly buttery, tastes rich, feels mouth-filling and lasts long on the finish.

title: Encanto 2017 Encanto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This enticing wine is savory on the nose, displaying light herb, fig and mineral aromas. Rich melon and crushed rock flavors yield a creamy texture.

title: Entrepreneur 2012 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Well-defined acidity holds on with tenacity in this stylistically rich, thick and full-bodied reserve-level wine from the elusive appellation. Big tannins provide a gritty, leathery texture marked by notes of coffee, toffee and dried herb, the fruit concentrated in black cherry.

title: Frank Family 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fleshy in fig, guava and a hearty helping of vanilla oak, this wine is of moderate build and lushly likable. The finish offers a sophisticated seasoning of anise.

title: Giornata 2017 Bianco Il Campo White (Paso Robles)
description: When looking for an affordable table wine with great packaging and unique flavors, opt for this blend of primarily Pinot Grigio and Falanghina, with touches of Vermentino and Verdelho. Aromas of light honey and Meyer lemon pith lead into a palate that is rich at the core with almond cream but surrounded by tangy grapefruit rinds.

title: Martinelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a robust, generous and meaty red wine. On the palate, smoke and toasted oak tones support warm baking spice, black cherry and an undeniable earthiness of cardamom and forest floor.

title: Navarro 2017 Late Harvest Sweet Muscat Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: Sweet, delicate and beautifully balanced, this wine has pure peach, apricot and honeydew melon flavors, a smooth texture and tangy acidity underneath. It should be great with a cheese course.

title: Peju 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this is a floral and balanced wine that displays great tension and texture. Fleshy in flavors of peach, lime zest and wet stone, it delivers a rounded feel that lingers on the palate.

title: Prima Materia 2016 Estate Barbera
description: High-powered berry and cherry flavors light up this very focused and purely fruity wine. It is quite full-bodied but not very tannic, and minimal use of oak in the winemaking yields a vibrant, uncomplicated character.

title: Rock Wren 2013 Syrah (Solano County Green Valley)
description: A dark color and intense blackberry aroma gets this wine off to an impressive start. Rich flavors of blackberry and black cherry flood the palate, backed by firm tannins and steady acidity. It's a big wine, not particularly oaky, but well poised and packs a lot of flavor.

title: Saracina 2017 Unoaked Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Intriguing pine-needle and white-pepper aromas lead to lean flavors of lemon and green apple in this light-bodied, crisp wine. It's a refreshing antidote to the overly buttery, oaky options.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Viognier (Santa Clara Valley)
description: There's a strong stony aroma on the nose of this well-shaped bottling, along with Meyer lemon pith and dried nectarine elements. The palate is streamlined with yellow-peach and citrus-peel flavors, with a full mouthfeel that is leveled by balanced acidity and a firm texture.

title: Tower 15 2016 The Swell Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 33% Merlot, 27% Petit Verdot, 27% Cabernet Sauvignon and 13% Cabernet Franc comes from both Paso Robles and Santa Barbara County vineyards. It shows aromas of elderberry, leather, dried leaves and cappuccino on the nose. It's lush in texture on the palate, where baked blackberry, charred meat and espresso bean flavors arise.

title: Viaggio 2014 Little Missy Estate Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Great concentration helps this full-bodied wine stand out. It has intense and ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors, moderate tannins and good length on the finish.

title: Au Bon Climat 2016 Los Alamos Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Warm almond, white peach and sweet oak aromas show on the nose of this wine from legend Jim Clendenen. There is solid tension to the palate, where edgy flavors of lemon skin are balanced by the warmth of hazelnut.

title: Calera 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: The nose of this wine is sharp and precise in tones of chalk, tangerine cream, dried lemon and crushed nuts. There's a strong mineral quality through the entire palate that accents flavors of lemon juice and yellow pear.

title: Cuda Ridge 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This impressive and full-bodied wine has powerful fruit and subdued oak flavors held tightly by a firm structure. Vivid black cherry and sour cherry unfold on the palate while light accents of dark chocolate and clove are layered in. Fine-grained tannins are abundant, but should mellow by 2023.

title: Eberle 2016 Steinbeck Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: There's a tarry backbone to the nose of this bottling, but there's also ample blackberry fruit, peppercorn, roasted meat and crushed violet aromas. The palate is intense in more tar, meat and peppercorn flavors, which result in a savory, medium-bodied mouthfeel.

title: Giornata 2016 French Camp Vineyard Aglianico (Paso Robles)
description: Bright aromas of blueberry meet with earthy aromas and a tannic tension on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a vineyard deep in the southeastern corner of Paso Robles. A firm structure carries plummy flavors on the palate, which is relatively light on its feet, approachable and easy to like.

title: Cuda Ridge 2016 Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: Great concentration and good balance make this medium- to full-bodied wine enjoyable. It has an intense dark color and plenty of ripe red- and black-cherry aromas and flavors that flood the layered, saturated mouthfeel.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is a strong earthy and rocky quality on the nose of this wine at first, with crushed gravel aromas, but then the dark red fruit becomes more boisterous. There is also candied red fruit in the background on the sip, but the mineral tones of slate and earth are prominent and compelling.

title: Domaine Anderson 2015 Walraven Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: A deep gold color and effusive aromas of dough, toast and butter start this wine off with a bang. The flavors are rich, vivid and nicely oaky, giving up butterscotch, toast and lemon curd along with softer vanilla and pear tones. It is generous and rich in texture.

title: Foxen 2016 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black raspberry, turned earth, baked plum and incense show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard of winemaker Billy Wathen's good friend Rick Longoria. There is a woody core to the palate, where oak and pine flavors are wrapped around black plum and boysenberry fruit, with a touch of sagebrush.

title: Giornata 2015 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh plum fruit meets with rocky earth, pipe tobacco and dark-red flowers on the nose of this bottling by Brian and Stephy Terrizzi. The palate is wrapped in a dark earthy core with bountiful acidity and thick tannins, carrying flavors of tangy plum skin and berry fruit.

title: Rocca 2014 Vespera Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from half Cabernet Sauvignon, the remainder nearly equal portions of Syrah and Merlot, this is a full-bodied ripe blend of spicy, fresh and ample flavors. With integrated tannin and oak, it is effusive in dark berry, leather and clove, with a meaty, gamy tinge on the finish.

title: Sanford 2014 Dominio del Falcon Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Named for the falcons that nest above this single block, this bottling offers aromas of cooked cherry, dried herbs, nutmeg and charred oak. The palate is wrapped in clove spice and dried red fruit, with a persistent tension and overall earthy flavor profile.

title: Sanford 2014 Vista Al Rio Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a vineyard planted by winery in 1997 that overlooks the Santa Ynez River, this bottling shows clean black-cherry, vanilla, clove and star anise aromas. There is a strong red-plum and orange-rind tang on the palate, which is framed by strong acidity and a chalky texture. Potpourri and black cherry pop on the finish.

title: Sheldon 2017 Vinolocity Red (Napa-Sonoma)
description: This is an unusual commingling of old-vine Petite Sirah from the Napa Valley and Tempranillo from Luc's Vineyard in Sonoma County, a 50-50 partnership between the two. Made in a carbonic style in stainless steel, it tastes of fresh strawberry, raspberry, with a fresh floral aspect to the palate that's juicy, plush and bursting with energy.

title: Shooting Star 2016 Barbera (Lake County)
description: Delicious fruit flavors, subtle spices and a generous mouthfeel come together in this full-bodied, luxurious wine. It has a mouth-filling texture due to lots of fine-grained tannins, very ripe and pure black-cherry flavors and excellent concentration that helps extend the finish.

title: Steele 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: Complexity and concentration mark this wine as a standout. It has a deep, dark color, with aromas of black cherry, currant and mint. Layered flavors of ripe fruit and mild spice are bolstered by a velvety texture of fine-grained tannins. The finish lingers nicely, and the wine will surely improve in the cellar. Best after 2021.

title: Via Romano 2017 Fiano (El Dorado)
description: This multi-faceted wine from a new winery that specializes in Italian grape varieties exudes light floral and almond aromas, then brings ripe fruit, a touch of vanilla and great acidity on the palate. It starts out subtly but builds richness with each sip, ending with a long finish.

title: Viaggio 2013 Submission with Permission Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is an original, authentic-tasting wine (made from 65-year-old vines) that doesn't follow a commercial profile. Instead it offers subtle fruity, savory and spicy aromas, and an abundance of ripe and dried fruits ranging from blackberries to figs and dates. It feels wonderfully mouth-filling but has enough fine-grained tannins for good structure.

title: Ampelos 2015 Ampelos Vineyard Lambda Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Woody earth meets carbonic strawberry in this lightly spiced, delicately crafted, estate-grown wine. With elusive notions of pomegranate and cherry, it is light and balanced, finishing gracefully soft and supple.

title: Barnett 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Concentrated in tannic layers of vanilla, cassis and sage, this wine offers a sauvage quality of mountain air and power. Its full-bodied ripeness and richness is complemented by a lifted hit of bright acidity that lingers on the finish.

title: Entrepreneur 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Bright, tangy acidity helps lift a soft midpalate of polished tannin in this appellation wine. It has enviable structure to offer around a layered flavor array of cassis, red currant and black cherry, its secondary characteristics playfully savory in black pepper and clove.

title: Francis Coppola 2016 Diamond Collection Black Label Claret Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Superripe flavors of black cherry juice and blackberry jam give this full-bodied wine richness and depth. It is concentrated and deep, showing dark chocolate and blueberry flavors, with light spicy, oaky accents of vanilla, cedar and mocha.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2016 Jose S Ferrer Selection Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Thirst quenching in Meyer lemon, wet stone and salty oak, this wine evolves in the glass to become something more robust in body and ripeness, delving into concentrated apple and pear laced in ginger.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2017 Estate Grown Pinot Blanc (Carneros)
description: This is a lovely white, vibrant and citrus-driven in acidity and freshness and focus. Nicely melded flavors of melon, lime and grapefruit accent a light-bodied, elegant style that will do well as an apéritif or meal accompaniment.

title: Goldschmidt 2013 Plus Yoeman Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Aged in new oak, this wine is rich and syrupy thick. The oak takes on smoky overtones that mesh well with the ripe cherry fruit, with flavors of sage and clove as well. The tannins are polished yet burly, adding sizable structure into the mix.

title: Imagery 2015 Upper Ridge Vineyard Malbec (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: This wine is a bit flat in black fruit and moderate structure,. It is soft and round but lacking somewhat in varietal character.

title: Mill Creek 2013 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal. It was given time in oak for two years in a combination of French and American barrels. A sweetness from the oak is noticeable, as a taste of root beer combines with juicy blackberry, the fruit ripe and round.

title: City Winery Chicago 2015 Reserve Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers an herbaceous nose of dusty gravel, bell pepper and thick black cherry, the body somewhat thin and simple in structure. The tannins pierce through on the finish.

title: Criss Cross 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)
description: Beefy in body and also in flavor, this full-bodied wine brings aromas like singed rosemary and flavors like maraschino cherries and barbecue sauce. It has moderate tannins for a grippy mouthfeel.

title: Geyser Peak 2015 Uncensored Red (California)
description: Soft and semi sweet, this wine has jammy, cherry-candy flavors and a smooth texture accompanied by moderate tannins.

title: Block Nine 2016 Caiden's Vineyard Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine tilts heavily toward extremely oaky aromas and flavors that have a smoky, concocted flavor and nearly overpower any fruit components that might be underneath.

title: Benessere 2015 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Sangiovese (St. Helena)
description: This is a hugely extracted wine that traffics in earthy mushroom and a streak of greenness that comes off as somewhat disjointed and harsh.

title: Bel Vino 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a mature, ready-to-drink wine with a brownish tinge in the color, and an aged aroma like cola and cedar with a touch of barnyard. The flavors are earthy and rather lean.

title: Crane Family 2014 Don Raffaele Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is steeped in eucalyptus and bay leaf, with a floral aroma that's hard to pin down. Its structure somewhat flat.

title: De Loach 2015 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: From a site situated at 900-feet in elevation and located blissfully close to the coast, this vineyard-designate is intensely salty and briny, in firm grasp of stony mineral characteristics. With a depth and breadth of full-bodied concentration, it's complex and layered in Gravenstein apple and pear, the aromas a mix of honeysuckle and apple blossom.

title: Flanagan 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A richness of graham cracker crust and baked pineapple greets the nose of this memorably delicious wine, a tremendous testament to the site. With a backbone of toasted oak and grippy youthfulness, it finishes in bright complex bites of green olive and fennel.

title: Lynmar 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Full bodied, fresh and fragrant, this is a successful celebration of the appellation, bringing together the best of several sites. Dark brooding fruit and forested earth complement one another beautifully as a fleshy rounded texture takes hold.

title: Sanguis 2014 French Books Red (Central Coast)
description: Tons of crushed rock and baked earth show at first on the nose of this blend of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, and then comes the exotic cola, black cherry and tarragon aromas. There's gravel on the sip as well, where firm squeaky tannins also carry blueberry and green-peppercorn flavors. Altogether, it's a complex yet very quaffable wine.

title: Stewart 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is an impressive effort, mingling together rich and forward flavors of blackberry cobbler and chocolate around a softly layered yet richly woven core of concentration and power. Decadent, it finishes with a welcoming smoky hint.

title: La Follette 2015 Hawk's Roost Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a strong element of rusticity that's entirely welcoming in its mix of truffled earth and fresh compost. The flavors are lean and sinewy: a tart lingering measure of cranberry and pomegranate perfectly spiked in black tea and cardamom.

title: MacPhail 2015 Toulouse Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This impressive wine has power combined with complexity, as expansive aromas of black cherry, cedar and rose petal lead to a full body, firm tannins and concentrated black-fruit flavors that linger on the finish. Aged in only 25% new oak, it will drink best after 2020.

title: Peake Ranch 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The attention-grabbing nose of this dark and brooding bottling shows plenty of ethereal aromas of hickory smoke, violet oil, cola, pepper dust, teriyaki and burnt bacon, all surrounded by the essence of purple fruit. The sip is super savory with loads of crushed pepper, roasted boar, duck fat and charred beef, with lilac on the finish.

title: Pestoni Family 2013 Domingos Brothers Red (Howell Mountain)
description: Given time to come together, this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Merlot is deliciously robust and complex. Expansive and richly layered, its flavors lean in to bolder elements of coconut and vanilla as simultaneous wisps of dried currant and cranberry soften the ripeness.

title: Saint K 2016 Old Potrero Vineyard Syrah (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Thick and dark in the glass, this is a very roasty wine on the nose, with aromas of toasted chocolate, smoked beef, hearty blackberry and a bit of purple-flower freshness. Charred meat flavors make for a savory palate, which is balanced by tart black plum and blueberry flavors and cut by a hint of lavender.

title: Stewart Cellars 2014 Tartan Red (Napa Valley)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon comprises 60% of this wine to Merlot's 40%, the grapes coming from three different vineyard sites, including Brokenrock. A sanguine thread of cranberry and red currant give the firm structure life and vibrancy, as dusty leather, fig and cocoa powder provide restrained richness. This is a tremendous value for the quality.

title: Walt 2015 La Brisa Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an impressive appellation blend, sourcing from the proprietor's Bob's Ranch as well as Gap's Crown Vineyard and others. Earthy compost and forested tea gird a full-bodied concentrated experience highlighted in dried cranberry, raspberry and rhubarb, a leathery hint of sarsaparilla adding creaminess.

title: Walt 2015 Sierra Mar Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich and exuberant aromas of black cherry, vanilla and brown sugar meet with a more floral depth as well as crushed gravel on the nose of this bottling by Winemaker Megan Gunderson. Buoyant acidity pops right away on the sip, allowing the silky tannins to present flavors of black plum, dark cherry, loamy earth and dark spices, from sandalwood to allspice.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Pence Ranch Mt. Eden Clone Monopole Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Second-generation vintner Drake Whitcraft is diligently honing a delicate, fresh style of Pinot Noir, which shows expertly in this bottling. Aromas of crushed violet, under-ripe cherry, tarragon and spearmint decorate the nose. The palate combines raspberry with crushed mint, proving extremely soft and feminine. It would be easy to drink the whole bottle.
designation: Pence Ranch Mt. Eden Clone Monopole

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Drum Canyon Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's an intriguingly earthy character to the nose of this bottling by Greg Brewer, with snapped sagebrush, dill, green olive and tart pluot aromas leaning into the herbal side of the grape. There's great tension to the sip, which is fresh and flavorful with underripe fig and strawberry, orange rind and a hint of green peppercorn.

title: Chesebro 2013 CM Ranch Grenache (Carmel Valley)
description: Brawny aromas of wild boysenberries, bay leaf, black cardamom, wet soil and black tobacco recall a tumble through the rugged chaparral on the nose of this bottling. The palate's black fruit and violet flavors mingle with lavender, chai spice, clove, black pepper and more tobacco, framed by firm tannins. This represents a tremendously complete sensory experience.

title: Daou 2014 Mayote Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: This always highly anticipated, nontraditional blend of 56% Syrah, 36% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Petit Verdot really shows off Daniel Daou's deft hand in the cellar. Bountiful yet taut aromas of black currant, vanilla, licorice, espresso, black rocks and smoke lead into a firmly structured palate full of black and purple fruit, tar and black olive, with a hint of dank herbs. Extremely complex, it is built to last, though can be enjoyed today. Drink now through 2034.

title: Eleven Eleven 2015 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark gold in color, this is a textured wine with complexity to spare. It's beautifully evolved and integrated, with tantalizing flavors of baked pear, crème brûlée and fennel. A floral bouquet of spring blossoms leads the nose.

title: Hall 2014 Terra Secca Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine from a range of vineyards along the eastern hillsides of the valley. It is hugely concentrated in mocha, chocolate, sage and tar. Toasted oak supports powerful, firm tannins and a plush texture, all beautifully spiced with clove.

title: Kokomo 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Peter's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a well-integrated and composed reserve-tier wine that lives up to its billing. A rich nose of blueberry and baked strawberry-rhubarb give it an edgy, savory quality that's also succulent and velvety on the palate, with long-lasting cardamom spice.

title: Writer's Block 2015 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)
description: This very good straightforward wine offers plenty of fruit flavors along with a firm structure that makes it feel appetizing and a little grippy on the palate. Aromas of black plums and cranberry syrup lead to vibrant red-cherry and cranberry flavors.

title: ZD 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dry compressed fruit flavor accents pronounced oak and tannin in this full-bodied, rich and rounded wine. Tangy and tart on the palate, it leans into savory elements of tobacco and pencil, with a leathery persistence.

title: Angels & Cowboys 2015 Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: This crowd-pleaser blends Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Malbec in undisclosed percentages, a combination that provides plenty of big structured tannin and black fruit. Leather, pepper and meat favors dominate against a backdrop of grippy texture and persistent spice.

title: Callaway 2016 Winemaker's Reserve Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: This winery has been making Chardonnay in Temecula for many decades, and it shows. Restrained aromas of pear skins, white flowers and a touch of butterscotch lead into a familiar, somewhat zippy Chardonnay palate of almond paste, fresh citrus and sea salt. A solid effort for the warmer region.

title: Ferguson Crest 2013 Fergalicious Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 40% Syrah, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Petit Verdot and 20% Grenache is very rich, brooding and concentrated on the nose, with black-cherry syrup and chocolate-sauce aromas. The palate is fruit-forward as well, with black-plum sauce and black-currant syrup, framed by slightly chunky tannins and strong acidity.

title: Judd's Hill 2014 Kairos Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Oaky, woody and tannic, this wine is elusive in fruit, preferring to offer dense, thick and concentrated flavors of tobacco, leather and sage. Medium-bodied in acidity, it does have structure to back up its powerful richness.

title: Judd's Hill 2014 Reserve Founder's Art Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Mildly floral and plummy, this is a soft, moderately structured wine, subtle in oak with rich rewarding flavors of black and red cherry that persist within lingering notes of clove and tobacco.

title: Katherine Goldschmidt 2015 Crazy Creek Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Tart and tannic, this is a juicy concentrated red wine, given one year in French oak, 20% of it new. Fine-grained tannin and dry oak support sage, black-currant and cranberry flavors that meld into chocolate and tobacco on the finish.

title: Lusso Della Terra 2012 Terzetto Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark red fruit, wood spice, crushed gravel and dark mud make for a well-rounded nose on this blend. Baking spice and vanilla lift up the cranberry and strawberry fruit flavors on the palate, further enhanced by a pinch of herbs, strong acidity and decent structure.

title: Murphy-Goode 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Flavorful and unusually gutsy for the varietal, this wine has almost meaty aromas, lots of grape-skin and grapefruit flavors on the palate and a sense of density the comes from a little tannin in the texture.

title: Peloton 2016 Spanish Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)
description: Exotic plumeria flowers, toasted hazelnut and a dollop of custard show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just miles from the Pismo coastline. The palate sizzles with acidity, which cuts through ripe flavors of pineapple and caramelized pears.

title: Salt of the Earth 2016 Rubino Moscato (California)
description: This is a delicious and very sweet red wine with fresh bright grapey flavors that have almost no parallel in California winemaking. It is light in body, so enjoy it over ice with fresh cheese before a meal, or use it as a fruit-punch ingredient.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Dark red plums, red currants, wood spice and a minty backbone all show on the nose of this bottling from a property south of Paso Robles. There is a minty freshness to the sip, along with flavors of strawberry, black-plum sauce and baking spice.

title: Violet-Green Winery 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is robust and oaky, with a touch of vanilla sweetness to the oak. Blackberry and cherry combine with ease on the palate, with a smooth, rich roundness to the texture.

title: Wrath 2015 Pommard 4/777 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Deep red cherry, sharp cinnamon spice, crushed gravel and wet cement show on the nose of this clonal selection. The palate shows red plums and star anise, proving tangy and tart.

title: Wrath 2015 San Saba Vineyard Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Crushed slate, black raspberry and eucalyptus show on the nose of this bottling from the winery's estate vineyard. The palate is tart and lighter bodied, with baked earth, loam and cranberry flavors riding an acid-driven frame.

title: Bellante 2015 Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Honey, candied lemon, woody earth and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. There is good energy to the sip, where flavors of lemon rind, toasted brioche, sea salt and woodsmoke show. It is a somewhat savory expression.

title: Cannonball 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A nice fresh minty aroma introduces this lightly oaked and generously fruity wine. It features ripe but not quite jammy blackberry flavors on medium body, and a smooth melted texture that's soft on tannins.

title: Falkner 2014 Meritage (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend of 45% Cabernet Sauvignon, 43% Merlot and 12% Cabernet Franc takes some time to open up, eventually showing plush aromas of blue fruit, cocoa and coffee. Stiff chalky tannins deliver flavors of baked red fruit and wet rocks. It may improve vastly with time.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Reserve Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Baked earth, crushed slate, dried sage and dried red fruits show on the dusty nose of this bottling. The palate is driven by tobacco flavors and dried garden herbs, proving rather Old World in style albeit a bit single-noted.

title: Lynmar 2016 Adam's Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a new vineyard site named for the producers' son, this is immensely rich, rounded and spicy in nutmeg, clove and ginger, completely inviting and immersive on the nose and palate. Made in a balanced, brightly complex style, it offers plenty of depth and nuance between the scenes, in full exploration of crisp to baked apple and pear.

title: Foxen 2016 Solomon Hills Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dark mulberry, black raspberry and slate start the nose of this bottling from one of the region's most coastal vineyards, but then comes a tremendous amount of black sage, Earl Grey tea and the slightest touch of game on the nose. Dark-berry flavors are cut by thyme and lavender on the palate, which is rich yet fresh, tart and lovely.

title: Chappellet 2014 Pritchard Hill Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's site which is situated at 1,800-feet in elevation, this is a beautifully put together wine, blended with 14% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec. It serves to celebrate the soil, exuding strong elements of sage, earth, graphite and crushed rock. Amidst the terroir is a richness of blackberry, clove and chocolate. Full bodied, it retains structure and grace.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This brilliantly balanced wine opens with tones of orange and nutmeg, slowly evolving in the glass to reveal rose petal, lavender and crunchy black cherry. This will continue to mature nicely in bottle; enjoy 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard

title: Melville 2016 Donna's Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extreme amounts of freshness arise on the nose of this radical cool-climate Syrah, from smashed plums and boysenberries to amazingly intense peppercorn, forest-floor, tobacco, pine-oil and asphalt aromas. Peppercorns, tar, dark herbs and strong anise flavors show on the intriguing palate.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a sacred site in the heart of the appellation, this shows broad, savory flavors of black plum, black currant, leather saddle and tobacco. A lingering thread of black and white pepper dots the landscape of full-bodied richness and complexity. The structure promises further aging; enjoy best from 2024–2034.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 ERA Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon with 6% Cabernet Franc and smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Merlot, fermenting the entirety in barrel. Black pepper, leather and rough-hewn, grippy tannin dominate elusive black fruit, pencil shavings and cedar, all within a context of sizzling intensity. This is one to age; enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram West Slope Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This site-specific wine justifies its singularity in a robustly perfumed, floral aroma and a spicy, savory embrace of black tea and cardamom. The fruit profile is defined by rhubarb and orange zest.
designation: Year of the Ram West Slope Single Vineyard

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Piocho Reserve Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The nose on this blend of 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 8% Cabernet Franc, 5% Petit Verdot and 5% Malbec is showy at first with candied black currant, but then it is elegantly straightforward, with layers of violet. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a clean yet taut structure and pitch-perfect acidity, carrying purple-fruit and dried herb flavors, all expertly integrated.

title: Roar 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Intensity is tantamount in this wine, starting with focused aromas of black raspberry, sun-warmed rose petals, spice cake and a slate-driven minerality. There is a strong acidic zip to the sip before it settles into a smooth groove, loaded with spice-soaked mulberry, Luxardo cherry and clove flavors.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Green Acres Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: The longtime grape-growing Sangiacomo family has partnered with winemaker James MacPhail to produce this beauty. A floral aroma carries to the balanced, full-bodied palate of Asian pear, fig and pineapple flavors, finishing on a crème caramel note.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A candied black-cherry aroma meets with wild thyme, dried marjoram and tea leaves on the nose of this bottling by Winemaker Blair Fox. It's light bodied on the palate, allowing elegant red-fruit and purple-flower flavors to ride the vibrant acidity into the finish.

title: Foxen 2016 Melville Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh aromas of pomegranate and raspberry meet with loads of sagebrush and wild mint on the layered and alluring nose of this bottling by Billy Wathen and crew. Flavors of smashed wild berries, dewy herbs, blistered tomato and forest floor moss show on the sip—a great balance between earth and fruit.

title: LaRue 2016 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Katy Wilson impresses with this bottling, coaxing together a wine that's briny and salty, perfectly consistent with this coastal-influenced Occidental site. A flavor of Asian pear accents a moderate structure and lingering complexity.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety smooth in feel and resplendent in a rose petal aroma, this is a lovely, full-bodied wine with depth and concentration. Deftly defined layers of dark cherry and tangerine shine bright, allowing for a refreshing complement to the wine's overall depth and power.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's high-elevation, 225-acre site on Spring Mountain, this is mineral in crushed rock and sanguine characteristics, with a hit of graphite and black licorice. The fruit is subtle, a mix of black currant and plum wrapped in contrasting notes of cedar and mocha. Medium-bodied, it shows structure and elegance.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Gravelly Meadow Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Soy, tobacco and dried herb mark this appropriately named wine, which does indeed have a gravelly, chalky aspect to its texture and taste. From a five-acre vineyard block of the estate, it is endlessly complex and nuanced, despite its full-bodied richness and concentration.

title: Foxen 2016 Block 8 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This block-designated wine is intense in hearty aromas of black raspberry, dried mint and loamy earth. Spiced cake and sharp purple-flower flavors arise on the palate, but it's the dark, penetrating and focused boysenberry and dark-fruit flavors that command attention. Drink 2019–2036.

title: Foxen 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's an impressive array of aromas on the nose of this bottling, starting with light red cherry and pomegranate before intensifying into boysenberry jam with loads of star anise and dried ginger along the way. The mouthfeel is full, carrying boysenberry-jam flavors laced with sandalwood, myrrh and anise.

title: Foxen 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A bowlful of ripe red fruits, hibiscus and sharp cinnamon-laced potpourri make for an inviting nose to this single-vineyard expression. Bright acidity cuts through flavors of tart raspberry, pomegranate and baking spice on the taut palate, which is light in body but loaded with flavor. Drink 2020–2032.

title: Maidenstoen 2016 Oliver's Vineyard Riesling (Edna Valley)
description: Springtime fresh on the nose, this bottling by Mike Callahan, who is the assistant winemaker at Chamisal, shows guava, crushed chalk, Key lime skin and ripe melon on the nose. The palate is zippy with penetrating acidity, offering more lime as well as Asian pear and Gravenstein apple flavors.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Zio Tony Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
