description: A salty air of quince and tart lemon give life and freshness to this focused and expansive white, from a site long farmed by the Martinelli family in the heart of the appellation. Green apple and nutmeg add secondary characteristics, as toasted oak appears on the lengthy finish.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a well-made, powerful wine. Elegant, integrated and effusive in oak, it has pretty apple blossom aromas and boldly layered flavors of green apple, crème brûlée and lemon meringue. The finish is lush in a honeycomb tone. This will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2020–2025.

title: Theopolis 2015 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Theodora Lee is making brilliant wines from her estate property in Mendocino County. Great concentration and a monumental structure help this wine stand out, even in a field crowded with those qualities. It tastes a little quiet and tight now, and needs time to mellow so that more complexity and richness comes out. Still, it already shows intriguing layers of black pepper, black fig, blueberry and graphite. Best after 2025.

title: Theopolis 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A stellar example of freshness from a richer region, this bottling offers buoyant and snappy raspberry fruit on the nose alongside dewy forest floor, tangy juniper, soft rose petals and a hint of nutmeg. Fresh and invigorating on the palate, the sip shows tart raspberry, crushed thyme, green peppercorn and tapenade flavors.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Coastlands Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a challenging vintage at times, a tiny amount of this subdued wine was made. The nose offers a sense of peatiness, like a good Scotch. Tart orange and grapefruit define an essential crispness to the fruit, as crushed rock and rose petal play along. The tannins and oak are soft and seamlessly interwoven.

title: Donelan 2014 Cuvée Moriah Red (Sonoma County)
description: This memorable wine blends 84% Grenache from the Dry Stack Vineyard in Bennett Valley with 16% Mourvèdre from the Kopf Vineyard. It's exotic and approachable, offering a rich taste of cherry liqueur and tart pomegranate with a background of soft oak and earthy baking spice.

title: Everhart Cellars 2014 Dorado Canyon Vineyard Malbec (El Dorado)
description: Very ripe and concentrated, this full-bodied wine has powerful fruit flavors, a big impact on the palate and very firm tannins to hold it together. The color is very deep, the aromas are like ripe blackberries dusted with cinnamon and cedar, and the flavors go deep and long, lingering on the finish.

title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Zero Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is an envelope-pushing wine that's distinctive and untamed in the way that it combines earthy, savory and mineral aromas with complex, meaty and fruity flavors that have wonderful depth on the palate and length on the finish. The balance is spot-on due to firm acidity and lean tannins, supporting the tangle of unusual and enjoyable tastes. Zero in this case means no added yeast, no new oak and no fining or filtration.

title: Mueller Family Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From one of the warmer mountain ranges in the Napa Valley, this wine exhibits plenty of elegance and classic restraint, though it offers plenty of simultaneous power. Cedar, dried herb, red currant and black pepper make up the range of seasonings, with a touch of crayon wax and bitter leather riding along a substantial grip of tannin. Cellar and enjoy best from 2023–2033.

title: Ancient Peaks 2015 Renegade Red (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: The price-to-flavor ratio on this bottling is astounding, as this blend of 55% Syrah, 27% Zinfandel, 13% Petite Sirah and 5% Petite Verdot offers all that Paso power at half the price. Intense black currant, blackberry pie, beef jerky and caramel aromas lead onto a palate full of chalky tannins and balanced acidity. The roasted blackberry flavors would pair perfectly with a beef stew.

title: Black Kite 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Bright black raspberry aromas meet with shaved licorice, fresh fennel, tarragon and purple rose petals on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The sip dries up considerably at first, with loamy, minty flavors, but they open toward strawberry, sumac and candied red cherry. Cinnamon and menthol spice fire up the finish.

title: Carlisle 2015 Rossi Ranch Grenache (Sonoma Valley)
description: After skipping a vintage, the producer offers this impressively powerful expression of the variety from a great site. Compressed plum and strawberry compote flavors are rich and rounded, nuanced in juicy acidity. A lasting bite of oak and tannin permeate on the long finish, accented in white pepper.

title: Carlisle 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Candied blackberry, black cherry, plum paste, mint and dark chocolate show on the nose of this dense built-to-last bottling by Mike Officer. The palate is thick and the tannins are still a bit stiff, but the intense marjoram, oregano, thyme and elderberry jam flavors will grow even more fascinating with time. Drink from 2019 through 2035.

title: Patland 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine goes to the limit with ripeness and full body, showing an especially dark color, very ripe and effusive fruit flavors like macerated cherries and blackberry jam and a mouth-filling texture packed with lots of expansive tannins. It's hard to resist its exuberance and concentration.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A richly ripe and rewarding white, this wine opens in hearty notions of butter, quince and spicy peach. Velvety smooth, it has a decadence that persists and impresses, its use of oak integrated and complementary to the wine's gravelly elements.

title: Cutruzzola 2014 Gloria Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: The nose on this bottling is both juicy and serious, with cherry, pomegranate, dewy morning sagebrush, muddy sand and star anise aromas. There is solid textural tension to the sip, where red currant and lavender flavors mesh. Strong acidity soars into the finish.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Azaya Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: Delicious fruitiness and full body are a winning combination in this luxuriously oaky, very ripe-tasting and impressive wine from Marin County—not exactly a household name for wine, but it should be. The black cherry and stewed-plum flavors are so rich they seem sweet, but a good structure of acidity and firm tannins keeps the wine balanced.

title: Gainey 2015 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There is extreme florality throughout this bottling, starting with wisteria and dark carnations on the bright and fresh nose, alongside black raspberry fruit. The flowers are a bit more subdued on the sip, yet violet, lilac and rosewater flavors persist, decorating the suave strawberry and rhubarb background.

title: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, juicy and broad on the palate with mouth-filling tannins that show its youthful vigor. Cherry and raspberry liqueur flavors run deep, wrapped in sizable oak and well-integrated accents of cedar and dried herb. This stands to be cellared; enjoy best 2024 through 2029.

title: Terra Valentine 2015 Cabernet Franc (Spring Mountain District)
description: Brawny in generous fruit and tannin, this 100% varietal wine is from a low-yielding vineyard at elevation. Soft layers of black cherry, clove and a welcome helping of dried herb combine effortlessly on the full-bodied palate to offer complexity and concentrated flavor.

title: Folded Hills 2015 Grant Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Bright and radiant aromas of cherry, strawberry and raspberry meet with rose petals, spice cake and a touch of bubblegum on the nose of this bottling by winemaker Angela Osborne. There is firm structure to the palate at first, then comes tart cherry and hibiscus flavors—altogether quite refreshing.

title: Grand Napa 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy black fruit meets powerfully structured tannins and concentrated flavor in this wine, blended with 10% Petit Verdot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 3% Merlot. Sizable oak supports layers of black cherry and currant, along with tense, underlying acidity. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Gesture G-S-M (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 80% Grenache, 19% Syrah and 1% Mourvèdre is easygoing, likable and fit for many occasions and meals, just like a good Châteauneuf-du-Pape. Inviting aromas of plump cherry, macerated strawberry and vanilla lead into a palate loaded with cherries and vanilla ice cream flavors, finishing on a touch of caramel.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Bootlegger's Hill Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This vineyard-designate shows off the ample richness of the site and appellation, offering fulsome, exotic flavors of guava and fig. The ripeness of the fruit finds its complement in equally ample acidity that refreshes and lingers on the finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Aldo's Vineyard Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)
description: Estate grown, this is a signature wine for the producer. It is named for Biale's father and made from vines planted decades ago. Tangy red fruit, plum and citrus complement a rich and tannic midpalate of powerful density and complexity, seasoned in dried flowers.

title: Small Vines 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Bright layers of citrus and strawberry highlight a wild element of high-toned character in this fiercely complex, tannic wine that expands on the palate over time. Floral rose and lavender persist from start to finish.

title: Trombetta 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with a voluptuous nose of black cherry, vanilla and black tea. The palate is lush and expansive, with complex earthiness that highlights a fruit profile brimming in spice and lively acidity.

title: Edmeades 2014 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Tight, concentrated aromas of black fig and dark chocolate meet beefy, earthy and ripe berry flavors in this high-powered, concentrated wine. It has a full body and firm tannins that give it a powerful structure, with nice depth and a lingering chocolate and cherry finish.

title: Barden 2017 Fonte White (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extremely fresh aromas of spring blossoms, lily and lemongrass show on the nose of this blend of 36% Chardonnay, 32% Pinot Blanc and 32% Pinot Gris. The palate is immensely textural and racy, delivering tingling flavors of yellow grapefruit, lime rind, yuzu an Asian pear.

title: Black Kite 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Plump red cherry, star anise, gingerbread and strawberry gelato aromas show on this single-vineyard expression. The palate is extremely structural even though it is lighter weight in mouthfeel, with taut tannins carrying snappy red-fruit flavors, dried ginger and brown spices. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Merill Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This big wine is so full of jammy fruit flavors and laced with such firm tannins that it's almost chewy. It has bold ripe fruit aromas like blackberries, rich and concentrated fruit flavors that are deep and focused, and a great structure of tannins and good acidity that make it lip-smacking to taste.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Chileno Valley Vineyard Riesling (Petaluma Gap)
description: From a vineyard farmed by Mark Pasternak on the Marin side of the new Petaluma Gap AVA, this is a perennially beautiful, bone-dry white. Floral, stony and crisp, it offers white peach and apple aromas and flavors, while the acidity is refreshing and integrated.

title: LaRue 2015 Thorn Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Katy Wilson's dedication to delicate winemaking is on full display in this tangy acid-driven wine from a beloved coastal site. Pomegranate and citrus underline the fresh, focused fruit aspects complemented by earthy forest floor, turned earth and crushed rock.

title: Ledge 2017 G2 Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Crisp and pure on the nose, this bottling by Mark Adams offers vibrant and fresh aromas of lime sorbet, honeydew and chalk. The palate is very tightly wound, steadily releasing flavors of grapefruit, lime and lemon, zipping with strong acid and chalky texture deep into the finish.

title: MacRostie 2016 Terra De Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Minty in forest pine and seductively silky, this wine is wickedly sauvage and complex, offering delicately layered flavors of wild strawberry, black tea and crushed rock. The tannins are supportive and supple.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rich and brooding with intensely perfumed oak, this is a layered white made from grapes grown throughout the appellation. It delivers medium-bodied weight and grip, with lush apple and gingersnap flavors.

title: Portalupi 2016 Pauli Ranch Barbera (Mendocino County)
description: This is a bold, ripe and rich wine that leads with saturated aromas of black fruits. On the palate, it feels broad, gentle and velvety as fine-grained tannins support flavors of blueberry, cocoa and black pepper. Excellent to drink now, it has the requisite tannins, acidity and depth for aging. Best after 2023.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Pagani Ranch Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: From old vines in the heart of the Sonoma Valley, this is an earthy, savory and impeccably structured wine. Lavender, rose and cedar all play a role in contributing complexity and depth to this beautiful wine.

title: Sanford 2014 Block 5 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: One of the winery's single-block series, this focused bottling features clone 777 and delivers aromas of red cherry, vanilla, licorice and pine oil on the nose. The texture is quite grippy, and the palate offers flavors of roasted cranberry, anise, sumac and allspice.

title: Etude 2016 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This estate wine offers a tight-grained tension of tannin and oak that underlines a robust ripeness and sense of power. Bright red fruit is in there and youthfully evolving to have its own day in the sun.

title: Naggiar 2016 Black Beast Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Intense color, flavor and texture make this wine big and bold. It was made from 65% Petite Sirah along with Syrah and Zinfandel and has an inky appearance, plenty of grapey and plummy aromas, rich jammy flavors accented by chocolate and very firm tannins that grip the sides of the mouth.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: A Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant red blended with Merlot, Zinfandel and Petit Verdot, this presents as burly, brawny and smoky, with soft supple tannin and oak that are well integrated into the whole. Easy to enjoy, its fruit is black and meaty.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is tightly wound in its youth and shows great potential for further development. A reduced entry shows generous oak, burnt sugar and pineapple aromas and flavors, a rich, decadent expression of the vineyard that still needs time to come around.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: This contains 6% Merlot and 7% Petit Verdot, the fruit from both Napa and Sonoma. Tight-grained tannins contribute a thick grippy midpalate of weight and texture before chocolate waves of dark cherry are complemented by dried herb and sage.

title: Riverbench 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Apple syrup, lime rind and orange Creamsicle aromas show on the nose of this wine. It's rather ripe on the sip at first, with heavy oak-soaked apple flavors, but then a sharp lemon-juice acidity slices through, giving balance.

title: Simi 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Entirely barrel-fermented, then aged in French oak, this is a fully fleshy, robust white, plentiful in oak and power. The fruit-forward components are a mix of fig, mango and cinnamon toast.

title: Toad Hollow 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Rounded aromas of tart red fruit, red and purple flowers, damp sagebrush and forest floor show on the nose of this very fairly priced bottling. Rustic flavors of dried plum and cranberry meet with earthy elements, all wrapped in a chalky texture.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Yes Dear Happy Wife Vineyard Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean aromas of peach, lemon and pineapple move toward tropical ripeness on the nose of this bottling—a well-balanced white from the warm region. It's bright and fresh on the palate with guava, tuberose and sweet cream flavors.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Griva Vineyard Therese Vineyards Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Rich aromas of pomegranate and cranberry are dusted with baking spice, pepper and dried herbs on the rather ripe nose of this bottling. The palate is also riper than usual for Pinots from this appellation, showing flavors of cooked berries, star anise, licorice, vanilla and cedar.

title: Paso Highlands 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Highlands District)
description: Red fruit, clove and licorice show on the nose of this bottling. Cooked strawberry, roasted plum and cherries are dusted with allspice on the fairly simple but clean palate.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 The Investor Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends sizable portions of Merlot and Petite Sirah with Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, the varieties in tension with one another for dominance, with the Petite Sirah winning. Baked plum, cocoa powder and black pepper ride along a thick tannic frame.

title: The Vice 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Meaty, dry and light, this wine offers moderate length and body, with highlighted flavors of cherry, lemon peel and mint.

title: Tie-Dye 2015 Red (North Coast)
description: A deep, dark color and smoky aromas lead to ripe and fairly rich fruit flavors in this big and straightforward wine. It is full bodied and somewhat tannic in texture, which makes sense considering the 43% Syrah, 40% Petite Sirah and 17% Zinfandel that went into the blend.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2017 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Full bodied and almost fat with all its unctuous flavors, this wine smells like butter and baking spices and tastes like pear syrup and nutmeg. It has a mouth-coating texture, plenty of oak influence and a sense of near-sweetness on the finish.

title: Bellante 2016 Jack McGinley Vineyard Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Concentrated aromas of blackberry and balsamic glaze show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is very tangy and thick with more berry-balsamic touches as well as peppery spice.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Big Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This wine is full bodied, dry, firm but smooth in texture and has a good array of berry and black-cherry flavors. It has nice weight and breadth and a good balance of body, moderate tannins and fruit acidity.

title: Mathew Bruno 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy and full-bodied, this 100% varietal white offers notions of sweet peach, baked pineapple, biscuit and honeycomb. The texture is thick and viscous.

title: Merriam 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Whole-berry pressed, the estate fruit is farmed organically for this wine, which is a rich and relatively thick expression of candied strawberry and watermelon Jolly Rancher. It refreshes through the finish.

title: Robert Hall 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of gravelly earth, dark black cherry, wet wood and smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also very earthy, although a tad weak, with smoke-laced black currant and peppery spices.

title: Jada Vineyard & Winery 2015 WCS Jack John Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Condensed rose petals, soft red plums, minty herbs and wet soil show on the approachable nose of this bottling. Rounded hibiscus and watermelon flavors lead the medium-bodied sip, where a compelling tension gives nuance to this strong expression of Grenache.

title: Killer Drop 2014 Red (California)
description: Dense and delicious fruit flavors plus a creamy, layered texture make this full-bodied wine almost irresistible. It has oodles of ripe black cherry and blueberry, with light baking-spice notes that expand on the palate. It is hardly tannic and feels lush and smooth.

title: Leoness 2014 Grande Mélange Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Candied cranberry, red currants, rose petals, bay leaf, oregano and peppercorns converge for a very compelling and interesting nose on this blend of 53% Syrah, 23% Grenache, 12% Mourvèdre and 12% Cinsault. Boysenberry fruit shows on the sip, alongside all of those intriguing herbal spices.

title: MacRostie 2015 Kent Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is creamy and lush in vanilla, marshmallow and a healthy helping of toasted oak, yet it evolves in the glass to show undeniable acidity and mineral-laden aspects of dried herb and crushed rock. The finish emphasizes its light-bodied approach.

title: Michael David 2015 6th Sense Syrah (Lodi)
description: Distinctive and exotic, this affordable wine is concentrated while layering cola, pine forest and clove nuances on top a core of ripe blackberries. It is medium to full in body and moderately tannic. The saturated flavors coat the palate nicely and linger on the finish.

title: Red Car 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Velvety smooth in sublime flavors of green apple and toasted oak, this wine takes a light approach to ripeness, allowing for the tart pineapple fruit to speak quietly around an acid-driven core.

title: Red Car 2014 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is peppery and leathery, with a rustic rambling edginess. Tart varietal flavors of black cherry, black pepper and a feral underbelly of mushroom, sage and barnyard are supported by supple tannin and supportive oak. This wine is lightly ripe and bold in acidity.

title: Ron Rubin 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a clear, bright and light-bodied red, the grapes grown on the producer's estate. Earthy mushroom, forest floor and black tea provide a savory backdrop that remains fresh in the glass thanks to buoyant acidity.

title: Tercero 2013 Watch Hill Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Cherry syrup, grenadine, red flower petals and a pinch of cinnamon show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard near Los Alamos. Strong hibiscus notes on the sip meet with black-tea tones, and the concentrated structure is firm with tannins.

title: Vermeil 2015 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salty caramel and oak are well integrated and in balance in this vineyard-designated white from a well-farmed cool coastal site. Crisp textures of apple and lemon shine alongside the medium-bodied frame of ripeness.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Shokrian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light, fresh and a perfect pairing for everything from burritos to roasted fish, this bottling is very light in the glass and shows soft strawberry and a hint of sweet sagebrush on the nose. The palate throws light hints of bay leaf and juniper in with strawberry soda pop flavors, proving quite fruity and likable.

title: Blue Rock 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a balanced delightful expression of the variety, possessed of cherry, cola, tree bark and cardamom aromas and flavors. The star of the show is the vibrant acidity, which refreshes and impresses in complexity.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 Stainless Steel Fermented Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This stainless steel expression starts with a plump, fresh and fruity nose of rounded melon, lemon bars, candied marshmallow and butterscotch. The opulence tightens up severely on the palate, where a zesty acidity and pithy grip carry flaors of baked apples, lemon rinds and sea salt.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Shokrian Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tightly wound aromas of yellow flowers, lemon wedges, pear flesh, beeswax and a kiss of oak show on the nose of this bottling from the vineyard formerly known as Verna's. There is great grip to the palate, with lemon oil, sandalwood and chamomile flavors, framed by a chalky structure. It offers good cellaring potential.

title: Cellars 33 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This combines grapes from two sites, the Hummingbird Hill Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap and a site on the warmer Westside Road in Russian River Valley. Fruity and inviting, it's also tannic and lengthy in stem, bark, tea and cranberry-raspberry, with a tease of orange zest.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Neal Vineyard Zinfandel (Fair Play)
description: This is a bold, seriously fruity and distinctive wine. It combines lots of rich blackberry and boysenberry flavors with a texture that's firm enough to bring good balance while staying very smooth. It has moderate fine-grained tannins and full body.

title: Clif Family 2016 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a dry elegant version of a sometimes boisterous varietal, and has the typical rose-petal and grapefruit aromas, then good, crisp and somewhat restrained fruit on the palate. The wine has great acidity, a touch of astringency that's mouthwatering, and a clean finish.

title: Le Casque 2015 Calotte Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is big in body but not too bold. It has an elegant personality due to good balance and complex flavors that are not overdone. Black tea and red cherries in the aroma join with cranberry and cardamom on the palate, making it interesting to savor.

title: Martinelli 2015 Vigneto di Evo Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed in smoky char, this is a sizable, high-octane red wine, smooth and succulent on the palate with highlights of spicy cinnamon, black pepper and cedar. It conjures up notions of strawberry pie.

title: Potek 2014 Kimsey Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Very floral on the nose, this bottling from a young vineyard shows crushed slate, red cherries and a touch of potpourri on the nose. The palate offers hearty flavors of baked boysenberry, peppery spice and a tart violet florality, proving quite a mouthful of flavors.

title: Chalk Hill 2015 Estate Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This blends 57% Cabernet Sauvignon with 29% Malbec, 10% Petit Verdot and 4% Merlot. It offers impressive tension of smoky black fruit, dark chocolate and leather with rounded edges of richness and sizable tannin.

title: Domaine Anderson 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine starts with a concentrated and earthy or reduced aroma, then brings on fresh, slightly spicy cherry and raspberry flavors shaded by damp earth tones. More than just a straightforward fruit bomb, it has nuances and complexity.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 G-S-M (Paicines)
description: This blend of 54% Syrah, 42% Grenache and 4% Mourvèdre offers oregano, peppercorns and salted beef against a plummy backdrop on the nose. The mouthfeel is full and chalky, delivering flavors of roasted black plum and dried herbs.

title: Easton 2015 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This wine is dark and brooding, offering black-pepper, blackberry and wood-smoke aromas, then potent concentrated fruit flavors on a rather tannic full-bodied frame. Subtle oak spices of wood smoke and clove add complexity on the palate and finish.

title: Flora Springs 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy, full-bodied and floral, this wine is generously proportioned in stone fruit and Meyer lemon tones. These tones complement the palate well, giving a sense of substance and style.

title: Iron Hub 2016 Estate Bottled Sémillon (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Rich and generous in character, this full-bodied wine has a luxurious texture, enticing honey and melon aromas and luscious fruit and spice flavors that verge on sweetness.

title: Kohler & Frohling 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: This is a 100% stainless-steel white that offers spritzy acidity and grainy texture around a midweight body as peach and vanilla flavors wrap around that light refreshing core of pure fruit. This is a new wine from one of the oldest wineries in the state, brought back to life by the great-great-grandson of original founder Charles Kohler.

title: Kokomo 2016 Timber Crest Vineyard Winemaker's Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dark cherry and blackberry flavors dominate in this thick, rich and concentrated wine, which is boldly ripe and round in style. Its intensity is additionally defined by strong characteristics of coffee and molasses.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Reserve Chardonnay (El Dorado)
description: This wine is packed full of ripe apple and pear flavors that are accented by vanilla and butter. This is a full-bodied, barrel-fermented wine that's big in profile but smooth in feel.

title: MacRostie 2016 Fedrick Vineyard Sangiacomo Family Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light and bright in strawberry and spicy cardamom, this wine is also alight with coffee and tea flavors and an abiding element of earthy mint.

title: Navarro 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This wine goes for extreme ripeness in the dense jammy saturated blackberry and black-plum flavors, has a broad smooth texture and full body. It's on the verge of sweetness, showing mild tannins and soft acidity, and is seductive for the purity and generosity of the fruit character.

title: Now Presenting... 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This playfully labeled wine shows strong blackberry aromas with surrounding hints of turned earth and dust on the nose. Tangy and dark-red fruits are held up by firm tannins, strong acidity and dried herbs on the well-framed palate.

title: Omen 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This big dry wine, based on Paso Robles and Sierra Foothills grapes, is intense in flavor, well-structured to stand up to big proteins, and nicely full bodied. Black-cherry and black-plum notes stand out on the palate, while light baking-spice accents begin in the aromas and continue through the finish.

title: Opaque 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Slightly tart aromas of black fruit meet with turned earth, campfire and incense on the savory nose of this bottling from the Riboli family. Cooked black-currant and olive flavors combine with roasted beef and cocoa on the thick palate.

title: Pestoni Family 2016 Estate Sangiovese (Rutherford)
description: Juicy in cherry with a strong element of char and smoke, this is a soft, rounded and full-bodied wine made entirely from the variety. It has secondary characteristics of dried herb and sage.

title: Point & Line 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Crisp apple, buttered nuts and a touch of honey show on the clean nose of this bottling. Tangy apple flavors meet with crushed nuts on the tense and tart palate, which finishes with a wash of vanilla spice.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Fortitude Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet oak lies beneath mouth-coating tannin in this full-bodied, 100% varietal wine, a rich, soft expression of cherry, vanilla and dried herb.

title: Raymond 2015 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Smooth and succulent, with a soft core of richness and length, this is a full-bodied, highly ripe and bold red with dense flavors of cola, clove and cinnamon.

title: Rockpile 2016 Cemetery Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Thick rounded richness is supported in pillowy tannin and brimming in brambly blueberry and blackberry. It broods and bristles in grippy texture and earthy elements of dried sage, lavender and crushed rock.

title: Rockpile 2016 Pritchett Peaks Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Tight tannins underscore a rocky dusty texture in this big-boned savory wine that is 100% varietal. Spice, leather and red fruit come together seamlessly basked in violet. It has plenty of power and concentration but leaves an elegant lasting impression.

title: Schramsberg 2014 Crémant Demi-Sec Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Balanced sweetness is at the heart of this wine, a blend of 71% Flora with 16% Pinot Noir and 13% Chardonnay. Richly layered flavors of peach and vanilla complement a lingering effervescence that will work beautifully with spicy foods.

title: Skinner 2016 Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: This classy wine offers a mix of spice rack and black cherry aromas, with rich plum, earth and rhubarb flavors. There is balance between ripeness of fruit and tension from the tannins and acidity. It stands on it own as a beautifully complex but not heavy wine.

title: Peltier 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This is a taut and bracing wine, with aromas of grapefruit and lime and flavors of lemon and jicama. It's rather light in bodied, but has such a refreshing, almost electric character that it still makes a big impression.

title: Battle Family 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a new project from Skip Battle and family, with Patrick Sullivan making the 100%-varietal wine. Elegant and cool climate in nature, it offers exotic complex layers of forest floor, sage, graphite and currant, the tannins elongated and polished. The structure and moderate ripeness show potential for aging. Enjoy best 2024–2029.

title: Margerum 2017 M5 Margerum Estate Vineyard White (Los Olivos District)
description: This is a compelling and delicious blend of 54% Grenache Blanc, 21% Viognier, 14% Marsanne, 8% Roussanne and 3% Vermentino from Doug Margerum's new estate property. Crisp Asian pear, apple blossom and stargazer lily aromas lead into a very grippy, tense and chalky palate full of nectarine sorbet, lime rind and tangerine flesh flavors.

title: Blair 2014 Morgantini Vineyard Tasting Room Series Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Cranberry, hibiscus, sandy mud and pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Morgantini Vineyard, which is rather light in color. It's soft and elegant on the sip, with well-integrated flavors of oregano, rose petals, bergamot, black raspberry and elderflower.

title: Blair 2014 The Reserve Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Relatively light in color, this reserve bottling from Delfina's Vineyard offers tangy red plum, sagebrush, bay leaf and rust aromas on the nose. The palate is awash in herbs, from thyme to oregano, set against a red-currant-reduction sauce and light savory flavors of roasted pork.

title: Clos de la Tech 2004 Domaine du Docteur Rodgers Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)
description: There are strong aromas of turned earth, wet loam, bay leaf, tobacco leaves and black olive tapenade on the nose of this recent library release from the winery that sits atop the Santa Cruz Mountains above Silicon Valley. It's thick on the palate with Indian and Mexican spices (from coriander to curry), with hints of powdered cocoa and tobacco as well. The acid and structure remain solid.

title: Folded Hills 2017 Lilly Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This Grenache-based rosé is one of the best of the year, showing tight aromas of strawberry, pink rose petals and crushed chalk. The palate is framed by an incredible acidic sizzle and chalky grip, carrying expertly subdued flavors of raspberry and red plum.

title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Cremant Sierra Madre Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A clean shade of yellow hay in the glass, the nose on this bottling is very inviting with aromas of baking croissant, baking soda and lemon peel. The palate combines strong yeast with crushed chalk and clay flavors, proving quite creamy in texture.

title: Iron Horse 2014 Rainbow Cuvée Estate Bottled Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: This wine celebrates diversity and is beautifully layered and fresh in a rounded peach tone. Moderate structure gives way to plenty of brioche richness on the palate.

title: Midnight 2014 Gemini Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 28% Malbec, 28% Tannat, 15% Syrah, 15% Petite Sirah and 14% Grenache is very rich on the nose, showing cherry reduction, pepper and licorice aromas. The palate starts off very silky and then stiffens to present well-integrated flavors of black cherry, dried mint and loamy earth.

title: Miro 2015 Conzelman Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a beautifully balanced wine that has enticing, expressive black-cherry and sweet oak aromas, and equally vibrant and complex fruit flavors that are well supported by good acidity and moderate tannins. It's a nicely tight wine that doesn't give everything away at first whiff, but keeps one coming back for more.

title: Priest Ranch 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a finely made wine that offers plenty of ripeness, structure and intensity. Rich and round, it has a soft backbone of cherry and cassis, with supportive yet integrated oak.

title: Schug 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Lush round flavors of pear, melon and salted rocky minerality work well together in this well-made estate wine. With integrated oak, it offers a soft smooth palate of balanced richness.

title: Ten Acre 2015 Jenkins Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Aromatic baking spices accent the lavish, ripe fruit flavors in this generous full-bodied wine that combines power and good balance. It is full of black cherries from the first whiff to the mouth-filling flavors and on through the finish. Moderate tannins and a touch of acidity add a little welcome grip to the texture.

title: Zotovich 2016 Z Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasty oak aromas surround the bright raspberry and strawberry fruit as well as a floral touch of rose petals and carnation on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very fresh with smashed raspberry and cranberry flavors, smoothed out by oak-smoked meat.

title: Sea Slopes–Fort Ross Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Brioche and almond flavors meet a sleek, smooth and tightly focused core in this meticulously made white. Apple, pear and lemon meringue provide complexity on the midpalate before finishing crisp and slightly spicy.

title: Bernardus 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This single-vineyard expression is loaded on the nose with brioche aromas alongside Meyer lemon preserves and a hint of apple cream. The palate is full in that California way, but balanced deftly, combining toast, oak, cashew and tangy lemon-curd flavors.

title: Clark-Claudon 2014 Eternity Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky oak meets rounded black fruit in this rich dense wine, softened in structure on the midpalate. Chocolate and vanilla flavors combine to underline the grip and full-bodied ripeness.

title: Justin 2014 Isosceles Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: There is a focused intensity of black plum, elderberry and black-cherry pie on the nose of this blend of 82% Cabernet Sauvignon, 9% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 4% Malbec. A ripe black-cherry flavor meets with licorice, vanilla and fudge on the palate, where polished tannins provide ample structure.

title: Oakville East 2015 Franc N Stern Cabernet Franc (Oakville)
description: Reduced and strongly aromatic in coffee, this wine offers generous helpings of tannin and dark brooding blackberry, tar and dark chocolate. Its powerful concentration doesn't detract from the overall structure, which suggests aging. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Pahlmeyer 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Reductive in the best way, this wine opens in a layering of salty brine and oak as a creamy palate reveals itself with power and concentration. Baked apple, gingersnap and cinnamon toast configure around bold structure and moderate acidity, allowing for a fulsome, voluptuous experience.

title: Small Vines 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged in neutral oak and made from great grapes, this shines in layers of bright refreshing acidity and sharp focused flavors of orange, grapefruit and cherry. Complex and beautiful, this is a wine that needs to be in your glass.

title: Tantara 2016 La Encantada Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The nose on this bottling from a vineyard planted in 2000 is loaded with raspberry gelato, hibiscus and spicy cinnamon-stick aromas on the nose. There's a twiggy herbal edge to the palate, where dried sagebrush, wild thyme and peppercorn play with tangy cranberry and nearly tapenade flavors. Intriguing throughout.

title: Albatross Ridge 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: There is a strong wet-chalk note on the nose of this bottling, along with aromas of marmalade, sourdough, apple, pear and lemon candy. The palate is consumed by a compelling tannic grip, framing diverse yet complementary flavors of chalk, clay, honeysuckle, Asian pear and nectarine.

title: Bella 2015 Barrel 32 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is blended from some of the best barrels that the winery made in 2015 from various parts of Sonoma. Gorgeous, plump blackberry aromas meet palate-drenching berry and black-cherry flavors in this dramatically concentrated but smooth-textured wine. It has a great sense of depth and focus due to the perfectly ripened fruit, while staying supple and composed. Best through 2025.

title: Jayson 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This has an invitingly fragrant sweetness on the nose, with jasmine and cotton candy, while the palate is etched in generous helpings of honeyed oak and brioche. Full bodied and richly textured, it delivers ample complexity around its strong additional flavors of hazelnut and vanilla.

title: Langman Estate 2014 Vincent Henry's Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: Beautiful fruit, flower and spice aromas give way to opulent, rich and complex flavors in this very appealing and polished wine. It has vivid black-cherry flavors, baking-spice accents and a palate-soothing texture of fine-grained tannins and moderate acidity.

title: Sanford 2014 Block 6 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Elegant aromas of cranberry, strawberry and dusty gravel show on the nose of this block-designated bottling. The palate is subtle but persistent, offering delicate flavors of hibiscus, pomegranate, oregano and wild thyme.

title: Vokel 2016 828 Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Named for the clone used in the cuvée, this wine offers lightly spiced, delicately layered tones of raspberry, cherry and pomegranate. The acidity is interwoven nicely between the fruit and spice.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Sourced from a mountainous site, this wine is brimming in mineral aspects of volcanic ash and crushed rock. Tangy and expansive on the palate, it offers persistent tones of flowers, ginger and lavender that accent rich baked plum. Enjoy 2021–2031.

title: Black Kite 2016 Kite's Rest Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Good balance and a plethora of juicy, ripe fruit flavors highlight this full-bodied wine. It has generous black cherry and light baking-spice aromas, plenty of cherry and sour cherry in the flavors and a moderately tannic texture livened by good acidity.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 3 Clone Estate Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegant aromas of black raspberry, wild mint, tarragon and mossy earth show on the nose of this clonal blend. Earthy thyme and cherry-tomato flavors play against the cranberry and raspberry fruit of the palate, with bright acidity driving deep into the finish.

title: Daou 2015 Micho Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark yet pure aromas of blueberry, black pepper, olive and savory roasted beef show on the nose of this blend of 57% Merlot and 43% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's thick and lavish on the palate, with sticky tannins and dark berry and charred meat flavors that make the mouth stand at attention. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Easton 2015 Rinaldi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Fiddletown)
description: Hardly a run-of-the-mill wine, this potent liquid exudes tobacco and flint aromas that join with wood smoke, cocoa and blackberry flavors to make it dramatic and spicy. Full body and firm tannins build great structure to pair with indulgent proteins and give it the stuffing to age. Best from 2022.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: The beautiful Rochioli site is divinely represented here, offering a lush, plush wine with an effusive nose of spicy oak. On the palate, the acidity is firm and focused, adding to a complex layering of texture and well-defined flavors of green apple, grapefruit and lime.

title: Rockpile 2016 Black Sheep Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: A 100% varietal wine made in magnums only, this is the owner and winemaker's amusing ode to his own position within his large family, choosing winemaking over grape growing, the choice of all his brothers. It is brightly layered and brooding in berry and spice, with lovely soft grooves of cinnamon, nutmeg and black pepper. The tannins are polished and supportive.

title: Small Vines 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine opens with a gorgeous, memorable nose of biscotti and hazelnut before unleashing a palate of defined tension and acidity. Light and bright, it has focus and an endearing freshness amidst a powerful embrace of tannin that amplifies its structure.

title: Small Vines 2016 TBH Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Robustly layered in crisp apple, lime and wet stone, this wine offers an intensity on the midpalate of grit and grip before easing into a thirst-quenching fistful of acidity. Complex and structured, it shows potential for aging; enjoy best from 2021–2031.

title: Poseidon 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Spicy floral Hungarian oak aromas and rich, detailed and concentrated fruit and spice-rack flavors give great appeal to this full-bodied and well-balanced wine. It has a plush layered texture, a great foundation of black cherry and complex tea, plus interwoven notes of cinnamon and forest floor.

title: Schramsberg 2009 Extra Brut Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied, steely and austere wine has a pale orange-gold color, citrus and green-apple aromas and crisp, dry flavors like grapefruit. It has light almond and earth accents and is driven by good acidity for a refreshing mouthfeel. Extra brut means truly dry, and this wine shows how appealing the style can be.

title: Sculpterra 2015 Mega Focus Red (Central Coast)
description: Fresh red currants, rose petals, tarragon and thyme meet with vanilla and caramel on the very pleasing nose of this blend of 70% Grenache, 16% Mourvèdre and 14% Syrah. Rosewater shows on the palate along with fresh cherry and strawberry flavors, wrapped in light tannins and judicious acidity. It goes down easy.

title: Shannon 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Red Hills)
description: An enticing aroma of toasted oak meets spicy ripe peach and pear flavors in this full-bodied luxuriously creamy wine. It has vanilla, nutmeg and ginger notes and a mouth-coating texture that is also well supported by acidity. Oaky, yes; delicious and balanced, also yes.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Estate Grown & Bottled Vermentino (Adelaida District)
description: This is a dynamic and lovely white wine that checks all the boxes. Aromas of melon and Meyer lemon meet with honeysuckle and wet cement on the nose. The palate is framed by a grippy tension, yet shows welcoming flavors of nectarine and pear. A powerful streak of lime acidity slices through it all.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rounded aromas of Meyer lemon and white peach are quite plush, and there are hints of butter and oak also slipping into the nose of this bottling. There is great zip to the sip, where rich flavors of pan-fried apples are cut by strong acidity.

title: Hanzell 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: There's a note of barrel influence on the nose, a heartiness of oak that weaves within the greater whole as the wine develops. Smooth, rounded richness, a mix of baked apple and hazelnut, provide a textured balance of flavor within lovely highlights of lemongrass and ginger.

title: Kukkula 2014 Pas De Deux Red (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Syrah expertly employs the best of both grapes, blending beastly brawn with floral beauty. Aromas of composting rose petals, forest underbrush, rustic berries and gamy animal hide lead into a savory, complex palate of salted plums, lamb hide and marjoram.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 Headpruned Block Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Herbal in brushy sage, with thick determined tannins, this is a complex worldly wine, leathery and full of black and white pepper. Soy, meat and tobacco also figure in, speaking loudly back to the spine of acidity.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Monitor Ledge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced with a strong grasp of oak, this wine has powerful concentration and body, a mix of dried herb and cedar that tangles with dark chocolate, brown sugar and blackberry cobbler richness.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Jolene's Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From head-trained vines planted more than a century ago, then aged in French oak, this is a bold, plum-driven expression of cherry and berry pie seasoned in cinnamon that's structured and exuberantly full bodied. It offers a bright streak of acidity that keeps it succulent in the glass.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Thick, elongated tannins rule the day in this mountain-grown wine, textured and grippy with a balance of bright acidity. The fruit is brambly in blackberry with dustings of dried herb, cola and clove that accent it well.

title: Niner 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A plump candied-blackberry aroma and a touch of wet slate make for a very inviting nose to this bottling, which is bolstered by 9% Petit Verdot, 5% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. It tightens up on the palate thanks to firm tannins, and delivers flavors of black cherry, milk chocolate and toast. Acidity rises into the finish.

title: Prager 2013 Royal Escort Paladini Vineyard Port (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely from Petite Sirah, this is given three years in neutral barrels and was bottled in 2016. Thick, syrupy, soft and sublime, it imparts a heady decadence of blackberry, cedar and tobacco.

title: Rusack 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A blend of the historic Sierra Madre and Bien Nacido vineyards, this reserve wine shows toasted hazelnut, seared lemon rind, salted apricot and a touch of sour cream on the tangy yet smoky nose. A sharp sandalwood flavors comes through on the sip, along with poached apple, buttered toast and sea salt. It needs a touch more time to come together.

title: Sol Rouge 2014 Gypsy Rouge Red (Red Hills)
description: This Grenache-based wine has very ripe satisfying black-fruit flavors at its core and plenty of good acidity and firm tannins to balance them out. Blackberry, balsam, beef jus and a light touch of black pepper emerge as it opens in the glass.

title: Stolo 2017 Rosé (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is one of the best rosés tasted so far this year, starting with brilliant aromas of bubblegum, white peach, orange rind and crushed chalk. The palate is racy and zips across the tongue with lime and plum flesh flavors.

title: Villa San Juliette 2014 Chorum Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Sweet herb aromas of oregano and tarragon mesh with exotic mulberry, plum and Luxardo cherry on the nose of this blend of 32% Syrah, 16% Grenache, 14% Petit Verdot, 12% Cabernet Franc, 12% Alicante Bouschet, 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Petite Sirah. That herbal intensity carries into the palate, where minty flavors decorate the background of plum fruit.

title: Wallis Family Estate 2015 Seraphim Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Feral aromas of leather and countryside make for a complex backdrop from which to enjoy this well-integrated wine's succulent black fruit, dried herb and clove. Full bodied, it's structured to age, dense from the vintage and appellation, yet softly layered in polished tannin.

title: Beauregard 2016 Beauregard Ranch Chardonnay (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Subtle aromas of white peach flesh, crushed limestone and nectarine blossom decorate the nose of this estate bottling from a pioneering family. The palate is loaded with flint, smoke and a plaster of Paris element in the background, all giving depth to the nectarine cream, key lime spritz and hint of chive flavors.

title: Derby 2013 Project Espana Derby Vineyard Red (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated lilacs, blackberry jam and black-plum jelly make for a very juicy nose on this blend of Tempranillo, Graciano, Grenache and Carignan. The palate is also jammy with ripe purple flowers, gingerbread and more berry jam.

title: Derby 2014 Laura's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Dark and thick in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows black plum and dried purple flowers on the nose. The tannins are soft, mouth coating and eventually quite sticky, carrying flavors of blackberry, black currant, tar and asphalt.

title: Hungry Hawk 2017 Elliot Ranch Albariño (San Diego County)
description: Honey, lemon blossom and white-peach aromas show on the tightly wound nose of this Albariño, which fares well in the warmer Southern California climate. Bright acidity carries flavors of wet stone, edgy citrus and green pear on the palate.

title: RouteStock 2015 Route 29 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Merlot makes its way into this red, softening its extracted red-cherry and cassis flavors and sizable, though integrated, tannins.

title: Wine Spots 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dense, rich and smoky in cherry, bark and clove, this wine is full bodied and inviting, with a big streak of forest floor that's unrelentingly earthy.

title: Boatique 2017 Rosé of Malbec (Red Hills)
description: A rich pink color, plenty of plum and raspberry flavors and a smooth mouthfeel make this full-bodied wine satisfying to sip. It is very well polished in texture, has good fruit concentration and fine balance.

title: Brutocao 2014 Estate Bottled Slow Lope'n Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This light- to medium-bodied wine has fresh, vivid cherry and raspberry flavors and a firm structure to support them. It feels tangy and slightly tannic on the palate and the fruit flavors continue to echo on the finish.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Estate Vineyard Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This extremely ripe and concentrated wine has aromas and flavors like a Port—almost raisiny, almost sweet—that saturate the taste buds, create a broad mouthfeel and linger nicely on the finish. It is full bodied, not very tannic, and rich in texture.

title: Lawer 2015 Betsy's Vineyard Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this shows a thickness of brick, tar and velvety layers of strawberry and blackberry. Full bodied, it's richly conceived and big in style.

title: Lion Ranch 2015 Syrah (Monterey County)
description: Red plums, dried earth, mushrooms and cracked pepper show on the nose of this twist-top bottling. There is a gamy touch to the acid-driven palate, which is dominated by fresh black raspberry and strong flavors of purple flowers.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 The Obsessive Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This proprietary blend of Syrah, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Zinfandel shows reduced black plums and sagebrush on the nose. Roasted strawberry, red plum and sweet sagebrush show on the palate, which has both good acidity and a tannic tension.

title: Morgan 2016 Twelve Clones Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A bit light on the nose, this bottling from 12 clones of Pinot Noir shows aromas of light-red fruit juice and turned earth. The palate shows lots of floral elegance, with rose petals and purple flowers lifting up the core of boysenberry fruit.

title: Paul Dolan 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Both aromatic and flavorful, this full-bodied wine has white tea and butterscotch aromas. Pear and apple flavors carry the smooth, viscous palate.

title: Refugio Ranch 2016 Ineseño Roussanne-Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 60% Roussanne and 40% Viognier starts with an aroma of banana then tightens up toward chalk and crisp nectarine flesh. It's tight and zesty on the palate with flavors of lime curd, red apple, Bosc pear and a hint of chive.

title: Writer's Block 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Good concentrated blackberry and black-cherry flavors ground this excellent, full-bodied and appropriately tannic wine. It has light oak accents, good structure, a gripping mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: La Folia Winery 2016 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)
description: This crisp, straw-colored white wine has interesting touches of complexity in the mineral and prosciutto aromas and the nice combination of savory herb and fresh apple flavors. It's medium bodied and has lively acidity.

title: Noceto 2015 Sangiovese (Amador County)
description: Few California Sangioveses are this true to type and this affordable. Very smooth, supple and well balanced, this wine is medium bodied, flavorful and will be very versatile with food. Good fruit acidity and light tannins add some grip on the palate, as subtle cherry, sage and leather flavors build toward the finish.

title: Pomelo 2017 Rosé (California)
description: This light, fresh wine tastes delicate and crisp, with hints of cherry candy accenting vivid melon and peach flavors. It has an appealing peachy color, lively acidity and pure flavors.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft in structure and tannin profile, this wine is savory in turned earth, sage and violet, with a distinct dried herb flavor to the midpalate and succulent waves of cassis and black raspberry.

title: Uvaggio 2015 Montagna Nera Red (El Dorado)
description: Hints of sage and thyme in the aromas give a nice savory sheen to this generous and fruity wine. It is medium to full bodied, very smooth in mouthfeel, well balanced and moderate in tannins.

title: Black Kite 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Smoky aromas of roasted chicken, sandalwood and oak are cut by strong Meyer lemon rinds on this bottling, which appeals to those with a fondness for rich toasty flavors. It's super zippy on the palate, with orange oil and lemon skin flavors cutting through the toasted pecan nuttiness and hickory smoke.

title: Cambria 2015 Element Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Candied black cherry, smoked pork, cola and crushed asphalt show on the complex, inviting nose of this smaller-block bottling from the estate's large vineyard. The flavors are deep and dark yet not rich or heavy, with hints of tar, black pepper, wild blackberries and black plum, all hung from a firm zippy structure.

title: Abbot's Passage 2014 Due West Nun's Canyon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a high-elevation site, this dark wine is herbal and soft, supple in texture despite considerable ripeness and power. Violet aromas mellow a fistful of dark chocolate and baked plum, as smoky oak wanders by.

title: Bouchaine 2015 Dijon Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Smoky and big-boned, this is a robust, complex and enticing wine, aged in French oak (28% new). Strawberry and balsamic notes are joined by black tea, cardamom and cola on the medium-bodied palate.

title: La Montagne 2013 Kessler-Haak Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Stewed cherry, sarsaparilla, shoe leather and incense aromas show on the nose of this clonal selection from a vineyard in the middle of the appellation. The palate is dominated by eucalyptus oil, pine needle and dewy juniper flavors, set against dark cranberry and black raspberry fruit. The finish is redolent with menthol and cedar.

title: Longboard 2015 Mystos Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Generous in oak and quiet tannin, this is a ripely bold and fruity wine that manages to also be balanced and savory—the texture grainy and gritty. Cardamom, dried herb and cola play well against black cherry and rhubarb.

title: Furthermore 2014 Nevina's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Savory cardamom and cola ride along a bright fresh core of fruity cherry in this well-made and balanced wine. Forest floor and a dash of white pepper contribute additional complexity and spice. This is a lighter take on coastal fruit.

title: Hall 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Hugely concentrated, this wine has power to spare, within its full-bodied richness and fruity succulence. Blackberry, black cherry and milk chocolate combine effortlessly to provide a pleasurable experience of complexity met by supportive acidity and exotic spice.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: This comes from the producer's own estate and from its top blocks of old vines. Spiced, it's also herbal in cedar and sandalwood, in addition to black licorice. Thick and spicy, it has enough acidity to brighten denser pockets of blackberry and black cherry. It shows plenty of structure for long-term enjoyment.

title: Husch 2015 Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A great example of a beautiful, focused wine, this medium-bodied offering from one of Anderson Valley's stalwarts has wonderful pure fruity aromas, a rich texture that's well supported by moderate tannins, and expressive red and black cherry flavors accented by cinnamon and all-spice.

title: Luna 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Made from 100% varietal grapes, the wine aged 22 months in 65% new French oak.This is a robustly crafted, powerfully concentrated experience, thick and hugely extracted in black fruit and black pepper. Leathery in texture, it has a fistful of oak that should settle down with cellaring. Enjoy best 2024 through 2034.

title: Mira 2014 Jimmy D's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from half Syrah and smaller parts Petit Verdot (35%) and Cabernet Franc (15%). Barnyard rusticity overwhelms at first before allowing other savory elements to speak. Leather, mushroom and cigar ride atop black currant and plum as generous tannins struggle successfully to soften by the finish.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 V Collection Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Dark gold in color, this is a creamy, full-figured wine made with supportive oak. Lively acidity provides fresh contrast to its richer tendencies, as a length of apple spice and fennel pique interest on the thick palate.

title: Pali 2015 Rancho la Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh aromas of licorice-laced plum, chaparral herbs and pristine alpine strawberry show on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The clean palate balances tart and ripe flavors, with firm tannins veiling the fruit and spice, and a flash of thyme showing on the finish.

title: Pech Merle 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Sourced from the Blue Rock Vineyard, this contains 8% Cabernet Franc, an addition that contributes violet aromatics. Crayon wax, plum and juicy cherry-blackberry are wrapped within integrated tannin and plenty of lasting power seasoned in black pepper and clove.

title: Robert Biale 2014 Basic Black Red (Sonoma County)
description: Meant to be brawny explosive wine, this blends 25% Syrah, 22% Grenache, 20% Petite Sirah, 17% Carignane and smaller drops of Zinfandel, Alicante Bouschet and Tempranillo in a classic field-blend style. Juicy and expansive on the palate, it has meaty tannin and leather as well as licorice, violet and pepper,. A lengthy streak of black pepper finishing things out.

title: Round Pond 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Blended with 12% Petit Verdot, this is a thick, extracted young wine, full of black cherry, chalky tannins and a gritty, grippy texture. Hugely present in power and oak, it will do well in the cellar. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Talley 2015 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This appellation blend allows a more affordable taste of the Talley family's Chardonnay excellence. This bottling shows aromas of Meyer lemon skins, warm nectarine, sea salt, tangerine pith and wet sidewalk. Rounded salt and stone fruit flavors show on the sip, but the citrusy acidity is persistent, cutting through the slight butter warmth. Caramel pops on the finish.

title: Barton 2015 Landslide Jurassic Park Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling dials in strongly to a crushed chalk aroma, which is peppered over the lemon pith and rainy sidewalk scents. It's very fresh and tightly wound on the palate, with lime spray, beeswax, a touch of petrol and a slight botanical element.

title: Bear Flag 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: This wine pays homage to a historic revolt in Sonoma in 1846. Waves of dark cherry and vanilla surround a strong core of integrated oak and supple texture in this well-made wine. Ripe, full-bodied and well-balanced, this wine will please many a palate with ease.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Grand Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This affordable red succeeds in offering full-bodied dark cherry and black-currant flavors among an expansive palate of integrated oak and structured tannins. The finish is an extended mix of cinnamon, toast and chocolate tones.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 Therese Vineyards Viognier (Arroyo Seco)
description: Though light on the nose, there is a distinctive toasted hazelnut aromas on this bottling along with nectarine cream, brioche and citrus rind. The palate is a fuller expression yet without becoming tropical, offering toast with marmalade flavors, a lively acidity and a grippy texture.

title: Noceto 2013 Linsteadt Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Raspberry, earth and leather aromas lead to rich, deep and savory flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and nicely funky wine. It goes beyond the simple fruit and acidity of many Barberas and adds a lot of complexity.

title: Parker 2015 Camp 4 Vineyard Roussanne (Santa Barbara County)
description: Honey, lemon curd, plumeria and white jasmine aromas meet with poached apple on the nose of this bottling. It's subtle on the palate and smoothed out with even flavors of roasted pear, caramelized apple, lemon juice and toast.

title: Parrish Family 2014 Silken Red (Paso Robles)
description: A dense plummy nose of milk chocolate and cherry compote is quite unctuous for this dark brooding blend of 62% Cabernet Sauvignon and 38% Petite Sirah. It's very soft and welcoming upon entry to the palate, showing slightly tart yet plush plum and fig flavors. The tannins are still sticky at this young age.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending sizable portions of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with Cabernet Franc, this approachable mix opens in a succulence of cherry and berry that remain juicy through the fleshy midpalate and finish. The oak is well-integrated and the tannins softened.

title: Raeburn 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This lovely and lingering white impresses from start to finish, showing a wealth of pear and peach flavors within an inviting jasmine aroma. It finishes in swift teases of wild vanilla and subtle oak.

title: Ram's Gate 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine has a feral aspect to it—a mix of wild mushroom and gritty stone, with the grit and grip persistent on the palate. Asian pear, apple and nutmeg highlight a full-bodied concentration nuanced in toasted oak.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Rosé (Monterey County)
description: Very pale pink in the glass, this offers a bright, vivacious nose full of bubblegum sticks and watermelon water. The palate is grippy in texture and lively in acidity, showing delicious but light strawberry flavors.

title: Seven Oxen 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Rusty red cherry, dried anise and a hint of carnation show on the nose of this bottling. A rose petal flavor is strong on the lightly bodied palate, where a firm tannic structure and solid acidity frame soft, welcoming flavors of Concord grape and vanilla on the finish.

title: Seven Peaks 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: What a wonderful value. Smooth and subtle, this medium-bodied wine layers raspberry and light earthy aromas over a smooth palate of ripe plum, tea leaf and baking spices. Soft tannins blend in nicely with a touch of good acidity for very nice balance.

title: Sojourn 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is an approachable, rounded and likable appellation wine, robustly built and shy in fruit, with soft, smooth layers of clove, red cherry and plum.

title: Sojourn 2015 Home Ranch Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Warm spices override a wealth of blackberry crumble in this robust wine, substantial in concentration and richness. Toasty smoky oak plays a background part, allowing the wine to remain fruit forward and soft on the palate.

title: Sojourn 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: An appellation wine that impresses with its complexity, this offers earthy tones of bark, cinnamon and wild strawberry within a sultry sleek texture that's spicy and moderately structured.

title: Sojourn 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy compost aromas and notions of forest floor tease the nose of this wine, which shows high-toned spiky acidity underneath strawberry, cranberry and rhubarb flavors. It is full bodied and concentrated in ripeness.

title: Sol Rouge 2013 Cinsault (Red Hills)
description: This variety is rare in California, but wouldn't be if they were all as good as this nicely funky, meaty wine. It combines earthy beefy mushroomy flavors with good plummy bass notes on a medium to full body, along with light tannins adding some grip.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Entanglement G-S-M (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 55% Syrah, 36% Grenache and 9% Mourvèdre offers unctuous flavors of blueberry and blackberry wrapped in sweet vanilla and full-bodied ripeness.

title: Valance 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, made in a small-production from Howell Mountain fruit. Dense black cherry and blackberry dominate around supersize tannins that are grippy and strong. It also offers a wealth of dried herb and sage. This wine will do well in the cellar; enjoy best 2023–2030.

title: Wild Thing 2017 Rendezvous Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: A deep pink color and bold fruit and spice flavors help this wine stand out from the pack. Made from mostly old-vine Carignan, it is full bodied, rounded and rich on the palate, yet has good acidity and a glimmer of tannin to add structure. Winemaker Carol Shelton achieves concentration that helps the flavors hang in there for a lingering finish.

title: Armida 2015 Il Campo Estate Field Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a traditional field blend consisting of 80% Zinfandel, 18% Petite Sirah and 2% mixed blacks. It's juicy and seductively soft, a study of blackberry, wild herb, toasted oak and grainy leather. It holds its full-bodied ripeness well.

title: Pestoni Family 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Rutherford)
description: Sophisticated and hearty, this is a well-made 100% varietal wine, juicy in black cherry, with a nice waft of wood-fired-oven smoke. Thick, it finds a smoothness of velvety texture as it opens, offering a length of leather, tobacco and black pepper.

title: Summerland 2014 Theresa Noelle Estate Proprietors Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intriguing aromas of rust, kirsch, dusty leather, crushed star anise, white pepper and li hing mui spice make for an earthy spicy nose on this reserve bottling. It's light in body and delicate in structure on the sip, combining baked earth, red fruit and a strong oregano touch on the finish.

title: Treana 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a great buy for those that  crave creamy, ripe wines. Aromas of black-cherry syrup, pie crust, salted caramel, snickerdoodle, brown sugar and maple syrup prove intoxicating. The palate is soft, thick and saucy, with more dark fruit flavors alongside vanilla, star anise and roasted cocoa.

title: Vineyard 511 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Rounded strawberry and blackberry flavors show on the luxuriously soft palate, giving a sense of richness and power. Accented in cedar and leather, it has an herbal underbelly that balances well against the ripe fruit.

title: Webster Cellars 2013 Arriere Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 60% Merlot with 40% Syrah—a successful marriage that is well structured and modest in ripeness. Cedar, wooded tannin and pencil shavings provide an Old-World character set against a backdrop of juicy tart red fruit and black pepper.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2014 Syrah (Templeton Gap District)
description: Cola, baked black cherry, crushed gravel, spice cake and root beer aromas make for a very inviting nose on this bottling from one of Paso Robles' cooler regions. A baked-goods flavor starts the sip before crisp, tangy fruit, penetrating acidity and chalky tannins take hold.

title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2014 Julia's Estate Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is well structured and nicely balanced. It feels elegant on the palate and has an enticing array of complex aromas and flavors. Raspberry, wood smoke and tea scents are followed by nuances of plum, cedar and cinnamon, while fine-grained tannins and good acidity keep the mouthfeel fresh.

title: LXV 2015 Lover's Spell Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling is extremely ripe and rich with black cherry syrup, milk chocolate and butterscotch aromas, proving very inviting, if slightly dessert-like. Those elements extend to the sip, where blackberry pie, candied blueberries, caramel and vanilla prove very tasty and perfect for those seeking a whopper wine.

title: MaidenStoen 2016 Coast View Vineyard Riesling (Monterey County)
description: Freshly cut melon and white lily flowers meet with pear skins and wet clay on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the mountains east of Salinas. The palate is rounded at first, with ripe nectarine flavors, but then a powerful acidity slices down the center, carrying tart lime skins, lemon rind and yellow grapefruit elements.

title: Pali 2015 Pali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromatic lines of squeezed lime, seared orange rind, white flowers and plaster show on the nose of this bottling from the winery's first estate vineyard. The oak flavors are present but restrained on the sip, where Meyer lemon cream and ocean spray ride a steady acidity deep into the finish.

title: Pali 2015 Rio Vista Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There are prominent hints of pine needle and menthol that ride atop the core of bright red cherries and rusty alpine strawberries on this single-vineyard bottling. The palate seamlessly integrates those juniper, dill and mint notes into the cranberry, raspberry and pomegranate juice flavors, all presented on a soft texture.

title: Pali 2016 Huntington Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling is one of the most reliably delicious Pinot Noirs for less than $30 each vintage, and this year is one of the best. Warm, even buttery aromas of brioche, strawberry jam and baking spice prove immensely inviting, leading into an approachable yet complex palate where fruit-punch flavors are lifted by clove, tart plum skins and vanilla on the finish.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Rector Creek Vineyard Block 5 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Peppery, soft and supple, this blend of Cabernet Franc, Zinfandel and Cabernet Sauvignon is brawny and full bodied. It is a strongly concentrated wine with highlights of dried cherry, baked plum and dried herb.

title: Peake Ranch 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong smoky character to this bottling, with pork roast and hickory smoke rising above the cranberry compote and orange rind aromas on the nose. The smoke extends to the sip as well, but there's also a strong and tangy pomegranate and sour cherry-flavor profile.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: The humble veteran Bruce McGuire has been making Syrah for decades, and this bottling offers stunning value. Lively aromas of tart black plum skins, white pepper, tar and rainy asphalt lead into a refreshingly acidic though complex sip with flavors of lavender, potpourri and blackberry juice that float across the palate.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 LPF Red (Adelaida District)
description: Dense aromas of woody blackberry, hints of bay leaf and thyme and a dusting of crushed graphite show on this elegant blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Petit Verdot. It's a very regal wine on the palate, with firm upright tannins conveying flavors of black plum, leather, tobacco and black pepper.

title: Wait Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Austere in elegant restraint, this wine is floral and focused, in brightly effusive layers of tart apple and pear. A thread of toasty oak and anise contributing beguiling side notes.

title: Whitcraft 2016 The Mind Behind's Vineyard Le Bon Climat Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Broad aromas of Asian pear, yellow flowers, Stargazer lily and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers nectarine and Pink Lady apple, and it remains very tightly wound long after opening, which indicates a long life ahead.
designation: The Mind Behind's Vineyard Le Bon Climat

title: Birichino 2015 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)
