description: Strawberry, red plum and dried rose petals float atop a very rocky core on the nose of this old vine expression, where wet gravel and crushed river stones serve as a backdrop. The palate is bouncy and fresh with wild raspberry set against crushed-concrete minerality.

title: Ehret 2012 Hillside Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Winemaker Nick Goldschmidt is behind this thick tannic wine, blended with nearly 17% Cabernet Franc. With big shoulders and a depth of extraction, it shines in forest pine, dark plum and dark chocolate—the oak toasty and robust.

title: Zoetic Wines 2015 Hop Kiln Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is spicy and earthy, with brawny, rustic and ripe waves of cherry and vanilla at its core. Simple in structure it's robust in tannin and oak, aspects that persist on the finish.

title: Luna 2014 Riserva Sangiovese (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, aged for 20 months in French and Hungarian oak. Tart and plushy, it has a level of rusticity that serves it well. Thick tannins meet a smoky oaky core of wood and dried herb.

title: Midnight 2014 Nebula Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Light black cherry aromas meet with a bit of rose petal, vanilla and pie crust on the rustic nose of this bottling. It's easy sipping on the palate, where roasted red berries meet with hot earth and a touch of charred beef.

title: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A dash of Carignane contributes to the whole of this easygoing likable wine. Softly layered baked plum and prune flavors are given additional heft and roundness from a richer undertone of caramel and brown sugar.

title: Chesebro 2016 Cedar Lane Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Sour grapefruit pith, wet clay, cut grass and a hint of white flowers show on the slightly reductive nose of this bottling, which opens up with a bit of patience. The acidity gives zip to the sip, where wet concrete and lime skin flavors shine.

title: Clif Family 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Tannic and rustic, this is a straightforward presentation of ripe rich plum and oak, along with sizable seasonings of pepper and leather.

title: En Garde 2014 Starkey Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy mint and tobacco leaf linger around a lightly structured wall of tart earth and cola in this site-designate wine.

title: Austerity 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Relatively elegant aromas of black currant, blueberry, loam, oregano and thyme show on the nose of this widely available bottling. The palate is simpler, with cocoa dust, black cherry, pepper and tannins that tighten into the finish.

title: Beringer 2016 Founders' Estate Pinot Noir (California)
description: Plummy flavors and a broad, soft texture make this wine taste ripe and plush. It blends lightly smoky and oaky nuances with butter and jam that accentuate an almost sweet character.

title: Scott Family 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Cured meat and oak add richness to an otherwise light-bodied expression of the grape. Floral in apple blossom aromas, it follows through with additional flavors of Gravenstein apple, pear and a lemony hit of freshness on the finish.

title: Truchard 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Medium in body and high in acidity, this herbal wine shows a tartness of sour cherry and baked rhubarb flavor, held tight within a subtle casing of oak.

title: Church & State 2014 Lost Inhibitions White (California)
description: Pleasant fig and pear flavors fill out this medium-bodied and rather subtly flavored wine. It tastes ripe enough, but not overly rich, has good concentration and an earthy component

title: Decoy 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This wine pulls from across the wider appellation to combine cool-climate grapes with warmer regions. Round and easygoing, it offers fleshy fine flavors of pineapple and peach, its oak integrated and unobtrusive.

title: District 7 Wines 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Extreme lawn clipping and green bell pepper aromas show on the nose of this bottling, with slightly rounder hints of guava, passion fruit and struck flint also arising. It's a bit riper on the sip, with yellow pear, Key lime, rainy cement and wet hay flavors.

title: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Wien Chateau Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: An abundance of white flowers and sweet grassiness (along with some ripe pear) shows on the nose of this bottling from a newer property in Temecula. Apples and nectarine flavors reveal themselves at first on the sip, which then grows more sour with cut grass and apple rind elements.

title: Gainey 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very clean aromas of Pink Lady apple, ripe Asian pear, squeezed Meyer lemon and a touch of wet stone prove refreshing on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of peach and Key lime pie ripeness to the sip, yet the wet cement minerality also shows through. It could use a touch more zippy acid.

title: District 7 Wines 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Fresh lemon and lime zest aromas are sharp in the nose of this bottling, cutting into the oak smoke character. The mouthfeel is round and creamy, with more oak as well as melted butter, apple and lemon flavors. It is a solid midweek Chard.

title: Hess 2016 Select Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Fresh Key lime aromas meet with touches of guava, plumeria and lemongrass on the steely nose of this bottling. There's a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, leaning a bit more toward Sauvignon Blanc than Chardonnay, with flavors of guava gum, green papaya, lime and grass.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Chardonnay (San Diego County)
description: This is a promising wine for SoCal Chardonnay, starting with aromas of lemon peels, sea salt, cream and honeysuckle. The palate is a tad sweet, with apple syrup and candied lemon flavors, but the mouthfeel is creamy and the acidity is good.

title: Sofia 2016 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Monterey County)
description: Extremely vigorous bubbles want to explode with the slightest swirl of the glass on this bottling, which is pretty solid for the price. Aromas of candied strawberry, yeast and cherry Starburst candy show on the nose, while the palate carries flavors of stewed strawberry and a hint of yeast. It's slightly sweet but not overbearing and will please a diverse crowd.

title: Michael Sullberg 2015 Lot 91 Reserve Merlot (California)
description: This is a well-behaved, nicely balanced wine with good cherry and sage flavors, an appetizing texture livened by light tannins and a touch of acidity. It should be versatile with food and easy to pour for a crowd.

title: Outlot 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Full bodied and intensely ripe, this wine is expansive and juicy, with pronounced oak across the palate and fully sketched flavors of baked pear, apple and peach. The structure is moderate and the finish sweet in vanilla.

title: LXV 2015 Crimson Jewel Hearthstone Vineyard Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 80% Sangiovese and 20% Petit Verdot shows punchy aromas of strawberry, hibiscus and light licorice on the nose. The palate combines the red fruit with a pinch of mace and touch of savory herbs, with rising acidity toward the finish.

title: Gen5 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Lots of fresh dark-fruit flavor and a silky texture make this wine easy to sip and enjoy. Touches of spiciness and milk chocolate give it a sweet edge, and the tannins are soft on the palate.

title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2016 Bin 5757 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: A value-driven proposition that's been left unoaked, this wine is fully creamy and robust despite its lack of wood, shining in lemon and grapefruit flavor and a depth of texture. It finishes clean and crisp.

title: Captûre 2016 Tradition Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County-Lake County)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, with a small percentage of grapes from Lake County, this light-bodied white is bristling in acidity, highlighted in quince, lemon, melon and a shock of grass.

title: Layer Cake 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Very ripe pear and peach aromas meet with coconut and white lily on the nose of this bottling. Lime, peach and yellow-melon flavors show on the slightly vinous sip.

title: Castle Rock 2015 Cuvée Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a very affordable, gentle, medium-bodied wine with good ripe-fruit flavors, hints of spice and a soft, plush texture. It's smooth to sip and has a welcome sense of ripeness along with low acidity.

title: Gracianna 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright vibrant acidity persists in this vineyard-specific wine, made in a fleshy full-bodied style with plenty of toasted oak and gravelly, tannic texture.

title: San Luis Bay Winery 2014 Rosé of Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: A deep shade of mauve in the glass, this rosé conveys much of its Syrah parentage, starting with aromas of rust, wet earth, dark plum and dewy herbs. Thyme and dark cherry fruit show on the palate, which is texturally sound although a somewhat odd expression overall. Might be better billed as simply a light Syrah.

title: California Republic 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a very pleasant well-proportioned wine that goes from ripe pear aromas to full expressive peach and pear flavors carried on a lush smooth texture. It's soft on the palate and low in acidity.

title: CK Mondavi 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Attractive dark-fruit flavors and a smooth texture lend a lot of appeal to this medium-bodied wine despite a reduced, earthy character in the aroma at first, which is not uncommon in screw-capped wines.

title: Friedeman 2015 UV Lancel Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Baked cherry, pine forest and earthy compost combine in this medium-bodied lightly oaked wine from a vineyard planted to multiple clones of the variety. Native fermentation lets the fruit and spice speak quietly.

title: Gnarly Head 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Oaky and extroverted, this full-bodied wine smells lightly smoky and full of baking spices. The flavors resemble sweet cherries, strawberry jam and a touch of maple.

title: Hunted 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Extremely fruity jammy aromas and flavors ride a soft juicy texture in this smooth easy-drinking wine. It's low in tannins and acidity, and has a sweet accent like maple syrup.

title: Jon Nathaniel 2014 Bodacious Red (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy mushroom and leather greet the nose and palate in this combination of mostly Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Tannic, with a softer landing on the finish, it offers heightened flavors of plum and black cherry.

title: Moss Roxx 2014 Ancient Vine Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A boisterous smoky oaky streak dominates this full-bodied wine from the aromas of charred meat and maple syrup to flavors of blackberry syrup and smoked bacon. It's an extreme treatment that not everyone will love, but it stands out in a group of purely fruity wines.

title: One Leaf 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: An obvious stamp of oak spices and butter defines this medium to full-bodied wine as it goes from butterscotch aromas to vanilla and eggnog flavors that have a sweet edge. The texture is smooth and rich.

title: Reyes 2009 Merlot (Los Angeles County)
description: Dried blueberries, thick blackberry jam and gingerbread aromas show on the nose of this older bottling from the Agua Dulce region. The palate is thick and tarry with flavors of charred beef and more blueberries. It's still alive, at least.

title: Velvet Bee 2016 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A yellowish shade of pink in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of yellow peach and orange rind. Seared lemon rinds appears on the sip, alongside a touch of walnut in what is almost an oxidative style.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: The Jackson Estate wines are usually a couple of steps above K-J Vintner's Reserve. Full ripeness and a moderate vein of sweet-seeming oak make this full-bodied wine taste sunny and appealing. Black-cherry and baking-spice aromas lead to juicy generous fruit flavors.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is a strong woody touch to the nose of this bottling along with dried peach and dried mango aromas. The palate begins with a strong citrus-peel flavor then leads into green-pear and cider-apple flavors. The finish is a unique touch of kaffir lime leaf and lemongrass, which would go well with a wide variety of food.

title: Roblar 2016 Estate Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fresh aromas of black raspberry, lavender, wet gravel and cedar are an impressive welcome to this estate focus on a variety that's rarely used alone. The palate balances chalky, firm tannins with black-currant, blackberry-jam and dark slate flavors.

title: Bernardus 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegantly earthy on the nose, this bottling starts with aromas of pomegranate, rose petals and dried herbs. The palate is quite tart with flavors of sour Montmorency cherry, and the savory dusting of herbs and baked earth balances the sip.

title: Brandlin 2013 Henry's Keep Proprietary Red (Mount Veeder)
description: From the proprietor's mountain estate, this combines 73% Cabernet Sauvignon with 14% Malbec, 7% Petit Verdot and 6% Cabernet Franc. Together, they mingle in a planky, oak-driven midpalate of compost, cedar and blackberry, with swathes of dark chocolate running through.

title: Briceland 2017 Phelps Vineyard Chardonnay (Humboldt County)
description: Rather reserved in style, this wine from remote Humboldt County on the Pacific Coast offers mild fruity, savory aromas, a good broad mouthfeel and flavors that blend pear and apple with more mineral and flinty accents. It's not overtly oaky but interesting and subtle.

title: Clos La Chance 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Rounded aromas of honeysuckle, lemonade, tangerine rind and gardenia make for a nose that's both broad and sharp on his wine. The palate is crisp and tight with citrus, but also shows Pink Lady apple, ripe pear, white peach and a pinch of salt.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Russian River Selection Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This lovely, light-hearted white offers an approachable embrace of firm lemon, fig and mango. It is acid-driven on the palate, with just a touch of lushness on the structured finish.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Por Vida Estate Red (Adelaida District)
description: Strawberry and cranberry aromas are hit with white-pepper spice on the nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 41% Primitivo and 9% Mourvèdre. There is lively acid on the palate, where fresh black raspberry and more pepper flavors meet with sage and thyme.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Palisades Vineyard Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
description: Polished tannin and subtle oak await further aging in support of this wine's powerful concentration of violet, molasses and black fig. Peppery, the spice contrasts well against the deeper, richer well of dark chocolate and graham cracker. Enjoy best 2026–2030.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Varozza Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Soft red fruit comes lightly spiced in this vineyard-designate, from a site in the heart of the appellation. It's plush and lush, with plenty of body and weight: a graceful companion for the table.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Rockaway Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This vineyard outside of Geyserville is known for contributing great concentration to its wines and this vintage is no exception. Chalky tannins, mocha and cedar wrap around a broad, full-bodied structure that boasts an impressive backbone of succulent cassis and black cherry.

title: Via Romano 2015 Barbera (El Dorado County)
description: This is a really well-made, flavorful and nicely balanced wine from a new winery that's doing exciting things. It's full bodied, moderately tannic and moderately acidic which is typical of the varietal, but backed by wonderful ripe black-cherry, black-olive and black-pepper flavors.

title: Wolff 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A pale shade of pink in the glass, this Grenache-based rosé is excellent, starting with soft aromas of bubblegum and pink lemonade. The palate is zesty, fresh and framed by persistent acid, with tangy raspberry, plum-skin and tight pomegranate flavors captured in a taut texture.

title: Ampelos 2015 Ampelos Vineyard Syrache Syrah-Grenache (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This blends 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache from the estate site. The wine is bright and fresh on the nose, a whiff of peppery meat and earthy leather arriving first. The midplate takes on more ripe concentration in brambly blackberry and strawberry.

title: Belden Barns 2016 Serendipity Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: From what the producer considers its best pocket of vineyard, planted to multiple clones, this is a beautifully expressive wine, well-integrated and delicately layered, with a flowing, silky texture. The flavors delve into raspberry, strawberry and black tea, humming along to an earthy finish.

title: Bernardus 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe but sour cherry aromas meet with purple flowers, hibiscus, subtle chaparral and a hint of juniper on the nose of this bottling. It's energetic on the palate, with earthy clay flavors playing against the background of rhubarb, red plums and orange rinds.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: With a touch of spice from well-integrated oak, this is a fresh and fruity white from a remarkable vineyard site, one of the best in the appellation. It shows balance within a context of undeniable ripeness and grip, the flavor defined in baked apple, almond and cinnamon.

title: Buehler 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a great value for a wine of such quality, made with a handful of Petite Sirah that grows in the same field-blended site. Layered and grippy, it shows structured blackberry and mocha flavors around secondary tones of leather and earth.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very earthy on the front end, this clonal selection presents aromas of dark hibiscus, baked red fruits, pine forest floor, peppercorn and wild herbs. Tangy cranberry and sour cherry show on the sip, where a decent tension frames the palate.

title: Phillips Hill 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Great structure and a brilliant sense of restraint make this vividly flavored and medium-bodied wine a keeper—and nearly as good as the winery's vineyard designates. A couple of years in a cellar or cool closet will enhance its red cherry, tea leaf and rhubarb flavors while softening the rather lean texture just a bit. The wine is elegant, appetizing and will be best after 2020.

title: Portalupi 2015 Shake Ridge Ranch Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a standout wine that tastes ripe and full, but also has good balance, a polished texture and a wonderful sense of layering and finesse. Blueberry, blackberry and dark chocolate waft from the glass and equally generous flavors coat the palate, propelled by a velvety layer of fine-grained tannins and full body.

title: Sanguis 2014 Misfit Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Black currant, plum skins and roasted pork aromas show on the nose of this Syrah that's enhanced by Grenache, Petite Sirah, Viognier and Roussanne. Char siu flavors meet with lilacs, violets, charred beef and roasted plums on the palate.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Veteran winemaker Bruce McGuire packs telltale freshness in every bottling, and this reserve is no different, with buoyant aromas of black currant, crushed violets and black licorice. The palate's snappy blackberry flavors are cut by hints of anise, bay leaf and dill, with plenty of purple-flower lift.

title: Sol Rouge 2013 Cabernet Franc (Red Hills)
description: This rich and layered wine has deep fruit flavors, a wonderful spiciness, firm structure and a lingering finish. It tastes like black olives, black cherries, cloves and wood smoke and has a wonderful, rounded mouthfeel backed by soft tannins.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)
description: This affordable red is high-toned in strawberry and a juicy earthiness, its use of oak and moderate power well-integrated. Smooth and velvety on the palate, it finishes in a bright tease of red licorice.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2014 John Sebastiano Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: From a vineyard on the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills, this bottling shows candied boysenberry, mocha, cherry compote, star anise and cinnamon on the nose. The palate is layered with tons of spice, from star anise and clove to licorice, which add depth to the black cherry base. The tannins are soft and polished.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This bottling from a new winery in Ojai shows salty lemons and lush nectarine on the nose alongside a touch of chives and roasted chicken flesh. The palate deftly blends browned butter with crisp citrusy freshness and a strong textural grip, proving refreshing and rich at the same time. The finish is chalky with hints of sea salt caramel and sliced apple.

title: Ashes & Diamonds 2015 Blanc No. 1 White (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of equal parts Sémillon and Sauvignon Blanc, barrel-fermented and aged in 40% new French oak for one year. It's fresh and alive in orange blossom aromatics and strong impressions of peach, pear and green apple. A bold streak of minerality gives it a hint of gravel and rock.

title: Benziger 2015 De Coelo Quintus Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A fruity nose opens the way to piquant, tart acidity in this coastal cool-climate wine. Concentrated extracted flavors of pomegranate and Bing cherry dominate, rounded by a grit of texture and cola spice.

title: Birichino 2016 Bechthold Vineyard Old Vines Cinsault (Mokelumne River)
description: This is a fresh, lively and refreshing bottling from old vines, which often offer deep complexity on a lighter frame. Aromas of rose petals, hibiscus, cranberry and wet cement lead into a palate full of crisp red currant, tangy strawberry, and a stunningly rocky minerality. Serve slightly chilled.

title: Black Kite 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a compelling mix of sweeter fruit and dry earth on the nose of this bottling, with strawberry compote and rusty rock aromas along with a vanilla-laced brioche. The palate loses the ripe fruit a bit, instead showing tighter and fresh flavors of black raspberry with anise, white pepper and sagebrush, proving quite sleek and restrained in style.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Old Vines Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is deep in fruit flavors, and has impressive structure in terms of extraction, body and an abundance of fine-grained tannin. It brings soft black cherry and cedar to the aroma, dark chocolate and blueberry to the palate and coats the mouth with a firm but velvety texture. Best after 2020.

title: Foley 2015 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smoked pork, dark soil, forest floor, purple flowers and dark-purple fruit show on the nose of this bottling. Rust and dried hibiscus petals are evident on the sip along with potpourri-laced cranberry and carnation flavors. It is quite complex and tasty.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Salty and floral, this wine offers deft layers of green apple, peach and pineapple—its richness subdued and in check—rounded by a bouquet of freshness that persists from start to finish. There's texture and complexity within nuance and restraint.

title: Heritance 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Soft and fleshy, this is a nicely made, well-structured wine, dusty in black currant, clove and cedar notes, showing plenty of varietal character. Billowy tannins surround secondary flavors of black cherry and tobacco which add to its muted power and grace.

title: Mt. Brave 2014 Merlot (Mount Veeder)
description: Largely structured and weighty, this well-made wine is youthful in its grippy tannins and full embrace of huckleberry and black-cherry fruit, the exuberance tempered by complements of black licorice and toasted oak. This will be happy in the cellar; enjoy best 2024–2029.

title: Paris Valley Road 2014 Zinfandel (California)
description: Full bodied and nicely dry, this well-built wine starts with smoky black-pepper aromas that lead to mouthfilling blackberry and black-cherry flavors supported by firm tannins. It's the kind of wine that will pair beautifully with a meaty or cheesy meal, because it has the texture to match that kind of richness.

title: Pence Ranch 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a great and extremely fairly priced taste of what the Pence team is up to on the eastern edge of the appellation. Sweet sandalwood, red plum, mulberry, black tea, juniper and a hint of maple show on the nose. The palate combines tart black-plum skins with cherry tomato and dewy garden-herb flavors.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: From a single site in Carneros, the Stewart Vineyard, this wine is exuberant in red fruit, with a sly hint of tobacco and tomato leaf. Big ripe tannins wrap around a meaty side show of garrigue and black pepper, finishing in elegant ripeness.

title: Korbel NV Extra Dry Sparkling (California)
description: This plush and lightly sweet wine combines aromas of white cherry and white peach on the nose, with ample fruit and spice notes on the palate. Fruitiness builds with each sip while a smooth, plush effervescence coats the mouth.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Lee Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Velvety in thick dense tannins, this wine is stemmy and earthy, with an exotic hint of clove and tobacco. There's a lingering hit of smoked cherry on the midpalate, finishing in oak.

title: Alara 2016 Late Harvest Viognier (San Benito County)
description: Very viscous and darkish yellow in the glass, this dessert wine offers fairly dainty aromas of smoke, oak and lemon sorbet. It's thick and sweet at first on the sip, but settles into honey and pleasant oak, with a savory roasted chicken finish.

title: Alara 2017 Viognier (San Benito County)
description: Refreshing aromas of key lime, pear flesh and the slightest hint of sweet oak show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is crisp and tight with Asian pear and lime-pith flavors, wrapped in a decent tannic tension.

title: Cosa Obra 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick and relatively rich, with a nutty underbelly, this white offers peach and pineapple flavors up front before making room for brighter aspects of lemon peel and grapefruit.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV2 Estate Four Clones Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dusty dried herb and tobacco frame a compressed structure of tightly wound tannin and oak in this chewy grippy wine. Black pepper and savory leather override the brambly blackberry and dark cherry with ease, finishing like a cup of strong coffee.

title: Dusty Nabor 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Loads of purple flowers, cassis and black raspberry framboise show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe strawberries, black plums and figs arise on the sip, where they are enhanced by minty pinches of tarragon.

title: Eric Kent 2015 Stiling Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral in rose petals on the nose, this hearty red is creamy in texture, with a lushness on the midpalate. The flavors are dipped in raspberry, orange and brioche.

title: Estancia 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Light citrus aromas and tangy apple flavors give this light-bodied wine a lively personality. From a long-time value-oriented brand, it has good fruit acidity, very fresh fruit flavor nuances and a crisp, clean finish.

title: Flora Springs 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Chalky tannins wrap around sizable oak, sage, tobacco and cedar in this full-bodied 100% varietal wine. An herbaceous component dominates on the back of the palate.

title: JCB 2015 No 6 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoked cherry and blackberry contribute richness to this wine's toasted quality of full-bodied intensity and flabby fleshy structure.

title: Kessler-Haak 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh honeysuckle and ripe lemons meet with white peach, roasted nuts and toast on the nose of this bottling. The zesty palate is mouthwatering with flavors of lemon and apple, framed by decent tannic tension.

title: Reynoso 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Intensely built, this wine offers sleek, velvety texture and a ripe body of dark-fruit flavor. Forest floor, black tea and Asian spice mingle well with black-cherry and wild strawberry robustness.

title: Trentadue 2015 La Storia Block 500 Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose and aromatic in balsamic, this wine features tight-grained oak and a sizable grip of tannin, with dense, layered flavors of blackberry, dark cherry and leather.

title: Wilson Foreigner 2017 Rorick Vineyard Albariño (Sierra Foothills)
description: Attractively buttery in flavor and very creamy in texture, this medium- to full-bodied wine tastes like vanilla, butterscotch and honey, and feels smooth and almost thick on the palate. Not the usual tangy profile of the varietal, but it's done well in an über-rich style.

title: Clos du Bois 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Ripe flavors and a round texture make this full-bodied wine a pleasure to sip. It layers black cherry, clove and black currant flavors with light oak spices on the mouthfilling frame that has a good touch of tannin for structure.

title: Au Jus 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Asian and Bartlett pear, cherimoya, honeydew and a hint of toast show on the nose of this bottling, which is full of creamy white-fleshed fruit elements. The palate is more tangy with lime, then settles into full white-peach flavors, cut by a pinch of savory sea salt.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2014 El CabRhône Red (Paso Robles)
description: This unique, creatively named and labeled blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Grenache and 20% Syrah shows rather light aromas of gently pressed black currant. The palate offers tart black plum and lilac, making for a nice table wine.

title: Briceland 2017 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Humboldt County)
description: Grassy, herbaceous aromas and tangy citrus flavors give a lively, extroverted personality to this medium-bodied wine. It has good crisp acidity that will make it refreshing on a warm day and especially good with simply prepared seafood and fresh-style cheeses.

title: Easton 2017 Monarch Mine Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a nicely concentrated dry wine that blends fruity and savory aspects and has a good framework of crisp acidity and medium body. Aromas of apple skin and flavors of apple and cucumber are accented by light earthy touches.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Devil's Gulch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: This is a distinctive, nervy wine that combines generous exotic flavors with a rigid backbone of acidity and tannins. It exudes aromas of forest floor, rhubarb and bay leaf on the nose, with crisp flavors of black cherry, pomegranate and tobacco. It is medium to full in body, shows little obvious oak influence but tremendous complexity and nuance. Best through 2025.

title: The Debate 2013 Beckstoffer To Kalon Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the heart of Oakville, this lovely, polished wine is high toned in currant and cassis, with classic structure and polished tannin. Pencil shavings, cedar, tobacco and herb de Provence give it seasonings and complex accents that play along the palate as it develops and evolves in the glass. The tannins are sizable and supportive. Best 2023–2033.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Sunshine Valley Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Red and black cherry, cassis and a beautiful back note of rose, orange and licorice play along the nose and palate of this spectacular, full-bodied and complex wine. Expansively rich and offering depth and breadth, it holds on to a mighty structure that should serve well through a decade or so of cellaring. Best 2024–2034.

title: Benovia 2015 La Pommeraie Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Whiffs of oak, matchstick, toasted nuts and reduction form the nose of this finely etched and youthfully exuberant wine. The palate is marked by juicy acidity, with flavors of lemon peel, green apple and brioche that lead to a salty sea-spray finish.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Brawny and richly plummy and brimming in dark cherry, black and red licorice, this wine has a gorgeous nose of graphite and leather, with subtle, complex notes of grit and crushed rock. The tannins present as dusty and polished, with extraordinary length. Best 2024–2034.

title: Schramsberg 2006 Blanc de Blancs Late Disgorged Méthode Traditionnelle Brut Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Crisp and elegant, this sophisticated wine has enticing mineral and bread-dough aromas, tiny bubbles that form a soothing mousse and bone-dry lemon, mineral and ginger flavors. It tastes steely at first sip and then slowly opens to more richness and depth. Best through 2023.
designation: Blanc de Blancs Late Disgorged Méthode Traditionnelle Brut

title: Novy 2015 Gary's Vineyard Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich, savory and yet still beautifully floral, this is all that a Syrah can be. Dark and thick in the glass, it begins with aromas of stewed black plums, burned beef, tar and teriyaki, yet with the lift of violets. The palate shows similar cohesive qualities, from dark fruit to roasted game, and is leveled by dramatic black-pepper spice and a bright acidity.

title: Benovia 2015 Tilton Hill Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This beautiful wine is smoky in character, with a warming baking-spice tone. Tangy red cherry, strawberry and pomegranate flavors mark the palate, offering elegance and delicacy around the core of citrusy acidity.

title: Mayacamas 2016 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: From the mighty dry-farmed site within the secluded appellation, this incredible wine is expressive in tones of flint, fig, pear and lemon peel, with lasting acidity that brightens and freshens the palate. Medium bodied, it's soft in feel yet structured, balanced and complex.

title: Prager 2009 Blonde Tawny Port (Napa Valley)
description: This white dessert wine was bottled in 2017 and is whisky-like in color. Thick, viscous tones of nougat, baked apple and honey biscuit combine along a soft, supple framework of richness and graceful complexity.

title: Joseph Phelps 2016 Pastorale Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This estate-grown wine from a deeply coastal site offers a steely entry of high-toned acidity and follow-through, a bright, focused and fresh exploration of quenching Meyer lemon pulp and zest. Green apple, lime and integrated oak support the well-composed build up of flavor and texture.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Gorgeously framed in vanilla cola, clove and a richness of baked plum and black cherry, this is a sumptuous, expansive expression of the variety, barrel-fermented in its entirety and well extracted to showcase the balanced nature of the fruit and spice. The finish offers length and plenty of power. This bold wine will do well in the cellar. Best 2024–2030.

title: The Bridge 2015 Farrow Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Strong tones of mocha, toasted oak, cedar and dried herb highlight this structured wine, a joint project between Sonoma County-based winemaker Jesse Katz and winemaker Ken Forrester of South Africa. Full bodied and robustly built, there's a wealth of power and flavor here, from coconut to black cherry. It's built to age. Best 2023–2030.

title: Wayfarer 2015 Estate Grown Wayfarer Vineyard Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: A youthful, tightly concentrated wine, this opens slowly to reveal a great depth of character and depth of flavor. Toffee, Meyer lemon and crisp apple meet a balanced richness of integrated oak, sublime texture and floral aromatics and brine that tease of the sea.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Papera Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: An exuberance of cherry blossom and violet greets the nose in this complex, textured wine. The structured palate offers tones of dried herb, brambly blackberry and black pepper, finishing weighty in just enough oak.

title: The Debate 2013 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy compost contrasts against high-toned acidity and fleshy flavors of currant, cedar and pencil shavings in this classically structured, concentrated wine from the famous site in the northern reaches of St. Helena. Black licorice and crushed stone add to its overall complexity and curious nature, the fruit extracted and pure.

title: Axr 2014 V Madrone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a juicy entry of cassis and dark cherry that's irresistibly inviting and rewarding. Graphite, dried herb and sage provide a lift of complexity and spicy savory seasoning around an impressively full-bodied midpalate of length and breadth.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Arrendell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a dense, juicy wine, with up-front richness to its bouquet of red cherry and strawberry. The acidity is lasting and refreshing, with silky tannins that add texture and grace.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer Dr. Crane Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Dried herb, sage and lavender make for a potent bouquet of inviting complexity and intrigue, followed by a tease of anise. Juicy, thick and rich on the palate, the wine has a grip and power that never lets go, showing its youth and 100% barrel fermentation. It will be hard to wait on this one, but cellaring will reward. Best 2024–2034.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 1023 Red (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a stellar combining of 52% Zinfandel, 45% Syrah and 3% Grenache, all estate-grown and dancing in acidity. Incredibly floral, bright and jammy, it evokes violet and berry pie, with rounded tannins that don't get in the way of the juicy midpalate. This wine is fresh with plenty of power.

title: Summer Somewhere 2017 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: A light, yellowish pink in the glass, this rosé shows crisp red apple, lemon rind and a hint of watermelon on the nose. A slight tang of yellow grapefruit gives depth to the light cherry and berry flavors of the palate.

title: Waxwing 2016 Flocchini Vineyard Sans Soufre Syrah (Petaluma Gap)
description: Made with no additions of sulfur dioxide (i.e. sans soufre), this is an earthy floral red, aged in neutral French oak to maintain a light touch of pure compost, rose petal and white pepper.

title: Writer's Block 2016 Pinot Noir (Lake County)
description: Light bodied and charming, this fragrant and cherry-flavored wine shows the delicate side of the varietal. Medium-ripe plum and red-cherry notes come with good fruit acidity and a very smooth non-tannic texture.

title: Mahoney 2014 Mahoney Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Smoky oak dominates on the nose of this tart, tannic wine, made in a big style embraced by ripeness. Baked strawberry and rhubarb find companionship in mint and clove.

title: Paris Valley Road 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Quite fruity and ripe, this medium-bodied wine smooths over the varietal's usual firm tannins, but brings forward cherry, strawberry and black-plum flavors that are fresh and juicy.

title: Pulchella 2016 Revision Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant, dried blueberry, black pepper and licorice show on this blend of 58% Mourvèdre, 18% Zinfandel, 15% Syrah and 9% Petite Sirah. There's a fresh flash of black plum on the palate before the vanilla and baking-spice flavors take hold.

title: Seagrape 2017 Los Alamos Vineyard Gewurztraminer (Santa Barbara County)
description: Pear rinds, sweetgrass, white flowers and tangerine zest show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is pretty mellow, with hints of orange blossom oil and apple flesh leading into a chalky finish.

title: Shooting Star 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine finds a nice balance between herb, citrus and mineral elements in the context of medium body, lively acidity and good concentration. It will be perfect for lunch or as a pre-dinner drink.

title: The Crusher 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine offers nice depth and richness along with the tangy, herbaceous personality that draws people to the variety. It has assertive snap pea and garlic aromas, fresh lemon and herb flavors and a crisp, snappy texture.

title: Vinum 2016 The Insider Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A rounded red berry aroma meets wet soil and the slightest hint of dried garden herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate is evenly weighted, carrying flavors of dark berry, oregano and pencil shavings.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2017 Uncaged Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This wine is relatively full bodied and has a light oak touch, so it's more than simple refreshment. Aromas of vanilla and fennel lead to a soft, smooth palate, with a subtle apple-pie flavor.

title: Andis 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)
description: This medium-bodied wine combines rich ripe melon aromas with tangy citrus flavors for a refreshing but satisfying impression. A lightly sweet baking-spice element expands on the finish.

title: Black Stallion 2014 Gaspare Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Dust, herb and graphite invite one into this appellation wine, which is a bit muted on the nose. Thick, concentrated and richly tannic, its powerful core is defined in tobacco, brown sugar and chocolate.

title: Buttonwood Farm 2017 Rosé of Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very showy aromas of watermelon, red cherry and red plum are cut by lime zest on the nose of this fairly ripe yet still fresh and zesty rosé by Karen Steinwachs. There is great acid and vibrancy on the tip of the sip, and then come thicker flavors of strawberry and watermelon juice.

title: Calera 2017 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Soft strawberry, citrus and earth flavors show on the nose of this bottling. There is strong tightness to the palate, where lemon-led acidity cuts through the pink-fruit flavors.

title: Christophe 2015 Limited Edition Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal bay leaf and sap mark the entry of this taut, tannic and highly concentrated wine, a hearty expression of black and red berries wrapped in vanilla oak.

title: Écluse 2015 Improv Red (Paso Robles)
description: Cassis, kirsch and a hint of caramel show on the nose of this blend of 47% Merlot, 29% Petite Sirah and 24% Petit Verdot. Roasted meat and black-plum-jelly flavors show on the palate along with a hint of turned earth.

title: Elyse 2015 Morisoli Vineyard Zinfandel (Rutherford)
description: Rich, round and soft, this wine exudes strong aromas and flavors of brown sugar and baked blackberry and plum, with threads of acidity woven through to provide contrast and balance. Blended within are 14% mixed blacks from vineyard.

title: Fleur 2014 Scarlett Vineyard Petite Sirah (North Coast)
description: This deeply colored, full-bodied wine is somewhat restrained in fruit flavors and has a firm, moderately tannic texture. It smells and tastes like blueberries and blackberries accented by oak spices and has the varietal's usual mouth-filling structure.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Jackson Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hazelnut, browned butter, honeysuckle and strong orangesicle aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which fits into the classic California Chardonnay category. There's a rounded entry to the palate, offering flavors of Gravenstein apple and poached pear that are carried on chalky backbone.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2013 Malbec (Lodi)
description: This is an oaky, smoky wine, with a full body and firm tannins. It smells like wood smoke and black pepper, tastes like smoked brisket and has an oaky sharpness in the texture.

title: Sierra Starr 2015 Rising Starr Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is fresh and fruity in flavor but serious in mouthfeel, as firm tannins and considerable acidity give it a lively, crisp sensation on the palate. It has tart red cherry and raspberry flavors and is very focused and pure tasting.

title: Vanilla Puddin 2013 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine tastes very lush, fruity and pastry-like, fairly dripping with pineapple and honey flavors, dressed in a rich soft texture with just a touch of good acidity to balance out a perceived sweetness.

title: Castle Rock 2013 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Earthy cherry coulis and a strong scent of menthol dominate in this value-priced wine—a hard find in this varietal category. Thin on the palate, it's an easygoing quaff, light and fairly nondescript in oak and fruit, dusted in forest pine.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: The aromas on this bottling are currently very shy, with hints of black fruit and pepper. The palate is also still emerging from its shell, with hints of tar, black plum and baking spice. The texture is decent, and will allow the flavors to show better in time.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2013 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lemon and orange pith aromas meet with toasted brioche and lemongrass on the intriguing nose of this bottling. The palate mixes apples, nuts and spice into a charoseth-like flavor profile, with hints of guava paste and yeasty sourdough rounding out the unique experience.

title: LangeTwins 2014 Diablo Vineyard Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: Big and brawny, this full-bodied wine has tight flavors of dark chocolate and wood smoke, very firm tannins and a finish that echoes maple syrup. Bring on the meats when you open this one.

title: Vienza 2014 Vendetta Super Tuscan Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Light in color, this blend of 70% Sangiovese and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon shows berry fruit, baked brick minerality, rose petals and bay leaf on the nose. It's easygoing and unique on the palate, with tangy juniper, balsam oil and pine needle flavors spicing up the berry fruits. Butterscotch flashes on the finish.

title: Longvale 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Opulent, very ripe fruit flavors fill this wine to the brim, from the aromas of strawberry jam to flavors of blackberry syrup. It's full bodied but light on tannins, so the mouthfeel is lush and soft.

title: Murphy-Goode 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Fresh tasting, dry and well balanced, this wine doesn't go overboard but has everything in reasonable balance, including a buttery appley aroma, and good acidity to bolster the fruit flavors and add a little bite to the texture.

title: Muscardini 2013 Cassata Vineyards Reserve Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: A dark and hugely full-bodied wine, this blends 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec, 15% Zinfandel and 12% Merlot. Concentrated blackberry flavor is seasoned in tobacco, clove and cedar, the oak pronounced and tannins tight, as heat vibrates on the finish.

title: Pear Valley 2016 Pear Valley Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded, plush and extremely tropical aromas of white peach, cantaloupe and poached pear show on the nose of this bottling. The sip tightens up a bit, then shows coconut oil, tuberose and more poached pear. Cleanly made, but quite ripe.

title: Press Run 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Tight-grained tannin wrap around moderate ripeness in this approachable, softly rounded wine. Sanguine, it offers cassis, current, soy and graphite flavors that don't ever overcomplicate.

title: Sean Minor 2016 Four Bears Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed thyme, oregano, anise and dill decorate the roasted blackberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. The palate is juicy with fresh and accessible fruits, though the herb qualities and hint of bell pepper are more prominent.

title: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Pruney raisin and plum aromas and flavors are met by fruit-forward notions of blackberry jam and cherry, providing a generosity of ripe fruit. Spicy cinnamon and dusty tannin accent the full-bodied concentration and simple finish.

title: Buena Vista 2014 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Dried cherry is complemented by brawny leather and tobacco flavors in this full-bodied extracted wine that drinks heavy. The tannins are firm and a tad harsh.

title: Fenestra 2011 Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: Smooth and well-balanced, this medium-bodied wine has earthy spicy aromas, flavors that combine meaty, herbal nuances with red and black cherry and a mouthfeel that's relatively light and easy. It's time to drink up this well-aged wine.

title: Ancient Peaks 2015 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Kirsch, caramel, maraschino cherries and hickory smoke make for a pleasing if somewhat sweet nose. Alpine strawberry and stewed raspberry show on the palate, which is fruity and flavorful if somewhat simple. Caramel pops on the finish.

title: Caricature 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine is generous in flavor, a touch soft in texture and has a bit of sweetness to round off any rough edges. It smells jammy and tastes like blackberries drizzled with maple syrup, while any tannins are softened by the ripeness and body.

title: Zina Hyde Cunningham 2015 Adeline's Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a savory earthy style, starting with herb and chicken-stock aromas and leading to lemon and dried herb flavors. It has a good crisp balance that's appealing.

title: Reyes 2013 Renaissance Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Slightly unclean aromas of lemon peel, wet dirt and damp sand show on the nose of this bottling. Dried lemon rinds and brackish-water flavors show on the sip.

title: One Leaf 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a basic red wine with plummy flavors that are nearly sweet, and a soft slightly sugary palate. It's simple and forgettable.

title: Predator 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine is one of the most blatantly oaky on the market. Smelling like Lapsang Souchong tea, which is smoked over pine wood, and tasting like burnt toast, it's oddly fun to taste but way over the top for most people.

title: Shafer 2013 Hillside Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Among the Napa Valley's most crowning achievements in Cabernet, this vintage of Hillside Select is stunning, bright and beguiling in every way. Intensely layered, its interwoven flavors burst in black licorice, dark chocolate, pipe tobacco, gun smoke and garrigue. Spicy oak adds to the power and weight. Drinkable now, it will show even greater finesse in time; enjoy best 2023–2033 and possibly beyond.

title: Halcón 2015 Tierra Petite Sirah (Yorkville Highlands)
description: This excellent wine from a steep terraced vineyard offers beautiful aromas of lavender and violet that segue to a palate replete with black fruit, black pepper and anise tones. Each flavor seems especially well defined and they layer together harmoniously on a velvety texture that provides good support for all that concentration. Best after 2020.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Calegari Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers a compelling nose of pretty florals and spicy forest-floor aromas. Dense on entry, it lingers in flavors of orange, cherry and rhubarb, with textured tannins and an undercurrent of a stony, mineral character.

title: Storm 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dried sagebursh, wild cherries, rose petals and baked soil aromas make for a compelling blend of savory and sweet on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastern side of the appellation. A chalky texture and front-to-back acidity presents flavors of ripe boysenberry and black raspberry as well as clove, black pepper and other intriguingly dark spices.

title: Portalupi 2015 L. Venturi Vineyards Petite Sirah (Mendocino County)
description: Superrich and undeniably flavorful, this stand-out wine achieves fine balance despite the huge tannins. It has an utterly dark color that stains the glass, wonderful aromas of crushed raspberries and black cherries, and deep fruit flavors that weave through tones of dark chocolate and mint. The mouthfeel is notably dense but somehow gentle. Best from 2020–2030.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Fresh Asian pear, lemon blossoms and honeysuckle make for an enjoyable nose on this bottling from a very coastally influenced vineyard just east of Santa Maria. The acidity on the palate is super racy and vibrant, carrying flavors of chalk and lime pith that sizzle long and deep.

title: Flaunt NV Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: This is winemaker Dianna Novy Lee's debut sparkling wine, blending 56% Chardonnay and 44% Pinot Noir and then aging the wine on the lees for three years before release. It impresses from first sip, showing acid-driven raciness and a core of green apple, lime zest and biscuit flavors that linger. It'll serve well as a delicious aperitif or fitting companion for the table.

title: Justin 2014 Focus Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and hearty aromas of black currant, caramel, lilac and a touch of roasted oak show on the dense nose of this wine. It is massive on the palate, but with appropriate balancing factors of entrenched acidity and chalky, sticky tannins that hold up the rich flavors of vanilla, black-plum skin and blackberry sauce.

title: Grgich Hills 2013 Old Vine Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Tight-grained tannins lie beneath a sleek, sophisticated structure of ageworthy complexity in this old-vine wine made from grapes planted in 1959. Intensely layered, it shows wisps of currant, pencil shavings and anise—seasonings for a lush backdrop of brambly blackberry. Enjoy 2023–2033.

title: Tierra Roja 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is a well-made, small-production wine from the producer's home estate. Inviting in perfumed oak, pencil and cedar, it has brawny power that remains elegant in the glass, with persistent acidity and layers of cassis and cinnamon.

title: Blue Rock 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a lovely light-bodied wine with serious intent and sophistication. Pear puree and apple skin mingle effortlessly along a plane of gravelly rocky mineral complexity that will show well with a variety of meals.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Family Reserve Grenache (Paicines)
description: This higher-end, elegantly packaged bottling delivers depth, starting with a well-woven, unique nose of baked strawberry, cinnamon, juniper, peppercorns and tobacco. Those elements converge on the palate alongside sandalwood, Montmorency cherry and vanilla, bolstered by a soft but steady acidity.

title: Longoria 2015 Cuvée Diana Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright and fresh aromas of pomelo pith, grapefruit flesh, guava skins and tangerine souffle show on the nose of this top-tier Chardonnay by veteran Rick Longoria. Clean and crisp flavors of mandarin pith and a crushed marble minerality give backbone to the richer touches of macadamia nut, cashew and the slightest kiss of buttercream.

title: Parducci 2015 True Grit Reserve Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: This monumental wine is one for the ages—or at least for 15 years. A deep color is followed by gorgeous aromas of rose, dark chocolate and blackberry syrup. The mouthfilling, ripe fruit flavors are concentrated, bolstered by thick, powerful tannins that give it a mouth-puckering astringency. The firmness sets this wine up for a long life. Best from 2022–2032.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Foss Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft and alluring, this wine opens in bursts of rose petal and black tea, with plenty of baking spices accenting its core of cherry, blueberry and rhubarb. As the wine mellows on the finish, it show a velvety texture of round, supple tannins.

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 Block Q Old Vine Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Extremely light in color in the glass, this bottling of a 40-year-old vineyard block is an old vine masterpiece, starting with aromas of crisp, underripe raspberry, tart carnation and orange rind aromas. It's fresh, light, lovely and very quaffable on the palate, where pomegranate juice is sprinkled with dried oregano and a pinch vanilla dust. The acidity is clean and balanced.
designation: Block Q Old Vine Bien Nacido Vineyard

title: Scar of the Sea 2015 House Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a purity to the black fruit, cocoa, espresso and wisteria aromas on the nose of this bottling from a small dry-farmed vineyard 2,100-feet up in the mountains. The zesty palate throws potpourri and white pepper together with fresh boysenberry and elderberry, making for a uniquely flavored wine, redolent with dried purple flowers.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2015 Late Disgorged Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Made from 90% Pinot Noir and 10% Chardonnay, this is cranberry colored and flavored, with a rich, thick mousse. Delicately textured, it has back notes of orange and strawberry and bright, fresh, persistent acidity and a complex lingering of seashell.

title: Hertelendy 2015 Signature Mountain Red (Napa Valley)
description: Small producer Ralph Hertelendy blends 81% Merlot with smaller percentages of other red Bordeaux grapes from a variety of sites across the valley in this well-made, complex wine. Char, smoked meat, juicy currant and cranberry are set against tight compressed tannins and intense oak, suggesting more time in bottle. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Inman Family 2015 Pratt Vine Hill Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy, complex and layered, this is a richly interwoven vineyard-designate. It shines in earthy lavender and forest floor, spiced cherry and cardamom, lingering with ease on the palate within a balanced framework of acidity and tenacious freshness.

title: Siduri 2016 Perry Ranch Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Demure and lightly earthy in forest and cardamom, this wine is defined by that underlying spiciness and a lengthy background of oak. Its balanced take on fruit includes strong twists of orange and wild strawberry.

title: Stolo 2016 Hillside Reserve Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo)
description: Grown on a vineyard less than three miles to the ocean behind Cambria, this bottling shows popcorn, light marshmallow and light cream on the very plush nose. The sip tightens up considerably, focusing on fresh and racy lime peels yet with richer hints of clotted cream and flowing butter in the background.

title: Folded Hills 2015 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Savory aromas of white pepper, charred wood and roasted black fruit run alongside elegant touches of purple flowers on the very layered nose of this bottling. It's lightly bodied for Syrah but very energetic on the palate, offering lilac, violet, pepper and elderberry flavors.

title: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black plum meet with smoke, turned earth and dried herbs on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines juicy flavors of baked cherry and more plum with sharp baking spices, all framed by strong but pleasant tannins.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2007 Carneros Cuvée Late Disgorged Brut Sparkling (Carneros)
description: A mingling of 55% Pinot Noir and 45% Chardonnay, this imparts nicely complex, layered elements of brioche, wet stone and lemon rind, the acidity tenacious and complementary. Dry, its late disgorging makes for admirable length and breadth.

title: Laurel Glen 2015 Counterpoint Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This is an approachable release from the mountain estate that is known for ageworthy Cabernet. Earthy and herbal, it offers clove, cedar and peppery notes. The structure is rounded and concentrated in balanced black fruit.

title: Navarro 2016 Deep End Blend Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine could be the centerpiece for a great dinner due to its combination of vivid, concentrated fruit flavors and good structure. Bold black-cherry and blackberry aromas lead to layered fruit and light spice flavors backed by moderate tannins and good fruit acidity that add grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Roar 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The nose on this single-vineyard expression combines ripe red fruits of pomegranate and raspberry with spicy Red Hots cinnamon candies. Bright red currant and more raspberry flavors explode on the palate, where nuances of Earl Grey tea, potpourri and rose petal flavors make for a fresh sip.

title: Skinner 2015 Syrah (El Dorado)
description: This wine tastes bold and assertive, pushing smoky oak and vanilla flavors close to the edge but rescuing them with attractive ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry. The wine is full bodied, layered and mouthcoating, supported by moderate tannins that melt into the bold flavors.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 High Slopes Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: An engaging spice-rack aroma and fruit flavors so ripe they're almost sweet make this a gorgeous, generous wine that feels wonderful on the palate and warm on the finish. Light touches of earth, black-pepper and new leather flavors meld with blackberry and blueberry while a full body carries them all to a lingering fnish.

title: Hirsch Vineyards 2016 The Bohan-Dillon Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This light- to medium-bodied wine shows good tension between expressive black currant and damp earth aromas and an almost steely texture. Though richer than the 2014, it's lean in mouthfeel, crisp and lightly tannic, and the flavors are quite enjoyable in a restrained way. Best after 2022.

title: Bodkin 2017 The White Rino Albariño (Suisun Valley)
description: This wine explodes with apricot and apple aromas. It's one of the purest expressions of the grape variety to be found in California, and brings excellent depth, concentration and personality to the table. Crisp acidity helps the texture to be lively, and despite light alcohol, it's rich enough to create a lingering finish.

title: Byron 2015 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling from a vineyard first planted in 1970 starts with woody sagebrush, forest floor, mushroom and moss aromas, but leads into ripe cranberry and rose petals, with the slightest hint of game. Bay leaf, marjoram and tangy cranberry touches complete the palate.

title: Epiphany 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Loads of savory aromas, from cracked black pepper, tar, game and beef crust, mesh with roasted black-currant and coffee tones on the nose of this bottling from the historic vineyard. The palate combines black fruit with coffee cream, savory lamb and more cracked pepper.

title: Iron Horse 2010 Brut LD Sparkling (Green Valley)
description: Made from equal parts Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, and late-disgorged after seven years en tirage, this is the winery's top-of-the-line bubbly, and it shows. Gorgeous wafts of peach skin tease the nose before dry, layered components of lemon peel, white flower and apple skin shine on the palate, dipped in a strong mineral streak of crushed stone.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2016 Comes a Time Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Concentrated morello cherry, packed flower petals, turned soil, light pepper and concentrated watermelon aromas make for an exotic nose on this bottling from Alta Colina Vineyard. Chalky tannins make for a grippy, somewhat sticky entry to the palate, where black-plum and wild animal flavors arise.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 Mourvèdre (Sierra Foothills)
description: Imagine tobacco, loamy earth and rhubarb mixed together to get a picture of the complexity and different-ness of this beautifully balanced Rhône-style wine. It feels medium bodied and moderately tannic on the palate as the flavors unfold slowly, releasing hints of new leather, sour cherries and mushrooms.

title: Zinke 2016 Blanca White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Clean and crisp on the nose, this blend of 42% Viognier, 21% Marsanne, 20% Grenache Blanc and 17% Roussanne shows mandarin pith, sliced apple and Asian pear on the nose. It's tightly wound on the palate, with fresh citrus, crushed granite and Gravenstein apple flavors that ride strong acidity into the finish.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Limited Release Ten Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in rose petal and cherry blossom, this 100% varietal wine has a chalky grip of tannin and substantial mouthfeel, with dusty spice and leather. The fruit is brightly accentuated in cassis.

title: Cloak & Dagger 2015 Illuminatus Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: Rather light in the glass, this estate bottling shows cooked red currant and cinnamon spice on the nose. The palate is both lightweight and tannic in texture, showing food-friendly flavors of star anise, clove, fennel and red fruits.

title: Emerald Hare 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This wine has classic rosemary and pine aromas and fresh, lively citrus flavors. Supportive acidity and a concentrated palate helps extend the finish. It's all about savory flavors and a nice tart character.

title: En Garde 2014 Touché Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Brushy sage and a thickness of leather play up the robust ripe nature of this reserve wine, which sources from Mount Veeder, Diamond Mountain and Howell Mountain, and blends in nearly 13% Cabernet Franc. A sweetness of cherry and cassis accent hearty toasted oak and tannin.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Seven Oaks Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry, smoke and a hint of caramel make for a very familiar and satisfying nose on this well-priced bottling. There is a deep core of black currant fruit, with chalky tannins, a dense mouthfeel and abundant acidity that drives into the finish.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 The Blend Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Dried berries, fennel pollen and layers of herbal intrigue arise on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon and 40% Syrah. Bay leaf and Mediterranean spices decorate the softly tannic palate, giving depth to the lavish blueberry and blackberry flavors.

title: Judge Palmer 2014 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Cassis, blueberry and mocha flavors are dusted in nutmeg and clove in this rich, soft and straightforward red from the famous site. The ripeness is in balance and measured.

title: Kitá 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A vibrant dazzle of pale pink in the glass, this bottling shows fresh, focused and exuberant aromas of bubblegum, rose petal and tangerine rind. Rounded watermelon flavors meet with lemon-lime on the palate, which is persistent in expression deep into the finish.

title: Brick & Mortar 2017 White (California)
description: A blend of whole cluster-pressed Chenin Blanc and Chardonnay sourced from Clarksburg and Napa Valley, this can is stainless steel and barrel-fermented and lovely in crisp, high-toned acidity. Apple, melon and citrus combine with aplomb, refreshing in focus and light style.

title: Lumen 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hazelnut, seared lemon rinds and sandalwood reflect the various oak types used in the making of this wine. The palate also reflects that wood, with lightly toasted oak flavors holding up the seared lemon and herb-roasted chicken elements.

title: Mahoney 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Spicy, light and ethereal in texture, this lengthy, brightly bodied wine offers delicate entry points of cranberry, rhubarb and strawberry that work well at the table or as an apéritif.

title: Thacher 2016 Working Holiday Cass Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Geneseo District)
description: Rusty aromas of dried cherry, roasted fennel and sweet smoke show on the nose of this blend of 47% Grenache, 30% Syrah and 23% Mourvèdre. Sour red-plum skins start the sip and then it warms toward red cherry with hints of anise, thyme and sagebrush. It will pair with a wide variety of foods.

title: Covenant 2015 Lavan Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Dark gold in color, this wine offers uplifting acidity and matchstick—strong elements that balance well against powerful layers of green apple, melon and pear. The ripeness is in check.

title: Frostwatch 2014 Merlot (Bennett Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is impressive in spicy clove, powerful plum and supple lengthy layers of flavor surround in polished tannin. It finishes with a silky smoothness that's not easy to forget.

title: Jarvis 2016 Estate Grown Cave Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Honey, brioche and layers of pineapple and mango give this youthful estate wine a richness that's hard to resist. It's supported by integrated oak that's toasty and sprinkled in a nutmeg tone. Steely acidity provides a backbone of freshness.

title: Novy 2016 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral in lovely ways, this big, bold and broadly expansive wine is hugely structured, with plenty of tannin and strong black-fruit flavor. Good supportive acidity keeps it balanced in the glass.

title: Picayune 2017 Hay Penny Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: This blend of 45% Syrah, 45% Grenache and 10% Barbera is citrus-driven and textured, winning in its light touch and refreshing grasp of acidity. Peach and melon add complexity and lasting fruitiness.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This wine is marked by a powerful extraction of tannin and sizable oak, the texture robustly grippy. Dust, crushed rock and sage define its imprint on the palate.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Juicy black cherry and blueberry wrap around big, expansive tannins in this hearty red that is sourced from several of the producer's best sites. With a backbone of structure and oak, it's toasty in character yet robustly fruity.

title: Perfusion 2014 Pinot Noir (San Francisco Bay)
description: This wine comes from a small vineyard in Wildcat Canyon, which is located in the hills of the East Bay. Aromas of mulberry, purple flowers, new leather, curry and cardamom lead into a palate of roasted tomato jam and chai spice.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Red (Red Hills)
description: This impressive wine, grown at 3,000 feet, offers deep dark-fruit flavors and hints of dark chocolate carried on a lush rich texture. It's full bodied, very ripe and concentrated, featuring blackberry and boysenberry flavors that flood the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Prager 2013 Aria White Port (Napa Valley)
description: Bottled in 2017, this dessert wine is made entirely from Chardonnay and dazzles in lithe layers of apple, pear and melon. With a medium-bodied feel, it shows density around underlying balance and structure.

title: Ravenswood 2015 Teldeschi Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the wilds of the appellation and field blended with nearly 16% Petite Sirah and smaller amounts of Carignane and Alicante Bouschet, this wine is rich in red brambly dusty fruit. Demure on the palate at first, it is soft and structured, with a strong taste of strawberry and white pepper on the finish.

title: Tanner 2015 Estate Grown Grande Petit Verdot (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has a dark color, fragrant floral and blueberry aromas and a mouth-coating richness that carries jammy blackberry and boysenberry flavors. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and lingers nicely on the finish.

title: The Withers Winery 2015 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Subtle and complex rather than simply fruity, this medium-bodied wine brings aromas of sunbaked earth, cedar and leather along with flavors like sour cherry, beef broth and anise that are compelling to taste. The texture is firm, moderately tannic and provides just enough tension so that the flavors seem to release slowly onto the taste buds.

title: The Withers Winery 2015 Ruben Mourvèdre (El Dorado)
description: Moderate fruit flavors, light spices and a firm texture make this medium-bodied wine appetizing and food-friendly. Made from 86% Mourvèdre grapes plus Grenache and Syrah, it's a tenor rather than a baritone and gives a brilliant performance.

title: Windchaser 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: Tempting toast and fresh bread aromas lead to layers of lemon, butter, crisp apple and baking-spice flavors in this nicely complex, compact and well-balanced wine from a three-year-old urban winery in Berkeley. It is medium bodied, feels lively but smooth on the palate and has aged-on-the-lees complexity and richness.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 Obsidian Block Red (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a beautifully blended 63% Petite Sirah, 32% Zinfandel and 5% Syrah from one estate block. Earthy, it offers soft, supple layers of blueberry, blackberry and cocoa powder, the tannins present, supportive and dusty. The finish explores the garrigue and black pepper side of the Rhône grapes.

title: Nickel & Nickel 2015 Hayne Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: With a strong tone of oak and tar on the nose, this vineyard-designate wine offers well-integrated power and intensity. Fresh red currant greets the palate within a framework of concentrated depth and extraction, with a lasting finish.

title: Quivira 2015 Wine Creek Ranch G-S-M (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Grenache makes up the majority of this blend at 65%, with 15% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre. Together they offer earthy barnyard, compost and fresh strawberry puree, the body thick and dense in tightly packed tannin. This is delicious and complex.

title: Ram's Gate 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Roots, stems and dried leaves make for an earthy entry into this estate appellation wine. Wraparound tannins and oak emphasize a gritty, grainy texture marked by robust cherry ripeness and secondary characteristics of black tea and rose.

title: Benziger 2017 Estate Paradiso de Maria Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This well-made wine is crisp and structured, layered in Meyer lemon, mandarin orange and a steely core of effusive acidity. Light bodied, it shows depth and texture enough to match a meal and find companionship at the table.

title: Derby 2014 Derby Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Elegant and spicy floral notes of concentrated rose petal, hibiscus, sage and juniper play against a sugar-plum aroma on the nose of this bottling. Thyme and bay leaf lace the ripe plum-pudding and baked berry flavors of the palate, which is lifted by a crushed purple-flower element.

title: Fulcrum 2016 Brosseau Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: The oak is still showing prominently throughout this young bottling, but it has all the bones to make for a compelling sip for the next decade or so. Aromas of black raspberry sorbet and smoke lead into a palate of snappy red fruit, white pepper, star anise and clove. Be patient and this will smooth out nicely. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Blending five of the producer's vineyard-designates, all dry-farmed and old-vine, this is a high-acid red with hearty spice and components of dried herb, cedar and oak. Supple and rich, it's distinctively savory and tart on the midpalate and finish, finishing in a blur of pepper.

title: Dante Robere 2015 Estate Reserve Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: This broad, rich and mouth-coating wine starts with effusive spicy oak aromas like wood smoke, cardamom and cedar before spilling very ripe, almost jammy, boysenberry flavors on the palate. It's unabashedly oaky, but has so many ripe generous fruit flavors that they balance each other out.

title: Bonny Doon 2017 Clos de Gilroy Grenache (Monterey County)
description: This bottling from four vineyards, with 12% Mourvèdre, shows loads of crushed carnation, rose petal, cranberry and raspberry on the nose. There is a compelling freshness to the palate, with potpourri and lavender flavors meshing into a background of pomegranate and rosewater.

title: Merryvale 2014 Profile Red (Napa Valley)
description: This big bold Bordeaux-inspired blend combines 85% Cabernet Sauvignon with 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. It offers a layering of dusty sage and crushed rock around tight-grained tannin that presents as soft and structured on the palate. The integrated fruit is a welcome mix of cassis and red currant.

title: Poseidon 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Flavorful and rich in texture, this generous and full-bodied wine presents a rather light, toasty aroma. Ripe, concentrated fruit and oak flavors are carried on a plush texture that coats the palate with vanilla, baking spice and ripe pear that linger on the finish.

title: Heritance 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Chocolate mocha caramel flavors contribute a deep sense of richness in they approachable, well-rounded wine, a testament to the appellation's dusty nature and embrace of black cherry.

title: Imagery 2016 Upper Ridge Estate Riesling (Pine Mountain-Cloverdale Peak)
description: This wine is pretty in honeysuckle and honeycomb aromas, featuring beautifully resolved acidity in a dry, welcoming context. Spicy lemon is bracing before it mellows, allowing room for green apple and pear.

title: Jessie's Grove 2013 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
