description: This dramatic and inky-colored wine has tight aromas of pencil lead, blackberry and mint followed by extremely concentrated flavors like berries, black cherries and black pepper, but with lighter floral accents, too. The structure is huge due to very firm tannins and robust alcohol, so the wine needs time to mellow. Best after 2022.

title: Miner 2013 The Oracle Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sourced primarily from Stagecoach Vineyard on Atlas Peak and blended with a small amount of Oakville Vineyard grapes, this is a blend of 57% Cabernet Sauvignon and 22% Cabernet Franc, with small percentages of Merlot, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Big, tannic and overpowering in its youth, it reveals hints of cedar, pencil shavings and sage, with a rich black-cherry core. Enjoy 2023–2033.

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Grenache (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine has an appetizing lip-smacking texture and a rather taut balance that could take on a wide variety of food pairings. It's all fresh berry and cherry flavors, snappy acidity and firm tannins.

title: Uphill Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: Very good concentration and a sleek texture make this medium to full-bodied wine from the Sierra Foothills easy to appreciate. It has layers of ripe black fruits, nuances of toasted oak and cedar, and fine-grained tannins that provide good backbone.

title: Brutocao 2013 Contento Vineyard Estate Bottled Primitivo (Mendocino)
description: An aroma like white pepper and damp earth leads to brawny fruit flavors in this full-bodied, concentrated and complex wine made from a grape variety genetically identical to Zinfandel, but often with slightly different flavors. It has a good firm texture, attractive balance for a wine of its size, and a lingering finish.

title: Chalk Hill 2014 Chairman's Club Carmenère (Chalk Hill)
description: An uncommon find in the appellation, this red is blended with 6% Cabernet Sauvignon and given nearly two years in 60% new French oak. Dusty, it's bold and rustic, with shocks of currant, blackberry and broadly distributed oak, the lasting note a mix of clove and black pepper.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 8% Petite Sirah, this is a velvety herbaceous wine with earthy undertones that presents as both rustic and refined. Leathery black pepper meets mushroom and cedar as the medium-ripe flavors lead to a juicy finish.

title: Dolin 2014 Rincon Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: There's a strong hazelnut character on this bottling from an iconic vineyard, with touches of lemon-laced crème brûlée and pink grapefruit zest. The nutty quality translates to pecans on the sip, with orange marmalade, toasted croissant and a slight bit of marshmallow toward the finish.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2015 Southworth Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: Bright, focused acidity flirts with the medium-bodied palate that boasts flavors of lemon and grapefruit. A background of supportive oak never gets in the way, offering complementing tones of nutmeg and vanilla.

title: Mi Sueño 2014 Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: This is a soft oaky wine that builds power and concentration as it opens and expands on the palate, showing brawn and plenty of body. Juicy blackberry is lifted by integrated acidity and welcome jolts of black pepper.

title: Tangley Oaks 2015 Lot 12 Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Sophisticated and full bodied, this generous style of wine wraps complex and subtle oak spices around a warm, generous core of ripe pear and apple notes. Wonderful vanilla bean and nutmeg nuances linger in the creamy texture and echo on the finish.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very chalky aromas of lime skins, lemon rinds and a touch of Gala apple flesh makes for an inviting nose to this estate bottling. The palate picks up the region's telltale sea salt flavors, which give savory depth to the seared lemon rind flavors. The acidity and texture are both firm.

title: Landmark 2015 Overlook Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County-Sonoma County-Monterey County)
description: Aromas of roasted red cherry, sharp black raspberry and herb-tinged smoked pork in mulberry sauce make for a mouthwatering entry to this bottling. The oak is strong on the palate, giving a vanilla overlay to the cranberry and rose petal flavors. A hint of juniper shows on the finish.

title: Longboard 2014 Dakine Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral aromatics are the star of the show in this full-bodied, densely packed wine, blended with 2% each of Grenache, Petite Sirah, Malbec, Zinfandel and Carignane. Tart in acidity, it's juicy and bright, with a persistence of black raspberry.

title: Noceto 2013 OGP The Original Grandpère Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine, from a vineyard first planted in the 1860s, has good balance an a distinctive flavor profile, as meaty earthy nuances vie for attention with delicious plummy flavors and a broad, rather soft texture. Full body gives the wine a little grip on the palate in lieu of heavy tannins.

title: Rasi 2016 It Was One of Those Rare LA Days Where There Happened to Be a Thunder Storm. Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rachel Silkowski works for winemaker Brian Loring, and his ripe and rich style is certainly apparent in this bottling with an incredibly long name. Dried alpine strawberry meets with mace and allspice on the nose, while the palate packs tarragon-laced boysenberry flavors alongside shaved licorice and allspice.
designation: It Was One of Those Rare LA Days Where There Happened to Be a Thunder Storm.

title: Shannon 2014 Home Ranch Reserve Tempranillo (Lake County)
description: Full bodied and full flavored, this complex wine smells like black olive, wood smoke and tobacco, tastes like blackberry and dried herbs and feels broad and firmly tannic on the palate. It's built to age well, and should show even more nuances after 2020.

title: Thacher 2014 Solo Concert Coast View Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)
description: Dense vanilla and baking spice aromas decorate the dried plum and purple-flower aromas on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the eastern mountains above the Salinas Valley. Black plum sauce, peppercorns and dark chocolate flavors show on the sip, which is quite heavy and dense but expertly structured to stand the test of time.

title: Hess 2014 Small Block Series Malbec (Mount Veeder)
description: A broadly defined, soft round red wine made with the utmost attention and time in French oak, this estate-driven effort is impressive in strawberry, cherry and blueberry cobbler goodness, rich flavors that wrap around substantial tannins. The persistent sensibility on the nose is floral in violet and mountain sage.

title: Jaffurs 2016 Stolpman Vineyard Roussanne (Santa Barbara County)
description: A strong shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of whipped cream, preserved lemon peels and a hint of smoked white meat, all honed in by a citrusy sharpness. The palate proves fresh, bright and tense, making the mouth water with a hint of sea salt along with creamy cherimoya and a touch more smoke.

title: En Garde 2013 Touché Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a reserve-tier wine that blends in Cabernet Sauvignon from both Diamond Mountain and Mount Veeder, in addition to 8% Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder) and 3% Merlot (Diamond Mountain). Made in a tiny amount, it speaks in rich rapturous tones of chocolate-raspberry truffle wrapped in coconut, oak and soft rounded tannin.

title: Flanagan 2016 Gap's View Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is youthfully coiled and shy, a full-bodied expansion of brawny root, tar and bark flavors. Mild in tannin and structure, it offers aromas of rose garden and lavender, with a tangerine-like lift of acidity.

title: Foxen 2015 Cuvée Jeanne Marie Willamson-Dore Vineyard Red (Los Olivos District)
description: There's a touch of gamy meat alongside purple flowers and candied rosemary on the nose of this blend of 60% Grenache, 23% Syrah and 17% Mourvèdre. It would be the perfect wine for any weekend table, with versatile and food-friendly flavors of violet, lilac, charred beef and tart purple fruits.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Beatty Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: A dense luxurious nose introduces plummy chocolate mocha flavors in this soft well-integrated wine from the producer's estate vineyard. High-elevation grippiness defines the serious tannin profile, suggesting further time in bottle or time to develop in the glass.

title: Monochrome 2016 Barrel Distortion Albariño (California)
description: Full bodied and full flavored, this substantial wine combines intense fruit flavors with bold, buttery and spicy accents. It feels mouthfilling and rich but has enough good acidity for liveliness and balance. Fine print on the label says this is made from Albariño, and it's a most unusual and enjoyable example of the Spanish varietal.

title: Pali 2015 Huber Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Wet clay, squeezed lemon and lightly toasted pecan show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard located just south of Highway 246. There's ripeness to the lemon-juice-driven palate as well as a rounded cashew cream character. The acidity is striking, nearly piercing by the finish.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Rector Creek Vineyard Block 4 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Petit Verdot makes up the majority of this blend at 58%, joining 38% Zinfandel and 4% Cabernet Sauvignon. Powerfully ripe and rich, it offers integrated oak and tannin around a juicy core of raspberry, blueberry and blackberry, the mouthfeel luxurious and soft.

title: Roberts & Rogers 2014 Reserve Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Creamy and luxurious in nature, this wine tastes of caramel apple, baked pear and pineapple. With a depth of vanilla oak, it offers body and weight, with a bright hit of freshness on the lengthy finish.

title: Round Pond 2015 Kith and Kin Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is earthy in tobacco and forest tones, with a bright thread of acidity within its more robust tendencies. Graphite, sage, leather and pepper meet firm, supportive tannins and a toasted oak tone.

title: Stewart Cellars 2013 Brokenrock Ranch Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a highly impressive wine that's 100% varietal and blissfully well-priced. Dusty blackberry cobbler comes first to mind, held in check by robust tannin and powerful structure. A wine that will appeal to Cabernet Sauvignon fans, it balances that power with a soft side embedded in peppery clove.

title: Barton 2014 Hot Blooded Counoise (Adelaida District)
description: So named because Counoise takes to long to ripen that it makes winemakers' collective blood boils, this bottling from Glenrose Vineyard is a great example of a lighter red wine from Paso Robles. Red cherry, rust, crushed gravel and dried herbs show on the nose, while the palate carries oregano, marjoram and a touch of cardamom against light red cherry and cranberry flavors. It's lively and fresh.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2013 Voluptuous Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Beeswax, paraffin, petrol and orange pith show on the light but resilient nose of this dessert wine. There's an intriguing ashy and Brie cheese rind quality to the smoky sip, where the honey and peach syrup sweetness is obvious but plays more to the background. This is quite dynamic.

title: Bennett Lane 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Reserve Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Buttery, rich and creamily lush, this wine is robust and in tropical and stone fruit flavor, with a side note of green olive that makes it intriguing and memorable.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Jovita's Selection Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: With a breath of matchstick on entry, this wine is ultimately juicy and gritty in texture, with a persistent backbeat of toasty oak. Ripe apple and papaya mix well to offer a tropical creaminess.

title: Leonard 2014 Rustridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Chiles Valley)
description: From the eastern edges of the Napa Valley, this is a bright and effusive wine, balanced in red fruit. Small percentages of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Grenache Blanc are included. It was barrel-aged for 18 months in French oak, 25% of it new. The wood is integrated and the texture softly layered.

title: David Clinton 2014 Teldeschi Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is quiet on the nose, but comes to life in its fistful of brawny, thick black fruit and gritty, leathery texture. A touch of black pepper and cinnamon play off each other on the long, resolved finish.

title: Experience 2013 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: With small amounts of Syrah and Zinfandel, this Pinot swings for the fences in spicy raspberry, cherry and cardamom, with just a touch of mint nipping at its nose. Robust oak and a ripe body give it power and weight.

title: J. McClelland 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wine is fermented in stainless steel and French oak. It's a big, brawny red, with plenty of black fruit, tobacco and leathery tannin around an intensely powerful core.

title: Eagle Glen 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This value wine has an astringency that adds to an overall puckering notion of ripeness and oak. Earthy mushroom and compost underlie red fruit, yeast and cedar.

title: Jessie's Grove 2012 Vintner's Choice Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A very strong and spicy oak aroma leaps from the glass, and the same dramatic smoke and chocolate element dominates the flavors of this full-bodied wine to the point that any fruity aspects are very muted.

title: Donkey & Goat 2014 Blakeman Vineyard Merlot (Anderson Valley)
description: Barnyard aromas and massive, drying tannins really stand out in this unusually raw-boned wine. It smells earthy and smoky, tastes meaty and herbaceous, while the texture is full of potent, gripping astringency on first sip that eventually moderates with subsequent tastes.

title: Chasing Lions 2016 Chasing Lions Chardonnay (California)
description: A heavy, sweet-seeming oak coating totally dominates the flavors of this soft-textured low-acid wine. It has baking spices, toasted bread and vanilla, while any fruity component is very subdued.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This screw cap wine is made to be simple and affordable and it is, with a reduced sensibility to the big amount of oak on offer and a harshness to the waxy apple flavor.

title: Uptick Vineyards 2013 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Huge oak and an intensity of ripe flavor give this wine a harsh edginess that's hard to dispel. Compost, coconut and a green hint of bay leaf or cedar mix in a disjointed way.

title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2014 ReZerve Tempranillo (Amador County)
description: This wine has an herbal pickle-barrel component that won't appeal to everyone. The flavors are on the tart side, like cranberry and capers, and some hard-edged oak sticks out on the finish.

title: Trecini 2015 Vicini Family Vineyards Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a funkiness to it that's intensely earthy, with a harshness of oak and tannin.

title: Reyes 2010 Estate Bottled Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: Cooked blackberries, balsamic vinegar and a hint of pepper show on the nose of this wine, which is over the hill already. Peppercorns, more vinegar and sour berries show on the sip.

title: Rock & Vine 2016 Three Ranches Chardonnay (California)
description: A strong smoky, overtly spicy and buttery character swamps any fruitiness in this full-bodied, heavy-textured and seemingly sweet wine.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Dark and vibrant in color, this is a stellar, jaw-dropping wine, beautiful and powerful, in addition to velvety and complex. It captures a mountain appellation seamlessly, all brawny tannin and lengthy weight. Cranberry, cassis, pencil shavings and wild sage form around a grip of grit and stony mineral.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Beckstoffer Las Piedras Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a bright concentrated wine that's velvety in texture and tone. Dried red cherry and cassis complement an undeniably present flirtation of dusty gravel and rock, a taste of terroir that persists and pleases, as medium-bodied weight gives in to a breadth of spicy complexity.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 61% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot and 7% Cabernet Franc into a seamless expression of black pepper, garrigue, clove and pencil. Old world in style and in full command of its power, it offers generously layered, intensely robust tannin and concentration that flirts with richness. Half barrel-fermented and half stainless-steel, it shows promise for cellaring; enjoy best 2023–2038.

title: Hall 2014 Rainin Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From the iconic site atop the mighty mountain appellation, Rainin is exotic in forest, soy and sage notes, with a powerful and densely layered tannin structure. Black pepper, plum and leather are made all the more complex by a tease of rocky ash that gives the wine a distinct mineral character and earthiness. This is one for cellaring. Enjoy 2024–2034.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Luxurious in brick, clove and a wealth of black-cherry pie, this is a beautiful succulent wine from the well-farmed site, silky in texture and integrated seamlessly with desirable oak. Saddle leather and black pepper dot the midpalate as a tangle of acidity weaves through, adding freshness and vibrancy. Cellar through 2033.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Chenoweth Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A bright wave of spicy sarsaparilla rides alongside crunchy, vibrant tones of crisp red cherry, pomegranate and dried herbs in this impressive, well-balanced wine from a tremendous site. Medium bodied, it shows grace and strength in equal measure for superb overall balance.

title: Alpha Omega 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a wow wine, half barrel-fermented and half fermented in stainless steel, that impresses from start to finish. Candied cassis and emphatic aromas of violet ride along a soft, delicately layered embrace of pillowy tannin and an expansive finish of pepper and clove. It hints at complexities that are still developing in the bottle.

title: Hall 2014 Bergfeld Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Smoke and oak commingle on the nose of this bright, crisply underwritten red, with 7% Merlot. Vibrant in red cherry, red licorice and cassis, the flavors are highlighted along a carpet of velvety texture and serious power. Enjoyable now, this should also be lovely and in full grasp of its grace from 2024–2034.

title: Lynmar 2015 Monastery Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Exotic and wild, this wine has a funky, floral and herbal core accented in rose garden and whole-cluster crunch. Decadent, the black cherry, blueberry and Asian spice components accentuate a voluptuously velvety texture and miles of black tea and persistent spice.

title: Lynmar 2015 Old Vines Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine delivers exactly what old vines should: complexity and intrigue. Delicious sparks of tea and wild strawberry are framed by tightly woven tannins across the broad midpalate, resulting in a velvety texture. The long finish boasts excellent evolution, with underpinnings of cardamom at the end.

title: Monte Volpe 2017 Vermentino (Mendocino County)
description: It's a treat to welcome a new producer of Vermentino in California. This wine balances vivid herb and ripe apple flavors with vibrant acidity for a mouthfilling but still refreshing character. Touches of lime and lemon perk up the palate while an almost sweet apple-tart note kicks in on the finish.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County-Napa County)
description: Lavender and licorice combine effortlessly on the nose and entry of this wine, which deserves its reserve billing. Juicy cherry, currant, cedar and dried herb are the highlights, woven around a dense core of generous tannin, richness and density. Enjoy 2024–2034.

title: Quivira 2017 Wine Creek Ranch Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is such a winning combination, a blend of 47% Grenache, 25% Mourvèdre, 15% Petite Sirah, 8% Counoise and 5% Syrah, all from the estate. Fuzzy apricot and peach present first within a dark pinkish-red color. Strawberry follows, the whole brightened by plenty of buzzy acidity.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Primitivo (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of red-plum jelly and berry syrup are lifted by fresh-plucked thyme and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling, which includes 12% Petite Sirah. The wine leans toward a heavier-bodied style on the palate, where intense blackberry flavors meet with forest herbs and a lively acidity, proving quite complex.

title: Siduri 2016 Parsons' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This long-standing vineyard designate is robust on the nose in forest earthiness and spicy cardamom, and pleasantly expansive on the palate in lasting concentration and jammy cherry and strawberry flavors.

title: Sola 2014 Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: Ripe and bold in flavor, this polished, focused wine is full bodied and firmly tannic. It has effusive blackberry aromas and wonderfully dry, concentrated flavors.

title: Tercero 2017 Aberration Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is another boundary-breaking bottling by Larry Tercero, who foot stomped this whole cluster blend of 40% Cinsault, 40% Grenache and 20% Carignan, aged it solely in stainless steel and then released it young with advice to chill before drinking. It's light in color and loaded with aromas of carnation, rose petal, red plum, cola and wet stone. The palate's rounded bright red fruit is fun and easy to glug.

title: Three Sticks 2016 The James Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Named after proprietor Bill Price's son, this bottling offers lean yet focused black raspberry and crushed purple flowers on the nose, as well as a slightly sour funky streak. The palate is framed by tangy dense boysenberry with a hint of pine tar. Patience will allow the flavors to better coalesce. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Trinchero 2015 BRV Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This estate-grown, 100% varietal wine is well made and full bodied in its thick, billowy yet tannic structure. Baked blueberry and leather provide a dense, savory core marked by lasting cedar and black pepper impressions.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned citrus is wrapped in youthful oak in this integrated, textured wine that's medium in weight and ripeness. A dustiness of crushed rock and nutmeg ride along the underside of the palate, lending nuance and savory balance to the fruit before a bolt of acidity hits the fresh, focused finish.

title: La Crema 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a wonderful wine, made in large enough quantities to be easily found on store shelves. Smoky, meaty and gamy aromas rise from the glass around perfumed rose. The palate is juicy and velvety, with flavors of berry pie and cinnamon.

title: Larner 2014 Elemental Red (Ballard Canyon)
description: Dark candied black-cherry and baked licorice aromas make for a rich entry to this bottling by Michael Larner. A smooth yet structured texture delivers ripe flavors of cracked pepper and boysenberry sorbet.

title: Spear 2016 Estate Grown Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light on its feet, this cool-climate Syrah shows just-pressed elderberry and boysenberry on the nose, with hints of cedar, herbs and game. The palate is restrained, likely a reflection of the young vines, with clean and easy flavors of berry, thyme and white pepper.

title: Spicy Vines 2015 Dragon's Kiss Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Full bodied but well balanced, dry and somewhat restrained in fruit flavors, this wine brings on the complex earthy meaty untamed aromas and flavors of the grape variety as well as blackberry and blueberry that build on the finish. It's a good way to put more adventure in your diet.

title: Tercero 2017 Rosé of Mourvèdre (Santa Barbara County)
description: Soft aromas of nectarine, raspberry granita and cotton candy come across as extremely fresh, crisp and clean on this rosé of Mourvèdre from Camp 4 Vineyard. There is a great zesty quality to the palate, which is full of life and taut with flavors of red pear, Pink Lady apple and grapefruit zest.

title: Derby 2014 Derby Vineyard Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted blackberry and black-plum aromas meet with milk chocolate and baking spice on the nose of this bottling, which sees 21% new oak. The flavors are broad and rich with violets, black currants and blueberries, framed by strong tannins and a persistent deep acidity.

title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Brut Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Made from estate-grown Pinot Noir, Chardonnay and Pinot Gris, this wine is focused in acidity, with dry, fresh components of lemon and green apple. Complex in mineral overtones, it offers a taste of oyster shell and wet stone.

title: Joseph Phelps 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Leather, tobacco and smoky char define the opening of this full-bodied, rich wine, blended with 15% Merlot, 3% Petit Verdot, 3% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. Woody and structured, its fruit leans dark and plummy, ending on a touch of dark chocolate.

title: Andrew Murray 2017 Espérance Curtis Vineyard Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This rosé bridges the gap between sunshine-driven fruits and the more mineral character of a classic pink wine, starting with a nose that blends ripe melon, strawberry and bubblegum aromas with wet river stones. The palate is crisp, bright and very stony, yet there is a peach element as well. Sure to please many palates.

title: Baldassari Family Wines 2015 Nolan Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Bright, dusty leather and raspberry cola highlight this lovely vineyard-designate, which shows cool-climate aromatics and retention of acidity. In balance, it's both fruity and weighty, with varietal highlights of pepper and garrigue.

title: Estancia 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark blackberry fruit meets with raw game on the nose of this bottling. Tangy black-plum flavors meet with a funky kick on the palate.

title: Kunde 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a dull tannic red, earthy in dried herb, sage and a lasting note of clove. It is full bodied and presents as duly ripe.

title: Millésimé 2013 Stone Rouge Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Black currant and elderberry aromas show on the overly ripe nose of this blend of 34% Merlot, 34% Cabernet Franc and 32% Sangiovese. Deep-black-fruit flavors meet with caramel, vanilla and balsamic vinegar on the palate.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2017 Proprietor's Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thickly constructed white that tastes sweet in vanilla and mango, a big expression of the variety that opts for richness over freshness.

title: Viaggio 2015 River Red (Lodi)
description: An earthy barnyardy aroma gives way to flavors like tamarind and dried cherries in this funky but interesting wine. Medium body and moderate tannins give it some weight on the palate.

title: Millésimé 2014 Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Overextracted aromas of reduced kirsch and cassis make for a very ripe nose. The palate is almost sweet but also very tangy with ripe extracted fruit.

title: Replica 2016 Retrofit Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Sweet fig, olive and sugar apple are the flavors that first come to the fore of this full-bodied, ripe and robust wine, which is flat in structure with little acidity.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Bohemian Rhapsody Red (Paso Robles)
description: Extremely overextracted on the nose, this shows aromas of cassis, dried berries and grape seed. It's tangy and ripe on the palate, with more grape-seed flavors.

title: Roth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine struggles for definition, showing a dryness of tannin around harsh, astringent green notes and overwhelming ripeness.

title: Kunde 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is tannic and heavy, made in a big full-bodied style that overwhelms at times. Soy, leather and earth feature prominently.

title: Leese-Fitch 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: A freshly sawn oak aroma and equally oaky flavors make this wine a one-note song. It is medium bodied and reasonably smooth in texture.

title: Pestoni Family 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: From a single vineyard, this white is given six months to chill in stainless steel. It tastes concentrated and full, with an overt tartness to the underlying acidity.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Riesling (Temecula Valley)
description: Sweet aromas of peach and apple syrup show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also quite sweet with fizzy lime-zest flavors than fall flat rather quickly.

title: Naggiar 2014 Nightshade Red (California)
description: This wine tastes fully mature, with aromas like balsamic and cedar, and flavors that are more earthy and leathery than fruity.

title: Briceland 2017 Pinot Gris (Humboldt County)
description: This is a decent-quality wine that shows mild apple and canteloupe flavors, a rather soft texture and medium body.

title: Spicy Vines 2015 Zin Master Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A sweetness of vanilla is highlighted from the oak in this candied, fleshy and simple wine that finishes in a burst of overripe heat.

title: Kenwood 2014 Six Ridges Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is unduly green and chalky on the palate, with a disjointed approach to acidity. Full bodied and robust, it struggles to maintain structure.

title: Cuda Ridge Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Livermore Valley)
description: Extreme aromas of garlic and onions lead to crisp lemon and garlic flavors that push the envelope of acceptability, but may suit some people's taste buds.

title: Kendric 2016 Proprietor Grown Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This dry lean wine is medium bodied and has a sunbaked mature character. The fruit aromas and flavors are minimal, conceding to dusty dry-earth notes.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a drinkable but very bland wine showing almost neutral flavors, low alcohol and a soft texture.

title: Furthermore 2014 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This winery is packaging the freshness and restraint that's possible in this region, with this bottling offering aromas of pomegranate, red currant and star anise on the nose. The palate is vibrant with red fruit, yet it is the bay leaf, wild mint and fennel pollen flavors that impress most and carry deep into the finish.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Fort Ross Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: From the coastal ridges of the appellation, this lovely wine is tart in strawberry, pomegranate and orange, with a beautiful floral element that lifts the pronounced acidity and darker, more savory forest-floor tones. Spicy and complex, it hits the palate with an intriguing twist of sea spray.

title: Heath Vineyards 2014 Absolution Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Snappy boysenberry meets with vanilla, roasted chocolate and purple flowers on the nose of this bottling, which is made by a Texas-based producer. There is great peppery spice to the sip, where dried herbs and roast beef give depth to the black-currant flavors. Lively acidity and polished tannins complete the picture.

title: Kaena 2014 Clone 362 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Dense blackberries, vanilla, star anise and ripe elderberries show on the nose of this clonal selection by Grenache guru Mikael Sigouin. Thick black plum and black-currant-sauce flavors combine with soy and violet on the palate, where a bright acidity penetrates deep into the finish.

title: Peter Franus 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From the Stewart Vineyard in Carneros, planted with the Musqué clone, this white is spicy and sublimely textured, with a persistence of mineral mystique and balanced ripeness. Its well-crafted fruitiness is a mix of white peach and lime.

title: Phillips Hill 2015 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Wonderful complexity and an appealing earthiness help this mouth-watering wine stand out. It has earthy, forest-floor aromas and bold but not overtly ripe flavors like rhubarb and sour cherry while the texture is nervy and alive with good acidity and moderate tannins. It's worth a search for something this unique.

title: Quivira 2015 Wine Creek Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This complex vineyard-designate is spicy and earthy in equal measure, the burst of white pepper most memorable. Dried plum, rhubarb and strawberry compote add to the story, with a fresh core of acidity piercing through the strong tannin.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 The Big Game Red (Adelaida District)
description: There's an impressive density to the aromas of this blend of 39% Cabernet Sauvignon, 37% Syrah, 15% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec, with ample amounts of black plum, lilac and damp forest wood. The palate's hearty structure carries ample purple fruit as well as dark chocolate, thyme marjoram and rainbow peppercorn flavors. Quite thick with tannins.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Sourced from older vines, this vineyard-designate wine is seductive on the nose in a rose petal aroma. Restrained in oak, the palate is structured and vibrant in flavors of dark cherry, raspberry, black licorice and chocolate.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Weir Vineyard Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Strong cinnamon and clove aromas lead to bold, ripe black-cherry and cassis flavors in this full-bodied, well-structured and ultimately nuanced wine. It has lots of grip on the palate from firm tannins and bright acidity, while the spicy oak flavors last all the way to the finish.

title: Lava Cap 2014 Estate Bottled Cabernet Franc (El Dorado)
description: This is a great find from a high-performing estate in the Sierra Foothills. Wonderful ripe fruit and chocolate flavors combine in a seductive texture that seems to melt in the mouth. Bursting with black cherries and blackberries, this full-bodied wine offers a plush mouthfeel from softly layered tannins and relatively low acidity, so it's delicious to drink.

title: Ancien 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: From a vineyard known better for Chardonnay and Pinot Noir, this lovely aromatic white is well crafted and fruity, dry with a creaminess to the texture that's beguiling without becoming too much. Lemon, quince and apricot flavors provide a bright, lingering fleshiness that will work deliciously at the table. It spent six months in neutral French oak.

title: Birichino 2014 Antle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: There's a lot of wild thyme, dusty creek bed and rainy cement on the nose of this bottling, with only the slightest hint of cranberry fruit. The palate's tension is tremendous, which is common for the appellation, with crushed sandstone and rugged earthiness cloaking the cran-hibiscus flavors. It's lightly bodied but firm with upright tannins.

title: Bokisch 2014 Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: There's no reason to drink Cabernet all the time when delicious, well-balanced and firm-textured California Tempranillos like this are becoming more and more common. From a specialist in Iberian grape varieties, the wine has lightly spicy aromas, nicely layered red- and black-cherry and wood-smoke flavors that fill the mouth and linger on the finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 VDK Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: A brightness of cherry and cranberry shines in this medium-bodied well-integrated wine, that has a complexity of texture that offers a slight grittiness. Cardamom, clove and white pepper successfully season the fruit.

title: Lang & Reed 2014 Two-Fourteen Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the Entav clone, intended to showcase a Loire Valley-style, this does indeed possess grace and charm, with a well-developed sense of dried herb and violet. Soft and expansive in texture, it features integrated tannins within a strong sense of French oak, allowing plenty of room for expansive raspberry flavors to burst throughout.

title: Foley 2015 T Anchor Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sagebrush, French toast and raspberry-syrup aromas make for a dynamic and delicious nose on this bottling. Then chaparral spice meets with salt, pepper, bay leaf and juniper on the palate, spicing up the ripe dark-red fruits.

title: Hertelendy 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This blends in 11% Petit Verdot, 7% Merlot, 5% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc, the whole aged nearly two years in 90% new French oak. Brawny in leather saddle, clove, dark chocolate and a substantial backbone of dense tannin, it's also rounded and fleshy in black cherry and cassis, with fresh, focused acidity.

title: Jessie's Grove 2013 Royal Tee Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a big flavor-packed wine made from some of Lodi's oldest vines. It's quite deep in color, very fruity in aroma, full in body and with nice depth to the ripe blackberry and boysenberry flavors. Accents of black pepper and clove emerge with each sip, while the wine has enough tannin and more than enough body to give a good sense of heft.

title: Paul Dolan 2015 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine was aged longer than most in oak barrels, and has wonderful subtleties that make it compelling to sip, savor and sip again. It starts with a light-gold color, then offers tangy citrus aromas that are lighter and leaner than the flavors to follow, which bring ripe pear and subtle baking spices. The body is full and the texture feels smooth, but with a good touch of crisp acidity.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2016 McConnell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From a vineyard that's 1,100 feet above Woodside, this bottling offers rounded red cherry, grenadine, densely packed rose petals and potpourri on the nose. The palate is zesty with red flowers and fruit-punch flavors, floating across the tongue with vibrant acidity and a lighter mouthfeel.

title: Croix 2015 Narrow Gauge Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, smoky and lightly spiced, this appellation wine shows moderate acidity and full-bodied concentration. Black tea, cardamom and baking spice give complexity to the upfront baked cherry and raspberry flavor, finishing in oaky texture.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Clone 337 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Mild spices and rich fruit flavors meld nicely in this full-bodied, plush-textured wine that is just as good as the stellar 2012. Attractive baking spice and cedar aromas precede ripe black cherry and cooked plum flavors. Moderate tannins add some extra structure. It is well-balanced and quite appetizing.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Deviate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Deviating from its usual path of single-vineyard designates, this wine blends grapes from the Jentoft Vineyard in Green Valley with the coastal Putnam Vineyard near Annapolis. Relatively thick, oaky and tannic at first, it offers robust black fruit and complex texture, followed by handfuls of baking spice and supple intensity.

title: Effort 2016 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Candied black raspberry, white pepper and bay leaf make for a lively, aromatic entry to this bottling. There is an ample amount of acidity on the palate, but also plenty of fruit and spice, from dark berry to thyme and ginger.

title: En Garde 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Tart tangy red fruit tastes slightly dried and fig-like in this lush plush red that's full bodied and ripe. The volcanic soils of the appellation accent mineral-laden teases of crushed rock and stone.

title: Kokomo 2016 Gopher Hill Block Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Light, floral and fragrant, this is a delicately layered wine that concurrently offers plenty of power and underlying richness of flavor. Strawberry and raspberry present with ease around a core of lovely earth and lingering Asian spice.

title: Mabera 2013 Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is delicious, dark and deep, from the almost-black color to spicy dark-chocolate aromas, extremely rich blueberry and espresso-bean flavors and a very firm tannic texture. The wine easily absorbs a lot of spicy oak and balances it with layers of fruit and fine-grained tannins. Best after 2025.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2014 Jewel Collection Series Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a big, bold, oaky and delicious wine from the first whiff of cedar and mint to the lingering, meaty, spicy finish. In between are layers of black cherry, blackberry and dark chocolate that coat the palate and a mouthfilling body braced by firm tannins.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2016 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Red plums, rust, turned earth, charred wood and oak-smoked meat aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a great bounce of acidity on the sip, where cranberry compote, sumac, orange rind and mulling-spice flavors take hold, finishing on a vanilla kick.

title: Zaca Mesa 2014 Estate Vineyard Roussanne (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp aromas of key lime pith, nectarine, lemon blossom and chalk show on the restrained, tightly woven nose of this bottling by Eric Mohseni. The palate offers a texturally tight feel, with supple flavors of grapefruit rind, cherimoya, honeysuckle and Gravenstein apple.

title: Materra Cunat Family Vineyards 2017 Cunat Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: This lovely white has a bright, floral nose and is fresh in flavor. Well-textured, it offers a wealth of delicious peach skin, Meyer lemon and grapefruit pith, the tang and juiciness of the fruit flavors melded together in impressive harmony.

title: Pulchella 2015 Awakening Red (Paso Robles)
description: This study of richness blends 56% Tannat from the Bella Collina Vineyard with 44% Petite Sirah from Loma Seca to deliver deep and dark aromas of black currant, smoke and coffee-caramel candies. The palate offers joyous purple fruits along with vanilla and caramel, cut by tart plum skins. It is sure to please crowds seeking a mouth-filling wine.

title: Venge 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is invitingly fresh in floral rose and lavender, offering a broad depth of flavor around moderate acidity and plenty of enticing flesh and plush tannin. The layered fruit dips into strawberry, dark cherry and blackberry territory, mouthfilling and pleasurable on the lengthy, Asian-spiced finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy in baked citrus, black tea and clove, this wine offers a supple midpalate and plenty of length. Moderate acidity and balanced ripeness transition to a savory crushed-mineral tone. It's rich within reason, more elegant than robust.

title: Beauregard 2014 Coast Grade Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Rust and red cherry meet with rhubarb and sage oil on the nose of this bottling from an extremely coastal site north of Santa Cruz. Bountiful acidity cuts through the rhubarb, pomegranate and fig balsamic notes of the vibrant palate.

title: Beauregard 2015 Beauregard Ranch Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: This bottling is quite dense on the nose with aromas of forest pine, juniper, bay leaf, rusty earth and dried cherry. There is richness to the palate, where a shiitake mushroom and boysenberry meet with similar forest and juniper notes.

title: Eric Kent 2017 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is made from 77% Pinot Noir, 17% Syrah and 6% Grenache. The trio works well together, combining to offer a distinct minerality of crushed rock around complex, curious flavors of cured meat, citrus and strawberry. The wine is dark as Dolcetto in color.

title: Heitz 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Made from certified organic grapes, this wine offers a strong uplift of acidity and refreshing layers of tangerine, white peach and Meyer lemon. With just enough grip and body it has complexity amid the freshness.

title: Baldacci 2013 Fraternity Red (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy herb and turned earth open this blend of 58% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Merlot and 9% Malbec. Offering substantial length and breadth, it's dusty in crushed rock, rose and cedar, with supple, lasting power and a distinct finish of dark cherry.

title: Pulchella 2016 Mercenary Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling, which includes 3% Tannat, is very fruit-forward but in a measured way, starting with red-plum jelly and red-cherry candy that benefit from sprinklings of licorice and sagebrush spice. The palate is lush and soft, cut by steadily rising acidity, and showing flavor of dark-red fruit and cinnamon.

title: Roar 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Golden apples, lime zest and lemon blossoms show strongly on the sunny nose of this bottling. The palate offers a tangy lemon-lime acidity and a chalky texture, proving racy and almost spicy with citrusy acidity.

title: Tolosa 2016 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Leathery tannin leads the way to a feral, wild quality in this wine—a savory persistence that intrigues and provokes the palate. Dense notions of dark cherry and black tea mingle around a forested spice that's part crushed rock mineral, part earthy mushroom.

title: Baileyana 2016 Firepeak Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Damp forest floor, dark berries and campfire aromas kick off the nose of this twist-top bottling that's always a solid Pinot Noir for a fair price. The palate is rich with earthy flavors of juniper and turned loam, and there is a rich mulberry component in the background leading into the acid-washed finish.

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Aromas of bursting boysenberries, sweet mint and dried flowers make for an exciting and fresh entry to this bottling. There is decent weight to the palate, where dark berry, licorice, sage oil and lavender flavors play out.

title: Acumen 2017 Mountainside Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Shy at first on the nose, this wine develops to reveal a voluptuous style of fleshy, rounded grapefruit, pineapple, cantaloupe and Meyer lemon. It remains complex and exotic through a lengthy midpalate and textured finish, with persistent acidity.

title: Allan Hancock 2014 Captain's Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: For what is essentially the class project at Allan Hancock College in Santa Maria, this is a solid wine. Baked vanilla cake, strawberry compote and clove aromas show on the nose, while the delicious, rather rich palate offers pound cake, baked cherries and vanilla. It's quite opulent but easy to enjoy.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2017 Riesling (Edna Valley)
description: Clean aromas of Meyer lemon pith, orange blossom, tangy apple, wet cement and a hint of petrol show on the nose of this bottling. Very dry and tightly wound on the palate, it offers tense tangerine peels and refreshing Meyer lemon flavors.

title: Covenant 2015 Neshama Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: An unusual blend of 60% Petit Verdot, 25% Malbec and 15% Syrah, this is a lush and meaty wine, rustically earthy and robust in leather. Cocoa powder, baked bread and tobacco round out the concentrated flavors.

title: El Lugar 2017 Greengate Ranch & Vineyard Blanc Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Winemaker Coby Parker-Garcia turns red Pinot Noir into a rich white wine each vintage, and this year's offers rounded nectarine, white melon, peach blossom and a tinge of grapefruit rind on the nose. There is solid tension to the palate, where rounded stone-fruit flavors meet with a touch of pear.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Butterscotch, daffodils, lemon cream and white flower buds show on the rich buttery nose of this bottling by a former race car driver-turned-vintner. Warmer tones of melted butter meet with Meyer lemon rinds on the palate, which finishes on butterscotch. It's held together by a compellingly taut texture.

title: Kobler 2017 Marsha's Vineyard Viognier (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral in jasmine, this is a nicely put together wine, tight in firm integrated acidity. Light layers of apple and peach give it a bright succulence that belies the underlying ripeness and unctuous texture.

title: Kunde 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: With a touch of reduction, this is indeed a reserve-tier wine in quality. It is concentrated and richly woven in flavors of apple pie and cinnamon. Tones of brioche and crème brûlée lend additional power alongside the bright acidity.

title: Midnight 2014 Zenith Estate Grown Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Licorice, dark red cherries, candied rose petals and hibiscus show on the nose of this blend of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Malbec, 20% Merlot and 10% Petit Verdot. It's fairly thick on the palate, offering roasted cherry, star anise and baking spice flavors, framed by tannins that arise on the finish.

title: Mill Creek 2017 Vera's Block Heritage Series Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp, bright and balanced, this white is floral in jasmine with a persistence of peach and pear flavor. Given time in neutral oak, it offers body and richness without heaviness, remaining fresh on the finish.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2013 Due Figli Estate Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: Tangy strawberry and red plum meet with sweet cherry-wood smoke and new leather on the nose of this bottling. There is a lot of earthy and spicy depth to the palate, where cinnamon and star anise lift the plump red fruit, all enveloped in chalky tannins and steadily rising acidity.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 Black Oak Vineyard Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp and fresh aromas of blackberry meet with a deep leathery backdrop on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines boysenberry with healthy pinches of oregano, marjoram and black pepper, yet it is quite young still, and will emerge with much more to say in the years to come.

title: Rideau 2015 Estate Mourvèdre (Los Olivos District)
description: Red-cherry-juice aromas mesh into leather, dried herbs and rustic mint aromas on the nose of this bottling. It's lightly bodied and clean on the tense palate, blending bright pomegranate with more leather and dried meats, ending on a caramel-laced finish.

title: Rusack 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Ballard Canyon)
description: This bottling, which comes from the historic Santa Cruz Island clone, starts with a very expressive nose that shows roasted strawberry, baking spice and light oak touches. Candied-strawberry and watermelon flavors arise on the palate, set against an elegantly spicy background of star anise and allspice.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Though the nose on this bottling is somewhat restrained, the aromas that do show are quite deep and dark, with boysenberry, alpine strawberry, purple flowers and cola. There is a nice pop to the acid-driven sip, where tart pomegranate and black-raspberry flavors meet with wet slate and a grippy texture.

title: Raymond 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This is a subtle wine that shows fig and subdued melon flavors on a smooth, non-tart texture. It is full bodied, light in terms of concentration but the rich mouthfeel will suit many palates.

title: Smoke Tree 2017 Rosé (California)
description: Light in body, light in flavor, this pale-pink wine tastes refreshing and straightforward, lean in terms of fruit flavor but showing an attractive herbaceous aroma.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of ripe fruit flavors. Fuji apple and honeydew melon take center stage, with low-acid and a soft texture.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2017 M Rosé (Temecula Valley)
description: A darker shade of reddish pink and sold in a high-shouldered bottling, this rosé offers aromas of cherry juice, earth, rust and gravel. Dried red-plum flavors show on the palate, which is lacking the higher acid found across the category.

title: Benziger 2017 Frank Johnson Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Grassy, this presents an herbal component of pea shoots and sharp up-front acidity, the midpalate midweight in body and ripeness. It lingers in a strong taste of lemon peel.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Belle Terre Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: Muted aromatically, this wine is intense in oak and richness, a mix of tropical pineapple, baked apple and robust butterscotch.

title: Ravenswood 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Meaty and woody, this combines mostly Zin with small amounts of Petite Sirah, Carignan and mixed blacks. Together they offer intensity and ripe blackberry jam and chocolate.

title: Gnarly Head 2016 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: Red plum, baking spice, dewy herbs, tobacco and a sour licorice aroma show on the nose of this well-known wine. The palate is more flat but clean, with simple tart pomegranate flavors.

title: Hungry Hawk 2016 Hill Springs Malbec (San Diego County)
description: Concord grape jelly, wisteria, candied violets and a hint of dank herbs show on the extremely powerful nose of this bottling, which is impressive simply for aromatic explosiveness. The palate shows roasted herbs and tangy fruit flavors.

title: Samuel Charles 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: Smoky, spicy aromas have a charred edge and lead to flavors that lean heavily toward oak rather than fruit. The wine is medium bodied and moderately tannic.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: This is a light-bodied wine with honest, straightforward and rather light fruit flavors and decent balance. An earthy trace in the aroma gets covered with good, moderate apple and kiwi flavors.

title: Chop Shop 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a good medium-bodied wine for those who don't mind generous sweet-oak seasoning. It smells like maple syrup and brown sugar, and adds black-cherry notes on the palate along with another wave of oaky spices.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This is a light-bodied refreshing wine that smells herbaceous, tastes lemony with a touch of sweetness and has a texture between crisp and soft.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2017 Estate Lilly Rosé of Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: One of the deeper-colored and more full-flavored styles, this wine is medium in body, has meaty, plummy flavors and a smooth texture.

title: Clone 7 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Oaky and grippy, with a strong taste of smoky char, this is for fans of a fruity robust style. The dark-red fruit diminished on the finish.

title: Magnolia Court Dorrian 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Rather light on the nose, this bottling shows dried red-fruit aromas. There is decent acidity to the sip, and then it fades into generic red fruit and a hint of fennel.

title: Septentrio 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Tannic and compressed in texture, this wine offers dark fruit and dried herb around elbows of sizzling acidity.

title: Sola 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Heavy oak aromas and flavors get in the way of the fruit character of this medium-bodied wine. It has plenty of cedar, vanilla and cinnamon notes along with the sweet sensation that comes from oak barrels or add-ins.

title: Swank n Smith 2015 Peacock Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)
description: Almost liqueur-like on the nose, this bottling shows kirsch and licorice on the overripe nose. Roasted plum and more licorice are evident on the palate, which is not all that reminiscent of Pinot Noir.

title: Line 39 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: The grape variety of this light-bodied lean-textured wine is instantly recognizable from the herb and veggie aromas and flavors. However, the obvious fresh herb, snap pea and onion flavors will be too extreme for some drinkers.

title: Schug 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: With an exotic nose of gardenia and jasmine, this is an inviting light-bodied white that is bright in sizzling acidity, with a strong taste of peach and melon.

title: Starmont 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine offers a balanced celebration of plum, dark cherry and cola spice that's velvety and textured. With moderate acidity keeping it fresh in the glass, it offers depth and length, as well as a slight tease of orange peel.

title: Stasis 2016 Murmur Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Clean and well-rounded on the nose, this bottling shows ripe pear, tight banana, white flowers and a toasty warmth. There's a hint of mango tropicality on the sip, but the bright citrusy edge of lime juice and flashes of toast and wood provide balance.

title: Stolo 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This fresh and zesty bottling smells of springtime, with lily and light sweetgrass aromas as well as riper flashes of peach, pear and apple flesh. There's zip and grip to the sip, with candied grapefruit rind and passion-fruit flavors.

title: Talley 2015 East Rincon Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Earthy aromas of turned loam mix with Bing cherry on the nose of this bottling, which is likely to grow more complex and intriguing with age. It's light and fresh on the sip, showing red currant, vanilla and a light touch of spice.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2014 Terzetto Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from one-third each Cabernet Sauvignon, Cabernet Franc and Merlot, all grown from the producer's estate vineyards in remote Chiles Valley. It's beautifully floral and soft, with a mix of candied plum, coffee and dried herb. Dusty, balanced and juicy, it is a lovely representation of elegance and quiet power.

title: Wise Villa 2016 Torrontés (Alta Mesa)
description: This is a rich, floral, slightly sweet and rather full-bodied white wine that resembles Gewürztraminer in the aromas of rose petals and lychees. It has lots of ripe pear and apricot flavors, an almost thick texture despite low alcohol and a delicious lingering finish.

title: Heitz 2015 Grignolino (Napa Valley)
description: The winery has been making this unusual red since 1961. Wrapped in a rose petal aroma, this is lightly textured on the palate and offers a light touch  of tangy cranberry and red-currant flavors. This is a lovely wine for the dinner table or as an aperitif.

title: Croix 2015 Starling Morelli Roost Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fleshy and bright in citrus and green apple, this wine is driven by its streak of supportive acidity, a succulence that helps moderate the toasted oak, nuttiness and full-strength body.

title: Derby 2014 Derby Vineyard Fifteen 10 White (Paso Robles)
description: Nearly half of this blend of 35% Viognier, 20% Marsanne, 18% Roussanne, 18% Picpoul Blanc and 9% Grenache Blanc is aged in acacia, with the other half in stainless steel and 8% in amphora. That combo delivers broad toasty aromas that are light and buttery yet convey guava jam and honeydew syrup touches. The palate is rounded with pear, peach and Rainier cherry flavors, enveloped in a racy lemony veil.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Cotes de Tablas Red (Adelaida District)
description: The 55% Grenache component of this blend takes the lead on the nose, where crushed rose, bright cherry, framboise and jasmine aromas align. The 25% Syrah, 13% Mourvèdre and 7% Counoise make their slighter presence a bit more known on the complex palate, where candied strawberry, cherry and pomegranate flavors dominate.

title: Black's Station 2016 Malbec (Yolo County)
description: Dark in color, this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine offers a black pepper tone with just-ripe blueberry and licorice flavors. These notes fan out on the finish and leave a ripe aftertaste.

title: Bruliam 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is an approachable, lovable expression of peach and apricot with a floral nose that invites one in to explore. Fresh citrus-driven acidity drives the brightness of the wine, making it both thirst-quenching and fun.

title: Carol Shelton 2014 Florence Vineyard Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This gets more than two years in mostly new American oak, as well as a sprinkling of Alicante Bouschet. Pepper, meat and violet rise from the nose, complementing the fleshy fruity blueberry that is to come. Full bodied, the wine is velvety soft and supple in texture and balanced in weight.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2016 Randall Grahm Clone Viognier (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Lightly honeyed aromas as well as honeydew meet with crushed chalk and hot sand on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows strong and fresh lemon flavors alongside a touch of cantaloupe, but remains expertly restrained throughout.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: From both the east and west sides of the appellation, this is an intensely fruity wine, soft in cassis and plum, that offers a sizable presence of polished tannin. The oak takes on a dustiness of black pepper and dark chocolate that lingers in spicy clove.

title: Keller 2015 El Coro Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy in mushroom and pine, this Petaluma Gap-made wine is generous in tannin, with a substantial underlying weight that supports cherry and blueberry flavors. The earthiness takes on a stemmy quality that is wild and complex.

title: MacRostie 2017 Clockwise Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Sourced from the Mirabelle and Jewell Ranch vineyards, the grapes Musque clone, this is a delightfully delicious and impressively made white. Floral, herbal and steely, it shows a wealth of crisp green apple and melon flavor with just a touch of neutral oak influence.

title: Matchbook 2016 The Arsonist Chardonnay (Dunnigan Hills)
description: A toasty, oaky, spicy aroma precedes equally oaky flavors that are nevertheless backed by ripe, juicy pear and ginger notes. These tones expand on the palate and linger on the finish. It's full bodied and broad in texture.

title: Obscurity 2015 Estate Geoff & Katy Vineyard Malbec (Fair Play)
description: More than just fruity, this intense and concentrated wine is deep and dark in color, smells like wood smoke and black pepper and tastes like blackberries, anise and dark chocolate. It is full-bodied and firmly tannic in texture to pair well with the richest roast or steak.

title: Spottswoode 2015 Lyndenhurst Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This remains one of the most impressive wines at its price point—a varietal wine blended with small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, from both the producer's estate and other pedigreed sites. Tense acidity buoys a brawny tannic profile that settles into lushness texture, highlighted in black fruit, butter, gunpowder and plum.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Three Palms Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced and brimming in barrel oak, this is a full-bodied, concentrated and ageworthy wine, flavored in strong layers of baked plum, cinnamon and soy. As it opens, generous helpings of blueberry and fig figure into the mix, adding to the complexity. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Reserve Grenache Noir (Amador County)
description: This wine is nervy in a good way, showing good acidity to match generous alcohol and a fine mixture of complex aromas and flavors ranging from mineral and dried herb to cherry, iron and beef juices. The color is in the natural lighter end of the garnet range, the aromas bring a wide variety of nuances, and the fruity threads weave in and out of savory ones on the palate and finish.

title: Arrow & Branch 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a lovely, barrel-fermented white that sources widely from Stagecoach Vineyard, a mountainous site that provides structure and balanced power in this case. Strong varietal aromas of pineapple, peach and anise ride a fleshy midpalate that refreshes in complex layers of lasting flavor.

title: Bee Hunter 2014 Oppenlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: Very fruity, very pretty in flavor and elegant in texture, this well-balanced wine tastes fresh and cherrylike, slightly floral and lightly spicy too. It seems to glide across the palate with ease and leave a lingering aftertaste of cinnamon and cherries.

title: Corison 2015 Sunbasket Vineyard Helios Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this shines in its full embrace of woody succulence, driven by a core of balanced red and black cherry. Tightly woven tannins provide structure without distraction or dominance, allowing an earthy thread of leather and clove to close things out.

title: Domaine Anderson 2014 Dach Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Smooth and supple, but with a strong heart of dark and ripe fruit flavors, this is a big wine in terms of flavor that still comes off elegant and well balanced despite its power. It's also full bodied, not overtly oaky, and seems to get better with each sip.

title: Easton 2015 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This is a deep, rich and mouth-filling wine from the heart of Zinfandel country in Amador County. It offers an abundance of ripe berries, black pepper and hints of oak spices. It's full bodied, creamy in texture, layered with black fruits and has a soothing, moderately tannic texture. Best through 2024.

title: Giornata 2017 Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: This is an immensely fun, fruity and fresh wine, a vibrant display of delicious youth that's ready to glug now. Light in the glass, the wine shows fruit punch and all manner of red fruit on the nose, along with some carnations. The palate offers red apple and watermelon but with tannic grip and ample spice to make it memorable.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2014 Barrack Family Estate Ten-Goal Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: There is very playful and buoyant energy to the nose of this blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon, 5% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc, 5% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot, with fresh and inviting aromas of ripe black plum, blackberries and spring flower petals. The palate is delicately bodied and full of black-raspberry and dried herb flavors.

title: Margerum 2017 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This extremely energetic and zippy bottling offers grassy elements on the nose that are balanced by hints of passion fruit, wet stone and lime rind. The palate is extremely textural and grippy, delivering pear and apple flavors along with pink-grapefruit pith and a chalky finish.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Toasted almond, lemon peel, grapefruit pith, ash and a waft of smoke show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the Brack Mountain Winery family. The palate is broad with lemon, pluot and hazelnut flavors, proving equal parts fresh, fruity and savory with every touch point needed in a Chardonnay.

title: Rocca 2014 Grigsby Merlot (Yountville)
description: Cinnamon-covered cherry and black currant highlight this beautifully layered, spicy and complex example of the variety—a well-made, full-bodied effort that finishes in a dusting of cocoa powder and coconut.

title: Tantara 2016 Dierberg Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light raspberry and strawberry aromas mesh with star anise and close on the pleasing if somewhat mellow nose of this single-vineyard expression. Riper, richer flavors of vanilla, oak, baking spice and cooked berries show on the palate, which is powered by strong acid.

title: Tantara 2016 Zotovich Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Framboise, sweet dill, moss and dewy herbs show on the nose of this bottling from the Sta. Rita Hills. A grippy texture grabs hold of the palate right away and won't let go, allowing pungent and underripe strawberry, cinnamon and all spice flavors to grab the attention.

title: Ex Post Facto 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This Syrah from Winemaker Greg Brewer is dynamic and built to last, starting with aromas of crushed peppercorn, tapenade, twigs, ground pepper, tar and elderberry fruit. The palate combines black currant with tart black-plum skin, thyme, bay and peppercorns, ending on flashes of tar and mocha.

title: Bacio Divino 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is 93% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Sangiovese—a tense, focused and structured blend that's full bodied and rich. Black currant, mocha and dusty crushed rock provide a complement of fruit and mineral characteristics that work well together and while supported by toasted oak.

title: Bargetto 2017 Regan Vineyards Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Broad and fleshy aromas of white melon and sliced pear are cut with a lime and kumquat edge on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the Watsonville area. There is decent tension and acid on the tip of the sip, with fresh and penetrating flavors of Meyer lemon, key-lime balm and light almond on the finish.

title: Bee Hunter 2014 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This is a distinctive wine with memorable flavors of rhubarb, wild berries and black cherries, an expansive mouthfeel and full body. The effect is very ripe and opulent while backed by mild tannins and good acidity for a tasty sense of balance.

title: Bella 2015 Maple Vineyards Annie's Block Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brambly aromas and wild berry flavors give this wine a classic profile, while a full body and moderate tannins help firm up the texture. Hints of olive and sage offer added complexity.

title: Concannon 2014 Reserve Petit Verdot (Livermore Valley)
description: A generous dose of spicy oak works well in this otherwise pure and fruity medium-bodied wine. It has good acidity, mild tannins and an elegant feel on the palate.

title: Cuda Ridge 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine starts with an aroma like cedar and leather, and proceeds to concentrated blackberry, beef and clove flavors. Give it points for complexity and an engaging earthiness, along with a dense texture of fine-grained tannins that add nice structure.

title: Fenestra 2013 Estate Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: Full bodied and very concentrated, this wine has a big, winning personality. At first whiff it's subdued, showing some meaty salt-and-pepper aromas, then powerful fruit flavors like boysenberry and black cherry seem to explode on the palate.

title: Leverage 2015 Trajectory Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark blackberry-syrup aromas meet with a slate-driven minerality and light purple flowers on the nose of this blend of 43% Grenache, 39% Syrah and 18% Mourvèdre. The palate is framed by solid acidity and shows more blackberry flavors as well as thyme and chaparral spice.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2014 Winona Vineyard Syrah (Lake County)
description: This is a polished and complex wine that's been well aged to smooth any rough edges, and offers concentrated black and red-cherry flavors shaded by clove and cardamom. Full bodied and lightly tannic, it will be a crowd-pleaser with rich food.

title: Tamber Bey 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Tart and leathery, this wine has elbows-out tannins that confront and persist. Dried herb, cedar and dark cherry mark its integral parts, with a full-bodied robustness that presents as rich and concentrated on the palate.

title: Tank Garage 2015 Like You Stole It Red (Contra Costa County)
description: A bright cherry aroma tops somewhat reserved cherry and cranberry flavors, while a good sense of grip and restraint make this wine appetizing. More like a British sports coupe than the Detroit muscle car on the label, it has very firm tannins, medium to full body and enough richness to carry the fruit through a lingering finish. Best after 2020.

title: Torial 2015 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a blend of old-vine Zinfandel, Grenache and Carignan. Crayon wax, barnyard compost, mocha and tobacco speak loudest amidst a tannic and tightly wound wine that's boisterous and big-boned in its youth.

title: White Hart Wine 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Light, fresh and easy aromas of lemon blossoms, tangerine juice and a chalky marble-like minerality show on the nose of this bottling from one of the most bang-for-buck regions in Monterey County. Clean and crisp on the sip, flavors of lemon juice, white peach, more chalk and a kiss of oak round out the palate.

title: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Besson Vineyard Grenache (Santa Clara County)
description: Very light aromas of rose petal, hibiscus and light cherry emerge with patience on the nose of this very restrained bottling. The palate is all about texture, with hints of cinnamon, rosewater, cherry foam and gravel, a hint of strawberry paste emerging on the finish.

title: Ben Ish 2016 Ben's Select Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Focused fruit flavors and very little oak influence make this a straight-shooter of a wine. It has appealing blackberry and raspberry aromas, rich berry flavors and a smooth texture with just a nip of tannin to balance all the fruitiness.

title: Callaway 2012 OPR Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Dark red fruit, wet wood, a pinch of herbs, pepper spice and a baked licorice aroma show on the nose of this top-end bottling from the historic regional producer. Shaved licorice shows on the palate, where grippy tannins and a woody spice make for an impressive sip.

title: Cinnabar 2014 G-S-M (California)
description: A dark color, full body and good structure make this wine taste robust and mouthfilling. It starts with light wood smoke and black pepper aromas and adds dark plum on the palate. It's a classic GSM blend of Grenache, Syrah and Mourvèdre.

title: Halcyon 2017 Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Contra Costa County)
description: Barely even a shade of pink in the glass, this rosé is tightly wound on the soft and subtle nose, with aromas of lemon skin, nectarine and inviting hints of strawberry. It's super racy on the sip, where Bosc pear flesh and tangy citrus prove refreshing.

title: Line 39 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Fairly big and nicely balanced, this wine gushes with black cherry and blackberry flavors and has just enough structure from good acidity, moderate tannins and a medium to full body. This wine is a crowd pleaser and a good choice for many different occasions.

title: Montemar Wines 2013 Zotovich Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh cranberry, carnation and raspberry aromas pick up a slightly caramelized vanilla-like note on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Alpine strawberry flavors are enhanced by crushed black pepper and rose petals, with the tannins proving impressively stiff almost five years in.

title: Salt of the Earth 2016 Flore de Moscato (California)
description: This wine is intensely sweet and concentrated, overflowing with late-harvest aromas like pear syrup and honeysuckle and full of dried apricot and honey on the palate. It will make a good dessert paired with toasted nuts or dried cheese.

title: Tamber Bey 2014 Rabicano Deux Chevaux Vineyard Red (Yountville)
description: This is a blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 26% Merlot and smaller amounts of Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot and Malbec. Sizable ripeness and vanilla oak define it, with an underlying elegance dotted in distinct fruit flavors of black cherry and plum.

title: Victor Vineyards 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Aromas like toasted nuts and dried leaves precede ripe plum and prune flavors while a full body and a welcomed layer of fine-grained tannins lift the palate impression. It's a slightly different take on the varietal.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Old Telegram Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: Fresh fruit flavors and a firm texture highlight this medium-bodied well-balanced wine. The berry and cherry flavors are slightly restrained and the mouthfeel is nicely dry and lightly tannic, giving an elegant impression.

title: Trenza 2013 Tinto Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Rather reserved on the nose, this 50-50 blend of Syrah and Tempranillo shows light aromas of black cherry, vanilla, purple flowers and cola. The palate starts soft and mellow, with more cherry, vanilla and slight clove flavors that ride a steadily rising acidity, and finish on vanilla.

title: Carol Shelton 2014 Florence Vineyard Rocky Reserve Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This comes from a vineyard 1,400-feet elevation, and it is blended with 14% Petite Sirah. Thick tannins surround a core of extracted red cherry and blueberry fruit; the texture is mild and fleshy.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy in rose petal and forest floor, this wine is medium bodied and somewhat tannic, with a finesse of raspberry and strawberry flavor. It shows well and is made in volumes that provide affordability and accessibility.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Sandy Bend Vineyard Fumé Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine reaches the extreme end of the buttery scale, showing toasty, oaky aromas, butter and vanilla flavors, a very creamy, rich texture and very full body. It has little overt fruit expression but plenty of complexity and savory character.

title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: The nose on this bottling is very showy with aromas of apple blossom, cut Anjou pear and guava. The palate skews tropical, with green papaya and underripe banana flavors, and a decently fresh acidity.

title: Castle Rock 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Light and fresh on the nose, this bottling has aromas of black olive, chile pepper, red cherry, cranberry and crushed pencils. The herbal character shows loudly on the palate, alongside cocoa, tart red cherry and cooked olives.
