title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Late Harvest Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles)
description: Honey, lemon blossoms, orange oil and the slightest hint of petrol show on the nose of this dessert wine, which smells a bit syrupy. That viscosity is evident on the sip, which is extremely sweet and rich, though there is a background of lime zest and lemon-verbena-powered acid to give depth.

title: Hess Select 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Frankly herbal in flavor, this wine smells reduced at first, like garlic and onions, but mellows to celery, cucumber and lemon on the palate. It's medium to full in body, has a rich texture and lingering veggie finish.

title: Mountain Terraces 2014 Taylor's Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: From a site high atop Glen Ellen's eastern edge, this estate-grown wine is brawny in leather, with a touch of sweetness to the oak. Robust wood flavor and tannin combine to emphasize the force and concentration of this wine, which has a puckering sensation of cedar and violet.

title: Oak Mountain 2014 Estate Merlot (Temecula Valley)
description: Subtle dark-berry aromas meet with hearty spices, including pepper dust, cigar box and wood varnish. The oak is prominent throughout, with flavors of pine, bay leaf, eucalyptus oil and dried cherries on the sip.

title: Pomar Junction 2016 Cotes de Pomar Blanc White (El Pomar District)
description: Very light in the glass, there is a subtle but growing tropicality on the nose of this blend of 40% Roussanne, 40% Grenache Blanc and 20% Viognier, with papaya, banana flower sap, candied honeysuckle and a bit of tuberose. The palate is clean with decent acidity, but those candied tropical flavors are overpowering, with mango, guava and banana syrup.

title: Séamus Wines 2015 Buena Tierra Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a full-bodied white rich in buttery oak and baked apple, with a tang of lemon and a yeasty nose of baked biscuit.

title: XYZin 2013 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fermented in stainless steel and barrel aged, this hearty wine is soft and simple with a juiciness of Kool-Aid-like flavors and dusty leather.

title: Sand Point 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Sweet-seeming shadings of oak complement substantial fruit flavors like black cherry and blackberry in this fresh concentrated wine. It has good acidity and mild tannins for that welcome grip on the palate.

title: Ty Caton 2015 Ty's Red Caton Vineyard Red (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Syrah comprises 55% of this blend, followed by 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, 6% Petit Verdot and 3% Merlot. Smoky oak encases compressed, meaty blackberry and big notions of tannin and oak. The finish flirts with overripe heat.

title: Europa Village 2016 Vienza Pinot Grigio (Temecula)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine shows fresh honeydew aromas along with sweet peach, honeysuckle and slightly tart orange rinds. The easy simple flavors include peach and ripe apple.

title: Kelly Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Bob Pepi is listed as the winemaker for this tightly woven, understated effort, which shines in red and black currant as well as blackberry succulence. Smoky, it finishes in warmer richer tones of bacon and leather.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2012 Estate Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Gritty, with explosive power midpalate, this has a tartness of acidity that stands up to a softness of texture and tangy red fruit.

title: Caricature 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)
description: Very ripe fruit flavors and a sweet brown-sugar impression make this medium-bodied wine showy in the vein of a red blend. It feels rather soft on the palate and a hint of sweetness carries through on the finish.

title: Murphy-Goode 2013 Alden Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From a high-elevation site, this wine opens mildly before a fierce grip of tannin and power take hold. Sticky black fruit, cedar and somewhat harsh tannins give it a brawny rustic quality.

title: Breathless 2012 Méthode Champenoise Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: This aged blend of Pinot Noir, Pinot Meunier and Chardonnay has an intense mousse on entry, a layering of flavor dipped in green apple and lemon. Structured and crisp, it tastes dry, complex and layered.

title: Bucher 2015 Pommard Clone Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From two blocks of the vineyard planted to Pommard, this is an earthy, smoky wine, concentrated in dark cherry and plum flavors. Medium bodied and supple, it finishes in a richness of baking spices.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Bela's Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Big tense layers of flavor dip into wild mint, strawberry and black cherry in this intense full-powered red. Cola and baking spice round it out and contribute complexity and length.

title: Chalk Hill 2014 Chairman's Club Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: Integrated and succulent, this estate wine is savory in clove and dried herb, sage and red currant. It is also powerfully built and full bodied with abandon. Containing 4% Petit Verdot and aged in 75% new French oak, it packs a lasting punch of tobacco.

title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2017 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A mostly stainless-steel fermented effort, this wine succeeds in floral, earthy, robust and richly layered richness, teasing caramel and vanilla crème brûlée out of the glass. With full-bodied oomph, it tingles in an underlying thread of stony mineral.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Somers Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is full bodied and fleshy, with flavors of dried herb, blackberry jam and cinnamon toast. Big tannins and structured acidity balance the bold flavors, giving this a soft, supple richness that's hard to shake.

title: Flanagan 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rose, lavender and tree bark pique the nose in this full-bodied earthy wine. Thick and rich on the midpalate, it shows a layering of dark cherry, rhubarb and rose, mingling fruit from several sources within the appellation.

title: Galerie 2017 Naissance Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Aged in French puncheons and concrete, this is an herbal, bright and buzzy white that's medium bodied and complex. Apricot dominates alongside hints of ginger and lemongrass.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Pinot Noir-based, this is light-pink in color and full of rich round flavors of strawberry and peach. Likably lush and moderate in acidity, it is dry with vanilla undertones that boost the fruit.

title: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: Light buttery notes complement fruit and salted oak in this dry, tannic and full-bodied white. The texture is grainy and lengthy, with flavors of ginger and lemongrass that work well against the riper, bolder aspects.

title: Malene 2017 Old Vine Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: From 44-year-old Grenache vines, this old vine rosé is a unique idea, and works quite well. Crisp aromas of strawberry, chalk and flint show much minerality. The palate is very textural, showing wet gravel and steely flavors with the lightest flash of red fruit.

title: Maxville 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy, dusty and black cherry-flavored, this is a soft, rich and well-integrated wine, boldly concentrated and complex, yet easily enjoyed now. The tannin structure is impressively built and a good foil for the oak.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2017 Glenrose Vineyard Picpoul (Adelaida District)
description: Just-sliced Asian pear, tangy grapefruit and a cool steel aroma show on the nose of this bottling of Picpoul—a grape which is increasingly seen alone in bottle. There is great tension on the sip, where lime-skin flavors reign.

title: Schramsberg 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Tiny bubbles keep rising long after this dry and crisp wine made from 100% Chardonnay is poured. It has a lemony flavor with almost salty, nutty accents and vivid acidity to keep it clean and balanced.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A rich, robust and lushly textured wine, this features toasted oak and spice tones, with strong flavors of butterscotch and tropical mango.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Voluptuously fleshy and rounded in oak, this earthy white shines in spicy ginger and lemongrass before unfurling lush layers of green apple, pear and mango that stick to the palate through a lengthy finish.

title: Tulocay 2015 Haynes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Coombsville)
description: Exotic and delicate on the nose, exuberant in rose petal and lavender, this wine is earthy and stemmy, with a weight on the palate that belies its underlying elegance and persistent acidity.

title: Alara 2016 Negrette (San Benito County)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling of a grape rarely seen in the state combines black plum, vanilla and ginger spice on the nose. Black cherry and milk chocolate flavors show on the palate, where strong acidity slices through the full flavors and the soft mouthfeel. The high listed alcohol is surprisingly balanced.

title: Ancien 2015 Haynes Old Block Chardonnay (Coombsville)
description: A tiny-production wine, this is thick, dense and concentrated upon entry, finding its way to freshness and balance via a midpalate of stone fruit, wet stone and salted oak.

title: Baker Lane 2017 Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made entirely from Syrah, this crisp, clean and focused wine is exuberant in lemon peel, blood orange and strawberry swirls, and its acid is linear in freshness.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Fields Family Vineyards Barbera (Amador County)
description: Quite lively in flavor, this medium-bodied wine exudes bright raspberry and red-cherry aromas, and has good acidity and vivid fruit flavors. It should be a versatile food wine due to the pinpoint balance.

title: Mabera 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Herb and spice aromas compete for attention in this dual-personality medium-bodied wine. At first sniff it has a vanilla character that stands apart from the strong grassy flavors but with time in the glass they merge nicely.

title: Morgan 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Arroyo Seco)
description: This bottling is very tightly wound and light on the nose, showing only hints of white peach, lemon rind and crushed gravel. It's clean and easy on the palate, with crisp flavors of lemon juice, rose petal and Meyer lemon rind that broaden a bit on the finish.

title: Murphy-Goode 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a light floral aroma, lots of fresh apple and peach flavors and accents of vanilla and butter. A dose of good, fresh fruit acidity livens up the mouthfeel and seems to brighten the flavors.

title: Pedroncelli 2017 Friends White (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 57% Sauvignon Blanc and 43% Gewürztraminer with no barrel aging, is ready to go with its exuberantly floral nose and sparkling acidity. Steely on the palate, it's easy to enjoy and light on its feet, with a fleeting intensity on the finish.

title: Roth 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Baking spices and brioche give this wine a warmth on the nose and palate—aspects that complement the baked cherry and berry richness at its core. Hearty and smoky, it's fruit forward and full bodied, easily approachable and enjoyable now.

title: Ruby Cellars 2016 Orange Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: This take on skin-contact Viognier works, but won't be for everyone. Murky in the glass, it shows aromas of smashed honeydew, melon rind and Meyer lemon on the edges. The palate is where things get interesting, with a creamy mouthfeel delivering flavors of orange bitters, lemon rind and honeydew candies. It's a great conversation starter.

title: Scheid 2016 San Lucas Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Monterey)
description: Light and almost effervescent in the glass, this bottling shows honeydew, kaffir lime, lemongrass and a hint of wet cement on the nose. The palate is lively with racy acidity and a stony minerality, offering melon and pink lemonade flavors, though it is ever-so-slightly lacking in the midpalate.

title: Senders 2014 Mahoney Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is a potpourri of floral aromas and earthy mint. It is a tight-grained high-toned varietal wine that's edgy in tannins and strawberry-rhubarb tartness.

title: Talbott 2016 Logan Sleepy Hollow Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: The nose on this bottling starts with alkaline and quinine touches before evolving into fresh lemon blossoms, almonds and toast. The palate is toasty and nutty as well, set against a fresh citrus backdrop.

title: Tamber Bey 2016 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is likably soft and approachable, its tannins mellowed and playing a supporting role. Huckleberry richness meets brown sugar on the palate, with a slightly smoky undertone for contrast.

title: Torial 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dark in raspberry-cordial flavors and richness, this concentrated wine has underlying flashes of high-toned acidity that keep it refreshing, with lasting highlights of cedar and currant.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Chloe Vineyard Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Subtle and pleasant aromas of lemon rind, nectarine, key lime and the hint of toast show on the nose of this well restrained Viognier. There are tropical touches of guava on the sip, but the lime flavors, strong acidity and grippy texture keep it in line.

title: Wise Villa 2016 Estate Albariño (Clarksburg)
description: This dramatic wine is no wallflower. It has a bright light-yellow color, striking aromas of chicken stock and wet earth that contrast with the tangy white-peach and grapefruit flavors that follow. It's very light in alcohol but feels medium bodied.

title: San Simeon 2017 Estate Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Flinty aromas meet with apple peels, lime rinds and pear flesh on the nose of this bottling. That flinty character just shows briefly on the palate, which warms up toward dried limes, yellow apples and a touch of grass.

title: Left Bend NV Mashup v.3 Red (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This intriguing nonvintage blend of mainly Syrah and Cabernet Sauvignon is a solera blend from across six vintages. Aromas of light red currant, licorice, dried mint and leather lead into a palate that's not as thick as expected. Herbs, baking spice, dried cranberry and vanilla flavors arise, and there's a hint of age to the wine due to the unique process.

title: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Unoaked Ernest Wente Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: A light herbal aroma leads to fresh and tangy but subdued citrus flavors in this light-bodied wine. It was made without oak aging, so the lean lemon and crisp apple notes and light but firm texture define it.
designation: Unoaked Ernest Wente Vineyard Micro-Lot Reserve

title: Puccioni 2015 Puccioni Ranch Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Thick and dense with a strong grapey character, this wine is raisiny in baked plum as well as richly layered with a taste of cherry pie and vanilla.

title: Ravenswood 2015 Dickerson Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Berry patch and brown sugar combine for a forceful, sumptuous and richly concentrated expression of the variety, which represents 100% here. Mint and leather abound along a simple structure and texture that's soft and layered.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Grainy, this wine is youthfully grippy and textured, with moderate acidity and layers of green apple, stone fruit and melon. Light on its feet, it's fresh and fleshy.

title: Las Positas 2016 Albariño (Sacramento County)
description: Rather strong in flavor for this grape variety, the wine has a gold color, exaggerated apricot, peach skin and toasted almond flavors, medium body and nervy fruit flavors. A sense of grip comes from acidity and a touch of tannin.

title: August Briggs 2014 Two Moon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Barbecue smoke and char dominate on the nose of this robust wine, which is somewhat one-dimensional in that element. Meat and black cherry add background notes.

title: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Merlot (California)
description: Spicy oaky accents give a little momentum to this mostly light and appealing wine. It has cinnamon, ginger and vanilla flavors blended with cherry notes.

title: Somnium 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is harsh and somewhat thin on the palate, with a wealth of tannin and smoky oak.

title: CK Mondavi 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Rather light in body and savory in flavor, this wine has earthy aromas, mild fruit flavors and a brothy component. It's smooth on the palate.

title: Happy Camper 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This is a light oaky off-dry wine with a soda-pop freshness and flavors like strawberries and cherry candy.

title: Judd's Hill 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This wine is simple and lacking in full flavor, the characteristics leaning into peppery tobacco and caramel oak.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Grand Reserve Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This wine is thick, heavy and tannic, with an herbaceous quality of cedar and pencil. Flavors of dark cherry and chocolate highlight the full-bodied concentration.

title: Liparita 2014 V Block Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This wine includes 16% Merlot and 2% Petite Sirah. Pungent earth overrides a dense syrupy concentration of blackberry mocha. The tannins are tight and green.

title: Fenestra 2012 Silvaspoons Vineyards Touriga (Lodi)
description: Very mature, with earthy leathery aromas, this wine offers a broad smooth texture, and flavors like dried fruits and nuts. It has a good backbone of acidity and light tannins. It is enjoyable for its well-aged bouquet and smoothness on the palate.

title: Iron Hub 2016 Estate Bottled Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This rosé goes for richness and a rather heavy mouthfeel and has flavors like peaches and maraschino cherries that are a touch sweet. The texture is soft and the balance is low in acidity.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This sturdy medium-bodied wine has good structure and a lightly gripping texture to counterbalance plummy flavors that have an earthy, metallic edge.

title: Camp 2016 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Aromas of violet and baked biscuit invite one in before this earthy herbal wine imparts harsh tannins that give it a tart sour taste.

title: Fenestra 2012 Tempranillo (Lodi)
description: This is a mature full-bodied wine that's on the downslope, showing aromas like sunbaked earth and leather, and flavors like balsamic and stewed plums.

title: Integrity 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Aged in stainless and new French oak, this wine is woody and muted on the nose, revealing a pungent barrel element that's hard to define. The fruit flavors are sour.

title: Rued 2014 Char's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is sour, tart and somewhat harsh, from grapes grown on the eastern side of the appellation.

title: Tuli 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This wine tastes distinctly of Kool-Aid and cherry cola: sweet and viscous with a harsh, green component that's hard to recommend.

title: Michael Sullberg 2016 Reserve Merlot (California)
description: This wine dramatically brings out the veggie side of Merlot. It smells like beets and herbs and tastes like plums with a side of greens.

title: Rubus 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is unstructured and mushy, with unpleasant notions of smoky cola that nearly taste chemical.

title: Spottswoode 2014 Family Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Nuanced, with 10% Cabernet Franc and 4% Petit Verdot, this is a quietly powerful wine, smooth and structured and immediate in its beauty, yet possessed of legs to cellar for 20-plus years. Crushed flowers and rocks open on the nose, providing a clutch of minerality, as grippy tannins support red currant, plum and a freshness of persistent acidity. Try to wait on this one. Best 2024–2034.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a layered, concentrated wine, richly woven with flavors of blueberry, strawberry, rose and lavender. Medium in weight, the palate feels compressed and thick but lifted by a lingering floral element.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Ledge 2016 Adams Ranch Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Hometown musician and vintner Mark Adams delivers an impressively elegant yet forceful estate blend of 86% Syrah, 11% Grenache and 3% Roussanne, starting with aromas of Luxardo cherry, roasted black plum, charred beef, pepper dust and wet rocks. Elderberry and elderflower flavors arise on the well-balanced sip as do lilacs and violets, so much that the experience is like drinking the color purple.

title: Ledge 2016 James Berry Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Violets, lilacs, ripe alpine strawberries and intense purple fruits are packed in wet clay aromas on the nose of this blend of 64% Grenache, 21% Syrah, 11% Mourvèdre and 4% Roussanne. Strong acid and chalky tannins hold flavors of roasted boysenberry and violet on the palate, which will last for years. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There is a tightly wound dairy quality to the nose of this appellation blend, which combines yogurt-like aromas with lime pith and ash. It's zippy, fresh and bright with acidity on the palate, where tightly woven tannins carry hints of sandalwood, oak and citrus flavors.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon balm, pink grapefruit pith and a touch of sour cream show on the nose of this bottling, which quickly freshens up into more citrus elements as it sits open. There is strong tightness to the palate, where fresh lemon, nectarine and warmer pineapple tones are dusted with acidity and sea salt.

title: Neely 2016 Amphitheater Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Focused aromas of lemon, daffodil, sea salt, golden hazelnuts and tangerine cream show on the wondrous nose of this bottling from above the San Francisco Bay in Portola Valley. The palate's nutty flavors are framed by a tannic tension, chalky texture and solid acidity, leading into a sea-salt finish. Drink 2019–2026.

title: Pali 2016 Pali Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From the 50-acre vineyard the winery planted in 2012, this bottling shows a purity of aroma and flavors, starting with sea salt, russet apples and light marshmallow on the nose. The palate shows pan-seared apples with a touch of sea salt, white peach and a hint of hazelnut, with a flash of crème brûlée on the finish.

title: Ramey 2014 Cole Creek Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: The producer's third vintage from this relatively cool site, this wine is beautifully wrapped in lavender and smoky grilled meat. There is 6% Viognier cofermented with the Syrah. Turned earth, game and white pepper give it varietal complexity and integrity, with a powerfully bright thread of acidity and silky freshness.

title: Riverbench 2016 Pommard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe red cherry compote, turned earth and chaparral spice aromas of sagebrush and wild mint converge for a very complex and inviting nose on this clonal selection. Tart cherry and cranberry flavors grow tangier with a hint of orange rind on the palate, which is dusted with peppery spice and finishes on a rounded strawberry kick.

title: Siduri 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Sultry and elegantly integrated aromas of purple flower and black raspberry decorate the nose of this single-vineyard expression by veteran Adam Lee. Pungent fruit shows on the palate, where baked black cherry and boysenberry are lifted by wild thyme and chaparral spice.

title: Stolpman 2016 Originals Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Ripe aromas of blackberry, black plum, spice cake, white pepper and cola show strongly on the nose of this bottling from the Stolpman family's original block of vineyard. Strong and mouth-filling tannins provide ample structure to the clean, peppery, pure purple flavors of the expertly balanced palate. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Westerly 2015 Cote Blonde Syrah (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Hearty, deep and polished aromas of black currant, black plums and blackberry-laced fudge are thick and impressive on the nose of this bottling, which includes 3% Viognier. Power is the message on the palate, where booming black-currant and charred beef flavors ride firm tannins that tighten on the finish. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Bob Cabral Wines 2015 Troubadour Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Forest floor, clove, black tea and ash mark this lush, full-bodied and textured wine. It offers plenty of red and black cherry flavors atop a delicate undercarriage of freshness and grace.

title: Davies 2016 Hyde Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From one of the appellation's great vineyards, this wine does the site justice in a quiet, expressive opening note of spicy fruit. A light, high-toned lift of acidity complements the bolder notions of oak and tannin, allowing all to open slowly in the glass.

title: Diamond Creek 2015 Red Rock Terrace Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Exotically earthy, this block designate is defined in graphite, tobacco and cocoa powder, with a gritty, grippy profile of tannin at its core. Savory, soft and supple in nature, it also shows concentration and structure within a full-bodied frame of mountain ripeness.

title: Ledge 2016 Dante Dusi Vineyard Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)
description: There is a strong but not overripe fruit character on the nose of this bottling from historic vines, with baked strawberry, plums and mulberry as well as a dusting of sweet clove. The palate is more lightly bodied than many Zins of the area and is also full of energy, showing bright and fresh red-fruit flavors and baking spice, eliciting elements not often seen from the grape these days.

title: Metzker Family Estates 2016 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and floral, this is bursting in stemmy earth and ash, forest pine and black tea. Concentrated, intriguing and fleshy, it shows its wild provenance, complemented in tart cherry and rhubarb layers that linger on the finish.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This classic bottling is still a baby and needs plenty of time to open. When it does, aromas of toasted hazelnuts, light oak, lemon pith and exotic apples show on the nose. The palate combines oak smoke with savory sea salt and sumptuous golden apple fruits. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Mumm Napa 2011 DVX Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: A 50-50 blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, given time to age, this shows layers of richness that can only be earned over time. Rounded supple acidity supports broad complex layers of green apple, Meyer lemon and peach. It finishes crisp and dry.

title: Satyre Wines 2015 Aristeaus Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: With a perfumed nose of rose and lavender, this lovely light-hearted wine is fleshy and complex, the texture plush and softly silky. Sourced from Morelli Lane and Manzana vineyards, both farmed by the Duttons, it's brimming in blueberry, rhubarb and strawberry, with a dusting of clove and cardamom.

title: The Calling 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made by Winemaker Dan Goldfield, this wine is well crafted and earthy. It's a soft, gentle expression of just-picked strawberry that's light in approach and delicate on the palate.

title: Las Positas 2016 Verdelho (Alta Mesa)
description: Light in body and very crisp in texture, this wine nevertheless packs a lot of flavor, showing bright lemon and fresh herb aromas, and very focused, tangy lemon and lime components on the palate. It is super refreshing and will be great with seafood among many other pairings.

title: Le Vigne 2014 Di Domenico Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Warm aromas of black cherry meet with vanilla and clove on the cohesive, satisfying nose of this reserve bottling. Bright red and candied fruit show on the hedonistic palate, where a pinch of green herbs provide complexity and a refreshing acidity washes into the finish.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark red-cherry, sweet blueberry and ripe watermelon aromas make for a very voluptuous and unique nose on this bottling. The palate is also fruity and zesty with sharp energetic acidity, showing juicy cranberry as well as baking spice on the finish. The acid should mellow soon and make for an even better wine.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's a compelling fatness to the nose of this bottling, with broad aromas of nectarine, banana and coconut. That tropicality is present in the palate, with flavors of plumeria and coconut cream, but it's dialed back by a zesty lemon-edged acidity. Both rich and racy, this will appeal to many Chardonnay lovers.

title: Arndt 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: A very down-the-middle red wine, sure to please most, this bottling starts with dark blackberry, elderflower, char and vanilla aromas. The palate offers dried blueberry and hints of thyme, riding fine-grained tannins and strong acidity into the finish. Still a tad sticky, so it could use more time.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2014 Petite Sirah (Monterey County)
description: Dried herbs, elderberries, peppercorns and a strong streak of gamy meat show on the nose of this bottling, which is less dense and more nuanced in style than many other Petite Sirahs. The gamy element extends to the palate, giving complexity to the black fruits and sticky tannins.

title: Ferguson Crest 2015 Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Concentrated berries, cola spice, licorice and gingerbread aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's thick on the palate with boysenberry, plum, hoisin and gingersnap flavors—a heavier and spice-laden take on the grape.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2014 Petite Sirah (South Coast)
description: Boysenberry, black pepper, dark spices and a hint of sandalwood show on the nose of this bottling, a good indication that Petite Sirah may thrive in this warmer Southern California climate. Rustic flavors of leather, dust, roasted blackberries and teriyaki are lifted with a pinch of purple flowers.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: A lot of ripeness and plenty of warm spicy oaky accents make this wine both mouth filling and easy to dive into. There are vanilla, cinnamon and sandalwood scents in the aromas, and fully ripe plum flavors along with light tannins.

title: Kunde 2015 Estate Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: Sanguine and herbal, this wine is hugely concentrated in extracted and intense flavors of blackberry, red currant and cedar. It showcases meaty tannins and rich oak.

title: Noceto 2015 Misto Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: A beefy brothy aroma leads to rich concentrated fruit flavors in this full-bodied and firm-textured wine. It has good structure, tasty layers of black cherry and red cherry and a mouth-filling presence that's appealing.

title: Caliza 2016 Kissin' Cousins White (Paso Robles)
description: Ripe pear and stone fruit aromas meet with smoke, wood and citrus pith on the dynamic nose of this blend of 48% Viognier, 26% Grenache Blanc and 26% Roussanne. It's tightly wound on the palate, with grippy texture and wild lime flavors.

title: Cuvaison 2015 Spire Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Woody, herbal and thick, this full-bodied wine is from a specific block of the winery's estate vineyard and its highest elevation spot. It's deeply concentrated and powerful in oak, a study in pepper and cardamom spice specked in black cherry.

title: Europa Village 2015 Vienza Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)
description: Bright red fruit, rose petals, carnation and cinnamon spice show on the nose of this promising bottling from a newer producer in Temecula. Zesty and lighter bodied on the palate with pomegranate and fennel flavors, this would be perfect for washing down pizza or pasta.

title: Falcone 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe tones of Pink Lady apple, light pineapple and tropical white flowers make for a soft and supple nose on this bottling. There is brightness to the sip, with lemongrass freshness that cuts through the slightly sweet lime-candy elements.

title: Jessie's Grove 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This is a silky smooth, full-bodied wine with a light gold color, inviting baking-spice aromas, ripe and concentrated fruit flavors and an especially rich mouthfeel, due partly to a high alcohol level.

title: Klinker Brick 2017 Bricks & Roses Estate Rosé (Lodi)
description: This well-balanced and straightforward wine has fresh crisp apple and white-peach flavors and a good dry palate with light acidity and light body. Those are just the traits that many people are looking for in a rosé.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2016 Jacks Hill Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Hints of lime blossoms, toasted nuts and wood smoke show on the nose of this very fairly priced bottling, whose previous vintages have been shown to age magically. Wood-fired pears and apples show on the palate, which will please both those seeking a bit of oak and those who enjoy a racier style of Chardonnay.

title: Monte Volpe 2013 Peppolino Red (Mendocino)
description: This wine was blended from mostly Italian grape varieties and aged in 25% new French barrels It has a firm, tannic structure and a good dose of tart cranberry and raspberry flavors shaded by cinnamon and cedar nuances. It's medium bodied but has enough grip to pair with rich protein dishes.

title: Shadybrook 2014 Estate V Red (Coombsville)
description: This is a Cabernet Franc-dominant blend at 36%, with 30% Cabernet Sauvignon and 24% Merlot (as well as tiny additions of Malbec and Petit Verdot). Sanguine, it's dusty and powerful in tannin and oak, with strong flavors of currant, cassis and mocha powder.

title: Siduri 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a nice expression of the appellation, spicy in big cherry fruit and a dense succulence that's hard to resist. Full bodied and integrated, it offers heft within a varietally characteristic earthiness and pretty aromatics.

title: Steele 2014 Stymie Founder's Reserve Limited Production Merlot (Lake County)
description: Full bodied and firmly structured, this wine is concentrated and ripe in flavor, coating the palate in richness. It has deep, ripe black-cherry aromas, cherry and milk chocolate flavors, firm tannins and a lingering finish.

title: The Winery SF 2014 Tempranillo (North Coast)
description: This wine offers gorgeous fruit flavors, subdued spices and great balance. It feels poised on the palate, lifted by good acidity, braced by moderate tannins and well filled out by plum, prune and cherry flavors shaded by hints of nutmeg and vanilla.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Vivid oak spices dress up the aromas and flavors of this full-bodied, ripe and concentrated wine. Toasted baguette and baking-spice nuances complement good, ripe berry and black-plum flavors while a firm moderately tannic texture adds good grip.

title: Waxwing 2016 Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Focused aromas of dark berry, charred beef, concentrated purple flowers and smoke combine for an intense attention-grabbing nose on this bottling. Smooth and well-integrated flavors of dark berry and baking spice make for a compelling palate where no single element stands out.

title: Anaba 2015 J McK Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Fleshy, this wine offers a roundness of oak and lushness on the midpalate, presenting as brioche and peach Melba. Structured with plenty of acidity as its backbone, it finishes in a concentrated swirl of crème brûlée.

title: Capo Creek 2015 Grenache (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is rewarding in tones of earth and blueberry that are balanced by bright, juicy acidity. Easygoing on the palate, with soft, integrated tannins, it finishes in a dusting of cocoa powder.

title: Amador Cellars 2014 Estate Tempranillo (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This wine is dark and brooding, showing ultraripe flavors, a full body and a thick layer of velvety tannins. It has well-concentrated blackberry and roasted plum aromas and focused fruit flavors that show just a touch of oak spice.

title: B.R. Cohn 2014 Olive Hill Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Sumptuous elements of baked plum, clove and cinnamon mark this big full-bodied wine, a 100% varietal from the estate. With an herbal underbelly, it imparts red currant and woody oak, with a grippy hold of tannin.

title: Landmark 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is an oak-powered bottling, showing lots of smoky wood and campfire aromas on the nose along with black raspberry. That smoke carries to the sip as well, wrapping up flavors of black cherry and star anise.

title: Fenestra 2013 Infrared Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Lovely balsam and cedar aromas meet ripe plum and cherry flavors in this medium- to full-bodied wine. It pairs fairly concentrated flavors with a moderately tannic texture and achieves good balance.

title: Fossil Point 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: This bottling starts with a pungent nose of pink grapefruit and ripe tangerine. The palate picks up more of a yellow-grapefruit expression, remaining fresh and tart.

title: Joyce 2017 Turbidity Current Rosé (Monterey County)
description: This pink blend of half Grenache and half Gamay Noir starts with a slightly sour nose of raspberry and lemon rind. There is great grip to the palate, which is shy in flavors but allows wet stone, nectarine flesh and citrus pith to cut through the acid and texture.

title: Ruby Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry meets with pencil shavings, game and wet schist on the complex nose of this bottling from a newer project in Atascadero. Rounded flavors of cherry and oregano show on the sip, along with dust and earthy forest-floor tones.

title: Steele 2014 Goodchild Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a strong herbaceous character to this bottling, with intriguing and exotic spice aromas decorating charred cherry-tomato and black-raspberry fruit. The palate is quite gamy, with tart cranberry flavors.

title: Stolo 2017 Gewurztraminer (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Fresh and floral aromas of lime blossom, white peach flesh and a hint of chalk are reminiscent of lemon-lime soda pop on the nose of this bottling. The sip is energetic, with acid and a tension that extends into the finish, showing lime, honeydew and white-flower flavors.

title: Storypoint 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A very deep color and concentrated blackberry flavors give this full-bodied wine a big impact. Berry compote and light touches of maple and wood smoke waft from the glass, then deep dark fruit flavors coat the palate while a moderately tannic texture helps balance the profusion of almost-sweet fruit.

title: Vasco Urbano 2015 Raboli Vineyard H P Mourvèdre (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is unusually dark in color for the varietal, and generously spiced with oak in both the aromas and the flavors. Very ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors meet light wood smoke and baking spices throughout.

title: Barrel Burner 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A strong cigar-box aroma meets with black currant, blackberry and black-cherry juice on the rather elegant nose of this good-value bottling. The flavors are clean, with licorice, dried herbs, black cherry and pipe tobacco, and are framed by decent tannins.

title: Dovecote 2017 Thompson Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Lime peels, rainy cement, flint and cut grass show on the nose of this bottling from the new owners of Thompson Vineyard, which is still a tad young and inward-looking, but sure to blossom in the months to come. It's very zesty on the palate, with long-lasting flavors of lime, pear and crushed gravel.

title: Louis M. Martini 2014 Lot No. 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Succulent in fleshy black fruit and lifted acidity, this is a smooth, plush and robust wine. It's a hugely concentrated expression of the grape that's impressive in its power. Black pepper, cigar and dark chocolate linger on the finish.

title: De Loach 2015 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tangy and seemingly demure, this wine is broad-shouldered and showy in its up-front ripeness of orange and rhubarb tones. Earthy spice lingers on the structured finish.

title: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Touriga Nacional (Sierra Foothills)
description: This varietal usually shows up in Port-style wines, but here it makes a wonderful dry table wine that's packed with deep berry flavors and has a very polished texture. Moderate tannins and good acidity give a bit of grip on the palate but it's velvety all the way through the finish.

title: Morgan 2017 Grenache Blanc (Monterey)
description: Light aromas of lemon and lime meet with green lily, nectarine and slate on the dynamic nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh, vibrant and grippy in texture, showing lime pith, crushed gravel and a slightly more ripe element of Asian pear.

title: Paradise Springs 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Boysenberry, black-plum skin and wet soil aromas show on this bottling from the region's pioneering vineyard. Acid powers the palate, where tangy boysenberry, taut red plum and earthy spices intermingle.

title: Pech Merle 2016 Reserve Lot 9 Zinfandel (North Coast)
description: An aroma just like blackberry jam provides an eye-opening start to this rich, lightly sweet and full-bodied wine. The color is extra dark for a Zin and the fruit flavors are extra concentrated. Moderate tannins add a little bite to the texture and keep the wine in balance despite huge fruit flavors and a perception of sweetness.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Patelin de Tablas Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 52% Syrah, 31% Grenache, 11% Counoise and 6% Mourvèdre is a complete success. Fresh aromas of carnations, purple flowers, crushed cranberries, plump berries and dried sage lead into a taut palate of red plums, red cherries and potpourri spice.

title: Black Stallion 2014 Barrel Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is aged for 26 months in 80% new French oak. It works to support and structure a wealth of robust, ripe fruit, offering a perfumed nose of cherry and vanilla. The flavors follow, soft and dusty in tannin, finishing with a bright swathe of cassis.

title: Brick & Mortar 2015 Sweetwater Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned and brimming in acidity, this is a fresh tart expression of raspberry and vanilla, fleshy and expansive on the palate in texture and mineral undertones of rock and stone. It is made in tiny quantities and well worth seeking out.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Dutton Ranch Shop Block Pinot Blanc (Green Valley)
description: Mineral-driven, earthy and floral, this gorgeous white is elusive in fruit, youthfully demure and full of vigorous acidity. Lightly ripe peach and mango come into play midpalate, with a squeeze of lemon emphasizing the wine's vibrancy on the finish.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is a foot-trod, whole-cluster wine fermented like a white, that is copper orange and pink in color. The grapes come from the producer's Fox Den Vineyard and another Dutton Ranch site. Earthy cantaloupe, cherry and cranberry figure into the mix, as does orange peel and watermelon, the acidity tight and tautly stretched across the vibrant texture.

title: Heath Vineyards 2014 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Salt and pepper spice show on the nose of this bottling by a Texas-based winery, leading into aromas of mulberry, black plum and star anise. Darker black-plum flavors meet with pepper and allspice on the palate, which is rich in style.

title: Heitz 2013 Linda Falls Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: This is the first vintage to be released from this vineyard-designate. It originates from Linda Falls Vineyard atop Howell Mountain, which the family has been farming since planting it in 2002. The wine is herbal and high in acidity, offering nuanced layers of tart cranberry, cassis and just-picked blackberry as well as a field-full of violet and wildflower.

title: Beauregard 2014 Beauregard Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Vivacious aromas of underripe blackberry, green peppercorn, cigar box and green olive show on the nose of this bottling from a coastal vineyard that sits 1,700 feet above the ocean. The softly tannic palate is tart with red fruit and loaded with forest spices, showing anise, fennel, green sage, more green olive and chaparral scrub.

title: Pessimist 2016 Red (Paso Robles)
description: This wine from the Daou brothers starts with dense aromas of blackberry, gravelly soil, wood ash and violets. The mouthfeel is plush in soft tannins, offering flavors of black currant, asphalt, purple flowers and marjoram.

title: Refugio Ranch 2017 Tiradora Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lime, kiwi and grass aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is tremendous zip and a stony, chalky texture to the medium-bodied palate, which is full of grass and lime peel flavors.

title: Sante Arcangeli 2016 Saveria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This single-vineyard bottling is very full on the nose with tangy red-cherry, fruit-punch, marjoram and sumac aromas. Lively and tart red fruits show on the sip, which also offers carnation and rosewater flavors that lead into a squeaky finish.

title: Silver Stag 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Spicy and herbal, this is a full-bodied, lushly plush wine that holds its power and concentration well in firm polished tannin. Sage, peppercorn and leather ride a lengthy midpalate complementing the bolder aspects of dark chocolate and coffee.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Salted apple and white peach aromas meet with a lemony edge, hint of toast and flash of sandalwood on the nose of this bottling. There is strong energy to the sip, where tangy waves of lemon candy meet with warmer flavors of pan-seared apple.

title: LangeTwins 2013 Midnight Reserve Red (Lodi)
description: This wine has a nice oomph of blackberry flavor and full enough body to carry it well. It feels rich and velvety on the palate and a generous layer of fine tannins doesn't get heavy.

title: McManis 2016 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This is a big bold wine that lays on the oak flavor without restraint. A strong aroma of cedar and baking spices is followed by very concentrated dark-fruit flavors and spicy charred oak flavors. It is quite tannic and almost thick in texture, giving plenty of grip on the palate.

title: Mirassou 2016 Moscato (California)
description: Light floral and peach aromas lead to a lively palate full of fresh fruit, lychees, and honey while a subtle fizz helps balance out considerable sweetness. It's a charming, light wine that's easy to swallow.

title: C.G. di Arie 2014 Mixed Breed Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a good, solidly built table wine with a robust texture and bold fruit and dark-spice flavors. It barrels straight ahead in style and will easily wash down some Korean barbecue or steak fajitas.

title: Mignanelli 2014 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Intriguing aromas of dark pomegranate, white pepper, crushed gravel and herb meet with a touch of tar on the nose of this appellation blend. The mouthfeel is heavy and the density impresses, but the flavors of rich cranberry and tart orange rind are a bit muddled and sour.

title: Vinum 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Lush and rich aromas of candied red cherries and vanilla dust show on the nose of this bottling. Rosewater and fruit punch flavors arise on the sip, riding into a vanilla dust finish.

title: Press Run 2014 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Dried black cherries, baked earth, rust and a hint of feral aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers an interesting line of tart red fruit along with dried thyme and a meaty touch.

title: Reyes 2014 Julia's Red (California)
description: There's a very strong scent of licorice on the nose of this blend of 54% Syrah and 46% Merlot, along with dark-red fruit and myrrh. Eucalyptus oil flavors arise on the palate, giving intrigue to the black cherry, peppercorn and roasted meat touches.

title: Terra d'Oro 2016 Moscato (Amador County)
description: Floral and honey-like aromas lead to very sweet flavors of apricot and peach in this medium-bodied wine. A good choice for friends that only drink sweet, or with your dessert.

title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a serviceable red, built to be enjoyed now, approachable in its mix of doughy leather, black cherry and structured tannin.

title: Obscured 2015 Red (California)
description: A particularly good value, this appealing and inexpensive wine adds light and tasty oak and spice accents to a good base of plummy flavors. It feels light and fresh on the palate and has enough concentration for a bit of a lingering finish.

title: Patland 2014 Terra Del Cuore Estate Grown Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This is hugely tannic, nearly impenetrable wine, hard to break through, a mix of pencil lead, tobacco leaf and dried herb that presents as bittersweet and a touch green.

title: Flowers 2015 Camp Meeting Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine has a persistent bitter note that's part earthy, part savory and a touch extreme. Rhubarb, rose, black tea and cardamom all figure in, but don't get along all together well.

title: Merriam 2013 Windacre Vineyard Estate Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: Dull aromatics open the way to thick dense red fruit, oak and a thickness of tannin in this estate-driven red which drinks heavy on the palate. Cedar and pencil shavings accent it well.

title: Ivory and Burt 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Candied flavors like caramel and butterscotch make this full-bodied wine seem sweet, while a lush, soft texture coats the palate.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Merlot (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: A hearty 12% Cabernet Sauvignon is added to this wine, which is aged in 100% French oak. Reduced, with sizable oak influence, it shows dried herb components wrapped in bittersweet black pepper and leather.

title: Layer Cake 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Slightly reductive aromas of wet clay and sour olive meet with dark cranberry fruit and camphor on the nose of this bottling. The palate is tart with raspberry and orange rind and gains complexity from the forest moss and wet wood flavors.

title: Rare 2014 Rare Black Blend Red (California)
description: A good blast of black cherry and cedar in the aroma is followed by rich, grapey flavors on a moderately firm texture. It is softened by a hint of sweetness on the finish.

title: Fetzer 2016 Sundial Chardonnay (California)
description: Pale lemon and thyme aromas precede a very buttery flavor in this split-personality wine. It is medium bodied, crisp at first sip but turns butterscotchy on the palate.

title: SIP 2015 Moscato (California)
description: This dessert-style wine is quite flavorful and sweet, from the aroma of apple cider and toasted nuts to flavors of golden raisins and honey. It has an almost thick texture and syrupy finish.

title: Dolce 2012 Late Harvest Semillon-Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is divinely sweet without ever becoming cloying. A blend of 89% Sémillon and 11% Sauvignon Blanc from grapes grown in Coombsville, it offers a clean, creamy palate of peat, caramel, vanilla wafer, nuts and honey. If a finishing touch of sweetness is needed at the end of any meal, this is your wine.

title: Freeman 2015 Akiko's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is a classic all the way through, from the exciting spice and dark-fruit aromas to the rich yet vibrant flavors and palate-gripping structure that suggests its ability to age. It has a wealth of fine-grained tannins, a medium to full body and a grand sense of weight and concentration. Best after 2024.

title: Merry Edwards 2014 Late Harvest Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This dessert wine was made from a block of the Musqué clone at the producer's Meredith Estate, picked when they were raisined then fermented and aged in 60% new French oak. A briny green-olive tone dots the nose before the sweetness of caramel, honeycomb, gingersnap and vanilla weighs in on the palate. This is concentrated, lush and creamy, with a bright citrus flourish on the finish.

title: Heritance 2013 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This outstanding effort from the famous site is truly inviting on the nose, with a prominent rose aroma. The smooth palate boasts power and grace, with a deft mix of black cherry coulis and cassis flavors tamed by dusty tannins. Hints of tobacco and dark chocolate carry through to the finish. Enjoy best 2023–2033.

title: Denner 2015 Dirt Worshipper Syrah (Central Coast)
description: This is a tremendously delicious bottling, enhanced by 2% each of Roussanne and Viognier, that's simultaneously lush and savory. The nose combines black currant sauce, smoked pork, cracked black pepper, crushed purple flowers, wild thyme and caramel. The palate is coated in lavish, polished yet still firm tannins and a vibrant acidity that carries flavors of black-plum pudding and peppercorns.

title: Patrimony 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Deep, dark and still very tightly wound three years after harvest, this second vintage of the Daou brothers' top-tier effort continues their march toward phenolic perfection. Aromas of black currant, elderberry jam, crushed black rocks, loamy soil and light purple flowers lead into a plush palate that's very dry, extremely textural and well balanced. Flavors of black plum, dark berries and dark chocolate ride sticky tannins that will smooth with patience. Drink 2019–2034.

title: Adelaida 2015 Viking Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: Dense blackberry jam, fresh violets, dewy thyme and a hint of cocoa dust show on the viscous, very impressive nose of this bottling. Black cherry, cola, roasted meat and touches of lilac arise on the palate, which rides a soft silky frame and plays well to multiple palates, from those seeking a serious well-structured wine, to others wanting more hedonistic fun.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Klopp Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Spicy baked rhubarb, plum and cherry clafouti give this wine a welcoming richness that shines warmly in toasty oak and cola tones. Light on entry, it develops robust flavors and texture in the glass, softly seductive in an underlying freshness of acidity, with flavors of cardamom, tea and drips of dark chocolate.

title: Villa Creek 2014 Slide Hill Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: There's an extreme and awesome amount of black pepper and crushed asphalt alongside a bit of elderberry fruit, on the savory nose of this bottling from a biodynamic, quite coastal vineyard. That savory cracked peppercorn aspect invades the palate as well, but also picks up more rounded blackberry and purple-flower flavors, set against a lively acidity and versatile texture that will play well with a variety of foods.

title: Villa Creek 2015 Willow Creek Cuvée Red (Willow Creek)
description: Cris Cherry is on the leading edge of Paso Robles vintners who push the ripe boundaries while remaining in compelling balance, and this blend of 70% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 10% Mourvèdre is an excellent example. Aromas of blackberry paste, fresh lilacs and hoisin sauce drop into a palate where blueberry and baked black-plum flavors are decorated with cola, sarsaparilla and black-pepper spices.

title: Freeman 2015 Keefer Ranch Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This wine is especially lively and focused, driven by electric acidity, nervy tannins and intricate fruit and spice flavors. While full bodied, it's not a blockbuster yet gives plenty of excitement in terms of mint, red-cherry and cinnamon flavors and a bracing mouthfeel. It will no doubt age well for several years. Best after 2022.

title: La Jota Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Blended with small percentages of 12% Cabernet Franc, 5% Merlot and 5% Petit Verdot, and then aged in 90% new French oak for 19 months, this stellar effort offers reduced oak, bark, toast and clove aromas and flavors alongside sizable, structured tannin and hearty ripeness. Black currant and chocolate dust a layer of tobacco. Enjoy best 2024 through 2034.

title: EnRoute 2015 Northern Spy Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Rose petal and dried herb tones are inviting in this powerful wine, with additional aromas of spicy orange, clove and blueberry. Layered in silky waves of tannin, it's a beautiful wine, seasoned in savory black pepper and minerals.

title: Epoch 2014 Ingenuity Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Viscous and dark in the glass, this wine's unctuous nose shows black currant, violet and a hint of hot asphalt. The blend of 50% Syrah, 25% Grenache, 18% Mourvèdre and 7% Petite Sirah is tight on the palate, where a tarry texture carries flavors of concentrated black currant, fresh blackberry and wild chaparral herbs. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Freeman 2015 Gloria Estate Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is an inviting and satisfying combination of ripeness and structure. It has generous black-cherry and clove aromas, rich floral, rhubarb and cherry flavors and a full, broad yet firm texture that's truly appetizing. Best after 2023.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Walker Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Salt rock and tart green-apple tones combine effortlessly to showcase a sublime texture with considerable length and depth. A touch of butterscotch graces the finish, but it's otherwise all about freshness in lemon and lime flavors, with exotic elements of lemongrass and ginger.

title: EnRoute 2015 Hop Kiln Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a prime spot on Westside Road, this is an impressive wine. A baked bread aroma and a lush flavor of raspberry jam is framed by integrated tannins as the palate expands and becomes increasingly complex. Succulent in texture, it broods in black cherry, black tea and a lasting bite of cardamom flavor.

title: Potek 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lemon blossoms, crushed chalk, sea salt, sandalwood smoke and lime pith swirl together into an extremely inviting, compelling and truly Burgundian nose on this bottling by Dave Potter. The palate is grippy and layered with texture and flavors of lemon rind, crushed nuts, judicious oak and the slightest pop of crème brûlée on the finish. Drink now–2030.

title: The Hilt 2015 The Vanguard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very tightly wound on the nose, this impressive bottling by Matt Dees of Jonata fame starts with fresh and seabreeze-like aromas, from lime zest and pink lemonade to wet slate and cool steel. The sip is energetic and racy like a classic Chablis, showing lemon balm, honeysuckle and well integrated oak across a texturally compelling platform.

title: Epoch 2014 Block B Paderewski Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Quite thick in the glass, this bottling by Jordan Fiorentini shows a compelling combo of black plum, black currant, purple flowers and crushed limestone on the nose. The palate is soft, and the chalky texture is sliced through by buoyant acidity, carrying flavors of black currant and crushed herbs that will last a long, long time. Drink 2019–2035.

title: Tolosa 2016 1772 Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Clean aromas of dark red fruit, black plum, turned earth and crushed slate made for a heady nose on this estate bottling. Those earthy tones extend to the palate, where blackberry, clove and vanilla flavors are framed by a chalky texture and fresh acidity.

title: Verve 2015 Stuhlmuller Vineyard Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: Pretty, floral and persistent in citrus-laden acidity, this is a lovely memorable wine, light and bright with complex elements of crème brûlée and Meyer lemon. It's made in a small amount from a great vineyard site, and shows more freshness than is typically expected from the appellation.

title: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Santa Barbara Highlands Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: A very transparent shade of rusty red in the glass, this bottling shows how compelling Grenache can be in a lighter style. Aromas of red cherry, salt-and-pepper spice and tanned leather show on the nose. It's clean and savory on the palate, full of dried carnations, hibiscus, white pepper and a touch of dill.

title: August Briggs 2014 Page Nord Vineyard Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: Compost, earth and wild truffle mix on the entry of this wine, making for a feral edge of varietal character. Supple tannin lies beneath layers of leather, meat and baked plum and cherry, with tart acidity adding to the freshness and overall balance of the wine.

title: Cellars 33 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This lovely, balanced red is from vines estimated to be between 90- and 100-years old, and made in tiny amounts. Baked berry, cherry and plum flavors wrap around bright mineral undertones and focused acidity. The texture is taut in grainy tannins, while the oak is subtle and supportive.

title: Crawford Family 2014 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Frothy aromas of framboise, mace, eucalyptus and wet slate make for a very plush and fulfilling nose on this bottling from a dramatic, bowl-shaped vineyard perched on the southwestern edge of the appellation. The mouthfeel is full, soft and enveloping, showing tart cranberry and tangy sage-oil flavors.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Family Reserve Malbec (Paicines)
description: Pure blackberry aromas are lifted by dark chocolate and mint on the nose of this reserve bottling from a historic wine-growing region south of Hollister. There's a sweet touch at first to the palate, but then gravelly tannins and zesty acidity delivers flavors of black plum, elderberry jam and tarragon. It is still quite young, and will improve in the cellar.

title: EnRoute 2015 Amber Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is thick and concentrated, with a distinctly earthy streak of dried herb, black tea, clove and cardamom. A warming note of baked bread adds substance alongside focused flavors of raspberry and black cherry.

title: Epoch 2014 Estate Blend Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Very pointed and heavy aromas of concentrated blackberry syrup, crushed violets, wet rocks and nose-tickling dark spice show on this blend of 36% Syrah, 36% Mourvèdre, 22% Grenache and 6% Tempranillo. It's big and confident on the palate with vibrant acidity, piquant fruit and an upright structure, but needs a bit more time to come into its own.

title: Freeman 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a wonderfully balanced, fresh and complex wine that shows finesse more than power. It has an aroma like sour cherries, cloves and bay leaves before flavors of rhubarb, black tea and black cherry come through. The texture is bolstered by mild tannins and welcome acidity, and it has enough weight for a lingering finish.

title: Krupp Brothers 2016 Black Bart's Bride Stagecoach Vineyard Proprietary White (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 73% Viognier and 27% Roussanne, this is an intensely floral and robust white, lush and creamy in dense flavors of butterscotch, honey, fig and baked apple. Full bodied and fleshy, it impresses in its ability to balance its strong arms with pretty aromatics.
designation: Black Bart's Bride Stagecoach Vineyard Proprietary

title: Montemar Wines 2013 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Roasted blackberry, crushed black pepper and funky tar show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from the Los Alamos area. Fairly thick on the palate, the sip shows more cracked pepper, elderberry and asphalt, framed by mouthcoating chalky tannins and a solid acidity.

title: Sojourn 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an intense, bright and focused wine aged in 30% new oak and made from well-farmed moderately ripe fruit. A salty element rides along with lemon and apple, a touch of melon at the door.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Côtes de Tablas Blanc Grown & Bottled on the Estate Viognier-Grenache Blanc-Marsanne-Roussanne White (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 43% Viognier, 40% Grenache Blanc, 14% Marsanne and 3% Roussanne shows a fascinating mineral tone, offering a grippy and yet still expressive wine. Aromas of Key lime and plaster of Paris lead into a dynamic palate of pink grapefruit pith, peach blossom and Rainier cherry, all set against a chalky backbone.
designation: Côtes de Tablas Blanc Grown & Bottled on the Estate Viognier-Grenache Blanc-Marsanne-Roussanne

title: Trombetta 2016 Four Brothers Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: This small-production white is reduced in its youth, with pungent, powerful flavors of tart green apple, golden honey, lemongrass and ginger. Persistent, fresh acidity supports the exotic nature of the fruit and the brightly layered palate.

title: Daou 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark aromas of black currant, elderberry jam, dark chocolate and an elegant layering of herbs show on the nose of this bottling. There's a dense frame of opulent black cherry and purple flowers on the sip, which is framed by upright yet smooth tannins.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 Ancient Vines Bedrock Vineyard Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is a blend of Carignan, Zinfandel and Mourvèdre, with the vines planted originally in 1888. Given time to age in mostly used French oak, it's weedy and herbal, thick and densely layered in fresh notions of blackberry and strawberry, with hints of leather and black pepper.

title: Dragonette 2015 Rita's Crown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This intriguing take on the grape blends nutty warmth with citrusy freshness, offering aromas of hazelnut, lime skin and a touch of ash. It's tightly wound at first on the palate, but then opens to reveal rounded flavors of honeysuckle, nectarine and peach blossom, hewn in by Meyer lemon pith and tangy grapefruit rind.

title: Etude 2015 Forté Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Snappy black-raspberry aromas meet with thyme sprigs, carnations, cinnamon and a hint of smoke on the very fresh and lively nose. Elegant flavors of cranberry, pomegranate and hibiscus are hit with a dash of potpourri on the sip, and it's refreshing that this reserve-type bottling aims for vibrancy and grace rather than simply strong oak.

title: Lava Cap 2014 Estate Bottled Syrah (El Dorado)
description: Powerful flavors and a rich mouthcoating texture make this a big and bold wine that's worthy of the heaviest proteins to pair it with. It has abundant spicy, smoky, peppery aromas and concentrated flavors of roast beef, dark chocolate and black cherry, plus a lingering finish.

title: Wolff 2015 White Wolff White (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Vibrant aromas of lime blossom, lemon balm and a wet stone minerality show on the nose of this unique blend of 56% Marsanne, 29% Albarino and 15% Grenache Blanc. It's very grippy on the palate, with crushed gravel and lemon glaze flavors.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2017 Dry Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: This wine is a long-running success story for the winery. It carries aromas of citrus zest and freshly sliced apples on the nose. The palate shows good balance through crisp acidity and a medium body, tempered slightly by 4 g/L residual sugar.

title: Art of the Cooper 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Strong and delicious oak flavors dominate this full-bodied and rich-tasting wine, keeping true to its name. Cedar, cinnamon and vanilla light up the aromas, while maple, brown sugar and clove flavors overlay jammy black-cherry notes. Moderate tannins are softened by a light sense of sweetness on the palate and finish.

title: Clos LaChance 2017 Hadley's Cuvee White (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Broad aromas of orange, melon, apple and pear are quite ripe but very clean on the nose of this bottling, a blend of Chardonnay, Sauvignon Blanc and Viognier. Tangy green-apple rind flavors meet with jasmine on the unique palate.

title: Grand Napa 2016 Master Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends Cabernet Sauvignon with Merlot and Cabernet Franc, the end result offering a sweetness of oak around balanced ripeness of black fruit, clove and dark chocolate. With a nose of violet and lavender, it has a touch of heat on the finish.

title: Le Casque 2017 Adrian White (Sierra Foothills)
description: Soothing and creamy to sip, this medium-bodied blend of white Rhône grape varieties has subtle fruit flavors but a very appealing, rich texture that coats the mouth and lingers on the finish. It tastes lush, figgy and indulgent.

title: Swanson 2017 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)
description: A slightly pink shade of yellow in the glass, this fresh bottling offers aromas of red apple and citrus spray on the nose. The mouthfeel is rounded and smooth, carrying flavors of peach, lime zest and a touch of salinity.

title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Block 92 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This wine opens in high-toned aromas of jasmine and apple blossom and is textured on the palate. It takes on a full-bodied ripe concentration of baked apple and tropical flavors wrapped in sweet oak.

title: Barnett 2015 Merlot (Spring Mountain District)
description: Made with 13% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Cabernet Franc, this is juicy in cherry and berry, a fruit-forward and roundly soft wine that's pleasantly structured, full bodied and fresh.

title: Butternut 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has aromas like toasted bread and black pepper, followed by ripe blackberry flavors and a firm structure of grippy tannins and mild acidity. It is medium to full bodied and offers plenty of character, so don't let the screwcap be a negative.

title: Cosa Obra 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Big in style and somewhat reductive, this wine offers funky earthiness and plenty of spearmint, clove and forest floor. It has a softness to the midpalate that reveals fruity flavors of black cherry and blueberry with a lasting note of cola.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2014 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: Bright cherry and cranberry aromas and equally vivid and crisp fruit flavors dominate this medium- to full-bodied wine. It has a firm texture of tannins and acidity and a mature mellow spicy character that develops in the mouth.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Merlot (Paicines)
description: Deep aromas of boysenberry, slate and pine show on the nose of this bottling from an appellation in San Benito County. Turned loam flavors arise on the earthy palate, which also offers dark cherry, strong acidity and firm structure that still needs some time to smooth out.

title: Folie à Deux 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is an easygoing approachable wine that's soft and supple in texture. Well integrated, it has a generous ripeness of black plum and mocha that plays well on the palate.

title: Kitson 2016 Black Knight Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From an organically farmed, high-elevation site east of the Petaluma Gap, this is a moderately light, delicate wine with cherry fruit and wisps of baking spice to offer. It retains an impressive grasp of minerality that tastes of crushed rock.

title: Lodi Estates 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a good, solid choice that will be versatile at the table. Fresh black-cherry and red-cherry aromas and flavors ride on an appetizing structure of light tannins and good acidity.

title: McManis 2017 Certified Sustainable Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Very fruity and fresh, this light-bodied wine shows vivid floral and apple aromas and flavors. It's attractively clean, snappy and straightforward.

title: Medlock Ames 2015 Kate's and B's Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Sticky in blueberry, coffee and leather, this wine presents as full bodied and big in style, with a savory smoothness on the texture.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This non-oaky wine is somehow brawny and pretty at the same time. It offers wonderful cherry-like floral aromas and equally focused bright flavors, along with a definitely dry palate and full body.

title: Quady 2016 Elysium Black Muscat (California)
description: Quite sweet but not heavy in body, this fruity, rich and concentrated wine is filled with sweet plum and bright cherry flavors, has a sugary texture and lingering finish.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2015 Beatty Ranch Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: Black and white pepper lead the way into this structured, beautifully made wine, which is sourced from pre-Prohibition-planted blocks from the estate vineyard. Leather, blackberry and a grainy, grippy texture highlight the explosive flavors. It's well balanced, with both the power and grace to age. Enjoy 2020–2025.

title: Benovia 2015 La Pommeraie Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is ethereal and intoxicating on the nose, offering a bouquet of wild rose and lavender that's hard to resist. Dense, concentrated strawberry and pomegranate flavors give it a tart freshness on the palate that contrasts well against its innate power. There's plenty of structure here for further aging.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Beckstoffer Georges III Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Succulent, generous in fruit and expansive on the palate, this exudes vibrant, polished layers of baked plum, blueberry and tobacco, a showcase for the famous site in the heart of the appellation. Big and bold, it doesn't hold back in power or richness yet succeeds in finding balance.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Thomas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Sumptuous, structured and exuberantly brimming in tangy red fruit, this wine is also intriguing in dried herb and chalky, polished tannin. It offers a touch of heat around the integrated oak and powerful complex balance between the savory and succulent.

title: Devil Proof 2015 Farrow Ranch Malbec (Alexander Valley)
description: From the oldest block of a dry-farmed, hillside site, this bold, beautiful red is a celebratory expression of crushed rock, dusty soil and floral teases of rose and lavender. Hearty, thick and rich in its youth, it offers a wealth of blue fruit, leather and brown sugar. The oak is integrated and the tannins are grippy yet beginning to show polish.

title: Prager NV Noble Companion 10-Year-Old Tawny Port (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from a majority of Touriga Nacional, with smaller amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Tinta Roriz (Tempranillo), and spent nearly 11 years in neutral oak before being bottled in 2017. It appears to be in its prime, beautifully rich on the nose and palate, with integrated, off-dry flavors of candied orange and cherry.

title: Talley 2015 Stone Corral Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Lovely aromas of dark strawberry, framboise and star anise make for a very fresh and inviting nose on this bottling. The palate surrounds energetic and tangy pomegranate flavors, which are lifted by thyme and forest moss. Delicious, complex and herbal all at once.

title: The Setting 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine sourced from the SJ Ranch, this offers intense tastes of sweet tobacco, coconut shavings and mocha, the layered flavors built around thick, extracted tannins and pillowy soft oak. The power and richness are complemented by a tension of acidity that brightens the full-bodied palate.

title: The Withers Winery 2015 Charles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is vivid and concentrated but not overly ripe, so it has an attractive tension between almost-tart red-cherry and sour-cherry flavors and richer savory mushroom and forest-floor notes. It's possibly the most nervy wine yet from the Charles Vineyard. Good acidity and moderate tannins add welcome grip on the palate, while the finish lingers nicely.

title: Trefethen 2016 Family Owned Estate Grown Chardonnay (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is a lovely, well-made white, bursting in tones of vanilla and biscuits on the nose. It is lush and layered on the light-bodied frame, the oak integrated and subtle, with flavors of green apple and mango.

title: Chamisal Vineyards 2015 Morrito Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling is led by a beautiful, dynamic nose of wild thyme, chaparral spice, mulberry, raspberry syrup and black-plum skins. The palate is rich and layered as well, with pomegranate reduction, roasted fig, purple flowers and more hints of wild herbs.

title: Hanzell 2015 Day Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Entirely stainless-steel fermented and oak aged—the oak neutral—this is a formidably memorable wine, fulsome and balanced in anise and juicy Gravenstein apple and peach. On the palate it's lush and creamy, with supportive acidity maintaining welcome, lasting freshness.

title: Holus Bolus 2016 Presqu'ile Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
