description: Syrah doesn't get much more cool-climate than this, starting with piquant aromas of white and green peppercorns, crushed thyme, bay leaf and tart boysenberry fruit. The intense pepper dominates the palate, though a clean line of black-plum skin runs through the sip.

title: Joseph Phelps 2015 Pastorale Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This estate-grown beauty out of the producer's Freestone property is stunning in stemmy, minty earth, a touch of smoke and powerful background tannin and oak. Made in an impressively lean, coastal style that's both exotic and fresh, its fruit leans savory and succulent in cranberry and rhubarb.

title: Thacher 2015 Glenrose Vineyard Cinsault (Adelaida District)
description: Consider this bottling the antidote to the richness of Paso Robles. Extremely fresh aromas of framboise, rosewater and white pepper align for a beautifully inviting nose. There is brilliant acidity at the tip of the palate, evolving into elegant tones of rose, red plum, pomegranate and exotic Middle Eastern spice.

title: Zeitgeist 2017 Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard Trousseau Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: Made to be fresh, fruity and enjoyed frequently, this wine is oily in lemon and apricot, with a refreshing, spritzy acidity that's both bright and complex. The vineyard is one of very few in the state to grow the variety and this producer has made it its mission to honor both the site and the grape. She does.

title: Alpha Omega 2014 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Structured, full-bodied and robustly ripe, this mountain wine is 100% barrel-fermented and given nearly two months in oak. Sticky tannins and a sweetness from the oak combine well to provide a velvety lush contrast to the wild blackberry, currant and fleshy mouthfeel of pepper spice and leather.

title: Axr 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tart in red and black currant, this wine offers explosive acidity and fleshy polished tannins, the core densely structured and full-bodied. Given nearly two years in French oak, 75% of it new, it is accented in woody, herbal layers of dust and earth. Enjoy 2024–2030.

title: Aperture 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From winemaker Jesse Katz, this Cabernet Sauvignon-dominant wine includes 4% Malbec. Textured, yet pleasantly soft, it offers an elegance of integrated, billowy tannin and oak. The warmth of the palate is embraced in flavors of mocha and spicy clove, with hints of cedar, graphite and dried herb.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 Claire's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This wine has a wild side, bringing out the savory smoky singed-rosemary and cooked-cherry elements of the varietal, with great balance aided by firm acidity and tannins. With its spicy aromas and layered concentrated flavors, this should improve with some age. Best after 2021.

title: Robert Renzoni 2014 Montepulciano (Temecula Valley)
description: Plump aromas of baked dark strawberries and caramelized plums meet with vanilla, baking spice and loamy soil on the nose of this bottling. The palate is broadly and softly painted with more baked red-fruit flavors, lifted by a licorice-like spice and cut by a twiggy earth element.

title: Rock Wall 2015 Rigg Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (San Francisco Bay)
description: Second-generation vintner Shauna Rosenblum gets bonus points for finding this vineyard in the hidden hills of Castro Valley and making this wine at a former Navy base in Alameda. Aromas of blackberry juice, smashed blueberry and baking spice lead into fresh juicy flavors that enliven the palate and would pair with a variety of foods, from burgers to lighter fare.

title: Roth 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Grassy, fleshy and piercing in freshness, this wine is made from fruit grown in both Chalk Hill and Dry Creek Valley. Persistent acidity supports fresh flavors of kiwi, grapefruit and peach, while a medium-bodied palate provides balanced weight.

title: Benessere 2014 Estate Sagrantino (St. Helena)
description: This may be the only wine made from this variety in the Napa Valley—a boldly fruity, structured and powerful wine strong in tannin and oak. Layers of well-developed flavors are defined by blackberry, black pepper and cinnamon stick.

title: Crawford Family 2015 Tin Shack Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated essences of honeysuckle and lily pair up with orange oil and a touch of nuttiness on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's zippy on the lively palate, showing smashed walnut and seared lemon-wedge flavors.

title: EnRoute 2015 Marty's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Marty's is a vineyard in the Green Valley possessed of Goldridge soils. This wine reflects its provenance, showing an intensity of reduced, spicy and concentrated flavor, a mix of black cherry, cola and sarsaparilla. The palate is full bodied and concentrated.

title: Etude 2015 Temblor Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From a site within the producer's estate-farmed Grace Benoist Ranch, this wine is earthy in rose petal and a strong layering of cranberry and rhubarb. An underlying element of nutty almond paste adds richness to the otherwise medium-bodied effort that's tart in acidity.

title: John Anthony 2016 Church Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Carneros)
description: This is a wine of considerable weight and concentration, voluptuous on the palate, with undeniable ripeness and meaty heft. Exotic in fennel, licorice and oak spice, it impresses with aspects of coconut and mango.

title: Kunde 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Tropical tones of mango and pineapple are vibrant in this wine. It is taut, with intense acidity that settles into toasty oak. Vibrantly focused, it has a core of vanilla and Meyer lemon that comes through on the finish atop a hint of butterscotch.

title: LangeTwins 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Well-balanced and well-crafted, this medium-bodied and firmly textured wine has everything in the right proportions. Ripe red cherry and baking spices lift the aroma while black cherry and cranberry flood the palate, soaking through the firm tannins and fruit acidity. It's best to pair with big proteins.

title: August Briggs 2014 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: Sweet juicy red and black berries show a briary brambly side that makes this wine soft and integrated in its richness and undeniable ripeness. Black pepper and shocks of cinnamon complement the fruit.

title: Ballentine 2015 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This robust, hearty estate wine is blended with 7% Petite Sirah, 3% Syrah, 1% Petit Verdot and 1% other red varieties. While rustic on the nose nose, it's palate is juicy and tannic, offering baked blackberry, leather and tobacco flavors.

title: Cabana Wines 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This big-boned wine works a lot of spicy, complex oak flavors into its potent blackberry and dark chocolate base, while firm tannins add to its structure and grippy mouthfeel. It's bold and dry, for drinkers who like a little bite in their wine.

title: Cuvaison 2015 Adda Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Made as a block and barrel selection, this white is meant to highlight some of the producer's oldest and most concentrated vines. It does, offering a confection of oaky vanilla and marshmallow on the nose before concentrated textures of soft sublime apple and peach meet lasting acidity.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 The Comet Red (Sonoma County)
description: Made from half Zinfandel, 40% Petite Sirah and 10% Carignan, given minimal exposure to new oak, opting instead for older French barrels, this wine is dark in color and bright and bubbly in acidity. Cherry and vanilla flavors complement one another alongside a dusty texture and finishing hit of black pepper.

title: Dragonette 2015 Grassini Family Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This is a pungent and tangy Sauvignon Blanc with aromas of heavy lawn cuttings and a slightly nutty quality in the background. The grassy element extends to the palate, where lime skins, grapefruit pith and hints of tropical fruit round out the sizzling acid-driven texture.

title: Flora Springs 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a smooth, smoky and well-integrated red wine that's balanced in its approach. Dusty oak is a nice companion to red-currant and cassis flavors that linger long.

title: Galerie 2014 Latro Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: This is a big bold wine, rough and sinewy in layers of leather, oak, tannin and earthy tobacco. The earthiness presents as a mix of wild mushroom, sage and cedar, with a sanguine meaty edge to the black fruit.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Walking Tree Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Blended with 8% Syrah, this is a well-made red, lengthy in black cherry, spicy clove and cinnamon. Medium bodied and accessible, it offers additional highlights of pencil shavings, tree bark and mocha.

title: Girard 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Rustic tones of earth and wood meet smooth, seductive layers of vibrant strawberry and blackberry jam dipped in milk chocolate. This is full in body and rich in feel.

title: Bernardus 2017 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very grassy aromas of lawn cuttings, juniper and pine oil show on the pungent nose of this zesty bottling. It's intriguing and lively on the sip, with green-fruit skins and more pine-needle tea flavors that keep one coming back for more on a hot day.

title: Bodkin 2017 Musqué Clone Sandy Bend Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Savory aromas and flavors like fennel bulb, snap pea and cucumber make this medium-bodied wine stand out. It has a good, crisp dash of acidity for balance and excellent fruit concentration that unfolds on the palate.

title: Della 2016 Keefer Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Stemmy and earthy, this is a robust, full-bodied and richly concentrated wine, candied in cherry and strawberry flavors. Accents of cola and cardamom add complexity and freshness to the power.

title: Dusty Nabor 2016 Paper Plane Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of boysenberry and black cherry meet with hints of game, jerky and cola on the nose of this bottling. Fairly ripe and rich blackberry-sauce flavors are lifted by anise on the palate, which is framed by balanced acid and tannins and makes for a fairly easy-drinking wine.

title: Ex 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Freshly cut lawn, wet cement, sour lime rinds, jalapeno and kelp combine for a very unique and compelling nose on this bottling. The roasted jalapeño note extends to the palate, where white pepper and crushed white-rock flavors make for a memorable sip.

title: Flanagan 2016 Sun Chase Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a bold brawny wine from a site high above the Petaluma Gap, with remarkably thick layers of spice and forest floor. The fruit is a mix of baked wild strawberry and rhubarb, with a lingering hint of white pepper.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Dry and fresh in acidity, with rounded corners of richness, this sings in apple, almond paste and a nice twist of gingersnap that lingers on the thickly moussed finish.

title: JCB 2015 No 7 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Sweet rose petal opens the nose of this intensely ripe wine, seductive in layers of soft integrated oak and tannin. The flavors veer into strawberry, cherry and orange, with an underlying brightness that helps balance out the bold.

title: Jordan 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Tart and tangy in underlying acidity, this elegant red offers a mix of dried herb, tobacco leaf and red currant, showing subdued ripeness within a context of elongated polished tannin and well-integrated oak.

title: Koehler 2015 Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling shows smashed strawberry, cracked pepper and a rustic balsamic aroma on the nose. The palate is spicy with pepper and tangy with sour strawberry and plum flavors, ending on a hint of vanilla.

title: Ladera 2017 Rosé of Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal, from grapes grown atop Stagecoach Vineyard. Both stainless-steel and French oak-aged, it offers strawberry, blueberry and watermelon flavors, strong, well-defined characteristics complemented by supple texture and a twist of lemon peel at the finish.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Catalyst Private Reserve Red (Temecula)
description: Strong aromas of licorice meet with dark-black plum on the nose of this blend of Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Franc, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. It's tightly packed on the palate with black plum, boysenberry and tart plum-skin flavors, flecked by anise throughout.

title: Navarro 2016 Méthode A L'Ancienne Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a relatively light wine that's elegant, easy to drink and well balanced. It shows plenty of jazzy cherry flavors, light spice and rhubarb accents and a smooth mouthfeel backed by light tannins and acidity.

title: Parducci 2016 Small Lot Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Mouthfilling, ripe and generous, this medium- to full-bodied wine packs a lot of flavor into a big but soft frame. Black cherry, blueberry and a hint of chocolate provide plenty to appreciate while mild tannins and soft acidity keep the structure gentle.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Generously fruity in blueberry and rich soft flavors of chocolate mocha, this is a decadent wine that offers integrated oak and tannin and is lush and fleshy from start to finish.

title: Velvet Bee 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong cedar kick to the woody nose of this bottling, alongside cinnamon and cranberry aromas. The wood spice is also strong on the palate, which is energetic in flavors of cranberry and rhubarb.

title: Allegretto 2014 Willow Creek Vineyards Ayres Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Roasted black cherries and dried herbs show prominently on the pleasant nose of this bottling by a luxury hotel property in the region. The palate combines dark fruit and ginger-like spice with a chalky mouthfeel, finishing on vanilla dust.
designation: Willow Creek Vineyards Ayres Family Reserve

title: Anderson Conn Valley 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: With 10% Sémillon, the white aged in neutral barrels, this is a rich, interwoven wine with spicy acidity and bold tropical flavors at its core. A dash or two of ginger and white pepper memorably finishes things out.

title: Bodkin 2017 The Falconer Verdelho (Suisun Valley)
description: More savory than fruity, this interesting and earthy wine has aromas of smoke and chalk, herbal and brothy flavors and good balance. It's off the beaten path but well worth the detour.

title: Byron 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There is a strong amount of smoke and oak on the nose of this bottling, but there's also elegant touches of creamy Asian pear and lemon rind. That citrus and smoke combination shows on the sip as well, along with sweet touches of apple flesh and a compelling sandalwood flavor.

title: Magnolia Court Dorrian 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Lemon curd, apple sauce, mango and melon make for a pretty ripe nose on this bottling. There is a strong sizzle of acidity on the sip and then quite ripe flavor of pear, apple soda and tropical kiwi.

title: Chalone Vineyard 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: This dry, low-yielding year impacted the fruit in this bottling considerably, as it shows loads of dried-out black cherry and raisin-like fruit as well as cola spice. A flash of acid starts the sip but then it also dries out toward prune and blackberry-paste flavors. The appellation's reliable structure keeps the tannic tension, however.

title: Barton 2017 Broken Road Viognier (Templeton Gap District)
description: Apple skins, dried white flowers and Asian pear flesh aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers ripe apples, pears and dried orange peels.

title: Buttonwood 2015 Malbec (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Roasted sweet plums, campfire smoke and balsamic reduction aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a tad disjointed, with dried fruit flavors and a zesty acidity.

title: Carpe Diem 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy compost, mushroom and black pepper meet cedar and tomato leaf—a savory backdrop against which thick, persistent tannins rule. The fruit is a mix of black cherry and wild strawberry, which give the wine a ripe bold character touched only sparingly by oak.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Paso Robles)
description: Light and subtle aromas of red cherry and mulberry lead the clean if shy nose of this bottling. The flavors are also straight-ahead and familiar, with cherry and vanilla framed by decent tannins and a late-rising acidity.

title: Napa Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and brimming in sage, this is a sinewy full-bodied red that is demure on the midpalate. It unleashes a finish dipped in dark chocolate, plum and black pepper.

title: Tom Gore 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Very ripe cherry and berry notes combine with spicy, chocolaty oak accents in this full-bodied velvety textured wine. It feels thick but soft on the tongue and has a lot of richness.

title: Trentadue 2017 OPR Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Dry, fresh and crisp, this is a light-bodied, unoaked, mouthcleansing wine with light fig, herb and citrus flavors and good acidity. It has 5 g/L of residual sugar and was aged on the lees for five months.

title: Mabera 2013 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Sweet and smoky oak flavors dress up this full-bodied moderately tannic wine and there are enough good blackberry and plum flavors to balance the spiciness.

title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2016 Bin 6410 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Compressed in simple layers of dark cherry, leather and cola, this is a thickly concentrated wine that mellows in the glass to show varietal character and supple texture, finishing light and bright.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2016 Cold Creek Ranch Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a robust high-toned white, direct in lemon and apple flavors, its nose floral if not somewhat muted. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness and power in check, allowing an underlying streak of acidity to refresh the palate.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Black olive and truffled earth make for an inviting entry to this mountain wine, which muddles along in structure and has a sour back note of acidity. Full bodied and robustly ripe, it may come around to show more fruitful nuance.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Turned earth, rust, dark cranberry and smoked meats show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is full bodied with more smoke, dried red fruit and a seasoning of dried herbs.

title: Lewis Grace 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)
description: Pronounced oak aromas and flavors define this full-bodied and firmly tannic wine. It smells like cinnamon, vanilla and nutmeg and tastes like cranberries and red cherries.

title: Plungerhead 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A spicy oaky character defines this full-bodied and ripe-tasting wine. The aromas resemble strawberry jam and brown sugar and the flavors are rich, fruity, and seem a bit sweet.

title: Terra Valentine 2014 Foretell Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This broad-shouldered, full-bodied wine is hearty on the nose in fruity cola and baked cherry, with persistent tannins and a healthy cradling of oak.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Golden oak, lemon chiffon and pineapple combine within this intensely high-acid white, which may need more time to integrate in the bottle.

title: Sanctuary 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is sticky thick and powerful in tannin. Fruity plum and raspberry jam press against leather and cigar box savory characteristics, finishing in a wall of firm, toasted oak.

title: Sand Point 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine pushes the envelope of flavors, offering herb and veggie aromas alongside an earthy, mushroom flavor. It certainly has personality but might not make all the guests at a party happy.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: A light plummy, herbal aroma and a watermelon flavor make this medium-bodied wine satisfying to sip. The texture is smooth and there's enough fruit concentration for a bit of a lingering finish.

title: De Loach 2017 Heritage Reserve Rosé (California)
description: A good, traditional salmon color, medium body and straightforward winey flavors will make this a good meal-time wine with medium-weight protein dishes. It has plummy and slightly earthy flavors, almost like a light red wine.

title: Hoopla 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This well-made highly polished wine has plenty of ripe black-fruit aromas and flavors, light oak touches and light tannins that add some welcome heft to the otherwise soft mouthfeel.

title: Kenwood 2016 Ricioli Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Grassy, herbal and with a slight gamy, meaty note of charcuterie, this is a thick, medium-bodied white from one site. Lush on the palate, its texture is gritty, with lasting tangy elements of lemon peel and grapefruit.

title: Matchlock 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling starts with aromas of cedar, dried oregano, black olive and the slightest hint of bell pepper. Crisp black raspberry shows on the clean and decently complex palate before the herbs come through, including marjoram and dill.

title: Newton 2016 Skyside Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This medium-bodied wine has spicy peppery aromas and smoky savory flavors plus a mild black cherry accent. It is big on aroma, rather light on fruit flavors and firm in texture.

title: Refugio Ranch 2017 Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This Syrah-based rosé is a light yellow pink in color, and starts with aromas of sour tangerine and tangy lime. The palate is also very tangy, almost grassy at times, with flavors of lime peel, green apple and a touch of white peach.

title: Rodney Strong 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Baked, smoky strawberry, plum and juiced-up tannins wrap round each other in this full-bodied, robustly rich and thick red, with a lasting earthiness and toasted hints of oak and vanilla.

title: Spellbound 2016 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This is a friendly, fruity variation on Petite Sirah that uses a dash of sweetness to counter the famous tannins and bring out jammy grapey berry flavors. It's very dark in color, medium to full bodied and relatively smooth in texture.

title: St. Francis 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This is an easygoing, enjoyable white, tropical in papaya and juicy stone fruit. Floral aromatics of jasmine give it a lift of invitation around a pleasant midpalate of juicy flavor.

title: Tangent 2016 Clone 530 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: Candied lime and cut grass aromas show on the nose of this single-clone bottling from the Paragon Vineyard. Dried lime rinds, pear flesh and apples show on the palate, which is fresh yet not overly acidic.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Gilsson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Blackberry jam and toast show up on the nose of this intensely ripe, syrupy wine, big in flavor and softness. Chocolate and vanilla swirls play off each other on the rich finish.

title: Wilson Creek 2014 Distinction Vineyard Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)
description: Rather light in the glass for this grape, this bottling offers lots of wild sagebrush and thyme aromas along with dried exotic plums and gravel. There is a slight balsamic tang to the palate, where cranberry, turned earth and pepper flavors arise.

title: Kokomo 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Chocolate mocha and vanilla ride alongside brambly black fruit and leather in this soft, integrated red that's intensely ripe. The finish is dipped in clove and dried herb.

title: Lewis Grace 2013 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)
description: This is a good sturdy well-made wine that captures the grape variety's innate palate-cleansing structure and fills the mouth with tasty cherry and blackberry flavors.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Lester Family Vineyards Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Extremely earthy on the nose, this bottling shows black currant, asphalt, dried fennel and roasted beef on the nose. That meaty aspect extends to the palate, where the black-plum fruit is overpowered by cedar and cigar-box-wood elements.

title: Plungerhead 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Generous additions of oak give this dark and full-bodied wine an almost-sweet character that incorporates maple syrup and brown sugar with blackberry and Bing cherry flavors. It feels firm and tannic but still approachable.

title: Talisman 2014 Adastra Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Intensely full-bodied and ripe, this tastes of baked strawberry puree and cinnamon, with a considerable supporting cast of toasted oak and firm tannin.

title: The Winery SF 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Feral in earth and black pepper, this wine is supple, richly round and expressive in cherry cola. Full bodied and ripe, it'll please fans of a bigger softer style.

title: Martin Ranch 2016 J.D. Hurley R.E.D. Vineyard Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Strong aromas of sandalwood, myrrh, pine cones and rose-petal potpourri show on the woody nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is also loaded with cigar box and charred pine flavors, with a hint of cranberry fruit.

title: Stony Hill 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Released after the 2014, this wine is herbal, with polished tannins that give it a softness around the edges. Tart cranberry and currant flavors accentuate its heightened acidity and underlying elegance. Still, time in the cellar could do interesting things. Enjoy 2023–2030.

title: Tongue Dancer 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark in color, this wine tastes of strawberry leather with an expansive taste of biscuit, lemon zest and Bing cherry. Medium bodied, it remains fresh in acidity, with a bite of body that gives it a nice mouthfeel that's complex but never weighty.

title: Zaca Mesa 2017 Estate Vineyards Z Gris Rosé (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Soft red plum, rose petal and raspberry aromas are cut by tangerine rinds on the nose of this rosé. There's a zippy structure and grippy texture on the palate, which carry fresh flavors of strawberry, lemon pith and the pop of bubblegum.

title: En Garde 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Brightly perfumed and inviting in dark, brooding cherry and blackberry, this mountain wine is moderate in structure and powerfully ripe, with forceful, persistent tannins and plenty of complementary oak. It finishes in sage, dried herb de Provence and black pepper.

title: Entropy Cellars 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This big and beautiful wine has a dense dark color, classically minty black currant aromas, a dry, appropriately tannic texture and good sense of concentration. It is medium to full bodied, ripe but not overripe, and deserves a place at the table with a lamb or veal chop.

title: Falcone 2014 Mia's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry, cedar oil, forest spice, savory meats and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling by John and Helen Falcone. The palate offers lots of roasted black plum, lively thyme and more of that cedar-like forest spice.

title: Ken Brown 2014 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied blackberry fruit gives way to elegant purple flowers, a slightly sour tar and hints of roasted meat on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a property planted in 2002. The palate is firmly structured and laden with acid, offering flavors of dried black currant, more purple flowers and roasted coffee.

title: Shooting Star 2015 Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: This wine is nicely dry, firm in texture and offers a very good mix of ripe-to-bursting blackberry and blueberry flavors along with moderate tannins, good acidity and a welcomed sense of freshness despite full body. It will make a hearty pairing with many kinds of beef, pork, and cheese.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2015 Cote del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This single-vineyard bottling from one of the winery's prized properties shows black cherry sauce, dill, anise and coffee bean on the nose. The coffee element is quite strong on the palate, where it spices up the dark-red fruits and settles in next to fresh acidity.
designation: Cote del Sol Valley View Vineyard Estate Vineyards

title: Lumen 2016 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Gris (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is a rather unique and fascinating wine, starting with aromas of pear galette, peach and apple blossom. There is a lemon-peel tension to the medium-bodied palate but also warmer nectarine and apple-syrup flavors, with a cantaloupe touch that goes into the finish.

title: Chalone Vineyard 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Chalone)
description: Joyous aromas of red and black cherry and sugar plums meet with ginger snaps and vanilla dust on the nose of this bottling. Dried strawberry and rhubarb pie are cut by orange peel and a hint of mint on the palate.

title: Dovecote 2017 Quail Valley Vineyard Viognier (Los Olivos District)
description: Shaved apple and nectarine aromas meet with a white-flower touch on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a backyard vineyard in Solvang. There is lots of zip on the tightly wound sip, which is laser-focused from the front to midpalate but opens a bit toward riper pear and apple on the finish.

title: Kings Carey 2017 Vogelzang Vineyard Semillon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A single-varietal Sémillon bottling is hard to come by in California, but this bottling shows that it fits somewhere between Chardonnay and white Rhônes. Crushed hazelnuts, saffron, preserved lemon and canola oil show on the intriguing nose. Bright lemony acidity drives the palate through nutty flavors and a grippy texture.

title: Kitá 2017 T'aya Camp 4 Vineyard White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Intriguing aromas of cantaloupe, chalk and crushed gravel make for a very compelling entry to this blend of 50% Marsanne, 44% Roussanne and 6% Grenache Blanc. The palate is tightly wound with grapefruit-pith flavors but also shows a touch of ripeness in yellow-melon and Anjou pear elements.

title: Brick & Mortar 2017 Rosé (California)
description: This is an impressive can of wine, refreshingly complex and lively in acidity. Bright flavors of pomegranate and cranberry come from a saignée of West Block Syrah in the Petaluma Gap and several Pinot Noir sites, stainless-steel fermented and radiant in depth and structure.

title: Paper Planes NV Flight School Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an impressive wine, canned and ready to go in 4-packs. The producer focuses only on rosé, and it shows, the offering effortless in bright flavors of rose petal, red cherry and pomegranate, the acidity is up front and lasting.

title: Rusack 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Sage and thyme lend herbal intrigue to this bottling, which also shows tangy aromas of red cherry compote. There's more herbal touches to the palate as well, with dried oregano and thyme set against a fresh pomegranate background.

title: Tamber Bey 2017 Fore Family Vineyard Rosé (Red Hills)
description: This is a substantive, savory and flavorful rose that has more oomph than is typical. Made from Rhône varieties grown at high elevation, its meaty, melony flavors, herbal accents, full body and relatively rich texture can fill the role of a light red wine at mealtime.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 English Hill Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Crushed rose petal and lavender open the aromatic nose of this lovely wine, which is light bodied and delicately crafted. The midpalate evolves quietly to reveal earthy forest, cardamom and a tang of blood orange.

title: V. Sattui 2013 Reserve Stock Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Earthy barnyard and turned earth open this wine, followed by fistfuls of baking spice and soft leather. Heat comes from the ripeness of baked black fruit and clove, the wine ultimately complex and structured.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Tundra Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Woody elderberry, thyme and dried forest aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The dark fruit is somewhat dried on the palate, where oregano and dust flavors round out the sip.

title: Greyscale 2015 Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is a broad, deeply flavored wine, highlighted in dark plum, black cherry and blackberry flavors. Big boned, it offers a softness of texture accounted in clove and toasted oak.

title: Jon Nathaniel 2016 Honest Bucker White (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from 50% Sauvignon Blanc, 25% Chardonnay and 25% Malvasia. The trio work well together, offering jasmine aromas around medium-bodied well-integrated flavors of peach and green apple.

title: Korbel 2016 Brut Sparkling (California)
description: This is a generous plush-textured wine made from organically grown grapes that combines a fresh fruitiness with more floral, candied, tutti-frutti flavors and just a pinch of sugar to soften the mouthfeel.

title: Angeline 2016 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This value-driven wine is successful in its smooth texture and floral aromas, with minimal if any oak perceptible on the palate. Peach, apricot and melon mix for a fruity profile dipped in lingering acidity.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2012 Estate Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from 41% Cabernet Sauvignon, 34% Merlot and 25% Malbec, this wine works in its presentation of dusty, soft and rounded red fruit, with touches of vanilla and cinnamon. Full bodied and ripe, it embraces a juicy, approachable style.

title: Briceland 2014 Ishi Pishi Ranch Zinfandel (Humboldt County)
description: Complexity is the hallmark of this medium-bodied, organically grown wine that smells like cedar and new leather and tastes like tamarind and raspberries. It has more vivid acidity than usual, and a lively gripping texture.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Private Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: A hit of pungent oak spice, a mix of nutmeg and vanilla, permeates the nose and palate of this full-bodied wine, moderately structured with fruit-forward flavors of green apple and Meyer lemon. It offers heat on the finish.

title: Monticello Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Syrah (Oak Knoll District)
description: Pomegranate and plum are complemented by dried herb in this brushy, moderately structured red wine. Thick dense layers of ripeness and oak give it a concentrated power highlighted in black licorice and black pepper.

title: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Parcel 41 Merlot (North Coast)
description: Very ripe and saturated with dark fruit flavors, this full-bodied wine combines a jammy character with wisps of smoke and grilled herbs. It gets points for good fruit concentration and feels smooth and full on the palate.

title: Pear Valley 2016 Pear Valley Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
description: Combining both citrus pith and more tropical components, this bottling shows fresh melon, Key lime, light guava and a touch of passion fruit on the nose. It tightens up on the palate, with sour orange and lime-sprayed popcorn flavors.

title: Russian Ridge 2014 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Very ripe fruit flavors like raisins and dried plums give this full-bodied wine a high concentration factor, while moderate tannins add more heft to the texture. It has a mouth-filling richness, high alcohol and a jammy character that lingers on the finish.

title: Trenza 2013 Mosaico Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah shows perky boysenberry, vanilla, crushed flowers and roasted black plum on the nose. Rounded red and purple fruits meet with leather and tannic tension on the sip.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Fresh apples, pear flesh, squeezed lemon and spring blossoms show on the nose of this bottling by musician Zac Brown. There is a strong sizzle of acidity to the sip, where zesty flavors of Key lime spray and Pink Lady apples arise.

title: La Folia Winery 2014 Fiano (Sierra Foothills)
description: This dry wine has a vivid gold color and smells earthy at first, but it soon opens up to rich peanut and honey aromas, soothing almond and marzipan flavors and a mouth-clinging texture.

title: Cutruzzola 2014 Riven Rock Vineyard Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Quite reserved on the nose, this bottling from a vineyard seven miles behind Cambria, shows light berries and sweet wood on the nose. The palate combines dried berries with fennel fronds, but is still quite wound up and needs more time to emerge.

title: D'Alfonso-Curran 2016 Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: Broad aromas of honeydew, tuberose and guava prove quite floral and tropical, and there is a chalky backbone providing aromatic structure. Crisp, clean flavors of Juicy Fruit gum show on the palate.

title: De Loach 2015 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: With a giant fleur-de-lis on the bottle, the nature of this wine is matched in intensity and outward fruit-forwardness. It's a mix of noble reduction, salty oak and baked apple and pineapple richness.

title: Identified 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a very pleasant, smooth and ripe-tasting wine that glides across the palate and spreads a jammy blackberry flavor to the corners of the mouth. It's soft in terms of acidity and tannins and has a sensation of sweetness from its ripeness.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Siena Red (Sonoma County)
description: The winery's ode to its Italian roots, this blends Sangiovese with Malbec, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon, creating a hearty fruit-forward endeavor highlighted in cherry, berry, leather and chocolate. Pronounced oak provides a touch of bitterness that contrasts with the fruit.

title: Vokel 2016 Eastside Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A tiny production from a small producer, this wine has a hearty entry and is hugely oaky and bursting in tannin. Its flavor profile is leathery, savory and smoky.

title: Cochon 2016 Les Sirenes Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Delicately layered and earthy, this wine takes on power as it opens in the glass, ending up in a full-bodied style of robust forest, cardamom and pomegranate. The structure is moderate in acidity.

title: McManis 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: Smooth, well balanced and lightly fruity, this light-bodied wine offers peach and cantaloupe flavors, with a supple texture and just enough acidity for freshness.

title: Novy 2015 Ramal Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)
description: Fantastically seductive in aromatics of brambly blackberry and chocolate, the flavors continue along the same theme, dotted in vanilla. Thick, dense and richly ripe, this wine packs a powerful punch and lingers in creamy texture on the finish.

title: Olelo 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a very solid Cab for the price, starting with aromas of roasted blackberries, black plums and oak. There is fairly prominent tannic structure on the palate, presenting flavors of roasted plums and berries and a hint of coffee.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Merlot (Mendocino County)
description: This is a sturdy, well-balanced wine, with supportive tannins and refreshing acidity that carries ripe flavors of blackberry and black cherry. It will be just the thing for a steak, roast or stew.

title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Light aromas of pear cider and lemon rinds show on the nose of this bottling, which is one of the more popular bubblies from the Central Coast. The palate offers dried apples and apple-cider flavors, with a touch of earthy dust.
designation: Cork Jumper Rosé Blanc de Noirs

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Lester Family Vineyards Partners' Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Ripe orange pith, tight apple flesh, lemon rind and sandalwood aromas show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from a property in the Corralitos area. There is a fine line of lime set against roasted apple and seared lemon on the palate, with toasty flavors on the finish.

title: Wolff 2016 Old Vines Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Very showy aromas of daffodils and white peach meet with sea salt and vanilla on the nose of this bottling. There is good grip to the sip, where flavors of lime, grapefruit and sliced orange arise.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2013 Judge Vineyard Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Made entirely from the one variety, this is bright and floral in red-fruit and lavender notes, as well as the darker side of the grape: compost, turned earth and barnyard leather. It shows power and full-bodied ripeness while maintaining varietal integrity.

title: Chappellet 2016 Mountain Cuvée Proprietor's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This rounded, approachable blend is well-made, blending 51% Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller percentages of Merlot, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Concentrated in big, burly black fruit, it offers accents of tobacco and mocha around a thick midpalate and finishing touch of char.

title: Mount Veeder 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: This adds 12% Malbec and 4% Petit Verdot to the mix, a burly, full-bodied expression of mountain mint, cinnamon and tenacious tannin. Juicy plum and dark cherry compete for attention amidst the strong herbal components and concentration.

title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Merlot (California)
description: Ripe, rich and full bodied, this opulent wine from a San Luis Obispo producer has plenty of fruit aromas and flavors shaded by chocolate and baking-spice nuances. It's all at a reasonable price for the level of quality.

title: San Simeon 2017 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of candied pomegranate, sweet sage, bay leaf and crushed hibiscus, with a touch of graphite minerality. It's fresh and bright on the palate, where cherry is dashed with dried herbs and white pepper.

title: The Archivist 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Fruity aromas of cherry, hibiscus and pomegranate grow more complex with wood spice, slate and clay on the nose of this widely available bottling. Full flavors of dried cherry and pomegranate juice meet with sagebrush and bay leaf on the palate.

title: Hearst Ranch 2015 The Pergola Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: A shade lighter than most Petite Sirahs, this bottling offers dried strawberry, black plum and fresh flowers on the nose. The palate surrounds a core of black and red-plum fruits and is laced with peppery spices, proving light on its feet.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy in black tea and leather, this tastes of smoky oak and dried cherry and strawberry, its texture smooth and silky. Exotic in an edginess of citrus, it finishes with a grip of tannin.

title: Newton 2015 Unfiltered Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This sources from multiple appellations, combining grapes into a cohesive unit of deep richness and dusty mineral. The richness takes form in flavours of chocolate-covered-cherries and currants, with accents of graphite and dried herb.

title: Stolo 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Polished aromas of raspberry sorbet meet with sumac, cinnamon and a very strong pine-oil element on the nose of this bottling. Red-cherry fruit shows on the sip alongside woody flavors of juniper and forest floor.

title: Vokel 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick and intensely ripe, this appellation red is hearty and substantial on the palate, a richly interwoven mix of dried herb, strawberry and cola.

title: McManis 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a smooth, medium-bodied wine with lots of ripe berries and a good mix of oak spices from cinnamon to vanilla and cedar. The mouthfeel has a little heft from light tannins, matched by good depth of flavor, so the balance is there.

title: Morgan 2015 G 17 Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black cherry, roasted beef, charred beets and a touch of freshness show on the nose of this bottling, which is a great everyday sipper. The palate combines roasted berry and very dry peppercorn flavors, set against a solid structure and well-balanced acidity.

title: Orange Coast WInery 2016 Rosé of Malbec (California)
description: Soft aromas of pink rose petal, strawberry, watermelon and zesty grapefruit skin show on the nose of this rosé. The palate is very approachable and easy-to-like, with candied strawberry and raspberry flavors as well as watermelon juice, cut by just enough acidity. It's definitely a crowd-pleaser.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Red (Howell Mountain)
description: A combination of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Syrah and 5% Zinfandel, this is a big blustery wine, stewy in dark fruit and dark chocolate. Big wraparound tannins support remarkable hits of leather and dried herb.

title: Piste-Off 2014 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dense black plum, black currant, chocolate, caramel and violets make for a very dark and ripe entry to this rich blend of 50% Syrah, 42% Merlot and 8% Cabernet Franc. The palate is lively with blackberry and mint flavors, and the structure and acidity are well primed.

title: Scaredy Cat Ranch 2014 Tempranillo (Ramona Valley)
description: Deep and dark in the glass, this bottling is from a region northeast of San Diego and spent 36 months in oak. It shows wet soil, clay and blackberry on the nose, and that dark-berry fruit extends to the palate, where it picks up black pepper, crushed lilacs and black-grape flavors, framed by grippy tannins.

title: Talbott 2016 Kali Hart Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Honeysuckle and lily aromas meet with crushed chalk, citrus pith and sliced pears on the nose of this bottling. There's a solid sizzle and crispness to the palate, where cut pears, pineapple and lemongrass flavors arise.

title: Toad Hollow 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: There's a kind of throwback personality in this enjoyable full-bodied wine as it has herbal-olive aromas and flavorful but not overripe cranberry and black-cherry notes on the palate. Some mild tannins give a little bite to the texture, which is welcome.

title: Tolosa 2016 1772 Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Yellow grapefruit, lime pith and a whiff of daffodil make for a tight and fresh nose on this estate bottling. There's a quick sweetness to the palate, reminiscent of Lemonhead candies, followed by zippy acidity and a lime-tangerine tang.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Estate Merlot (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Very tangy and youthful blackberry fruit meets with licorice and roasted plum on the nose of this bottling from south of Paso Robles. The palate is very zesty and fresh, with bright raspberry, blackberry, vanilla and brown spice atop squeaky tannins and strong acidity.

title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2014 Simpatico Ranch Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)
description: Light in color, this pretty wine offers floral aromatics around crisp persistent acidity dipped in fresh lemon, tangerine, peach and wet stone. The finish shows some oak.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2008 Syroir Red (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Alpine strawberry, grape Jolly Rancher, lilac and violet aromas all come to the fore in this blend of 68% Syrah and 32% Pinot Noir, which barely shows its decade of age yet. The palate starts very dry and then releases tangy red fruits, rose hips and baking spice, with a lift of mint toward the finish.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2013 Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This red blend contains all five Bordeaux varieties, most markedly 40% Merlot and 33% Cabernet Sauvignon. Reduced slightly, it's a restrained, elegant take, tart in acidity, with classic elements of cedar, red cherry, tomato leaf and dried herb.

title: Ex 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Rusty red cherry, piquant black raspberry, sagebrush and a touch of tobacco make for a slightly rustic, ever so slightly funky take on the grape. Baked strawberry, anise, white sage and a hint of cooked meats show on the palate.

title: Girasole 2016 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Earthy, buttery aromas precede generous fruit flavors in this medium to full-bodied wine that is mouthfilling and broad in texture. The contrast between a savory, earthy side and a more crisp and fruity one makes it satisfying to sip.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a larger production wine that's well-made and in an affordable price point, offering a big full-bodied presence marked by earthy mint, black tea and black cherry. It finishes in toasty oak.

title: Shooting Star 2013 Syrah (Lake County)
description: This is a very focused, medium-bodied and tightly structured wine with delicious beefy aromas and satisfying blackberry flavors supported by firm tannins and good acidity. It has a lot of appealing fruitiness shaded by hints of black pepper.

title: Simi 2014 Landslide Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Reduced and tannic, this is a full-bodied highly concentrated and robust wine, softly approachable with moderate red and black fruit and a lasting sense of herbaceousness.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 TPS Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry, black currant, crushed cranberries and caramel make for a relatively fresh nose on this blend of 67% Tannat and 33% Petite Sirah. The palate dries up considerably, with rounded elberberry and elderflower flavors, finishing on a chocolate note.

title: Tolosa 2016 Hollister Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Tart raspberry, tuned earth, garrigue and a touch of gaminess show on the nose of this bottling. Black pepper spice and woody flavors show on the sip alongside mossy forest-floor notes.

title: Collier Creek 2015 Red Wagon Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: An aroma like toasted almonds and wood smoke meets spiced plum and red-cherry flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It's an oaky version that maintains pretty good balance.

title: Dutton Estate 2016 Thomas Road Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: This is a big ripe red wine moderate in structure that offers fleshy mouthfuls of cola and black cherry.

title: K Squared Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Honey-dipped pineapple and guava, with a touch of fig give this wine a fruity midpalate. This has a moderate structure and a lingering note of anise.

title: Kunde 2016 C.S. Ridge Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Thick and oaky, this estate wine evokes caramel and pineapple-upside-down cake—its texture lushly unctuous and rich.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2016 Alegria Vineyards Sangiovese (Russian River Valley)
description: With an ashy undercurrent of char and smoke, this wine offers medium-bodied layers of dried cherry and leather, finishing with a lasting note of black pepper.

title: Bravante 2013 Cabernet Franc (Howell Mountain)
description: Dusty with highlights of cedar and sage, this full-bodied wine presents as somewhat dull on the palate—a soft, rounded and approachable expression of jammy blueberry.

title: Esser 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Yellow apple and sweet oak aromas make for a pleasant if not particularly complex aromatic entry to this bottling. Ripe apple and pear meet with sweet buttercream on the palate.

title: Kirkland Signature 2015 Signature Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: This is a full-bodied, boldly ripe Cabernet Sauvignon. Soft layers of dark cherry and plum are well integrated and contrasted against dusty crushed rock and toasted oak.

title: Malibu Rocky Oaks 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A deep shade of pink, this bottling from Pinot Noir grapes shows very subtle red-fruit aromas on the nose. There is decent texture on the sip, but the flavors are muddled and slightly rusty.

title: Murphy-Goode 2014 Liar's Dice Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Brawny fruit is overwhelmed by smoke and charred oak in this thickly tannic wine that has a jammy core of blackberry and marshmallow flavor.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Chardonnay (California)
description: Pear, butter and vanilla aromas lead to a soft, rich texture and tasty fruit flavors. The wine is medium in weight, low in acidity and easy on the palate.

title: Old Soul 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is an easygoing, fruity wine that shows sweet-oak aromas, a soft texture and candy-like flavors of cherries and raspberries. The body is medium, tannins are light and it finishes with a sense of sweetness.

title: Raymond 2015 LVE Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This has a wealth of cherry cola flavor that brushes up against varietal black currant and cedar. It takes on a lush brawny ripeness that overwhelms and opts for fruit flavor over structure.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Battaglini Vineyard Ancient Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral and quite cherry-berry in fruity flavor, this wine has mild structure and generous tannin, with a midpalate bursting in earthy oak.

title: Balderdash 2014 Joyride Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Very extracted aromas of red currants and all spice show on the ripe nose of this bottling. Muddled plums and berries meet with spice cake on the rich palate.

title: Binz 2016 Oleta Vineyard Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: This big and rather tart wine has a green streak in the piney, woody aromas and flavors that accompany red-cherry and sour-cherry notes.

title: Briceland 2017 Spirit Canyon Vineyard Arneis (Mendocino County)
description: Rustic and hearty in style, this medium-bodied wine has earthy aromas, strong acidity and flavors like peach skin and grapefruit rind.

title: Carson Scott 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine has fresh fruit flavors and a fair share of vanilla and nutmeg from aging with oak. It feels smooth, medium bodied and soft in structure as little tannin comes through.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)
description: Boasting overripe aromas and flavors of raisins and dried cherries, this wine is full bodied and very broad.

title: Dutton Estate 2015 Karmen Isabella Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an austere, earthy and tannic red tangy in strawberry and dark cherry with a lingering taste of hazelnut and oak.

title: Bellante 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The dank aroma of forest undergrowth meets with campfire smoke and red currants on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is lightweight in body though lively with flavors of wild berries and pine forest spice, bolstered by solid acidity.

title: LangeTwins 2013 Miller Vineyard Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Big and beefy, this wine has huge aromas of wood smoke, beef jus and cedar followed by generous blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a firm tannic texture. Earthy roasted elements indicate it's fully mature now.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: There's a lot of stony earth and deep red-cherry fruit to the nose of this soft and rich bottling, with a pinch of dust as well. The palate is framed with decent tannins, showing dried berry, leather and herb flavors. Very down-the-middle wine, great for midweek dinners.

title: Lobo 2014 Wulff Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Stemmy earth and forest floor dominate on the nose of this funky wine, which offers sizable oak and a touch of leather. Big boned and concentrated, it finishes in black pepper and cardamom.

title: Côte West 2014 Krueger Lane Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This wine is 100% varietal and quietly balanced, edgy in structure and herbaceous undertones. The highlights lean into dried herb, crayon wax and pencil shavings.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2015 Hoffman Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Very showy and rich, this full-bodied wine smells like melted butter, caramel and meringue and tastes extremely buttery too. It has lots of sweet-oak influence, lemon and pineapple flavors and a syrupy finish.

title: Ferguson Crest 2014 Fergalicious Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Plump blueberry, hints of fresh violets and a flash of fig balsamic reduction sauce show on the nose of this blend by the pop star Fergie and her father. There is good energy to the sip and vivacious flavors, with high acid and rich dried black-fruit flavors that taste a tad sweet toward the finish.

title: Francis Coppola 2014 Kicker Cane Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Mushroom forest and dried herb give this wine an earthy character that pleasantly surrounds its thick extracted core of burly tannin and tobacco. Dense and chewy on opening, it softens in the glass.

title: Robert Mondavi 2016 Fumé Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 92% Sauvignon Blanc and 8% Sémillon, the two barrel-fermented for richness and layering. Lemongrass, wet stone and apricot mingle well together around supportive acidity that's bright and substantial. Creamy and lush, it finishes clean.

title: Seven Angels 2014 Chosen One Red (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated boysenberry syrup, baking spice, gingerbread and French toast aromas show on the nose of this blend of 42% Grenache, 42% Mourvèdre and 16% Syrah. Chalky tannins frame the sip, which offers concentrated blueberry, black cherry and vanilla spice.

title: Urban Legend 2015 Cooper Ranch Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: Superripe in flavor and lush in texture, this is a welcoming wine that tastes very fruity, feels mouth-filling and finishes with a touch of sweetness, partly due to its elevated ripeness level.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick oaky wine that shows plenty of toasted wood notes and herbal undertones. Juicy and broadly expansive on the palate, it's dense and rich in blackberry and jammy black-cherry flavors.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 One Oak Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a handsome full-bodied wine that's full of flavor and has the kind of bold, moderately tannic texture that goes great with big proteins. It shows lots of ripe blackberry and cherry aromas that continue on the palate.

title: Y Rousseau 2013 The Musketeer Alder Springs Vineyard Tannat (Mendocino)
description: This robust wine has salt-and-pepper and grilled beef aromas, strong smoky peppery flavors that wrap around a bright cherry core, and very firm tannins that give it a tight grip. So young and tannic that it needs time to show its stuff. Best after 2025.

title: Dancing Crow 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This light-bodied wine is quite dry and refreshing with lean fruit flavors and a good crisp texture. It's low in alcohol, too, and will be a crowd-pleaser, especially in hot weather.

title: Kunde 2014 Heritage Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Muted aromatics lead to soft, thick layers of rounded black cherry and blackberry, with moderate structure and ripeness in check. Vanilla and chocolate flavors contribute additional richness.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2015 L'Apiculteur Cedar Lane Vineyard Viognier (Arroyo Seco)
description: A tad reductive at first, this bottling shows dried lemon skins and pink grapefruit rinds, and slowly opens into a more floral experience. The palate offers warm white peach and guava notes, nicely restrained for the grape.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Lester Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Wet clay and moist earth are prominent aromas on the nose of this bottling, alongside brighter red-cherry tones. Cola and baking spice lift the hearty cooked cherries of the palate, and the acidity is powerful.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Victoria Denice Vineyard Carignane (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Woody spices of juniper and pine logs dominate the black-plum aromas on the nose of this bottling. There's peppery spice to the earthy palate, with roasted plums, charred meat and a hint of vanilla on the finish.

title: Morgan 2016 Highland Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very restrained on the nose, this bottling shows light aromas of honeysuckle, blanched almond and lemon rinds. There is good tension on the sip, where fresh and clean citrus and stone fruit flavors ride a steely texture.

title: Le Casque 2015 Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Raspberries, blackberries and black pepper harmonize in this full-bodied, firm-textured and quite concentrated wine. The spiciness of pepper and cardamom is fun to taste and blends well with the vivid bright fruit flavors.

title: MacRostie 2015 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy and slightly sulfurous in big oak, this full-bodied wine manages to grasp handfuls of bright acidity that persists through a wall of powerfully ripe tropical flavor. Aromas and aspects of citrus and white flowers contribute additional freshness.

title: Potek 2014 Demetria Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Damp funky herbs meet with boysenberry, dark cranberry, cinnamon and mace on the compelling, unique nose of this bottling. Juniper and fennel pollen spice up the tightly wound, dark-red fruits on the sip, where meaty hints of roasted game add to the complexity.

title: Pride Mountain 2016 Viognier (Sonoma County)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine fermented and aged in neutral French oak, the vines grown at 2,100-feet elevation. Viscous and floral, it's deliciously balanced, with well-defined layers of apricot, white pepper, honey and vanilla wafer.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2016 Gali Vineyard Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Raspberry syrup, crushed slate, damp forest floor, wet gravel and fresh hibiscus make for a pleasing nose on this single-vineyard expression. Rounded red fruit, carnation and moist soil flavors ride a gravelly structure on the palate.

title: Villa Creek 2013 Luna Matta Vineyard Mourvèdre-Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: This single vineyard selection of 70% Mourvèdre and 30% Syrah is very firmly structured, needing a bit more time to evolve. But all the promise of a great wine is there, starting with rocky aromas on the nose alongside blackberry jam and roasted black plums. The palate is thick with elderberry and black currant fruit, spiced with pepper, juniper and eucalyptus oil, and layered across strong sticky tannins. Drink 2019–2033.

title: August Briggs 2014 Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky barbecue and stewed plums give this wine a robust rustic edge that works within its larger context of complexity. Meaty, it's smooth and grippy, with lingering notes of tobacco leaf and cedar.

title: Bonny Doon 2015 Cigare Alternative F Red (Central Coast)
description: Reserved on the nose, this blend of 57% Grenache, 17% Cinsault, 16% Mourvèdre and 10% Syrah from five different vineyards shows light cherry juice, bay leaf, crushed rose petals and turned earth on the nose. It remains mellow on the palate, focusing on rocky earthy gravel-like flavors, as well as flashes of tart raspberry and white pepper, wrapped in an intriguing texture.

title: Crawford Family 2015 Walk Slow Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rich aromas of rhubarb, alpine strawberry, red rose petals and cinnamon spice show on the nose of this bottling. It's more tightly wound and quite dry on the sip, with fresh wild red-currant and mace flavors framed by a chalky backbone and solid acidity.

title: Galerie 2014 Pleinair Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Grainy and gritty in texture at first, this wine finds a smooth roundedness on the midpalate that follows it through the bright acidity and punches of red plum and cherry. Ultimately rich and full-bodied, it offers a touch of reduction on the finish that presents as complex and intriguing.

title: La Marea 2015 Brosseau Vineyard Grenache (Chalone)
description: Strong red fruit, smoke, pressed red flowers and iron show on the nose of this bottling from an appellation whose rugged, rocky setting is known for producing age-worthy wines. Though lighter in body, the palate is tremendously tannic and firm at this young age, so patience is required for the wood shavings, pepper spice and caramelized red-fruit elements to shine. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Longoria 2014 Fe Ciega Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated sarsaparilla, dark red cherry, wet loam, sagebrush and a slightly funk aromas show on the nose of this bottling from Rick Longoria's estate vineyard. That slightly sour funk quality extends to the sip as well, giving wild and rustic Old World nuance to dark berry, leather and crushed slate flavors.

title: Mirror 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Big-league power and tannins make this a very textural wine, almost chewy in the mouth and showing plenty of dark fruits, black pepper and cloves to fill it out. It will taste great now with a steak or chop but will show its best stuff after 2020.

title: Montemar Wines 2013 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in the glass, this single-vineyard bottling shows approachable red cherry, sweet sagebrush and slight caramelization on the nose. The rustic red-cherry flavors of the palate are lifted by white pepper and a pure bright acidity that's quite racy and exciting.

title: Publix 2016 Premium Limited Edition Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This value-driven white is robust and exuberant, with an exotic tropical nose. Serious oak wraps around fleshy, lengthy amounts of mango, pineapple and lemongrass, with a linger of Tahitian vanilla on the finish.

title: Smith-Madrone 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: This is a concentrated wine made with 8% Cabernet Franc and 7% Merlot within the blend, a restrained take on mountain-grown fruit and tannin. Cassis, red currant and cedar persist within a framework of tart acidity and balanced oak, the structure suggestive of further aging. Enjoy best 2024 through 2034.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: Concentrated in flavor and solidly built, this full-bodied wine offers lots of cherry and cinnamon notes wrapped in a firm texture of fine-grained tannins and mild acidity. The spicy oak accents of cinnamon, nutmeg and clove meld with the fruit for a great sense of layering and complexity.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 G-S-M (Livermore Valley)
description: Attractive earthy aromas and nicely rich fruit flavors shape this full bodied and well polished wine that is smooth on the palate but framed by moderate, appetizing tannins. One of many recent outstanding wines from the Wood Family.

title: Tank Garage 2016 Liquid Light Show White (California)
description: Grassy and floral aromas give a big initial impact to this medium-bodied wine and lead to flavors that have a little more ripeness and richness, like honeydew melon, Bosc pear and a touch of butter. Made from 75% old-vine French Colombard and 25% Sauvignon Blanc, it has a good foundattion of acidity to keep it lively on the palate and finish.

title: The Crusher 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Fully ripe and rich, this mouthfilling wine oozes black plum and clove aromas, vibrant black-cherry and coriander flavors and is bolstered by firm tannins and a full body. It's big, bold and complex at the same time.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2016 Heritage Vines Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 20% Petite Sirah and 1% Primitivo, this is a thick, dense wine that offers smoky char beneath rich, full-bodied red berries and softly integrated oak. The finish has touches of mocha and sweet tobacco.

title: Duckhorn 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Blended with 10% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot, this wine is from two estate vineyards, one of which contains some of the producer's oldest vines. It offers a hearty helping of thick, dense black fruit, spicy clove, bay leaf and leather, structured by powerful tannins.

title: Joullian 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Carmel Valley)
description: Aromas of ripe boysenberry and black cherry meet with sweet herbs and cocoa on the nose of this bottling. Berry flavors show on the palate alongside dried herbs, slightly sour plum skins and a touch of tobacco, all framed by tense tannins.

title: Kenwood 2015 Six Ridges Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy forest and pine meet a thistle of rose petal in this somewhat exotic full-bodied red made from multiple sites. Orange peel and strawberry define its fruitier components, alongside cola and a handful of toasted oak.

title: Larner 2014 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Opulent fruit tones of blackberry and black currant are sprinkled with toasty vanilla aromas on this Syrah, which is very approachable and user-friendly. Thyme and cracked pepper lift the dark berry flavors of the palate.

title: Le Casque 2017 Calotte White (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a friendly, rich and lightly oaked wine that coats the tongue with ripe pears, apples and vanilla. While the texture is smooth and lush, the wine has enough good acidity from its 58% Marsanne grapes to provide balance and freshness.

title: Château Souverain 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This wine is relatively big and broad for the variety, combining mineral and lanolin aromas with generous crisp apple and gooseberry flavors. Firm acidity keeps it lively and refreshing, and there is enough concentration for a lingering finish.

title: Folktale 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This bottling from a newer property at the entrance to Carmel Valley is very fresh on the nose with aromas of sweet honeysuckle, candied banana and a very prominent pineapple note. That pineapple persists powerfully on the palate, where it meets with citrusy acidity and a toasty oak touch.

title: Frostwatch 2015 Ophira Reserve Chardonnay (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a blend of the best barrel lots and is not made every year. For this vintage, it opens in floral gardenia and green olive, imparting spicy acidity and tart tastes of green apple, pear and peach. Bright on entry, it has an underling richness and depth of concentration that's fleshy and lush.

title: Hanna 2015 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Thick, oaky and dense in tannin, this is a highly ripe wine that finds its groove amidst a curtain of baked bread, compost and blackberry bramble. The richness is underlined in mocha chocolate and sweet tobacco.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Petit Verdot (Howell Mountain)
description: Earthy in compost and truffle, this is a concentrated exploration of a grape more often used for blending. A bright thread of acidity courses through its veins, helping to balance the bold ripeness and grippy tannic structure at its core.

title: Marimar Estate 2016 La Masía Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the estate's Don Miguel Vineyard in cool-climate Green Valley, this wine is floral on the nose, with a pronounced jasmine note. The palate is weighty in oak and tropical fruit tones, with fleshy richness of baked peach and apple pie.

title: Migration 2015 Running Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is from the producer's 70-acre estate vineyard and is the second vintage from it. It shows the appellation's classic mix of warm baking spice and velvety, smooth texture, with a robustness of red cherry. The finish is lush and rich in vanilla.

title: Muirwood 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Anjou pear, apple blossom, tangy lime skins and a wet cement aroma show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from a 40-year-old vineyard. It's zippy on the palate, with lime skin and petrol flavors.

title: Nottingham Cellars 2017 Micro-Lot Reserve Ghielmetti Vineyard BDX Blanc White (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is bold, full-bodied and balanced, combining the richness of 65% Sémillon with the citrus tang of 35% Sauvignon Blanc. Aromas of honey, vanilla and toast lead to ripe grapefruit and melon flavors and a texture that's creamy and mouth coating.
designation: Micro-Lot Reserve Ghielmetti Vineyard BDX Blanc

title: Omen 2016 Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a full bodied and rather complex wine that is nicely dry and moderately tannic. It has a medium to full body, generous black-plum aromas, touches of earth and oak, and well-concentrated blackberry flavors that linger on the finish.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Blended with 8% Merlot and 4% Petit Verdot, this is a full-bodied wine, no doubt, with inviting waves of dark cherry, cassis and milk chocolate. Well structured, it retains underlying acidity that helps balance out the ripeness and power of the fruit.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Reserve Claret (Sonoma County-Napa County)
description: This combines 56% Merlot with 44% Cabernet Sauvignon, the fruit from both counties. Aged entirely in French oak, it holds the oak well, offering lengthy tannins and powerfully concentrated black fruit, with accents of sage, dried herb and vanilla.

title: Quivira 2016 Fig Tree Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Pungent in grassy, herbal tones, this is lemony tart in key lime and stone fruit, with a sublime texture and straightforward freshly layered finish.

title: Ravenswood 2015 Big River Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine is densely packed in soft tannin, its thickness characterized by earthy leather, black pepper and clove. Soy and black licorice follow along for the ride, as the full-bodied richness takes hold on the palate.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: A showcase of great winemaking, this has fruit from both the Sonoma Coast and Russian River Valley appellations. Complex, structured and built with strong textural components, it boasts melded flavors of fresh strawberry, citrus and blueberry, as well as lingering notes of black tea and baking spice.

title: Black Stallion 2014 Transcendent Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a jammy wine with a lot of life. It's moderately structured and fruity in blackberry and cherry flavors. Cedar and dried herb tones add complexity to the expansive midpalate, which is sticky in tannin and oak. It will benefit from more time in the bottle; enjoy 2024–2030.

title: Massican 2017 Gemina White (California)
description: Wow, this is a beautiful wine. A blend of 77% Pinot Grigio from the Napa Valley's Chiles Valley and 23% Greco from Russian River Valley, winemaker Dan Petroski melds them both together into a floral and fresh explosion of vivid flavor. Tart apricot and peach meet freshly squeezed lemon as balanced acidity lingers masterfully on the finish.

title: Rusack 2015 Mt. Carmel Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extremely light yet lovely aromas of hibiscus, pomegranate, strawberry, wet slate and sagebrush show on the nose of this bottling from an iconic vineyard atop the appellation. The palate balances tannic weight with acidic energy, carrying flavors of white pepper, fresh thyme and fresh pomegranate and hibiscus, going down easy but with circumstance.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2017 Dutton Ranch Green Valley Vineyard Gewürztraminer (Green Valley)
description: This stainless steel-fermented wine is dry, fresh and delightful. Flavors of apricot and white peach tease the palate and are joined by grapefruit, wet stone and lime zest. The vibrant acidity lingers alongside tones of ginger and oyster shell on the finish.

title: Trefethen 2015 Family Owned Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Blended with small amounts of Petit Verdot, Malbec and Merlot, this is an impressive wine well worthy of the producer's 50th anniversary. Currant, boysenberry and light handfuls of spice are wrapped in soft, polished tannins that offer an elegant length.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 1910 Block Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This estate-grown block-designate is insanely good, soft and spicy in black and white pepper from first sip. Elongated, chalky tannins support bright, fresh acidity and strong, well-defined flavors of leather pouch, crushed rock and cherry. The texture is supple and complex.

title: Hertelendy 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A matchstick tone rules the nose of this tremendously powerful white, which evolves to show toasted oak and salty notes. The robust palate unravels in layers of Gravenstein apple, fig and crushed rock, with plenty of length on the nutmeg-laden finish.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Redwood Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark in color, this comes from a coastal and rugged Annapolis-area site. Dark cherry, blood orange and pomegranate flavors ride along a midpalate of dense, bold and layered concentration, finding life from ample acidity, wild spice and anise on the lengthy finish.

title: Groth 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Muted at first, this reserve wine shows a deft hand. A red currant tone is met by a mild grip of tannins and a soft midpalate that is lightly rich in coconut shavings and mocha. Supple and balanced in richness, it offers classic flavors of cassis and cherry wrapped in supportive oak.

title: Heitz 2012 Trailside Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From a certified-organic vineyard in Rutherford, this is a 100% varietal wine that impresses from start to finish, allowing room for a slight whiff of reduction and tar on the nose.
