Dark notions of coffee are interwoven between bright layers of cassis and red cherry around structured acidity and oak. Enjoy 2020–2028.

title: Sea Smoke 2015 Monopole Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The nose on this iconic bottling is tightly wound and reminiscent of springtime, with fresh lily, white melon, Meyer lemon pith and faint butter aromas. It's zesty and zippy on the palate with chalky flavors, showing Pink Lady apple flesh in the midpalate and a racy grapefruit acidity that carries into the finish.

title: The Withers Winery 2016 Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy mint, sage and lavender make for a heady, aromatic introduction to this wine, which continues to impress on the palate in its delicate layering of strawberry and fresh focused acidity. Balanced and light in style, it shows the nuanced greatness of the vintage as well.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2014 Sievers Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Chiles Valley)
description: From organically grown estate fruit, 100% varietal, this is a lovely wine, high-toned in acidity and impressively balanced all around. Elegant, polished tannins support dark brooding blackberry, black currant and coffee with a complex lingering note of black pepper and bittersweet chocolate on the finish.

title: Anaba 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a delightfully earthy, delicate wine, juicy in light waves of red cherry and pomegranate that are accented by notes of dried herb and cinnamon. The palate is expansively plush yet silky.

title: Grassini 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Full and soft on the nose, this lush bottling from one of the premiere estates in the region offers aromas of black cherry, caramelized blackberry and spice cake. Polished tannins and a vibrant acidity frame the palate, where lively red-fruit flavors are lifted by peppery spices. Though delicious now, this will last for years. Drink 2019–2029.

title: Inman Family 2017 Endless Crush OGV Estate Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Estate-vineyard designated, pressed like a white wine and aged on its lees in stainless steel, this wine is pale pink in color and deliciously textured, with a richly rewarding midpalate and plenty of balanced acidity. Fresh raspberry, strawberry and watermelon laced in mint all play a memorable role.
designation: Endless Crush OGV Estate Rosé of

title: Rusack 2015 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Pinot Noir (California)
description: The Rusack family's quest to grow grapes on Catalina Island continues with great success in this bottling, which is light in the glass and shows loads of sagebrush, forest spice, red cherry and grenadine on the inviting nose. The palate is exuberant with energy and deeply layered with flavors of juniper, rosewater, hibiscus and strawberry.

title: Venge 2015 Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Rich flavors of dark chocolate and blueberry cobbler give this wine an inviting taste of sunshine-filled Napa Valley fruit. Its tannins and oak are well integrated, with supportive acidity keeping the experience in check and mouthwateringly delicious through the close.

title: Beaulieu Vineyard 2014 Georges De Latour Private Reserve Estate Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This famous wine lives up to its name, showing tart cherry on entry, followed by a thick midpalate of sage, cedar and tobacco. Lightly spiced in white pepper and clove, it has an underlying elegance that needs time to overcome the youthful, grippy aspects of the tannins. Enjoy 2024–2029.
designation: Georges De Latour Private Reserve Estate Selection

title: Paradise Springs 2017 Pink Ash Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is one of the more exciting rosés of the year, and not just because actor Billy Zane used Thomas Fire ash in his label painting. Pale pink in color, the wine shows chalk and light nectarine on the nose before offering strawberry glacé, a hint of bubblegum, kumquat acidity and an extremely chalky texture on the palate. Proceeds go to fire's victims.

title: Starmont 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a beautifully made wine that is richly textured and expressive in dried herb, cedar and understated accompaniments of cherry and vanilla. Dry, integrated tannins round out the texture and provide structure.

title: Stewart 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Plummy strawberry, blueberry and a voluptuous undertaking of baking spice combine effortlessly and with a great depth of flavor in this juicy, lengthy wine, full-bodied but retentive of enough acidity to complement the robust fruit and body.

title: Davies 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a remarkable deal for the quality and the appellation—a winning study in dusty sage, pencil shavings and lean, well-integrated fruit. A small percentage of Malbec is added, the whole Old World in style and nature, with supple texture and lasting earth and cola spice.

title: Krupp Brothers 2014 Veraison Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: With 6% Malbec, this mighty, majestic wine offers crushed rock, graphite and sage on the nose, painting an inviting portrait of its mountain provenance. Richly structured and powerfully built, it exudes freshly picked black cherry and blueberry, finishing in a touch of black and white pepper.

title: Michael David 2015 Rapture Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: Smooth and fruity, this indulgent wine is a new luxury-level offering from one of Lodi's most adventurous winemakers. It drenches the palate with extraripe blackberry and blueberry fruit, alongside a polished, creamy texture that helps the flavors cling on the finish. It is a deeply colored, full-bodied and moderately tannic wine.

title: Magna Porcum 2017 Sus Volans Whole Cluster Rosé of Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Dark orange in color, this whole-cluster offering is juicy and delicious in fresh flavors of strawberry and blood orange. Tight, vibrant acidity keeps it exciting and focused, while a posh mouthfeel gives it context and complexity.
designation: Sus Volans Whole Cluster Rosé of

title: Robert John 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Not many of these magnums were made, the wine within 100% varietal and aged for 44 months in new French oak. Fruity with a floral nose, it's layered and tart in pomegranate, red currant and dried herb, showing big tannin weight and a hearty complexity. It has ages to go in the big bottle, too. Enjoy 2020–2030.

title: Stony Hill 2015 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)
description: Woody, expansive, gritty and grippy, this is an exotic, delicately layered wine from the historic producer, so good in its complexity and lightness of being. Bread and salted butter greet lemon zest and stone fruit along with a line of sophisticated acidity and stony mineral intrigue. This wine will do well in the cellar; enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Trefethen 2017 Family Owned Estate Grown Dry Riesling (Oak Knoll District)
description: Grown on the producer's Home Ranch, this offers flavors of juicy peach, stone and white flower, with the midpalate bringing tangy tones of Meyer lemon and grapefruit. Balanced through and through, it shows lushness on the finish.

title: Williams Selyem 2016 Terra De Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From one of the producer's coolest sourced sites, this sings in aromas of rose petal, earthy stone and tobacco. The palate brings tangy cranberry and raspberry flavors, with lingering tones of orange peel and clove. The tannins are substantial yet tamed.

title: Black Stallion 2014 Bucephalus Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 71% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Syrah, 8% Malbec and 7% Petit Verdot, aged more than two years in 100% new French oak. It's wonderfully layered, with hints of black pepper, leather and gamy meat. Big, bold and lush, it's enjoyable now in its power but will do well in the cellar. Enjoy 2024–2034.

title: Chappellet 2015 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is blended with a hearty 14% Petit Verdot and smaller additions of Merlot and Malbec. Together, they form a harmonious whole of soft, supple and densely packed flavor, characterized by red currant, earthy dried herb, plum and crayon that finishes in bold tannin and dark chocolate.

title: Croix 2015 Thomas Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Seductively perfumed, this is a thick, velvety wine with a grip of earthiness that never lets go. Cola, black cherry and a bolt of clove keep it inviting and complicated in the glass, yet ultimately pleasurable, soft and silky with a length of toasted oak on the finish.

title: Fallon Place 2016 Herbitage Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Earth, mushroom and a touch of reduction are savory complements to moderate structure and balanced ripeness in this pretty, expressive wine. Succulent cherry and strawberry dominate and provide welcome contrast.

title: Hudson Vineyards 2017 Estate Grown Aleatico (Carneros)
description: Made from a southern Italian grape grown in Carneros, this testifies to a happy new home. Vinified as a white wine, this is lightly orange in color and hearty in aromas of earth and flowers. Lively acidity supports a wealth of white peach, grapefruit and hazelnut, lightly ripe and easy to sip with abandon.

title: Janzen 2015 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Made entirely from Cabernet Sauvignon grown in this Yountville-area site, this is red-fruit forward, full bodied and expansive in waves of flavor and complexity. Compressed tannins round out the structure and powerful grip.

title: Beauregard 2014 Beauregard Ranch Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling by Ryan Beauregard shows loads of cinnamon, forest floor, candied pomegranate, thyme and sage on the nose. There is bountiful energy on the palate, which carries flavors of bay leaf, juniper and candied raspberry, framed by tense tannins.

title: Sanford 2014 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Though a bit older than most current Chardonnays, this bottling from the region's most historic vineyard hardly shows a hint of age. Aromas of lemon curd, lime zest and walnut are both fresh and warm on the nose. The palate is lively with Bosc pear flavors yet also leans rich, with sea salt caramel and a hint of butterscotch riding far into the finish.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Bright red fruit and acidity complement this wine's overall power and concentration, buoyed by supple tannin and quiet oak. Violet aromas give it additional complexity and elegance, a nice contrast to the black cherry and cassis.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2014 Curtis Vineyards Petit Verdot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Baked blueberry and black cherry meet with black licorice and fresh wisteria florality on the nose of this bottling. The tannic grip is apparent right away on the sip, and a bit strong, but it carries fresh and vibrant black-fruit flavors.

title: 786 Wines 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Good depth and concentration lift this medium-bodied and well-balanced wine well above the average. It has complex fruit flavors, light touches of vanilla and butter, and a velvety smooth texture supported by just enough acidity to keep it lively.

title: Avensole 2013 Aventura Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)
description: There's an intriguing blend of candied cherry and rosewater reduction on the nose of this bottling, which includes 5% Syrah, along with sweet bay leaf and fennel. Red currants and cranberries show on the sip, lifted by caramelized sage and pepper dust.

title: Bishop's Peak 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Grapefruit zest, freshly squeezed lime and a steely minerality show on the nose of this widely available wine made by the Talley family. The palate is tightly wound with more lime skins, but, with time, opens up into flavors of buttered sourdough, marmalade and brioche.

title: Bonterra 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Baking spices and ripe fruit come together to give this medium-bodied wine a big, friendly personality. It feels broad and smooth on the palate and the vanilla, nutmeg and butter notes are as generous in the flavors as in the aromas.

title: Hoopes 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Coombsville)
description: Oaky, oily and robust, this white is moderate in acidity, offering a focused line of stone fruit that's fleshy and ripe.

title: Cabana Wines 2014 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Like a home-baked apple pie without the sweetness, this light-bodied wine smells of sliced apples, nutmeg and cinnamon and tastes fruity and lightly spicy. The texture is very smooth and gentle, too.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Soft and elegant on the nose, this bottling presents rounded violets, plump blackberries, broken asphalt and dried dill on the nose. The palate is plush with blueberry and lilac flavors that ride chiseled tannins and benefit from peppercorn and marjoram spices. It is complex and flavorful.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Blend 33 White (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 38% Roussanne, 31% Marsanne and 31% Viognier is a Rhône-style white for Chardonnay lovers, starting with an intriguingly buttery and toast-filled nose that's cut with aromas of squeezed lemon. The palate is bolstered by a citrusy acidity and decent textural grip, finishing on melted butter.

title: Friedeman 2015 Dichotomy Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a selection of clones and vineyard sites, this affordable varietal wine offers forest pine, cardamom and pomegranate, the fruit elusive within its more savory nature.

title: Gracianna 2015 Westside Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from Bacigalupi Vineyard fruit, which is located on Westside Road, this wine offers a generous bouquet and outlay of dark cherry, baked vanilla, toasted oak and forest notes, its heart savory and tart in additional characteristics of clove, cranberry and pomegranate.

title: Hungry Hawk 2015 Cabernet Franc (San Diego County)
description: Quite light in the glass, this Loire-like bottling shows great promise from San Diego County, with very fresh aromas of cranberry, white pepper and green herbs on the nose. Tart yet candied pomegranate fruit shows on the sip, where that peppery character continues, blending crushed thyme and peppercorn with a touch of caramelized herbs on the finish.

title: Shooting Star 2015 Merlot (Lake County)
description: A deep color and potent aromas of blackberry and black currant are the first impressions from this full-bodied, firmly structured and well concentrated wine. They lead to a palate full of deep blackberry flavors, a nicely dry balance and mouth-filling texture.

title: Ledson 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Hugely concentrated in big blackberry and currant fruit, this wine also offers mountainous tannin weight and grip. Pencil shavings, bitter leather and tobacco and a sizable imprint of savory oak demand attention in the glass.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2013 Estate Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From equal parts Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, as well as 32% Malbec, this is a slightly reduced expression of earthy black tea, black currant, toasted oak and sizable tannin. Full bodied, it shows the concentration and density of the vintage.

title: Carmel Road 2014 Drew's Blend Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Bright but wild on the nose, this bottling, which is overseen by actress Drew Barrymore, shows raspberry, thyme, sagebrush, rhubarb and smoke aromas on the inviting nose. The palate offers light berry flavors alongside hickory smoke, proving refreshing if not too complex.

title: Carmel Road 2014 First Row Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Dried red currants and cranberries meet with loamy soils on the nose of this block-designate bottling. Tangy red fruits and a hint of olive show on the palate, where the earthy minerality shines through the energetic acidity.

title: Ancien 2015 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Candied cherry dominates in this densely concentrated wine, its tannins pronounced. Rose petal aromatics contribute a savory underbrush added to by forest, black tea and cardamom characteristics, as lasting acidity provides freshness.

title: AuburnJames 2013 Cabernet Franc (North Coast)
description: Very ripe fruit aromas, a touch of volatility and a bold powerful set of flavors make this full-bodied wine dramatic to taste. It has a firm structure, too, based on good acidity and a considerable layer of fine-grained tannins that easily support all the black cherry and pomegranate flavors.

title: Ballentine 2015 Pocai Vineyard Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Calistoga)
description: This nearly 100% varietal wine, with a tiny smattering of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot, is given plenty of time in new oak, a distinction that's noted on the palate. Smoky char and meaty bacon are prominently displayed, as black cherry and blackberry mix along a brawny landscape of ripeness and full body.

title: Paul Dolan 2016 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Easy and fruity, this effusive wine is packed with cherry and blackberry flavors, has a smooth, lightly tannic texture and subtle oak spices to add some extra interest. It's dry, full bodied but quaffable.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: Herbal and perfumed, this is a tannic, grippy and complex red, sourced from throughout the county. Peppercorn, cedar and chocolate-covered berries define the pleasant array of flavors.

title: Sketchbook 2016 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Apple-skin aromas, lively fruit flavors and an almost chewy texture give a lot of presence to this medium-bodied wine. It has good structure, an appetizing mouthfeel and pleasant apple and lemon notes.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Vittorio's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Soft and supple, this is a sound offering of deep dark-chocolate-mocha flavors and rich layers of baked plum and dark cherry.

title: Waxwing 2016 Flocchini Vineyard Syrah (Petaluma Gap)
description: This wine from a relatively cool-climate area is thickly concentrated and dense in a black fruit tone. Tobacco and leather wrap around flavors of burly blackberry, smoke and strawberry fruit leather.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Uncaged Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Soft lemon pith, light butter and a hint of marshmallow show on the nose of this bottling by the rock 'n' roll star Zac Brown. There is good grip at the tip of the sip and then lemon-lime sorbet flavors, which are pleasant if not overly complex.

title: Zinke 2016 White Hawk Vineyard Viognier (Santa Barbara County)
description: There is a great deal of restraint leveled across this bottling, starting with the tightly wound nose of apple and pear. Similar flavors play into the palate, but the sip is all about racy acidity and chalky texture.

title: B Side 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This wine is carried by baking spice and black cherry aromas. The full-bodied palate brings bright berry and cherry flavors and a good layer of fine-grained tannins that complement the firm acidity.

title: Byron Blatty 2017 Rosé (Los Angeles County)
description: White peach, bubblegum and watermelon make for a fruity yet not overripe nose on this bottling of Grenache. The palate shows red apple, Rainier cherry and wet gravel flavors, making for a refreshing, zesty flavor profile.

title: Caliza 2015 End of the Day Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry and a hint of nutmeg show on the ripe and accessible nose of this red blend that's affordably priced to be an everyday drinker. Intriguing if slightly muddled chaparral flavors of fennel and juniper meet with plum sauce and cherry syrup on the palate, which is wrapped in a chalky texture.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Mature and mellow in taste, this full-bodied wine has a relatively light color, aromas like leather and black tea, and flavors like dried cherries and tamarind. It's an individualistic drink and a good escape from the often sweet and overripe school of Zinfandel.

title: Cline 2016 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: An interesting mineral aroma lends a distinct profile to this otherwise full-bodied, dry and moderately tannic wine. It has a good palate-cleansing grip, plus raspberry and mineral flavors and a tangy finish.

title: Elyse 2015 Korte Ranch Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Blackberry crumble is the star of the show in this expansive fruit-forward red, blended with 11% Petite Sirah, Carignan, Valdiguié and Grand Noir. Aged in American oak, it presents a strong presence of vanilla that finishes sweet.

title: Ferguson Crest 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dried thyme, sage and oregano meet with toasted wood, black currant and pencil shavings on the somewhat shy nose of this bottling. The flavors are nuanced with rounded plum and herb flavors, proving smooth although subtle.

title: Frostwatch 2014 Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a thick, rich and hearty version of the variety, powerful in baked notions of strawberry pie. An earthy, herbal component gives it life and complexity with lasting structure and sprinklings of cardamom spice.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2017 Soul Mate Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Steely aromas of strawberry and red apple show on the nose of this bottling. It's very tight on the palate, with a grippy, tense structure that allows gunmetal and light red-fruit flavors to slowly emerge.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2017 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: Plush peach aromas are hidden behind an impressive wall of wet concrete minerality on the nose of this pink wine. The stony qualities also show on the sip, where rainy sidewalk flavors mix with a touch of watermelon.

title: Longboard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Strong grassy, herbal, piney aromas and flavors light up this medium-bodied wine. It has lively acidity, plenty of personality and good balance, so it fills the bill very nicely.

title: Per Caso 2013 Touriga Nacional (Adelaida District)
description: This bottling from Glenrose Vineyard offers aromas of roasted berry, coffee candy and black peppercorns on the nose. The palate is leathery with dried berry and prune-sauce flavors, with a pinch of vanilla spice.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Barrel Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a tightly wound, extracted barrel selection made entirely varietal. Full-bodied dense layers of dark chocolate complement brighter notions of black cherry and cassis.

title: Schramsberg 2009 J. Schram Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Enticing aromas of toasted almond and pear tart lead to an equally seductive and complex palate that is dry but rich in feel. It has the complexity and layering of a wine aged a long time on the yeast, and shows excellent concentration that leads to a long, lingering finish. This is Schramsberg's top-of-the-line Chardonnay-based wine and it definitely lives up to its billing in this vintage. Best after 2023.

title: Larkmead 2015 Solari Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and packed in flavor and body. Low yields make for a densely rich and concentrated experience on the palate—an intense, slightly reduced tangle of chocolate, caramel and dusty compressed black fruit. Earthy, it flaunts crushed rock, gravel and graphite elements, with a streak of fresh acidity on the finish. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Corison 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This understated, elegant study in the variety opens in beguiling aromas of floral rose before opening into a finely made, structured and gracefully constructed wine that's fully in balance. Leather, black cherry and dark chocolate highlight a midpalate of finely polished, tamed tannin and integrated oak. This is delightfully enjoyable now, but can stand up to aging; enjoy best 2020–2030.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 Ascent Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Smoky, earthy anise and dark-chocolate aromas give way to concentrated and layered black-plum, clove and blackberry flavors as this full-bodied wine expands on the palate. Its texture is richly tannic and the mouthfeel is generous, prolonging the lush flavors on the finish. A perennial standout, this wine has proven it can age well. Best after 2025.

title: Roar 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Deep aromas of candied black cherries, ginger snaps, star anise and iron-laced soils are rich and inviting on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Boisterous, energetic flavors of red fruit meet with cinnamon, annatto and, on the finish, the buzz of Sichuan peppercorn. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Schramsberg 2009 Reserve Sparkling (North Coast)
description: Distinctive aromas of toasted nut and wood-smoke give this full-bodied wine an exotic start, while baked apple, browned walnut and crisp cherry flavors continue the theme. Made from 82% Pinot Noir and 18% Chardonnay, it offers layers of spice, smoke and mild, savory mushroom and tea flavors, surrounded by a plush, creamy texture and light acidity to keep it fresh. Best after 2023.

title: Brooks Note 2015 Pinot Noir (Marin County)
description: This enticing wine has aromas of black cherries, rose petals and black tea followed by blackberry, rhubarb, clove and cedar flavors that mingle on the palate. A very firm texture of moderate tannins and good fruit acidity keeps it lively in terms of mouthfeel, and the concentration carries through a lingering finish. Best now–2025.

title: Corison 2015 Sunbasket Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Made from a site planted in the 1950s by the grand wine wizard André Tchelistcheff, this wine is remarkable in its gravelly mineral character and well-managed tannin profile. Soft supple texture is complemented by focused layers of savory red fruit and lifted acidity. Enjoyable now, it has structure to age. Enjoy best 2020–2030.

title: Laurel Glen 2008 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Mountain)
description: A library selection of the last vintage made by founder Patrick Campbell from bud break to bottle, this shows the prowess and longevity of the vineyard, a resplendent celebration of leathery black pepper, black cherry and mocha. The secondary characteristics are coming into their own, with a lovely high-wire tension of acidity and freshness just beginning to fade. Drink soon.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2016 The Golden Road Monastrell (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This bottling, which is now known to be Graciano, is very deep in color and shows hearty black plum, purple flower and smoked meat on the focused nose. It's thick on the palate, loaded with vanilla, shaved chocolate, charred beef and wild dark berry, presented atop chalky tannins that are firm yet enveloping.

title: Wayfarer 2016 Wayfarer Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This estate-grown beauty is succulent and supple, with a tense body of bright wild strawberry, crushed rock, dried lavender and Asian spice. Robustly rich and deeply layered in flavor and texture, it finishes in a gorgeous dabble of white pepper.

title: Arista 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A compelling combination of well-integrated oak spices and forward, opulent fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine almost irresistible. It has a smooth texture, layered and concentrated notes of cinnamon, nutmeg, new leather, wood smoke, cooked cherries and ripe plums supported by moderate tannins and good fruit acidity.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Angel Camp Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A wonderful perfume of cinnamon, black cherries and violets starts this full-bodied wine on a great note, and it follows with rich, ripe and complex fruit and spice flavors. The mouthfeel is generous and broad yet light in tannins, bringing the abundance of flavors into a lingering finish.
designation: Year of the Ram Angel Camp Single Vineyard

title: Joseph Jewell 2016 Eel River Valley Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: Charming fruit flavors and great structure come together in this very appealing, well-balanced and concentrated wine. The aroma bursts with red cherry, black cherry and black currants while the flavors add nuances of rhubarb, mild spices and black tea for a complex, delicious effect overall. The wine is full bodied and well scaffolded by moderate tannins and fresh-tasting acidity. Best after 2022.

title: Paradigm 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Silky, structured and subdued, this wine shines in black pepper, leather and tobacco, with a dash of underlying dark chocolate. More savory than fruit forward, it has lively acidity and integrated oak and plenty of structure for aging. Enjoy best 2020 through 2023.

title: The Debate 2014 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This wine offers incredible aromatics, built around complex twists of cedar and sage. The velvety midpalate speaks to undulating waves of red licorice and cherry-berry, in full embrace of ripe rich fruit and quiet structure. Full bodied and powerfully built, it should do well with cellaring; enjoy best 2024–2029.

title: Larkmead 2015 Dr. Olmo Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is fresh and inviting in its nose of exotic spice and blackberry bramble. A dusty texture of soft supple tannin is interwoven effortlessly in dark chocolate, caramel, violet and crushed rock. This wine is structured to age but also well worth enjoying now.

title: Larkmead 2015 The Lark Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Winemaker Dan Petroski coaxed small yields to make this 100% varietal wine from a warm drought-year vintage marked by concentration and scarcity. Densely spicy, leathery and tobacco-laden, with quiet, dusty black fruit, this structured red is abundant in cocoa powder and crushed rock elements. This wine is worth cellaring; enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Schramsberg 2001 Reserve Late Disgorged Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This complex and mature wine shows how interesting and layered a fine sparkling wine can become with time. It was aged on the yeast lees for the extremely long period of 16 years before disgorging. Honey, butterscotch and grilled baguette aromas give way to rich mellow fruit and spice flavors and a creamy, mouth-filling texture livened by fine bubbles and mild acidity.

title: Sunshine Valley Vineyards 2015 Jubilee Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 10% Merlot, 4% Cabernet Franc and 2% Malbec by winemaker Jean Hoefliger, this wine opens in a reductive whir of sticky tannin, red berry and cassis before finding a treasure trove of hidden clove and black pepper. Structured and fulsome, it's lengthy and complex, with complexity to spare. Enjoy now or in time; best 2025–2030.

title: Rutherford Hill 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a juicy straightforward red, hearty in tannin and blackberry and black-cherry fruit. Dusty in texture, it has accents of bark, clove, dark chocolate and toasted oak.

title: Storm 2015 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The exploration of underripe tones must have some limit, and Ernst Storm pushes that line in this bottling, which starts with pickled tomato, brined olives, vinegar-soaked peppercorns, under-ripe boysenberry and dust on the nose. The pickled aspect carries to the palate, where the tomato-like acidity is fascinating, and yet may prove a bit too weird for the mainstream.

title: Tin Barn 2014 Pickberry Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Blended with 17% Merlot, this wine is earthy in compost, black tea and mushroom, the fruit marked by black cherry, with big rustic tannins giving the flavors pause. Richly full bodied, it features smoky barrel oak and a lasting trace of tobacco.

title: Robert Renzoni 2016 Barile Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: There's a strong, slightly bitter walnut quality to the nose of this bottling, along with toasted oak, lemon zest and cream. That nutty note carries to the sip as well, where the oak is quite prominent but well integrated, giving warm toast flavors that are cut by lemon-peel acidity. A strong potential for South Coast Chardonnay shows.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Riserva Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied sweet-tasting wine boasts a bonanza of fruit flavors, all very ripe and jammy and mouthfilling, while the texture is rich and high in alcohol, and the tannins are very light.

title: Sojourn 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a big-shouldered wine on the entry, a full-bodied and fleshy experience of concentrated, tropical mango and pineapple flavor that pleases the palate without any overt fussiness.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 wZT Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 59% Zinfandel and 41% Tannat shows tangy red-fruit aromas of wild berries and grenadine as well as rustic herbs in the background. There's a fennel spice background to the sip, where red-fruit flavors show strongly. This is a good midweek wine for pizza and burgers.

title: Bellante 2016 Jack McGinley Vineyard Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Strong honeydew aromas meet with plumeria and cold steel on the nose of this single-vineyard expression by a small family winery that's been producing since 2000. The rounded soft palate shows white-peach and poached-pear flavors.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a nicely balanced silky-textured wine that's medium bodied and infused with ripe plum and raspberry flavors accented by light herb and spices. It has more staying power on the finish than its relative lightness suggests.

title: Gamble Family Vineyards 2014 Paramount Red (Napa Valley)
description: Equal parts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc make up the heart of this wine, with 28% Merlot and 8% Petit Verdot. Boldly succulent, robust and full bodied, it has an earthiness that's part wood, part cedar, with big pronounced tannins seasoned in clove and pencil.

title: Le Casque 2015 Grenache (Sierra Foothills)
description: Quite smooth in texture and rather mild in flavor, this wine has a rich mouthfeel, tasty elements of black pepper and cranberry and just enough tannin for a little grip on the finish.

title: Mignanelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Crushed gravel, tight cranberry and lots of turned earth show on the nose of this appellation blend. The flavors are relatively light on the palate, with tart cranberry and white pepper riding waves of acidic energy.

title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2014 Redemption Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Smoothly textured and offering surprisingly lively acidity, this robust, intensely ripe red is brooding in dark berry, cola and chocolate flavor, the whole aged just over a year in American oak. The oak adds a sweetness of vanilla.

title: Beckon 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: A rather stunning deal for the price, this bottling shows creamy lemon, lime blossom and a hint of hazelnut, set against a chalky backbone. The palate shows a flash of sweetness then tightens around a steely core, offering orange skin tang, zingy lime rind and slightly richer hints of cashew cream.

title: Big Six 2015 Whiskey Bourbon Barrel Zinfandel (California)
description: This chewy-textured wine has a high level of oak flavor that registers as a sweet-seeming enticing spiciness. Aromas of vanilla and cedar lead to maple syrup, wood smoke and nutmeg flavors that blanket the ripe fruit flavors underneath.

title: Carpe Diem 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an affordable wine that is easy to enjoy. Dried herb, clove and graphite tones provide a savory edge, as rounded tannins provide a softness to the texture. Strawberry, cassis and red currant give it additional fruity brightness.

title: Contour 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This bottling, which blends 36% Mendocino County, 34% Monterey County and 30% San Luis Obispo County fruit, shows grenadine, dark cherry, pepper and mulberry on the very intriguing nose. Cooked black plums, Earl Grey tea and rosewater show on the sip.

title: Karah Estate 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dark in color and robust on the palate, this wine is earthy, offering dusty cranberry and orange flavors. A meaty fleshy texture remains refreshing and varietal.

title: Labyrinth 2014 Martian Ranch Vineyard Tempranillo (Santa Barbara County)
description: Plump boysenberry aromas meet with tanned leather, toasted thyme and a bit of burnt caramel on the nose of this bottling from a biodynamic vineyard near Los Alamos. It's juicy and fruit-forward on the palate, with searing acidity and a grippy, leathery texture, showing lots of rustic earth tones and herbal spices. Needs time to develop.

title: Lawer 2014 Hillside Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, with a hearty dose of oak, this is a big-boned, tannic and textured wine, blended with 1% Syrah. Blackberry, black currant and clove play nicely with each other, blending on the palate with ease.

title: Parker 2015 Roblar Vineyard Rosé of Mourvèdre (Santa Barbara County)
description: A slightly yellow-orange shade of pink, this wine is oxidizing quickly, showing aromas of toasted nuts and dried apples. The palate also offers nutty qualities of cashew and marzipan, with dried orange ring as well.

title: Tortoise Creek 2015 The Revivalist Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine smells like brown sugar and carries lots of jammy fruit flavors. Moderate tannins give it some structure.

title: Woodbridge by Robert Mondavi 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied value-priced wine has relatively light herb and veggie accents as well as modest raspberry and plum flavors. It is quite smooth and soft in texture.

title: Benziger 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Muted and tannic, this wine is simple and lean on the midpalate, with flavors of red and black currant and yeasty bread.

title: Callaway 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried red cherries and blueberries meet with peppercorn and oregano on the nose of this wine. The flavors are oddly tangy and tart, with cherry, blackberry, pine and juniper, enhanced by a bit of earthy crushed gravel.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: Soft-textured and relatively full-bodied, this wine smells peachy, tastes ripe and lush and has little noticeable acidity.

title: California Square 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of candied red cherry and kirsch meet with cigar box, peppercorns and jalapeño on the nose of this wine. Lots of mud and clay palate, as do dark cranberry, sour cherries, herbs and a touch of vanilla on the finish.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Merlot (California)
description: This light-bodied wine smells like candied fruit, and tastes fresh of raspberries and strawberries that meet a soft texture.

title: Casaeda 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh and fruity, this wine is somewhat spritzy and tart, with a taste of huckleberry and cola.

title: St. Francis 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Simply constructed and structured, this affordable red is approachable and easygoing, offering flavors of black cherry, pencil shavings and sage, with a dustiness to its rich full-bodied texture.

title: Sutro 2014 Warnecke Ranch Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This involves 25% Cabernet Sauvignon—the two varieties combining for a muted dusty texture of broad-shouldered richness and brawn. Plum, tobacco and chocolate all play a part.

title: Girard 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine is simple and slightly sweet in perception, with heavy flavors of melon, hazelnut and almond paste.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards NV Muscat Canelli (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Somewhat sherry-like on the nose, this bottling offer honey, dried banana and plumeria aromas. There are flavors of honeydew, tuberose and dried lemon rinds on the sip, which prove interesting albeit obscure.

title: Kenwood 2016 Six Ridges Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: This fully ripe, robust white shows a mix of briny olive, green peas and peach and is concentrated in richness that becomes slightly cloying.

title: Jessie's Grove 2016 Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: This wine is unusually light in color and shows earthy spicy aromas that lead to mild oaky flavors but very little fruit on the palate. It's an off-beat style of wine that nonetheless is dry and appetizing.

title: Sola 2013 Meritage (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine tastes green and slightly astringent, with oppressive tannins that distract from the hearty red and black fruit.

title: Suveg 2014 Sangiovese (Lodi)
description: Quite tannic and acidic, too, this wine smells chocolaty, tastes like tart strawberries and feels chunky and astringent on the palate. It needs something rich, like lasagna, for a good pairing.

title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2013 Simpatico Ranch Pinot Noir (Bennett Valley)
description: The aromas of this wine seem sweetly caramelized and overripe, a somewhat off-putting experience around a medium-bodied build.

title: It Is What It Is! NV Sweet Rosé (Lodi)
description: This is a sweet and full-bodied wine with a vivid pink color, lush texture and flavors like cotton candy.

title: River Road 2016 Mills Cuvée Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: This wine is somewhat harsh and lacking in fruit. It is citrus-heavy, with only a slight hint of fig.

title: Carlisle 2016 Steiner Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Nutty and dense on the nose and entry, this wine finds its rhythm with ease, showing a depth of grainy texture and focused flavors of citrus-fresh tangerine and Meyer lemon. It shows structure to age gracefully but is nearly impossible not to enjoy now.

title: Cedarville 2015 The Rules of Fair Play Red (Fair Play)
description: An enticing toasty spicy oak aroma leads to good, ripe blackberry and black-cherry flavors that are layered and concentrated. This full-bodied wine is made from 62% Zinfandel and 38% Petite Sirah. It shows a lot of oak character but does it well and backs it up with ample rich fruit notes and a moderately tannic texture.

title: Côte West 2017 Gianquinto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a light-bodied, refreshing white, succulent and fruity in pear, apple and fuzzy peach. A thread of minerality plays out as wet stone and lemon peel.

title: Croma Vera 2016 Revelación Red (Paso Robles)
description: This compelling blend of Tempranillo, Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah starts off somewhat light on the nose before deep blueberry aromas lead into sweet smoke, loamy earth and caramel-laced coffee aromas. The palate is quite ripe with black-currant fruit as well as a touch of leather.

title: Hearst Ranch 2016 Three Sisters Cuvée Red (Paso Robles)
description: Red plum, spice cake and flower petals make for a light, elegant nose in this blend. The palate shows tart cranberry, rosewater and sumac flavors, with the slightest hint of game, framed by rather light tannins.

title: Koehler 2015 Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Black-raspberry lollipop aromas are lifted by oak, bay leaf and thyme on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied than most Syrahs, offering white-pepper, dark-red-fruit and dried chaparral herb flavors, proving quite easy to enjoy.

title: Lichen Estate 2014 Blanc de Noir Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Very fruity, fresh and lively, this well-balanced and delicious wine has soothing bubbles and vivid citrus and apple flavors accented by floral and pistachio notes.

title: Siduri 2016 Lingenfelder Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Demure on the nose, this wine is intense in tannin and oak, the rich red cherry fruit marked by earthy spice, forest pine and sizzling acidity.

title: Siduri 2016 Saralee's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Strawberry, rhubarb and forest floor mix well in this intensely big-boned, thickly tannic wine. Asian spice seasons the ripe ribald fruit.

title: Skinner 2016 Smithereens Red (El Dorado)
description: Exotic and intensely fruity aromas lead to equally vivid fruit flavors that are well matched by moderate tannins and good acidity. Black plum and macerated cherry join hints of cedar and clove for a complex and satisfying flavor profile.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 L'Autre Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine is very fruity but also bolstered by darker flavors and firm tannins that bring balance and a good mouthfeel. An almost jammy cherry and strawberry flavor is complemented by light baking-spice notes and a touch of black pepper. Winemaker Bill Easton blended 79% Grenache with Mourvèdre and Syrah.

title: V. Vineyards 2014 Audace Ruby Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine blends within a hearty helping of Merlot (13%) and Cabernet Franc (10%). Together, they offer pencil shavings, soy and earthy sage in character, the tannins sizably built and fully wrapped around rich layers of baked plum and black cherry.

title: Velvet Bee 2014 Rita's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean aromas of citrus-laced crème brûlée and creamy white peach make for an inviting entry to the nose of this bottling from a vineyard high atop the appellation. Those elements tighten on the palate to focus more on lime zest before the richer vanilla and peach-custard flavors lead into a caramelized finish.

title: Zotovich 2016 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a great entry-level wine, starting with aromas of lemongrass, Asian pear, pomelo pith, chalk and a slight hint of butter. There is strong tactile energy on the sip, which grabs hold of the palate with a lime pith edge then settles into creamier lemon-balm flavors.

title: Allegretto 2013 Ayres Family Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Made in conjunction with the top luxury property in Paso Robles, this slightly aged bottling offers chocolaty vanilla-laced and caramel-kissed aromas on the nose, set against the dried blackberry and clove scents. It's thick on the palate, sliding from alpine strawberry flavors into espresso, framed by sandy tannins.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2017 Paso Ono Vineyard Albariño (Paso Robles)
description: Zesty aromas of lime give an edge to the warmer tones of poached pear and peach on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with a lemon sorbet and tangerine-rind kick before tasting much like orange juice, with a flash of hazelnut on the finish.

title: Epiphany 2015 Hampton Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Deep and hearty aromas of blackberry, cherry wood and bacon show on the nose of this bottling. Dark berry, roasted pork and violet-flower flavors show on the palate, hitting all the classic Syrah notes.

title: Epiphany 2016 Rodney's Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Meyer lemon pith and tangy grapefruit flesh make for a tart and crisp entry to the nose of this wine. The palate is also tangy with lemon peels and apple skins, all wrapped in a chalky texture.

title: Fess Parker 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a steal for under $20, offering aromas of apple flesh, ripe pear, brioche and yellow grapefruit on the nose. The palate is crisp with citrus yet broad with fresh Gravenstein and Gala apple flavors.

title: Jax 2016 Y3 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This value-driven wine is juicy up front in dark cherry cola flavors complemented by orange-peel-laden acidity. Its structure is moderate and approachably round.

title: PRIE Vineyards and Winery 2016 Mokelumne Glen Vineyards Dornfelder (Lodi)
description: Don't miss a chance to taste a Dornfelder from California. This intensely concentrated and fruity but not tannic wine has a deep dark ruby color and aromas like blueberries and dark chocolate. Flavors of blackberries and raspberries join in on the palate, and the texture is velvety and lively.

title: Red Car 2014 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This wine is silky smooth and resplendent in rose-petal aromas. On the lightly crafted palate of restrained ripeness, it reveals deft characteristics of orange zest, pomegranate and red cherry amid a grippy texture and quiet finish.

title: Urban Legend 2014 Cooper Ranch Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: An elegant and supple example of the varietal, this wine blends ripe, seductive fruit aromas and flavors with a sleek texture and silky mouthfeel. Moderate tannins melt into the black cherry and blackberry notes for a nice sense of depth and a lingering finish, too.

title: Vie Winery 2013 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: Cofermented with 3% Viognier, this red is lovely and floral in red cherry and blueberry, the fruit richly concentrated and approachable. Lovely accents of white pepper and dried herb add to a tease of black olive that's entirely rewarding.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Estrella River Clone Petris Vineyard Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine from one clone, made in tiny amounts with indigenous yeast fermentation. Exotic and inviting, it offers robust berry, citrus and leather, with a biting quality of tannin that eases into a concentration of velvety texture.

title: Volatus 2014 Topgun Cuvée Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Broad aromas of black plum, cherry, sweet cedar and a touch of smoke show on the nose of this blend of 38% Petit Verdot, 36% Malbec and 26% Cabernet Sauvignon. The palate is framed by layered tannins that provide structure but don't get in the way, allowing ripe flavors of boysenberry to mesh with peppery spices and crushed gravel.

title: B Cellars 2015 Star Vineyard Chardonnay (Rutherford)
description: For fans of a bigger voluptuous style, this wine delivers a lush layered combination of honeycomb and crème brûlée. Dark in color, the oak is pronounced and supportive, while the structure is moderate, opting for velvety texture and rich ripe fruit.

title: Fenestra 2016 Semillon (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine shows a classic, generous style with the waxy aromas and rich texture typical of the grape variety. Melon, walnut and lemon zest flavors make it interesting to sip, and the mouthfeel is broad and inviting.

title: Alyris 2014 The Audition Take 1 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine grown on Mount George at the southern end of the valley. Cave-aged nearly two years in all French oak, it's tightly wound and intensely ripe, a bold, boisterous offering of black cherry, black pepper, clove and lasting oak. Let it open in the glass.

title: La Marea 2017 Kristy Vineyard Albariño (Monterey County)
description: Crisp and juicy aromas of squeezed Meyer lemon, white peach, honeydew rind and rainy sidewalk show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. There is great grip to the palate as well as a light texture, but the flavors are generous with more stone fruit and melon, making it rounded and likable for many tastes.

title: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Merlot (El Dorado)
description: Extra richness and depth lift this wine to a high level of quality and deliciousness. Its ripe blueberry, blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors seem layered and generous, and it fills the palate with fine-grained tannins and a full body.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: This wine is dense with rounded and deep blackberry at its core. The palate is framed by strong tannins but also bright acidity, which carry forth energetic well-integrated flavors of bursting berry fruit and dark spice.

title: Morgan 2016 Double L Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon cream, peach and mango show on the nose of this top-tier bottling from the historic regional producer. The flavors are light and bright, with lemon juice and apple flesh, though the wine feels a bit more reserved in this vintage.

title: Noceto 2014 Riserva Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: The purity of fruit flavor in this medium-bodied wine is compelling to taste, and shines through in a focused way uncomplicated by noticeable oakiness. The wine is elegant, sleek in texture and redolent of red cherries all the way through a lingering finish.

title: Parker 2015 Los Alamos Valley Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: From Cat Canyon vineyard and aged in neutral French oak, this bottling is tightly wound on the nose, with restrained aromas of white peach, nectarine, pineapple and lemon rind. There's a touch of almond paste to the sip, then come fresh lemon wedges and buttered nuts in the finish.

title: Portola Vineyards 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Sandalwood, black cherry, mulberry jam and campfire smoke show on the nose of this wine that's sourced from the Regan and Veranda vineyards. It's already showing a touch of age on the palate, with balsamic notes drizzled across the plump berry, white pepper and marjoram spices.

title: Publix 2016 Limited Edition Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This robust and powerfully concentrated wine is thick in tannin yet pretty in rose petal and strong flavors of black cherry, strawberry puree and tangerine. For fans of a bigger style, it delivers.

title: Puccioni 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Blended with 14% Petite Sirah from a planting that dates back to 1904, this wine is smoky in oak and brightly fresh in black cherry and blackberry fruitiness. Focused on the palate, it's robust yet balanced and enjoyable.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 beCS2wZ Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon (from two different vineyards) and 34% Zinfandel shows reduced strawberry and fig juice on the nose as well as cola, pepper and baked earth aromas. It's pleasantly smooth on the palate, offering baked plums, stewed raspberries and woody herbal qualities of thyme and peppercorn.

title: Vie Winery 2015 Roussanne (Lake County)
description: For a white wine, this one has almost the feel of a big red. It shows a deep, gold color, lots of body, a gripping texture and flavors that are much more savory and nutty than simply fruity. It should open up and get more interesting with time. Best after 2020.

title: Bonny Doon 2014 X Block Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is a tremendous example of a cool-climate Syrah, enhanced by 12% Viognier, with cracked black peppercorn, gamy lamb meat, tarragon, rosemary, soy sauce, mint and black currant all present on the nose. The pepper-crusted meat flavor with blackberry jam shows strongly on the sip, finishing with hints of butterscotch and vanilla.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Acin Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Explosive floral and fruit aromas leap from the glass in this brilliant bottling, which is bursting with plump red cherry, bundles of rose petals and just a touch of green peppercorn to keep it herbally intriguing. Lively and fresh on the palate, that deep pomegranate and Montmorency cherry picks up an herbally laced line of thyme, oregano, white sage, green cardamom and white pepper.

title: Robert Mondavi 2014 To Kalon Vineyard The Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from a majority of Cabernet Sauvignon from the famous historic site, with 6% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. It startles in beauty and grace, with plenty of power and concentration. It's a charismatic wine, bright in red currant and black cherry and a soft, supple texture that holds an underlying grip and toasty oak spice.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2013 Astral Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The deft hand of winemaker Tyler Thomas, who was hired in 2014 but blended this vintage, already shows in this bottling, which shows aromas of black currant, asphalt, spice cake, lava rocks, loam and a touch of tart black plum skin. The palate is peppery and herbally laced with bay, oregano and crushed pencil flavors, with tense but approachable tannins. Drink now through 2023.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Toboni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a vineyard site in what is known as the reasonably cool Santa Rosa Plain, this is a spicy, oaky and richly concentrated wine. Pomegranate, bay leaf and cardamom flavors are focused, grounded by abundant notes of tart cranberry and strawberry. The mouthfeel is silky, while an herbal underbelly and lingering clove flavor persists through the finish.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 Hapgood Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lemon spray with hints of flint, light smoke, chalk and toasted oak show on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling by Greg Brewer. It's really tightly wound on the sip, with expressive grapefruit pith and squeezed citrus as well as a distinctive Brie-rind note. A light flash of roasted marshmallow pops on the finish.

title: Bruliam 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tart in cassis, cranberry and pomegranate on the entry, this wine develops a depth of richer rewarding flavor as it goes, leaning more into dark cherry and blueberry. Juicy, layered and delicious, it's well integrated and voluptuously silky on the palate, offering impressive length and breadth.

title: Calluna 2013 Estate Red (Chalk Hill)
description: Made from a majority 49% Cabernet Sauvignon, this blends 27% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc, 8% Petit Verdot and 2% Malbec as well. It showcases the site and vintage well, in a ripe powerful mix of tobacco, cedar and plum, finishing savory and cool.

title: La Follette 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This appellation wine exudes beauty and grace, offering strongly etched characteristics of bacon meat, black cherry, blueberry and spicy cardamom. Succulent and silky, it has a thickness on entry that settles to reveal bright, integrated acidity.

title: Flanagan 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A lovely appellation wine, this has a quiet, floral entry and twisted characteristics of anise, baked apple and vanilla crème brûlée. Medium-bodied, complex and buoyant in acidity, it offers a wealth of flavor and elegance.

title: Flanagan 2015 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the site high atop the Petaluma Gap part of the coast, above Gap's Crown, this is inviting in every way. Black raspberry is seasoned in cardamom and forest pine as a tannic backbone provides structure and strength. A hit of citrus highlights the fresh persistent acidity.

title: Heitz 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Dry and sublime, with undeniable elegance, this is textured, gravelly and integrated with subtle power. Fennel, white peach and lemon rind highlight the toasty oak, making for a complex balanced whole. It would be difficult to find a wine of this quality for this price.

title: Kaena 2015 Ali'i Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Bountiful boysenberry fruit shows alongside a muddy, loamy clay minerality on the nose of bottling, which is lifted further by crushed lavender aromas. The palate's rounded berry fruit is complemented by cherry wood smoke, grippy tannins and strong acidity. The slate and clay character provides a compelling backbone.

title: Lutum 2015 Durell Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Entirely destemmed, this is a cool coastal wine, gracefully restrained and excitingly bright. Tart rhubarb and strawberry join exotic citrus tones and notes of rose petal as spicy acidity lurks within a construct of robust integrated tannin.

title: Lynmar 2015 Five Sisters Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A perennial knockout, this wine is juicy and fresh yet somewhat brooding in structured flavors of red cherry, strawberry and plum. With intriguing layers of earth and forest floor framed by tight-grained tannins, it's a sophisticated and complex experience. A deep boysenberry note adds richness on the finish.

title: Lynmar 2015 Lynn's Blend Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy forest and twig support a medium build of integrated acidity and balanced fruit in this blend named for the proprietor. Aged in 55% new oak, blackberry and black licorice dominate the profile against a fine-grained texture of toasty wood and depth.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Pence Ranch Gamay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This wine, which sold out via Instagram before it was even released, is a fascinating conveyer of soil flavors. Extremely herbal on the nose, it smells like a freshly dug, muddy hole surrounded by towering pines and mossy ground, with exotic berries in the background. The palate is woody, full of dank mushrooms, wild berries and green peppercorns.

title: Brewer-Clifton 2015 3-D Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lush red cherry and rosewater aromas meet with muddled sage, pepper dust and wild herbs on the nose of this excellent bottling, where rich fruit and herbal intrigue collide. Thyme, dried sage and even broadleaf parsley flavors show on the sip, set against a background of piquant cranberry and tart red currant, with bountiful energy that carries through the entire palate.

title: Clementine Carter 2015 Grenache Gris (Ballard Canyon)
description: There's a very Gamay-like quality to this bottling, with loads of crushed gravel and schist-like minerality sprinkled atop light cranberry, crushed carnations and slightly ripe raspberry. It hits the palate softly then comes a sharp acidity and then that mellows to allow soil-driven flavors and candied red fruit to combine seamlessly.

title: Davies 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Bold ripe fruit flavors find impressive support from firm tannins and refreshing acidity in this natural-tasting and well-structured wine. The black cherry, raspberry and cranberry flavors are vivid and mouthfilling, while a lip-smacking texture keeps them alive on the palate and through a lingering finish.

title: Calera 2015 de Villiers Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: Deep and meaty on the nose, this 40th anniversary bottling offers black plum, dried violet and roasted meat aromas. Mulberry, strawberry and plum flavors show on the wild palate, which is lifted by elements of pine needle, dried sage and mint.

title: Poetic Justice 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: Thick, concentrated and rich, this vineyard-designate from the famous Oakville site is grippy on the midpalate, with a juicy backbone of black cherry and blackberry. A huge thread of crushed rock-like minerality sparkles through the finish.

title: Dierberg 2015 Dierberg Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Baked black-cherry and plum aromas meet with star anise, hot gingerbread and wet slate on the fairly opulent, very delicious nose of this bottling. It's more tightly wound on the palate, where cherry and black raspberry are lifted by baking spice. It's the pitch perfect acidity and tannic edge that are most impressive.

title: Levo 2016 Spot Duvarita Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: This series of Syrahs by Bret Urness is an ode to vineyard owner Brook Williams, and this cool-climate expression is lovely, showing white pepper, dried purple flowers and boysenberry on the nose. The palate is jammy and candied in the background, but the foreground is all pepper, acid and florals, like sipping liquefied lavender and violets with a pinch of white pepper.

title: Roar 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: With an array of butter and cream elements on the nose, this bottling shows just enough richness to appease many Chardonnay fans, but not so much to overwhelm those seeking a brighter, lemony edge. It's crisp and clean on the palate, where butter takes a backseat to tangy lemon and mandarin orange flavors, with light crème brûlée on the finish.

title: Stephen Ross 2015 Stone Corral Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Crisp black-plum and mulberry aromas meet with wild mint, baked earth and rosemary on the extremely elegant nose of this bottling by veteran Stephen Ross Dooley. There is a strong herbal kick to the palate of oregano and marjoram, but also floral hints of lavender and violets, all decorating the dark fruit in the background.

title: Arista 2015 Harper's Rest Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This an edgy grippy wine from the heart of the appellation's Middle Reach. Dense and spicy, it has a sharpness to the palate that presents as full bodied and fairly tannic, etched in lengths of citrus, forest floor, cardamom and dark, brooding cherry.

title: Lombardi 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Robust in peach, apple and integrated oak, the flavors are well integrated and richly woven together, with bright underlying acidity helping to maintain freshness and focus. The brightness is met and complemented by a lingering taste of crème brûlée and vanilla.

title: Lombardi 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Griffin's Lair and Sonoma Stage Vineyards, both within the new Petaluma Gap, provide the fruit for this stellar, smoothly textured, well-integrated red. High in acidity, it tastes of citrus and wild strawberry, with a lasting tease of black licorice.

title: Jarvis 2016 Finch Hollow Estate Grown Cave Fermented Unfiltered Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This unfiltered wine is spicy in ginger and nutmeg tones. It is completely intriguing in its combination of wet stone, tangy acidity and exotic spice tones. It sings in toasted oak and a wealth of concentrated apple and pear.
designation: Finch Hollow Estate Grown Cave Fermented Unfiltered

title: Rocca 2014 Grigsby Vineyard Syrah (Yountville)
description: Dark and inky, this is a burly wine, jammy to the core. Floral aromas meet spicy leather and white pepper alongside a strong streak of rosemary, recalling roast lamb, a pairing with which it would succeed.

title: Betwixt 2016 Boer Vineyard Grenache (Chalone)
description: Light rosewater, strawberry and cherry-juice aromas meet with rounded star anise and baking spice on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There is great chalky tension to the palate and a ripping acidity, framing flavors of red fruit, orange rind and, on the finish, vanilla paste.

title: Cattleya 2016 Donum Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Snappy black raspberry, baked cherry and fragrant boysenberry are lifted by a touch of fennel on the nose of this bottling. Full flavors of smashed berry, sweet thyme and peppery spice show on the palate, which makes for a very big and powerful yet clean and fresh wine.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2016 Peterson Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Smoke, blood, roasted berries, crushed rose petals and clove show on the dynamic nose of this single-vineyard expression. Rounded flavors of mulberry, star anise and clove show on the palate, which grows even more complex toward the finish with roasted tomato and meat elements.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2017 Kiler Grove Vineyard Ugni Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This may be the best white wine in Paso Robles, starting with powerfully chalky aromas of Gala apple and freshly plucked sweet herbs. It's zesty on the palate, with key lime and red-grapefruit flavors, all riding a laser-sharp acidity and a tremendously chalky grip.

title: Talbott 2016 Diamond T Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: This bottling from a vineyard planted in 1982 shows aromas of buttered toast, lemon preserves and marmalade. There is a flash of lemon sorbet on the palate, which is surrounded by warm, oaky flavors, proving both savory and refreshing.

title: Ten Acre 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This smooth, full-flavored, indulgent wine from a noted single vineyard adds baking spice top notes to a generous pear and apple base and builds a splash of savory minerality on the midpalate and finish. It is medium to full in body, mouth-filling and creamy.

title: Zotovich 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling starts with tense aromas of fresh melon, chalk, Meyer lemon pith and chilled peach. There is a great chalky texture to the palate, where honeysuckle, ripe nectarine, tangerine and plum-flesh flavors make for a very tasty Chardonnay.

title: GrapeHeart Vineyards 2013 The Beat Red (Suisun Valley)
description: Quite an eye-opener, this bold, full-bodied wine is black in color with a dark-ruby rim, offers powerful dark-fruit aromas and opulent fruit and spice flavors. While labeled as a red blend, it has more than enough Cabernet Sauvignon to be a varietal wine. The concentration level is high enough that hints of blueberry, dark chocolate, blackberry jam and charcoal keep evolving on the finish.

title: Calera 2015 Reed Vineyard Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: This was a tough vintage for the winery's 40th anniversary, amounting to just over a half-ton an acre from this vineyard, but the results are stunning. Aromas of cranberry compote, smoked pork, crushed slate, pine needle and roasted tomato lead into a clean palate of mulberry, red plum, white pepper and sumac.

title: Lawer 2017 Betsy's Vineyard Rosé of Syrah (Knights Valley)
description: Rich, round and slightly candied, this is a crowd-pleasing wine that shows layered flavors of apple and cherry. The acidity is measured and supportive.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Pinot Blanc (Paicines)
description: Honey, apple flesh, wet stone and lime show on the layered nose of this bottling from an appellation in San Benito County. The honey-brushed palate shows orange cream and a hint of almond.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Intriguing aromas of pomegranate, rosewater and kirsch show on the nose of this bottling. Concentrated watermelon flavors show on the palate, which is very familiar and pleasant.

title: Emerald Hare 2017 Rosé (Napa County)
description: Made from 65% Pinot Noir and 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, this offers elusive, crunchy red fruit and integrated acidity with a lush mouthfeel.

title: J Wilkes 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Clean strawberry-juice aromas meet with light mint cream on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are a bit primary still, with fresh and juicy red-fruit touches with just a touch of tannic framing on a somewhat thin body.

title: JCB 2016 No. 12 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Juicy and broad-shouldered in a ripeness of brawny blackberry and cherry fruit, this wine is marked by a preponderance of oak and tannin.

title: Picayune 2015 Padlock Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is made from 72% Merlot with 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 8% Cabernet Franc. Roundly structured, it has classic herbal undertones that accent black cherry and clove, with a lasting taste of toasted oak.

title: Sean Minor 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Zesty lime and citrus blossom aromas make for a very fresh take on the grape. There is a hint of sweetness at the tip of the sip, then come bright flavors of orange rind and squeezed citrus.

title: Austerity 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Tangy red fruits meet with roasted game, damp campfire and juniper on the nose of this bottling. There is a strong eucalyptus and pine needle kick to the sip, alongside tobacco leaf and dark fruits.

title: Ballard Lane 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Slightly sour cherry aromas meet with juniper and wet earth on the nose of this bottling. Similar elements carry over to the palate, where tangy orange-rind flavors meet with pomegranate and earthy herbs.

title: Blair Estate 2015 The Matriarch Delfina's Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: A fairly dark shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling starts with aromas of toasted nuts, lemon sorbet and clotted cream. The palate comes across as cleaner and crisper, tangy with orange rind but broad with toasted bread and more nutty qualities. It shows a touch of early oxidation.

title: Cooper-Garrod 2014 Finley Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Tar and dried berries show on the somewhat weak but pleasant nose of this bottling. Tannins frame the palate rather rigidly, hiding the dark-fruit flavors.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: With 5% Sémillon and 1% Muscat, this is no shy white, offering instead full-bodied, lush and fleshy flavors of peach, mango and vanilla. It lingers in a finish of freshly cut grass.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Purple Rain Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Both the candied-red-cherry and warm baking-spice notes make for a very welcoming nose on this bottling. The palate is a bit light and framed by rough tannins, showing flavors of smoke, cinnamon and red fruit.

title: Pulchella 2015 Mercenary Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked black-raspberry aromas meet with sagebrush and a pinch of pepper on the fresh nose of this bottling. The palate shows slightly sour plum, smoke, wild mint and woody earth flavors.

title: Roth 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Fleshy and gravelly, this white is blended with 14% Sémillon. It leans into a sweetness of stone fruit and vanilla, with a lasting lushness on the finish.

title: Benessere 2017 Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato di Sangiovese (St. Helena)
description: Tart, dry acidity accentuates a sharpness of lemon and grapefruit in this thickly textured wine. A gamy note of charcuterie contrasts well against the fruit.
designation: Estate St. Helena Vineyard Rosato di

title: Chime 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: A little restraint adds interest to this value-priced wine. Subdued in flavor but with good balance and a refreshing mouthfeel, this dry wine gets the job done without overt oak or a cloying texture.

title: J Wilkes 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Dried lemon peels, key lime, white peach and strong wood aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's tangy and very flavorful on the palate with sharp lemon and grapefruit elements.

title: J Wilkes 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Wet slate, earth, smoke, dark red fruit and a hint of roasted pork show on the nose of this bottling. Tangy red-currant flavors meet with thyme and more savory meat qualities on the palate.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Burly soft tannins are both chalky and robust in this well-made full-bodied wine, which is blended with small amounts of Syrah, Grenache and mixed Rhônes. Soy, blackberry, blueberry and chocolate flavors mix well before a softness comes into play on the finish.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 Tête-à-tête Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This big but gentle wine has a mouth-filling texture and lavish fruit and spice flavors that are hard to resist. Lots of berries and cherries flood the taste buds, while soft tannins and relatively low acidity give it a nicely viscous feel.

title: Toccata 2015 Classico Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Freisa and Petit Verdot shows hickory, red-cherry and pepper-crusted steak aromas on the nose. The palate offers tangy cranberry fruit and a slightly reductive touch of tar.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Riesling (Anderson Valley)
description: Fruity and fresh-tasting peach and pine aromas waft up from the glass before crisp apple and white-peach flavors hit the tongue, tempered by a light touch of sweetness. The wine is light to medium bodied, very tasty and charming.

title: Waits-Mast 2017 Mariah Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)
description: A bright gold color and assertive oak aromas and flavors make this an unusual example of the variety, but it is appealing nonetheless. The aroma is quite buttery and the flavors resemble toasted almonds and grilled pears while the body is full and viscous.

title: Westbrook Wine Farm 2011 Museum Red (Madera County)
description: This full-bodied and densely packed wine has aged well. It shows aromas like coffee and cedar, and flavors like late-harvested plums and chocolate. It feels smooth and velvety but has substantial tannins suspended in the rich fruit and spice elements.

title: Bellante 2015 Watch Hill Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite gamy on the nose, this bottling shows lamb meat, crushed asphalt and black pepper on the nose. The palate is very woody with cedar shavings but also plenty of juicy dark fruit and a touch of game.

title: Bellante 2016 Shokrian Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Cassis and lilac aromas show prominently on the nose of this very extracted wine. The palate is juicy and tangy with balsamic-laced strawberry fruit, lifted by a touch of savory pepper on the finish.

title: Challen 2014 Jasper Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rusty aromas of earth, pomegranate and raspberry meet with a dusty minerality on the nose of this bottling from actor Challen Cates. It's fairly light on the palate, offering tangy cranberry, thyme and dried sage flavors.

title: Croma Vera 2017 Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Very light and clean aromas of lime balm, squeezed citrus, freshly cut apple and wet cement show on the nose of this bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard. Green-pear and sliced apple flavors are framed by a chalky grip and a racy acidity that's almost too powerful.

title: De Loach 2015 Maboroshi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a delicately textured fruit-forward wine lush in candied strawberry and grainy oak. Relatively light bodied, it retains acidity well, adding a flourish of lavender on the finish.

title: Hestan 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is sticky and grippy in tannin, with a reductive quality to its huge burly structure. Dusty elements of crushed rock ride alongside sizable oak and a girth of baked cherry.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2017 Pinot Gris (California)
description: Hints of spearmint and minerals on the nose and ample ripe-apple and honeydew flavors on the palate add up to a substantial and well-balanced wine. Bright acidity lends a tangy undertone.

title: JCB 2014 No. 9 Brut Sparkling (Los Carneros)
