description: Blending 51% Chardonnay with 49% Pinot Noir, this is a creamy rounded sparkling wine of moderate structure, opting for fleshy opulence in abundance. It tastes of green apple, melon and peach.

title: Joullian 2017 Rosé (Monterey)
description: A richer style of rosé made from the traditional saignée method, this darker-hued wine shows loads of red cherry, cola, earth and vanilla on the nose. It's ripe on the palate, but it works, with black cherry and more vanilla flavors that are enticing and cut by decent acid.

title: Koehler 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There is an abundance of tropical fruit, sweet pear and orange Popsicle aromas on the nose of this bottling. It dries up considerably on the sip, where bright and tight flavors of apple flesh are framed by fairly ripping acidity.

title: Lichen Estate 2014 Blanc de Gris Sparkling (Anderson Valley)
description: Bold in fruit flavor and very dry, this medium-bodied Pinot Gris smells tangy and fresh, tastes crisp and lively like tart cherries and lemons, and seems to have very low residual sugar.

title: Prima Materia 2014 Grenache (Lake County)
description: Very smooth, ripe and grapey, this is an exuberant wine packed with plum, strawberry and cinnamon flavors. It is full bodied but very low in tannins, so the palate impression is soothing and soft. The winemaker blended in 12% Syrah and 8% Petite Sirah, and a portion of the grapes was air dried on racks before fermentation.

title: Rabble 2016 Mossfire Ranch Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Smoke, leather and dark-berry aromas make for a savory and fruity entry on the nose of this bottling. Gritty tannins frame the rugged palate, offering plummy flavors of rhubarb and hickory smoke.

title: Spicy Vines 2015 Morning Song Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Plum, wax crayon and sizable tannins pique the palate of this robust full-bodied wine, made in a 100% varietal manner. The midpalate is soft in fruity berry and oak flavors, finishing in a quiet dusting of white pepper.

title: Kokomo 2016 Peters Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Explosive in succulent layers of fruit, this apple and pear-driven beauty is lightly spiced and well-integrated, with an impressive depth and length that gives it a warmth and welcoming character.

title: MacRostie 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned acidity and spice combine with great intrigue in this beautifully quaffable wine, marked by complex texture and bright layers of orange and grapefruit.

title: Sol Rouge 2014 Syrah (Red Hills)
description: Extremely concentrated fruit flavors and full body make this wine impressive and memorable. It has spicy, floral, slightly smoky aromas, and deep dark black-cherry and blackberry flavors that are unusually intense and delicious. The mouthfeel is moderately tannic and helps support all that fruit.

title: Waxwing 2016 Dierberg Vineyard Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Loads of green peppercorns, juniper, dried violets and charcoal show on the nose of this extremely cool-climate Syrah. That pepper spice powers the palate, where thyme, forest moss and firm tannins frame background boysenberry flavors.

title: Aperture 2015 Del Rio Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Rich blue fruit is the star of the show in this 100% varietal wine, from grapes grown on this hillside site. Enticing in crushed rock and dusty earth, the fruit is contrasted by tones of leather and black pepper. A powerful tannic structure underlies it all.

title: Devil Proof 2015 Rockpile Ridge Malbec (Rockpile)
description: From a new dry-farmed site, this is fleshy and expansive in complex waves of flavor and texture. Mocha, coconut flakes and blueberry combine around a rich and rounded body that boasts power and grip.

title: Eighty Four 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This project from Doug Shafer and Elias Fernandez continues to impress, showing the beauty of this variety in California when in the right hands. The nose offers an undeniable wealth of violet and lavender while the palate exudes smoked cherry, juicy blueberry and an underbelly of garrigue.

title: Joseph Phelps 2015 Quarter Moon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the producer's estate-grown site near the coast in Freestone, this shows soft, structured waves of citrus and wild strawberry met with hints of wood and pine. Bolstered by quenching acidity at its core, this is light in feel and delicately crafted.

title: Ken Brown 2014 Rancho La Vina Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling is redolent with carnations, hibiscus and pomegranate on the nose, which is sprinkled with oregano, marjoram and black-pepper spice. It's lighter bodied on the sip, which is full of energy and layered with texture, showing cranberry and minty flavors.

title: Limerick Lane 2016 Hail Mary Syrah-Grenache (Russian River Valley)
description: Estate grown, this combines 98% Syrah and 2% Grenache into a fist of perfumed violet, lavender and garrigue—the nose both feral and pretty. Black pepper, tar and up-front tannin give it an intensity that persists on the full-bodied palate, accented in meaty complexity.

title: Ram's Gate 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Ethereally earthy and forested, this appellation wine is succulent and supple in fleshy blackberry, huckleberry and a freshness of cardamom spice. The full-bodied density exudes fruitiness supported in rounded tannin.

title: Roberts & Rogers 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy in an inviting tapestry of spice, this wine is textured and full bodied, with lingering sentiments of clove and cinnamon. The fruit shines bright and tart in red currant and cassis. It offers well-developed flavors that work well with a complement of oak.

title: RouteStock 2016 Route 116 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a screaming deal for a wine of this quality: a light, delicate and earthy expression of the grape that's stemmy and spicy. Forest floor, bark and dark brooding fruit meet a tangle of tight-woven acidity dipped in orange zest.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Syrah (Amador County)
description: This is a big fascinating wine that adds complex smoky earthy tobacco aromas to rich mouthfilling flavors of blackberry and blueberry. Full body, moderate tannins and good acidity give it grip on the palate and deep funky earthy flavors linger on the finish.

title: Benovia 2015 Martaella Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a youthful, tightly woven wine, with a floral nose of cherry blossom. A wealth of bright cranberry and raspberry melds over a grainy texture, supportive acidity and integrated oak.

title: Écluse 2013 Lock Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Very dense in the glass, this rich complex wine shows dark blackberry, black currant and even flashes of blueberry on the nose, with spice cake and concentrated jasmine as well. The tannins are thick but polished on the sip, where elegant purple-flower flavors meet with vanilla cake, chocolate, blueberry muffin and a strong acid blast on the finish.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Silky smooth, soft and concentrated, this hails from 100-year-old vines in the heart of the appellation. The wine is luscious in strawberry and black-cherry flavors. Expansive and boldly ripe, it has a core of richness that never overwhelms, finding companionship in a wisp of black and white pepper.
designation: Fanucchi Wood Road Vineyard Old Vine

title: Ken Brown 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Baked red cherry, roasted plum, rose petals, carnation and extremely dark spice show on the nose of this bold bottling from the historic vineyard. It's elegantly presented on the palate, where flavors of red currant and framboise mix with baking spice, prominent floral touches and a penetrating acidity.

title: Big Basin 2015 Homestead Red (California)
description: This blend of 43% Mourvèdre, 16% Syrah, 14% Grenache, 14% Carignane and 13% Cabernet Sauvignon is a great look at what this cult producer is doing, but for much less price than other bottlings. Pure tangy fruit aromas of mulberry and condensed flower petals cut through the rustic earthy and gamy elements on the nose. Vibrant acidity explodes on the palate, which is full of red-currant, cranberry, parsley, sage and lavender flavors.

title: Margerum 2015 Uber Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Savory aromas of black pepper, roasted lamb and burnt bacon decorate the boysenberry-syrup and dried maple-sugar notes of this bottling's extremely compelling nose. Brown sugar-glazed pork flavors meet with more pepper, soy and au jus on the palate, which will grow more complex and delicious with time. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Challen 2015 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft and smooth aromas of exotic cherry and plum meet with baking spice and clove on the nose of this bottling. The palate integrates stewed red fruits with white and black pepper, showing both a deep dark richness and a tangy edge.

title: Cinnabar 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Loads of purple flowers and wild thyme meet with aromas of black raspberry and alpine strawberry on this appellation blend from a winery founded by Tom Mudd in 1983. The well-integrated palate shows tangy black-plum and wild chaparral flavors, starting quite exuberant before tightening up around woody tannins.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Twin Creeks Estate Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Dark cherry, turned earth and hibiscus meet with cedar and pine-wood spice on the nose of this bottling. It's more delicate on the palate, where earthy herbs meet with bright raspberry fruit flavors, framed by solid acid and a lighter mouthfeel.

title: Folded Hills 2015 August Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rather ripe on the nose, this blend offers aromas of candied strawberry, red cherry and a hint of cinnamon. The palate is lighter in mouthfeel, very clean and easy to enjoy, with a decent structure that's not too tight, showing flavors of red fruits and red spice.

title: Gamble Family Vineyards 2017 Gamble Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: This vineyard-designated white is impressively layered and complex, with integrated acidity and texture to its light-bodied character. Lime, cantaloupe and wet stone give it a fruity complexion met by a note of salty brine.

title: Grassini 2015 Merlot (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Penetrating and inviting aromas of candied cherries and sweet cedar show on the nose of this estate bottling. The palate combines both ripe red cherries with slightly underripe fruit flavors alongside pencil shavings, dried herbs and chalky tannins.

title: Inman Family 2014 Whole Buncha Bubbles Blanc de Noir Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: This is made from 100% Pinot Noir grapes grown on the producer's Olivet Grange Vineyard—a fun, quaffing wine with plenty of quality to back up its whimsy. Light-orange-yellow in color, it's funky and earthy in flavors of wild strawberry, wet stone and dried herb.
designation: Whole Buncha Bubbles Blanc de Noir

title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick and rich in feel but with fresh acidity, this wine tastes of lemon, strawberry and a touch of grapefruit. It is layered and complex while offering approachable rewards, made from a majority of Pinot Noir with smaller amounts of Chardonnay and Pinot Meunier.

title: J Vineyards & Winery NV Cuvée 20 Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Broadly defined in honeysuckle, peach, brioche and moderate acidity, this is a crowd-pleasing and immensely likable sparkling wine. The finish lingers on a deep, nutty tone.

title: Kinsella 2015 Heirloom Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Red-fruit-forward and full of sanguine earthiness, this wine is soft, supple and expressive in rich voluptuous flavor and a cradling of charred, toasty oak. Full bodied and ripe, it delivers plenty of rounded lushness.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 Pont de Chevalier Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)
description: This white has a creamy, lush texture that is complemented by a bright enduring freshness of grapefruit and lime. The full-bodied midpalate fruit profile is defined in tropical guava, apricot and almond paste.

title: Malene 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Rosé of Mourvèdre (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light and pleasant aromas of nectarine and red apple show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression of rosé. The texture is very grippy and chalky, carrying light flavors of raspberry soda.

title: Martin Ranch 2012 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Nebbiolo (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Rosewater, sweet tar, tea and cedar aromas provide the hallmark aromas of Nebbiolo in this bottling. Strong tannins and acid frame the sip, allowing flavors of red cherry, leather, rust and potpourri flavors to emerge. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Neyers 2017 304 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Intensely floral, this youthful white is citrus-driven in nature, with a grainy texture and moderate acidity. Toasted oak rides in the background, offering a complementary element to racy lemon.

title: Oakville East 2015 Core Stone Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a Cabernet Franc-driven blend, combined with a large percentage of Cabernet Sauvignon and smaller amounts of Merlot and Petit Verdot—some of the fruit from Stagecoach Vineyard. Big effusive tannins wrap around robust cassis, currant and mocha vanilla flavors. The wine is generously ripe and robust in structure.

title: Oakville East 2015 Harter Family Double H Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Chocolate graham cracker richness defines the early impression of this wine, which is powerfully intense and tannic. A succulence of dark cherry meets the bolder, more savory character with ease—balanced and refreshing.

title: Paix Sur Terre 2016 Songs of Its Own Glenrose Vineyard Red (Adelaida District)
description: Boysenberry pie, sweet asphalt and roasted coffee aromas show on the nose of this blend of 52% Grenache, 45% Mourvèdre and 3% Cinsaut. Fairly firm and thick tannins frame the palate, which shyly shows flavors of black currant, elderberry and dried ginger spice.
designation: Songs of Its Own Glenrose Vineyard

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tight-grained tannin and texture wrap around this wine's fresh acidity and full embrace of forest and earth. Robust flavors of dark cherry and baked strawberry ride along smooth full-bodied ripeness before unfurling a minty finish.

title: Treana 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Extremely rich, deep and extracted on the nose, this bottling by Austin Hope is loaded with vanilla, cassis, caramel and Bourbon aromas. It's rich, lush and soft on the palate, offering vanilla, sea-salt caramel and coffee flavors set against a black cherry core.

title: Zotovich 2016 Zoto Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Ripe cranberry and raspberry juice aromas meet with the hint of wet river stones on the nose of this twist-top bottling. The palate is loaded with pomegranate and more cranberry flavors as well as hints of wild mint and dusty chaparral, with a pop of vanilla on the finish.

title: Alara 2016 Boudoir Green Red (San Benito County)
description: Strong aromas of vanilla, spice cake and very extracted plum makes for a rich and concentrated nose on this blend of 50% Sangiovese, 30% Grenache and 20% Negrette. Thick black plum pudding, clove, caramel and even fudge arise on the palate.

title: Blazon 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine is buttery and oaky in aroma, fairly rich in texture and has plenty of ripe peach and apple flavors. It is nicely oaky, from the toasted bread aromas to a slight tannic bite on the tongue and spicy, nutmeg finish.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2015 Herman Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Moderate in acidity and midweight in ripeness and power, this offers lush flavors of caramel and baked apple before finishing simply and without much fuss.

title: Kula 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Somewhat delicate on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of kirsch and spice cake to start. It lands softly on the palate, with mouth-coating flavors of strawberry and sharp cinnamon, with a pinch of dried herbs.

title: Kynsi 2017 Barn Owl Blush Rosé (Edna Valley)
description: Rich aromas of red plum, vanilla and wet stone show on the nose of this bottling from Pinot Noir grapes. Cherry and nutmeg flavors show on the warm palate.

title: Migration 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made of grapes sourced from several vineyards, including a few that the producer uses in single bottlings, this is a round and rich wine tasting of custard, vanilla and sweet pineapple.

title: Pech Merle 2015 T-Bar-T Ranch Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)
description: Aromatically shy, in contrast to its showy tannins, this wine is huge in structure and weight, with a jammy core of black cherry and raspberry dusted in clove.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Estate Picpoul Blanc (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Wet stone and gravel make for a mineral-driven entry to the nose of this bottling, which also shows aromas of pomelo rind. A rocky tension grabs hold of the palate and delivers sour orange-pith and lemon-rind flavors.

title: Townley 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Grenache (Mendocino)
description: Lean and appetizing in character, this medium- to full-bodied wine blends mild raspberry and forest-floor aromas with meaty, slightly peppery flavors. It has a tangy texture that leaves a clean aftertaste.

title: Volatus 2015 Bloody Well Right Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated black plum, hoisin sauce and black pepper show on the nose of this bottling, an ode to the musical career of the vintner's father-in-law. Tangy black-fruit flavors meet with more pepper spice and light vanilla on the ripe palate.

title: Balderdash 2016 ‘Til Death Do Us Part Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of guava, bubblegum and pink-grapefruit rinds show on the nose of this bottling from a winery in Massachusetts. The texture is a crunchy on the palate, offering flavors of dried apples, lime extract, a pinch of herbs and, on the finish, a nutty character.

title: Clos LaChance 2016 JoLi Meritage (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Rich black cherry and tart berry meet with a touch of red flowers on the sharp nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied on the palate, with more tart red-fruit flavors, showing loads of acid and sticky tannin.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 The Immigrant Red (Paicines)
description: This bottling is very shy on the nose, offering tight boysenberry and wet gravel aromas with patience. The palate is a bit flat as well, but eventually delivers flavors of baked cherry and baking spice, held together by tense tannins.

title: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: This is a dry, sturdy wine that has moderate cherry and herb aromas. The palate is lean but offers clean fruit flavors and a medium body.

title: Prospect 772 2015 The Truant Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Overt and extra-ripe fruit aromas and an opulent late-harvest flavor make this full-bodied wine tempting while low acidity and light tannins let it go soft in terms of mouthfeel.

title: Quivira 2016 Anderson Ranch Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Earthy and herbal, this full-bodied wine offers a generous helping of tart acidity and wild flavors of brambly berry, red cherry and vanilla bean.

title: Sean Minor 2017 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant, black plum, crushed pine and dried herbs show on the nose of this twist-top bottling. Roasted black plum with oregano flavors show on the sip.

title: St. Supéry 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-integrated and smoothly soft white, balanced and light bodied with a lasting imprint of peach, apricot and green apple.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Cabernet Franc (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine has an herbal nose of dried sage and cedar that highlights a palate of sticky tannin that grips and dominates. Red and black cherry contribute a touch of fruit.

title: Volatus 2017 CAVU White (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Slightly sour pear rinds, dried lemon peels and underripe tangerines show on the nose of this blend of 67% Viognier and 33% Roussanne. It's quite tangy on the palate, with tart grapefruit flavors, yet there is also a toasty element offering a warm balance.

title: Clouds Rest 2014 Femme Fatale Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy herb and earth meet a fleshy midpalate of tight-grained tannin and oak in this moderately structured wine, made from estate-grown grapes.

title: Cuttings 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Full bodied and nicely complex, this ripe and concentrated wine exudes ripe fruit, light smoke and black pepper aromas and flavors while offering a satisfying sense of heft and structure. The black-cherry and black-plum flavors are rich and concentrated, verging on sweet and softening the effect of moderate tannins.

title: Elyse 2014 Morisoli Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Structured and undeniably concentrated, this is a burly brawny red, showing the exuberance of a warm, steady vintage and a well-known site. Mountain sage, cedar and graphite give it a savory complexity complemented by dense dark cherry.

title: Gainey 2016 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in the glass, this wine starts with a touch of sandalwood on the nose alongside preserved lemon, toast and oak. The palate offers a firm textural grip, then leads into tangy lemon rind, sour apple and a bit more toasted oak flavors.

title: Hartford Court 2015 Sevens Bench Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine has a pretty nose of apple blossom and jasmine. Present, persistent oak gives it a roundness and richness that complements mango, wet stone and lemon-drop flavors and tight focused acidity.

title: Jason-Stephens 2014 Malbec (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Blackberry, roasted coffee and spicy white-pepper aromas play on the nose of this Malbec, a strong performer in this region. There is strong tannic tension to the sip and loads of acidity, which carry flavors of boysenberry juice, spice cake, herbs and espresso.

title: Kokomo 2014 Peters Vineyard Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an earthy, nutty and dry sparkling wine, made from Chardonnay, that tastes of apple skin and lemon zest. Textured tight acidity buoys the flavors and provides lasting freshness in the glass.

title: Kokomo 2016 Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brawny in leather, baked strawberry and blackberry, this is a robust version of the variety, ripe, softly layered and undeniably fruity. Cinnamon and brown sugar add richness and a touch of spice.

title: Brutocao 2016 Bliss Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: An attractive, spicy oak aroma leads to butter and vanilla flavors and a broad creamy texture. The wine feels full bodied, tastes toasty and rich without overdoing it, and has a lingering finish.

title: Michael Pozzan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This lean and refreshing wine smells minerally and tastes bright and citrusy, backed by crisp acidity and a light body. Lemon and lime merge with light herb and mineral flavors that stay lively with each sip.

title: Órale 2014 Mas Que Alta Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Blackberry syrup, coffee extract and a touch of raisin show on the intense nose of this bottling from the Tierra Alta and Morehouse vineyards by bartender-vintner Chris Wright. There is great verve to the sip, with dark berry flavors and a strong tannic structure.

title: Replica 2016 Knockoff Chardonnay (California)
description: This brand brags on the label that they replicate your favorite wines, and with this one they really did it. Ripe fruit aromas of pear and peach lead to rich fruit flavors and a lively spicy component of nutmeg and ginger in this full-bodied and creamy-textured wine. It combines richness with oaky complexity in an alluring way.

title: Sassoferrato 2015 Monte de Ferro Red (Alexander Valley)
description: Named for winemaker Matt Smith's ancestral village in Italy, this is a blend of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Cabernet Franc and 9% Sangiovese. Sanguine, it features strong flavors of currant, wood and graphite, with secondary notions of dust and cedar, the tannins sizable but polished and lengthy.

title: Sofia NV Méthode Champenoise Sparkling (Monterey County)
description: Clear hay yellow in color, this bottling shows fresh and supple aromas of nectarine and Asian pear. The palate combines citrus, stone fruit and Pink Lady apple flavors, all presented with a very consistent, persistent mousse.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (Clarksburg)
description: This is an exuberant but well-balanced medium-bodied wine, with fresh apple and lime aromas and a tangy yet layered texture. The two varieties weave together nicely, presenting the rich aspect of Viognier and the crisp, lively aspect of Chenin Blanc.

title: Tiny House Vineyard 2016 W.E. Bottoms Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This vineyard is set amongst redwood trees outside the coastal town of Occidental. The resulting wine is juicy in orange and rhubarb flavors, with a robust fleshiness and lushness on the palate. It has an enticing smoked and candied element in the background, dotted in lasting cardamom and clove.

title: Tiny House Vineyard 2017 Rosé of Pinotage (Sonoma Coast)
description: This small-production wine is earthy, with a distinctly herbal nose, yet shows a hearty robustness and meaty character on the palate. Lightly ripe, it offers underlying hints of cherry and Tahitian vanilla, with sparks of vibrant acidity.

title: Venge 2016 Scout's Honor Red (Napa Valley)
description: Winemaker Kirk Venge combines 70% Zinfandel with 14% Charbono, 9% Petite Sirah and 7% Syrah to great effect, offering a jammy expression of blackberry, brown sugar and vanilla. Soft integrated oak supports the rounded rich fruit and gives it an impressive framework of structure and likability.

title: Christopher Street 2014 Winemaker's Pride Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blend of all five key red Bordeaux varieties, the majority Cabernet Sauvignon, has a soft entry of red currant and cherry that leads into savory elements of pencil shavings and tobacco. Full bodied, the oak and tannin are well integrated. The brand is devoted to supporting LGBT equality.

title: Clif Family 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Mendocino)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a very pale-pink color, vivid strawberry and grapefruit flavors and a good crisp texture. It will provide great refreshment as well as concentrated fruit flavors that last through the tangy finish. The Clif Family made it with Grenache grapes and no oak aging.

title: Riverbench 2016 Bedrock Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite rich on the nose, this bottling from a historic property deep in the appellation shows loads of honeysuckle and gardenia on the nose as well as lemon bar, nectarine, candied apple and a flash of nuts. It lands with ripe power on the palate, carrying hints of mango and pome fruits.

title: St. Francis 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brimming with a sweetness of baked cherry and molasses, this is a soft, rounded and robustly ripe wine that carries its weight well. A touch of structured, high-toned acidity complements the power and outer reaches of excess, allowing the experience on the palate to speak.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Twelve Falls Red (Stags Leap District)
description: This is an estate-grown combination of half Cabernet Sauvignon with 40% Petite Sirah and 10% Merlot. It offers moderation and grace within its juicy core of muted black fruit, cedar and gamy meat seasoned in black pepper.

title: Talisman 2014 Red Dog Vineyard Honey's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Bursting in black cherry and a light thread of cola spice, this is from a single block of one site, planted all to Pommard clone. Tree bark and black tea provide seasoning to a soft and lengthy palate of exuberance.

title: Tobias 2015 Formation Red (Sonoma-Mendocino)
description: Hearty and full bodied, this wine is loaded with blackberry, dark chocolate and beef flavors and structured with moderate tannins and a rich mouthfeel. Blended from Zinfandel, Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, it has good concentration, ripeness and length, and it's easy to enjoy.

title: Ziata 2015 Mia Madre Red (Napa Valley)
description: Tight-grained tannins and oak define this wine's powerful concentration and the heartiness of the vintage. Flavors of black plum, blackberry and leather give it fruit-forward complexity but are held in check by the wines inherent structure.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Riverstone Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: This wine starts with plush aromas of yellow melon, plumeria, wild lime sorbet and a hint of cream. There is ample zip to the palate, where acidity and a strong floral character keep the honeydew and white peach flavors in check.

title: Chandon NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)
description: Made from 93% Pinot Noir and 7% Pinot Meunier, this is a lovely sparkling wine, rounded and layered with moderate acidity. The flavors dance around aspects of wild strawberry, raspberry and melon, with a lasting tease of hazelnut.

title: Acumen 2014 Mountainside Red (Napa Valley)
description: Blending 42% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Malbec, 19% Merlot, 14% Cabernet Franc and 6% Petit Verdot, this is an elegant, structured red, elongated by silky tannins. Cedar, sage, red currant and turned earth provide an understated savory personality.

title: Artesa 2016 Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This soft, smooth estate wine is forward in tart red fruit, supported by pillowy tannins and well-balanced acidity. There are welcome flavors of cherry and strawberry that flirt with pomegranate and rhubarb.

title: Artesa 2016 Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Silky, sanguine and tart, this wine is defined by tones of strawberry, rhubarb and citrus. It is a delicate, lightly textured wine that holds its ripeness well and has a lingering spice note.

title: Au Contraire 2015 Lawler Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine offers expressive tones of strawberry, leather and jam, with a full-bodied, rich approach. A creamy, velvety quality unfolds on the palate, supported by brawny tannins.

title: Blue Rock 2017 Baby Blue Blanc Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made with the addition of 9% Viognier grown in Bennett Valley, this is a pleasing white layered in lushness and strong flavors of pineapple and mango. The tropical nature doesn't preclude brightness and balance, ending in a flourish of white flowers.

title: Bruliam 2016 Rocky Ridge Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This is a hearty red, completely characteristic of its rough-hewn, mountain appellation, a study in crushed rock and elusive mineral elements. The fruit is a mix of blackberry and black cherry dipped in chocolate, with seasonings of black and white pepper.

title: Calluna 2015 Calluna Vineyards Cuvée Red (Chalk Hill)
description: This is among the finest Bordeaux blends at its price point, from estate-grown fruit, and consisting of a majority Merlot. A dusty, oaky nose gives way to soft fleshy black fruit, cedar and black pepper, offering length and breadth with ease.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Well rounded aromas of red cherry, wood smoke, cowboy leather and earth make for a very accessible entry to the nose of this affordably priced wine. There is a strong snap to the palate and an impressively chalky grip, offering flavors of dark cherry, cranberry and, on the finish, some vanilla.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Searby Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A thick, rich and oak-laden white on entry, this coastal-influenced white is crunchy in green apple, melon and mango. Ultimately balanced and medium bodied in ripeness and body weight, it finishes in a pleasing note of Meyer lemon.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Swan Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: An estate wine made entirely from the Swan selection of the grape, this is a delicately layered high-toned red, stratified in rhubarb, strawberry and a burst of dried herb. It is light bodied and coastal in influence and style.

title: Charles Heintz 2015 Valentina Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the Heintz Estate, this is a floral, herbal wine with an edge of carbonic brightness and acidity to it, which works well in its light-bodied frame. Lithe on the palate, it offers a subtle take on pomegranate, rhubarb and black tea.

title: Côte West 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Crisp and floral, this wine has mid-tier structure and is ultimately clean, focused and unfussy in style. Restrained ripeness allows room for lemon zest, grapefruit and persistent acidity to shine.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Pear Valley Vineyard Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked meat, dried mint and roasted black plums combine for a complex sense of elegance on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are cohesive yet varied, with black currant, violet and roasted beef, upheld by tannins that are soft yet steady, with a growing presence toward the finish.

title: Raymond 2014 LVE Legend Vineyard Exclusive Red (Napa Valley)
description: This John Legend-led partnership is a blend of 55% Petite Sirah, 39% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. Bright, focused red cherry and cassis meets soft rounded tannin that contributes to a seamless offering of velvety texture.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Sicilia Vineyard Fiano (Sutter County)
description: This is a great change-of-pace wine, rather full in body and rich in texture, but with zesty grapefruit and rose petal aromas and buttery almond-like flavors that are more savory than simply fruity. As if Italian native Fiano wasn't a rare enough grape variety, the winemaker blended in 15% of Coda di Volpe, an even lesser known Italian variety.

title: Sierra Starr 2015 Super Nova Petite Sirah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine is nicely balanced considering how big it is in terms of tannin and body. The aromas ooze blueberry syrup and blackberry jam while the flavors are equally rich. The texture is quite firm and tannic but it feels right and will help the wine age well. Best after 2022.

title: Trentadue 2014 La Storia Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Black olive, truffle and a nuanced streak of graphite shine in this softly textured, focused and well-made wine. Cedar and dried herb complement quietly in the background, as integrated oak supports without distraction.

title: XYZin 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (California)
description: Nice depth and breadth come together in this richly packed, fruity and full-bodied wine. There's a hint of freshly baked bread in the aroma along with ripe plum and blackberry, while an almost jammy richness spreads across the palate and lingers on the finish.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Zoto Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light in the glass, this twist-top bottling offers tight and bright aromas of white rose petals, citrus peel and cold steel on the nose. The palate is much more exciting, with lime zest, baked nectarine, lemongrass and a hint of marshmallow, all set against a chalky structure.

title: Bella Grace 2014 Grenache Noir (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Gripping in texture and nicely saturated with ripe plum and smoked meat flavors, this is a compelling, interesting and complex wine. It shows light oaky, toasted accents on top of vivid red cherry and black-cherry flavors, while firm tannins and good acidity keep it appetizing.

title: Bella Grace 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Dark but friendly fruit flavors seem to saturate this medium-bodied wine, showing admirable concentration on the palate and good length on the aftertaste. Blueberry, boysenberry and mild spices give it lots to like. The wine is 100% varietal and has a firm texture without obvious tannins.

title: Bevela 2014 Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: A bit lighter in color than the typical Syrah, this wine, which comes in a squat wide bottle, shows strawberry, roasted fennel and a savory smoke quality on the nose. There's a bountiful burst of acidity at the tip of the sip, followed by a spice rack of flavors that give depth to the light, slightly sour red-currant fruit. It's very tangy on the finish.
designation: Old Fashioned Superstition Tierra Alta Vineyard

title: Castle Rock 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Vibrant blackberry aromas leap from the glass on this bottling, which also offers anise, violet and dried meat aromas. The palate combines smashed black currants with black pepper and violets, wrapped together by serious tannins.

title: David Bruce 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned red fruit is complemented by citrus-squeezed vibrancy in this full-bodied red, that presents as fleshy on the palate. A grit of oak adds power to the lengthy spicy finish.

title: Di Bruno 2016 Vermentino (Santa Barbara County)
description: Almost as pale as water in color, this is a fascinating wine. It starts with aromas of sweet peach blossom, candied tangerine rinds, honeysuckle and white rocks. There is a flash of sweetness on the zippy palate, but it quickly dissipates into a floral Asian pear-laced flavor profile. It is a perfect pairing for sushi.

title: Ehlers Estate 2015 Cabernet Franc (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the producer's own vineyards, this is a full-bodied take on the variety that drinks crisp and clean, shining in extracted red and black cherry that become succulent in the glass. Broadly expansive tannins support rather than distract.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Atoosa's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a meaty, brawny wine that's well-conceived and velvety smooth in texture. It ticks all the boxes on the variety, imparting well-defined layers of leather, black pepper, blackberry and gunpowder, lasting long on the finish in a trickle of spice.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Kalen's Big Boy Blend Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: Brawny and vibrant in acidity, this well-made full-bodied wine is a study in softened tannin and texture, with an oomph of weight and breadth. Raspberry and black cherry shine alongside black pepper and cinnamon with a lasting tease of brick and leather.

title: Foppiano 2014 Grant Station Carignane (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny, this is an inviting version of the variety, well-done by this historic producer. Baked plum is met by dusty, soft and rounded tannin structure, the oak supportive and happy in the background. The light spiciness adds a sense of richness. This is an ideal pizza wine.

title: Geyser Peak 2014 Merlot (California)
description: Concentrated black cherry and black olive aromas have an earthy edge in this full-bodied wine, while the flavors are dry and potent black fruits with touches of dark chocolate. It's a well-structured wine that will improve through at least 2021.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Van der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Rose garden and lavender aromas make for an inviting entry into this mountain-grown wine, as stiff, bristling acidity keeps it bright and lively in the glass. The texture is broadly soft and seductive, developing a silkiness on the finish.

title: Le Casque 2014 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Good fruit concentration and firm structure make a fine combination in this full-boded mouth-filling wine. It has a compelling dense chewy texture that supports lots of ripe black cherry and blackberry flavors with firm tannins.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Eastside Road Neighbors Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This multi-vineyard wine is sourced from hillside sites on the eastern edges of the appellation, including Foss and Calegari vineyards. Perfumed in clove and other baking spice tones, it has beautiful aromatics and ripe, firm tannins. The palate is marked by flavors of plum, rhubarb and cherry clafouti.

title: Turnbull 2015 Estate Grown Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This is a grainy, herbal red wine, boldly tannic and softly smooth in texture. It takes on mountain airs of sage, clove and tobacco, with a brushy graininess that adds complexity and intrigue. Blackberry, black cherry and currant give a tart fruitiness to the flavor.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Allen Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a robust white, exhibiting an exotic nose of spicy nutmeg and lemongrass. Fully oaked, it presents ripeness and concentration, a sign of its youthful vigor and the density of the vintage. Lemony acidity provides freshness against the bolder landscape of ripe apple and melon.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Precious Mountain Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Velvety in concentrated black-cherry and strawberry flavors, this age-worthy wonder also displays floral intensity and persistent, supportive tannins. Bright acidity is layered throughout, adding a sense of energy to the robust nature of its brambly undercurrent of dry-farmed fruit. Enjoy 2020–2025.

title: Phillips Hill 2015 Valenti Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Flavor complexity and a lot of finesse in the texture give just about everything a Pinot Noir can give. This wine, from a tiny, high-elevation vineyard, has enticing aromas of mint, clove, bay leaf and red cherry followed by vibrant flavors of red cherry and black tea (that are satisfying but don't overpower the firm texture), fine tannins and welcome acidity. Best after 2020.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Fox Den Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: From a cool site above Occidental, this shows smoky peppercorn, high-toned strawberry and raspberry notes—the fruit expansive and succulent throughout. Focused acidity provides a persistent energy and freshness, with a measured sense of oak.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Rochioli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: What a beautiful wine from the famed site still farmed by the Rochioli family. This is fresh, fruity and layered in citrus and Gravenstein apple, with interweaving acidity through flavors of lemon and lime. It has a stony quality that speaks to underlying minerality and a jolt of briny, salty air.

title: Hall 2014 Ellie's Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softened by 6% Merlot, this is a classically elegant wine, juicy in cranberry, cassis and teases of coffee bean, the tannins broadly etched and brawny in their youth. Integrated oak provides a spiciness of toffee and black licorice, as the aromas develop floral notions of violet as the wine opens in the glass. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Sanguis 2013 Pilgrim Syrah (Central Coast)
description: Deep and dark on the nose, this savory bottling, which is enhanced by bits of Viognier and Grenache, shows chocolate, seared beef, black currant, black pepper, rosemary and lamb aromas. It's soft and thick on the palate, where baked black-cherry flavors are spiced by star anise, coffee and cola, with energetic acidity popping on the finish.

title: Hall 2014 Eighteen Seventy-Three Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is brawny in tannin and big in oak, yet completely beguiling in an underlying delicacy of refined power. Chalky texture that traffics in tobacco and leather overlays elusive fruit and persistent earthiness, a mix of blueberry and blackberry bramble and mountain sage.

title: Martinelli 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is memorable and impressive—a ripe exploration of earthy goodness that's rich and velvety smooth. Spicy red fruit seduces amidst a well-developed core of complex orange peel and cardamom highlights, the oak well-integrated and supportive.

title: Pence 2015 Unum Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This organically farmed ranch on the eastern edge of the Sta. Rita Hills is producing amazing wines, including this bottling, which combines boysenberry, forest moss, gamy meats and a mud-pit earthiness on the nose. Focused and intense flavors of earth, ripe elderberry, sagebrush and a hint of truffle show on the sip, where the tannins are polished but structurally sound. Drink now–2030.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Drake Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Pear and melon meld with briny minerality on the palate of this well-integrated, mildly ripe wine. Lasting acidity supports spicy flavors of nutmeg, allspice and anise. The texture is harmonious and focused.

title: Roederer Estate 2011 L'Ermitage Brut Sparkling (Anderson Valley)
description: Dry and nicely mature, this complex wine is always among California's best bubblies. It combines great balance, tiny bubbles and some very interesting flavors that make it as appealing as a well-cellared white Burgundy at its peak. Hints of toast, butter and almond fill the aroma, while lemon, crisp apple and baking spices fill the palate. It has lively acidity that's softened by a good sense of body.

title: Castello di Amorosa 2016 Morning Dew Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Bold and spicy, this firmly built wine is the first Morning Dew Ranch vineyard-designate from the new owners of the estate. It starts with exotic and enticing aromas of fresh mint, basil and clove, then delivers pure, focused black fruits and a generous dose of new-oak spice on the palate. Healthy, lip-smacking tannins and firm acidity give it great structure, yet there's no hurry to enjoy this wine. Best after 2020.

title: Madrigal 2013 Final Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a warm welcoming wine, resolved in tannin and well-integrated overall. Black licorice, tobacco and clove add to the savory depth of dark, brooding character as an unexpected waft of violet perfume lurks beneath the full-bodied ripeness and concentration.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from grapes sourced from several sites across the appellation, this shows deft winemaking skill in its velvety, gritty texture and beautiful aromas and flavors of cured meat, rose petal and Asian five spice. Bright acidity lifts the tones of cranberry, rhubarb and mushroom earthiness, with a touch of crushed stone.

title: Daou 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this bottling shows hearty black fruit, peppercorn and a touch of asphalt. Classic Cabernet Franc flavors show through the richness of the palate, with notes of crushed pepper and loamy soil playing up against a boysenberry backdrop.

title: Furthermore 2014 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very pretty and precise on the nose, this bottling, which is quite delicate for the rich-leaning region, shows candied pomegranate, cinnamon spice, hibiscus and wet gravel on the nose. Wild strawberry and rhubarb flavors pop on the sip, alongside watermelon rind and a very rocky and tense minerality. There is tons of tannic and acidic depth.

title: Shafer 2015 TD-9 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a new offering from the producer, sparked by winemaker Elias Fernandez's desire to make a Merlot-based blend, rather than a varietal Merlot. It is an estate-grown blend of 56% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon and 16% Malbec. Rich and concentrated, it's delightfully robust and vibrant, offering a mix of blackberry, blueberry and caramel chocolate flavors that finish in soft, integrated oak.

title: Illumination 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Well integrated with a subtle fist of power, this wine is fleshy and fruit forward in apple and lime with a stony mineral edge. A twinge of fresh grapefruit flavor brightens the glass and adds to the overall complexity.

title: Jax 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: This stainless-steel fermented wine is monumentally light in profile and easy to love. Refreshing waves of watermelon, strawberry and dried rose petal will conjure happy memories of footloose and fancy free days at the beach.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 1850° Red (Lodi)
description: This big, robust wine blends spicy oak aromas and flavors with saturated blackberry and blueberry for a concentrated and layered effect. Made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and old-vine Zinfandel, it is full bodied, moderately tannic and quite mouthfilling in texture.

title: Kreck 2016 Teldeschi Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a site first planted in 1915, this is a tiny production of wine that's well worth seeking out. It speaks to old-vine dusty spice and dried sage, its texture softly beguiling and boldly full-bodied. It offers plenty of vigor and power.

title: Longevity 2017 Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: Get ready for a different take on Chardonnay in this earthy, layered wine. It has an unusually deep golden color, mature aromas like baked apples and a nutty, honeyed flavor akin to that of a late-harvest dessert wine. The flavors develop nicely with each sip and reveal subtleties of fruit and mineral that linger on the finish.

title: Midnight 2015 Solstice Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Rich aromas of blackberry jam, roasted meats and gravel are very well integrated on the nose of this bottling. The palate deftly balances pepper and charred meats with a strong black-currant core, adding touches of gravel and tobacco leaf toward the finish.

title: Navarro 2017 Rose of Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Delicate and light, this wine has floral and red-cherry aromas, subtle berry and cherry flavors and good acidity. It tastes absolutely clean and fresh—just what most people want in a rosé.

title: Olelo 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Broad, clean aromas of melon, mango and guava are cut by a chalky minerality on the nose of this bottling. Bright, tropical flavors on the palate glide along a river of fresh acidity.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Quixotic Cabernet Sauvignon (Adelaida District)
description: A rich and ripe style of Cab, this bottling starts with almost sweet-smelling aromas of black cherry, blackberry and toasted oak. Framed by a chalky mouthfeel, the palate offers tangy flavors of blackberry alongside savory touches of pepper and dried flowers.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Rector Creek Block 5 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 52% Cabernet Franc and 48% Zinfandel from an estate site, this is a burly, pleasingly round and rich wine, layered in dark chocolate, blackberry and leather. The finishing touches include swathes of lingering cinnamon and toasted oak.

title: Riley's Rows 2016 3x3 Red (North Coast)
description: This is a well-made blend of equal parts Merlot and Syrah, the wine smooth and brawny in a grip of leathery tannin, spicy cinnamon and pepper. It has a meaty profile complemented by tastes of dried herb, cedar and dark cherry.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Diego's Reserve Carmenère (Dunnigan Hills)
description: A leafy, minty streak adds interest to this nicely fruity, silky smooth and medium-bodied wine. It seems to melt in the mouth and coat the tongue with an almost jammy but not too heavy plum character that's easy to enjoy.

title: Rodney Strong 2014 Brothers Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: From a high-elevation site, this is a broadly structured, full-bodied wine, with strong elements of cedar, dried herb and brown sugar. A cherry jam flavor accents the luxuriously lush palate, ending on an earthy leather note.

title: Rowen 2015 Red (Sonoma County)
description: From a high-elevation site called Cooley Ranch, this combines 55% Cabernet Sauvignon with 26% Malbec, 17% Syrah and 2% Viognier. Clove, sage and peppercorn dot the smoothly textured palate, never holding back on the bold, juicy black-fruit flavor and the chocolate finish.

title: Skinner 2015 Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: A touch of violet in the aroma is about the only delicate thing in this deeply colored, intense and tannic wine. It shows a spicy oak influence, and has the varietal's usual inky hue, concentrated black-pepper and blackberry flavors and strong but well-integrated tannins. Best after 2023.

title: Tinto Rey 2015 Super Tinto Red (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This wine is big and bold yet still easy to drink. It has oodles of black fruit aromas, dense fruit flavors and generous dashes of spicy, smoky oak. The texture is firm enough to offer balance, yet is silky enough to remain enjoyable.

title: Burnside Road 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Intriguing mineral, savory and figgy aromas announce that this is not an average wine. The flavors are equally complex but well harmonized, blending fruity and earthy elements and supported by good acidity and a nice richness in texture.

title: Joseph Carr 2015 Family Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Oodles of jammy berry-like flavors pump up this rich and full-bodied wine from the maker of Josh wines. It has a broad mouth-coating texture, and hints of dark chocolate and vanilla on the finish.

title: Joseph Jewell 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Delicate up front with a backbone of thick weight and tannin, this wine is pleasant on the midpalate in cherry and pomegranate, with a floral tease of rose petal. This is a barrel selection of several sites, including Hallberg and Bucher.

title: Maxville 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: There is a considerable amount of Petite Sirah (11%) blended within this wine, which helps emphasize its big power and concentration. Earth, soy, currant, cedar and graphite accent a core of juicy blackberry and chocolate-covered cherry.

title: Hahn 2016 SLH Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Almond, yellow peach, daffodil and noticeable oak aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Dried lime peels, apple slices and lemon juice dominate the palate, which feels a tad dried out rather than fresh.

title: Harmony Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated dark red-fruit and a prominent cigar-box aromas show on the nose of this bottling, named after the tiny coastal town where the winery is headquartered. Cedar-led wood spice dominates the palate.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2014 Riserva Collection Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine has an alluring oak aroma, rich, spicy and oaky flavors and a mouth-filling texture due to full body and pretty strong tannins. The woody notes of cedar, tobacco, chocolate and cinnamon take center stage while fruit flavors play a secondary role.

title: Salvestrin 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tobacco, leather and cassis work well to present a united front of flavor in this full-bodied richly woven wine. Herbal and woody, with pronounced tannin, it finishes in cedar and pencil.

title: Barefoot NV Pinot Noir (California)
description: Light but flavorful and fresh, this wine has good varietal character, medium body and good complexity, too. Aromas of red cherry and tea lead to cherry and plum flavors, mild tannins and a bit of fresh acidity for balance.

title: Europa Village 2015 Vienza Barbera (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried blackberry, ripe red-melon and plum aromas meet with a touch of leather and funk on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit rustic, showing more leather as well as slightly sour red-plum-skin flavors. The tannins are very soft.

title: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: There's a solid crispness to the clean citrusy nose of this bottling, which also offers a bit of honeysuckle and white lily. The palate offers simple, nearly sweet flavors of red pear with a hint of bubblegum, framed by a chalky structure.

title: Europa Village 2016 C'est La Vie Private Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling shows pear flesh, apple blossoms and the slightest tinge of cut grass on the fruity, easygoing nose. Though it lacks a bit in texture, the palate shows fleshy apple and pear flavors as well as a touch of tropical guava.

title: Francis Coppola 2015 Kicker Cane Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Smoky oak meets thick rich meaty tones complemented by a richness of blackberry and black cherry in this light-bodied approachable red.

title: Hoopes 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky char on the oak emphasizes savory and earthy aspects of this weighty wine, a combination of tobacco leaf, pencil and compost. A hearty 9% Merlot is added, as are 3% Petit Verdot and 2% Petite Sirah.

title: McManis 2016 Jamie Lynn Vineyard Barbera (California)
description: Impressive for its combination of grapy richness and spicy oak notes, this medium-bodied wine is showy and attractive. It has moderate tannins and good acidity typical of the variety.

title: Roger Roessler 2016 Black Pine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Robust in earthy aromas, this wine is substantial on the palate, with big flavors of extracted raspberry that's nearly syrupy on the palate. Sizable tannin and oak play supporting roles.

title: Steelhead Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This screw cap wine has a strong earthy scent at first whiff, but mellows into fresh herbs, grapefruit and white pepper after a little airing . It has great acidity, medium body and the refreshing qualities most people look for in a Sauvignon Blanc.

title: MacRostie 2016 Wildcat Mountain Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Heady in honeysuckle aromas, this wine is thick and concentrated in crème brûlée richness, interwoven in baked apple and pear with pronounced oak.

title: McManis 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Smooth and easy to drink, this medium-bodied wine has plenty of fruit flavor, with shades of vanilla and nutmeg. The texture is silky, showing a hint of tannin but overall is ripe and juicy.

title: Cass 2017 Mr. Blanc White (Paso Robles Geneseo District)
description: Though light in the glass, this white blend shows extremely perfumed aromas of tuberose, passion fruit, tropical fruit soda and Juicy Fruit gum on the very ripe nose. Juicy flavors of mango, guava, papaya and Fruit Stripe gum show on the palate, which is clean yet a bit much.

title: Eberle 2017 Côtes-Du-Robles Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A darker shade of pink, this blend of 60% Syrah, 37% Grenache and 3% Viognier offers dark raspberry and mulberry on the nose, with a touch of rocky minerality. The palate is clean with rounded plum and turned earth flavors.

title: Hendry 2014 Hendry Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 27% Malbec, 20% Petit Verdot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon 20% Merlot and 13% Cabernet Franc. Together they form a tart tangy streak of acidity that supports leather, cedar and integrated oak. The tannins present as grippy and persistent.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: There's lots of sweet-seeming spicy oak in this full-bodied wine, yet it also has a good core of ripe blackberry and plum to keep it in balance. Moderate tannins and a mouth-filling texture give it heft.

title: Andis 2016 Bill Dillian Vineyard Sémillon (Amador County)
description: This wine smells earthy and minerally and tastes relatively austere due to firm acidity and not overly ripe flavors. Light to medium in body, it offers good savory, smoky notes and an inviting texture that seems to gain richness with time in the glass.

title: Bob Cabral Wines 2016 American Girl Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark cranberry in color, this medium-bodied wine is abundant in dark cherry, wild strawberry and melon flavors. The midpalate is powerfully built with bright acidity offering crisp refreshment.

title: Bodega de Edgar 2016 La Guera White (Central Coast)
description: An intriguing an ultimately successful blend of 80% Albarino and 20% Chardonnay, this bottling starts with intriguing tangerine, freshly cut melon and light almond aromas on the nose. It's racy on the palate with both bright, lasting acid and a pithy texture, offering rounded nectarine flavors and a hint of lemon cream.

title: Bucher 2017 Bucher Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: An inviting nose of wild strawberry and cherry open this delightfully focused and fresh wine. The acidity is refreshing and clear, supporting light-bodied layers of rhubarb and melon.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Classic Estate Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Light in color, there is lots of juicy pomegranate fruit on the nose of this bottling from the centrally located estate, alongside red-licorice and cinnamon scents. It's crisp, lively and fresh on the palate, with bright red-fruit and rose-petal flavors.

title: Croma Vera 2016 Maduro Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Smashed blackberry, purple flowers and loamy earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Sticky tannins frame the palate, though it's a fairly fresh take on the grape, with boysenberry and fresh purple flowers meeting with leather and smoked meat flavors.

title: Daou 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Fresh spring grass, lemongrass, grapefruit, pear blossom and a hint of flint show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is framed by a compelling texture that's both fleshy with stone fruit and racy with sharper lime rinds, providing great depth.

title: Eberle 2016 Eberle Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Those seeking a fresh, detailed Chardonnay from Paso Robles will be pleased with this bottling. Light, easy aromas of lemon balm, white peach and clarified butter into a palate full of lemon zest, creamy cherimoya and brioche flavors.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of black plums and purple flowers meet with savory roasted meat and crushed gravel on the nose of this bottling. Firm tannins frame the palate, holding up flavors of blackberry, black olive and dried herb, with a flash of vanilla on the finish. It's built to last, so drink 2020–2030.

title: Epiphany 2016 Gypsy Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Always one of this winery's best bang-for-buck bottlings, this blend of 36% Cinsaut, 30% Counoise, 21% Mourvèdre and 13% Grenache is extremely fresh, starting with aromas of strawberry, star anise, hickory and white pepper. The palate is juicy, spicy with pepper and zesty with acid, so chill it down slightly and drink up.

title: Estancia 2016 Stonewall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Oregano and lavender decorate the plump strawberry and mulberry flavors on this light, layered and elegant bottling. It's easy to sip on the palate, riding the balance beam between rounded dark-red fruit and allspice, framed by fresh acidity.

title: Justin 2015 Justification Red (Paso Robles)
description: Soft red-cherry aromas meet with dark spice on the nose of this 52% Cabernet Franc and 48% Merlot blend. Framed by firm, sticky tannins, the medium-bodied palate shows flavors of red currant, cedar and oak.

title: Pine & Brown 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This wine is exceptionally smooth and polished, showing a gentle but not too-soft texture that carries fresh apple and lime flavors and subtle oak accents like nutmeg and vanilla. With medium to full body, it feels like a barrel-fermented wine but without obvious oakiness, and shows good layering and concentration.

title: San Simeon 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this reserve bottling shows cassis, olive and savory earth aromas of dried herb and peppercorn on the nose. A roasted beef in blackberry sauce flavor meets with notes of black plum, mint and shaved chocolate on the palate.

title: Siduri 2016 Pratt Vineyard Sexton Road Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Minty sage and an intensely tart sense of citrus and rhubarb shine in this balanced, coastal-influenced red, which retains plenty of tannic power against its fresh bubbly acidity.

title: Sketchbook 2016 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This lightly earthy wine is soft in mouthfeel despite bright underlying acidity and fine-grained tannins. Hints of leather and barnyard lead to generous flavors of red and black cherry as well as light baking spices on the palate.

title: Skinner 2015 Eighteen Sixty-One Red (El Dorado)
description: This will be an outstanding dinner wine when a roast or steak is on the menu. It has a good, gripping texture and firm acidity that will stand up well to fatty dishes. A nice core of blackberry and black-cherry flavors is surrounded by hints of clove and cinnamon.

title: Zotovich 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Crisp aromas of candied cherry and raspberry are straightforward, while wet river stones add minerality and cola adds spice to the nose of this wine. Those elements converge on the palate, picking up ginger-spice and pomegranate juice flavors.

title: Galerie 2017 Equitem Sauvignon Blanc (Knights Valley)
description: This is bright in acidity and nicely textured, with an underlying lushness to the weight of the body. Peach and dried herb show most prominently on the palate, with a smoothness of stony mineral and lentil.

title: Al Lago 2015 Sonata Red (California)
description: Shaved dark-chocolate, cedar and black-cherry aromas show on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Syrah and 20% Sangiovese from the Santa Rosa Valley, a region that connects Los Angeles to Ventura County. Lighter bodied than expected on the palate, the bottling offers strawberry, cherry tomato, peppercorn and oregano flavors, and is still quite young.

title: Arista 2015 Perli Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Abundant fruit flavors that are so ripe they're almost sweet dominate this full-bodied, mouth-filling and seemingly soft-textured wine. It is generous with plummy cherry-candy notes and has soft tannins for a pillowy finish.

title: Bee Hunter 2016 Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: Aromas of fresh bread and baking spices lead to buttery appley flavors in this well-balanced and reasonably crisp wine. It is light to medium in body, but has a good sense of ripeness.

title: Cult X 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is velvety and full bodied, with a quiet power. Cherry, strawberry and black tea mingle around a jammy center of tannic intensity and toasted oak.

title: Firestone 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Strong aromas of dewy springtime grass, lime zest, pomelo rind and wet cement make for a pungent entry to this bottling. The palate is stony in flavor, with touches of pink lemonade, cut grass and lime rind.

title: Franciscan 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County-Napa County)
description: Remarkably fragrant in jasmine, this wine is light, balanced and well-integrated—a larger production offering that doesn't shirk on flavor or style, offering plenty of pretty bang for the buck.

title: Kula 2017 Picpoul Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Very light aromas of tangerine, dried lemon, dried apple and yellow-grapefruit pith show on the nose of this bottling of a grape that is slowly starting to show up solo more frequently. The palate is tangy and citrusy with flavors of grapefruit and underripe pineapple.

title: Kunde 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Juicy, soft, round and rich, this wine is fruit forward in blackberry and plum with an underlying hint of brown sugar. It finishes in black pepper and cinnamon.

title: Lava Cap 2017 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine balances a tangy citrus side against a rich texture and riper flavors of pear and apple that come out on the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Lush and expansive, this is a fleshy and ripe red with highlights of brooding rhubarb, strawberry and citrus flavors.

title: Portalupi 2016 L. Venturi Vineyards Charbono (Mendocino)
description: Full body and massive tannins make this an imposing wine that needs a juicy, fatty accompaniment at the table, or a number of years in a cool cellar to mellow. It has a deep, dark color, bold aromas of cranberry and dark chocolate, and tight fruit flavors like tart blackberries. The texture is dry and astringent. Best after 2023.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Madonne Blanc White (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Pear, apple, dried white flower and clay aromas show on the nose of this blend of 61% Roussanne, 17% Grenache Blanc, 17% Clairette Blanche and 5% Picpoul Blanc. Meyer lemon and pear flavors show on the sip, which is slightly flat in tannins and acidity.

title: St. Supéry 2017 Dollarhide Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in jasmine, this is a fleshy expression of the variety that's ripe, resolved and moderately structured. The fruit is a mix of fresh peach and green apple.

title: Tobias 2017 Lexi's Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino)
description: Combining light herb and mineral aromas with somewhat richer pear and fig flavors, this medium-bodied wine is fruity, smooth and shows some savory complexity too.

title: Uptick Vineyards 2017 Hilda's Rosé (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from a 50-50 marriage of Pinot Noir and Syrah, this is pungent in strawberry and an earthy array of charcuterie, its meaty edge doing a good job of complementing the fruit and bright acidity. It is refreshing with enough body to do well at the table.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Black Sears Vineyard Zinfandel (Howell Mountain)
description: This wine is tightly wound with plenty of tannic tension, a mountainous expression of menthol and turned earth seasoned in black pepper. Brambly blackberry flavor is accentuated by aspects of dark chocolate and coffee.

title: Black Box 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a rich style of Chardonnay that shows pear and apple aromas, with vanilla and butter flavors. The palate offers a good balance of ripeness and natural acidity. It's medium in body and smoothly textured without feeling too soft.

title: Andis 2016 d' Amador Barbera (Amador County)
description: This crisp, lip-smacking red wine has lots of cherry and cranberry flavors, light to medium body and good balance. It's an appetizing mealtime wine that doesn't steal the show.

title: Artesa 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This is a full-bodied white made in a bigger style, its flavors leaning into caramel apple, vanilla and sweet oak. It benefits from accents of gingersnap and nutmeg.

title: Balderdash 2016 Truth Serum Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Wet river stones, key lime and exotic apple aromas show on the nose of this bottling. It's very dry on the palate, offering broad flavors of yellow pear, lemon zest and grapefruit rind.

title: Bee Hunter 2016 Docker Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir Rosé (Mendocino)
description: This wine was released a year later than most. It has a light copper color, mild raspberry aromas and lively peach and raspberry flavors. Medium body and a bit of nice viscosity gives it a substantial mouthfeel that helps it stand out.

title: Buttonwood 2017 Musque Sauvignon Blanc (Los Olivos District)
description: Grassy aromas met with cut limes on the easy nose of this bottling from the historic winery on Alamo Pintado Road. Granny Smith apple flavors consumer the sip, which is smooth and refreshing.

title: Shafer 2015 One Point Five Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: Taut and leathery, this is a thickly tannic, incredibly structured and powerful wine, softened by 7% Merlot and 3% Malbec. Extracted black fruit is poised amongst earthy truffle, crushed rock and black pepper, the aromas and flavors integrated and built to age. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Crocker & Starr 2015 1 Post Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This bold wine is the flagship of winemaker Pam Starr's small fleet. It boasts dramatic, dark-fruit flavors, a firm muscular structure of fine-grained tannins and subtle acidity and great length on the finish. The palate layers dark chocolate on blueberry and black cherry. It will be a minor shame to drink it before 10 years. Best from 2024–2034.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Westside Farms Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Nutty and tart in acidity, this is complex in flavors of Granny Smith apple, lime and tangerine. The texture on the palate is lush yet structured in acidity, which gives this wine cellar-worthy potential. Enjoy 2025–2030.

title: Crocker & Starr 2015 Stone Place Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Rich and layered but not at all heavy, this beautifully polished estate-grown wine is made from the property's oldest vines. A taste starts with perfumed light oak spices in the aroma, wraps ripe black-cherry, blueberry and cola flavors around the palate and finishes with a moderate bite of tannin to carry the lingering cherry and baking spices. Best after 2024.

title: J. Lohr 2015 Signature Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this luxury-level bottling is pure and refreshing, offering aromas of black cherry, loamy soil, dried mint and caramel-laced coffee. The palate is framed by upright tannins, yet is soft enough to enjoy now, showing deep flavors of black currant, dried herb, milk chocolate and toffee. Drink 2020–2040.

title: Dierberg 2015 Steven Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Named after Jim and Mary Dierberg's grandson, this is part of a new reserve series, and the extra attention shows. Lush and candied aromas of red cherry, star anise and vanilla are lavish but focused and not overripe. The palate dries up a tad, adding lavender, violet, pepper and bergamot to the red fruit mix, proving extremely elegant and memorable.

title: Arista 2015 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral, reduced and mineral-driven, this blockbuster wine is tremendously complex and memorable. White peach, pineapple and white flowers intermingle with ease as teases of fennel, dried herb and ginger come to the fore. The oak lingers in wisps of salty caramel.

title: Levo 2016 E-99 No. 2 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Freshly pressed blackberry and açaí aromas meet with lilac and a touch of licorice powder on the nose of this bottling, which is bolstered by 13% Petite Sirah. The palate is loaded with black currant, blueberry and black-cherry flavors and finished on a hint of caramel and roasted plum, all wrapped in chalky tannins. Drink 2020–2031.

title: Roar 2016 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tightly woven on the nose, this single-vineyard expression shows aromas of Meyer lemon pith, tangerine spray, lime zest and almond cream. The palate is fresh and zesty in lime and grapefruit flavors, but a backdrop of smooth nut butter and poached nectarine brings it all together.

title: Sea Smoke 2015 Ten Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Baked cranberry, cherry, clove, vanilla bean and mossy earth show on the nose of this always much anticipated bottling from the region's first cult producer. The palate is tangy with rounded black-plum, star anise and black-peppercorn flavors. It's excellent now, but those tart elements will find more integration with patience. Drink 2019–2035.

title: Cattleya 2016 Cuvée Number One Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Lavish black cherry makes for a very focused but rich nose on this bottling, which is enhanced with aromas of vanilla wafer, tart black plum skins and polished purple flowers. There's a breezy lightness to the palate at first, yet it shows powerful flavors of black plum, violet and baking spice, all riding a pretty ripping acidity.

title: Daou 2015 Eye of the Falcon Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: There's a strong sense of tight black currant that's ready to pop on the nose of this bottling of Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot. The spice and mineral aspects are strong too, with aromas of black pepper, beef char, gravel and lava rock. The palate is dense in both charred and fresh dark-fruit flavors, finishing on a light touch of cocoa powder.

title: Hudson Vineyards 2017 Estate Grown Grenache Rosé (Carneros)
description: Pale copper orange in color, this is a tremendously delicious and thirst-quenching contemplation of 100% Grenache, whole-cluster pressed and fermented in both stainless steel and neutral oak. Lemon, grapefruit peel and green apple mingle around bristling, beautifully integrated acidity and a lasting burst of strawberry.

title: Massican 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and stony, this impressively complex and memorable white has a thirst-quenching grasp of gravelly minerality, a core element built around bold, beautiful flavors of fig, Meyer lemon and tangerine.

title: Rideau 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The nose of this bottling is extremely compelling and layered, showing red cherry, pomegranate, crushed gravel, juniper, thyme and cracked white pepper. The delicate yet flavorful palate combines tangy fruit with earthy herbs, pepper spices and a woody hint of mescal.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This appellation blend is better than the winery's single-vineyard expressions, at least right now. On the nose, loads of chaparral spice play against the cranberry, mulberry and roasted tomato backdrop, enhanced with a touch of shiitake mushroom. The palate packs strong sagebrush and eucalyptus flavors with salted plum fruits.

title: Della 2016 Graham Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Velvety and intense, this powerful wine shines in black raspberry, strawberry and a crispness of blood orange, melding the flavors together seamlessly into one whole. Rose petal aromas dot the landscape and add a floral component that complements the integrated Asian spice.

title: Flanagan 2016 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Lemon peel, tangerine and grapefruit mark the entry of this bright, focused white, filled with tension and gravelly texture. Lithe in spirit, it holds on to plenty of underlying richness and concentration, finding balance within an undeniable embrace of power.

title: J. Lohr 2014 Cuvée St. E Red (Paso Robles)
description: Roasted black cherry, caramel, vanilla, coffee, cola and toasted oak all show on the inviting, lush and layered nose of this Cabernet Franc-led blend.
