The lush yet appropriately edgy palate combines black cherry, dark chocolate and violet flavors. It's soft in texture, but structured by enduring tannins and ample acidity.

title: Arista 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, seductive and focused, this best of the best from the appellation is lengthy and complex, with tension on the palate. Dark cherry, wild cinnamon, crushed rock and black tea mingle effortlessly around a rich, dense roundness that never loses its balance or sense of delicious purpose.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2015 Arcadia Vineyard Chardonnay (Coombsville)
description: This is half barrel fermented and half fermented in stainless steel. It's gritty and expansive on the luxurious palate and well-made, offering layers of apple, pear and melon with a tease of anise on the lengthy full-bodied finish.

title: Lava Cap 2016 Viognier (El Dorado)
description: Far from simply fruity, this is a complex and sophisticated wine that shows how distinctive the grape variety can be. It relies on savory, minerally flavors that have wonderful subtlety and reserve. With each sip it settles a little deeper on the palate, lingering for a long finish buoyed by underlying acidity.

title: Occasio 2016 Del Arroyo Vineyard Chardonnay (Livermore Valley)
description: This new offering from John Kinney's tiny, consistently high-performing winery is big and muscular—very ripe and full bodied, generously laced with butter, toasted oak and almond flavors on a particularly creamy texture but not going over the top. Only about six barrels were made so it's rare, but worth a search.

title: Ancien 2015 Mink Vineyard Pinot Noir (Coombsville)
description: This is a lovely wine from a fine appellation, on the outskirts of the town of Napa. Rose, cassis and cherry-strawberry accent a chiseled structure of finely honed acidity and a succulent core that will equally please a crowd and connoisseurs.

title: Archium 2015 Faction Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a very prominent gamy quality throughout this wine, which starts with aromas of roasted lamb, charcoal, creosote and animal pelt. The palate takes that feral quality even deeper, with hints of Worcestershire sauce, dried lamb and peppery spice. Great for Northern Rhône lovers.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This is a stunning example of a wine that's fresh and light yet loaded with flavor. Buoyant aromas of black raspberry juice, dried fennel and wet slate lead onto a palate of snappy, slightly sour pomegranate, white pepper and sumac. The texture is equally complex, while the finish brings additional flavors of candied cherry and strawberry.

title: Grgich Hills 2014 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: With a slight nose of noble reduction, this seductive wine offers a wealth of balanced flavor and body, shining in tones of nuts, fennel, vanilla and mango. The oak is measured and supportive, never getting in the way, allowing the acidity to pierce through the fruit.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: There's impressive aromatic depth to the nose of this winery's top-tier bottling, with black cherry, olive, wisteria, wet wood, juniper and bay leaf all present. These elements converge on the sip, where black plum, light licorice and loamy earth flavors are enhanced by hints of truffle, nutmeg and vanilla. The tannic texture is upright yet not sticky or in the way.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Syrah (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Winemaker Dominic O'Reilly worked for years under Ojai Vineyard Syrah master Adam Tolmach, so it makes sense that his take on this historic property would be so excellent. Aromas of deep black plum fruit are cut by game, tar and wild herbs. The palate shows fresh purple fruit and violets alongside cracked pepper, held up by a strong tannic backbone.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Lewis MacGregor Estate Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Distinct tones of cherry pit and cinnamon-clove define the aromatics of this wine. It's a relatively full-bodied style of the variety from the east side of the appellation. Succulent and fleshy, it offers an array of salty, savory notes and is appealing in its velvety texture and roundness. Cola, warm baking spices and orange peel add to the complexity.

title: Wrath 2015 San Saba Vineyard Syrah (Monterey)
description: This wine explores the gamy, cool-climate side of Syrah, sourced from the winery's estate vineyard just outside of the Santa Lucia Highlands. Roasted coffee, burnt toast, charred lamb, powdered cocoa and elderberry jam show on the nose, while a gamy flavor comes through even stronger on the firmly structured palate.

title: Stolo 2015 Creekside Estate Syrah (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Roasted aromas of wet campfire, black pepper and roasted lamb crust meet with a pickled boysenberry scent on the nose of this bottling, the first time that this winery has made two estate Syrahs. (Hillside is the other.) The palate shows a strong lift from tarragon and mint, but the gamy quality is powerful as well as is the spice, with Szechuan peppercorn and kung pao beef flavors.

title: Storm 2015 Duvarita Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Mossy forest floor, pine needle, juniper and black pepper aromas show against a backdrop of elderberry on the extremely compelling nose of this bottling by Ernst Storm from a vineyard to the northwest of the Sta. Rita Hills. The palate shows much more of that foresty spice, as well as tapenade, wild berries, bay leaf and thyme.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Beautifully inviting in aromas of caramelized biscuit, vanilla wafer and baked apple, this is a creamy and lush white wine, full bodied and highly ripe in style. A lovely hit of tangerine-laced acidity keeps it fresh and fleshy.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Stolpman Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Drake Whitcraft is becoming a master at weaving a wide array of sensory experiences into very light wines. This starts with candied pomegranate, fennel bulb and cracked white pepper on the nose, then hits the palate with bright snappy red fruits, heavy peppery spice and a penetratingly bright acid profile. It goes down easy, but with complexity.

title: Whitehall Lane 2014 Millennium MM Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a blockbuster wine, full bodied and ripe, yet able to hold its considerable power in check. Its well-integrated oak and sizable structure give it weight and breadth, as well as age-worthy intrigue. Red currant, cedar and cigar box mark the flavor profile. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Wrath 2015 Boekenoogen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Winemaker Sabrine Rodems manages to tame the richness of this vineyard while retaining its hedonistic joy. Aromas of rose, pomegranate, hibiscus, rhubarb and dark spice lead into pillowy flavors of strawberry, raspberry and clove. This wine feels light and racy yet full of body and flavor.

title: Cordant 2015 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Paso Robles winemaker Tyler Russell applies that region's rich style to Sta. Rita Hills fruit for massive effect, great for lovers of ripeness and density. Aromas of baked vanilla cake, black cherry, loamy soil and star anise leap from the glass. Then the palate delivers loads of blackberry compote, licorice and clove, letting it all hang out yet bolstered by bright acidity and firm lavish tannins.

title: Dolin 2013 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Pomegranate, carnation, dried cranberry, potpourri, baked earth and vanilla cookie all come to the fore on the nose of this light but expressive wine from the historic vineyard. Stewed red cherry and cranberry arise on the palate alongside thyme, peppercorn and the slightest hint of game.

title: Justin 2014 Isosceles Red (Paso Robles)
description: This flagship bottling is still a whopper of a wine. This vintage, a blend of 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Cabernet Franc and 12% Merlot, offers barely ripe black cherry, green peppercorn and charred fennel on the nose. The palate is loaded with both savory and ripe flavors, from roasted black plums and charred beef to oregano and dill. Very complex and chalky in texture.

title: Peake Ranch 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong amount of newer wood aroma to these early releases from this new project. This bottling shows ample charred oak as well as roasted cherries, damp earth and crushed slate on the nose. Dark berries reaveal themselves on the sip alongside oak smoke.

title: Sbragia 2014 Gino's Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dusty and peppery, this big-boned wine leans into tart red-fruit flavors like cranberry and strawberry, with a thickness of tannin at its core. Leather, coffee and cinnamon swirl around adding seasoning to its overall length and breadth on the palate.

title: Trombetta 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a juicy exploration of the coast—a well-made effort that showcases notes of forest floor, black tea and savory pine. The black cherry and currant fruit leans dark and brooding, with an impressively balanced, medium-bodied hold on the palate.

title: Hess 2016 Shirtail Ranches Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This wine strikes a great balance between freshness and concentration. It smells clean and minerally, tastes crisp at first like lemon and jicama but also concentrated and layered in notes of rich pear and fig.

title: La Storia 2015 Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Leather, cedar and juicy blackberry fruit combine with force in this expansive, concentrated wine. Chocolate toffee layers provide additional richness and complexity, as the finish ends smooth.

title: Ravenswood 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Blended from several appellations across the county and adding in 14% Petite Sirah, 6% Carignane and 3% other black grapes, this wine succeeds in combining brambly black fruit ripeness with black pepper spiciness, expanding across the palate with grace and power.

title: Ravenswood 2014 Teldeschi Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From the historic site on the eastern edges of the valley, this wine is juicy, soft and layered in cranberry, cherry and vanilla. Expansive and robustly concentrated, it benefits from the addition of 19% Petite Sirah and 5% Carignane, seasoned in cinnamon and black pepper.

title: Reata 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a juicy, full-figured white, with a core of minerality that persists effortlessly on the palate. Wet stone, anise and green apple combine for maximum flavor within tones of well-integrated oak.

title: Talley 2015 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Butterscotch candies, lime spritz, concentrated honeysuckle and strong praline aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate combines salted butter, orange rind and white peach, with hints of white pepper, chamomile and smoke.

title: Viluko 2013 Malbec (Sonoma County)
description: Brushy in forest floor, this is a soft, velvety and bright red wine, with well-integrated oak that never takes over. A taste of cherry, blueberry and graham cracker combine nicely.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Blood Orange White (Santa Barbara County)
description: A numeric score on this wine is almost silly, as it's about as bizarre as wine gets. A shade of yellowish orange in the glass, this bottling shows aromas of vermouth, wood varnish, cherry and, yes, blood orange on the nose. The palate combines iron, sour peach, walnut oil and pine much like a Sherry. Fascinating, though not for the mainstream.

title: Bouchaine 2015 Estate Pinot Meunier (Carneros)
description: Among the few wineries to make a varietal wine of this grape, better known for blending, this is a smoky robust effort that's velvety and luxurious in texture. Full bodied and confident in oak, its flavors lean into strawberry, mint and bay leaf.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Big oak and a touch of reduction show through on the nose of this appellation wine, as full-figured flavors of crème brûlée, pineapple and Gravenstein applesauce play along a gravelly texture. Highlights of nutmeg and ginger spice the fruit well.

title: Miro 2015 Petite Sirah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This big bold wine is highlighted in raspberry, vanilla and smoky oak. Its texture is velvety smooth and rounded, while the flavors boast black licorice, black juicy fruit and a foundation of graham cracker crust.

title: Ravenswood 2014 Belloni Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a peppery, plummy wine with plenty of grip on the palate. Structured and meaty, it rides its ripeness with ease, showing a taste of vanilla soda on the finish. Mixed black grapes account for 25% of the whole and originate from vines planted around 1900.

title: Signaterra Benziger 2014 Three Blocks Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: Made a Demeter-certified blend of 70% Merlot and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon, this wine offers a tight-grained tannic structure, with notes of dusty clove, cassis and violet. A rocky mineral quality lurks beneath the full-bodied richness.

title: Stolo 2015 Estate Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Candied lemon peel, walnut, cashew and balsam aromas show on the rich nose of this bottling from a vineyard just east of the Pacific Ocean behind Cambria. The palate is viscous with flavors of lemon syrup and orange rind.

title: Clementine Carter 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light in color in the glass, this bottling shows fragrant touches of clean tropicality, including creamy cherimoya, light tuberose, refreshing apple blossoms and sliced Gala apples on the nose. There's a bountiful sizzle of acidity to the sip, where crisp pear and apple flavors meet with honeysuckle and Key lime spray.

title: Concannon 2016 Reserve Assemblage Blanc White (Livermore Valley)
description: Gorgeous ripe fruit flavors blend with baking spices in this high-toned but full-bodied and opulent wine. Nuances of peach, honeydew melon, honey and flowers are carried by a mouthfilling, nicely viscous texture.

title: De Loach 2015 OFS Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: An approachable, accessible and high quality wine, this offers flavors of crème brûlée seasoned in anise. It is a rich round expression of the variety that has an additional depth of baked apple and toasted oak.

title: Strange Family Vineyards 2015 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A darker shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling begins with aromas of sour lemon candies, sourdough bread, plumeria and jasmine. The palate is crisp and tart, with sour apple and lemon-rind flavors.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Carsi Vineyard Chardonnay (Yountville)
description: Generously oaky and exuberant in golden raisin, this has nutmeg and vanilla highlights on the nose, followed by an intensely rich round palate that veers into tropical territory. Underlying acidity helps to brighten the finish.

title: Le Mistral 2017 Single Vineyard Rosé of Grenache Blanc (Monterey County)
description: The spirit of experimentation is strong in this bottling, which is a pink wine made from a white grape thanks to a dry ice soak with red Grenache for 16 hours, delivering color without red juice. The result is a beautiful light-pink color, aromas of rose petal, strawberry and nectarine and a zippy palate with tightly wound flavors of lemon and tart raspberry.

title: Fleur 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (North Coast)
description: Light bodied and fresh tasting, this wine has a pale-pink color, delicate watermelon and raspberry flavors and a lively crisp mouthfeel. Its appetizing palate-cleansing aspect will pair well with a wide variety of foods.

title: Graziano 2016 Dry Chenin Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: This is a tight, lean and refreshing wine with minimal ripeness but great acidity and a very clean palate-cleansing texture. It's just the thing for acid freaks and will light up pairings like goat cheese and seafood.

title: Krupp Brothers 2015 Water Witch Stagecoach Vineyard Red (Napa Valley)
description: The majority of this wine is made from Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec, with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc, Tempranillo, Syrah and Merlot. Burly, expansive and rich, the tannins are billowy and supportive, underlining the strong flavors of mocha, tobacco and sage.

title: Andrew Murray 2016 Enchanté Curtis Vineyard White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There are very ripe aromas of apple, pear and guava on the nose of this blend of 55% Roussanne and 45% Grenache Blanc. There's a strong pithy character to the palate, which offers ripe flavors of honeysuckle, jasmine, guava and pineapple.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Le Cigare Blanc Reserve White (Central Coast)
description: Ripe aromas of pear flesh and yellow-apple slices meet with a hint of butter and lots of chalk on the nose of this blend of 67% Grenache Blanc and 33% Roussanne. The palate offers grapefruit-skin, nectarine and pear flesh flavors, proving very easy to quaff if not overly complex.

title: Clos La Chance 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Concentrated aromas of black plum, licorice, sage and bay leaf show on the fragrant nose of this bottling. The palate offers rounded flavors of cherry and plum set against tobacco and cedar shavings.

title: Fleur 2016 Estate Vineyards Vermentino (Carneros)
description: Waxy apple and melon dominate on the nose of this dry, moderately structured wine. It is a pretty and floral expression of the grape and does it justice within a light-bodied focus of ripeness.

title: Korbel 2014 Natural Sparkling (Russian River Valley)
description: Made in a Brut style from 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, this sparkling wine is high in acidity with a metallic edge to the palate, simple and dry in execution with highlights of tart applesauce and lemon zest.

title: Noble Vines 2017 515 Vine Select Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Always an easy-to-find rosé offering, this bottling shows raspberry, rose petals and a hint of flint on the nose. The texture is chalky, carrying riper strawberry tones and more crushed rock flavors.

title: Quivira 2016 Wine Creek Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This has a pretty nose and a meaty quality to the body and texture, and a medium-bodied core highlighted in melon, peach and apricot flavors. The finish revisits the floral.

title: The Lost Chapters 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in leather, violet and cedar, this wine is ripe and intensely dense in blackberry and blueberry cobbler, with a soft underlying structure.

title: Clos LaChance 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Broad aromas of yellow pear and nectarine meld with hints of butter and gunmetal on the nose. There is decent tension to the palate, where Bosc pear and Gravenstein apple flavors arise.

title: Dancing Crow 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Good varietal character comes through as this full-bodied wine moves from black-olive and light herb aromas through ripe black-cherry flavors and a rich velvety moderately tannic texture.

title: Davis Bynum 2015 Jane's Vineyard Clone 667 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral rose petal and black tea open the nose to this wine, which is simple in its approach, tangy in acidity and fruity in cherry and strawberry. There's an air of baking spice that dots the finish.

title: Entropy Cellars NV Fusion Lot 7 Proprietor's Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Tempting chocolate aromas and luscious, ripe berry and plum flavors make this medium-bodied wine hard to resist. It has a very smooth texture, soft tannins and a lingering finish that echoes spices and chocolate.

title: Fossil Point 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Delicate aromas of key lime, squeezed lemon and wet cement show on the nose of this widely available, affordably priced wine from the Center of Effort team. It's a lighter take on the palate as well, where fresh citrus spray, grapefruit and wet cement show.

title: Holly's Hill 2016 Petit Patriarche Red (El Dorado)
description: This is a well-mannered wine with complementary characteristics of fruit and spice in the aroma, blackberry and leather in the flavor, and richness matched with light tannins in the texture. It's full bodied and well balanced.

title: Chacewater 2014 Nell Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This gorgeous wine is soft and gentle on the palate, with concentrated, layered flavors and a full body. Aromas of black cherry, blueberry and cassis lead to cherry and dark chocolate on the palate, while a generous layer of fine-grained tannins lightly coats the palate. One of the top Cabernets from Lake County, it will be best through 2024.

title: Etude 2015 Pinot Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Robust and dark, this wine broods in dark fruit, marked noticeably by a velvety seductive texture of tightly wound tannin and oak. Medium in weight, it remains in balance and freshly lush—a calm, concentrated expression of coastal grapes.

title: Iron Horse 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Freshly cut green apple shines brightest in this no-oak white, which manages to be crisp and creamy nonetheless. Tart acidity lies underneath a lush, dense texture of flavor akin to crème brûlée.

title: Lang & Reed 2016 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and entirely from grapes grown in the Oak Knoll District, a cooler section of the valley. Aged minimally in both French oak and stainless steel the wine is noteworthy for its crispness and fleshy texture. Peach and apricot figure prominently alongside honey oak and a tease of salty brine. This is one of Napa's classic whites for good reason.

title: MacRostie 2015 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Shy in its voluptuousness at first, this wine is taut in lemon and hazelnut goodness, with soft subtle oak in support of the fruit. A persistent streak of grapefruit intensity adds further freshness and vibrancy to the core of overall complexity and smooth, rounded richness.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2014 Reserve Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Livermore Valley)
description: Beautiful oak aromas and flavors intertwine perfectly with ripe fruits like black cherries and blackberries in this rich, concentrated and complex wine. Great balance between rich fruit, firm tannins and light acidity make it lively but mouthfilling at the same time, while the finish is delicious and lingering.

title: Smith-Madrone 2015 Chardonnay (Spring Mountain District)
description: From the exceptional site atop Spring Mountain, this white is lovely and complex, a mix of sharp tangerine, orange and lime flavor that packs within its layers of fruit an undeniable thirst-quenching acidity. The oak is supportive and subtle, playing a supporting role with deft ability.

title: Sojourn 2016 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the tremendous site overlooking Sonoma Valley, this is a creamy, lushly crafted white, with a freshness of tangy lemon meringue, pear and orange at its core. Salty vanilla and toasted oak give it some richness and concentration while remaining balanced and bright.

title: The Hilt 2015 The Old Guard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a damp-forest-floor quality of pine needles, turned earth, moss and exotic wood smoke to the nose of this bottling, which gives depth to the black-raspberry and caramel aromas. A zippy acidity carries from the front to back of the sip, where more forest-like flavors of juniper and bay leaf meet with hickory and boysenberry. The firm structure ensures ageability.

title: Villa Creek 2015 Avenger Red (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly pressed blackberry meshes with slightly reductive hints of tar on the nose of this blend of 70% Syrah, 10% Petite Syrah, 10% Grenache and 10% Mourvèdre. Asphalt flavors rise on the palate along with deep elderberry, sagebrush and wild thyme and oregano, framed by very firm tannins that penetrate into the finish.

title: Aftermath 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This small-production wine offers a classic nose of cedar and clove before introducing itself on the palate as soft, pleasing and plumply ripe. The full-bodied weight offers integrated, fleshy flavors of mocha and plum that linger with ease on a lengthy finish.

title: Bruliam 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Deep and hearty aromas of boysenberry, hickory smoke, iron, bay leaf and forest floor show on this single-vineyard expression. Dark rhubarb, baked strawberry and red plum pop on the sip, with healthy pinches of mace and cinnamon spice. It is very complex.

title: Epoch 2014 Veracity Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: The dense yet fresh aromas of black currant, violet and lilac make for a beautiful aromatic core to this blend of 66% Grenache, 18% Mourvèdre and 16% Syrah, which is lifted by anise. The palate is also thick with dark fruits yet cut by tarragon and wild mint, riding a fairly sticky, heavy frame that still needs time to develop.

title: Lieff 2016 Alamo Creek Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (San Luis Obispo County)
description: From a remote vineyard located on red soils in the middle of nowhere, this is a very bright bottling that offers aromas of honeysuckle, crisp yellow apples, pear skins and tangy kumquat rinds. There is extreme energy to the sip, where Asian pear, lime peel and more crisp apple flavors converge. It's a property to watch.

title: Longoria 2015 Sanford & Benedict Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Veteran Rick Longoria's take on this historic vineyard starts with dark cranberry and ripe plum notes on the nose, and then comes a slightly gamy quality alongside crushed gravel and sweet sagebrush. The palate carries boysenberry, loamy soil and more chaparral spice, with an intriguingly layered texturality.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Zinfandel (Red Hills)
description: It's great to find a big dry wine like this that has good structure without giving up the expansive berry flavors that Zin does so well. The aromas are potent with ultraripe blackberry and black cherry, then the mouthfeel has good gripping tannins for a lip-smacking finish.

title: Peter Franus 2016 Albariño (Napa Valley)
description: This lovely white is sourced from one site, the Stewart Vineyard in Carneros. It offers incredibly inviting aromatics and high-volume freshness, a nice combination that's balanced and ready for seafood. Peach and apple crispness further define it.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2016 Coast Grade Vineyard Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: This bottling is still quite young, which explains why it simply gets more interesting the longer that it's open. Aromas of red cherry, vanilla, rose petal and baking spice drop into a palate full of hibiscus, potpourri, lavender and Earl Grey tea flavors, which all grow more complementary and delicious with time.

title: Villa Creek 2015 High Road James Berry Vineyard Red (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Zesty black currant, rich milk chocolate, hints of caramel and a flash of dried sage show on the nose of this blend of 60% Syrah, 20% Grenache and 20% Mourvèdre. It's thick and a bit chunky on the palate at this early age, carrying flavors of loamy soil and black currant syrup, set against a very chalky texture.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Methode Ancestral a|muse Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Cloudy in the glass and strong in the excited bubbles game, this pet nat shows lots of apple-driven aromas, from Pink Lady to Pippin, as well as white rose petals, Anjou pear and only the slightest hint of yeasty funk. It's also very clean, crisp an tight on the palate, with Bosc pear, grapefruit pith and citrus skin tang on the finish.
designation: Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Methode Ancestral a|muse

title: Raymond 2015 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Perfumed in violet, this is a soft, integrated and subtle wine, sweet in oak and rich round cherry flavor. Made entirely from one variety, it shows the power and grace of the appellation and the dense concentrated vintage.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Estate Grenache (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Concentrated aromas of pomegranate and cherry meet with more complex aromas of crushed rocks and wet wood on the nose of this estate bottling. There is brightness and lightness to the elegant palate, where rose, hibiscus, red fruit and cedar flavors intermingle.

title: Satyre Wines 2017 Sinfonia Vermentino (Los Carneros)
description: This is a tiny production wine, floral and acid-driven with an underlying note of biscuit. Barrel-fermented and then aged in both neutral French oak and stainless steel, it is well-integrated and lightly ripe, with focused flavors of Meyer lemon, lime and fig.

title: Scharffenberger NV Brut Rosé Excellence Méthode Traditionnelle Sparkling (Mendocino County)
description: This is a mellow, subtle wine that is quietly concentrated and polished. Mild raspberry and cinnamon aromas lead to crisp apple flavors on the palate. It shows good balance and a refreshing mouthfeel that's full of fine bubbles.

title: Shannon Ridge 2016 High Elevation Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: This full-bodied wine has a flinty, earthy aroma and dense flavors of blackberry and blueberry. The palate shows lots of richness and concentration, which makes for a lingering fruit and spice finish. It is well balanced, doesn't overdo the oak and will be a good wine to stock up on.

title: Alara 2015 Tempranillo (Central Coast)
description: Ripe black-currant, baked fig, clove and ginger aromas show on the rich nose of this bottling. The palate is also quite ripe with thick fig cake and gingerbread flavors, though framed by chalky tannins and lots of acid, proving very Rioja-like.

title: Alara 2016 Boudoir Red (San Benito County)
description: A clean bouquet of crushed roses and purple flowers, baked boysenberry with vanilla and rich spice cake show on the nose of this blend of 50% Sangiovese and 50% Tempranillo. Clove, gingerbread and tangy black-plum flavors are evident on the balanced palate.

title: Balderdash 2013 Trademark Red Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: There is intense color and even a dark-chocolate kick on the nose of this bottling, along with more usual aromas of baked berry, plum jam and clove. The tannins are a tad sticky on the sip, carrying boysenberry flavors and plentiful acidity.

title: Balletto 2015 Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a medium-bodied white offers plenty of personality, displaying tones of vanilla wafer and Meyer lemon. These flavors combine effortlessly on the palate to provide a well-balanced experience.
designation: Cider Ridge Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Balletto 2016 Emerson Block Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is earthy, ripe and lush in texture. The palate is velvety and generous, displaying dark cherry and raspberry flavors, with lavender, rose petal and earthy forest-floor tones backing it up.
designation: Emerson Block Burnside Road Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Duckhorn 2015 Merlot (Atlas Peak)
description: Grown at high elevation, this is 100% varietal. Thick in mocha, oak and dusty sage, it speaks to strong tannin and oak, providing a punch of full-bodied ripeness and chocolate-covered plum.

title: En Garde 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Thick and dense in blue fruit and billowy tannin, this is a well-made, hyper ripe red, generous in oak and a lasting thread of leather and black pepper.

title: Frank Family 2015 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 11% Petite Sirah, this wine is soft, round and richly layered in strong flavors of baked plum and dark cherry. It balances its ripeness with nuanced aspects of toasted oak, firm tannin and moderate acidity.

title: Kitson 2016 Haynes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Coombsville)
description: This is a highly earthy, delicate and floral wine from a nook in the southern end of the Napa Valley. The acidity is present and supportive of its bold, beguiling flavors of strawberry, raspberry and vanilla tea.

title: Kula 2017 Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Clean aromas of chilled Asian pear flesh, key lime and a chalky mineral streak show on the tightly wound nose of this bottling, which includes 11% Picpoul Blanc. The palate is tense and crunchy in texture, show pear and lime rinds as well as apple flesh in the midpalate.

title: Maxville 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This has small amounts of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, the whole offering a soft integrated taste of blackberry, cherry and cassis. Lingering seasonings of clove and leather add to the complex experience.

title: Michael David 2015 Ink Blot Cabernet Franc (Lodi)
description: This broad-textured, deeply fruity wine is also generously spiced with oak. It shows tempting black-cherry and blackberry flavors, as well as plentiful vanilla, nutmeg and milk chocolate accents. These flavors are housed on a richly tannic texture and lead to a spicy finish.

title: Pine Ridge 2017 Chenin Blanc-Viognier (California)
description: Crisp, lively and refreshing, this medium-bodied wine offers a tangy citrus flavor and a light mineral accent that adds complexity. It's a natural pairing for seafood.

title: Ramey 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark, brooding black fruit and strong tannin greet a rich, interwoven palate of full-bodied ripeness and cola in this lush red wine. The grapes are sourced from the warmer reaches of the appellation and show deep concentration lifted by moderate acidity.

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sanguine in red currant and a touch of meat, this wine offers a bright, underlying thread of dried herb and cedar, flavors that are built around a wall of ample tannin and oak.

title: Imagery 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Delicious ripe apple and pear aromas meet equally vivid and enjoyable fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, soft and easy-drinking wine. Just a touch of lemony acidity brings a little lift on the palate and keeps the finish nicely fresh.

title: JCB 2014 No. 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a massive wine, compressed in black fruit, tobacco and cigar box. It has a big-boned nature to its structure and a tight embrace of oak and tannin. It offers plenty of heat around the baked blackberry and currant character.

title: Pence Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very delicate on the nose, this bottling from Blair Pence offers light lemon, fresh nectarine and wet cement aromas. It's very tight and edgy on the sip, with lime flavors and a pinch of baking spice, proving crisp and refreshing.

title: Victor Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Good balance, medium body and a nice blend of fruit and spice flavors make this wine taste very well put together. It has crisp apple and lemon aromas, deceptively concentrated nutmeg, fig and pear flavors that slowly unfold on the palate, and a good lingering finish.

title: Wente 2016 Riva Ranch Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's a classic California Chardonnay backbone to this bottling, with aromas of toasted wood, crème brûlée, poached pear and apple custard, yet there are also more delicate hints of chalk and orange blossom as well. The palate combines ripe Pink Lady apples and vanilla spice and caramel richness.

title: Wine Guerrilla 2015 Paradise Lane Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Eucalyptus, Bay leaf and mint figure in prominently to the nose of this wine, an herbaceous expression of the variety that's sinewy in thick blackberry, almost to a syrupy level. From head-trained older vines, it retains that mix of fruit and earth to the powerful end.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2015 Zoto Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Reserve aromas of black cherry, plum, clove and tarragon-crusted roast pork show on the nose of this bottling. The palate combines pomegranate and rhubarb with subtle star anise spice, proving altogether delicate and easy to drink.

title: Brander 2016 Merlot (Los Olivos District)
description: This twist-top bottling is fun and fresh, perfect with a light chill. Aromas of red plums, strawberries, carnations and cola lead into a zippy palate full of plum and more strawberry fruit.

title: Cherry Pie 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County-Monterey County-Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a fresh light spicy wine that's well balanced and flavorful without overdoing the body or extract. It blends red cherry, cinnamon, vanilla and strawberry and has good acidity and a touch of tannin to heighten the mouthfeel.

title: Dancing Bull 2015 Zinfandel (California)
description: Hints of vanilla bean and maple bar in the aroma make this full-bodied wine seem more sweet than it is, because it responds on the palate with mouth-filling fruit, moderately firm acidity and tannins. It finishes nicely dry, quite fruity and generous.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2016 Rava Blackjack Vineyard Grüner Veltliner (Monterey)
description: Crisp Anjou pear, white flowers, lime zest and chalk show on the nose of this bottling. There's a great interplay between the high acid and tannic grip on the sip, where ripe Asian pear and red-apple flavors slide into a squeaky, taut finish.

title: HammerSky 2014 Extraction Special Selection Reserve Petit Verdot (Paso Robles)
description: Bright blackberry jam aromas meet with dusty earth, baked bricks and a hint of caramel on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very ripe with blueberry, cassis and baked licorice flavors, very lush and comforting, if a tad sweet.

title: Muscardini 2013 Gracie Creek Vineyards Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Candied cherry flavors are brashly ripe and juicy in this simple effort, the structure moderate and the texture oaky and tannic. Meat, black licorice and blackberry jam meld along a density that's hard to shake through the big finish.

title: Steele 2016 Pinot Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tightly wound aromas of lemon skin meet with hints of toast and pecan wood on the nose of this bottling from Bien Nacido Vineyard. Mandarin pith, lemon rind and toasty croissant flavors show on the subtle palate.

title: The Federalist 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: This full-bodied wine packs in ripe dark-fruit flavors of blackberry and boysenberry, and has smoky oaky accents to add some welcome complexity. Adding in 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, 2% Malbec and 2% Merlot accounts for some of that complexity. The wine is concentrated and mouth filling in texture without being too tannic.

title: Tower 15 2015 The Jetty Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This blend of 50% Grenache, 29% Syrah, 14% Carignane and 7% Cinsault is a versatile and well-priced table wine for all occasions. Aromas of hibiscus, berry, cola, rose petal and pine smoke lead into a palate where bay leaf and pepper hold up the red fruit.

title: Lafond 2014 Pommard Clone Lafond Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a strong density of dark fruits on the nose of this clonal selection, along with muddy clay, crushed slate and fennel pollen. The palate is thick with boysenberry jam, star anise and vanilla, though the strong flavors are competing rather than collaborating.

title: Lois Rae 2015 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Bright, fresh, fruity aromas and flavors are supported by a good firm texture in this very clean, tangy wine. It has a bracing mouthfeel, plenty of red cherry and raspberry flavors and light to medium body.

title: OZV 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Oozing with blackberry jam aroma and flavor, this medium-bodied wine has a very rich, lightly sweet mouthfeel, tons of blackberry and boysenberry on the palate and a toasty, spicy, lingering finish.

title: Reyes 2015 Grenache (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: This is the strongest showing yet from this region northeast of Los Angeles, with aromas of berry, hickory smoke, slate and rust on the nose. There is a rustic quality to the sip, with fennel seed-laced salami and macerated plum flavors.

title: Domaine Anderson 2016 Estate Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: A an earthy streak adds a twist to the generous fruit and butter notes in this medium-bodied wine. It has smoky, wet-earth aromas, peach and apricot flavors and lively acidity.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Claret (Paicines)
description: A blend of all five Bordeaux red grapes, this bottling shows charred black plum, forest underbrush and pencil shavings on the nose. Woody flavors meet with blackberry fruit and burned hazelnuts on the palate.

title: Gehricke 2014 Ponzo Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and aged in both new French and American oak. Turned earth and grilled mushroom provide savory contrast to soft jammy layers of cinnamon, plum and blackberry.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of crisp apple, poached pear and a hint of chalk show on the nose of this widely available, reliable bottling. It's tightly wound on the palate, with pungent lime, pear and honeysuckle flavors.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (High Valley)
description: This wine has modest fruit and spice flavors, a relatively firm texture and medium to full body. It is elegant in texture, well balanced but unassuming in its restrained flavors.

title: Jellyfish 2017 White (Central Coast)
description: A fun label great for seaside sipping, this bottling starts with wispy aromas of honeydew and lime-laced cream on the nose. It's crisp like Alpine river water on the palate, with lime and tropical hints of tuberose and plumeria arising toward the finish. Would pair with many foods, from spicy Asian to fresh shellfish.

title: Keller 2013 Late Harvest Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This small offering of late-harvest richness is varietal in its full embrace of mushroom earth and woody tannin, the fruit rich in strawberry and cherry cobbler.

title: Kopriva 2017 Ricci Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is a delightfully crisp, seamless and simple white, the only wine made by this producer. Grapefruit, lemon and lime flavors contribute freshness to a crisp, floral personality that's unfussy and fun.

title: Kula 2016 Estate Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of black currant, blackberry syrup, root beer float and charred meat show on the nose of this bottling. It's a tad syrupy on the palate, where caramelized black-fruit and tar flavors are cut by decent acidity.

title: Kunde 2016 Wildwood Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: Tart and tangy in apple and lemon, this white has a juicy midpalate of layered vanilla crème brûlée. It finishes dry and focused with a twist of lasting freshness.

title: Kunde 2017 Signature Rosé (Sonoma Valley)
description: From estate-grown grapes, this blends 82% Grenache with 18% Syrah. Crisp and fruity in strawberry and peach, it has undertones of vanilla on the midpalate and bright floral elements that linger on the finish.

title: MacRostie 2016 Day Ranch Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is an attractive, smooth and nicely fruity wine that is lightly spiced with oak. Medium bodied and easy to drink, it offers good black-cherry and black-plum flavors and mild tannins in the texture.

title: Maddalena 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Black-cherry and caramel aromas show on the familiar, straightforward nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. It's very cleanly made, with crushed blackberry, crushed slate and smoked wood flavors on the palate.

title: R. Bryce 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe Bing cherry and clove aromas make for a clean and familiar entry to this bottling, a new label from the folks behind Bien Nacido Vineyard. It's boisterous and juicy on the palate with red currant and raspberry, held together by ample tannins.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Meyer lemon pith and orange flesh show on the very light and easy nose of this bottling from the region's pioneer winery. The palate is much more intriguing, with a chalky, tense frame delivering lemon-lime flavors.

title: Skinner 2017 Smithereens White (El Dorado)
description: Fruit-forward and quite ripe in flavor, this medium-bodied wine offers dramatic apricot aromas, rich vanilla and butter flavors and a lingering finish.

title: Spicy Vines 2017 Violet Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is made from a field blend of Cinsault, Grenache, Carignan and Zinfandel, coming from a nearly century-old vineyard. It was aged six months in neutral Pinot Noir barrels. Dark ruby in color it offers thick, fruity flavors of raspberry and strawberry.

title: Tessier Winery 2016 Alegria Vineyards Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)
description: This is from a great site near the town of Healdsburg planted to an array of heirloom, less-obvious varieties. Juicy and dusty, it has a wealth of tangy currant and cassis flavor and high-toned acidity, with a simple thread of cedar and dried herb.

title: Tower 15 2017 The White Cap White (Central Coast)
description: This blend of Grenache Blanc, Roussanne, Marsanne and Viognier begins with aromas of lemon preserves on toast with the slightest hint of butter. It tightens up on the sip at first, then opens to show guava-jelly flavors and more lemony elements.

title: Wilson Creek 2017 Chloe Vineyard Winemaker's Select Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Very ripe aromas of guava bubblegum and key-lime pie are leveled by crushed gravel on the nose of this solid white wine from Temecula. Lime leaf and lemongrass show on the sip, which is Sauvignon Blanc-like and finishes with a flash of sweetness.

title: Sand Point 2016 Merlot (Clarksburg)
description: Sweet oak aromas and candied fruit flavors give this medium-bodied wine a pop personality. It has a soft texture, light tannins and quite a bit of vanilla and oak spices.

title: Exitus 2016 Red (California)
description: A touch of Bourbon-like sweetness softens this full-bodied wine that is very fruity, smooth and easy to sip. It doesn't go to the smoky extremes of others in this category, and has an eye-catching bottle design that evokes an old-fashioned whiskey bottle.

title: Josh Cellars 2015 Family Reserve Red (Lodi)
description: Vanilla and milk chocolate aromas lead to jammy plum and strawberry flavors and a touch of maple syrup in this medium-bodied, soft and slightly sweet wine.

title: Kendric 2015 Reward Ranch Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This medium-bodied wine is well-balanced, moderately flavorful and has a good, gripping texture. Light red cherry and cranberry are the flavor focal points.

title: Via Romano 2014 Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This is a smooth and rounded red with friendly fruit flavors and hints of butter and vanilla. Medium bodied and not too concentrated, it's easy to sip.

title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Wisps of lime and tangerine in the aroma lead to some riper richer flavors in this medium-bodied and soft-textured wine. It has light butter and vanilla accents and low acidity.

title: Spicy Vines 2015 Edge Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an old field blend of Zinfandel, Petite Sirah, Carignan, Cinsault and Grenache, cofermented together and aged nearly two years in French oak, a small percentage of it new. The wine is thick in muddled red fruit and possessed of a soft rich texture.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Le Grand Vin Red (Fair Play)
description: Big, oaky and already well aged, this full-bodied wine has plenty of structure filled in with spicy cedary aromas and vanilla and black-cherry flavors. Firm tannins give it a hefty mouthfeel.

title: Bianchi 2015 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Quite shy on the nose, this bottling offers dark red fruit and sandalwood with patience. The palate is a bit flat, with basic red-fruit and wild herb flavors.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Red (California)
description: This generous and fruity wine doesn't overdo the barrel treatment but packs a lot of blackberry and raisin flavors into a medium-bodied frame. Mild tannins add some good structure to the mouthfeel to balance a touch of sweetness.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2016 Stony Point Vineyard Pinot Noir (Petaluma Gap)
description: This wine doesn't taste fully integrated, its marriage of fruit, oak and tannin still elbowing each other for space. The aromas are earthy and tinged in a flash of forest.

title: LangeTwins 2015 River Ranch Vineyard Montepulciano (Lodi)
description: Dramatic oaky aromas and flavors make this estate-grown wine a bit of a one-note song, as wood smoke and black pepper dominate. It is full bodied, moderately tannic and has a mouth-filling texture.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Rector Creek Block 4 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 52% Petit Verdot with 48% Zinfandel for an intensely tannic expression of dried herb and clove that overwhelms.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 Red A Premium Red (Amador County)
description: Fairly rich and ripe tasting, this medium-bodied wine has strong oak aromas and flavors that register as cedar, tobacco, dill and pine. It is light in terms of tannin and acidity, has a touch of sweetness and feels very smooth in texture.

title: Lorimar 2015 Red (California)
description: Blatant oak aromas and flavors dominate whatever fruit flavors might lie underneath. It smells sweet and spicy, tastes spicy and has moderate tannins and high alcohol.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a fruity, soft-textured and sweet wine with cherry and raspberry flavors. The mouthfeel is rich and plush and the acidity is quite low.

title: Trentadue 2016 Old Patch Red (California)
description: This wine is very fruity, smooth and polished, showing light oaky touches on ripe plum and black-cherry flavors that finish on the sweet side. The texture is soft and acidity feels low.

title: Kenwood 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Creamy thick with a candied midpalate of watermelon Jolly Rancher and strawberry jam, this has elements of dried herb and jalapeño.

title: Spann Vineyards 2014 S & M Syrah-Malbec (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 67% Syrah with 33% Malbec to powerful effect. The wine is thick in nondescript red berry and blueberry notes and oaky tannin.

title: The Archivist 2017 Rosé (Lodi)
description: This light-bodied wine has a vivid light ruby color, plenty of ripe and fresh strawberry and cherry candy flavors and a soft, almost sweet balance.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Pinot Grigio (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of wet cement, apple, lime skin and a hint of flint. There is decent acid and texture to the sip, where light flavors of pome fruit and tangy lemon show.

title: Sean Minor 2017 4B Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This is a fruity and fresh-tasting wine that's light to medium in body, very aromatic and has flavors like a fruit salad of apples, melons and peaches with a dash of lemon juice. All that fruitiness verges on sweetness, so dry-wine stalwarts beware.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is intensely earthy and big boned, with a shock of tart acidity. It flourishes in the appellation's herbal mint and pomegranate.

title: Castle Rock 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: This wine presents vibrant citrus-zest aromas and clean, fruity, almost-sweet flavors on a rich texture. It has more thickness and mouthfeel than many renditions of the grape, and feels low in acidity.

title: Heavyweight 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Ripe fruit flavors dominate this full-bodied but soft-textured wine as it goes from mulled cherry aromas to baked blueberry flavors wrapped in mild tannins and barely a trace of acidity. While not sugar-sweet it has a dessert-like quality.

title: Millésimé 2013 Le Reflexion Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very ripe and overextracted aromas of berry and grape meet with a touch of vanilla bean on this rustic bottling, which includes 12% Viognier. The palate explodes with extreme amounts of acid, which carry candied boysenberry and lavender flavors.

title: Two Angels 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)
description: This wine is light bodied, very fresh in aroma and reasonably crisp in texture, showing green-apple flavors and subtle herb and citrus notes. It is very clean, well balanced and should be perfect for a crowd.

title: Briceland 2015 Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: Light and dry, this straightforward wine has a pale-garnet color, mild aromas of cherries and baking spices and restrained fruit flavors. The texture is rather lean and slightly tannic.

title: Lula 2017 Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: Crisp and lean, this is an unusually light-bodied and straightforward wine for the grape variety. It has mild green-apple and pine needle aromas and flavors and a tangy texture.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2012 King Crimson Red (Paso Robles)
description: Very extracted aromas of blackberry and raspberry meet with cola on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and primary: like drinking straight blackberry juice with the slightest hint of tannic structure.

title: Round Pond 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Thick, concentrated and rich, this is a 100% stainless-steel fermented white that tangles in tart flavors of lemon and grapefruit.

title: SeaGlass 2017 Riesling (Santa Barbara County)
description: Extremely light in the glass, this wine's aromas are almost so subtle that they don't exist. The palate is more interesting, starting a tad sweet then tightening around chalk and nectarine.

title: Three Thieves 2017 Rosé (California)
description: This clean, picnic-style wine gushes fresh fruit in the aroma and the flavor, like apricots, cherries and apples. It is medium bodied, appears slightly sweet and has a relatively soft mouthfeel.

title: Castelli Family Vineyards 2014 Estate Sangiovese (Ramona Valley)
description: Plump black-currant, wood oil and licorice aromas show on the fairly ripe and deep nose of this bottling from northern San Diego County. Tannins rise quickly as does prominent acid on the palate, where black-fruit and darker-spice flavors reign.

title: Alara 2016 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A fairly dark shade of reddish, rusty red pink, this older rosé shows aromas of dark cherry and juniper on the nose. There are lots of earthy tones to the palate, where cranberry is the dominant fruit.

title: Joullian 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Carmel Valley)
description: Rather tropical on the nose, this bottling shows pear, plumeria and ripe apple aromas on the nose. It's a bit viscous on the palate but with some energy, carrying flavors of apple soda, honeydew and candied pears.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Merrill-Johnson Vineyard Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)
description: This light and very lean wine smells like fresh thyme and pine needles, tastes very crisp and delicate, has low alcohol and good refreshment qualities.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: Dried herb aromas and lemon-lime flavors highlight this medium-bodied and smooth-textured wine. It has considerable richness in the mouthfeel and tastes soft in terms of acidity.

title: Sobon Estate 2017 Viognier (Amador County)
description: An assertive oaky streak covers ripe apple and caramel flavors in this full-bodied wine. It shows pronounced aromas of charred wood and smoke in the aroma that continue on the palate.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Viognier (California)
description: This is a soft-textured, medium-bodied wine with floral, earthy aromas and butterscotch flavors that come off as candied and a touch sweet. It's well made and should appeal to people who don't like their wines bone dry.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Merlot (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine possesses a hearty helping of tannin and herbal elements that won't appeal to all. Full bodied and concentrated in ripeness, the dried herbs and cedar dominate on the nose and palate. Small amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Malbec are blended in.

title: Jigar 2017 Tollini Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Redwood Valley)
description: An especially bright copper color make this wine stand out visually, while tart fruit flavors and a very dry crisp texture complete the picture. Moderate in alcohol, it has a lean taste profile, too.

title: Saddleback 2016 Old Vines Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a touch of reduction that makes it hard to fully delve into, a well as a thickly tannic character of ripeness that quietly exudes notions of blackberry and vanilla.

title: Binz 2016 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine shows a lot of oak influence in the baking-spice aromas, cedar and vanilla flavors and spicy finish. Under the oak are bright raspberry and cherry flavors.

title: Caricature 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Clarksburg)
description: Obvious oak aromas and an almost sweet sensation on the palate give this wine a sense of wearing plenty of makeup. The texture is broad and soft, and the flavors are like candied cherries.

title: Esser 2016 Merlot (Monterey County)
description: Red cherry and turned earth show on the simple but clean nose of this bottling. Tart red fruit and more dusty qualities show on the sip, with a hint of vanilla on the finish.

title: Esser 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Cut grass and pungent green-apple slices make for a familiar entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with Granny Smith apple and nectarine flavors, but they are short-lived and the texture is flat.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Carignane (Lodi)
description: This is a showy brash wine that smells smoky and oaky, has medium body and tastes like wood char, cranberries and vanilla. Not much varietal character comes through but it will please oak lovers.

title: La Storia 2016 Block 303 Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine opens gritty in texture and tannin before softening on the midpalate. Black fruit, cedar, dried herb and black pepper combine for a forceful experience of power and serious ripeness.

title: LangeTwins 2017 Estate Grown Moscato (Clarksburg)
description: This is a sweet but light-bodied dessert-style wine that will taste great with cheese, desserts that aren't too sweet, or on its own. It has floral aromas and flavors like apricots and tutti-frutti ice cream, but it also has good acidity to keep it balanced.

title: Resign 2017 Rosé (California)
description: A rather deep copper color and a combination of savory and fruity flavors make this medium-bodied wine a little more serious and substantial than many. It's made from red Rhône varietals.

title: Rocca 2014 Grigsby Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This vineyard-designate has a sweet nose of oak and corresponding thick ripe richness on the palate—a full-bodied take that's generous in tannin and flavors of vanilla and coconut.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The aromas of cedar and cigar box consume the dark fruit on the nose of this bottling. Similar wood-spice and pine-oil flavors are wrapped around the palate, with flashes of black plum and tobacco trying to emerge.

title: Carnivor 2016 Zinfandel (California)
description: A deep, dark color and deep, dark flavors steal the show in this extra-ripe and extremely spicy wine. Oak is the star, as cedar, clove, vanilla, cinnamon and smoke notes pervade the aromas, flavors and finish.

title: Telios 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine has good fresh fruit flavors that verge on jammy, boosted by a sweet-seeming oak character that includes vanilla, maple and brown sugar accents. It's smooth in texture and light in tannin content for this varietal.

title: Blue Victorian Winery 2016 Barbera (Suisun Valley)
description: A heavy oak influence gives this full-bodied wine smoky, charred aromas and flavors that dampen the fruity components that may have been in the grapes. It's bold and spicy.

title: Collier Creek 2016 Old Press Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Soft-textured and definitely fruity, this easy-going non-oaky wine is charming for its fresh raspberry aromas and red-fruit flavors. The texture is smooth and non-tannic.

title: Formation 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Quite light in the glass, this twist-top bottling shows hints of hibiscus, cranberry and damp herbs on the nose. The palate offers tart flavors of tomato and orange rind, lifted by fresh herbs.

title: Maxville 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and herbal, this wine offers bright, persistent acidity around a full-bodied embrace of ripe peach and pineapple.

title: Parducci 2017 Small Lot Pinot Gris (Mendocino)
description: The aromas of this medium-bodied wine overflow with apples and peaches, and the flavors are crisp, fruity and clean. The mouthfeel is rather rich for the varietal and backed by a nip of good acidity.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Soulmate Red (Paso Robles)
description: Plush blackberry jam, violet and rich plummy aromas show on this blend of 40% Syrah, 35% Mourvèdre, 21% Counoise and 4% Grenache. It's dense and ever-so-slightly sweet on the sip, with blackberry and red-currant-jam flavors and plenty of candied lilacs.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky oak dominates on the nose of this burly wine, a study in black cherry, cola and sanguine undertones of forest, rose and meat. Moderate in acidity, it presents as fully fleshy and ripe, with a soft smooth texture.

title: Hoopla 2016 Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: This dark-colored wine is made from Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Petite Sirah, Cabernet Franc and Syrah, the whole fermented in stainless steel for five months. Tangy cranberry, cherry and orange highlight a medium build of power and moderate acidity.

title: Adelaida 2016 Anna's Estate Vineyard Picpoul (Adelaida District)
description: Dried lime skin aromas meet with rounded red apple, nectarine and lemongrass aromas on the nose of this bottling, one of the first single-varietal Picpouls coming to market. The palate is extremely racy with tangy lime skin flavors, but rounded out by the midpalate with stone fruit and lemon wedge and the slightest hints of sweet oak and butter.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2014 Estate Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This puts 38% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot and 30% Malbec to good work, offering a sizable sense of tannin and integrated oak. Leather, black pepper and pencil shavings provide contrast to the fruitier components of baked plum and dark cherry.

title: Avensole 2014 Malbec (Temecula Valley)
description: This bottling, which includes 12% Merlot, 5% Cabernet Franc and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, shows bright raspberry and pomegranate fruit as well as crushed slate and dried earth. The palate is fresh and light with cranberry and boysenberry flavors.

title: Barrymore 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Bright aromas of lime, pear and crushed chalk rise to the nose atop a slight bit of effervescence in this latest release from the actress Drew Barrymore. The sip is bright and playful with lots of fun energy and a compelling texture, proving easy to quaff if simple overall.

title: Barton 2015 Tiny Dancer Grenache Blanc (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: A golden shade of yellow, this slightly richer take on the grape shows lemon rinds, honeysuckle oil and lightly roasted nuts on the nose. The palate is lively and textural, with an immense grip at the tip of the grip leading into flavors of yellow apple and citrus peel.

title: Campos Family Vineyards NV Sparkling Rosé (Lodi)
description: This light-salmon colored wine has a good deal of red-wine flavor carried nicely by fine-beaded effervescence and good acidity. Plum and peach fill the aromas, while the flavor is plummy and just off dry.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and earthy aromas of red and black cherries meet with loamy soil, crushed rocks and rusty earth on the nose of this bottling. Meaty flavors show on the palate alongside gravel, tangy black plum and a hint of anise, with a decent tannic structure carrying roasted coffee bean flavors into the finish.

title: Mignanelli 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This 50-50 blend of Santa Maria Valley and Santa Cruz Mountains fruit shows candied lemon rind and Gala apple on the approachable, familiar nose. There is a touch of zip to the palate, where lime cream and salted citrus flavors arise.

title: Migration 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Generous in ripe black cherry, pine forest, tar and toasted oak, this is a hearty wine, robustly full bodied, with a gravelly aspect to the texture that provides complexity and ample length.

title: Monticello Vineyards 2013 Estate Grown Merlot (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wine offers a wealth of structured tannins that integrate well with its fresh tart red fruit. Soy, baked bread and cedar add nuance and additional flavor.

title: Peltier 2015 Black Diamond Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Bold and tannic, this wine has lots of structure and a firm mouthfeel along with good but tight flavors of black cherry and blackberry. It tastes lean and focused and will pair nicely with rich proteins.

title: Scratch 2014 San Saba Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)
description: There's a honeyed character to the nose of this bottling, along with lemon cream, orange cake and a slight nuttiness. The palate shows the slightest hint of sweetness, but it slips to the background quickly, allowing the pecan, seared orange and baking spice elements to shine, with a fresh spray of lemon wedge and a creeping sense of petrol toward the finish.

title: Sobon Estate 2014 ReZerve Primitivo (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine is frosted with a chocolaty character from oak, and has ripe plush fruit flavors underneath. The spicy cocoa-like oakiness also has a smoky tinge.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 Rocky Top Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This wine is very fruity, concentrated and saturated in terms of flavor and rich and broad in texture. The tannins are quite soft and acidity low so It seems mouth-filling but not heavy on the palate.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2014 Tolay Red (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an unusual comingling of 40% Blaufränkisch, 30% Syrah, 10% Cabernet Franc, 10% Malbec and 10% Petit Verdot. It compels in earthy tobacco and mushroom flavor, adorned in violet aroma. Soft and velvety, the fruit is compressed and tightly structured.

title: Tower 15 2016 The White Cap White (Santa Barbara County)
description: This is a richer-leaning blend of 29% Viognier, 29% Marsanne, 29% Roussanne and 13% Grenache Blanc, with aromas of banana split, cognac-poached pears and a hint of caramel. Creamy flavors of baked pear, clove and vanilla are cut by a sharp Meyer lemon acidity.

title: Deaver 2016 Malvasia Bianca (San Joaquin County)
description: Wonderfully expressive aromas of rose petals, litchis and yellow peach meet vivid, slightly sweet fruit-basket flavors in this rather full-bodied mouth-filling wine. It has great concentration and keeps the fruit notes humming through the finish.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Weighty and oaky on the front of the palate, this settles into a balanced embrace of exotic guava, mango and anise, brightened by a refreshing undercurrent of acidity.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Ancient Vine Quaglia Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Rich and round with a soft texture, this wine offers a pillowy tannin structure and a leathery backbone of savory flavor. Raspberry and vanilla stand out amidst toasted oak and hints of dusty crushed rock.

title: V. Sattui 2015 School House Creek Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: High-toned red cherry highlights this soft, rounded and highly ripe wine, which is varietally correct and well representative of the appellation. Dense concentrated fruit is accented in cedar and clove.

title: Wilson Creek 2015 Promenance Vineyard Family Reserve Zinfandel (Temecula Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling offers subtle aromas of red fruits and turned earth. There is decent tannic tension to the palate, where rounded red-fruit and herb flavors meet with an anise spice.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Franc (Paicines)
description: Ripe black-plum and vanilla aromas are layered with rocky soils, chaparral scrub and thyme on the nose of this bottling. It's lighter bodied but lively and likable on the palate with ripe berry, cherry and dried oregano flavors.

title: Eberle 2017 Eberle Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Paso Robles is not known as a Chardonnay land, but the Eberle team manages to pull of fresh and worthy bottlings each vintage, even from the eastside of town. Broad poached pear and apple-blossom aromas lead into a palate of peach and pineapple, which is framed by decent tannic tension.

title: Golden 2017 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Broad pear, squeezed lemon, grapefruit blossoms and a waft of smoke show on the nose of this new, smartly priced brand from the Folktale Winery in Carmel Valley. Smoked chicken flavors make a savory entry to the palate, which then tightens around lemon zest and sea salt, proving quite mouthwatering.

title: Langman Estate 2015 Bud's Block Malbec (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine is rich in blackberry and blueberry flavors and mellow in texture. It starts with aromas of cinnamon and black pepper, has good fruit concentration, light tannins and low acidity.

title: Mark West 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rich black-cherry aromas are layered with game, herbs and wet slate on the complex and ripe nose of this bottling. Tangy red-cherry flavors and strong acidity consume the hefty palate along with a pinch of herbs, wrapped in a creamy mouthfeel.

title: Oso Libre NV Primoroso Especial Red (Paso Robles)
description: The multi-vintage blend is quite subtle on the nose at first, slowly allowing hints of dark hibiscus, plum, blackberry ham and loamy soil to emerge. Dark flavors of black plum, earth and underbrush show on the palate.

title: Resign 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Fermented and aged in neutral oak, this wine offers pretty aromas of lemon and apple blossom. The firm palate brings peach and apple flavors that are balanced by tense acidity.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2014 Madonne Estate Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Crushed lilacs, red spice and well-integrated black-plum aromas show on the nose of this blend of 69% Grenache, 16% Syrah, 12% Mourvèdre, 2% Carignan and 1% Counoise. The palate blends incense, dried rose petals, cherry and plum flavors.

title: Tantara 2015 Ingeborg Syrah (Los Olivos District)
description: Very ripe aromas of black plum, elderflower, jasmine and a hint of teriyaki show on the nose of this bottling. It's clean and full on the palate with a strong sticky tannic tension, showing primarily black-plum flavors.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Relatively light body comes with terrific, fresh fruit flavors and good balance in this appealing and straightforward wine. Raspberry and cherry waft up from the glass and equally exuberant fruit flavors fill this wine out nicely.

title: Bolshoi 2016 Estelle Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This bottling by a winemaker originally from Moldova offers well-integrated aromas of black plum, subtle licorice and sweet herbs on the nose. The palate is polished and carries flavors of fresh berries, wild mint and anise, proving fruity but balanced.

title: Cebada 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Reduced cherry and cranberry aromas meet with wild mint and fennel on the nose of this bottling. There is compelling structure on the palate, where boiled red-cherry and cranberry flavors and lifted by bay leaf and oregano.

title: Fiddletown Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)
description: Chalky aromas and flavors distinguish this bone-dry, refreshing and different wine. It's light in body, light on ripe fruit flavors but brings out the mineral, saline and citrus flavors that many wine drinkers love.

title: Mark West 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Bright fresh fruit flavors with some good depth highlight this attractive medium-bodied wine. It balances ripeness with crispness and has a lingering fruity finish.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Viognier (Sierra Foothills)
description: This very flavorful wine has plenty of apricot and peach flavors and a saline accent that sets it apart. It smells like almonds and dried apricots, and tastes vividly fruity and nicely crisp.

title: Point & Line 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Light aromas of wet cement, grapefruit rind, grass and smoke show on the nose of this bottling from the Jack McGinley Vineyard. There is compelling grip to the palate, where lemongrass, lime leaf and rounded apple flavors make for a mellow sipping experience.

title: Beauregard 2014 Zayante Vineyard Merlot (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Light aromas of carnation and snappy black raspberry meet with the elegant touch of bay leaf on the nose of this cool-climate Merlot. Its grapes grow on a southwest-facing orientation, which is the only reason they get ripe at all. The palate's red-currant and cherry tones are overcome by herbal touches of bay, juniper and mint, wrapped in zesty acidity.

title: Benziger 2017 De Coelo Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the winery's coastal estate property, this is inviting in candied strawberry Jolly Rancher and peach. With lovely acidity and freshness, it offers enough body and mid-tier weight to be a nice companion at the table as well as stand up on its own.

title: Naggiar 2017 Estate Grown Root 49 Viognier (Sierra Foothills)
description: This full-bodied wine wraps subtle fruity and floral flavors in a rich mouthfilling texture that feels sweet even though it's a dry wine. It has layers of light honeysuckle, vanilla and apricot that persist from the aroma through a lingering finish.

title: Pech Merle 2017 Valhall Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A 100% stainless-steel white, this is quenching and substantial in weight, with a grainy texture that shows complexity and layering of flavor. The fruit is a pleasing mix of Meyer lemon and kiwi.

title: Poseidon 2015 Primo's Hill Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: An earthy mineral aroma leads to baking-spice flavors, mild cherry and subtle plum fruit in this very smooth-textured and medium- to full-bodied wine. For having been aged in all-new Hungarian oak barrels it's not at all overpowering with oakiness.

title: Ram's Gate 2015 Gap's Crown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: There's an element of compressed wood to the oak in this wine, which rises on the nose with force, alongside a robust ripeness of berry pie. Soft and supple, it mellows in the glass to unveil elegant layers of strawberry and orange zest.

title: Thacher 2013 Original Copy Red (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 40% Cabernet Franc, 39% Malbec and 21% Cabernet Sauvignon needs a little time to unwind, but is quite compelling when given that space. Aromas of oregano, dried berries, leather and earth lead into a palate of dark red fruits, juniper and pine wood. Potpourri spice and more voluptuous purple-flower and fruit flavors emerge with time.

title: Three Sticks 2016 PFV Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine sources from several of the producer's coastal sites, from Gap's Crown to Durell Vineyard. It's herbal and smoky, velvety thick and soft, with an underlying persistence of cardamom, clove, orange and dark cherry. The full-bodied concentration supports polished tannins and a density of fruit.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Tempranillo (Fair Play)
description: Floral aromas and plenty of black-fruit flavors nicely fill out the full body of this ripe and opulently textured wine. The color is black almost to the rim, the aromas are spiced with vanilla and cocoa, and the flavors are so ripe with dried berries and cherries as to taste slightly sweet on the finish.

title: Dante Robere 2015 Estate Syrah (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine aged in Hungarian oak barrels is rich and concentrated, well-balanced and feels velvety smooth. It has black-cherry and raspberry flavors shaded by considerable smoky spicy oak notes that open up on the palate.

title: Domaine Carneros 2013 Ultra Brut Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Made from estate-grown grapes, 51% Pinot Noir and 49% Chardonnay, this dry delicious wine sings in high-acid lemon zest and pulp. It's layered, focused, fresh, tart and simply delicious.

title: Etude 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Sweet compost, tobacco and big, ripe tannins provide a robust entry into this wine. The palate opens with waves of boysenberry that hold tight through a spicy, peppery finish.

title: Kokomo 2016 Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is generously rich in red and blue berry, a density of fruit that is nicely contrasted against waves of peppery spice and leather. The oak is present yet polished alongside lengthy tannins and a lasting earthiness of sweet compost.

title: La Honda Winery 2016 Sequence Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From vineyards planted in shallow soils on steep slopes, this bottling offers plump cherries, sumac and rust on the nose, which combines fruit and soil compellingly. Tart pomegranate and hibiscus come through on the palate, which is taut, fresh and grippy, with a sharp mace spice kick.

title: Foxen 2016 Ernesto Wickenden Vineyard Old Vines Chenin Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Coming from old vines, this bottling is typically one of the more compelling non-Chardonnays from Santa Barbara County. This vintage shows light lemon, chalk, white peach and Asian pear on the nose. The palate is grippy as ever, with lemon-lime acidity and a green-pear flavor.

title: Anaba 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
