description: This appellation wine is made from multiple single-vineyard sites. It's light and floral, with a fresh, focused embrace of grapefruit, Meyer lemon and Gravenstein apple. Hints of fennel and orange mark the finish.

title: Big Basin 2014 Grizzly Grenache (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This bottling of an Alban clone was fermented 56% whole cluster, and makes for a more mineral-driven Grenache, with aromas of dried red currants, sarsaparilla, leather and pencil shavings. It's very dry on the palate with red plum, rosewater, candied jasmine and a hint of spearmint, but the firm tannins need much more time to smooth out.

title: Bravium 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine boasts a lush palate of apple, pear and Meyer lemon. It is grainy in texture and supported by oak, yet there's a steely thread of acidity to help balance the richness.

title: Órale 2013 Buena Onda Grenache-Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Strong peppercorn, bay leaf, grilled berries and a touch of tar show on the nose of this blend of 69% Grenache and 31% Syrah. It's fairly thick on the palate with roasted plum, soy and lilac flavors, but quite complex and attention-grabbing.

title: Robert John 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: This blends in tiny amounts of Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Franc, the whole an expansive big-boned expression of structured cassis and currant. Graphite, dust and dried herb provide savory seasoning and additional complexity.

title: Cline 2017 Cashmere Rosé (California)
description: This rather full-bodied wine has a vivid orange-pink color, strong savory meaty aromas and somewhat sweet flavors that make it feel soft.

title: Nicholson Ranch 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Aromas of salt and confectionery lead to a dull palate. Its fruit tones are muted by an overly generous vanilla oak tone.

title: Kenwood 2014 Six Ridges Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine presents as lean on the palate, and somewhat non-distinct in its mix of eucalyptus and bay leaf aromas and faint flavors of dark plum.

title: Swank n Smith 2015 Marquetry Red (Paso Robles)
description: Fairly light in the glass, this blend of 51% Merlot and 49% Cabernet Franc shows strong aromas of fruit punch and berry syrup. Candied-apple and strawberry-candy flavors meet with anise on the palate.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Limited Release Cold Springs Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Jammy with a flatness of cola and sticky tannins, this wine offers a feral quality of wild sage and dried herb around a substantial style of ripeness.

title: Pra Vinera 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine gives a sweet impression along with heavy-handed oak aromas and flavors like cedar, menthol and wood smoke.

title: Toad Hollow 2016 Richard McDowell's Selection Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: A 100% varietal wine, this is somewhat nondescript in thick layers of baked fruit and oaky tar.

title: Elyse 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 5% Pinot Blanc into the mix, the fruit from York Creek Vineyard high atop Spring Mountain, while the Chardonnay comes from a site in Carneros and another in Dry Creek Valley. Together they coalesce into thick, oaky waves flavored in toasted marshmallow.

title: Gnarly Head 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has semisweet oak aromas and flavors, plus a soft velvety texture with little tannin and low acidity. Notes like waffles and maple syrup meet jammy-berry flavors.

title: Lyeth 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Made in an obvious, commercial style, this wine has heavy aromas of charred wood, smoke and black pepper that don't let much else show through. It feels moderately tannic and medium bodied.

title: Tortoise Creek 2015 Cherokee Lane Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This wine is very jammy in flavor, lightly sweet, and has soft acidity and tannins. Baking-spice aromas continue through the flavors and add to the sweet impression.

title: Andretti 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Atlas Peak)
description: This white is somewhat muted aromatically and dull on the palate, with a juicy succulence that presents as sweet and thick.

title: Carneros Ranch 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is straightforward in its appeal of simple red fruit tones. This lacks complexity and depth but is easy going down.

title: Lorimar 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: An intense smoky meaty charred aroma leads to heavy flavors like hickory smoked bacon and barbecue sauce, backed by lean fruit flavors and lots of woody tannins.

title: Murphy-Goode 2014 Minnesota Cuvée Chardonnay (Alexander Valley)
description: Aged eight months in Minnesota oak, hence the name, this wine shows overbaked qualities of toffee and caramel, its acidity disjointed, the wine somewhat harsh and hot.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is thick, dull and overtly earthy in compostable earth and green herb.

title: Hailstone Vineyards 2014 Restoration Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is sweet in taffy, marshmallow and anise flavors, with an underlying harshness that's hard to shake.

title: Taft Street 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers simple tones of apple and oak on the nose and palate. It is medium in build and straightforward in its appeal.

title: Langman Estate 2017 Lovie's Rosé (Sierra Foothills)
description: This medium-bodied wine has an unusual reduced aroma that makes it smell swampy at first before turning meaty and herbal on the palate.

title: The Debate 2013 Beckstoffer Missouri Hopper Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Made by Jean Hoefliger, this is one of three Beckstoffer vineyard-designates meant to spark debate. It is dusty and inviting in spicy cola cinnamon and clove. The tannins are polished and soft, and ultimately elegant, as a core of juicy cassis glistens in supportive acidity, lingering brightly along a firm, well-defined finish.

title: Fenestra 2015 Semillon (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a fascinating wine in a non-fruity fashion that smells like almonds and golden olive oil, tastes figgy and feels mouthfilling. From a veteran, consistent producer, the wine is medium to full-bodied and has a smooth and rich texture.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Dominique Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Deep hay in color, this wine is full bodied and creamy, with well-integrated layers of pineapple, papaya and green olive. Toasted oak supports the fruitiness and floral aromas.

title: Foppiano 2013 Gianna's Block Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: This tastes of savory bitterroot, cedar and pencil. The wild exotic flavors are met by fruity black cherry and black licorice. Generous in tannin, the wine is soft and layered— a charming block-designate that shows complexity and length.

title: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crisp and fresh on the nose, this bottling offers lime skin, lemon juice, crushed flint and graphite aromas. It's tightly wound and zippy on the palate, but with ample flavors of Asian pear flesh, grippy chalk and a Key lime twist.

title: Luna 2014 Canto Super Tuscan Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 55% Sangiovese, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc, the grapes sourced from both Atlas Peak and Howell Mountain. Smoky barbecue char wraps around tart tangy red fruit and powerfully soft and supple tannin.

title: Birichino 2015 Old Vines Jurassic Park Vineyard Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very light on the nose, this bottling from 37-year-old vines shows squeezed lemon wedge, chilled Asian pear, hints of jicama and white rose petals on the nose. The citrusy palate is driven by a grapefruit pith flavor and enhanced with a touch of chalk. The texture is compellingly grippy.

title: Birichino 2015 Saint Georges Old Vines Zinfandel (Central Coast)
description: Fresh and broad aromas of strawberry and red currant meet with peppercorns and crushed oregano on the nose of this bottling of old-vine Zin from southern Santa Clara County. It's a lighter style on the palate, with bright red plums, crushed river rock and a good helping of herb flavors.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Natalia's Selection Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: This is a juicy and full-bodied white, tightly woven in oak and butterscotch. Expansive on the palate, with a depth of apple pie and nutmeg, it offers a balance of fresh acidity that complements well.

title: Pali 2015 Cargasacchi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light aromas of pomegranate, vanilla dust and sweet pastry show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors are also quite subtle, with red currants, a touch of bitter cranberry and dried garden herbs.

title: Rolling Plains 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is an impressive wine at the price point, sanguine and meaty, with medium-bodied density and highlights of cassis. Bright and well integrated, it's food friendly and ready to please a crowd.

title: Scheid 2014 Doctor's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Light in the glass, this bottling is a decent example of a more restrained Santa Lucia Highlands wine, with aromas of crisp raspberry, hibiscus and cranberry notes alongside warming hints of vanilla and thyme. Fresh and lively flavors of tart red fruits are dusted by herbs and spice cake on the palate.

title: Technique 2016 Proprietary Red (Stags Leap District)
description: This blend is made from 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Petite Sirah and 15% Merlot. It works in its dusty bramble of succulent black cherry and licorice, ultimately presenting a satisfying, likable wine that's full bodied and richly round.

title: Viluko 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Mountain-like tannins make for a robust, powerful and concentrated palate that shows a leathery texture. Sage, black pepper and black currant spice up richer elements of dark chocolate and caramelized oak.

title: Croma Vera 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Hearty and rather complex aromas show on the nose of this bottling, including black cherry, vanilla, cocoa dust, hickory smoke and coconut. The palate is dominated by baking spice and gingerbread flavors, set against a blackberry and caramel backbone, but the impressive part is the chalky firm tannins that hold up the flavors quite nicely.

title: Flanagan 2014 Merlot (Bennett Valley)
description: This is a sanguine Old World-style wine, rounded in tannin and generously soft. Coconut, bay leaf, cherry and vanilla give it a yin and yang quality that flirts with both savory and rich flavors, finding balance despite its full-bodied concentration.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2014 Vintage Reserve Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: A blend of 77% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Cabernet Franc, 6% Petit Verdot, 2% Malbec and 1% Merlot, this is a hearty sanguine red wine, with highlights of eucalyptus, peppercorn and billowy tobacco-laden tannin. Well integrated, it shows plenty of oak and inky concentration.

title: Leto 2013 The Hidden One Old Vine Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Thick and dusty in cedar and a touch of smoke, this robustly ripe wine leans into thickets of brambly black currant and blackberry dipped in chocolate.

title: Margerum 2016 Sybarite Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The nose on this sleek bottling by Doug Margerum manages to combines both the grape's telltale grassy tones and tightly reductive qualities with fresh passion fruit and kiwi flavors. There is a great sizzle of acidity to the sip, where lime skin and white rock flavors shine.

title: Peake Ranch 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: The nose on this bottling is extremely subtle, with hints of stone fruit and citrus. The palate is extremely crisp and clean, with Asian pear, lime peel and hints of oak smoke. The focus is tightly wound texture more than overt flavors.

title: Peltier 2016 Black Diamond Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Crisp and steely, this wine tastes absolutely fresh from the light herb and green-apple aroma to the lemon-lime flavors, lively acidity and clean snappy finish. It's light to medium in body, has good balance and an especially appetizing character.

title: Bellante 2017 Jack McGinley Vineyard New French Oak Cuvée Viognier (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This is a bottling for oak lovers, starting with aromas of smoked cantaloupe and lemon peels. That smoke element envelops the palate, where acidity lifts the lemon-and-herb-roasted-chicken flavors, which finish on caramel and pound cake.
designation: Jack McGinley Vineyard New French Oak Cuvée

title: Chronic Cellars 2016 Dead Nuts Red (Paso Robles)
description: Smoked blackberries and turned earth aromas show on the nose of this blend of 73% Zinfandel, 21% Petite Sirah and 6% Tempranillo. There is a compelling tightness and freshness to the palate, where boysenberry and licorice flavors converge.

title: CK Mondavi 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a trim, well-balanced wine that fills a nicely crisp frame with appealing lemon, green apple and butter notes. Light to medium in weight, it offers bright acidity to keep it refreshing while still delivering substantial flavor.

title: Earthfluence 2017 Grenache Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Poached pear aromas meet with crushed chalk on the pleasant nose of this bottling. The palate is framed by a chalky grip, which releases flavors of honeysuckle, pear and a hint of toast.

title: Joel Gott 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A pale shade of pink, with noticeable yet very light effervescence, this bottling shows light aromas of strawberry, raspberry and a hint of wet concrete. It's clean, tight and light on the palate, with a flash of cherry sweetness, proving to be the perfect beach wine.

title: Kitá 2017 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Extremely light in the glass, this single-vineyard expression shows pear, chalk, honeysuckle and lily aromas on the clean focused nose. There is grippy texture and bright acidity on the palate, where the flavors are quite tropical, with guava being dominant.

title: Koehler 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling shows plenty of poached pear and tuberose on the fairly exuberant nose. The palate is quite tropical with flavors of coconut, papaya, mango and much more pear.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: The college kids did well in this bottling, which offers Asian and Bosc pear on the delicate nose alongside hints of white flowers and toast. There is tension to the palate, showing flavors of toasted sourdough with lemon preserves.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2016 Peterson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Honey and chamomile aromas are prominent on the mellow nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The flavors are quite subdued, with touches of honeysuckle and squeezed lemon.

title: MCV 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Freshly pressed morello cherry, dried red flowers, rust and a hint of brown sugar show on the nose of this bottling. It's straight-ahead on the palate with clean red-cherry flavors, lifted by a touch of sandalwood.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 Especial Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Very juicy on the nose, this bottling smells of a black-cherry and pomegranate soda pop with a pinch of dried herbs. There are also lots of poppy qualities to the sip, where tangy plum juice meets with a touch of dried hop flavor.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 Mustard Creek Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Fairly light in the glass, this bottling shows fresh aromas of sour cherry, dill and marjoram on the simple but likable nose. The palate delivers candied raspberry, cranberry and plum flavors, making a perfect table wine for a variety of foods.

title: Pech Merle 2014 Angier Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: Dusty and briary in black cherry and berry, this wine offers moderate structure and ripeness within a context of soft round texture and approachability.

title: Refugio Ranch 2016 Roussanne (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lemon cream, sandy soils and yellow flowers show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the south side of the Santa Ynez River. It's tightly wound on the palate, with flavors of pear and apple cream, finishing on a lime-driven acid kick.

title: Rusack 2015 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Zinfandel (California)
description: There's a great story behind this planting, which comes from grape cuttings that were grown more than 100 years ago on Santa Cruz Island, but the wine still struggles in the island breeze. Light aromas of red cherry and sweet cedar lead into a palate of tangy red fruit, wet soil and wood spice.

title: Scheid 2015 Hames Valley Vineyard Petite Sirah (Monterey)
description: Crushed purple flowers, leather, sarsaparilla and blue-fruit aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate, which is relatively medium bodied for this heavy grape, is very dry and tarry, offering flavors of grilled black plums and charcoal.

title: Strala 2015 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends large amounts of Merlot and Zinfandel with Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and Malbec. Together they form a thick, plummy core accented in dried herb and integrated oak, with a sweetness of milk chocolate on the finish.

title: Ledson 2017 Grove Vineyard Viognier (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from a site along Petaluma Hill Road, this is an herbal, creamy and lush wine that was fermented in stainless steel and is now wrapped in good tight acidity. Lemon meringue and green-apple flavors balance each other and allow the wine to maintain lasting freshness.

title: Mesa Del Sol 2012 Syrah (Arroyo Seco)
description: Black-plum jelly, blackberry ice cream and a hint of dried herbs show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the warm part of this appellation. Black-fruit and violet flavors show on the tangy palate.

title: Michael Pozzan 2015 Annabella Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: An easygoing, enjoyable wine, this is integrated in good dark fruit and integrated oak, with soft tannins and a length of cinnamon and clove.

title: Chappellet 2016 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A tropical tease of guava permeates before citrusy green apple and cinnamon brioche introduce themselves on the midpalate in this well-made, memorable wine. The oak is subtle and well-integrated, allowing plenty of room for the freshness of lasting, vibrant acidity to take indelible hold.

title: Covenant 2017 The Tribe Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: An opulent plush texture and luxurious flavors like those in a pear tart give more than enough personality to this full-bodied barrel-fermented wine. It has a mouth-filling presence, subtle oak accents and a surplus of richness in the pear, toasted almond and cream flavors. It will be delicious paired like to like with a buttery seafood dish or even osso buco.

title: Grassini 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: The nose of this impressive bottling is laced with both tangy fruit and rocky minerality, ranging from dark strawberry and morello cherry to crushed slate and dark-violet aromas. The energetic palate bursts with black raspberry and exotic dark plum, lifted by star anise, clove, waves of acidity and squeaky tannins. Drink 2019–2034.

title: Kobler 2017 Kobler Family Vineyard Rosé of Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Thick, rich and meaty, this is a dry, layered and balanced wine, textured in citrus peel and dark cherry. It shows off the variety and the vineyard, allowing room for an exotic complexity to speak and last on the finish.

title: Crocker & Starr 2014 RLC Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Big, fruity, subtly oaked and well-structured, this full-bodied wine packs in flavors of blackberry jam and dark chocolate framed by firm tannins. It offers a lot of ripeness and concentration and comes with tantalizing nutmeg, cinnamon and toast accents that build on the palate and linger on the long-lasting finish. Best after 2022.

title: Dovecote 2015 Redtail Thompson Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Crushed purple and red flowers converge with concentrated cherry liqueur and pepper spice on the elegant, ripe nose of this 45% Syrah, 30% Grenache and 25% Mourvèdre blend. It's tightly woven on the peppery palate, with grippy hibiscus, raspberry and citrus-rind flavors, providing a great survey of this historic vineyard.

title: Gainey 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a stellar wine, especially considering it is simply the family's appellation blend. Aromas of crisp black raspberry, thyme, sagebrush and mint provide tremendous depth on the nose. The palate is lively, elegant and very smooth, showing white pepper, cedar and more black-raspberry flavors.

title: GrapeHeart Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Suisun Valley)
description: This lush, ripe and full-bodied wine practically oozes blackberry and blueberry flavors that are layered, palate-drenching and delicious. It has subtle oak and baking spices, and moderate tannins that peak through the rich fruit.

title: Hug 2016 Rancho Ontiveros Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: The aromas on this bottling are earthy and quite deliciously underripe, showing forest floor, moss, tomato leaf, green peppercorns and tapenade on the nose. It's very zesty on the palate, where barely ripe mulberry and exotic plum flavors are lifted by grape leaf and toasted tomato touches. It offers tons of energy and intrigue.

title: Langman Estate 2015 Susan's Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Enticing and edgy, this medium-to full-bodied wine embraces the wild side of Syrah with its gamy, meaty aromas and fruit flavors that pull back just short of fully ripe. It has fascinating black pepper, singed herb and blackberry flavors, as well as balanced acidity and firm yet not pushy tannins.

title: Arista 2015 U.V. El Diablo Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This bold, effusively floral wine is laser-focused in acidity, with a strong essence of candied tangerine, guava and pineapple. With a touch of reduction, it's complex and tightly wound, with salty oak and youthful intensity.

title: Picayune 2015 Rive Gauche Red (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot, this is muted in an earthy compost tone that accents burly aromas of black currant and plum. Concentrated, extracted power and sturdy tannins provide strength and complexity to the palate, with finishing notes of black pepper and leather.

title: Stephen Ross 2015 Escolle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black cherry, orange peel, tarragon and slate show on the rather rich and ripe nose of this bottling by Stephen Ross Dooley. The palate is more tightly wound and restrained in its expression, offering elegant red plum, dried rose petals, orange rind and a hint of lavender.

title: Talbott 2016 Audrey Diamond T Vineyard Estate Grown Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Meyer lemon and yellow apple aromas make for a fresh and inviting nose, although the hazelnut, toast and smoke scents ensure this is a serious wine. The palate is loaded with acidity and a taut texture, offering savory yet zesty flavors of lemon and apple, while a hint of vanilla unfolds on the finish.
designation: Audrey Diamond T Vineyard Estate Grown

title: Della 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A sweetness of ripe berry and rhubarb meets velvety texture and moderate acidity in this well-made, full-bodied wine. Lengthy in tannin and oak, it offers structure and underlying elegance beneath the power and density.

title: Arista 2015 Banfield Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a dry-farmed site and older vines, this wine is resplendent in white flowers, salty brine and strong flavors of melon, pineapple and sweet vanilla. With a soft integrated texture and toasted oak, crème brûlée and burnt sugar.

title: Arista 2015 Two Birds Vineyard Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a polished, elegant and savory estate wine that is dark and moody in baked earth. Structured, the flavors are full bodied and bold, velvety smooth in baked cherry, strawberry, cola and a seasoning of baking spice. This is a wound-up wine that needs time in the glass to open.

title: Beauregard 2014 Beauregard Ranch Zinfandel (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: Very dark and dense in color, this bottling from a coastal vineyard shows focused blackberry and cinnamon-laced snickerdoodle aromas on the nose. There is blackberry jam on the tip of the sip but then it grows more intriguing with crushed asphalt and earthy flavors of thyme and sage, all framed by dry polished tannins.

title: Calera 2015 Jensen Vineyard Fortieth Anniversary Vintage Pinot Noir (Mt. Harlan)
description: Concentrated aromas of red cherry liqueur, sagebrush and a hint of toasted oak show on the nose of this bottling, which is from a vintage that harvested less than a half-ton per acre from this vineyard. Sandalwood, chaparral scrub and earthy juniper play along with the cranberry and red plum flavors on the palate.

title: Levo 2016 Spot Slide Hill Vineyard Syrah (Edna Valley)
description: Black plum, soy, baking spice and a hint of vanilla show on the nose of this bottling by Bret Urness (with the label giving a nod to the vineyard's manager Brook Williams). Rich, dark and lush flavors of baked pastries and black-currant syrup show on the palate, which is creamy in mouthfeel and finishes with a splash of acidity.

title: Lurton 2015 Red (Sonoma County)
description: This blends 53% Merlot and 47% Cabernet Franc into a tidy, classically stylized package of bay leaf, red currant, red cherry and black pepper. Structured and true to each variety, it features powerfully focused tannins that support without distraction.

title: MacRostie 2016 Sangiacomo Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Floral, this is a fresh, lengthy and acid-driven white, welcoming in its medium-bodied grasp of balance. Apple, Meyer lemon and nutmeg form a nice bond of flavor with just a hint of ginger.

title: Naggiar 2015 Estate Grown Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: One of the most concentrated California Barberas on the market, this wine shows a very deep dark color, opulent and ripe fruit aromas and a wonderful sense of layering and density. It oozes blueberries, boysenberries and dark chocolate, has a firmly tannic texture, tasty oak spices and a long lingering finish.

title: Noceto 2015 Marmellata Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: It tastes as if Noceto is getting a better and better handle on this tricky grape variety. This wine captures the tension along with the complexity and generosity of this traditional Tuscan grape. It has intriguing smoke, raspberry and black-pepper aromas, lively cherry and cranberry flavors and good gripping tannins in the texture.

title: Ram's Gate 2013 Bismark Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Soft and supple in tannin, this vineyard-designate shows a wealth of full-bodied grip and complexity, its highlights an exploration of earth, tobacco and clove. Dried herb adds to the mix, the savory components allowing just enough light to allow for a succulence of black cherry.

title: Renwood 2015 Indian Creek Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Big and bold, this wine gives most people what they want in a Zinfandel—mouth-filling, luscious, palate-drenching berry flavors and good structure, too. Firm tannins and supportive fruit acidity keep the fruit notes from being cloying and help the wine linger nicely on the finish.

title: Robert Mondavi 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a tremendous value for the quality— an earthy, sanguine and dried herbal wine that's tightly wound in structure and composure. Accents of pencil lead and cocoa powder add complexity and savory components to the full-bodied whole.

title: Sean Minor 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is an impressive, well-priced wine to stock up on. Golden waves of toasted oak complement a backdrop of honeysuckle and apple blossom, while spicy nutmeg seasons well-honed notions of apple and pear.

title: Sojourn 2016 Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This lovely wine has earthy mint and dried herb at first, peeling into exotic nuances of Asian spice and cinnamon. Juicy and persistent on the palate in crisp red fruit, it finishes with a stony quality of mineral, coastal freshness and acidity.

title: Wallis Family Estate 2014 Seraphim Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Broadly structured amidst a wealth of mountain fruit and tannin, this wine impresses in its succulent body of plummy dark cherry, sage and dark chocolate. The dense complex layers are well integrated with toasty oak. Enjoy 2024–2034.

title: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Shake Ridge Ranch Grenache (Amador County)
description: This bottling by Angela Osborne is a great example of a light wine that's loaded with action. Aromas of cranberry, orange rind, baked soil, forest herbs and river stones show on the nose. The palate shows red plum, mace, white pepper, tarragon and more forest floor, all wrapped in a lithe texture.

title: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Vie Caprice Vineyard Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light red currant, rose petals and jasmine tea are outdone by the crushed gravel minerality on the nose of this bottling. The palate is all about texture and earth, with a light body and grippy texture conveying rocky flavors alongside dried strawberry, rose petals and a salt-and-pepper spice.

title: Big Basin 2015 Coastview Vineyard Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Proprietor Bradley Brown has developed a unique but compelling style of Chardonnay from this 2,400-foot-high vineyard east of Salinas. Dynamic aromas of walnut, preserved lemon, sea salt, marmalade and butter show on the nose. The palate starts with hazelnut paste, then becomes chewy with chalk and toasted marshmallow flavors. Smoke carries into the finish. Every sip provides a new sensation.

title: Evan's Ranch 2015 Lone Oak Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Blackberry syrup, roasted cocoa and a hint of coffee show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that the Gainey family owns far west of and more coastal than their primary estate. The energetic palate shows solid black-fruit flavors that are both lush and tart, lifted by lavender and framed by fresh acidity and strong tannins.

title: FEL 2015 Savoy Vineyard Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: Beautifully fruity and focused, this medium-bodied wine is underpinned by good acidity and accented with light butter and almond flavors to go along with the vivid lemon and crisp apple notes. Fine balance and the pure fruit expression make it special.

title: A Tribute to Grace 2015 Murmur Vineyard Grenache (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rose petals, cola, macerated wild cherry and cherry pits meet with gravel and crushed brick minerality on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just on the east side of Highway 101 south of Orcutt. The palate is fresh and mineral-driven, with turned earth, gravel and strong acid taking center stage over the light-red-fruit flavors.

title: Peachy Canyon 2015 Snow Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Like a walk through a chaparral thicket, this bottling shows tons of herbal influence, with dried oregano, thyme and sage sprinkled atop tones of red plum and hibiscus. Those herbs also decorate the palate's cranberry core, which also offers a roasted meat flavor.

title: Samsara 2015 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Savory aromas of roasted pork in a black-plum reduction combine with tar and loads of black pepper on the nose of this county blend. Purple flower and Concord grape flavors are prevalent on the sip, which is ready to drink now but structured to last awhile.

title: Sojourn 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Juicy and velvety in texture, this wine shows a wealth of full-bodied oak and tannin up front that settles into lovely characteristics of rose petal, strawberry, rhubarb and forest floor. The finish is lengthy and robust.

title: Vitesse 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is pretty in aromatics of cassis and violet, and soft and approachable on the complex palate. Full bodied, it's able to find a balance between etched flavors of cinnamon, plum and cherry that persist on a lasting grip of integrated tannin.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Crown Block Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Hints of mint and cedar in the aroma lead to full ripe fruit flavors like black cherry and blueberry in this Merlot-based Bordeaux-style blend. It has full body and moderate tannins that give just enough heft and grip on the palate.

title: Flowers 2015 Camp Meeting Ridge Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: With a backbone of well-defined acidity, this coastal white is creamy in texture, with highlights of fig, pear and toasted oak. Juicy and likable, it lingers in a vanilla wafer tone.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2016 Mountain Cuvée Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a well-blended red, combining 73% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 3% Malbec and 2% Cabernet Franc. Pungent earth and tobacco highlight a soft round palate of dried herb, clove and red and black currant, finishing in cherry-vanilla.

title: Moniker 2016 La Ribera Vineyard Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This wine is delightfully smooth as it delivers moderate fruit, butter and almond flavors on a rich-feeling yet light texture. It coats the palate from the first sip through to the mild, lingering finish.

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: Meaty, sanguine flavors greet the straightforward entry to this appellation wine, a showcase of the area's warm climate. Substantial concentration builds along the midpalate, dusted in clove, black cherry and berry.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Mourvèdre (Adelaida District)
description: Plummy fruits meet with rosewater and tart strawberry on the nose of this bottling by vintner Jason Haas. Against a tannic backbone and chalky texture on the sip, there are punchy flavors of red and purple fruit, bolstered by solid acidity. It is quite easy to quaff.

title: Velvet Bee 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright, crisp black raspberry and sharp hibiscus tones make for a very pungent, nose-tickling aromatic start to this appellation blend. The palate is also sharp, with mace and allspice, while searing acidity cuts through the strawberry and raspberry flavors.

title: Wood Family Vineyards 2015 El Loco Rojo Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This is an appealing, substantive wine that combines ample fruit and spice aromas with well-concentrated black cherry flavors and a moderately tannic texture that will help it pair well with rich dishes. It's a classic Bordeaux-style blend made from 65% Cabernet Sauvignon plus the four other red Bordeaux varietals.

title: Frei Brothers 2015 Reserve Merlot (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This soft, approachable red impresses in a mix of earthy mushroom, soy and cedar, its body thickly constructed around a core of ripe tannin and charred oak. Well structured, it finishes in bursts of black pepper and leather.

title: Montage Vineyards 2012 Seven Sons Vineyard Syrah (Los Angeles County)
description: Charred beef, pepper dust, oregano, thyme and sage make for a savory entry to the nose of this bottling from the Malibu area, but there is aromatic lift from dried lilac aromas as well. The palate is classical, with firm tannins carrying more herb and pepper as well as tar, blueberry and a slightly gamy quality.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2015 Ferrario Famiglia Collection Red (Livermore Valley)
description: A good blast of black cherry and cedar in the aroma is followed by rich grapey flavors on a moderately firm texture that's softened by a hint of sweetness on the finish.

title: Sergio 2014 Dr. Reid Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Made by proprietor Anna Monticelli, who also makes the Pina Napa Valley wines, this is a robust hearty vineyard-designate made in tiny numbers. With 5% Cabernet Sauvignon blended in, it offers earthy tannin and a soft muscular texture of lightly spiced oak and dark chocolate cherry.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Reserve Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Layers of roasted beef, blackberry compote, pepper, tarragon and vanilla show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime Paso Robles producer. The palate combines New World richness with Old World elegance, offering dried plums, spice cake and pecan flavors.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Claret (Paicines)
description: Four Bordeaux varieties work as a team in this bottling to deliver aromas of blackberry jam, caramel, roasted cocoa, peppercorn and dark soil. There's great cohesion to the palate, where black cherry, hints of root beer and purple flowers ride buoyant acidity and chalky tannins.

title: August Briggs 2014 Petite Sirah (Calistoga)
description: Smoky char and bacon give this wine a lot of personality and depth—big-time flavors that highlight a soft velvety texture of concentration. Brawny and broad, it's a powerhouse of ripeness and richness.

title: Leoness 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Licorice spice, black cherry cordial, sweet sage and rustic earthy aromas show on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 14% Cabernet Franc, 8% Merlot and 3% Petit Verdot. Blackberry, pepper and dark cocoa are evident on the sip, along with more of that tangy licorice spice and bay leaf flavor.

title: Morgan 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Light and crisp on the nose, this bottling shows passion fruit, lemon, chilled Anjou pear slices and a hint of grassy scents, proving broadly appealing. There is great zip to the sip and a bit of viscosity as well, with zesty flavors of green apple rinds and chopped lemongrass.

title: Naggiar 2015 Zio Luciano Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Abundant Bing cherry and black-plum flavors fill out this deeply colored, full-bodied and rather soft-textured wine. It tastes nicely concentrated and feels velvety on the palate due to fine-grained tannins.

title: Steele 2016 Viognier (Lake County)
description: This is a light, appetizing style of a sometimes heavy varietal. Unique citrus and pine aromas lead to juicy, fresh and tangy flavors that range from lemon to honeysuckle. On the palate it's crisp and clean, lightly fruity and refreshing.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Grenache Blanc (Adelaida District)
description: Pineapple, candied mango and melon show on the plush, nearly tropical nose of this bottling. That ripeness dissipates a bit on the sip, where poached apple and pear flesh flavors rule.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2015 Cellar Select Meritage (Santa Barbara County)
description: Aromas of pencil shavings, black peppercorn, oregano and elderberry frame the nose of this blend of 32% Merlot, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Petit Verdot, 12% Cabernet Franc and 10% Malbec. It's tightly wound on the palate, where a dried cherry flavor meets with dried herbs and cracked pepper, lifted by a dash of acidity.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Falleri Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: This is a tiny production wine for the producer. It's also among the producer's lightest and most delicate. High-toned cherry and strawberry fruit support a floral, herbal entry of beautiful perfume, the texture soft and in balance.

title: Round Pond 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Soft and supple in milk chocolate and cherry, this wine contains 2% Petit Verdot. Dried herb, sage and pencil shavings contribute a savory complement to the richness of the ripe fruit.

title: Ruby Hill Winery 2015 Grapeful Red (California)
description: Good fruit concentration meets firm structure in this very full-bodied well-extracted wine for a winning, bold personality. Blackberry, boysenberry and wood smoke meld with ample, soft tannins for a mouthful of flavor and a generous texture to boot.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Kim Giles Vineyard Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Minty and herbal on the nose, this delicately layered wine is light in body. Lemon peel, cranberry and pomegranate highlight the palate, giving an exotic edge to the wine.

title: True Myth 2016 Paragon Vineyard Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This widely available wine is a solid catch and stands out with its beautiful packaging. It offers a smoky nose that's complemented by lemon peel and sandalwood. Oak shows prominently on the palate, where smoked peach, melon and more lemon ride a creamy texture.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Reserve Merlot (Fair Play)
description: This is a big, structured, full-bodied Merlot that feels moderately tannic in texture and gushes with ripe plum and black-cherry flavors. A light minty aroma and attractive oak spices work well to add complexity.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This estate-grown wine is brawny in leather, earth and cedar, with powerfully concentrated flavors of red currant and black cherry. Substantial in style, it resolves on the midpalate to show touches of acid-tinged grace and restraint. Its finish is sticky in dark chocolate.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Edcora Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: Winemaker Henrik Poulsen worked alongside the late Denis Malbec on this winery project, which is relatively new to the appellation. Deep brambly berry aromas rise from the glass in this elegant effort, blended with tiny additions of Petit Verdot and Cabernet Franc. Brown-sugar flavors accent a velvety rich and smooth texture, the tannins tamed and softened.

title: Cebada 2014 Blanc et Noirs Extra Brut Sparkling (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light yellow in the glass, this bubbly is a mix of 70% Pinot Noir and 30% Chardonnay, and starts with yeasty aromas of sourdough and a light squeeze of grapefruit on the nose. The bready flavors show on the sip too, alongside tart lemon touches.

title: Cedarville 2015 Naylor Vineyard Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This generous, concentrated and full-bodied wine has rich dense flavors and a very firm structure. A touch of spicy earthiness in the aroma leads to luscious notes of blackberry jam and dark chocolate on the palate.

title: Etude 2017 Grace Benoist Ranch Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From estate fruit, this is a dry, textured and meaty wine, layered in strawberry and raspberry flavors. Teases of dried herb and mint season the fruit.

title: Fetzer 2016 Eagle Peak Merlot (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine matches ripe black-plum and -cherry flavors with light yet firm tannins. A sense of concentration and density comes through on the palate and encourages the lingering finish.

title: Hawley 2014 Broadwing Estate Meritage (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This successfully combines 60% Cabernet Sauvignon with 35% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Franc, aging the whole for 27 months in French oak. Hugely concentrated, it shows a rocky mineral character of ash, leather and white pepper, the fruit black and burly and the tannins structured.

title: Kunde 2014 Dunfillan Cuvée Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: An estate-grown blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Syrah, this wine is soft, supple and offers lasting structure. Blackberry and black currant combine for a jammy entry that's both sanguine and mineral in tone.

title: Meiomi 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, supple and earthy, with robust tannin structure and ripeness, this wine impresses in its interwoven layers of baked rhubarb, strawberry and cranberry. It lives up to its reserve-level billing and finishes dry.

title: Migration 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Tannic and full bodied, this wine holds its weight and grip well. On the palate, it offers a dense expression of cherry cola, warm baking spices and toasted oak.

title: Prospect 772 2016 Black Tie Charlie Red (California)
description: This is a rich, tempting and full-bodied wine with enticing oak spices in the aroma, and tongue-drenching blackberry and boysenberry in the flavor. An extra dark color, moderate tannins and extreme ripeness all combine to amp up the experience.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Stewed red plum, pepper, dried herbs and baked earth show on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts quite zesty in a snappy raspberry-jam flavor, lifted by a hint of white pepper and solid acidity.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Thick dense layers of mocha and baked cherry pie accent a rounded, richly ripe and well-made varietal wine that's full bodied and memorably expressive.

title: Thirty-Seven Wines 2015 The Hermit Reserve Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a blend of 50% Merlot and 50% Cabernet Franc sourced from throughout the county. Sanguine, it offers a juicy midpalate marked by cranberry, red currant and graphite, the acidity tight and firmly focused, allowing for a lasting freshness on the finish.

title: Via Romano 2016 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a richly textured and well-concentrated wine that brings a lot of substance to each sip. It combines savory herb and mineral flavors with mild fruity notes and a hint of fennel, all carried by a smooth and broad texture.

title: Wait Cellars 2016 Los Amigos Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Russian River Valley)
description: Sizable, dry tannins wrap around a core of leather and dried herb before a juicy midpalate unleashes flavors of blue fruit and plum. This wine is light on its feet and lingers on tones of cloves and herbs.

title: McManis 2017 Estate Grown Certified Sustainable Viognier (River Junction)
description: This ripe and rich wine has orange blossom and honey aromas that lead to a palate of vanilla, orange and peach flavors. It displays a smooth, thick texture, with soft acidity and a creamy presence.

title: Alara 2017 Grenache Blanc (San Benito County)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite dynamic, blending lightly roasted nuts with honeysuckle, nectarine and crisp Alpine creek water. Rounded apple and pear flavors show on the sip, lifted by touches of jasmine and a citrusy acidity.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2015 Family Album Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: Baking spices and milk chocolate in the aroma lead to very pleasant plum, spice and chocolate flavors that weave together on the palate and the finish. It's a smooth, well-modulated wine with mild tannins and a plush mouthfeel.

title: Buck Shack 2016 Small Batch Sustainably Farmed Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Chocolate and beef aromas and flavors complement the generous, ripe berry and cherry notes in this full-bodied wine. New oak is prominent on the palate, showing loud tones of baking spice, mocha and maple.

title: Calculated Risk 2014 Red (Mount Veeder)
description: A soft, rounded and balanced red blend, this shows deft layers of plum accented in mountain sage, dried herb and a lightness of nutmeg.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2016 Goltz Vineyard Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This wine is full bodied and well balanced, easy to enjoy for its wealth of fruit and spice flavors, and also appetizing due to good acidity and moderate tannins.

title: Chimney Rock 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Cabernet Franc (Stags Leap District)
description: Dark in color, this is a meaty wine with violet aromas and distinctly layered flavors of blueberry and dried cherry. Its acidity is lively and refreshing and an effective complement to the larger story of complexity and refined texture.

title: Crosby Roamann 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Tangy flavors of currant and cassis are lifted by a richness of vanilla in this bold, full-bodied and robust wine. The leathery texture helps emphasize its tannic underbelly and wealth of toasted oak.

title: Gibbs 2016 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% varietal, value-driven wine that is sanguine and meaty as well as layered in dark plum and currant. Strong and powerful, it has a high-toned, dusty texture that brightens the fruit and earth.

title: Kunde 2015 Heritage Block Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: Made from estate-grown fruit, this offers notes of smoked oak and charcuterie on top of a soft, rounded expression of red fruit. The mellow tannins meld seamlessly with the flavors.

title: Lewis Grace 2017 Torrontés (Alta Mesa)
description: This is a bright, snappy, floral and fruity wine that will make a great pre-dinner drink and pair well with seafood and spicy Asian dishes. It's technically dry but so fruity and exuberant that it comes off as a bit sweet.

title: Lion Ranch 2017 Lioness Rosé (Santa Clara Valley)
description: A yellowish shade of pink in the glass, this rosé of 76% Grenache and 24% Cinsaut offers aromas of nectarine, bubblegum and rainy cement. The palate is tense and chalky with a wet stone minerality as well as flavors of pink-peach flesh and lemon peel.

title: Marimar Estate 2015 Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled Tempranillo (Russian River Valley)
description: Blueberry, mocha and earth highlight this softly textured wine that's made from an estate-grown site and pays homage to the producer's Spanish heritage. It has grip and quiet power.
designation: Don Miguel Vineyard Unfiltered Estate Grown & Bottled

title: Navarro 2017 Cuvée 128 Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: Brisk and tangy all the way through, this light and refreshing wine was fermented in large oak vats and aged on the lees for four months. It features citrus aromas, lively citrus and crisp apple flavors and a nicely tart texture that livens the palate.

title: Portalupi 2016 Shake Ridge Ranch Barbera (Amador County)
description: This is a pretty, fruity and focused wine that displays good balance and a sleek texture. It offers plenty of red cherry, black cherry and spice accents that are supported by light tannins and tangy acidity.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)
description: A nice representation of what the grape can do in California, this is blended with 19% Cabernet Sauvignon and 1% Petit Verdot. The result is juicy, leathery and soft in texture, with well-defined notes of dried currant, cherry and a lasting tease of sage.

title: Prospect 772 2015 The Brat Grenache (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a bold full-bodied wine that's well oaked and has plenty of black-fruit flavors too. Firm tannins support ripe black-cherry and blueberry flavors while tempting baking spices and wood-smoke accents add extra interest. It's made from 79% Grenache and 21% Syrah.

title: Shannon Ridge 2016 High Elevation Collection Petite Sirah (Lake County)
description: Smooth but dense, this wine is unusually supple for the variety. It shows a great combination of ripe, rich fruit flavors of black fig, black pepper, wood smoke and blackberry, with firm but not harsh tannins that give it a plush, mouthcoating texture. Best through 2025.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2015 Hope Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache, 27% Syrah, 15% Mourvèdre, 2% Petite Sirah and 1% Carignan is a strong showing for this historic—but only recently revived—region between Morgan Hill and Gilroy. Blackberry, lavender, elderflower buds and soil show on the nose. The structure is quite firm, holding elegant flavors of dark berry, white pepper and strong acidity.

title: Balletto 2016 Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smooth and integrated, this is an earthy and spicy wine that offers balanced flavors of strawberry jam, citrus and a dash of white pepper. These tones linger as the wine's seamless, viscous texture takes hold.
designation: Sexton Hill Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Challen 2015 Scarlett Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fairly dark in the glass, this is an intense and jammy take on Pinot Noir, offering aromas of boysenberry and blackberry on the nose. It's brawny and masculine on the sip, with a full and creamy mouthfeel with just enough tang, and would work well in a steak house.

title: Domaine Eden 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Intense aromas of pine, cedar and incense meet with roasted black plum, deep violet and a hint of lavender on the layered nose of this bottling, which includes 16% Merlot, 4% Petit Verdot, 2% Cabernet Franc and 1% Malbec. The woody flavors show on the palate alongside red plums and white pepper, all encased in a chalky texture.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Saucy aromas of black cherry, red plum and spicy ginger snaps show on the nose of this reserve bottling. The spice quality overtakes the sip at first before the tart cranberry fruit and wild-herb flavors return to round out the experience.

title: Lynmar 2016 Quail Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine exudes notes of cherry, blueberry and pine forest on the nose. The palate offers plenty of savory notes within its full-bodied folds of grippy tannin and toasted oak. Complex and compact, it will hold well in the cellar. Enjoy 2021–2026.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Georganne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is an oaky and powerfully structured wine, with a fleshy opening of orange, red cherry and tea-laced forest floor. The tannins are strongly etched in grippy ripeness and structure.

title: Neely 2016 Bee Block Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: From 38-year-old vines on the northern limits of the appellation near Portola Valley, his bottling offers sunshine-loaded aromas of cooked lemons, yellow peach and damp wood. The palate is broad and strong with flavors of sandalwood, roasted apples and toast with preserved lemon spread.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Hudson Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Full, fleshy and complex, this is a beautifully layered and nuanced wine, well integrated with a bite of acidity and grip. Peach, pear and anise all play a part in bringing it to life, allowing room for further development in the glass.

title: Riverbench 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There's an intriguing gamy kick to the nose of this appellation blend, giving depth to the red-cherry, Earl Grey tea, sagebrush and sarsaparilla aromas. The mouthfeel is full and loaded with acidity, offering flavors of dried sage, more tea leaves, hibiscus and floral potpourri.

title: Robert Biale 2016 R.W. Moore Vineyard Zinfandel (Coombsville)
description: From the cooler reaches of the Napa Valley, this historic vineyard site provides an earthy, spice-filled entry of cocoa powder and black pepper, rubbed in dried herb. Rounded and rich in red fruit, it has grip and concentration, a heady ripeness that's balanced by ample acidity.

title: Sequoia Grove 2013 Cambium Red (Napa Valley)
description: Already aged in bottle for some time, this Bordeaux can withstand plenty more evolution in bottle, its bright red fruit structured enough within a tight frame of chalky tannin and coconut oak. The ripeness is moderate and in balance.

title: Siduri 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite subtle at first on the nose, this bottling offers baked red-cherry aromas and a dusting of soil with some swirling. The palate blends dark red cherry with touches of sagebrush and wild thyme, lifted by a hint of white pepper.

title: Stolpman 2016 Estate Grown Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Compact elderberry aromas and purple flowers mesh with savory touches of roasted beef and black pepper on the nose of this bottling, which is quite young. Black-currant and lilac flavors pop on the sip before the tightly woven structure temporarily hides them, though they will surely arise in the years to come. Drink 2020–2036.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Faith Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Intensely dark in the glass, this impressive blend of 58% Petite Sirah, 39% Syrah and 3% Carignan shows strong aromas of black currant, black plum, whole peppercorn and violet. Sandy tannins frame the dry palate, which combines structural power with balanced depth, offering flavors of black currant and burned caramel that are buoyed by bright acidity.

title: Chiron Wines 2015 Candor Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Densely concentrated and rich in red fruit, this 100% varietal wine also offers complex layers of tobacco, earth and dried herb, mingling it all together into a cohesive whole. The tannins are plush and polished, giving the wine strength with purpose.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Estate Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A beautiful shade of light purple in the glass, this first estate bottling off of this new property in the southwest corner of the appellation shows red currant, cherry and star anise on the nose. The palate starts with tangy black-raspberry fruit, but the focus is the compelling tannic tension and bright acid.

title: Folded Hills 2016 Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Roasted berries, dark cocoa, white pepper and a touch of tar make for a compelling aromatic entry to this bottling from the new project owned by Andy Busch from the famous brewing family. It's firmly textured on the palate, offering flavors of black plum, lilac and a hint of charcoal.

title: LaRue 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Katy Wilson crafts a delicate, grainy and textured wine from coastal fruit in this light-bodied, crisp and fresh take on the variety. Impressive on the midpalate in establishing just the right amount of weight to give it complexity and bite, it finishes in a seductive layer of clove and cola.

title: Bella Grace 2017 Viognier (Amador County)
description: This rather hefty and powerful white wine has plenty to explore. It offers aromas of smoke, roses and flint, flavors that are ripe like pears with a savory aspect like sliced fennel bulb and a big rounded texture.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Vin Gris de Cigare Reserve Rosé (Central Coast)
description: This reserve rosé, which is a blend of 50% Grenache, 15% Grenache Blanc, 12% Cinsaut, 12% Mourvèdre, 8% Carignane and 3% Roussanne, does indeed show a bit of age and elegance. The nose starts with light strawberry and preserved lemons before turning a bit nutty with browned-butter touches. The palate offers a blend of walnuts, nectarine and orange rind, with a hint of pine.

title: Effort 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: Meyer lemon rind, wet gravel, lime blossom and a touch of toast show on the nose of this bottling, which is quite restrained. It's tightly wound and quite grippy on the palate, where clean and crisp flavors of river stone and citrus shine through.

title: Feist 2016 Reserve Cooper Vineyard Barbera (Amador County)
description: This is a big wine that shows concentrated berry and black-pepper flavors, with accents of rosemary and wood smoke. Firm tannins and good acidity give plenty of grip.

title: Kukkula 2014 Iso Red (Adelaida District)
description: The name “Iso” is Finnish for big, and this blend of 90% Cabernet Sauvignon and 10% Syrah fits that bill, showing pure and clean aromas of blackberry jelly, caramelized black currants, dried herbs and vanilla spice. The red and purple-fruit flavors are very candied and sweet-seeming, but there are dashes of herbs and acidity to add complexity.

title: Lorimar 2015 Meritage (California)
description: This dry Bordeaux-style blend is rich and satisfying, showing generous berry and plum aromas, a mouthfilling texture and nuances of earth and leather that complement the fruit flavors. It is full bodied but not too tannic.

title: Niner 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Stewed red currants and a hint of licorice make for a familiar nose on this twist-top blend of Cabernet Franc, Merlot, Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Grenache, Malbec, Petit Verdot and Barbera. Those bits combine for a tannic sip that's full of acid, with bright and juicy red fruit flavors and sarsaparilla spice.

title: Pech Merle 2017 Loasa Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc
description: Aromas like wet stones and smoked ham meet flavors that are also slightly earthy, along with good lemon and crisp apple notes. The wine is medium bodied, nicely tart and not at all bland.

title: Roblar 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated aromas of cranberry and pomegranate meet with tangy orange peels and juniper spice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is loaded with rich, thick and dense dark red-fruit flavors, which are leveled by herbal touches of forest moss and a shiitake-like umami kick.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal in cedar, wood and a thick concentration of blueberry and dark cherry, this is a fruity and likable wine that finishes in a dollop of milk chocolate.

title: Verde 2015 Estate Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Black plum, cocoa, coffee spice and raisin syrup show on the fairly ripe yet not overdone nose of this bottling. The palate is well integrated with flavors of red cherry, baking spice and a vanilla finish, all presented with fresh acidity.

title: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Syrah (Placer County)
description: Mild aromas of wood smoke and charred oak lead to rich and layered blackberry flavors that are so ripe they're almost sweet. A firm but smooth texture completes this medium- to full-bodied wine.

title: Le Casque 2015 Adrian Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Ripe black-fruit aromas and flavors and moderate spicy oak accents give this full-bodied wine an easy appeal. Made from Mourvèdre and Syrah, it has a smooth, lightly tannic texture and hints of black pepper and smoke that develop in the glass.

title: RouteStock 2016 Route 121 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: High-toned floral aromas of jasmine open this wine, in a Sauvignon Blanc-reminiscent way, bright and steely on the nose with a touch of reduction and oak following. Dense rich layers of apple, pear and mango define the midpalate.

title: Schramsberg 2012 Redding Ranch Brut Sparkling (Marin County)
description: This wine smells earthy at first, tastes quite dry and minerally and has a savory edge on the finish. It is nicely austere, very tight in texture and seems to hold its fruit flavors tightly too. With time in the glass the bold character of the Pinot Noir base wine takes over.

title: Septentrio 2014 Tempranillo (Lake County)
description: This full-bodied wine exudes aromas of new leather, sandalwood and black cherries, while the flavors are ripe and mouthfilling. Plenty of tannin coats the palate before the wine slowly releases dark-chocolate and cherry-candy notes on the finish.

title: Sofia 2017 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Monterey County)
description: This is certain to please large crowds, starting with its brilliant pink color and clean aromas of bubblegum, raspberry and chalk. It's taut and tight in texture, with pink-lemonade and fresh framboise flavors that will appease both experts and neophytes.

title: Steele 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Vanilla, caramel and roasted cherry aromas make for a lavish yet not overly rich nose on this bottling from the historic vineyard. The palate offers a similar trio of flavors, proving very familiar if not particularly complex.

title: Stolo 2016 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Showing slightly sour touches on the nose, this estate bottling offers aromas of lemon peels, limeade honeysuckle and apple flesh. It's also very tangy on the palate with lime peels and lemon juice, but delivers a touch of hazelnut warmth and even a flash of marshmallow on the finish.

title: White Hart Wine 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: It may be impossible to find a carefully made old-vine Pinot Noir from a single vineyard (McIntyre) for just $25 other than this bottling. Earthy tones of dried red fruit meet with pepper and smoked pork on the nose, while the palate offers dark pomegranate, star anise and a touch of smoke.

title: Havens 2014 Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 60% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Malbec, the result a sanguine meaty expression of classic structure and hearty extraction. Black currant, cassis, cedar and underbrush provide a savory earthy mix of flavor and complexity.

title: Jax 2016 Dutton Ranch 7 Barrels Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Focused, fresh acidity rules the day in this well-made wine made from Kirk Venge. Aromas and flavors of pineapple, white flower and golden oak meld together to offer a lush yet balanced experience.

title: Klinker Brick 2014 Farrah Grand Reserve Syrah (Lodi)
description: This is a flashy, very full-bodied wine that's saturated with spicy smoky oak from the initial aroma through the finish. Luckily, it has bold and concentrated blackberry flavors that meet the oak half way and keep it deep and satisfying to sip.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2017 Pierre's Pirouette Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Light pink in the glass with a tiny bit of effervescence in its youth, this rosé of 48% Grenache, 43% Mourvèdre and 9% Cinsault shows tart tangerine, grapefruit pith, watermelon and strawberry water on the nose. There's tremendous sizzle to the sip and plenty of textural depth, carrying flavors of watermelon rind and ripe flesh.

title: MacRostie 2015 The Key Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Creamy thick, sultry and savory, this is a small-production wine made to impress and provide impact, which it does well. Baked apple pie dusted in cardamom is the lingering reward, buoyed in medium acidity and an armful of toasted oak.

title: Naggiar 2014 Estate Petit Verdot (Sierra Foothills)
description: Extremely tasty fruit flavors and a broad welcoming mouthfeel make this medium-bodied estate-grown wine hard to resist. It has perfectly pure and fruity flavors, like blackberry and black cherry, just a hint of tannin and subtle spicy tones that come out with time.

title: Napa Cellars 2016 Classic Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Stainless-steel aging retains a welcome crispness in this wine, which evolves in the glass into a medium-bodied, fleshy expression of peach, melon and butter. It's well integrated and approachable.

title: Plungerhead 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Generous fruit flavors make this wine a standout. There is very little new oak influence, and who needs it when the blueberry, blackberry and raspberry notes are so delicious and layered? A creamy texture and lingering finish complete the picture.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Syrah (Sonoma County-Napa County)
description: Aged only in neutral oak, this bold, lushly concentrated wine is big in blueberry, with a savage feral component of compost and sage. The smoky oak and tannin are intensely intertwined, while a back note of dried herb recalls the Old Wold.

title: Sleeping Giant 2014 Inglewood Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Dark berry and tobacco ride along a pathway of taut tight-grained tannin in this well-made wine, aged in all French oak, 75% of it new. Within a powerfully ripe robust frame it allows room for bright vibrant acidity to speak and freshen the otherwise full-bodied expression.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Roussanne (Adelaida District)
description: Pristine lemon-blossom aromas meet with cherimoya, peach and guava skins on the nose of this bottling. There's a hint of smoke to the sip, where zippy lemon peels, more guava and a touch of toast on the finish combine for a very restrained take on the grape.

title: Tablas Creek 2016 Patelin de Tablas Blanc Grenache Blanc-Viognier-Roussanne-Marsanne-Clairette Blanche White (Adelaida District)
description: Light and delicate on the nose, this blend of 52% Grenache Blanc, 24% Viognier, 12% Roussanne, 9% Marsanne and 3% Clairette Blanche shows candied lemon, baking soda and freshly cut nectarine on the fleshy nose. The palate is loaded with both zip and riper qualities, with apple, pear and citrus elements showing through the tightly wound, texturally compelling sip.
designation: Patelin de Tablas Blanc Grenache Blanc-Viognier-Roussanne-Marsanne-Clairette Blanche

title: The Hidden Gallery 2015 Unti Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a well-known site in the heart of the appellation, this wine is tight and tannic, offering robust layers of leather, tobacco, toasted oak, black licorice and dust tones. There's also an earthy element that works well with lingering cedar and black pepper notes.

title: Westwood 2015 Annadel Gap Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: An estate wine that's 100% varietal, this is thick and unrelenting in concentration, with blackberry, black licorice, leather and smoky oak pleading for attention in equal measure. Rough and tumble power and intensity rule the day, with seasonings of coffee and cinnamon.

title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2013 CYRUS Red (Alexander Valley)
description: While Cabernet Sauvignon-driven, this blend includes all five major red Bordeaux varieties. It offers plenty of full-bodied richness within framing, structured tannins. The palate is marked by flavors of leather saddle, pencil, black cherry and cassis.

title: Bee's Box 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Rich, soft and mouthfilling, this wine from Francis Ford Coppola has plenty of ripe black-cherry, black-plum and strawberry flavors, a broad mouthfeel and gentle texture. Light on acidity and heavy on fruitiness, it's easy to enjoy.

title: Big Smooth 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Very ripe and saturated in flavor, this wine lives up to its name and velvet-finish label. It is full bodied, mouthfilling and nicely viscous in texture. Late harvest and dried-fruit flavors like raisins and prunes dominate the aroma and palate, while moderate tannins and acidity liven it up a bit. A sense of richness helps all that flavor linger on the finish.

title: Cast 2014 Watson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Reduced, this wine is densely concentrated and thick in tannin and oak. Structured to age, it offers an abundance of blackberry, cherry and cured meat, with a lasting imprint of smoky char.

title: Cellars 33 2015 Hummingbird Hill Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy and earthy, this small-production offering is etched in tart and tangy flavor, with a strong underlying influence of oak. The medium-bodied core is succulent in cranberry and rhubarb.

title: Etude 2016 Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: A lovely, substantial white, this offers rocky, floral mineral elements around a medium build of viscosity and relative density. Lemon zest and apricot flavors provide freshness and depth.

title: Bydand 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softly round and voluptuous in style, this wine offers oaky char overtones and brawny black fruit. Full bodied, it finishes with secondary characteristics of leather and black pepper that balance well against the dense fruit.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Vogensen Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dense, concentrated layers of plum, dark cherry and blackberry intermingle on the brooding palate. Vanilla and cinnamon add seasoning and hints of richness. This is sourced from a site considered somewhat extreme for the appellation, on the back side of Bradford Mountain.

title: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Private Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Juicy aromas of black currant and black cherry are bolstered by tones of vanilla and coffee. It's rich, soft and lush on the sip, with a grippy tannic frame that supports flavors of blackberry syrup and espresso bean. The acidity rises on the finish.

title: Eberle 2015 Eberle Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Baked black cherry, black plum and shaved licorice make for a thick aromatic profile on the nose of this estate bottling by the legend Gary Eberle and winemaker Chris Eberle (no relation, really). Ripe blackberry, purple flowers and dark chocolate shavings show on the palate, which is elegantly wrapped in chalky tannins and buoyant acidity.

title: Flanagan 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this full-bodied wine is spicy, earthy, dark and dense, with strong flavors of Gravenstein apple and nutmeg. The aromas are floral, a hearty mix of honeysuckle and apple blossom.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2016 Lozier Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Boysenberry juice, wild thyme and mint make for a compelling entry to this blend of 34% Grenache, 33% Syrah and 33% Mondeuse. The palate is quite dry and framed by decent tannins and fresh acidity, carrying a strong mint and berry flavor combination.

title: Michel Rolland Napa Valley 2013 MR Red (Napa Valley)
description: Lifted acidity buoys hefty dusty tannins in this well-made red, a collaboration between its famous French namesake and Napa Valley winemaker Jean Hoefliger of Alpha Omega Winery. Dried herb, soy, oak and tobacco all make a full-bodied, richly rewarding statement, complementing the quiet tangy red fruit.

title: Midnight 2014 Starlight Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: Rose petal, potpourri, red cherry and vanilla make for an elegant entry to this bottling, which spent 26 months in neutral French oak. There is decent structure to the palate, where cranberry and red-cherry flavors decorate roasted meat and violet touches.

title: Miro 2016 Cuvée Sasha Red (North Coast)
description: This medium- to full-bodied wine heaps on the fruit flavors but has a good backbone of moderate tannins and acidity that make it appetizing and keep it tasting fresh on the finish. Made from mostly Grenache and Syrah, it has a dash of Petite Sirah, too.

title: Navarro 2016 Deep End Gewürztraminer (Anderson Valley)
description: Aromas like white cherries and pistachios, and flavors that are floral and deeply fruity give a lot of depth and substance to this medium- to full-bodied wine. The texture is rich and soothing and leads to a good lingering finish.

title: Reynoso 2016 Putnam Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick, rich and smoky fruit dominates in this full-bodied densely lush vineyard-designate. Dark cherry, cola and clove round out the interwoven flavors.

title: Skinner 2017 Grenache Blanc (El Dorado)
description: Fruity and vibrant, this crisp and clean wine brings fresh green apples to the aroma and an almost citrus character to the flavors, which have floral and almond accents too. It shows medium body and a nicely round texture balanced by good acidity.

title: Spring Mountain Vineyard 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's grand estate atop Spring Mountain, this is a memorable white, exuberant in apple, stone fruit and lemon peel, with a tease of guava. The acidity is integrated well and complementary to its contoured texture and hint of minerality.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Ne Cede Malis Petite Sirah (Stags Leap District)
description: Blended with 15% mixed varieties, this estate-grown red is oaky and robust, generous in youthful, chalky tannin. Mocha, caramel and coffee flavors ride along a wave of sharp blueberry and strawberry, with a persistence of black pepper.

title: The Pinot Project 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is such a great buy from importer Michael Skurnik who turned to California for this wine. While supple in texture, the wine packs in dense red-cherry and ripe raspberry aromas and flavors that seem subtle at first but slowly open and expand with each sniff and sip. It has good layering and an excellent balance of moderate tannins and acidity.

title: Via Romano 2017 Pinot Grigio (Sierra Foothills)
description: Rich fig and almond flavors follow a floral aroma in this full-bodied and mouth-filling wine. Melon, mineral and consommé notes add complexity while the generous texture coats the tongue and creates a lingering finish.

title: William Hill Estate 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Tightly wound in pillowy tannins, this big, boldly ripe red is awash in blackberry, black currant, black cherry and vanilla flavors. The finish is succulent and lingering.

title: XYZin 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Dusty tobacco and thick concentrated tannic structure dominate in this ripe full-bodied wine. Blackberry cobbler comes to mind on the palate, alongside mocha chocolate and brown sugar.

title: Chronic Cellars 2016 Sofa King Bueno Red (Paso Robles)
description: This widely available, cleverly named blend of 44% Syrah, 31% Grenache, 13% Petite Sirah, 10% Mourvèdre and 2% Tannat packs in a ton of flavor for the price, offering fresh, inviting aromas of baked black cherry, boysenberry pie and vanilla. The palate is clean and juicy, with berry, thyme, cracked pepper and lavender flavors.

title: Aperture 2015 Soil Specific Red (Alexander Valley)
description: This blends 40% Cabernet Sauvignon with 31% Malbec, 26% Merlot and 3% Cabernet Franc, aging the whole in 70% new oak. Woody and tightly wound in tannin, it offers strong layered flavors of blueberry, cinnamon and dark chocolate, finishing dry and peppery.

title: Vigilance 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Red Hills)
description: Smooth and flavorful, this wine has plenty of pear and light herb aromas. Light spice, mineral and melon flavors offer a good sense of layering on the palate, all leading to a generous mouthfeel and lingering finish.

title: Cobblestone 2007 Cobblestone Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: A wine that is still available in limited amounts, this aged red offers classic secondary aromas of leather, tobacco and raisin, with a seasoning of clove. Drink soon—it risks being quickly past its prime.

title: Domaine Carneros 2015 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: From the neighboring vineyard that has done so much for the variety in this appellation, this white is grainy in toasted oak and caramel crème brûlée, rich and made in a full-bodied style. The richness is kept in check by juicy notions of baked tangerine and Meyer lemon.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine is predominantly Cabernet Sauvignon, blended with small amounts of Merlot, Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Smoky, toasted oak underlies rounded layers of blueberry, black cherry and plum, leaving the palate rich and pleasing.

title: Etude 2015 Grace Benoist Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Carneros)
