description: Earthy and robustly expansive on the palate, this wine is full of black cherry, oak and bark elements—complementary expressions that work well within a medium-bodied context. A smoky element of forest floor lingers on the finish.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2013 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Exotic aromas of wildflowers are inviting on the entry of this wine, which is bright in fresh acidity with a backbone of substantial tannin that presents as intense. Pomegranate and strawberry tanginess follow through nicely on the textured palate.

title: Foxen 7200 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Ripe apples, lime skin, chalk and Asian pear aromas slowly come to the fore on the nose of this subtle bottling. It lands very cleanly on the palate, offering yellow apples, hints of chalk and chiseled marble and then a slightly tropical swing toward mango on the finish.

title: Iron Horse 2015 Deer Gate Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: With a slight note of reduction and toasted oak, this wine is ultimately high-toned and high in acidity, with fresh streaks of plum and black cherry. Accents of dried herbs pepper it with additional complexity and earthiness.

title: Jalopy 2016 Dr. Sundquist Riesling (Los Olivos District)
description: This bottling, of which all profits go toward climate research in honor of the winemaker's scientist father, shows candied orange peels, fresh lily blossoms, pear flesh and a touch of cream on the nose. The palate is impressively cohesive and complex, its grippy texture carrying flavors of grapefruit pith, peach and a touch of hazelnut.

title: Jessie's Grove 2015 Ancient Vine Carignane (Lodi)
description: Intense, freshly crushed berry aromas and flavors seem to light up this full-bodied, bold and ripe wine. The fruit flavors are focused and pure and the texture is vibrant, giving the wine a lot of life.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Vintner's Reserve Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a spicy, oaky, full-bodied wine that's alluring in aroma and rich in flavor. Hints of vanilla, nutmeg and coconut lead to broad, ripe cherry and raspberry flavors on a smooth and lightly tannic texture.

title: Dragonette 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Forest undergrowth, muddy earth, crushed tarragon, dried mint and dark but not sweet plums show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate shows earthy clay flavors as well as ripe cranberry and rose petals.

title: Etude 2015 Deer Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Perfumed in rose and violet and velvety smooth, this thick concentrated wine is richly woven in black cherry and black licorice. Its weightiness is youthful yet in check.

title: Ferguson Crest 2014 Private Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Candied blackberry and black currant meet with lilacs on the concentrated gooey nose of this bottling by the pop star Fergie and her father. The thick blackberry note shows on the palate as well, with beef char, a touch of teriyaki and liquefied violets.

title: Hawley 2017 Hopkins River Ranch Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark in color, this is a pretty wine, intensely aromatic in jasmine, anise and fresh flavors of white peach and green apple. Medium bodied, it has some oomph to the palate but is balanced.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This is a smooth mouth-filling wine that's easy to love for its deft combination of ripe plum and black cherry along with chocolate and baking-spice undertones. It feels medium bodied, well balanced and has a touch of tannin to help the texture.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The longtime Rhône variety-focused winery is expanding into Burgundian varieties, and this first Chardonnay is a solid start. Aromas of lime, white melon, wet stone and a touch of guava lean toward a richer expression. The palate is rounded with clotted cream, salt and lemon zest flavors, balancing between the buttery Californian and tenser Old World styles.

title: Municipal Winemakers NV The Fizz Sparkling Shiraz (Santa Barbara County)
description: Sparkling red wines aren't a common options, but Dave Potter has been making one for almost a decade, and it's a tasty twist for the table. This version is just as advertised: Syrah with bubbles, so the nose shows concentrated blackberry syrup and the palate combines boysenberry, black pepper and purple flowers. The effervescence enhances the graphite minerality.

title: Potek 2014 Blanc de Blanc Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Rounded, yeasty aromas of baking bread, sharp apple skins and the slightest hint of petrol show on the nose of this bubbly by Dave Potter. The bubbles are incredibly sharp and the tangy citrus flavors are refreshingly sour, with a dried apple touch rounding out the midpalate.

title: Roth 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This soft, round Merlot blends in small amounts of Malbec and Syrah to offer a powerful, full-bodied frame. It's lengthy on the palate in tart red fruit, integrated oak and fresh acidity.

title: Ancien 2015 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Dark cherry and pomegranate take on a delicate nature in this mineral-laden red, tasting of crushed rock and orange zest. A gritty complex texture rides beneath and is lifted by firm buoyant acidity.

title: Angry Bunch 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This wine captures a wild brambly character without being tricked up with new oak. Bolstered by 6% Petite Sirah, 3% Syrah and 2% Alicante, it shows raspberry and tea aromas, while the palate brings ample cherry and raspberry flavors and balanced tannins.

title: Ballard Lane 2017 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Tight aromas of lime, wet stone and bright lemon are quite fresh on the nose of this well-priced wine. There is tension to the palate, carrying flavors of nectarine, white melon and tangy citrus.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV6 Estate Single Vineyard Series Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brawny in tones of toffee and coffee, this wine is generous in tannin and rich and rounded in feel. Black olive and blackberry flavors contrast well on the palate, making this a composed package.

title: Eberle 2017 Côtes-Du-Rôbles Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Delicate and chalky on the nose, this blend of 50% Grenache Blanc, 46% Roussanne and 4% Viognier offers pear, honeysuckle and nectarine aromas. There is solid zip on the palate, where cantaloupe, lemon skin and dried apple flavors are touched with exotic saffron spice.

title: Enotria 2016 Arneis (Mendocino)
description: Crisp and lively, this light-bodied wine smells citrusy, tastes tangy and fruity and has a zippy mouthfeel. It's very refreshing and will be great at lunch or to start an evening's festivities.

title: Grounded Wine Co. 2017 Space Age Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: A pretty and clean color of pink, this Grenache-based rosé by Josh Phelps shows fresh aromas of strawberry, watermelon, wet stone and pink blossoms. The palate's light cherry flavors are offset by just enough textural tension.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture RVG White (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh and succulent but not overripe aromas of pear, peach and guava peel are very prominent on the nose of this blend of 49% Roussanne, 37% Grenache Blanc and 14% Viognier that saw both oak and acacia barrels. Mango and guava flavors are cut by a sharp citrus flash of lime juice on the palate, which offers a long finish.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Very subtle on the nose, aromas of ripe pear and honeydew emerge with patience, as do mineral streaks of chalk and wet cement. There is abundant energy to the sip, where gravel and chalk flavors linger in the forefront and bright key lime and hints of mango and papaya show on the backdrop.

title: Meeker 2015 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Rich red cherry and cinnamon highlight a big-boned wine that's lengthy in clove, cinnamon and dried herb. The components work well within brawny, chalky tannin and toasted oak.

title: Meyer Family Cellars NV Port (California)
description: An outstanding after-dinner drink, this wine has a tawny color along the rim and abundant nutty mapley apricot-like flavors. A combination of elevated alcohol, good acidity and firm tannins gives it a grip on the palate and contributes to a long tasty nutty finish.

title: Peltier 2016 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A dark color, concentrated flavors and firm tannins make this a deep and impressive wine. It has nicely ripe flavors like blackberries and black cherries, a grippy texture and very full body.

title: Pine & Brown 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Brawny in brown sugar and black cherry, this is a robust, 100% varietal wine made from two vineyard sites within the appellation. Soft, supple and approachable in its balanced richness, it finishes in mocha.

title: Pride Mountain 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Generous in strong fruit flavors of cherry liqueur and blueberry jam, this is a full-bodied expression of the grape blended with small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot. The tannins are powerful and opulent.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Old Kraft Vineyard Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: With a charred, meaty nose, this wine has a strong tannic profile and thickness of fruit, layering from blueberry to plum. It remains concentrated and thick on the palate through highlights of black pepper, cinnamon and clove.

title: Rockpile 2016 Jack's Cabin Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: Juicy black fruit and big oak give this 100% varietal wine a notable opulence around deep layers of mocha, dark chocolate and nutmeg. It is full bodied but not overbearing, showing balanced lushness.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is sourced from three of the family's best coastal sites: Roberts Road, Fedrick and Amaral Vineyards. Earthy, spicy and floral in rose and lavender, it has an enduring and endearing softness on the palate and crisp focused flavors of blueberry, nutmeg and vanilla.

title: Sonoma-Loeb 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has a yeasty nose and intense opening acidity that mellows in the glass. Earthy and complex, it's unabashedly lush and full bodied, with spicy highlights of rhubarb, pomegranate and orange peel.

title: Stewart 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: A 100% varietal wine that celebrates its strength and softness in equal measure, this wine delights in crayon wax, dried herb and red currant, the initial elements complemented in black plum, clove and cedar. Savory and tannic, it shows a balanced approach to its full-bodied ripeness on the lasting finish.

title: Stolpman 2017 Roussanne (Ballard Canyon)
description: A dark shade of yellow in the glass, this bottling offers aromas of orange cream, salted lemons, concentrated melon and a light brush of oak. There is good grip and a decent sizzle to the sip before it settles into fleshy fruit, offering dried peach, sea salt, mango and savory roast chicken flavors.

title: Amor Fati 2015 Mossfire Ranch Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Deep and dark aromas of roasted coffee, crushed lava rocks, blackberry and blueberry show on the hearty nose of this bottling. Espresso bean and walnut flavors arise on the sip, which picks up an elderberry element and is framed by solid acidity and forgiving tannins.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2015 3 Sum Red (Paso Robles)
description: Lush aromas of candied strawberry, plum jelly and the lift of spearmint arise on the nose of this blend of 77% Zinfandel, 15% Syrah and 8% Cabernet Sauvignon. Rich black-currant flavors are enhanced by clove and cardamom on the palate.

title: Bellante 2016 Dierberg Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Black cherry, mint and tarragon converge for a very rich, dark and herbally lifted nose on this single-vineyard expression. The palate is layered with marjoram, lavender and Earl Grey tea flavors that decorate the richer cranberry and rosewater background.

title: Cedarville 2015 Estate Syrah (El Dorado)
description: This wine is rich and concentrated from the deep garnet color to the blackberry aromas and generous, almost jammy fruit flavors. Full body, moderate tannins and mild acidity provide good balance and a mouth-filling texture.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2015 Reserve Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Fair Play)
description: This is a serious, even age-worthy wine that packs wonderfully ripe black-cherry and black-currant flavors into a frame of firm tannins and good acidity. Full body and a mouth-filling viscosity make it impressive on the palate, while the flavors are so concentrated they linger nicely on the finish. Best after 2022.

title: Hudson Vineyards 2016 Pick Up Sticks Estate Grown Grenache (Carneros)
description: With 9% Syrah and 1% Viognier, this wine tastes of strawberry compote, violet and rose—floral and enticing with its robust backbone of clove and leather. Smoothly textured, it's a joy to drink, and a fine pairing with charcuterie and grilled meats.

title: Jarvis 2016 Finch Hollow Estate Grown Cave Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Estate-grown and fermented in the producer's deep caves within Atlas Peak, this wine is aromatic in matchstick and oak. The palate offers a lush, layered and full-bodied rendering of apple, pear and brioche flavors.
designation: Finch Hollow Estate Grown Cave Fermented

title: Arista 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Robustly concentrated and rich in ripe notions of apple, pear and white peach, this wine offers an intensity on the midpalate and plenty of lush length. It finishes with ease, allowing room for toasted oak and vanilla to linger.

title: Roblar 2016 Estate Cabernet Franc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Snappy black raspberry and young strawberry aromas meet with white pepper, marjoram and a touch of vanilla bean on the nose of this estate bottling, a blend of two clones. Caramelized cranberry and underripe raspberry flavors show on the lighter-bodied sip, lifted by anise and clove.

title: Vermeil 2015 Jean Louis Vermeil Frediani Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Calistoga)
description: This is a tightly constructed, well-mannered wine, lifted by the addition of 24% Cabernet Franc. Turned earth and violet aromas give in to an intensely concentrated midpalate of rich blueberry and black cherry, the finish structured and strong in oak.

title: Von Holt 2015 Suacci Family Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Intoxicatingly floral in rose petal and lavender, this wine is abundant in juicy red fruit and spicy acidity, with a cool-climate earthiness that's undeniably enjoyable and intriguing.

title: Covenant 2016 Landsman Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: Jammy in brambly blackberry and simultaneously exotic in cured meat, this wine offers a wealth of lavender, licorice and leather, the body integrated in tannin and oak. It finishes softly round.

title: Covenant 2016 The Tribe Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: This nicely combines 85% Merlot and 15% Zinfandel into a winning mix of sanguine currant, cranberry and black olive set against a backdrop of smoked meat and black pepper. Thick and lush on the palate, it aims to please and succeeds.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: This estate-grown wine shows a balance of fleshy peach and mango settled on a light-bodied frame. There's a backbone of oak and a stony texture that offers support to the broad fruit flavors.

title: D.R. Stephens 2016 Silver Eagle Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy and spicy, this wine is hugely concentrated and textural. Dried herb, black tea, pomegranate and cardamom cola mingle on the palate in a balanced, focused way, buoyant in background acidity.

title: De Loach 2015 Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Juicy black fruit rides along an integrated, full-bodied essence of power in this strong, succulent red. Grilled meat, lavender and black pepper accentuate the brambly blackberry and plum.

title: Della 2016 Terra de Promissio Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky and powerful in a backbone of full-bodied ripeness and tannin, this is a juicy, succulent wine defined by dark cherry, strawberry and pomegranate, with a thread of persistence earthiness and black tea.

title: Eden Rift 2016 Chardonnay (Cienega Valley)
description: Subtle at first on the nose, this bottling shows sharp yuzu, yellow apple and mineral tones on the focused nose. It's very taut on the palate, offering hints of Pink Lady and Gravenstein apple as well as a lemon rind kick.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2013 Duo Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Baked red currants and boysenberry paste meet with sweet wood, charcoal-grilled meat and toast on the nose of this bottling, which includes 2% Petit Verdot. It's quite expressive on the palate, showing flavors of pencil shavings, ripe berries and Concord grapes.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 Super Tuscan Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A lighter shade of red in the glass, this blend of 57% Sangiovese, 28% Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Merlot shows joyous aromas of ripe red currant and a hint of balsam. There is a compelling combination of pine-like mint and rounded red cherry and strawberry on the palate, with a gravelly minerality and smoked pork flavors in the background.

title: Sand Point 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This full-bodied wine amps up the butter and vanilla notes on a rich soft texture. It is mouth-filling, verging on sweet, and feels low in acidity.

title: Wine Spots 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet tannins emphasize a rich rounded midpalate of jammy dark cherry and a smooth texture, making for a fruit-forward approachability that will please an array of palates at a fair price point.

title: Liparita 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: Rounded in nondescript aspects of apple and crushed stone, this lightly ripe white is floral in jasmine and honeysuckle and is easily quaffable.

title: Silver NV 724 Reddick Street Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Stewed cranberry, roasted meat and a reductive tarry quality show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite tangy, a bit overextracted and slightly odd, with flavors of roasted figs, smoked nuts and a hint of balsamic vinegar.

title: Sostener 2015 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Very ripe aromas of black plum, tangy earth and baked fruitcake show on the nose of this bottling, which is aimed at raising the sustainability message. Dried berries and leather reveal themselves on the palate, which is a touch overcooked but lifted by decent acid.

title: St. Anne's Crossing 2014 Slattery Road Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Soft and moderately structured, this is a 100% varietal wine that's jammy in black cherry and berry with a strong presence of tannin.

title: Bella Luna 2014 Estate Riserva Sangiovese-Cabernet Sauvignon (Templeton Gap District)
description: Black currant, balsamic blackberry, roasted meat and purple flowers show on the nose of this blend of 60% Sangiovese and 40% Cabernet Sauvignon. There is chalky grip on the sip, which grows quite strong by the finished, and tangy flavors of balsamic fig sauce.

title: Broken Earth 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Hickory smoke wafts across the nose of this bottling against a red berry backdrop. That smoky character extends to the palate, which also shows blackberry jam and tangy plum-skin flavors.

title: Kirkland Signature 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This is a tasty, dry, well-balanced wine that offers plenty of fruit flavor and a nice nip of tannin in the texture. It has a figgy aroma and ripe strawberry and plum flavors that will please a crowd.

title: Ballard Lane 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: A touch reductive even with plenty of time to breathe, this bottling offers ripe blackberry, tar and game aromas on the nose. Dried herbs, more game and sour black fruits show on the palate, which ends on a vanilla-cookie finish.

title: Charles Krug 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: Grassy and herbal, this white is tart and tight in acidity, with a low level of ripeness that keeps it crisp and clean. Lemongrass and lime round out the finish.

title: Chronic Cellars 2016 Suite Petite Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Lighter than most Petite Sirahs, this bottling shows a boysenberry-laced fruit-punch aroma on the nose alongside cola and black-cherry soda pop. The palate is very juicy with plum, violet and lavender touches.

title: Écluse 2015 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This Zinfandel is crafted in a more underripe style, which is a laudable effort, but falls a bit short. Aromas of tangy plum skin, mulberry and baked tomato lead into a earthy palate of moss, tobacco and tomato leaf.

title: Lawer 2016 Betsy's Vineyard Viognier (Knights Valley)
description: Nutty, metallic and tropical, this estate-grown white takes on a voluptuous, unctuous texture and sweet ripeness.

title: Ledson 2014 Estate Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: Turned earth, compost and dried herb greet the entry of this full-bodied, fully ripe wine, intense in compressed, jammy red and black fruit.

title: Magnolia Court Dorrian 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Bright red berries and slightly damp herbs show on the inviting nose of this bottling, which starts quite juicy. The mouthfeel is fairly light and fresh if simple and easy, with decent acidity though not much structure.

title: Belden Barns 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Strong flavors and aromas of pea shoots, peach and sweet vanilla give this wine a richness and full-bodied, fleshy personality.

title: Sevtap 2016 Leyla Semillon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Baked lemon and orange meet with grassy aromas on the rather reductive nose of this bottling, which also shows lots of dried citrus pith. Tangy lemon peel and very ripe nectarine flavors arise on the palate.

title: Sevtap 2016 Vermentino (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Citrus rinds, pear flesh and a hint of nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. Warm yellow-apple flavors meet with poached pear and blanched almond on the palate.

title: Taft Street 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Dark in color, this is a textured, tannic and dry wine, robust in rose petal, dark cherry and pomegranate.

title: Sanctuary 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a testament to oak, having aged in 80% new French barrels for 15 months. Ripe and intense, it melds tart black olive and clove with plush rounded layers of caramel and coffee.

title: Sketchbook 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: Well structured due to firm tannins and acidity, this full-bodied wine is also a good value. It will pair well with the richest proteins and has lightly earthy and spicy aromas, vivid and taut flavors like fresh blackberries and a nicely gripping mouthfeel.

title: Summit Lake 2013 Emily Kestrel Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Muted in leathery tobacco, this is a thick wine sticky in woody tannin and dusty stoniness. Decadent and concentrated, it offers layers and layers of blackberry and chocolate.

title: Terragena 2013 Father and Son Blend Holden-Mapley Vineyard Red (Alexander Valley)
description: Cabernet Franc edges out its companion Cabernet Sauvignon 54% to 46% in this light-bodied quietly ripe wine. Sage, cedar and fresh herb provide a vegetal underbelly that will appeal to fans of those flavors and style, with a juicy underbelly that's marked by a tartness of cranberry.
designation: Father and Son Blend Holden-Mapley Vineyard

title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Cuvee Jeane Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: A light touch of cut grass leads to lemon rinds, citrus spray, Gala apples and a touch of guava on the nose of this widely available wine. It's clean and crisp on the palate, where stone fruit and apple flavors reign, set against a chalky texture.

title: Croma Vera 2015 Revelacion Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dried rose petals, concentrated red cherry, anise, thyme and caramel show on the nose of this blend of Tempranillo, Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. The palate is dominated by a rustic sagebrush quality, with earthy red berry and crushed slate adding pleasant complexity.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Thick and moderate in structure, this wine is fleshy, lush and tropical in nature. Swirled in butterscotch, vanilla and caramel, the oak is toasty and supportive.

title: Birichino 2016 Vin Gris Rosé (California)
description: Light strawberry aromas meet with pink lemon and tangerine rinds on the simple nose of this bottling. The palate shows pleasant touches of strawberry and lemon as well as a touch of peat and pine smoke, but is missing some acidic boost.

title: Ca' Momi 2016 Bianco White (California)
description: Savory earthy accents complement ripe melon flavors and a generous texture in this pale-colored, medium-bodied wine. It has good heft on the palate, and is rich enough to keep the flavors lingering.

title: La Honda Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose on this bottling is quite shy at first, and then slowly arise aromas of citrus pith, sliced Gravenstein apple and a mushroomy, woody component. The palate's citrus rinds, pomelo pith and hints of tangerine are presented on a well-wound frame.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This is a voluptuously lush white wine awash in pineapple, honeyed pear, vanilla and toasty oak. Moderate acidity supports its rich ripe fruit-forward nature.

title: La Crema 2016 Pinot Gris (Monterey)
description: There's a touch of fizz to the glass in this twist-top bottling, which shows light peach, yellow melon, sliced apple and orange-cake aromas. The flavors are subtle but the texture is decent with acidity and grip, allowing ripe pear and a touch of lime bitterness to arise slowly.

title: Pegasus Estate 2016 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Mellow aromas of pear, rainy sidewalk and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling. There is bountiful acidity on the sip, with cut grass and apple skin flavors.

title: AuburnJames 2009 Bella Vista Vineyard Block 2 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Hugely oaky, this wine also features a dustiness on the nose and palate, alongside woody tannin. Black olive and dried herb give it an herbaceous quality that belies its full-bodied richness and ripe core.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2015 Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This wine is full bodied, very ripe tasting and has a soft expansive mouthfeel. Touches of earth and barnyard join stewed plum flavors for a rustic but enjoyable taste profile.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Kristy Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Light although sweet red-cherry-syrup aromas meet with iron and crushed sage on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The sip is simple yet tangy with tart red fruit, proving very easy to enjoy.

title: La Honda Winery 2013 Lonehawk Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Rich blackberry and candied black-cherry aromas meet with strong cedar, roast beef, smoke, olive, soy and a tarry quality on the nose of this bottling. It's very dry and sticky with tannins on the sip, which relegate the flavors of red cherry and roasting herbs to the background. The 100% American oak treatment remains prominent, so this may evolve more favorably with time.

title: Markham 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Florally perfumed in orange blossom, this plush, medium-bodied white is awash in pineapple and a strong taste of cinnamon stick, its oak pronounced and supportive.

title: Titus 2013 Andronicus Red (Napa Valley)
description: Largely tannic and generous in oak, this is a blend of Merlot, Cabernet Franc, Petit Verdot, Malbec, Cabernet Sauvignon and Zinfandel. Plum, currant, bread dough and leather are among the more powerful components, with a rich rounded mouthfeel providing approachability.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 ZC Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 50% Syrah, 30% Petite Sirah and 20% Cabernet Sauvignon offers a very rich nose of licorice, black currant leather, tobacco and potpourri. The palate is a tad sour and dried out, with black plum skins, purple flowers and peppery spice.

title: Clos LaChance 2014 Whitestone Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Focused aromas of black currant and blackberry are edged by thyme, bay leaf, black pepper and Indian spice on the nose of this wine, which comes from vines planted on a limestone hillside. Chalky tannins frame the intense flavors of the sip, including black fruit, dark violets, loamy earth and a gravelly minerality. Hints of vanilla and caramel soften it all.

title: Experience 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is soft, smooth and brightly focused in acidity. The palate offers a sanguine notion, with cassis and meat tones that are highlighted by cinnamon. A persistent freshness prevails on the finish.

title: Furthermore 2014 Gioia Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Inviting in warm aromas and flavors of baked cherry cobbler, this medium-bodied wine offers firm focused acidity built around well-developed highlights of cardamom, cinnamon, orange peel and cola. It's lengthy and complex.

title: Las Positas 2013 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)
description: Bursting with ripe, almost jammy fruit flavors, this exuberant wine from an often-outstanding estate is rich and mouthfilling, full bodied but not too tannic to easily enjoy. Flavors run the gamut from blackberry to Bing cherry to blueberry and espresso.

title: Foley 2015 Rancho Santa Rosa Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Cranberry, hibiscus and rosewater converge on the soft, plush nose of this bottling, which also shows hints of star anise and baked goods. It's a light and playful wine on the sip, where juicy raspberries meet with gravelly minerality. This is light, fresh and full of long, simmering acidity.

title: Ken Brown 2014 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Baked red currants and cherries are lifted by vanilla, dewy sagebrush and hint of peppercorns on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is bright and energized with tart red fruits, but it's approachably rich and spiced with jasmine and Earl Grey tea flavors.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Gritty in oak, this coastal appellation wine is bright and herbal, offering crisp, vibrant overtones of cranberry, pomegranate, strawberry and rose. A streak of fresh mint and lavender adds floral elements that contribute to its lovely profile of delicate elegance, supported by mellowed oak.

title: Mt. Brave 2014 Cabernet Franc (Mount Veeder)
description: Blended with 14% Cabernet Sauvignon, then aged 18 months in 64% new French oak, this is a lovely example of the variety: velvety, with smoky undertones of oak. Milk chocolate, raspberry and wild truffle combine well on the medium-bodied palate, the finish bright and focused in acidity.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Rich in green apple and fig, this wine offers medium-bodied weight and breadth and grainy acidity. From the famous site planted to densely concentrated berries, it's fleshy and textured, with plenty of complexity from spice and oak.

title: Peltier 2015 Estate Grown Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A big wine that's unabashedly oaky, this one sports a delicious, spicy, toasty, and lightly smoky character from the first whiff through the densely packed flavors and then continues to linger on the finish. The texture is dense, soothingly tannic, and coats the tongue and sides of the mouth with spiciness as well as ripe berry and new leather accents.

title: Pence 2016 PTG Gamay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pence is one of the few producers growing and making Gamay in California, and they're setting quite a standard. Aromas of red cherry, cola, hibiscus, pomegranate, fennel and cracked pepper lead into a lightly bodied palate full of airy berry fruit, juniper and licorice spice. Quite refreshing and just complex enough.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 Primal Scream Syrah-Grenache (Adelaida District)
description: Very elegant aromas of black plum, black cherry and black currant meet with bay leaf and mint on the deep nose of this blend of 61% Syrah and 39% Grenache. It's soft on the palate, with a cohesive flavor profile that pairs deep berry flavors with pepper and dried herbs. The Syrah is well tamed, proving mellow and soft overall.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2016 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Pale pink in color, this is a pitch-perfect rosé, with aromas of watermelon, pink grapefruit, rose petal and lemon rind. There is great zip to the palate and a chalky texture, carrying fresh but tight red-fruit flavors. It will please New World and Old World fans alike.

title: Benovia 2014 Grenache (Sonoma)
description: Quietly floral, this wine has small percentages of Syrah and Alicante Bouschet. Red licorice and a thread of white pepper play along a thick big-boned entry that softens into a silky wonder as it develops. It highlights the savory aspects of this beloved Rhône variety.

title: Bonny Doon 2013 Le Cigare Volant Reserve Red (Central Coast)
description: This blend of 55% Grenache, 25% Syrah, 16% Mourvèdre and 4% Cinsaut starts of with a reserved nose that slowly offers aromas of roasted cranberries, tangy black plum, dried lilacs and crushed asphalt. The palate shows a dried fruit elegance, with blackberry leather, loamy soils, minty herbs and roasted meats.

title: Adelaida 2016 HMR Estate Vineyard Chardonnay (Adelaida District)
description: From a historic vineyard, this Chardonnay is quite Burgundian in style, showing much potential for this grape in Paso Robles. Reserved aromas of lemon rind, vanilla shavings and cashew are quite fresh, while the palate drives the middle road, with tight grapefruit rind and mandarin pith flavors on one side and plumeria and guava on the other. Chalky texture throughout.

title: Lafond 2015 SRH Riesling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very fresh and crisp on the sip, this bottling shows lively lime flavors, steely minerality, citrus blossoms and pomelo pith, and is reminiscent of a crisp summer morning. It's tightly wound on the palate, where vibrant lime and orange-peel flavors hang from a chalky texture, with Asian pear, Meyer lemon, tangerine and petrol toward the finish.

title: Flanagan 2014 Syrah (Bennett Valley)
description: This wine is on the edge, complex in white pepper and cool-climate characteristics of dried herb and leather. Brawny and full-bodied, it's also bright in underlying acidity, with plenty of elusive power.

title: Hall 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Among the winery's larger offerings, this wine doesn't hold back on quality, offering tight-grained tannin expression around rounded flavors of plum compote, blackberry bramble, cedar and clove. Bright, focused acidity tempers the ripeness and underlying richness, making for a welcome drinking experience.

title: Hall 2014 Craig's Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 65% Cabernet Sauvignon with 35% Merlot, the two playing well against each other to provide a broad soft expanse of decadent flavor. Cherry, plum, vanilla and well-integrated oak make it round and opulent, with a fleshiness that persists through a lengthy finish.

title: Bellante 2016 La Encantada Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated rosewater, crushed carnations, juniper, pine needle and pomegranate-cherry candies show on the complex nose of this bottling. It's quite exuberant on the palate as well, with sour cherry and rhubarb flavors as well as a turned earth component.

title: Della 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: An appellation wine with plenty to offer, this is velvety smooth in texture and brimming in smoky cherry, with a juicy midpalate and enviable length and breadth.

title: Derby 2013 The Maneater Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black-cherry, vanilla and root beer aromas make for a rich, deep and compelling nose on this blend of 64% Zinfandel and 36% Petite Sirah. Leathery tannins and loads of acid frame the sip, where flavors of dark cherry and mulberry meet with thyme and lilacs.

title: Grassini 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Grassy aromas of cut lawn and green apple meet with wet sidewalk and dried lime rinds on the crisp, almost austere, nose of this bottling. There is extreme zip to the sip, with more grass and lime-rind flavors, proving quite bright.

title: Lumen 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: This bottling is loaded on the nose with dried hibiscus, pomegranate, rose petals, leather and slate aromas. Cinnamon, sumac and rose flavors are strong on the light, bright and tight palate, giving depth to the raspberry and white-pepper backdrop.

title: Morgan 2016 Cotes du Crow's Red (Monterey)
description: This blend of 52% Syrah, 44% Grenache and 4% Tempranillo is always one of the best price point bets in the region. Savory aromas of pomegranate, boysenberry, tar, charred meat and dried thyme lead into a palate layered in purple flowers, marjoram and dark-berry fruit.

title: Refugio Ranch 2015 Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Smoked blackberries, hickory wood, roasted meats and a touch of tar show on the nose of this bottling from the estate vineyard on the south side of the Santa Ynez River. The charred beef and smoked fruit kick carries to the palate, where tannins provide tension yet the mouthfeel remains soft and inviting. A great wine for barbecued ribs.

title: Robert Renzoni 2014 Sonata Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Tightly wound aromas of black plum and crushed slate emerge with patience on the nose of this bottling, a 50-50 blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and the Brunello clone of Sangiovese. Leather, loamy soil, oregano and marjoram flavors show on the palate, with is dense and thick but soft and well structured.

title: Tongue Dancer 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Spicy cola, blueberry and boysenberry make for a brooding, complex and lengthy experience on the palate, components that add up to more than a sum of the parts. Velvety tannins and integrated oak add textural complexity and structure.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Paradiso Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends large amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot with smaller additions of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Black pepper and clove dominate and accent the wine's juicy acidity within a sizable framework of black cherry, blackberry and oak.

title: Zaca Mesa 2014 Mesa Reserve Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Strong, gamy aromas of charred lamb and animal hide give intriguing depth to the black plum base of this bottling. Roasted berry, more roasted lamb and rosemary play on the palate, which is firm in tannic structure.

title: Lewis Grace 2014 Renner Vineyard Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: Very concentrated and ripe, this wine is densely packed with blackberry jam and blueberry compote flavors accented by hints of vanilla and black pepper. The wine is bold, full bodied and mouth-filling.

title: Mansfield-Dunne 2016 Cortada Alta Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Loaded with baking spice, gingerbread, black raspberry and wet slate on the nose, this single-vineyard bottling is a spicy treat. Dried sage, oregano and marjoram show on the palate, where the background is filled in with pomegranate and rhubarb flavors.

title: Midnight 2015 Nocturne Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Nuanced aromas of turned earth, dried sage and rainbow peppercorns play against the ripe black-plum backdrop on this bottling. The palate offers a straightforward and enjoyable take on Syrah, showing more black plum as well as milk chocolate, charred beef and peppery spice, and held together by chalky tannins and biting acidity.

title: Pali 2016 Summit Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Always one of the more solid Pinot Noirs for the price, this appellation blend is quite dark in the glass and pops with aromas of fresh boysenberry and cola spice. Candied-berry flavors met with Dr. Pepper, licorice and tarragon on the palate, which culminates in an acid-washed finish.

title: Pazzo 2016 Pazzo Red (Napa County)
description: This blends a majority of Sangiovese with Syrah, Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah and Merlot. Bright and juicy, it offers good structure and midweight ripeness, tasting of cherry, leather and menthol.

title: Peachy Canyon 2017 Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of strawberry compote, lime peel, red apple and watermelon juice lead into a tart palate of similar flavors that are warmed up with a touch of vanilla. It is rounded but zippy at once.

title: Stephen Ross 2015 Bee Sweet Vineyard Grenache (Edna Valley)
description: Lively aromas of sumac, cinnamon, hibiscus, plum, lavender and turned earth make for a very compelling, layered and sexy entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate shows more restraint, with rosewater, tangy red-plum skins and tart pomegranate flavors, wrapped in taut tannins.

title: Tolosa 2016 Saltonstall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Savory forest floor and earth mingle beneath spiky acidity before giving way to a velvety smooth palate in this wild wine. Brooding berry and pomegranate are met by good, tight acidity, an underlying freshness that's needed to complement the wine's powerful intensity and ripeness.

title: Vinum Cellars 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Thick grippy tannins surround a core of mountain sage and dried herb in this 100% varietal wine. Tart underlying acidity brightens a triumvirate of cherry, cassis and red currant, with the promise of rocky minerality lingering on the finish.

title: Scar of the Sea 2016 Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Methode Ancestral a|muse Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Cloudy in the glass and strong in the excited bubbles game, this pet nat shows lots of apple-driven aromas, from Pink Lady to Pippin, as well as white rose petals, Anjou pear and only the slightest hint of yeasty funk. It's also very clean, crisp an tight on the palate, with Bosc pear, grapefruit pith and citrus skin tang on the finish.
designation: Block 11 Bien Nacido Vineyard Methode Ancestral a|muse

title: Sleeping Giant 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A new wine from the producer, this impresses in its juicy acid-driven approach and beautifully balanced fruit—a mix of cassis and currant. Tart in mineral and dried herb sensations, nuanced aspects of cedar and graphite are persistent on the palate.

title: Thacher 2013 Hastings Ranch Vineyard Blanc de Blanc Viognier (Adelaida District)
description: Rarely does a sparkling Viognier hit the market, and it's doubtful that any could be as good as this bottling by brewer-turned-winemaker Sherman Thacher. Extremely effervescent bubbles shoot out aromas of Asian pear, lemon zest, gardenia and the slighest hint of guava tropicality. The bubbles are soft on the sip, carrying honeydew and sharp lime flavors.
designation: Hastings Ranch Vineyard Blanc de Blanc

title: Verada 2015 Tri-County Pinot Noir (Monterey County-Sonoma County-Santa Barbara County)
description: There is no denying the concentration and allure of this densely packed and medium-bodied wine. Floral and spice aromas lead to layers of cherry and rhubarb wrapped in a supple, velvety texture that coaxes the flavors across the palate and onto a long finish.

title: Archium 2015 Haven Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a strong streak of elegant herbs, from bay leaf to mint to thyme, set against a plummy background, along with turned earth and rose petals, on the nose of this bottling. Rose hips, marjoram and tangy pomegranate flavors show on the lively sip, which also benefits from grippy tannins.

title: Daou 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: There's no doubt that the Daou brothers aim for a richer style on their Chardonnay than most Central Coast growers, but each vintage is an evolution that brings more nuance to the bottling. This starts with lemon syrup, butterscotch and plumeria on the nose, while the palate starts and finished with penetrating mandarin-rind-powered acidity that cuts through flavors of vanilla, crème brûlée, cashew and roasted marshmallow.

title: Friedeman 2015 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Super exotic in funky, stemmy qualities of earthiness, this is a light-bodied lightly ripe red, spicy and fresh in balanced flavors of forest floor, pomegranate and black tea.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Stewy, meaty and juicy, this wine is fleshy and expansive on the palate, with deft touches of smoke, black cherry and berry pie. Seasoned throughout is a classical layering of black pepper and cinnamon that keeps it fresh and spicy.

title: Ancient Peaks 2014 Oyster Ridge Red (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Fresh yet deep and penetrating aromas of blackberry syrup, black-currant jam, vanilla, milk chocolate and crème brûlée are well woven and not overblown on this blend of 51% Cabernet Sauvignon, 36% Merlot, 5% Syrah, 5% Petite Sirah and 3% Malbec. The palate starts with smoothed-out tannins that dry up a bit by the midpalate, and a strong acidity carries flavors of boisterous purple fruit and baking spice. Still quite young and energetic.

title: Cinnabar 2014 Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: In this wine, a full body and a little extra fruit ripeness push the sometimes austere varietal into a more generous, expressive mode, where black pepper meets black cherry and the firm tannins feel rounded at the edges. It's a handsome, well-balanced wine that will drink best after 2020.

title: Davis Bynum 2015 River West Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From an estate site alongside Westside Road, this impressive white shines in full-bodied nutty oak and a slight element of reduction that adds rather than detracts. Exotic in salty tangerine, peach and stone, it lingers in lasting oak spice.

title: Gamble Family Vineyards 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Yountville)
description: Fermented three-quarters in oak and the rest in stainless steel, this wine is fleshy, tart and delicious. Acid-driven and picked to retain an innate lightness, it shines in grapefruit and lemongrass flavors, steeled by a grainy, complex texture.

title: Le Casque 2015 Espion Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Extravagant in all directions, this monster of a wine from a high-performing winery combines massive, ripe fruit flavors with lavish oak accents and has a monumental framework of full body and firm velvety tannins. It's hard to imagine a deeper color, and the aromas bring out tobacco, black pepper and wood smoke while blackberry and blueberry flavors fill in the middle beautifully. Blended from two-thirds Syrah and one-third Petite Sirah. Best after 2023.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Georganne Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the warmest and northernmost vineyard site the producer employs, this is a lush, concentrated and undeniably full-bodied wine, juicy and dense in dark cherry and cola. The texture is soft and velvety, with length and breadth, the tannins polished and well integrated.

title: Patland 2014 D'oro Stagecoach Vineyard Red Dessert Wine Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This dessert wine is made entirely from Petite Sirah grown on the mountainous vineyard site atop Atlas Peak. It tastes and smells of salty leather as big bold flavors of cinnamon cola and black pepper weigh in. The palate is thick, dense and richly layered.
designation: D'oro Stagecoach Vineyard Red Dessert Wine

title: Sojourn 2016 Reuling Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fleshy and gently oaked, this vineyard-designate is a a standout for its mix of well-defined flavors of lemon, green apple and stone. Its substantial upfront richness and ripeness settles in the glass to offer balance and succulent memorability.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Esprit de Tablas Red (Adelaida District)
description: Elegance is prominent on this flagship blend of 49% Mourvèdre, 25% Grenache, 21% Syrah and 5% Counoise, starting with dried red flowers, dark red berries, char, wood spice and pepper dust on the nose. Red plums rise on the palate, lifted by fresh herbs, proving light on its feet yet redolent with compelling flavors and tons of body.

title: Tercero 2013 Larner Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Freshly smashed pomegranate and red cherry meet with white pepper, light bay leaf, anise and tarragon on the nose. The riper palate blends those herbal touches together with black raspberry and boysenberry, adding hints of lavender and pepper as well. Squeaky tannins and strong acidity lead into the finish.

title: The Hilt 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Lime pith, butterscotch, chilled pineapple and lemon meringue aromas show on the nose of this winery's entry-level bottling. The palate is nicely chiseled, with a tight frame and wound up freshness revealing grapefruit zest, Pink Lady apple and a touch of flint and gunmetal flavorings.

title: Three Sticks 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Medium in build and impact, this is a round, richly stylized white, satisfying in nutmeg, butterscotch and toasted oak. It rewards in textured, velvety smoothness on the lengthy muscular palate.

title: Skinner 2017 Seven Generations White (El Dorado)
description: Plush but not fat, this subtle and complex wine combines peach and vanilla flavors with fig, crushed rock and bright acidity. The creamy mouthfeel stays well balanced as lemon and crisp apple notes come forward on the midpalate and linger through the finish.

title: Steele 2015 Pacini Vineyard Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Engaging and nicely oaky but also well structured, this full-bodied wine has dense layers of ripe fruity spicy flavors and almost chewy tannins. It is concentrated, deep and with a lengthy finish. Best after 2022.

title: Neely 2015 Upper Picnic Spring Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Fresh raspberry and pomegranate mix with hibiscus, sumac and French toast aromas on this bottling from a vineyard just south of San Francisco. It's very fresh and snappy on the precise palate, with bright raspberry and cranberry flavors leading into dried ginger and all spice.

title: Ancien 2015 Jouissance Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tightly wound, youthful and still developing, medium-bodied wine, with plenty of beauty to show for it even as it evolves. Dense black cherry, plum and cardamom flavors are complemented by floral aromatics of rose, violet and lavender.

title: Bella 2015 Florence Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Pure, expressive fruit flavors and a supremely polished texture make this full-bodied wine a delight to drink. It practically oozes raspberry and blackberry aromas, and floods the palate with flavors of berries and peppery spice.

title: Blind Justice 2015 Beckstoffer To Kalon Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smoky cherry and tar open the way to well-defined flavors of cola spice and vanilla in this 100% varietal wine from the famous Oakville site. Integrated, it is succulent and fruit-forward with sultry, sensuous texture and heavy toasted oak.

title: Duckhorn 2015 Merlot (Carneros)
description: A 100% varietal expression of this fine grape, in this case from a relatively cool climate, this sings in brambly black-cherry, mocha and graham cracker richness, its texture soft and supple on the midpalate. Tremendous aromatics give it a memorable lift and length, elegant to the end.

title: Foxen 2016 Block 43 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This coveted block designation from a historic property combines rich aromas of black cherry and dark berry with gamy hints of roasted pork and composting violets. It's bright and tart at first on the palate before wood spice, roasted cherry and cherry pit show in the midpalate. It's still a young wine.

title: Grace + Vine 2015 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Very dark in the glass, this bottling from a new project based in Santa Barbara County offers aromas of elderberry, blue flowers, dark cocoa and earth, proving both rocky and fruity on the nose. Acid rises quickly on the palate to deliver flavors of blueberry, black rocks and a hint of leather.

title: Graziano 2014 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: This is a snappy, well-balanced and also concentrated wine that's compelling to drink. Engaging complexity in the aromas leads to equally intriguing and spicy flavors that are well supported by good acidity and firm tannins.

title: Kokomo 2016 Rockpile Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brambly blackberry flavors are seasoned with pungent aromas of cinnamon and nutmeg in this thick, rich and intensely ripe wine. Its power and concentration provide a lushness and roundly fruity approachability that doesn't hinder its lingering, textured complexity.

title: LaRue 2015 Rice-Spivak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Strawberry flavors coat the palate delicately in this tangy, softly textured wine that shows restraint in ripeness and style. The site's volcanic ash soils contribute a mineral element that's part turned earth, part crushed rock.

title: Lava Cap 2016 Estate Bottled Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Plummy and generous on the nose, and equally rich and expansive on the palate, this wine is smoothly textured and full bodied. Light tannins add a little grip to the plush sensations of black plums, strawberries and a dash of dried herbs.

title: Naggiar 2015 Le Grand-Pere Estate Reserve G-S-M (Sierra Foothills)
description: Cherry and cranberry aromas precede richer riper black-plum and black-currant flavors in this full-bodied plush-textured Rhône-style blend. The combination of bright red fruits, warming black fruits and hints of mild oak baking spices give the wine complexity and interest.

title: Oakville East 2015 Rough Road Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County)
description: A sizable helping of 16% Cabernet Franc adds complexity to this wine, a thick, dense portrait of black fruit, sage and cedar. Textured and taut, it has plenty of mountain-grown ripeness on offer, finishing in dried herb, crushed rock and turned earth.

title: Quivira 2016 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a juicy, leathery and layered wine with hearty characteristics of grilled meat, blackberry and black cherry. Bold and full bodied, it retains supportive acidity and is integrated in tannin and oak, showing lasting notes of nutmeg and clove.

title: Replica 2016 Goldenrod Flower Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine offers aromas of fresh cherry and berry. Smooth and gentle on the palate, the berry flavors become even more ripe on the palate and ease through the lingering fruit-and-spice finish.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Roberts Road Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy blueberry and clove tones give way to a juicy core of soft, integrated fruit. This is ultimately a full-bodied, ripe and robust wine that lingers on a baking spice note.

title: Tower 15 2016 The Jetty Red (Central Coast)
description: Plum, dried strawberry, rocky earth, nutmeg and fennel make for a brilliantly complex nose in this blend of 50% Grenache, 26% Syrah, 10% Cinsault, 9% Carignan and 5% Counoise. The palate shows a plump plum flavor and a healthy dose of baking spice, with the tannins and acidity in expert balance.

title: Workman Ayer 2015 De Facto Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Gamy aromas of peppercorn-crusted beef smoked over an oak wood fire meet with black plum and boysenberry on the savory nose of this 80% Syrah and 20% Grenache blend. Smoky bacon flavors lead into elegant red-plum and hibiscus flavors on the medium-weight palate.

title: B Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: A hearty, generously full-bodied and concentrated wine, this has an intensity of oak that works against the ripe fruit. Gravenstein apple speaks loudest, accented in wild fennel, salty air and nutmeg.

title: Black Kite 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Broad aromas of melon, warm nectarine, light lime and melted butter make for a creamy nose on this single-vineyard expression. There is a compelling tightness to the sip, where the acidic zing cuts through richer flavors of campfire-roasted lemon and prominent oak smoke.

title: Bouchaine 2015 Estate Swan Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is an earthy wine interwoven in blueberry and tangy cranberry and pomegranate fruitiness. Light in texture and approach, it's as earthy as it is fruity, with subtle offerings of rose petal, cedar and sage. A citrus-like squeeze of acidity hits on the finish, a welcome goodbye.

title: Cambria 2015 Fog Tide Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Extremely pleasant aromas of caramel-laced honeydew cream and light cashew show on the nose of this bottling that's focused on a specific block of this historic vineyard. The palate zings with freshness and acidity right out of the gates, and then allows fatter notes of melted butter, orange peels, mandarin slices and clotted cream to consume the midpalate.

title: Croma Vera 2016 Albariño (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Pear and grapefruit aromas are prominent on the clean and easy nose of this bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard, as is a sweet floral touch of Stargazer lily. The flavors are crisp and strong with more white flowers, and the grippy chalky texture and solid acidity make for a lovely wine altogether.

title: Furthermore 2014 Graton Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Tightly wound in its youth, this is a spicy integrated wine that offers black tea and baked strawberry-rhubarb flavors alongside bold aromas of rose petal and forest floor. Moderate structure supports the moderate ripeness and expansiveness on the palate.

title: Jaffurs 2015 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Boysenberry compote, wet asphalt, black peppercorns and dried thyme make for a classic and compelling nose on this countywide blend. Rustic sagebrush and wild thyme flavors show on the sip, set against dark red plums and a gravelly minerality.

title: Kaena 2015 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Plump, dark strawberry, lavish kirsch, along with cola, cinnamon and allspice show on the nose of this rich bottling from a vineyard on the small appellation's northern end. Vanilla, caramel and cherry-jubilee flavors show on the ripe sip, where a solid tannic tension arises on the finish.

title: Kaena 2016 Rosé of Grenache (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A deeper shade of pink, this bottling shows raspberry, rose petal, crushed gravel and wet slate on the impressively mineral nose. There is a complex texture to the palate, which is loaded with crushed rock and chalk, and also shows candied raspberry and cherry flavors.

title: Kaena 2016 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: A slight hint of hay yellow in the glass, this bottling shows a clean line of cantaloupe, plumeria, daffodil and vanilla-spiced pear sauce on the nose. The palate is grippy with lemon skin tension, offering richer yellow-peach-cream flavors against that pithy texture. Great combo of ripeness with restraint.

title: Bennett Lane 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Given nearly two years in 30% new French oak, this aged wine is thickly wrapped in blackberry bramble and solidly built tannins, with a baked quality to the fruit. Robust oak leans into full-bodied concentrated flavors of tobacco, clove and mocha.

title: Casa Dumetz 2015 Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Sonja Magdevski is exploring what Grenache can do across Santa Barbara County, and this appellation blend is a bit more simple that her single-vineyard expressions, but gives a great sense of what she is up to. Purple hibiscus, light mulberry, rooibos tea and exotic cherries show on the fresh nose, while the palate is delicate with hints of plum, black raspberry, star anise and vanilla dust.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Twilight Idol Thompson Vineyard Grenache (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite light, cloudy and blood-orange colored in the glass, this oxidative bottling from Thompson Vineyard, which spent 140 days on skins, is unlike any Grenache on the market. Aromas of plum, fig, pepper, strawberry wine and balsamic vinegar lead into a palate of sour red plum and white pepper. Fascinating for wine geeks, though perhaps too weird for most.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There is plenty of toasty oak on the nose of this reserve bottling, but it's judiciously applied and cut by lemon balm, Asian pear, hot croissant and pecan oil aromas. The sip also shows a savory oak-smoke character, but the midpalate is all about lemon cream and butter-basted apple pie, with a touches of vanilla, cinnamon and cashew riding into the finish.

title: Seagrape 2015 Jump Up Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light in color, this bottling shows suave pomegranate and piquant cranberry on the nose alongside subtle potpourri, bay leaf and juniper. The palate packs in wild forest flavors of sage, thyme and more bay leaf, with a slight hint of green olive giving complexity to the tart red fruit.

title: Shane Wines 2014 The Charm Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A wonderful combination of spices, fruits and good structure make this an outstanding wine. It has a spicy, lightly smoky aroma that also includes black cherries, leading to deep cherry and berry flavors accented by cinnamon and clove. The texture is silky, supported by mild fine-grained tannins.

title: Sodaro 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: Reduced, this wine is supple and succulent in raspberry, plum and cherry-like cassis. Firm, integrated tannins give it structure to spare and a place to hang its ripeness.

title: Tower 15 2015 The Swell Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Lush aromas of coffee cake, cappuccino and caramel meet with both bright red fruit and a hint of kirsch on this twist-top ready-to-drink blend of 43% Cabernet Franc, 28% Petit Verdot, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Merlot. Juicy black plums and cherries show on the palate, which is relatively light on its feet with a firm enough structure, finishing on more cocoa, mocha and latte flavors.

title: Franciscan 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is an impressively made wine, offering a tart red currant around savory notes of fresh tobacco, clove, cedar and graphite. Robustly built up front, it shows balance through the midpalate and a firm control of its ripeness, dotted in baking spice and pepper.

title: Halcón 2015 Openlander Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino)
description: This stand-out wine is not showy, and has nice fresh fruit flavors shaded by baking spices, a good, lightly gripping texture due to moderate tannins and supportive acidity, and a lingering finish. It's well balanced and not at all tiring to keep sipping.

title: Tantara 2016 Dierberg Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Smoked almonds, wood spice, peach and Meyer lemon preserves show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from vines planted in 1997. It's very tightly wound on the palate, with plenty of peach, mango and salted lemon flavors riding balanced acidity.

title: Bernardus 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Black cherry, black plum and violet aromas make for a deep, intense yet elegantly balanced nose on this bottling from the legendary vineyard. Candied cherry and boysenberry flavors show on the sip alongside black and purple sage, all wrapped in compelling tannic tension.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Monte Rosso Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: From a site that sits at 1,600-feet in elevation, this wine is rich, round and ripe, as well as slightly reduced, and tightly wound in its youth. Leather, graphite and diesel wrap around a peppery, exotic core of dark chocolate and brambly blackberry that's ever changing in the glass. Enjoy best 2026–2030.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Home Ranch Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: A longtime farming family debuts the first wines of its own with this impressively lush, plush white, tropical in flavor and seasoned in vanilla oak. Expansive on the palate, it manages to uphold tight, firm acidity throughout.

title: Siduri 2016 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: From a steep vineyard near the eastern edge of the appellation, this effort by Santa Rosa-based Adam Lee offers composting rose petals, bright red cherry and a hint of game on the nose. There's a gamy kick to the palate as well, giving depth to the cherry and dried ginger flavors.

title: Wolff 2016 Petite Sirah (Edna Valley)
description: Cool-climate Petite Sirahs are an utter rarity, yet like cool-climate Syrah, they show an amazingly savory character when bottled. This wine starts with tar, peppercorn, cola-spice and boysenberry aromas that lead into a vibrant palate of pepper, roasted lamb and dark fruit. Energetic and fresh.

title: Bellacosa 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blessed with 3% Petit Verdot, this wine represents the appellation with class and style, showing lush, smooth layers of crowd-pleasing complexity. With underlying elegance and a sense of balance, it offers red and black-cherry flavors alongside richer teases of mocha and tobacco.

title: Bianchi 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Lavish aromas of vanilla and pound cake with a black-currant frosting show with a pinch of pepper on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is a great range of flavor on the palate, from boysenberry juice to potpourri to roasted meat, and it all rides strong acid across the lightly tannic structure.

title: Crocker & Starr 2014 Bridesmaid Red (Napa Valley)
description: Sophisticated, dry and well structured, this Bordeaux-style blend from winemaker Pam Starr is big and flavorful while achieving good balance, too. It has perfumed oak aromas, opulent black-cherry and blackberry flavors, lots of velvety tannins for grip and enough concentration for a lingering finish.

title: Daou 2016 Unbound Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black currant and smashed black plum meet with crushed slate and turned loam on the deep and dark nose of this blend of 81% Petite Sirah, 14% Tannat and 5% Tempranillo. Thick with grippy but smooth tannins, and wrapped in a buoyant acidity, the brawny blend offers the darkest and driest of fruit flavors.

title: Davies 2016 Goorgian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a very flavorful, medium- to full-bodied wine that blends ripe black cherry and clove with hints of vanilla and cinnamon. Supportive fruit acidity and light tannins add structure for an appetizing mouthfeel.

title: Domaine Eden 2015 Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Like its bigger Mount Eden sister, this more affordable, usually more immediately accessible bottling needs time to open up. With patience, aromas of honeysuckle, oak and nuts provide a savory impression. The palate combines grapefruit pith and Meyer lemon rinds with savory salt and nuts.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This reserve white is tangled in tones of brioche and crème brûlée, with a bright shock of lively acidity that supports an underlying cradle of toasted oak. Stone, quince and a spark of lemon meringue add intrigue to the midpalate. Best 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Reserve Single Vineyard

title: Epiphany 2015 Revelation Rodney's Vineyard Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 53% Syrah and 47% Grenache is well integrated on those nose with candied blackberry and lilac aromas. A chalky mouthfeel presents flavors of dark berry, cedar and slate on the palate, which is extremely well structured and should last for years. Drink now–2030.

title: Fera Mena 2015 Terra de Promissio Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stemmy and carbonic in nature, this wine exudes earthy forest, with bright, fresh up-front notes of strawberry, lemon and grapefruit peel. Light and on the precipice of ripeness, it dances that fine line well, offering up plenty of subtle flavor within a world of complexity.

title: Grace + Vine 2015 CounterPoint Lot 1 Red (Paso Robles)
description: It's not entirely clear what this wine is a counterpoint too, although it certainly offsets the bigger richer wines that dominate Paso Robles. Bright aromas of grenadine, spicy hibiscus and cinnamon lead into a palate of juicy red cherry, pomegranate and rosewater. It's bright and refreshing.

title: Melville NV Blanc de Noir Non-Dosé Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A faded shade of pink in the glass, this nonvintage bubbly offers rose petals, lemon, raspberry and chalk aromas. The palate starts with a sour strawberry and watermelon flavors, combining a strong tartness with recognizable and welcome fruit flavors.

title: Prima Materia 2014 Aglianico
description: Winemaker Pietro Buttita loves to tackle unusual grape varieties and he did a great job with this one. The wine is beautifully concentrated and focused, practically bursting at the seams with black-cherry and blackberry flavors that are extremely ripe and potent. It's so intense that the fruit notes cling to the tongue and sides of the mouth, echoing on the finish.

title: Stolpman 2017 Para Maria de los Tecolotes Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this extremely well-priced bottling, named after vineyard manager Ruben Solorzano's wife, is intense yet elegant, with crushed slate, black currant and charred pork aromas. The palate's chalky texture carries flavors of black plum, boysenberry, dark cocoa, fennel and marjoram.

title: Westbrook Wine Farm 2012 Fait Accompli Red (Madera)
description: Here is a great discovery from often overlooked Madera County. There's a lot going on in this dark-colored, very aromatic and full-flavored wine that has matured for quite a while in the bottle already. Earthy, meaty, leathery aromas vie for attention while very potent fruit, dark-spice and beef jus flavors virtually flood the palate and cling to the sides of the mouth.

title: Kessler-Haak 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Fresh and lively aromas of hibiscus, sumac and tea leaves make for a compelling entry to this bottling. Tart cherry and plum-skin flavors lead into richer fruit toward the finish, with touches of Earl Grey tea and loamy soil throughout.

title: MacMurray Estate Vineyards 2016 Winemaker's Block Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Softly alluring and youthfully vibrant in fresh power and tart acidity, this block-designate is spicy and fruit-forward in black cherry, blackberry and a dip of vanilla cola.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Herbal and forested in savory elements like rose petal and black tea, this is a gorgeously rich and round red wine, a true showcase of the appellation and sure to please a crowd. Red and black cherry are met by wild strawberry and lush waves of depth.

title: Navarro 2016 Premiere Reserve Chardonnay (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a beautiful, elegant, lighter-styled wine in a half-bottle that shows great balance between ripeness and fresh acidity. Lemon and crisp apple aromas lead to light vanilla and butter flavors that mingle well with the fruit elements.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Carnal Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 64% Grenache, 22% Mourvèdre and 14% Syrah certainly plays toward the riper end of the spectrum, but its roasted red fruit is deeply layered with star anise, ginger, clove and caramel aromas. It's powerful on the palate, with unctuous flavors of roasted blackberry and plum as well as more baking spice.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Gremlin Vineyard Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: This is a bright and lightly layered wine that offers tones of Asian spice, earth and black tea. The acidity is tart and tenacious, interwoven between gentle jolts of mint, chocolate and dark cherry.

title: Siduri 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of rose petal potpourri, cranberry, raspberry and sandalwood arise on the nose of this single-vineyard study. Creamy and soft with well-integrated acid on the palate, this wine offers flavors of plum and mulberry, making for a smooth sip.

title: Cuvaison 2016 Mariafeld Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Light cranberry and strawberry flavors show impressive depth and breadth in this full-bodied expressive wine. Cola and cinnamon provide spicy seasoning that melds well with the fruit, the entirety textured in layers of velvety softness.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This estate white is full of crushed rock and wet stone elements that blend with tones of apple, oak and salt. Light bodied and restrained, it shows a wealth of structure and aging potential. Enjoy 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Dunning Vineyards 2015 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Dark cherry and boysenberry aromas meet with a hint of anise on the nose of this bottling from Paso Robles' Westside. Flavors of strawberry compote and boysenberry paste are lifted by clove and gingerbread on the rich palate.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Clone 115 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Light aromas of black raspberry, cranberry jam and a hint of oak smoke kick off the nose in this study of a popular clone. The smoky elements mask the fruit at first on the sip, but ripe berries and mulberry slowly arise alongside the charred pork flavors, bolstered by a long-simmering acidity.

title: Foxen 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Lighter in the glass, this appellation blend shows pomegranate sorbet, cranberry skins, rose petals and wild herbs on the nose. The palate is crisp and tart with raspberry fruit that's lifted by chaparral spice and wild thyme.

title: Grace + Vine 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Candied aromas of ripe cherry meet with dark wild herbs and a hint of cedar on the nose of this bottling from a secret dream team of regional vintners. The wood element shows on the sip, where flavors of red plum and mulberry are lifted with fennel frond and herbal spices.

title: Grgich Hills 2016 Fumé Blanc Estate Grown Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A grip of reduction on the nose in tones of flint and matchstick is consistent for the producer's style. On the palate are light-bodied layers of green olive, pineapple, peach and lemon, a contrasting set of fruit and savory elements that work seamlessly together.

title: J Vineyards & Winery 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy, seductive and soft, this well-made wine offers tones of forest floor, pomegranate and strawberry. It delivers plenty of flavor beneath a delicately crafted body.

title: LaRue 2014 Rice-Spivak Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Succulent and bright, this interweaves crunchy red fruit into a cohesive whole of balanced freshness and high-acid tenacity, the tannins supportive in providing weight and grip.

title: Mount Eden Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This Santa Cruz Mountains-based winery has been making a value-driven Edna Valley Chardonnay since 1985, and this one does not disappoint, Pungent aromas of lemon oil and orange pith are rounded by seared white peach, crushed sand and smoke on the nose, while the zesty palate delivers more stone fruit, bright lemon, toasty oak and solid tannic tension.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2017 Lone Oak Vineyard Partners' Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Shy at first on the nose, this wine begins to show pithy aromas of tangerine alongside gardenia and a touch of sour cream. The palate is texturally driven with grippy tension that leads into more orange-pith and pink-grapefruit flavors, finishing on an ashy Brie-rind quality.

title: Black Stallion 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-integrated white wine, made in an unabashedly full-bodied manner that displays ample fruit. Fig, vanilla and a thread of lemon zest give it plenty of flavor and crowd-pleasing personality.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Chêne d'Argent Estate Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This white is rich and creamy, with a slight note of reduction. Decadent in caramel toffee and crème brûlée, it is well made and succulent, allowing the fruit to shine over the well-integrated oak.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Silky and rich, with a dry palate that's lengthy and robust in mousse, this is a lovely expression of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay bubbly, delightfully tasting of strawberry and peach.

title: Hall 2015 Craig's Red (Napa Valley)
description: A hearty red blend that's powerfully built and full bodied, this offers big ripe flavors of bacon fat, toasted oak and blueberry jam. Intensely rich and concentrated, it will wholly satisfy fans of the style.

title: Lang & Reed 2017 Chenin Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy and oaky, this white is floral and lengthy, with a moderate body of ripeness and weight. Peach, apple and lime play on the midpalate before finishing in a burst of white flowers.

title: Lynmar 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Pungent in earthy compost and a touch of matchstick, this wine offers strong, sturdy flavors and body, with a silkiness on the midpalate. Intense flavors of baked apple and pineapple are softened and balanced by a lasting embrace of acidity.

title: Migration 2016 Running Creek Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Intensely ripe and full bodied on entry, this wine settles into a more balanced sensibility of caramel apple, salty oak and robust flavors of candied apple and pear.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
description: This combines all five red Bordeaux varieties, with Cabernet Sauvignon dominant at 48% and Cabernet Franc close behind at 24%. Juicy, approachable and round, it has strong present tannins and an intensity of oak, tobacco and cedar.

title: Quivira 2015 Black Boar Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
