description: Blended with 7% Petite Sirah, this tightly tannic wine allows room for a juicy core of fleshy dark-cherry flavor around moderate oak and a mix of dried herb and black pepper. Complex and structured, it shows plenty of potential to age. Enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2017 Flood Family Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: Broad aromas of pear, Pink Lady and Granny Smith apples show on the fresh nose of this wine. The flavors are fresh and vibrant, offering hints of crisp Anjou pear and wild lime.

title: Riley's Rows 2016 Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: Salty green apple and taffy give this robustly rounded, textured and layered wine a focus and bright streak that's met by earthy mineral qualities of wet stone and sea spray.

title: Roblar 2017 Estate Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rounded honeysuckle, honey butter and seared white-peach aromas make for a fairly rich entry to this estate bottling. Yellow-peach and creamy mango flavors show on the sip, but the ripe fruit evolves into a savory sea salt and saffron side, finishing with a hint of pound cake.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Stanly Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: With a light entry of spicy earth and pomegranate, this full-bodied wine evolves to share warm baking spices, brown sugar and baked cherry flavors—a robust and memorably rich experience on the palate.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Toyon Farm Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is tart in cranberry and strawberry, with a depth of blue fruit seamlessly blending in. Velvety smooth, it tastes voluptuous in style, with a lasting imprint of cola and oak.

title: Skinner 2015 Dry Diggings Red (El Dorado)
description: Exuberant jammy aromas and equally fruity flavors drive this full-bodied and plush-textured wine. It has truly concentrated blackberry and blueberry aromas plus expansive and deep flavors that coat the tongue and linger on the finish. There's not a lot of tannin to interrupt the fun.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2017 Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Fresh-pressed plum, light raspberry and rose-petal aromas show on the nose of this bottling from deep in the appellation. There is solid tension to the palate, where plush plum and nectarine flavors play against a steely backdrop.

title: Stewart Cellars 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Salty stone and lemon zest offer a blend of deep prolonged flavor in this well-made white that is bittersweet in oak and managed tannin. There's an intensity to the finish of baked apple, pear and fig.

title: Terre Rouge 2015 Viognier (Fiddletown)
description: Fat in mouthfeel, waxy and earthy in aroma and rich, apricot-like and nutty in flavor, this wine emphasizes savory notes rather than fruity ones and richness in texture rather than crispness. Dried meats like prosciutto and salami could be great pairings.

title: Waits-Mast 2015 Nash Mill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This is a mellow, soft and gentle wine that offers ripe strawberry and cherry flavors, subtle brown sugar and vanilla accents and a smooth, mouth-filling texture. It seems to lack some of the stuffing of recent vintages but still gives lots of pleasure.

title: Anaba 2015 Las Brisas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From a breezy site within the Mahoney estate, this delicately compressed red is fresh and focused in acidity, with a thick midpalate of cranberry, orange and rhubarb. The oak is well-integrated and in support of the fruit without distraction, finishing fleshy.

title: Asuncion Ridge 2015 Barrel Select Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo)
description: This is a very delicate Pinot Noir from a vineyard 2,000 feet in elevation, which is a good sign for the potential of elegance for this grape when grown near Paso Robles. Boysenberry, leather, purple flowers and Earl Grey tea notes show on the while the palate is tangy with red-plum notes and soft in texture, lifted by potpourri-like flavors.

title: Bella Luna 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Barbera (Adelaida District)
description: Fresh and tight aromas of boysenberry fruit and star anise show on the nose of this easy-to-enjoy bottling. It's very lively with juicy dark fruits and light baking spice on the palate, making a great pairing for pizza, pasta and burgers.

title: Terre Rouge 2016 Monarch Mine Vineyard Roussanne (Sierra Foothills)
description: Subtle savory flavors like herbs and mushrooms and consommé meet mellow fruit flavors of Bosc pear and yellow plum in this full-bodied and lushly textured wine. It has a broad mouth-filling presence, and flavors that are at once rich but also show some restraint that encourages more sipping. Save until at least 2021 for an extra treat.

title: Bernardus 2016 Sierra Mar Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Bright lemon aromas meet with toast and sweet oak on the nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is aggressive in flavor, with bright citrus, buttery brioche, sea salt and a vanilla finish, all wrapped in grippy structure with well-integrated oak flavors.

title: Byron 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Fairly tart and juicy on the nose, this bottling from one of the region's oldest vineyards offers raspberry, baking spice and a hint of wild boar flesh on the nose. The flavors are full of barely ripe red fruit and more gamy qualities, and there is plenty of acid cutting through the rounded mouthfeel.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Older Barrels Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark aromas of black cherry, wet slate, loam and strong baking spice show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from some of the more neutral barrels in the winery. It's crisp and juicy on the palate, with rich flavors of wild cherry and cola, all cut by strong acidity.

title: Goat Bubbles 2015 Blanc de Noirs Bien Nacido Vineyard Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Freshly smashed lemon aromas meet with yeast and sourdough on the nose of this excellent bubbly bottling. The palate's bubbles are soft and inviting, with flavors of yuzu, fresh bread and the slightest hints of smoke and ash.
designation: Blanc de Noirs Bien Nacido Vineyard

title: Louis M. Martini 2014 Monte Rosso Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This bold, flavorful wine offers well-integrated tones of red currant, dried cherry, dusty leather and clove. Savory and profound in elongated tannins, it holds its powerful ripeness and structure with pride, showing the stuffing to age well. Best 2024–2029.

title: Lula 2016 Rescue Block Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: While full bodied, this wine also has more than enough fruit, spice and savory nuances to give it plenty of flavor. The aroma exudes sour cherry, wild berry and underbrush while the flavors reveal ripe black cherry, rhubarb and light tea notes for an appealing and complex mix. It's called Rescue Block because the grapes are from a block of 1,000 old vines that Lula's owners nursed back to health.

title: Schramsberg 2014 Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (North Coast)
description: A crisp texture and rather full body carry subtle spice and lean dry fruit flavors in this nicely reserved and complex wine. Apple skin, lemon zest and hints of toasted almond carry the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Wilson Foreigner 2016 Rancho Chimiles Valdiguié (Napa Valley)
description: Made from a family estate in the eastern wilds of Napa Valley, this small-production red is fermented in a concrete tank and aged in neutral oak. It retains ebullient freshness and focus, its fruit a mix of grape, cherry and plum. Around the edges are floral aromas and superb mineral characteristics.

title: Lichen Estate 2016 Estate Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Ripe and round, this generous semisweet wine is quite different from the average Grigio. It has ripe apple and pear aromas, concentrated fruit and light spice flavors, a broad, almost thick texture and lingering finish.

title: Bellante 2015 Bentrock Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Deeply layered spice-rack aromas of clove and star anise lift the mulberry fruit on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the appellation's westernmost point. Tarragon and marjoram flavors give depth to elderberry and black-plum-skin backdrop, which proves rather elegant.

title: Bernardus 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Butterscotch and hazelnut aromas make for a very creamy and yet not overblown nose on this bottling. It's zesty on the palate with strong lime and lemon-rind flavors, yet the core remains the clarified butter, hazelnut and cashew flavors, leading into a crème brûlée finish.

title: Bouchaine 2017 Vin Gris of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a delightfully delicious and immensely quaffable wine, made from a majority of whole cluster-pressed, estate-grown grapes that were fermented in stainless steel. It is light in body and lively in a dried herb tone, with crisp, inviting flavors of tangerine, white peach and watermelon.

title: Broken Earth 2014 Studium Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of Petite Sirah, Petit Verdot and Merlot is aged in new French and American oak two times (once before blending, and once after) to produce a whopper of a wine. Aromas of black cherry, toffee and vanilla are leveled by gravel and fresh raspberry. The rich sip reveals scorched caramel, roasted coffee beans and charred black-currant flavors.

title: Cedarville 2015 Estate Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Sophisticated in flavor and extremely smooth in texture, this high-elevation wine is easy to enjoy while also offering interesting nuances of fig and black pepper in the aroma, and plump plum and raspberry on the palate. It's another excellent wine from the very consistent Cedarville property.

title: El Lugar 2016 Hilliard Bruce Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Well-integrated aromas of clove, star anise, cola and suave black cherry show on the nose of this bottling from the southernmost vineyard currently used by winemaker Coby Parker-Garcia. Dark cherry flavors meet with sarsaparilla and cola on the rich, brawny palate.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite a dark expression of Pinot Noir, this wine begins with aromas of boysenberry juice, pungent star anise and a black licorice touch on the nose. On the palate, bouncy and sharp acidity drives through dark-fruit flavors, making for a very lively bottling.

title: Galerie 2017 Terracea Riesling (Spring Mountain District)
description: This wine is fermented partially in concrete, partially in amphora and French oak puncheon. Lemony green-apple and peach flavors star with ease against a backdrop of creamy, lush texture and plenty of fresh bright acidity.

title: Janzen 2015 Cloudy's Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's estate vineyard wedged within the Vaca Mountains, this is a nicely structured wine, lengthy in dry tannin and a persistence of dried herb. A lingering fruitiness of cherry and cassis offer depth of flavor within floral aromatics of lavender and sage. The finish is defined in mocha.

title: Mirabelle NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: A creamy texture, buttery aromas and subtle ginger flavor make this wine from Schramsberg generous, complex and easy to love. Bosc pear, white peach, powdered ginger and cinnamon all combine for good complexity and concentration. Chardonnay leads the blend 68% to 32% Pinot Noir.

title: Sentivo 2012 Estate Petite Sirah (El Dorado)
description: This smooth and accessible wine is sturdy in texture, has good blackberry and black-pepper flavors and a medium to full body. The color is a bit light for the varietal and the tannins are firm but far from oppressive.

title: Thorn 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Fans of The Prisoner will like this broadly juicy blend of 81% Merlot with Syrah, Petite Sirah and Malbec, the body full and fleshy. Ripe in baked plum and chocolate, it's robust and smooth.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Wet cedar, dark cherry and pine smoke show on the nose of this well-distributed bottling. Dark red fruits and wood spice come through on the palate, which is framed by a sticky texture and lingering acidity.

title: Castle Rock 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Red cherry, allspice, cinnamon and a touch of oak show on the nose of this likable and quite affordable bottling. The red fruit on the palate is a bit dried and slightly sour, lifted by peppery spices, smoky oak and filmy tannins.

title: Folie à Deux 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Eucalyptus and mint show on the nose of this full-bodied wine, grainy and somewhat hot on the palate in robust ripeness. Baked rhubarb and cranberry define the midpalate fruitiness.

title: Austerity 2016 Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Roasted cherry and rusty earth aromas show on the simple nose of this bottling. The palate shows similar elements, with dried cherry, turned earth and a hint of thyme, bolstered by decent acidity.

title: Broken Earth 2016 Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded aromas of poached pear show on the simple nose of this bottling. There is a boost of orange zest on the sip, which then settles into flavors of apple flesh.

title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Zinfandel (California)
description: Full bodied and rustic in personality, this wine has earthy dusty aromas, along with ripe berry and balsamic flavors.

title: Salvestrin 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This youthful wine has a muted nose and thick, concentrated layers of tannin and tobacco. It takes time to unwind in the glass around a substantial core of oak.

title: SAVED 2017 Magic Maker Rosé (California)
description: An extremely pale-salmon color leads to aromas like canteloupe and thin watermelon flavors in this light-bodied wine. It has good acidity for a refreshing quality but not much concentration.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Tannic and herbal, this wine is velvety but thick, with non-varietal aspects that make it jammier and more robust than expected.

title: Wilson Creek 2015 Family Meritage (Temecula Valley)
description: Fairly light aromas of roasted red plums, smoke and a touch of thyme show on the nose of this blend of 60% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Cabernet Franc, 13% Merlot and 7% Malbec. Oregano, marjoram and thyme meet with more red plum and campfire smoke on the palate.

title: Clone 7 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Robustly rich with an underlying oaky note of char, this wine offers a chalky texture of tannin and dark-cherry coulis, the finish an intriguing mix of black pepper and clove.

title: Clouds Rest 2008 Egoiste Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: A library wine on offer, this has elements of dark cherry, cassis and chocolate, and a supple texture, with a midpalate that's beginning to dull.

title: Gehricke 2015 Chalk Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Crème brûlée and toasted marshmallow greet the nose as a buttery backbone of flavor begins to develop on the palate. Thick and rich with intense acidity, this youthful vineyard-designate is still finding itself.

title: Gnarly Head 2017 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: Very appley, fresh and crisp, this wine is light bodied, clean and appetizing. It gives simple refreshment and there's nothing wrong with that.

title: Raymond 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: This is a subtle wine that shows fig and subdued melon flavors on a smooth, non-tart texture. It is full bodied, light in terms of concentration but the rich mouthfeel will suit many palates.

title: Smoke Tree 2017 Rosé (California)
description: Light in body, light in flavor, this pale-pink wine tastes refreshing and straightforward, lean in terms of fruit flavor but showing an attractive herbaceous aroma.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)
description: This medium-bodied wine has plenty of ripe fruit flavors. Fuji apple and honeydew melon take center stage, with low-acid and a soft texture.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2017 M Rosé (Temecula Valley)
description: A darker shade of reddish pink and sold in a high-shouldered bottling, this rosé offers aromas of cherry juice, earth, rust and gravel. Dried red-plum flavors show on the palate, which is lacking the higher acid found across the category.

title: Gary Farrell 2015 Hallberg Vineyard Dijon Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Undeniably spicy, this wine is tart and tangy in acidity, too—focused and full of tension. Notes of dried herb, black tea and cardamom punch first, before allowing room for the fruit, which presents itself as an irresistible combination of cherry and pomegranate.

title: Grassini 2016 Block 14 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This block-designated bottling is tightly wound and a bit restrained at first on the nose, but then aromas of flint, peach, ash and white lily begin to elegantly arise. The palate is tart, tense and taut with flavors of lime skin, orange rind and an ashy Brie cheese rind element that makes it very distinctive.

title: Heath Vineyards 2014 Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Freshly pressed blueberries, tar, violets and baked blackberry cake show on the dense nose of this bottling by a winery in Texas. The sip is surprisingly delicate at first, with extreme floral flavors that are cut by black-currant cookies, char, black pepper and tar. The acidity rises into the finish.

title: Howell Mountain Vineyards 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Perfumed in cherry, vanilla and cassis, this wine offers dusty brawny tannins that surround a silky supple palate of pronounced texture. Sticky on the finish, it has room to age. It is enjoyable now in its firm grasp of ripe fruit and layered depth.

title: Bailarin 2015 Suacci Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Forest-floor mushroom and pine add spark to a rustic framework of restrained ripeness and savory spice, most definitely cardamom. Medium in body and oak, its fruit is satisfyingly elusive, a mix of rhubarb and pomegranate.

title: Carlisle 2015 The Integral Red (Sonoma County)
description: This is a coferment of 56% Syrah and 44% Mourvèdre, the grapes grown in Bennett Valley. It possesses grace and style within a brawny shell of spice and leather. Violet aromas dance around the entry, as complex earth tones tease in black olive, cured meat and berry pie.

title: Ousterhout 2012 Bradford Mountain Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a brawny leathery red with voluptuous black fruit and a taste of black pepper. Grippy, it offers plenty of structure and complexity to suggest long-term enjoyment, and is a good versatile call for the table.

title: Robert Biale 2015 Royal Punishers Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Featuring a juicy backbone of blackberry and dark cherry (highlights of a seamless structure), this wine shines in additional flavors of vanilla and leather. Full bodied, it holds its weight and breadth in check, delivering voluptuous within a classic framework of style and complexity.

title: Terragena 2014 Wiley Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A classic light color and complex aromas like rhubarb, forest floor and raspberry precede lively red cherry, pomegranate and mushroom flavors on a lean and appetizing texture. This outstanding wine makes a great change of pace from the ponderous fruit-and-oak bombs.

title: Tinto Rey 2016 Verdejo (Dunnigan Hills)
description: Intriguing and complex, this full-bodied wine combines bright elements of orange zest and pineapple with richer flavors of toasted almond, salted peanuts and dried figs. It is ripe in feel, but good acidity lifts it up and keeps the taste refreshing through a long finish.

title: Wonderment Wines 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Petite Sirah (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged in Burgundy oak barrels, this refined, balanced and ultimately delicious wine features strawberry-preserve flavors wrapped in toasty oak. Leather, cigar box and a bite of cedar add to its complex whole, its texture soft, fulsome and richly layered.

title: Zenaida Cellars 2015 Zinfandel (Templeton Gap District)
description: Quite lovely aromas of rose petals, raspberry framboise, gravel, baked earth, vanilla and caramel show on the inviting nose of this bottling. There is an intriguing peppery spice and herbal character of thyme, bay leaf and oregano on the sip, all set against a backdrop of exotic cherry.

title: Jaffurs 2014 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Purple flowers, blueberry cream and a caramel richness live on the nose of this single-vineyard expression from one of the newer properties in the region. The mouthfeel is dense, the tannins are stiff and the acidity is bright, carrying flavors of charred meat, purple flowers, black pepper and extremely dark berries. It's still young, so drink 2019–2029.

title: Jaffurs 2016 Bien Nacido Vineyard Viognier (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Very chalky, tightly wound and mineral-driven on the nose, this expertly restrained bottling also shows Key lime, slight white peach and a whiff of daffodil on the nose. Zippy as can be on the sip, flavors of lime and pink lemon are overshadowed by chalky tensions and limestone flavors, much like licking a white rock.

title: Black Kite 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Smoky aromas of roasted chicken, sandalwood and oak are cut by strong Meyer lemon rinds on this bottling, which appeals to those with a fondness for rich toasty flavors. It's super zippy on the palate, with orange oil and lemon skin flavors cutting through the toasted pecan nuttiness and hickory smoke.

title: Cambria 2015 Element Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Candied black cherry, smoked pork, cola and crushed asphalt show on the complex, inviting nose of this smaller-block bottling from the estate's large vineyard. The flavors are deep and dark yet not rich or heavy, with hints of tar, black pepper, wild blackberries and black plum, all hung from a firm zippy structure.

title: Miro 2015 Ponzo Vineyard Old Vines Reserve Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: With 12% Petite Sirah, this old-vine wine is dominated by candied plum on the nose and mouth, with additional notes of ripe black fruits on the palate. The palate is bold yet well-integrated, with a velvety texture and graceful structure.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Moses-Hall Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Smoky char meets noble reduction in this medium-bodied tightly wound wine. Youthfully grippy, it unravels slowly to show aromas and flavors of dark cherry, chocolate mint and forest floor, finding a balance between power and grace.

title: Shane Wines 2014 La Reine Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Rich fruit flavors are accented by brown sugar and vanilla in this seductive and easy-drinking wine. It has a smooth soft texture, lots of ripeness and low acidity for a melting mouthfeel and sweet-seeming finish.

title: Claudine 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon has small percentages of Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot. Spicy clove rides atop full-figured waves of black cherry and blackberry fruit. It's balanced and well-integrated within its ripe fruit frame, with structured tannins and a deep, rich concentration.

title: Muirwood 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: Smoke, loam and leather give depth to the otherwise sweet-smelling black-cherry jelly aroma on the nose of this bottling. There is a clean line of joyous fruit on the palate, wrapped in grippy tannins, with a pinch of herbs and vanilla-cookie flavors on the finish.

title: People's Wine Revolution 2014 Bea's Knees Oberti Vineyard Petite Sirah (Suisun Valley)
description: Rather light in texture and body for this notoriously tannic varietal, the wine has plenty of blackberry and boysenberry flavors, a rich and moderately firm mouthfeel and an almost jammy finish.

title: Via Romano 2017 Lileana Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: A light salmon color and peach and citrus aromas give way to light flavors of raspberry, white cherry and baking spices in this medium-bodied lean-textured wine.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Cienega Valley)
description: Soft aromas of berry, wet gravel and rust show on the nose of this bottling from a recently rebranded yet extremely historic property in San Benito County. It lands on the palate with watery watermelon flavors, proving quite shy in both flavor and structure.

title: Edna Valley Vineyard 2016 Merlot (Central Coast)
description: The nose on this widely available, decent everyday red shows black cherry, charcoal and a strong rocky element on the nose. The juicy red fruits show strongly on the sip at first, and then comes more herbaceous oregano, marjoram and pepper. Acidity and structure rise into the finish.

title: Gnarly Head 2016 1924 Double Black Red (California)
description: An extra-deep color leads to rich ripe black-cherry and chocolate aromas in this smooth, velvety and concentrated wine. Blueberry and blackberry notes spread out on the palate while well-integrated oak and a hint of sweetness keep it user friendly.

title: Hullabaloo 2015 Old Vines Zinfandel (California)
description: This dry medium-bodied wine has herb and black-pepper aromas and an earthy meaty flavor that would suit a Rhône varietal well. It has a good structure of acidity and moderate tannins.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Wild sage, dark red cherry and turned earth show on the familiar nose of this bottling. The palate is even-handed with red fruit and dried chaparral flavors.

title: Kirkland Signature 2016 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Mint and earth tones ride along a juicy core of cherry in this medium-bodied wine. Big bones of oak and tannin give it a grippy finish.

title: Broadside 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: The nose on this bottling shows fresh strawberry, dried dill, herbs, green peppercorns and a hint of green bell pepper. Those pyrazine flavors also show on the sip, with more green-pepper elements giving intrigue to the red-fruit backdrop.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2014 Sleeping Lady Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: High toned and floral, with lifted acidity throughout, this wine offers red fruit and clove but is light on the midpalate, offering powerful ripeness without much structure.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is an herbal offering of the variety, correct in some of its cedar and dried herb components. Dusty oak and tannin define a moderate structure of warm, supple plum and baked cherry steeped in cinnamon.

title: Saint Gregory 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This medium-bodied barrel-aged dry wine has plummy aromas and cherry-candy flavors accented by a hint of vanilla. Think of it as a nice light Pinot Noir, which it is of course.

title: V. Sattui 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Cool-climate aromatics open this wine, which drinks heavier in dark plum, dark chocolate and an earthy compost note. The acidity is uplifting, if not somewhat disjointed, and quiet on the finish.

title: Via Romano 2017 Celeste Riserva Rosé (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This crisp and tangy wine made from Sangiovese grapes has the lightest color imaginable, light citrus and herb aromas and flavors and light body too. Still it has an appealing freshness and thirst-quenching character, aided by a touch of sweetness.

title: Whipsmart Wine Company 2016 Sit in the Sun Very Old Vines Muscadelle (Sonoma Valley)
description: Honeydew melon and lemon candy and chiffon define this midweight wine, an unusual variety for California. High-toned acidity is offset by a confectionery finish of marshmallow.
designation: Sit in the Sun Very Old Vines

title: Zinke 2017 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: Very light aromas of raspberry, strawberry and wet gravel show on the nose of this bottling from Alta Mesa Vineyard in the Cuyama Valley. The flavors are light, simple and pleasant, with red-fruit and tangy mandarin-orange-rind touches.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Very ripe, raisiny in flavor and almost sweet, this full-bodied wine oozes blackberry, prune and raisin notes on a soft pillowy texture. It seems appropriate with cheese or chocolate at the end of a meal.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2014 Reserve Estate Vineyard Primitivo (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied and smooth-textured wine has earthy berry-like aromas, nicely ripe blackberry and raspberry flavors and a good touch of tannin in the mouthfeel.

title: City Winery Chicago 2015 Obsidian Ridge Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Red Hills)
description: This medium-bodied wine is balanced toward the lean, crisp side of the spectrum and shows moderately ripe cranberry and cherry flavors. Medium tannins and lively acidity give it a bright sensation on the palate.

title: Melville 2015 Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Toasty aromas of seared lemon, citrus pith and ashy Brie rind show on the nose of this bottling from the longtime grape-growing family. The palate is extremely focused and sharp, offering lime sorbet, green pear and more pithy qualities, wrapped in a compellingly grippy texture.

title: Roar 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Noticeably cloudy in the glass, this single-vineyard exploration shows rich mulberry, black plum and candied rose-petal aromas. It's soft and creamy on the palate, where tart red plum and fresh thyme flavors prove a promising pairing.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from a majority of the variety blended with dozens of interplanted varieties that date back to the site's planting in 1890, this impresses in its lovely, lifted aromatics of nutmeg and clove. On the palate, expect blackberry cobbler and plum with an underbelly of balanced ripeness.

title: Tantara 2016 Tondre Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon syrup, toasty sandalwood, dried mango and nectarine show on the nose of this bottling from vines planted in 2007. The palate pairs squeezed lemon, guava and mango-cream flavors with a hint of oak and decent acid, finishing with a waxy texture.

title: Waxwing 2015 Tondre Grapefield Syrah (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Savory aromas of pepper, roast beef and hearty dark fruit show on the nose of this bottling, a rare Syrah from the Santa Lucia Highlands. There are tangy flavors of underripe blackberry on the palate, but the crushed peppercorn and lamb roast with rosemary elements are most prominent.

title: Westerly 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Black plum, violet, lilac and a hint of chocolate are well integrated on the tangy yet rich nose of this balanced effort by a winery that recently changed hands. The wine hits the palate with hefty black-cherry, blackberry and elderberry-jam flavors, proving thick and impressive atop chalky tannins.

title: Bernardus 2016 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: There's an herbal kick on the nose of this single-vineyard expression, with dried seasonings and tea leaves lifting the boysenberry fruit core. More tea and marjoram meet with roasted plums on the palate, which is cut by crisp acidity.

title: Chiron Wines 2015 Pelkan Ranch Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Knights Valley)
description: A  herbal and perfumed nose opens this lovely, well-made and robust wine, which is both softly round and complex in nature. A billowy texture supports firm acidity, integrated oak and bursts of red and black fruit, plum and clove.

title: Croma Vera 2016 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Bright aromas of pomegranate, raspberry sorbet, ripe cherry, rosewater candy and vanilla show on the fresh yet luxurious nose of this bottling. It's light in feel, with a tense in structure that carries flavors of strawberry, cinnamon and dried ginger.

title: Entrepreneur 2014 Widdoes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Clove and forest pine open this immensely perfumed and expressive vintage-designate, its backbone built in plush, polished tannin and lengthy power. Black cherry, brambly berry and cola complement each other in dense, concentrated waves.

title: Inman Family 2015 OGV Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the family's 10-acre estate vineyard, this wine is defined by its balance: a sweet embrace of delicate red fruit complemented by earthy, savory dried herb and pine. Light, carbonic and exotic, it shows a grip of tannin that softens over time in the glass, reflective of a concentrated vintage.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Stagecoach Vineyard Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Cedar, pencil shavings and toasted oak accent a rich full-bodied core of red-cherry cola and berry in this mountain-grown wine that offers plenty of grip and acid-supported structure. The aromatics are perfumed and the length of the finish impressive in strong tannin.

title: Stolpman 2016 Hair of the Bear Red (Ballard Canyon)
description: Illogical alchemy happens when Roussanne (25% in this case) is thrown in with dark grapes like Petite Sirah: the purple wine actually gets darker thanks to the white grape's oily grip. This well-named bottling shows black currant, Concord grape, blackberry juice and crushed lilacs on the deep and hearty nose, while the palate is driven by ripe and roasted black plums, finishing with hints of maple syrup, brown sugar and gingerbread spice.

title: Two Angels 2016 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)
description: Complex, compelling aromas of fig, mint and cocoa start this full-bodied wine off with a bang before rich, jammy blackberry and blueberry flavors flood the palate. The texture is quite tannic, but is balanced out by the richness and concentration of the fruit tones. It's a big, boisterous wine that needs some equally big proteins to pair with. Best after 2020.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Grand Reserve Red (Fair Play)
description: Excellent depth of fruit flavor makes this Cabernet Sauvignon-based blend a standout. There is little obvious oak flavor to detract from the very ripe, opulent black-cherry and blackberry flavors that soak through moderate tannins and fill the mouth with generous, layered richness. It has a fine structure for aging, too. Best through 2023.

title: Black Kite 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Spicy, earthy and dark in fruit, this vineyard-designate offers integrated oak and a broad fleshy midpalate. Full-bodied richness and ripeness go hand in hand to make for a voluptuous expression of the grape from a tremendous site.

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Glenrose Vineyard Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Rich aromas of black currant, gingerbread, fresh lilac and jasmine slide into a meatier backbone on the nose of this bottling. It's soft on the palate at first and then spreads out to reveal blackberry, violet and roasted pork flavors, framed by solid acidity and fine tannins.

title: Foxen 2016 Julia's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Ripe red cherry meets with hints of dewy thyme, sagebrush and minty earth on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate is loaded with herbal impact, as thyme and oregano provide depth to the pomegranate and raspberry flavors.

title: Hearst Ranch 2015 The Point Red (Paso Robles)
description: Blackberry aromas are layered with savory touches of pepper, salt, leather and turned earth on the complex and well-integrated nose of this Bordeaux blend, named for the Hearst family's rocky point off of San Simeon beach. Dark-red and black plums are lifted by marjoram and Asian spice on the medium-bodied palate.

title: JCB 2014 No 34 Brut Rosé Sparkling (Carneros)
description: This is made from 80% Pinot Noir, the remainder Chardonnay, both coming from both the Napa and Sonoma sides of the appellation. Inviting in wild strawberry, it is dry and stony and exuberant in earthy mineral aspects of crushed rock and dried herb.

title: Bogle 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Full body, firm structure and well-concentrated fruit flavors make a great combination in this robust wine. It makes the mouth water for a meaty dish to enjoy it with, and it has a good palate-coating sense of richness.

title: Charles B. Mitchell 2013 Reserve Estate Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)
description: This wine has great structure and very focused fruit flavors. Attractive floral and strawberry aromas lead to nicely concentrated fruit and mineral notes that are firmly supported by moderate tannins and a medium to full body.

title: Highland Valley 2015 Barbera (San Diego County)
description: Light anise, dark red currant and plump cranberry show on the nose of this Barbera bottling, which exhibits potential as a reliable grape for this warm region. Ample marjoram and star anise reside on the buoyant palate, alongside fresh boysenberry and vanilla flavors.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Whale Rock Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of tobacco, tar, black cherry and charred beef show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. It's fairly tight on the palate, with judicious and not overjoyous black currant as well as tar and hints of dried herb flavors.

title: McKahn 2016 Grenache (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This wine is full-bodied and quite concentrated, starting with oaky cedary aromas that lead to ripe rich blackberry flavors and a broad mouthfilling texture bolstered by moderate tannins.

title: Neyers 2016 El Novillero Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is highly floral in gardenia and honeysuckle, with a light touch to the oak. Its muscular entry has a slow build up of concentrated apple and pear flavors supported by moderate structure.

title: Oakstone 2015 Estate Vineyard Meritage (Fair Play)
description: Dark, concentrated and well-seasoned by oaky smoky spiciness, this full-bodied dry wine has rich blackberry flavors and a velvety texture. It's made from almost equal parts of the Bordeaux grape varieties Merlot, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petit Verdot.

title: Proulx 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This is a very berrylicious play on Zinfandel, with strong yet elegant berry and currant aromas as well as touches of violet and lavender. Boysenberry syrup powers the palate and is leveled by white-pepper, dried marjoram and mint flavors, set against loamy earth tones that come through strong on the finish.

title: Saint K 2017 Flower Bomb French Camp Vineyard Malvasia Bianca (Paso Robles)
description: Candied limes and tangerines meet with slightly reductive notes of grass, lemongrass and kaffir lime on the nose of this beautifully labeled bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and acid-washed, and settles into a pleasant vibe of lime, grapefruit and underripe orange flavors.

title: The Withers Winery 2017 Rosé (El Dorado)
description: This refreshing dry wine made from Mourvèdre and Grenache has a light-salmon color and fresh raspberry aromas and flavors. A slight bite of tannin and acidity firms up the palate impression nicely.

title: V. Sattui 2013 Paradiso Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blend is made from 73% Cabernet Sauvignon, 21% Merlot, 3% Malbec and 3% Petit Verdot. Possessed of a muted earthiness and spicy oak, this wine offers a depth of baked plum and baking spice within full-bodied ripeness and dense power.

title: Vasco Urbano 2015 The Sheriff G-S-M (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is seriously oaky and tannic, filling the aroma with smoke, cedar and pepper and the flavor with roasted, meaty and darkly fruity flavors like macerated blackberries. The texture is heavily tannic and somewhat drying but the rich fruit notes come back on the finish for relief.

title: Château Souverain 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Smooth and medium in body, this supple wine has fresh and engaging cherry and berry flavors, with subtle oak spices, mild tannins and soft acidity. It's well balanced, polished and pleasing.

title: Easton 2015 Monarch Mine Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: Pure concentrated black-cherry flavors light up this wonderfully focused, vibrant and full-bodied wine. It is firm in texture due to moderate tannins and fresh acidity that give a little bite to the mouthfeel.

title: Folktale 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Tart red fruit, a pinch of herbs and mushroomy qualities show on the nose of this bottling alongside an intriguing gamy note. There is pomegranate fruit driving the complex palate, which also shows dried shiitakes, more herbs and a bit of barnyard funk.

title: Highland Valley 2014 Craftsman Cuvée II Red (San Diego County)
description: The blend of 32% Cabernet Sauvignon, 32% Merlot, 28% Malbec and 8% Cabernet Franc shows promise for this region, starting with aromas of pressed red cherry and cedar. The sip is quite tangy with red plum, and is made complex by tobacco leaf and Mexican mole spices of cocoa and dried chile.

title: Klinker Brick 2017 Grenache Blanc (Lodi)
description: This wine has an appetizing apple-skin tanginess and slight tannins underneath crisp, vibrant almond and white peach flavors. It's absolutely dry, lean and dramatic.

title: Bonny Doon 2017 Vin Gris de Cigare Rosé (Central Coast)
description: Pale pink in the glass, this blend of 57% Grenache, 18% Grenache Blanc, 9% Mourvèdre, 6% Roussanne, 5% Carignane and 5% Cinsaut shows light strawberry, melon, lime pith and wet sidewalk aromas on the nose. The palate is reminiscent of a gin and tonic, with strong lime character that cuts into the strawberry flavors.

title: C R Graybehl 2016 Mounts Family Vineyard Grenache Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Waxy apple skin, flint and a subdued palate of jasmine and white flowers mark the soul of this light, steely wine, which is reserved in fruit, revealing mostly lemon peel.

title: Cavaletti 2016 The 109 Mile Syrah (California)
description: This big but non-oaky wine starts with a rich figgy aroma that's slightly funky but engaging. It coats the palate with ripe blackberry, black-cherry and savory notes backed by firm tannins.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: A strong herbal display shows on the nose of this bottling, including dried oregano as well as shaved chocolate, coffee and red-plum fruit. The palate adds marjoram and pencil shavings to the mix, which gives a strong cedar tone to the cooked blackberry flavor, finishing with sticky tannins.

title: Firestone 2016 Riesling (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Sweeter-leaning aromas of lime and lemon syrup meet with crushed white rocks and light orange blossom on the nose of this bottling. The palate proves more dry than expected, with flavors of lime rind, orange-blossom candies and fresh herbs.

title: Goldschmidt 2016 Yardstick Ruth's Reach Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rustic and well priced, this has a char oak imprint with highlights of cedar and pencil, its overall intensity and blackberry richness tamed by an herbal underbelly and lifted acidity.

title: GTB 2016 Del Barba Vineyard Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: This wine is very smooth, fruity, ripe and almost sweet in flavor. It has plum and raisin notes, a soft texture, elevated alcohol and low acidity.

title: Oso Libre NV Carnal Red (California)
description: Extracted black-plum aromas meet with tangy balsamic vinegar and blackberry on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very rich and thick with boysenberry-jam and spice-cake flavors that eventually find some tannic structure.

title: Shannon 2015 Two Bud Block Reserve Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Heavy oak spices dominate this full-bodied wine giving it plenty of vanilla, cinnamon, wood smoke and black pepper in the aromas and flavors. Beneath the oakiness and firm tannins, the berry flavor that the varietal is known for is rather hidden.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Estate Reserve Cabernet Franc (Fair Play)
description: Powerful in structure and quite ripe and monolithic in flavor, this full-bodied wine tastes like black cherries and light oak spices and has a firm texture backed by moderate tannins.

title: Carson Scott 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Fresh apple and pear aromas lead to rich, ripe pear and vanilla flavors in this medium-bodied and lushly textured wine. It has a mouth-coating thickness that's soft and full.

title: Cline 2016 Ancient Vines Zinfandel (Contra Costa County)
description: Very ripe, almost sweet fruit flavors pour forth from this full-bodied wine, accented by baking spices like vanilla and cinnamon. It feels very smooth and soft in texture.

title: Clos LaChance 2015 Reserve Cabernet Franc (Central Coast)
description: Fruity and juicy aromas of ripe blackberry and purple flowers prove lush but with a tang on the nose of this bottling. Candied blackberry, vanilla, sarsaparilla and cigar-box flavors show on the palate.

title: Formation 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Seared apple, lemonade and lemon-blossom candies show on the steely nose of this fresh twist-top bottling. Tangy orange rinds meet with broad Pink Lady apple flavors on the palate.

title: Midnight 2015 Estate Merlot (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: The nose of this bottling is quite shy, offering hints of black cherry, dark berry and loam with patience. The palate shows simple berry and earth flavors, with a touch of tannic tension.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Red (Atlas Peak)
description: Made from 61% Sangiovese and 39% Cabernet Sauvignon, this is earthy and tannic, with a dry, leathery composition of oaky black pepper and dried cherry.

title: San Simeon 2014 Estate Reserve Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Baked red-cherry, vanilla, baking-spice and turned earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Strong herbs, from oregano to thyme, show on the sip, alongside tangy red fruit flavors.

title: Sean W. McBride 2016 Filigreen Farm Old Saint George Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Maple syrup in the aroma and raspberry jam in the flavor add up to a very fruity, almost-sweet wine that is rich and mouth-filling. It has a soft soothing texture, low acidity and little tannin.

title: Telios 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This is a good, solid and concentrated wine for everyday occasions. It has ample blackberry and blueberry notes, a light vanilla and cinnamon oak touch, smooth texture and rich finish.

title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Nice fruit concentration, a touch of spicy oak and a very clean uncomplicated flavor profile make this smooth and almost-sweet wine easy to quaff and enjoy. It's full bodied, soft and not noticeably tannic.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Gilsson Vineyard Old Vine Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Baked plum, licorice and lavender aromas and flavors define this jammy wine, which takes on a sweetness of oak. Thick on the midpalate, it has substantial weight from the tannins and powerfully ripe fruit.

title: Wente 2014 Coastal Selection Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Pomegranate and light baking-spice aromas show on the mellow nose of this bottling. The palate is clean with fruit punch and spice-cake flavors wrapped in a fairly mellow texture.

title: California Republic 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Butter and vanilla notes dominate the jammy fruit flavors in this rich and seemingly sweet wine. It is medium bodied, lightly tannic and heavily influenced by oaky aromas and flavors, including baking spices and maple syrup.

title: Stasis 2017 Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Light aromas of honey, rounded nectarine and a hint of Meyer lemon pith show on the nose of this bottling. Rounded apple and pear flavors meet with seared peach and lemon zest on the refreshing palate.

title: Velvet Bee 2016 McGinley Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Wet cement and cut grass make for a very fresh nose on this bottling. The palate is quite grippy in texture, offering lime pith, red pear and more damp sidewalk flavors.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Homage Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Black currant, blackberry, damp wood and dried purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling from the region between Gilroy and Morgan Hill south of San Jose. It's a down-the-middle Syrah on the palate, showing familiar hints of pepper and black fruit with proper tannins and acid.

title: Broken Earth 2013 CdR Red (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded blackberry and plum meet with hickory smoke and flint on the nose of this blend of 53% Petite Sirah, 22% Syrah, 16% Grenache and 9% Viognier. It's full of flavor on the palate, combining tangy berries, charred wood, a hint of tar and herbal oils.

title: Bucher 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from several blocks and clones within the sustainably farmed site, this is an earthy, stemmy wine that is exotic in lightly spiced cola and pomegranate. A robust texture and body provides nuanced richness and ample concentration.

title: Byron 2015 Nielson Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Sour lemon aromas meet with strong sandalwood and charred oak on the very woody nose of this bottling. Tangy lemon skin, lighter lemon blossom and viscous, nearly sweet oak flavors show on the palate, which is dominated by wood.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Mourvèdre (Contra Costa County)
description: A light color and relatively light flavors of strawberry, cooked plums and tamarind make for an interesting, unusual character for this medium-bodied wine. It will be a good choice when the occasion calls for a red with restraint.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2017 Dry Riesling (Central Coast)
description: Light lime aromas meet with nectarine on the plush nose of this appellation blend by this Alsatian variety-focused winery. It's quite dry on the palate, offering subtle flavors of apple rind and wrapped up in a fairly tight texture. It's an easy-drinking introductory Riesling.

title: Cochon 2015 Whole Hog Red (California)
description: Supple, concentrated and generous, this wine has lightly oaky aromas like vanilla and coconut, an abundance of ripe plummy milk-chocolaty flavors and a soft texture that feels gentle on the palate.

title: Cosa Obra 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fleshy and full-bodied with moderate acidity, this is a barrel-fermented wine, made from Pinot Noir grapes grown by the Sangiacomo family. Strawberry, melon and cherry flavors leap from the glass.

title: Dusty Nabor 2017 The Florist Viognier (Ballard Canyon)
description: Slightly cloudy in the glass, this bottling, featuring a great label by artist Ethan Stuart, starts with aromas of mashed-up lemons, crushed nuts, and oak. That smoky lemon tang shows strongly on the palate too, which verges on savory, with hints of roast chicken, sea salt and herbs.

title: Falkner 2017 Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Loads of white flowers meet with an orange-banana smoothie and sandalwood aromas on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows the sweetness of apple flesh with a rounded woody character, making for solid flavors even if the acid is a tad weak.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Oregano meets with dark pomegranate and a touch of smoke on the nose of this appellation blend. More smoke shows on the palate alongside tangy red fruit and dried herbs. It's a decent midweek option.

title: Frenchie Winery 2014 Frenchington Red (California)
description: Flavors like blackberry jam and black pepper make a nice match in this full-bodied broad-textured wine made mostly from Bordeaux varietals with 22% Petite Sirah added. It tastes rich and smooth, and is concentrated enough for a lingering finish. The ornate label features a surprising yet alarming portrait of George Washington with the face of a French bulldog that belongs to winery owner Jean-Charles Boisset.

title: Gloria Ferrer NV Sonoma Brut Sparkling (Sonoma County)
description: Made from a majority of Pinot Noir, the minority Chardonnay, this wine is focused in green-apple aromas and flavors. The acidity is fresh, dry and balanced within a thick mousse of understated richness.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 P1 Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Ripe red-fruit aromas meet with sweet wood shavings on the nose of this blend of 66% Cabernet Sauvignon and 34% Syrah. Blackberry flavors show up alongside pepper and thyme on the pleasant, but somewhat simple, palate.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2016 Rick's Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Syrah and Merlot plays to the less-ripe side of the equation, offering aromas of tomato, bell pepper and green peppercorns. There is juicy red fruit on the palate and lots of peppery spice, but that bell-pepper undercurrent persists, which is interesting for this often very ripe region.

title: Meeker 2017 Evina Vineyard Verdelho (Contra Costa County)
description: Very crisp, lean and herbaceous, this light-bodied wine has aromas of celery and white pepper and vivid flavors of cucumber and fresh herbs. It's very thirst quenching and vibrant in texture.

title: Saintsbury 2016 Sundawg Ridge Vineyard Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Minty, this wine is full bodied and powerfully built, with smooth lush layers of spicy cardamom and forest pine. The fruit is elusive, a blend of brambly berry and cherry that is wrapped within dense oak.

title: Satyre Wines 2016 Amalthea Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Light, fresh and with a bite of citrus at its core, this blends 85% Pinot Noir with 15% Vermentino, the two fermented and aged in French oak, just 10% of it new. The high-toned acidity is nicely integrated around strawberry highlights and a lasting tease of ginger.

title: Naggiar 2015 Mistero Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: This wine has pleasant floral and spice aromas, a velvety-soft texture full of fine-grained tannins and generous black-plum and dark chocolate flavors that verge on sweet. It's full bodied, mouth-filling and delicious.

title: Noceto 2015 Dos Oakies Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: An aroma like ginger cookies and generous fruit and spice flavors make this full-bodied wine hard to resist. Clove, ginger and nutmeg fill the aroma, while black-cherry and black-currant notes coat the palate and linger on the finish. It's a fairly big wine that's delicious and well-balanced.

title: Opolo 2014 Rhapsody Reserve Collection Red (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is lively on the nose in touches of caramel, red cherry, Chinese five spice and crème brûlée. The palate is fruit forward in a candied cherry note, but cut by ginger spice and framed in a chalky, tannic structure.

title: Piña 2014 Buckeye Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Full bodied and rich, this wine is structured and classically aromatic in cedar, pencil and sage brush. The herbal, earthy elements are well developed and seasoned further in toasted oak, black pepper and clove. Cellar through 2034.

title: Ram's Gate 2013 Winemaker's Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: This is a thick, dense and structured wine sourced from the Bismark Vineyard high atop the appellation. Juicy and soft, it has substantial tannins up front that resolve and mellow in the glass. Black currant, earthy sage and dried herb hint at its mountainous provenance and higher elevation.

title: Seven Oxen 2015 Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Dense boysenberry, black plum and dried teriyaki meet with savory notes of soy and teriyaki on the nose of this bottling. Roasted black-plum flavors show on the smoky sip, which is enhanced by roasted lamb and complex rosemary notes. The tannins are still stiff and young, but this will drink well until at least 2025.

title: Trombetta 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: The mother-daughter team behind this wine and the new Petaluma Gap appellation showcases the brawny, boisterous nature of the site, coaxing lush layers of blueberry and black cherry from its thick extracted layers of polished tannin and underlying bolts of acidity.

title: Challen 2015 Zotovich Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Clean lines of Meyer lemon, hazelnut and vanilla are framed by a smoky oak touch on this first ever Chardonnay from this winery. The wood flavors show prominently on the sip, which offers toast with lime preserves and a hint of forest spice.

title: Dowdell 2014 Soda Canyon Cabernet Sauvignon (Atlas Peak)
description: This is a hugely tannic, thick and extracted wine that bears further time in the cellar. Within its powerful frame lie layers of leather, tobacco, black currant and dried herb that show richness and power. Enjoy 2024–2034.

title: Drew 2015 The Ornbaun Syrah (Mendocino Ridge)
description: Serious ripeness and juiciness stand out in this deep-colored medium-bodied wine grown at high elevation. It smells earthy and lightly oaky, and tastes very fruity and generous, flooding the palate with jammy blackberry and black cherry flavors.

title: Lorimar 2014 Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: A promising new project out of Temecula, this bottling, which includes 15% Merlot and 5% Cabernet Sauvignon, offers dense aromas of dried strawberry, red plum, vanilla and baking spice. Cooked cranberry, strawberry and pomegranate flavors show on the sip, which is framed by a chalky texture and lifted by hints of rose and carnation.

title: Malene 2017 Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: This rosé, by the team at Chamisal, is a superstar in the category, offering a little bit of everything for all palate preferences. Perfumed aromas of peach, strawberry and wet gravel combine fruit with minerality, while the palate is framed by a compelling texture. Flavors of red apple and plum sail into the finish.

title: Masthead 2015 Mohr-Fry Ranch Block 433 Sangiovese (Lodi)
description: This wine balances ripe fruit flavors with oak spiciness. Aromas of mahogany and cedar start it off, followed by cherry and black currant flavors that are shaded by chocolate and linger on the finish. It boasts an appetizing and moderately tannic texture, with supportive acidity that keeps it fresh and compelling.

title: Paraduxx 2016 Proprietary White (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of 65% Viognier, 28% Chardonnay and smaller amounts of Rousanne and Marsanne. Aromatic in jasmine, it's medium bodied with fresh, vibrant layers of fresh acidity built around strong flavors of apricot and apple.

title: Peachy Canyon 2015 Clevenger Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Concentrated aromas of red currant, alpine strawberry and carnation show on the nose of this bottling from one of the region's Zinfandel pioneers. The palate follows suit, with a juicy blackberry sorbet flavor and a gravelly minerality that are upheld by firm tannins and solid acidity.

title: Ram's Gate 2015 Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Medium bodied and well-crafted, from a tremendously well-farmed site, this white is crisp and acid-driven with a lightness of being that surprises. Asian pear and crème brûlée both play a part in intriguing the palate.

title: Rococo 2016 Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: From 40-year-old vines comes this semisweet wine by young winemaker Natalie Darr, full of aromas of honey, honeysuckle, chamomile and fortune cookies on the nose. The sweetness is subtle on the palate, as it surrounds a chalky core and grippy texture.

title: Rococo 2016 Sur Lie Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: From 40-year-old vines in Los Alamos comes this crisp, lovely wine, which shows nectarine, Meyer lemon spray and grapefruit peel aromas on the nose. The palate is crisp and grippy, with light stone-fruit flavors alongside crushed white rocks and a slight citrus tang.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Anthony & Dominic Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: A combination of spicy, fruity and savory flavors, as well as a suave texture, make this wine quite impressive. Subtle nutmeg and vanilla aromas lead to fresh pear and white peach flavors, with a touch of minerality for a tasty but not extreme personality.

title: Sojourn 2015 Proprietary Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a nicely put together, complex red, brimming in smooth layers of integrated black fruit, plum, cinnamon and clove. The robust ripeness is well-managed and in check, with a welcome smoky touch to the lengthy finish.

title: Côte West 2016 Gianquinto Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Fermented in stainless steel and then given time in neutral French oak to age, this is a fleshy, oaky white with some heft to it, but never a sense of weightiness. The midpalate is lengthy and well integrated, offering a wealth of pear, melon and fig flavor.

title: Dashe Cellars 2014 Louvau Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is 100% varietal and aged only in older French oak. Restrained, it offers funky compost aromas and a pervasive sense of mineral earthiness. Structured, it's expansive on the palate with supportive, tight-grained tannin and savory elements of cedar and black pepper. It should do well with aging; enjoy best 2020 through 2024.

title: Ivory and Burt 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This polished wine has enticing aromas of vanilla and almond, rich flavors that combine ripe blackberries with mild baking spices, and a creamy, layered feeling on the palate. It's supersmooth and enjoyable.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Zesty, herbal and fresh, this bottling offers oregano, anise seed and marjoram alongside pine needles, juniper and background red fruit on the nose. Woody flavors and more herbs meet with rounded red fruits on the palate, making for a lighter, very quaffable style of Cab.

title: Martin Ray 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Crisp notions of yellow apple and pear meet integrated acidity and balanced oak in this white. With a firmness to the mouthfeel, it has the structure and approachability that will please a broad range of palates.

title: Montemar Wines 2013 Bentrock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A slight bit of age is showing on this bottling, but in pleasing ways for now. Aromas of nutmeg and vanilla decorate the core of red currant, cranberry and hibiscus. The palate is snappy with tart raspberry that sits atop mace, baked earth and dried carnation flavors.

title: Muscardini 2014 Los Chamizal Vineyard Zinfandel (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Fruit-forward and robustly ripe, this vineyard-designate offers dark strawberry flavors and slight complements of lavender, leather, cedar and smoke. It's full bodied, grippy and succulent from start to finish.

title: O'Connell Vineyard 2016 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: A small-production wine from a two-acre site, this offers super earthy, rustic aromas of rose petal, geranium and subtle wild strawberry. This red is a bold full-bodied wine that holds its undeniable ripeness in check.

title: Peter Franus 2014 Mourvèdre (Red Hills)
description: This is a densely flavored and firmly textured wine that will benefit from further aging. It has a deep color, restrained aromas of black pepper, beef and berries and a mouthcoating viscosity due in part to an abundance of fine-grained tannins. Best after 2021.

title: Reynoso 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Alexander Valley)
description: Fermented in a concrete egg, this wine retains and offers plenty of texture. It is a fleshy medium-weight white with the body to stand up to food and a graininess that presents as wet stone minerality. The little bit of oak used in aging gives it a touch of spice.

title: Seven Deadly Zins 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine is full bodied and silky, bringing lots of jammy fruit flavors, generous vanilla and black pepper while remaining very smooth and deceptively light on the palate. Tannins and acidity stay in the background to let a creamy sensation come through.

title: Smith Devereux 2014 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy and smoky, this is made entirely varietal. With a floral backbone, it's pretty and inviting, with plenty of power and full-bodied richness, the flavors defined by red currant, cassis and toasted vanilla oak.

title: Sojourn 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Steely, this wine is intensely briny and floral, with a substantial backdrop of oak. Peach, pear and fleshy bites of apple meet a coastal-laced sense of salty acidity and gritty texture.

title: Steele 2015 Cabernet Franc (Lake County)
description: This is a handsome, lightly spicy and firmly built wine that will enhance the richest braises or roasts on the table. It has subtle mint and white-pepper aromas over snappy red cherry and raspberry flavors that make it a lively sip.

title: Sutro 2014 Warnecke Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a tannic woody wine, blended with 3% Merlot, youthful and boldly concentrated in black cherry and cedar. A sanguine savory undertone of meat and sage rides along quietly within the layers of hearty extraction and power.

title: The Hidden Gallery 2015 Blanc Caché White (Napa Valley)
description: This blends nearly equal parts Marsanne and Viognier with 27% Chardonnay, the grapes from Stagecoach Vineyards. Thick, viscous and honeyed, it offers dense concentrated flavors of marshmallow and baked apricot, finishing smooth and succulent.

title: Tolosa 2016 1772 Stone Lion Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Sultry aromas of dried sage, crumbled bay leaf, rust and rose buds meet with dark hibiscus and mulberry fruit on the nose of this bottling. There is a solid rounded weight to the palate, where ripe cranberry, tart red plum and raspberry meet with dark spice and well primed acidity.

title: Whistler 2014 Picus Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine shows an abundance of earthy stemmy character, remaining elusive in fruit in preference of fierce forest floor and cardamom. Salty air interweaves itself within the medium-bodied structured frame.

title: Potek 2013 Kimsey Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Dried black currant and blueberry meet with crushed black rocks, turned loam and slight caramelization on the nose of this single vineyard expression. The palate lands with ripe blackberry syrup flavors that are lifted by anise, violet and beef char.

title: Reyes 2015 Syrah (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: Hearty and boisterous on the nose, this bottling shows blackberry, savory peppercorns, dried violets and gamy meat on the nose. The grape's typical flavors also show on the palate, where peppercorns and roasted meat mix with black currant, purple flowers and herbal spice. The structure is firm but the mouthfeel soft.

title: Conclusion 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: Oaky and reduced, this wine offers ripe black cherry, cola and subtle spice, with a streak of watermelon-fresh acidity. Medium-bodied, it reveals an underlying earthiness under the toasty oak.

title: District 7 Wines 2015 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Light berry aromas meet with wet gravel and dank forest-floor elements of pine needle and juniper on the nose of this bottling. The earthy forest-moss flavor is prevalent on the sip, leveled by cranberry, pomegranate and smoke elements. It is a decent everyday Pinot.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Territory Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which includes some Petite Sirah and Monastrell, is still quite wound up on the nose, with aromas of slate, wet mud, berries and a bit of baking spice showing shyly. Rounded red-fruit flavors show on the sip as does that muddy clay-driven minerality, all framed by decent acid and tannins.

title: Imagery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: Very fresh and very herbal in flavor, this wine smells like fresh-plucked snap peas, and tastes crisp and citrusy thanks to bright tangy acidity. It is light bodied and feels cleansing on the palate.

title: It Is What It Is! NV White (Lodi)
description: This wine tastes like a late-harvest dessert wine, and a very good one. A deep gold color and assertive nutty aromas start it off with a bang, while flavors of honey, toasted almond and caramel follow on the palate. Its texture is plush and mouthfilling and the finish lingers nicely.

title: La Montagne 2013 Clone 4A Kessler-Haak Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a balsamic fig sauce touch to the nose of this clonal study, along with earthy soil, wild mint, iron and cherry. The flavors are very earthy and somewhat rustic as well, with touches of olive, sandalwood and dark red fruits.

title: Parducci 2015 Small Lot Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This powerful dry wine smells lightly earthy with lots of black cherry. It tastes rather taut and reserved due to very firm tannins and acidity, and has deep blackberry fruit underneath it all. It's very enjoyable in a dry style and will be great with food.

title: Sanctuary 2015 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Sourced from Dutton Ranches and Heintz Vineyard, this wine employs a hearty helping of oak, which supports a core of juicy pear and pineapple. With additional richness from secondary elements of crème brûlée and coconut flakes, it finishes boldly ripe and full bodied.

title: Zoetic Wines 2015 Block 21 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a block within the Hop Kiln Vineyard, this is made from 100% Pommard Clone grapes. Earthy in compost-like rusticity, it's intense in whole cluster-like spiciness, with a soft nose of rose petal and pomegranate.

title: Line 39 2015 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Good balance and moderate concentration help make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. It has pleasant and complex aromas and flavors like red cherry, black tea and a hint of sweet oak that combine very nicely and are supported by good acidity and fine tannins in the texture.

title: Miro 2015 Gaddis Vineyard Old Vines Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: This has a dried-fruit component of plum and cherry—akin to a fruitcake in richness and flavor. Supple on the palate, it finishes in a cloud of brown sugar.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A confectionery nose of cotton candy and honey-baked apple permeates through the rich palate and nose of this wine. Firm in oak, it's fleshy and round with moderate acidity and a finishing touch of coconut shavings.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Properly restrained on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of chalk, honeysuckle and sliced tangerine. There is good zip and freshness to the sip, where lemon rinds and squeezed grapefruit flavors ride an energetic structure.

title: Uphill Vineyards 2013 Jimmy's Dream Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: This wine has good natural-tasting fruit flavors and the appropriate firm tannins, plus medium to full body and a mouth-filling texture. It's a solid well-made choice in a non-oaky style wine.

title: Alyris 2015 The Audition Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This is an intensely thick and concentrated wine, richly ripe in caramelized apple, tropical mango and hugely grippy toasted oak. There's a thread of jasmine that pierces through beautifully on the nose.

title: Avensole 2016 Susan Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Loads of fresh passion fruit kick off the nose of this exuberant bottling, although there are telltale touches of cut grass and green grapefruit pith in the background. There's a pleasing and round freshness to the sip, where ripe stone fruit meets with more sour edges of lime skin and grass.

title: Barton 2016 Holiday See Canyon Vineyard Albariño (San Luis Obispo)
description: Lemon-lime soda concentrate, grapefruit, honey and chamomile make for a broad, somewhat rich nose on this bottling. The sip shows lots of freshness and acidic zip, with waxy, almost bitter flavors of lemon skin, sour pink grapefruit and the lightest hints of wood.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Beeswax Vineyard Picpoul (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine's dainty and delicate nose allows Asian pear, pear blossom and yellow rose petal aromas to show. It's even tighter on the sip, with hints of Pink Lady apple and a slightly sour pear-skin element.

title: Bouchaine 2014 Estate Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a light tart wine, cradled in herbaceousness and well-defined flavors of strawberry, cranberry and rhubarb. High in acidity and subtle in oak, it has a grainy texture piquant in cardamom spice.

title: Brassfield 2014 Pinot Noir (High Valley)
description: This is a good, well-made wine with an appetizing texture, modest but tasty cherry and raspberry flavors and full body. A little cedar and cinnamon help to spice up the aroma, and firm tannins give the mouthfeel good weight.

title: Three Thieves 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: An almost unbelievably good buy, this wine is clean, fresh and appealing. It has a toasted oak nuance in the aroma and expansive fruit and baking spice flavors that fill out the palate. Well-balanced, it displays a ripe red-cherry flavor and a fairly crisp and appetizing texture.

title: Vie Winery 2013 Les Amours Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: A touch of Mourvèdre was added to this blend of the Thompson and nearby White Hawk vineyards, which shows elderberry jelly, jasmine and wisteria on the intensely floral nose. Those florals float across the palate, with lilac and violet decorating the core full of black plum and peppercorn.

title: Z. Alexander Brown 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (North Coast)
description: Fresh herb and melon aromas lead to a fairly rich mouthfeel and a combination of tangy, fruity and mineral-like flavors that add up to a well-rounded and well-made wine.

title: Tercero 2016 Carignane (Santa Barbara County)
description: Deep red fruit meets with cedar and pepper dust on the nose of this bottling, which takes some time to come into its own and will probably be better in a year or two. Plummy flavors are framed by tight and sticky tannins, and lifted by peppercorns and crushed slate.

title: Villa San Juliette 2015 Reserve Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Nutmeg, baked cherry, Chinese five spice and cinnamon show on the nose of this bottling. The palate falls in line, with rounded red fruit, baking spice and a compelling texture.

title: Villa San Juliette 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Very light in the glass, this fresh bottling shows aromas of lime rinds, Anjou pear skins and rainy cement but also riper touches of passion fruit and gooseberry. There is a strong citrus tang to the sip, a ripe apple flavor and a crushed seashell minerality.

title: Klinker Brick 2015 Farráh Syrah (Lodi)
description: Hints of vanilla and milk chocolate dress up this amply fruity, nutty wine as it spreads across the palate smoothly and turns a touch sweet on the finish. It's deliciously rich and easy to sip, and will make a good dessert wine.

title: Jalopy 2014 Happy Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Stewed black plum, licorice and milk chocolate show on the nose of this ripe red blend, packaged in a colorful label. Berry and strawberry flavors meet with dried anise on the palate, which is framed by somewhat sticky tannins.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 ReZerve Tannat (Amador County)
description: This big wine smells very potent and concentrated, and tastes ripe and broad and mouth coating. Full body and a thick but not chewy texture give it a lot of impact on the palate, carrying opulent blackberry and black-cherry flavors through the finish.

title: Las Positas 2014 Estate Tempranillo (Livermore Valley)
description: Vibrant fruit flavors and a very firm tannic texture peg this wine as one to age for a few years. It combines cranberry and cherry aromas with deeper black-cherry and cassis flavors that stay lively due to good acidity.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Dried blueberry, loamy soil, anise and roasting herbs of oregano, thyme and marjoram show on the nose of this bottling. Roasted blackberry flavors show on the slightly sweet-seeming sip, which is made complex by pepper and charred meat.

title: Andis 2014 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: A robust component of smoky aromas and flavors give a large personality to this concentrated, ripe and extremely full-bodied wine. It practically spills over with juicy blackberry and boysenberry flavors, and has a full but sleek mouthfeel backed by mild tannins.

title: Bogle 2016 Phantom Chardonnay (Clarksburg)
description: This giant of a wine has more than enough oaky aromas, a full body and toasty, buttery flavors that coat the palate. The vanilla, lemon zest, butter cream and grilled baguette notes are delicious, so this will be a great choice for people who like an all-out oaky style.

title: Rococo 2017 Alta Colina Vineyard Viognier (Adelaida District)
description: Elegant Asian pear, apple blossoms and wet stone make for a restrained take on Viognier by young winemaker Natalie Darr. It's a tad riper on the palate, with poached pear and hints of tropical fruit, but also a zesty acidity and firm chalky texture throughout.

title: Simple Life 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine from Don Sebastiani & Sons. It has aromas and flavors of cherries, forest floor and cloves, plus a healthy streak of smoky, spicy oak. Moderate tannins give good grip on the palate and there is enough flavor concentration to fill the mouth and linger nicely on the finish.

title: Tangent 2016 Paragon Vineyard Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: This stainless expression shows soft and supple aromas of candied honeydew, cotton candy and bubblegum, yet against a crushed chalk minerality. It's grippy on the palate, offering hints of guava soda and passion fruit, yet with a savory hint of sea salt from the nearby ocean.

title: Chloe 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: This widely available bottling strikes a nice balance between ripeness and restraint, starting with a cherry and strawberry nose. Framed by a taut texture, the palate offers flavors of strawberry juice and red plum cut by pink grapefruit pith, with a hint of baking spice for complexity.

title: Dragonette 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
