description: Pomelo skin, grapefruit zest, chalk and a bit of reductive petrol and smoke aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers tremendous textural grip with tangy lime and underripe Pink Lady apple flavors.

title: Klinker Brick 2017 Albariño (Lodi)
description: This very dry and appetizing wine has a pale color and light aromas of apricot and almond, followed by crisp, fresh and relatively austere flavors that are mouthwatering and refreshing. It's a great antidote to rich and oaky wines.

title: Arthur Cellars 2015 Pride and Joy Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a microscopic production, which shows itself to be medium bodied to full, with soft moderate structure. Dried cherry, raspberry and dried citrus round out the approachable, likable fruit-forwardness of the layered wine.

title: Bellante 2016 Camp 4 Vineyard Mourvèdre (Los Olivos District)
description: Dried strawberry, roasted meat and leather aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers tangy plum-skin flavors with a touch of dried earth.

title: Blair 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: A rather dark shade of mauve-pink in the glass, this rosé is quite ripe with aromas of dark plum, rose petal and crushed slate. The palate is quite grippy with somewhat clunky tannins and is full bodied in style, showing strong flavors of dark red fruit, vanilla and baking spice.

title: Paris Valley Road 2017 Chardonnay (California)
description: Butter, butterscotch and baking spice aromas explode from the glass and lead to extremely rich, butter and caramel flavors in this unapologetic full-bodied wine. It has a soft creamy texture that coats the palate and little acidity to counter it.

title: Pull 2013 CdR Red (Paso Robles)
description: Thyme, pepper, asphalt and sweet cherry-liqueur aromas show on the nose of this blend of 37% Petite Sirah, 34% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 9% Viognier. Ripe mulberry and dark plummy flavors meet with purple flowers on the candied palate.

title: River Road 2016 Double Oaked Chardonnay (California)
description: This full-bodied wine matches fruitiness with oakiness in equal measure, wrapping luscious pear-syrup flavors in a blanket of butter and vanilla.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Jammin Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Extremely rich aromas of prune and spice cake show on the very extracted nose of this bottling. Thick and gooey flavors of black-currant and blueberry syrup arise on the sip, but there is decent acidity to cut through the ripeness. The finish is laced with vanilla and caramel.

title: Duckhorn 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 18% Sémillon, this is a lush wine richly discreet in guava, melon and fig, with moderate acidity holding it together with grace and concentration. A note of oak boosts the tropical profile.

title: Mason Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Grassy in pea shoots, this is an easygoing, quaffable white with buzzy acidity and a lasting taste of fig and melon.

title: Midnight 2015 Moonbeam Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Earthy on the nose, this bottling shows exotic red-plum aromas as well as hints of sagebrush. Turned earth, plum skins, pepper and savory roasted-meat flavors arise on the palate.

title: Proulx 2016 Willow Creek Farm Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Light in both color and aroma, this bottling offers faint scents of framboise, plum and licorice. The palate is full of tart red-plum-skin flavors, and would make a nice table wine for midweek dining.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a juicy, powerful red, tangy and tart in red currant and cranberry, with a huge presence of grippy tannin.

title: Take Me With You 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Pretty in pink and orange colors, this is a thick, rich and rounded wine, generously fruity in dark cherry and strawberry preserves. The acidity is measured and happy to play a background role.

title: Criss Cross 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: This wine slathers butter and vanilla aromas together with overripe pear and pineapple flavors for an assertive profile. It feels full bodied, tastes slightly sweet and has a cushy soft texture.

title: Geyser Peak 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Redolent of Anjou pear and vanilla in the aroma, this full-bodied wine floods the palate with ripe and creamy flavors and a lush texture that's soft on acidity. On the midpalate and finish a tinge of sweetness rounds it out, possibly from the 10% of Viognier that was blended in.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2016 Territory Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling, which includes 23% Petite Sirah, offers very ripe aromas of tangy black plum, black pepper, wild mint and chocolate on the nose. The palate is a bit overextracted and thick with flavors of dried black currant, raisin and a touch of prune, with savory smoked meat flavors as well.

title: Martin Ranch 2016 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Cedar and smoke aromas decorate the tangy black-plum aromas on the nose of this bottling. Tons of wood spice also shows on the palate, including cedar, redwood and pine, set against the dark-red-fruit backdrop.

title: Sevtap 2016 Chenin Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Interesting aromas of dried pear, mango, honeydew rind and cherimoya show on the nose of this bottling. There is tightness and freshness to the sip, but the acidity fades quickly as flavors of lemon peel and dried apple arise.

title: Sobon Estate 2015 Home Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: Smoky oaky aromas and flavors blanket the cherry and plum notes in this medium-bodied bold-tasting wine. The strong charred-barrel character is obvious but this wine will be enjoyable for most people.

title: Heavyweight 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Very concentrated and fruity, this medium-bodied wine practically explodes with black-cherry aromas and bright berry flavors. It has very little tannin, which is unusual for the varietal.

title: Madrigal 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth, unfussy and moderate in structure, this is a ripe fruit-forward wine is robust in black-cherry and mocha flavors.

title: Chiron Wines 2015 Unfamiliar Truth Grenache (Napa Valley)
description: Earthy in wild strawberry and blueberry, this intense, ripe and fruity wine is nonetheless balanced in bright lifted acidity that persists and refreshes. Tightly wound, the texture is layered and complex.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2017 Gewürztraminer (Central Coast)
description: Orange blossom, lime pith, candied citrus and a touch of flint show on the focused nose of this wine. It's quite racy and grippy on the sip, where orange zest and julienned Pink Lady apple flavors dominate.

title: Heitz 2017 Grignolino Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: Made entirely from this rare Italian variety, this is a consistently good, interesting and dry offering, juicy in pomegranate, rhubarb and orange zest, with a tangy vibrancy in the glass. There are hints of white pepper and dried herb that add intrigue.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 Apex Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Freshly smashed red berries meet with crushed rose petals and a touch of minty herb on the nose of this blend of 44% Malbec, 22% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Merlot and 12% Cabernet Franc. The ripeness is well balanced on the palate, which is medium weight and redolent with flavors of red currant, blueberry, earthy soil and a pinch of herbs.

title: Kelly Fleming 2014 Big Pour Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A proprietary blend of 81% Cabernet Sauvignon with 11% Malbec and 8% Syrah, this is a big bold wine, full of flavor. Green and black olive play against juicy blackberry and mocha, with lingering hints of cedar and tobacco.

title: Martinelli 2016 Bella Vigna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick and concentrated in blueberry and black cherry jam, this is a robustly ripe, powerfully built wine, full of intensity. Toasted oak and threads of black tea and black pepper add savory complexity to the fruit.

title: Midnight 2014 Titan Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Rounded and layered on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of vanilla, black cherry and licorice. It hits the palate with a soft mouthfeel before tannins show a bit of firmness toward the finish, with more baked black-cherry flavors but also layers of white sage and dill.

title: Rideau 2016 Garey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite light and yet complex on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of wild strawberry, crushed slate and Sichuan peppercorn. It's clean on the palate, showing more dark strawberry as well as tighter plum fruits, turned soil and wet slate flavors.

title: Rideau 2016 The Englishmen Sangiovese (Los Olivos District)
description: Candied cranberry and pomegranate juice meet with a hint of dark soil on the nose of this bottling from Camp 4 Vineyard, proving playful but also serious in density. Black plum and açaí rise on the tip of the sip, then the flavors dive into thicker, richer plum paste, chocolate and oregano, surrounded by simmering acidity.

title: Robert Renzoni 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Temecula Valley)
description: Quite light in the glass, this bottling from the Brunello clone is a great showing of delicacy and balance for a Temecula red wine, starting with tempting aromas of strawberry and hickory smoke. That savory-tinged red-fruit character carries to the palate, which is tense in texture, lifted by peppery spice.

title: Silver 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Freshly smashed berries, thyme, slate, cedar and milk chocolate show on the nose of this bottling, which includes 5% Sangiovese and 3% Cabernet Franc. There is lots of acidic zip to the sip, where cedar and tobacco leaf flavors meet with dark chocolate and rich dark fruit.

title: Tenshen 2016 Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark yet joyous on the nose, this blend shows blackberry, black plum, purple flower and uncracked peppercorn on the nose. There's a soft entry to the palate, where dark fruit and roasted meat flavors are framed by fresh acidity and polished tannins.

title: The Larsen Projekt 2017 Grenache Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Fruity, fleshy and fulfilling, this tiny-production wine showcases the variety in a refreshing way, offering bright focused acidity around bold flavors of strawberry, peach and stone.

title: Three Saints 2013 Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This entry-level bottling by the Dierberg team is a great deal—one of the few Central Coast Pinot Noirs under $25 that tastes right. Herbal aromas of marjoram, thyme, bay leaf and juniper float atop red-cherry scents. The palate adds soft pomegranate and eucalyptus to the equation.

title: VGS Chateau Potelle 2014 Wildcat Mountain Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Laurel bay and mint provide an appellation-specific tease to this powerful wine, full of structure, ripeness and texture that lingers in black cherry and currant. White pepper and chocolate mocha provide savory and sweet elements that balance each other before a lengthy finish of clove.

title: Wilson Family 2015 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Dense aromas of black currant, vanilla and fudge show on the nose of this bottling from a family estate in the Templeton Gap district. Lush on the palate, yet with firm, chalky tannins and steady acidity, it offers lavish flavors of dark fruit and baking spice.

title: Zinke 2015 Syrah (Central Coast)
description: This is done in a very ripe and jammy style, sure to please those seeking a big red wine. Blackberry jam, smoked meat, Concord grape and purple flowers show on the nose while the rounded palate offers caramelized black currant, vanilla and a touch of fudge.

title: Al Lago 2015 Aria Syrah (California)
description: From grapes grown in the Santa Rosa Valley of Ventura County, this wine, made by Paso Robles vintner Guillaume Fabre, includes 5% Cabernet Sauvignon and shows rich aromas of black cherry, black plum, roasted pork and leather. It's hearty on the palate, like roasted beef in elderberry sauce with a hint of tar, and opens up toward richer fruit flavors with time.

title: Andrew Murray 2015 Esperance Curtis Vineyard Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Blackberry and boysenberry meet with strong lilac and wisteria aromas on the nose of this blend of 65% Grenache, 20% Mourvèdre and 15% Syrah. The palate is clean and crisp with a firm structure, offering flavors of black raspberry, black plum and a hint of tarragon.

title: Arista 2015 Mononi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine presents as reduced slightly before unleashing subtle hints of rose petal and lavender. Soft, sultry and brimming in wild strawberry and cherry, it's powerfully ripe and cradled in robust oak.

title: Ilaria 2014 Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This wine exhibits hearty oak and ripe black cherry, cranberry and plum. Blended with 15% Cabernet Sauvignon, its grapes from Coombsville primarily, it's high-strung in supportive acidity and dried herb and tobacco.

title: August Briggs 2014 Charbono (Calistoga)
description: This is a soft, juicy and approachable wine, in full grasp of grapey cherry flavors that veer overtly fruity. Medium bodied, it's a nice choice for the table, indoors or out.

title: Fatty Pope 2015 Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark strawberry, black plum, fennel pollen, tarragon and a hint of caramel show on the nose of the solid second vintage for this memorably labeled bottle. Ripe purple fruit meets with minty spices on the palate, where the richness is cut by directed acidity.

title: French Bar 2015 Petite Sirah (California)
description: This is a very good, moderate rendering of the varietal, blending good blackberry aromas with lightly smoky peppery flavors and medium to full body. It's firmly tannic and will taste great with juicy meats and indulgent cheesy pastas.

title: It Is What It Is! NV Red (Lodi)
description: This is a pretty concentrated fruit-driven wine that shows focused red and black-cherry flavors and an elegant texture. It sips very smoothly, feels light to medium bodied and has a fresh fruity finish.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2016 Barrel Select Chardonnay (Lake County)
description: This dramatic, hefty wine has strong oaky, spicy aromas, a rich and honeyed fruit flavor and a texture that's almost thick, making it cling to the sides of the mouth. A touch of sweetness registers on the finish.

title: Pali 2016 Bluffs Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This youthful wine pulls from several vineyards across the appellation, offering strong floral aromas of rose, geranium and lavender. Sizable tannins add to a feeling of full-bodied richness, highlighted in black tea, forest and clove.

title: Peltier 2015 Triomphe Estate Grown Red (Lodi)
description: Aromas of cocoa and maple syrup lead to lush, lightly sweet fruit flavors that have plenty of oak spice to dress them up. This wine tastes very ripe and full bodied, oozing with jammy flavors but it also has enough of a tannic backbone to keep it fresh on the palate.

title: Brander 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Los Olivos District)
description: Broad black cherry aromas meet with soft touches of rosewater, star anise and hibiscus on this rather light bottling. It's very fresh on the palate, with lively pomegranate and berry flavors, though not much of the dark spice or tannic depth expected of the grape.

title: Concannon 2014 Clone 7 Cabernet Sauvignon (Chalk Hill)
description: Tannic and oaky, this is a big, powerful wine with a lot of extraction and density to it. Intense notions of blackberry, black licorice and cedar meet accents of cigar box and pencil, finishing with a robust richness.

title: Concannon 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Spring Mountain District)
description: Leathery oak dominates in this medium-bodied wine from the mountain appellation. Green, dried herb emphasizes its varietal character, as thick tannins wrap tightly on the palate.

title: Donkey & Goat 2015 The Bear Red (El Dorado)
description: This is an unusual red that is light in color and extract and has a good grippy texture to carry the light spice, raspberry and earth flavors. It's nicely balanced and makes a refreshing change of pace from bigger bolder wines.

title: Eberle 2015 Vineyard Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Fresh aromas of dark strawberry, red plums, dark chocolate and brown spices show on the nose of this bottling by the legendary Gary Eberle. Crisp and buoyant purple fruits pop on the palate, set against a backdrop of dried lilacs and chalky tannins.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Dos Ninas Vineyard Syrah (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Deep and dark black currant, black plum, prune, dried sage and licorice spice show on the nose of this bottling. The dark dried fruit meets with a minty lift on the palate, proving relatively light in texture but with a strong, somewhat leathery tannic backbone.

title: Rock View 2015 Reserve Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: There's a decent serving of thyme and sagebrush on the nose of this affordable bottling alongside the piquant raspberry and cranberry fruit, with a touch of wet earth in the background. The decently weighted palate shows cranberry and more dried herbs, gaining complexity toward the finish.

title: Heffernan 2012 VV Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Sanguine and bitter in dried herb, this is a thick dense wine, explosive on the palate in juicy black cherry and berry. The finish is a tad harsh in tannin.

title: IG 2015 Petite Sirah (Red Hills)
description: This is a giant of a wine, from the heady, dried-fruit aromas to the flavors soaked in espresso and blackberry syrup to the thick blanket of tannin that wraps it all up. It is very full bodied, feels warm on the palate and leaves an astringent aftertaste.

title: Peju 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in black cherry and smoky oak, this is a robust, richly ripe red, meaty and brawny in leather and blackberry jam.

title: Philippe-Lorraine 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a value wine, thick in resolved tannin and a density of tart cassis and red and black currant. Dried herb and earthy graphite elements give it varietal character and a brightness against the weight.

title: Van Ruiten 2016 Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Bold and oaky, this full-bodied wine layers wood smoke and butter aromas over baked pear and almond flavors, while hints of new oak run through it. The wine has a mouth-coating texture and tastes warm and spicy on the finish.

title: Ledson 2013 Stagecoach Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A bold, bombastic, 100% varietal wine made from mountain fruit, this red was aged 30 months in all French oak, 52% of it new. It imparts burly notions of oak and tannin alongside graphite, cedar and sage highlights. Very ripe, it expands on the palate in blackberry and black pepper, never letting go of its power.

title: Oro Bello 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Like a pear tart, this wine from a new small producer is full of baking spices, butter and fruit from the first whiff to the lingering, rich finish. While dry, it's full bodied, very lush and viscous in texture, and the yummy flavors are bold without going to extremes.

title: Korbel NV Blanc de Noirs Sparkling (California)
description: Elegant and plush, this wine is both light and rich at the same time, as it combines a fine mousse of bubbles with good fruit and spice flavors and a creamy texture. Everything is well-blended and harmonious, as well as concentrated enough to have a long and lightly ripe finish.

title: Shooting Star 2015 Zinfandel (Mendocino County)
description: Very ripe, Port-like flavors and a big but soft presence on the palate give a bold personality to this full-bodied wine. It's deep and concentrated in berry and raisin flavors that are layered and delicious, squeezing dark chocolate and mint between them.

title: Turnbull 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Juicy, round and silky, this is an approachable, relatively light-bodied wine that doesn't shirk on underlying brawn. Moderate structure maintains a fresh, focused likability as slightly spicy oak hits hardest and most pleasantly on the finish.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine opens with a confectionery hint of marshmallow and caramel before showing its more steely underbelly of fresh, focused acidity. Funky apple, nutmeg and lemongrass figure into the medium-bodied mix, a complement of savory and fruit.

title: Marimar Estate 2016 Acero Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This unoaked wine always impresses, offering sweetly floral tones on the nose and a wealth of tropical mango and pineapple on the palate. Steely, with some bristling citrus-driven acidity, it's refreshing and focused, with hints of lemongrass.

title: Meeker 2014 Hoskins Ranch Grenache (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A rare 100% varietal offering, this works well to showcase dusty, pronounced tannin around a richness of baked cherry and strawberry seasoned in white pepper and orange. Tart acidity works alongside floral aromatics of cherry blossom and violet.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Coopersmith Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Rose, hibiscus and pistachio mark the aromatic profile of this hearty, well-made wine, dipping into juicy, succulent and bright layers of blueberry and black cherry. A round rich tannin structure provides a welcome fleshiness, with a backbone of acidity.

title: Omen 2015 Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors push through a firm and tannic texture in this medium to full-bodied wine from a new brand and a French-born winemaker. It's distinctively lean in mouthfeel due to substantive tannin content, but in the aromas and on the finish, an abundance of berries and dark spices comes through.

title: Ousterhout 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is made in a light nuanced style, and is somewhat shy at first on the nose. Perfumed rose eventually comes through to accent welcoming, bright flavors of orange and red cherry. The oak is tight-grained and supportive.

title: Patland 2014 Proprietary Red (Napa Valley)
description: A hearty blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Malbec and Syrah, given plenty of time in new French oak, this wine is a mix of crayon wax, red and black currant and firm, grasping tannin structure. Complex, it adds secondary characteristics of black cherry and lightly oaked spice as it opens in the glass, full bodied all along.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Inspiration Red (Paso Robles)
description: Elegant aromas of violet and lilac meet with an intense and pure expression of boysenberry jam on the nose of this blend of 45% Mourvèdre, 34% Syrah and 21% Grenache. The palate is framed by a strong tannic backbone and a plush mouthfeel that carries flavors of black plum, boysenberry and, on the finish, a flash of vanilla.

title: Pono 2014 Mana Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A small-production wine from a brand-new producer, this is blended with 10% Merlot and 2% Petit Verdot. Simply structured with grace and restrained tannin, it's highlighted in black cherry, vanilla and a hearty streak of cinnamon, presenting full-bodied power from an elegant perspective.

title: Sanguis 2014 Acacia Thorns Red (Central Coast)
description: This is a dense bottling that combines Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot, so dense that the brooding nature hides many of the aromas and flavors. But patience eventually rewards with black-plum skins, tree bark and earth on the nose, and black currant and chalky tannins on the palate.

title: Sean Minor 2015 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A rose petal aroma starts things off in this wine, while the palate provides a delicate rendering of rhubarb, strawberry and forest floor flavors, buoyed by a gravelly texture and balanced ripeness.

title: Silverpoint Cellars 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Don Van Staaveren is the winemaker of this well-crafted wine, sourced from Rodger's Creek Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap area. Opulent on the nose, it follows up in richness and robust flavors of toasted oak and apple, finishing awash in butterscotch.

title: The Farm Winery 2014 Touchy-Feely Grenache-Syrah (Adelaida District)
description: Candied strawberry fruit meets with the lightest hint of sage on the nose of this bottling, which includes 18% Syrah. Rounded red fruits show on the sip with a pinch of dried garden herbs, set against a structure that's well balanced between acidity and tannins.

title: Tortoise Creek 2016 Mission Grove Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine might be the best value available in California Pinot Noir. It has great varietal character in the aroma and follows through with tempting spice, red fruit and savory nuances on the palate. Black tea, red cherry and clove waft from the glass while cherry and cranberry spread across the palate, braced by moderate tannins and fresh acidity. It's a beautifully balanced medium-bodied wine.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Vista Verde Vineyard Late Harvest Gewürztraminer (San Benito County)
description: Orange blossom, tangerine souffle, light honey and gin-like botanical aromas show on the nose. The palate's concentrated sweetness combines orange zest with lemon cream, making for a nicely complex after-dinner sip.

title: Burt Street Cellars 2014 Herman Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine offers a deep inviting nose of blackberry cobbler, lavender and violet, the fruit dense and concentrated. There's a lift of freshness on the finish that keeps it alive and balanced in the glass.

title: Davies 2016 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From fruit grown at both Cuvaison and Hyde vineyards, this is a celebration of the appellation, with pleasing, earthy cardamom and a touch of mint. Dark cherry, vanilla and orange flavors layer around moderate oak and acidity, forming a fruit-friendly complex whole.

title: McKahn 2016 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Aromas of black pepper and wood smoke meld with rich, concentrated and jammy fruit flavors in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and impressive wine. Aged in 50% new barrels from France and Hungary, It shows plenty of spicy, almost sweet oak character to offset the dense flavors and big structure. Best after 2023.

title: Midnight 2014 Mare Nectaris Reserve Red (Paso Robles)
description: Candied violets, black currant candy, lilac and even a hint of jasmine show on the floral nose of this blend of 35% Cabernet Sauvignon, 35% Merlot, 17% Petit Verdot, 8% Malbec and 5% Cabernet Franc. Bright flavors of dark-purple fruit are leveled by a chalky mouthfeel, solid structure and ample acid.

title: Novy 2015 G-S-M (Sonoma Valley)
description: This blends 36% Syrah, 23% Mourvèdre, 22% Viognier and 19% Grenache. A beautiful perfume of violet opens the proceedings, followed by white pepper, garrigue, lavender and meat. A high-toned midpalate tames the wine's richer, riper leanings that takes on a robust taste of strawberry leather before pepper comes back to dot the finish.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Royal Punishers Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: Brown sugar, red berry, lavender and a touch of heat mark this velvety thick and smoothly tannic wine, a hearty showcase of the variety. Complex and interwoven in oak, it finishes in bits of black and white pepper.

title: Sketchbook 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This is a delicious and substantial wine that emphasizes subtlety and structure, while slowly revealing fruity, spicy and savory elements with each sip. It has reserved pear and almond aromas that carry to a palate accented by ripe peach, vanilla and cream. The texture is viscous and holds everything together.

title: Talisman 2014 Adastra Vineyard Méthode Ancienne Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Exotic in aroma and grainy in texture, this tiny-production wine excites in its thick layers of crisp and crunchy tang of fruit, which spans from pomegranate to wild strawberry to boysenberry. Layers of cola add a richness that trails on the finish.

title: Viaggio 2014 The President Merlot (Lodi)
description: Touches of dried herbs and black olives in the aromas and flavors give an authentic appeal to this full-flavored and full-bodied wine. A hint of spicy oak enhances the experience but doesn't overwhelm the fruity, savory aspects that are so enjoyable.

title: Niner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: This bottling from the extremely coastal Jespersen Ranch shows what a truly cool climate can do for Sauvignon Blanc. It's tightly woven but approachable on the nose, with aromas of honeydew, kiwi and wet stone. The palate is incredibly zippy, offering chalky flavors of apple and pear. A lime rind tartness holds the finish.

title: Acumen 2014 Peak Attelas Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From an estate-grown site that's rocky and sheltered from high heat, this wine, blended with 4% Malbec, retains plenty of firm acidity alongside big-boned tannins and balanced weight. Coffee and cassis complement a wealth of dark cherry, blueberry and plum flavors.

title: Allan Hancock 2016 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark berry and cherry fruits meet with turned earth, oak smoke and wet rocks on the intriguing nose of this bottling from the Santa Maria community college winery. Boysenberry and black-raspberry flavors show on the sip alongside shaved cocoa and soil flavors, the overall richness cut smartly by acid.

title: Balletto 2016 BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Bright and balanced, this is from a relatively warm site and is full, fleshy and meaty in style. Savory black tea and cardamom season a core of red cassis, black cherry and strawberry, with a soft, velvety texture behind the fruit.
designation: BCD Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled

title: Elyse 2015 York Creek Vineyard Petite Sirah (Spring Mountain District)
description: Huge in tannin structure, this mountain-grown wine includes 7% Carignan and 2% Zinfandel. Baked bread, red fruit, leather and sizable brawn characterize its youthfulness; enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Gainey 2017 Limited Selection Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Clean, crisp and reminiscent of springtime on the nose, this bottling shows aromas of lime blossom, wet cement, scratched pomelo skin and cut grass. The palate is extremely energetic and makes the mouth tingle while delivering flavors of lemongrass and lime.

title: Kessler-Haak 2015 Ohana Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: A tad lighter in style than the winery's richer bottlings, this fresh wine shows pomegranate, dried roses and a hint of game on the nose. Freshly squeezed black-raspberry and sour cherry flavors ride a sharp acidity into the finish.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2014 Private Reserve Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Temecula Valley)
description: Roasted black currants, charred meats, purple flowers, milk chocolate and a hint of teriyaki show on the nose of this layered and complex bottling from vintner Don Lorenzi. There is a strong structure to the palate, where anise and wild herbs show against a core of black plum pudding.

title: Meiomi 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Earthy and reserved at first on the nose, this new reserve bottling from the popular label offers rhubarb pie, turned earth and purple flower potpourri on the nose. Ripe fruit flavors of cranberry and raspberry show on the palate, as do turned earth and crushed slate flavors—a more elegant step up from the original bottling.

title: Ramey 2014 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the cooler edge of the Petaluma Gap, this is coharvested and cofermented with 10% Viognier, which gives it a lift on the midpalate. Smoky char, baked raspberry, leather and pepper highlight a complex, thickly concentrated experience of powerful grace and silky texture.

title: Riverbench 2015 Cork Jumper Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Hay yellow in the glass, this vibrant bubbly, made from Chardonnay, offers aromas of toast and shaved nectarine on the nose. The palate is loaded with lemon flavors, proving tangy, tart and pleasantly sour as it rides across the creamy mousse.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Founding Farmers Zinfandel (St. Helena)
description: Earthy and brimming in crisp red fruit, this is a floral, somewhat ethereal wine that's powerfully built in ripe plum and licorice that finishes in grippy tannin.

title: St. Supéry 2014 Dollarhide Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is high-toned in dried herb and currant, with a whisper of cedar and soy. The texture is leathery and chalky in tannin.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Ancient Vine Crow Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Black olive, truffle and brown sugar underlie this opulently ripe wine, mild in structure and big in tannin. Cherry and berry flavor add to its lush voluptuous nature.

title: Vermeil 2015 1908 Block Luvisi Vineyard Zinfandel (Calistoga)
description: This is an intensely tannic wine from an historic site, richly layered in brown sugar, molasses and cinnamon. The bolder flavors are in contrast to herbal elements of black pepper, clove and cedar.

title: Al 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: This canned wine offers a convenient means of enjoying crisp white wine, starting with aromas of dried hay, steel and lime leaf. The palate offers sour apple, tart limes and very strong cut-grass flavors.

title: Angry Bunch 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a generous and fruity wine with attractive black-pepper and wood-smoke accents that add complexity to the plummy, raspberry-like fruit qualities. It's full bodied but smooth and easy to sip.

title: Butternut 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Nicely fruity and full in mouthfeel, this appealing wine offers ripe black-cherry and raspberry aromas, almost-sweet cherry flavors and a smooth, lightly gripping texture.

title: Cebada 2014 Cuvée Pinot Noir (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: A touch sour on the nose, this bottling offers earthy yet fruit-punch-like aromas of pomegranate and sage. The body is light on the palate and framed in a chalky texture, offering tangy red fruit and a slightly sour finish.

title: Debts and Lessons 2017 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Monterey County)
description: Quite light in color, nearly water in appearance, this off-dry Riesling is a very pleasant, delicately sweet experience. Aromas of honeysuckle, lychee, canned pears and white rocks leads into a palate that blends sweet apple with chalky minerality and pithy tension.

title: Doren 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this 100% varietal wine is brawny in smoke, tar and espresso. Its fruit components are subtle and nuanced, a light mingling of cherry vanilla and red currant.

title: Easton 2017 Lot 1852 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This is a smooth relaxed wine that's easy to sip and enjoy without having to fight high alcohol or tight tannins. It has a relatively light color, plenty of plum and sour-cherry flavors and medium to full body.

title: Eberle 2016 Eberle Estate Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A bit shy in aromas at first, this bottling slowly opens up toward blackberry and caramel scents with patience. The palate is densely structured, putting texture at the forefront, with flavors of black plum and pepper arising toward the finish.

title: Hawley 2016 Cabernet Franc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Strong in red fruit and clove and light in tannin and oak, this is a robust wine that remains soft on the palate.

title: Josh Cellars 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Fleshy and lush in baked apple, pear and fig, this wine has a balanced backbone of acidity that gives it a freshness around the fruit. It seriously overdelivers on price.

title: Maddalena 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Loads of fresh and tropical aromas of pineapple, orange, pear and a hint of guava show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. The palate is also a very showy style of Chardonnay, with solid acid and structure delivering flavors of guava, tuberose, mango and more pineapple.

title: Mietz 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With 10% Merlot, this wine is brawny in baked and dried flavors of blueberry and cherry, its texture soft and rounded with a moderate amount of richness. There's both tension and balance in its acidity.

title: Napa Cellars 2016 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal and grippy, this medium-bodied wine offers tones of red plum, dried herb and a touch of graphite. It has a lasting streak of freshness that supports the fruit.

title: Pedroncelli 2016 Bushnell Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an intensely jammy, rich, 100% varietal wine that's rich and thick with elements of barbecue, grilled meat and Italian deli. It finishes in vanilla oak and black pepper.

title: Vokel 2016 Starscape Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a crisp, lemony and green apple-laden white with moderate oak and a bright streak of acidity that keeps it balanced and refreshing.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Mourvèdre (Amador County)
description: This effusively fruity wine has a dazzling cherry-candy character that pervades the aromas and flavors, making it taste almost sweet. It's one of the purest, fruitiest California Mourvèdres available—easy to sip, low in tannins and medium in body.

title: Truett Hurst 2016 The One Armed Man Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: A Zin-based blend that offers the variety's friendly personality, this has seasonings of smoked oak and leather with maximum-level ripeness that presents as syrupy and sweet. Dark chocolate, blackberry jam and vanilla all figure in.

title: Anonymous 2015 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Merlot and Cabernet Sauvignon work well together in this blend, which also contains Petite Sirah, Malbec and Zinfandel. Reduced and concentrated, there's a moderate richness and rounded quality to the palate, dotted in red plum and cinnamon.

title: Butternut 2017 Rosé (Central Coast)
description: A rusty shade of pink in the glass, this bottling starts with slightly sour aromas of raspberry, strawberry and iron. The palate is a little muddy with dried plum and rusty earth flavors.

title: Côte West 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky cherry, strawberry and vanilla combine to provide a fruity red with moderate structure and understated ripeness in this vineyard-designate.

title: Crosby Roamann 2014 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: A skin-fermented, 100% Sauvignon Blanc, this wine is dark and brooding with a slightly oxidative character that won't appeal to everybody. Concentrated and oaky, it tastes of honey and baked apple with a viscosity that lingers.

title: McManis 2017 Chardonnay (River Junction)
description: Ripe tasting, rounded and rather soft in feel, this medium-bodied wine oozes pear, butter and butterscotch flavors for a rich, mouthcoating effect. The McManis family makes it from a vineyard that is certified sustainable.

title: Truett Hurst 2016 Inconspicuous Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Syrupy black fruit is liqueur-like in consistency and richness, the wine dusty in texture and wrap-around tannin. It has a burly ripeness that dominates in all aspects.

title: Knights Bridge 2016 East Block Chardonnay (Knights Valley)
description: This wine has pretty floral elements that come to fore ahead of a heavier, riper style that's viscous and plush on the palate. Golden-apple flavors take on a baked note, accompanied by pineapple and crème brûlée.

title: Leese-Fitch 2016 Merlot (California)
description: A charred wood aroma and toasted bread flavors stand out in this medium-bodied oaky-flavored wine, masking much of the fruit flavor that might lie beneath.

title: Pestoni Family 2016 1892 Field Blend Red (Lake County)
description: An aroma of freshly sawn oak boards leads to equally spicy and bold flavors that tamp down the moderate plum flavors underneath. The wine is full bodied, moderately tannic and definitely full of oaky spiciness.

title: Pezzi King 2017 Angela's Estate Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Made from a saignée of Zinfandel, this offers a briary berry-filled character that tastes somewhat diluted on the midpalate. The wine is easygoing and moderate in acidity, going for power over grace.

title: Prospect 772 2017 Baby Doll Rosé (California)
description: Almost dark enough in color to be a red wine, this rosé is the antithesis of the pale Provençal-style wines that are in vogue. It shows effusive floral and raspberry aromas, and plum-skin and watermelon flavors on a medium-bodied frame.

title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2016 ReZerve Barbera (Amador County)
description: A strong earthy meaty aroma is followed by herb, tomato and green-olive flavors in this medium-bodied wine. It has a distinct personality that relies on savory characters and makes a fun change of pace.

title: ZD 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is broadly brawny in big ripe flavors of black fruit and molasses with a tightly wound tannins.

title: Bell 2016 The Scoundrel Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (California)
description: This sweet-seeming medium-bodied wine blends vanilla aromas with milk chocolate and cherry flavors and a soft texture for a simple and soothing character.

title: Educated Guess 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: This is a 100% whole-cluster pressed wine that is high-toned in flavors of lemon peel and grapefruit. The finish is quick and unfussy.

title: Harken 2017 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (California)
description: Vivid toasted-oak aromas and flavors dominate this full-bodied mouth-filling wine. Along with a charred-wood aroma come buttery butterscotchy flavors from a complete malolactic fermentation and a pear nectar component that provides the fruity side.

title: Navarro 2016 Navarrouge Red (Mendocino)
description: This good, easy-drinking wine gives a sweet first impression and builds fruity and savory notes through the flavors and finish. It adds chocolaty accents to herbal ones like bay leaf and fruity ones like black plum.

title: Paraduxx 2015 Pintail Red (Napa Valley)
description: Thick tannins take on a leathery quality in this blend of 64% Zinfandel and 36% Cabernet Sauvignon, the Zin from high atop Howell Mountain. Tart acidity underlies the leather, black currant and dried herb.

title: Saddleback Cellars 2016 Barrel Fermented Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a strong candied flavor of sugarcane and baked pineapple, allowing its ripeness and barrel-fermentation to speak loudly and with conviction.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Vintage Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 6% Petit Verdot, this is a hearty and succulent wine, brimming in blackberry and tobacco. It is marked by dry substantial tannins that mellow slowly on the finish.

title: City Winery Chicago 2015 The Wine That Does Not Speak Its Name Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Oaky sage, pencil and dried herb provide an earthy context around which smooth, rounded and approachable texture is built. The wine moderately complex and medium bodied, blended with 4% Merlot.
designation: The Wine That Does Not Speak Its Name

title: Europa Village NV Annabel Brut Sparkling (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean aromas of Asian pear, light honeysuckle, fresh lemon and a bit of chalk show on the light and delicate nose of this bottling. Clean and frothy bubbles present the tang of green citrus and green apples on the palate, which is mellow, soft and very enjoyable.

title: Foursight 2016 Charles Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Anderson Valley)
description: This cheery wine has a lot of vibrant fruit flavors including lemon, grapefruit and crisp apple that refresh the palate, along with light spice notes of vanilla and ginger and perhaps a touch of sweetness.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2013 Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated and ripe black-currant aromas meet with brown sugar on the intense nose of this bottling. Softer blueberry flavors show on the fruity, ripe sip, framed by grippy tannins.

title: Joullian 2016 Roger Rose Vineyard Chardonnay (Arroyo Seco)
description: Tropical fruit aromas of mango, honeysuckle, canned pear and coconut show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Guava and creamed-pear flavors show on the sip alongside coconut milk, offering a clean, fresh and strongly tropical style.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2016 Grand Reserve Chardonnay (Santa Barbara-Monterey)
description: Meyer lemon, hazelnut and Gravenstein apple aromas show on the clean and restrained nose of this Chardonnay that comes from Santa Barbara and Monterey counties. Rounded peach blossom, Bartlett pear and more roasted nuts appear on the tightly wound sip.

title: Left Bend 2014 Muns Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Potpourri, ripe strawberries and a touch of cedar show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate offers baked berries, sandalwood and dried melons, and the texture is a little bit flat.

title: Lorimar 2014 Zinfandel (California)
description: Candied red fruit, mace and nutmeg show on the familiar nose of this bottling, which includes 20% Petite Sirah. It's quite ripe and seemingly sweet on the palate, which is full bodied with smooth tannins and a soft acidity.

title: Forty Five 2014 Mahna Mahna Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dried herbs, dark fruits, licorice, leather and pencil shavings make for a familiar nose on this blend of 55% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Cabernet Franc and 22% Merlot. The rustic tobacco and leather elements show on the sip, giving depth to the background black-cherry and blackberry fruits.

title: Peloton 2015 Diamond JEM Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated blackberry and purple flowers are lifted by hints of herbs, twigs and pepper on the nose of this bottling. The palate starts with candied dark fruit and is lifted by strong black spices in the midpalate, though never gains too much complexity. It offers decent grip and acid.

title: Rubino Estates Winery 2014 Landmark Collection Sangiovese (Livermore Valley)
description: This wine is very generous in aromas and flavors, offering ample spicy, cedary, and sunbaked aromas and a spiciness on the palate that's almost sweet, backed by ripe poached fruit flavors and accents of maple syrup. Firm tannins and a good touch of acidity keep it balanced.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Heroe Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: One of the winery's bottlings that form an ode to the farm crews, this wine starts with hints of honey, lemon syrup and pear skins on the nose. There is a strong vibrancy to the sip, where lime juice cuts through the ripe pear flavors.

title: Tangent 2016 Paragon Vineyard Pinot Gris (Edna Valley)
description: Tight and bright on the nose with citrus and lime blossoms, this stainless bottling also offers slightly warmer aromas of nectarine and peach as well on the nose. There's a hint of grass clipping on the front of the palate, but then it opens toward lemon, lime and tonic water flavors.

title: Ultima Tulie 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Caramelized lemon wedge, poached apples and a touch of citrus pith show on the nose of this bottling. There is solid zip to the sip, where ripe rich flavors of pear, apple and cooked lemons arise.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Ranchita Vista Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Dense loamy soils and crushed basalt frame the earthy nose of this bottling, which is deep and dark and shows a hint of caramel as well. The palate is extremely chewy and thick with tannins and muddy clay flavors that barely allow the blueberry and blackberry fruit to arise.

title: Cass 2017 Oasis Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: Cotton candy and bubblegum aromas make for a very showy nose on this bottling of this pink GSM blend. It's light and airy on the palate, with watermelon, pink fruit and more bubblegum flavors, all cut by squeezed lemon and tangerine.

title: Boisset America 2014 Christophe Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers a fist of grippy tannin around a simple structure of soft approachable cassis and red cherry. The undertone is marked by herbal compost earthiness and oak.

title: Las Palmeras 2015 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: Candied lemon and a sour citrus pith blend the sweet and tangy sensations on the nose of this simple yet clean wine. Smoke flavors lead off the sip, followed by lemon butter and a touch of midpalate sweetness.

title: Chacewater 2014 Merlot (Sierra Foothills)
description: Good and grapy, this wine has lots of dark-fruit flavors and enough body and tannin for a grippy texture. It is very clean and well made and will be a good go-to wine for casual occasions.

title: Grgich Hills 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine has a high-octane opening of power and concentration, the body following in big style and youthful oak. Woody, dusty and herbal, it has a richness and softness to the texture.

title: Hestan 2015 Chardonnay (San Francisco Bay)
description: With a strong opening note of matchstick, this wine offers an abundance of toasted oak on the nose as well, following up on the palate in buttery, rich and ripe flavors.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Flume Crossing Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Almost petrol-like on the nose, this bottling shows dried grass, hay, flint and a strong jalapeño aromas. That green-pepper element also shows strongly on the sip, which is clean, crisp and rather intriguing, finishing with a rounded apple warmth.

title: Kenwood 2016 Green Valley Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Caramel oak and toast come first to the nose, which shows a touch of reduction. Robustly rich in apple, pear and mango flavors, it also imparts a balance of high-toned acidity that helps keep the wine fresh in the glass.

title: MCV 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Somewhat exotic aromas of wild lime and Anjou pear show on the nose of this bottling. Pink Lady apple and riper pear flavors show on the palate, which shows decent restraint for this grape, especially in a warmer region.

title: Monte Volpe 2014 Primitivo (Mendocino County)
description: On the earthy side of the spectrum, rather than simply fruity, this appealing full-bodied wine has good concentration, a feeling of richness on the palate and a lingering, berrylike finish.

title: One Leaf 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Gamy, this simple affordable red is velvety smooth, rich and round, with strong flavors of black cherry, blackberry and currant.

title: Pech Merle 2017 Ivy Rosé de Syrah (Petaluma Gap)
description: A 100% stainless-steel fermented quaffer, this is richly meaty and raspberry-filled, explosive in lush flavor and gritty texture.

title: Ravenswood 2015 Bedrock Vineyard Red (Sonoma Valley)
description: This blends a majority of Zinfandel with 20% Carignan, 10% Alicante Bouschet and 6% Petite Sirah. Leather, currant and a sizable helping of oak open the wine before a bittersweet swathe of leather, tobacco and dark chocolate greet the midpalate and end with a savory finish.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Estate Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Earthy mint and dried herb compete against a backbone of rose petal and geranium in this savory wine. Plush, silky texture belies a simple midpalate of smooth, rounded edges and light spice.

title: True Myth 2013 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dried blueberry, blackberry, herbs, leather and turned earth show on the nose of this first-ever reserve bottling for the brand. The palate is smoky and framed by firm tannins, offering flavors of roasted meat and black plum.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Rosato di Sangiovese (North Coast)
description: Bright pink with a touch of orange tint, this medium-bodied wine has a candy-like nouveau aroma, and fresh, bright cherry and strawberry flavors. It's nothing if not expressive.

title: Verde 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Stony and plush on the nose, this offers aromas of ripe nectarine, lime, green herbs and chive. There is a rocky texture to the palate with decent acidity framing flavors of key lime and lemongrass.

title: Viviani 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: This medium-bodied wine wraps fresh, ripe and focused black-cherry flavors in a smooth, elegant texture. It tastes pure and just slightly smoky from oak, feels polished on the palate and has a clean fruity finish.

title: Waxwing 2016 Lester Family Vineyard Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Sweet-leaning aromas of black currant, ripe boysenberries and fruity strawberries meet with a touch of caramel on the nose of this bottling. The palate dries up considerably, showing fresh black raspberry and cola flavors.

title: Wise Villa 2015 Estate Sangiovese (Placer County)
description: Cranberry, red cherry and fresh oak flavors liven up this medium-bodied, moderately tannic and appetizing wine. It has the nervy texture that the grape variety is known for, and good balance between fruit, acid and body.

title: Baldacci 2014 Allwin Syrah (Carneros)
description: A 100% varietal wine from estate-grown grapes, this opens in crayon wax, dark plum and cherry, with a thickness on the palate that's both full bodied and overtly ripe. Concentrated and tannic, it's made in a big style that persists on the finish in oak.

title: Bliss 2014 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: Nicely dry and well balanced, this is an appetizing medium-bodied wine that offers no-nonsense cherry and berry flavors and a lightly tannic, almost crisp, texture that will be a good palate cleanser.

title: Boatique 2017 Sauvignon Blanc
description: This is a lively thirst-quenching style of wine, like adult lemonade, that blends good acidity with a sense of ripeness or sweetness and relatively full body. It has a firm but smooth texture and appealing, subtle melon and fig flavors.

title: Calerrain 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Monterey County)
description: Slightly vinous on the nose, this pink wine shows hints of raspberry and strawberry on the nose. The palate offers slightly unusual hints of toast and nuts at first, but then settles into a familiar background of fresh red fruits and a taut texture.

title: David Clinton 2015 Ancient Vine Teldeschi Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Baked bread aromas ride alongside velvety thick layers of black cherry, licorice and vanilla in this robust full-bodied wine from the long-farmed site.

title: Fetzer 2016 Shaly Loam Gewürztraminer (Monterey)
description: A solid choice for anyone seeking a medium-sweet wine, this bottling starts with aromas of Key lime pie, orange blossom and lemon-lime soda, leaning toward petrol. Racy acidity slices through the palate, which is sweet in honeysuckle and orange blossom flavors.

title: Happy Camper 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Toasted oak and spice-cabinet aromas meet rich pear and pineapple flavors in this full-bodied oaky wine. The texture is soft and mouthfilling, and the palate impression seems sweet due to ripe fruit and generous vanilla and cream accents.

title: Kirkland Signature 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This is a screaming deal for a wine that's this well made, with 12% Merlot added. Reduced slightly, it offers light-bodied ripeness around oak and strong tastes of cedar, tobacco, cherry and red currant.

title: Leoness 2014 Cabernet Franc-Merlot (Temecula Valley)
description: The baked licorice and stewed fruit flavors are strong on this blend of 68% Cabernet Franc and 32% Merlot, lifted by oak influence and a pinch of oregano. Squeaky tannins frame the palate, which also carries cooked-fruit flavors and a strong anise spice.

title: Lusso Della Terra 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Primary aromas of Concord grape and grape seed meet with prune and licorice spice on the nose of this bottling. The palate is also grapey and loaded with licorice flavors.

title: Madrigal 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Intensely concentrated and leathery, this is a full-bodied and ripely rich red, showing a wealth of bold black licorice, toasted oak and meat.

title: Malibu Ridge 2014 Malbec (Malibu Coast)
description: Primary aromas of Concord grape, grape seed and charred wood kick off the nose on this bottling, which is bolstered by 7% Cabernet Sauvignon and 4% Merlot. The palate is clean but simple, with grape, cola, cocoa and cappuccino flavors.

title: McManis 2016 Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a well-made, value-priced wine with plenty of juicy berry flavors, accented by caramel and vanilla. It is mouthfilling, not-quite sweet and very easy to sip, with a smooth texture.

title: Oak Farm 2016 Tievoli Red (Lodi)
description: This is a good flavorful choice for people who don't like dry red wines. It has very fruity aromas and moderately sweet blackberry-jam flavors that coat the palate and linger on the finish.

title: Sand Dollar 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Broad aromas of apple and pear meet with hints of roasted nuts on the nose of this widely available bottling. The palate takes the somewhat sweet pome fruit and adds a bit of orange juice, making for an easy midweek quaffer.

title: Big Six 2015 Whiskey Bourbon Barrel Red (California)
description: This is a full-flavored, oaky wine that is lavish in its emphasis on sweet-seeming baking spices and wood smoke in both the aromas and the flavors. It feels smooth and velvety on the palate, where the spiciness reverberates with blackberry and milk chocolate for a sweet-seeming finish.

title: Lucas & Lewellen 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: A beautifully, slightly mauve-ish shade of pink, this bottling offers raspberry and lemon zest on the strongly scented nose. The palate starts with a tang of mandarin orange pith, then leads into slightly more rounded and rather strong watermelon flavors, all held up by a grippy structure.

title: Malibu Ridge 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Malibu Coast)
description: From a biodynamically farmed property, this bottling, which includes 9% Malbec, appears to be slightly effervescent in the glass and smells of underripe blackberry, cigar box and woody herbs. The palate is a bit tart with underripe blueberry flavors, but also offers purple flowers and snapped twig flavors.

title: Orange Coast WInery 2015 Barbera (California)
description: Red cherry, crushed slate and a pinch of herbs show on the nose of this bottling from the Temecula area, which shows good potential for making solid table wines from this grape. It's light, easy and quaffable on the sip, where gravel and light red-fruit flavors are prominent.

title: Orange Coast WInery 2015 Sangiovese (California)
description: Licorice, hoisin plum sauce and stewed strawberry aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Temecula area. Baked licorice, charred meat and roasted red plums show on the sip, where decent acidity and squeaky tannins provide structure.

title: Josh Cellars 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: A dark color and extracted flavors of grape skins and blackberries accompany a very firm texture that's laced with sandy tannins. These elements make for a bold, full-bodied and monolithic wine.

title: Cabana Wines 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: An earthy streak in the aroma and flavor marks this wine as a bit of an outlier while fairly generous red and black-cherry flavors give a good payoff on the palate. The wine is medium-bodied, light on tannins and smooth to sip.

title: California Roots 2016 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Semisweet and very fruity, this easy-drinking wine has floral peachy aromas and flavors and a soft texture with just enough of a citrus component to keep it lively.

title: Callaway 2014 Winemaker's Reserve Roussanne (Temecula Valley)
description: Orange blossom, wet rocks and chamomile-syrup aromas show on the nose of this reserved take on an often unctuous grape. The palate is more about texture than overt flavors, with a grippy frame slowly revealing flavors of lime cream.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Pinot Noir (Mendocino County)
description: This wine, from a unique single-vineyard on steep slopes, has power along with complexity, combining aromas like sun-baked earth and dry leaves with layered cherry, tea and rhubarb flavors and a firm, nicely tannic texture. This will stand up to rich entrées very well, and should improve through at least 2021.

title: Two Sisters 2015 Lindsay's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Plump red cherry, rust, dried sage, wild thyme and baking spices show on the nose of this top-end regional wine from Bill Foley. The palate shows cohesive well-woven flavors of strong red fruits, turned earth, brown spice, cracked pepper and a menthol-like finish. The acidity is perfect, the tannins soft but structural.

title: Walt 2015 The Corners Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Very ripe and very lush, this wine oozes opulent black cherry and blueberry from the aroma through the lingering finish. The fruit flavors are concentrated and deep, and a touch of baking spices adds complexity as the wine spreads across the palate and seems to coat the tongue.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Faces Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Very light in color, this unique wine shows peppery figs, plum paste, rust and star anise spice on the fascinating nose. It's light in body with a great textural grip, offering up a distinct stew of flavors, including macerated orange, plum, Christmas spice, sarsaparilla, coffee candies and a white-pepper-dust finish.

title: Davies 2015 Ferrington Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Smooth and fruity, this wine is easy to enjoy from the first classic whiff of red cherries and tea to more substantial black cherry and clove flavors. It's medium in body and has light, velvety tannins. Great balance and liveliness thanks to good acidity help lift this wine above the pack.

title: Flanagan 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has the rich oaky exuberance of the famous vineyard site—a mix of butter, lemon curd and apple pie. Creamy and layered, it has seasonings of nutmeg and cinnamon, integrated oak and persistent acidity that makes it delicious experience.

title: Flanagan 2015 Platt Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Lush, concentrated and richly put together, this coastal, estate white offers a mix of inviting flavors from Bosc pear to pineapple and fennel. Integrated in oak and balanced in ripeness, it'll pair well with a range of foods and be wholly satisfying on its own.

title: Lumen 2015 Presqu'ile Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This bottling by Lane Tanner, who used solely clone 667 and employed 50% new Hungarian oak, offers intense cherry on the nose alongside rose petals, carnations, preserved oranges and North African spice. There's bountiful energy to the sip, where bay leaf, thyme and green sage meet with dark red fruit.

title: Lutum 2015 Gap's Crown Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the lovely Petaluma Gap site, this wine is a mix of menthol, forest floor and noble reduction—totally savory in style. Moderately concentrated and ultimately fresh in bright acidity, it has a thickness of wild strawberry and cherry and a length of cardamom spice.

title: MaidenStoen 2016 Lafond Vineyard Riesling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lime pith, scratched pomelo skin, crushed chalk, a hint of flour and tons of rocky minerality show on the nose of this tightly wound bottling—the best of this winery's current vintage. There is extreme raciness to the textured and slightly grippy sip, with flavors of lime, chalk and a hint of pluot flesh. It's all about texture.

title: Peake Ranch 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Clean aromas of flint and smoke meet with Meyer lemon pith, a touch of tangerine and white flowers on the nose of this bottling by the new estate of John and Gill Wagner. There's bountiful texture to the sip, where slightly sour lemon and lime flavors are balanced by honeysuckle, wood chip, pecan and rosemary-laced roasted-chicken flavors.

title: Raymond 2015 LVE Legend Vineyard Exclusive Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Heady aromatics pierce through a full-figured sensibility of oak and body in this well-made wine—a partnership between the winery and musician John Legend. A gritty texture makes way for a length of baked pineapple and pear decadence that lingers effortlessly on the palate.

title: Sanguis 2013 Verve Red (Central Coast)
description: A slightly tradition-bucking blend of Grenache, Syrah, Cabernet Franc and Viognier by Matthias Pippig, this wine shows black cherry, vanilla, dark loam, crushed rocks and dried thyme on the mineral-laced nose. Strong tannins and acidity frame the sip, where berries, anise and vanilla converge. The tannins need a bit more time to integrate.

title: Stolpman 2015 Angeli Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: For the winery's more serious bottling, this is a very fresh and lively wine rather than austere and regal, with boisterous lilacs, violets, smashed plums and boysenberries on the nose. Candied blackberry shows on the sip, which is relatively lighter in texture and body, with hints of hickory smoke as well. These flavors will stay vibrant for years, and merge with time. Drink 2019–2030.

title: Mira 2013 Schweizer Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty and chalky tannins and oak grasp robust black fruit and licorice in this full-bodied well-made wine, aged for two years in 100% new French oak. Leather, tobacco and clove contribute complexity to the lengthy finish.

title: Pali 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lovely black raspberry, hints of sage, sandalwood, soil, sweet dill, tarragon and fennel make for a very expressive nose on this single-vineyard selection. The palate deftly combines dark but tart plum, pluot and black raspberry fruit with notes of baking spices. The texture is pitch perfect, with judicious acidity and structural tannins.

title: Round Pond 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a well-integrated reserve wine, enjoyable in its complex plushness and characteristics of clove, cassis and red cherry. Leather, tobacco and soy come in midway, adding to a robust, softly spoken finish.

title: Sanguis 2014 Loner Favonius Bien Nacido Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There are strong hints of smoke and flint at first on the nose of this bottling, but then comes a tighter mandarin orange pith character and a warming sandalwood spice. It's very fresh, tightly wound and bright on the palate, with pink grapefruit, squeezed lemon and lime skin toward the finish.

title: Stolo 2015 Creekside Pinot Noir (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Rustic red cherry, baked earth, pretty rose petals, candied currants and a bit of sweet oak show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard just east of Cambria. The herbally tinged palate places fresh thyme and dill against a backdrop of light cranberry and pomegranate, proving lightly bodied but extremely energetic with acidity. Vanilla pops on the finish.

title: Walt 2015 Brown Ranch Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Brown sugar and Asian spice components make this wine warm and inviting—a strong, powerful expression of the variety that's concentrated in flavor and body weight. Tart cranberry and raspberry are seasoned in elements of dried herb, adding complexity.

title: Tinto Rey 2017 Estate Bottled Verdejo (Dunnigan Hills)
description: This is a fairly rich and moderately fruity wine that has peachy aromas and flavors and light to medium body.

title: Chime 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This wine has a strong new-oak signature easy to detect in the vanilla and cinnamon aromas and the ginger-spice flavors that layer over good red-cherry notes underneath. It is medium to full bodied and highly stylized.

title: Foley Johnson 2016 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Floral and characterized by bold stone-fruit flavors, this wine is spritzy in acidity, with a nutty herbal imprint of anise.

title: Viaggio 2014 Pinot Noir (Lodi)
description: A good weekday choice, this full-bodied wine smells of plums and prunes, has an iron-like tang in the flavors and a pleasant mouth-filling texture.

title: Vinum Cellars 2016 Chenin Blanc (Clarksburg)
description: Dry and medium bodied, this wine has appley aromas, apple-skin flavors and a tangy, edgy texture. It tastes rather low on the ripeness scale but has refreshing qualities.

title: Wilson Creek 2015 Gerry's Vineyard Family Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Really light in the glass for a Cab, this bottling shows hints of green herbs and exotic red plum on the nose. The palate is a bit thin and minty, surrounding a light cranberry core.

title: Andis 2015 Grenache (Amador County)
description: This full-bodied wine has assertive smoky oaky aromas and flavors that nearly overwhelm the jammy fruit flavors underneath. The roasted toasted character gives a little spine to the otherwise soft impression on the palate.

title: Pull 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Rather light in the glass, this bottling shows cherry juice, smoke, caramel and mint on the nose. The palate delivers acid, but in a slightly weird way, carrying flavors of extracted cherry and berry along with dark spice.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2012 Back in Black Red (Paso Robles)
description: A tad cloudy in the glass, this proprietary blend shows smashed blackberry, crushed thyme and grape-seed aromas on the nose. It's quite tangy and chalky on the palate, with strong black-plum-skin flavors.

title: Shenandoah Vineyards 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Amador County)
description: This medium-bodied wine has an earthy, smoky aroma followed by tangy lemon flavors and figgy, earthy accents. It has a crisp mouth-cleansing texture.

title: CK Mondavi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A flinty aroma and smoky, white-peppery flavors give this medium-bodied wine a savory rather than fruity profile. Hints of earthiness join subtle lemon flavors on the palate.

title: Kirkland Signature 2017 Pinot Grigio (California)
description: Fresh in feel and a touch sweet, this fruity wine is light bodied and shows flavors of flowers and apples, supported by a soft texture.

title: Millésimé 2013 Scoprire Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This atypical blend of 70% Syrah, 22% Sangiovese, 8% Cabernet Franc shows tangy aromas of blackberry balsamic sauce, turned loam, smoke and grape seed on the nose. The palate is very primary with Concord grape and oak flavors.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is flabby and full-bodied, with ripe flavors of green olive and apple. There's a lingering sweetness to the finish.

title: Rockin' R Winery 2013 Hellagood Grenache-Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: Caramel candies, black cherries and oak dust aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Grenache and 50% Syrah. A coffee-candy flavor meets with black-cherry and cola flavors on the palate, which finishes with oddly chalky tannins.

title: Bel Vino NV Cabernet Franc (California)
description: Cherry compote and extracted red fruit meet with toffee on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely tangy and tart, with pinches of herb, coffee and cocoa adding intrigue.

title: Shamwari 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine has a strong note of juniper amidst dried herb, earth, leather and tobacco, the tannins persistently chewy and somewhat astringent.

title: Carneros Ranch 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This wine is quietly floral with a thick entry of simple, lemon-lime flavors and a rounded structure.

title: Van Ruiten 2017 Sparkling Rosé (Lodi)
description: This very fruity and slightly sweet wine has a hot-pink color, bold aromas of cherries and strawberries and a simply fruity flavor.

title: Carson Ridge 2016 Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: Aromas of orange blossom and mandarin pith show on the somewhat flat nose of this bottling. There's a burst of acid on the tip of the sip, but it quickly fades into dried apple and orange-rind flavors.

title: Skinner 2016 Grenache (El Dorado)
description: Very light cherry and berry aromas are followed by mild fruit flavors and a slightly gripping texture in this medium-boded wine. It is delicate and restrained, with very good acidity and more taut balance than most examples.

title: Westerly 2017 Rosé (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A dark shade of reddish pink, this rosé show kirsch-like aromas as well as concentrated plums, strawberries and a hint of clove on the nose. It's quite juicy on the palate with cherry flavors and a chalky texture on the finish.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Legacio Red (California)
description: This Super Tuscan blend of Sangiovese, Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot shows cherry, wood-oil and balsamic-vinegar notes on the nose. The flavors are quite woody, with juicy red-fruit, anise, roasted fig and juniper flavors.

title: Bellante 2016 The Dark Side Cuvee Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Deep and dark aromas of blackberry, elderberry, black plum and clove show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is rather thick and somewhat sweet with blackberry jelly, roasted meat and brown-sugar flavors.

title: Falkner 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Shy aromas of cut grass and yellow-apple rinds show on the nose of this bottling. There is a sweet flash of ripe apple on the palate, but it's cut with a fresh lime juice kick.

title: Metzker Family Estates 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Thick in tightly woven tannin, this is an earthy, minty wine, rich in baked flavors of cherry and strawberry with a grip of toasted oak.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: A solid sense of concentration and fresh floral and citrus flavors make this wine attractive. It has a lively but smooth texture, with good acidity backed by a soft, ripe and fruity core.

title: St. Francis 2015 Anthem Meritage (Sonoma County)
description: A blend of 68% Cabernet Sauvignon, 23% Merlot and 9% Malbec, this wine is soft and structured, with dusty tannin and components of sage and cedar. The midpalate is intensely ripe without overt definition—a mix of blackberry and blueberry jam.

title: Bel Vino NV Chardonnay (California)
description: Aromas of slightly burned toast, lemon rind and butter show on the nose of this bottling. The palate also shows similarly familiar flavors, with lemon balm, wood oil, a splash of citrus and a midpalate of toast.

title: Buena Vista 2015 Ida's Selection Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: A thick, reduced entry of leathery meat and blackberry bramble mark this wine, which is densely rich in additional baked-cherry flavors. The finish is smoky in oak.

title: Graveyard 2015 Scream Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black-currant jam, crushed slate and black plum show on the nose of this bottling, which features a rendition of the famed Edvard Munch painting on the label. Candied cherry and blackberry meet with a roasted wood flavor on the palate.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: Herbal in dried herb and sage, this is a rich and softly pleasing wine, with moderate structure and a chalky aspect tot he texture. The core flavors dip into chocolate mocha and baked cherry.

title: Newton 2015 Puzzle Red (Spring Mountain District)
description: Cabernet Sauvignon and Merlot make up the majority of this blend, with smaller amounts of Petit Verdot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec. Turned earth and dried herb provide a classic entry of savory imprint against dry tannin and savory oak.

title: Oak Grove 2017 Family Reserve Winemaker's Rosé (California)
description: This is a light-bodied, low-alcohol wine that tastes delicate and fresh, showing faint cherry aromas and flavors and brisk acidity for balance. It's dry and refreshing, so it fills its role well.

title: Oso Libre 2015 Alsacia Riesling (Arroyo Seco)
description: Classic Riesling aromas of petrol and grapefruit pith combine with wet clay on the nose of this bottling. It's very tight on the palate, clinging to a lime-pith core and loaded with tons of acid and more petrol flavors.

title: Sevtap 2015 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Crushed red flowers, thyme, wet rocks and rusty earth make for a compelling nose on this bottling. The palate proves extremely tangy, with strawberry balsamic sauce flavors and white pepper on the finish.

title: Sobon Estate 2017 Rosé (Amador County)
description: With its vivid copper color, this is not a shy-looking wine, and it also has vivid, tart cherry and raspberry flavors to match. On the palate it has light to medium body and a dry, slightly puckering texture.

title: Terra d'Oro 2017 Exploration Series Pinot Grigio (Clarksburg)
description: Well done in a light, refreshing style, this medium-bodied wine offers tangy green-apple aromas, fresh citrus and herb flavors and good nervy acidity.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2017 Sisters Forever Un-Oaked Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: This twist-top bottling is very pear-driven and tropical leaning on the nose, with edgier touches of citrus. It grabs hold of the palate with ripe apple and more pear flavors, but a lime peel element keeps it zesty.

title: Falkner 2017 Chardonnay (Temecula Valley)
description: Lime skins, guava and a hint of sourdough show on the nose of this bottling. Light honeydew and guava flavors show on the easy and clean sip, which doesn't offer too much texture or acid, but remains very pleasant.

title: District 7 Wines 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Monterey)
description: Still tight on the nose, this well-priced bottling shows tar, black pepper, dried cherries, leather and crushed pencil aromas. The sip starts with sweetish black currant before cedary spice, black olive and wood smoke take hold. The tannins are soft and polished.

title: Kaena 2014 Tierra Alta Vineyard Grenache (Ballard Canyon)
description: Concentrated fruit aromas of red plum, reduced strawberry and gingerbread are a bit much on the nose of this bottling. The cooked flavors are very kirsch-like, with concentrated cherry and plum, yet there is still a compelling tannic structure and a strong acidity.

title: 29 & Oak Wines 2016 Reserve Red (Napa Valley)
