description: Light bodied, this charming combination of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Petit Verdot has an entry of cherry, vanilla and subtle char. Consistent and juicy on the midpalate, it has a taste of bark that provides a bite of bitterness on the finish.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2012 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is an extracted, softly layered wine, generous on the palate in dark brooding cherry, blackberry and cassis. Additional elements lean richer and more concentrated, highlighted by chocolate, leather and tobacco.

title: Avensole 2014 South Slope Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: There are strong aromas of spearmint and licorice on the nose of this bottling, set against a background of black cherry and tangy strawberry. The sip is very energetic and chalky in structure, with flavors of tangy red fruit, licorice, bay leaf, milk chocolate and vanilla on the finish.

title: Birichino 2015 Muscat Canelli (Monterey)
description: Ripe aromas of Gravenstein apple, nectarine, Meyer lemon, red pears and orange blossoms show on the very approachable and pleasant nose of this dessert wine. It's quite sweet right away on the sip, full of apple, pear and viscous orange-blossom flavors, with just enough acidity.

title: Mill Creek 2013 Hillside Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is aged entirely in French oak, 75% of it new. Grippy structure surrounds a softened sensibility of dark cherry and chocolate, the oak smoky and tinged in vanilla.

title: Napa Cellars 2014 V Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: This is a 100% varietal wine, leathery and earthy in approach and style. Full bodied and extracted in bold brawny black fruit, it offers accents of pencil and wax.

title: Pegasus Estate 2016 Rosé of Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This pink wine shows plump white peach, watermelon, wet cement and a twist of lime on the nose. There's a flash of sweetness on the sip, with ripe melons, but then it dries up, highlighting rosewater and soft pink-fruit flavors.

title: Puccioni 2014 Puccioni Ranch Old Vine Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: With the addition of 14% Petite Sirah, this delightful old-vine wine is lightly spiced with a taste of black licorice. Vanilla, blackberry and white chocolate add layers of complex, welcomed flavor and succulence to the full-bodied whole.

title: Salvestrin 2014 Cavaso Red (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied blend combines a majority of Merlot with Syrah, Petite Sirah and Cabernet Sauvignon. Tannic and tight-grained, it's rustic in leather, black cherry and tart soy.

title: Truchard 2014 Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This is a tart lively wine complex in forest floor, black tea and tangy flavors of cranberry, rhubarb and strawberry. It retains a medium-bodied weight that gives it breadth.

title: Trunk Up Wines 2014 Red (Napa Valley)
description: From grapes grown in Carneros and Oak Knoll, this wine combines nearly equal parts Merlot and Cabernet Franc, with smaller amounts of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Tart and tannic, it offers structure and a lightness of oak around old-school elements of red currant and cedar.

title: Croma Vera 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Dense black plums, crushed black rocks and a dollop of vanilla, star anise and licorice show on the rather rich nose of this bottling. The flavors are a tad woody, with cigar box quite prominent, as well as roasted game and dark minty cherries.

title: Educated Guess 2015 Merlot (Napa County)
description: With small amounts of Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, this is a reduced and juicy wine, showy in notes of oak and cinnamon. Juicy plum and black cherry provide concentrated fruit flavors alongside a richness of milk chocolate.

title: Falkner 2016 Viognier (Temecula Valley)
description: Clean if rather ripe aromas of peach, bubblegum and banana show on the nose of this bottling, which displays expert restraint from a warm region for an often blousy variety. There's a rich custardy touch at first on the sip, with plumeria and guava flavors, but then the chalky texture reins it back.

title: LXV 2016 Summer Satine Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Relatively light and delicate on the nose, this bottling shows chalk, ripe pear and the unmistakable aroma of banana-flavored Now & Laters candy. The palate is tightly wound yet tropical, with papaya, mango and ripe peach flavors, each more expressive as the wine warms.

title: Croma Vera 2015 Revelacion Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dried rose petals, concentrated red cherry, anise, thyme and caramel show on the nose of this blend of Tempranillo, Grenache, Cabernet Sauvignon and Petite Sirah. The palate is dominated by a rustic sagebrush quality, with earthy red berry and crushed slate adding pleasant complexity.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Thick and moderate in structure, this wine is fleshy, lush and tropical in nature. Swirled in butterscotch, vanilla and caramel, the oak is toasty and supportive.

title: Sanctuary 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This is a testament to oak, having aged in 80% new French barrels for 15 months. Ripe and intense, it melds tart black olive and clove with plush rounded layers of caramel and coffee.

title: Mumm Napa 2013 DVX Rosé Sparkling (Napa Valley)
description: Made from just a bit more Pinot Noir than Chardonnay, this is a lovely, complex and memorable wine, elegantly round and lengthy on the palate. A fleshiness of tangerine, peach and cherry complement the bright persistent acidity that has had time to mellow and integrate in the bottle.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: Big but very agile, this full-bodied wine balances great fruit acidity with equally great richness in terms of ripe Anjou pear flavors and an almost thick, mouth-coating texture. The appearance has a faint green highlight in the yellow gold color, the aroma has toasted oak, butterscotch and apple, while the flavors nearly flood the palate with toasted almond, cream and baked pear.

title: Patz & Hall 2016 Pisoni Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Amazingly inviting aromas of rounded red cherry, wet slate, loam, vanilla, cracked pepper and dried herb show on the intense nose of this classic single-vineyard expression. Framed by sandy, nearly gritty tannins and a buoyant acidity, the flavors of ripe black cherry, tangy blackberry and wild herbs will only intensify with time. Drink 2019–2032.

title: Ramey 2015 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a well-made wine from several sites, including Cole Creek, Rodgers Creek and Alegria, all vineyard-designates of their own. Together, they sizzle in floral lavender, smoke and gamy meat. The Syrah is cofermented with 6% Viognier. The body is concentrated in ripeness and grip; let it mellow in the cellar and enjoy best 2025–2030.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: From an historic site in the middle of Sonoma Valley, this wine is creamy and viscous with a thicket of vanilla and cherry cordial opening up on the palate. Thick and oaky, it lingers in black pepper and an exotic mineral element that's part crushed rock, part dried herb. This is a beautiful and beguiling example of the variety.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Ten Oaks Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned contours of red cherry and pomegranate make for a tart profile, edged by tightly wound acidity and underlying freshness. This is an exotic wine that could stand more time in the bottle to truly reveal itself. Enjoy from 2020–2025.
designation: Year of the Ram Ten Oaks Single Vineyard

title: Sangiacomo 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Made from the producer's own Green Acres and Home Ranch vineyards, this is heady and inviting in decadent, lengthy waves of caramel apple and Meyer lemon meringue. Full bodied and densely ripe, it has oaky cinnamon spice and a twist of vanilla, finishing with impressive minerality.

title: Tantara 2016 Zotovich Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Broad aromas of white peach, gardenia, jasmine and butter are leveled by a sharp lemone note on the nose. The palate is tense at first, eventually releasing waves of butter, lemon balm and melon, proving creamy and bright at once.

title: Merry Edwards 2016 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Broadly fleshy and expansive on the palate, this is a lovely, powerful wine, spicy in forest pine and clove. Succulent on the midpalate, it offers an array of well-defined citrus and wild strawberry, with a lingering quality to the finish that impresses in rose petal and lavender.

title: Davies 2016 Ferrington Vineyards Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: A little smokier in aroma and fuller in flavor than the rest of the range of Davies Pinots, this wine tastes robust, ripe and exotic, but still has bright acidity and firm tannins to give structure. It is full bodied, nicely oaky and well balanced. Best through 2024.

title: Donum 2015 Year of the Ram Single Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Plush and expansive from start to finish, this is an impressive wine with length and breadth. Jolts of well-defined flavors of cherry and vanilla meet spice and earth, making for a contemplative, tasty wine.
designation: Year of the Ram Single Vineyard

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Dutton Ranch Morelli Lane Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From vines planted in the 19th century, near the town of Occidental, this is a knockout wine, integrated and memorably spicy, and with a dash of white pepper at its core. Baked blueberry and cherry meet cinnamon and chocolate powder around a persistence of underlying freshness and beauty.

title: Lynmar 2016 Block 10 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Slightly reductive, oaky and robust in tannin, this is a powerful expression of its particular site, planted to a mix of clones. Red cherry is pronounced along with a floral component of rose and earthy thread of crushed stone.

title: Siduri 2016 Garys' Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This is a heady, powerful and delicious wine from a famous vineyard by veteran winemaker Adam Lee. Plump red cherries, star anise and vanilla shine on the nose, leading into a beautifully full palate loaded with red currant, dark cherry and baking spice. The acid sings into the finish.

title: Animo 2016 Heritage Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is an exotic, 100% varietal wine given impressive time to mature before release. It's worth the wait. Flinty, it offers plenty of body around a wealth of well-developed pineapple, grapefruit and lemon-squeeze flavors, finishing in balance and with lingering complexity.

title: Barra of Mendocino 2016 Estate Grown Petite Sirah (Mendocino)
description: Made from organic grapes, this wine has an impressively deep color that stays concentrated right to the dark-red rim. The nose brings violets, blueberries and black pepper, and the flavors gush dark fruit and dark chocolate, with hardly any oak influence. A surprisingly gentle layer of fine-grained tannins smooths the texture and soothes the palate. Best after 2023.

title: Davies 2016 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This well-modulated, well-balanced and delicious wine has everything in place from the light baking-spice and red-cherry aromas to the black-cherry, raspberry and rhubarb flavors to the tangy and palate-cleansing mouthfeel. It's especially good for the “regular” Anderson Valley bottling.

title: Happy Canyon Vineyard 2017 Piocho Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling, which includes 12% Sémillion, starts with fresh and snappy aromas of wet grass, ripe passion fruit and cold rain—a stunning aromatic combo. The palate is extremely zippy, with powerful acid slicing through flavors of lemongrass, lime and wet stone.

title: Lynmar 2016 Quail Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Heady floral and toasted oak aromas are inviting on the nose. Flavors of crisp apple and pear meld with additions of sea salt and pretzel.

title: Melville 2017 Clone 76 Inox Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: If freshness is the challenge, this very light yet vibrant bottling by Chad Melville is a champion. Aromas of pear flesh and lime blossom lead into a sip that dances across the tongue with flavors of Asian pear, white melon and lemon juice, finishing with a hint of intriguing ash. The wine still zips days later.

title: Francis Coppola 2014 Nimble Vineyards Reserve Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Meaty and brawny in all the right ways, this varietally satisfying wine broods in black fruit, cured meat and licorice, its tannins polished but substantial. Fresh jolts of acidity keep the whole from getting bogged down, but this full-bodied effort will do well with some time in the cellar; enjoy best 2020 through 2024.

title: Freeman 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Great structure and tight but plentiful flavors make this wine a great cellar candidate. Firm tannins and great acidity put a lot of backbone behind black cherry, cedar and clove notes that are layered and complex. It will be best after 2022.

title: Kagan 2015 Grist Vineyard Syrah (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Only a handful of cases were made of this lovely wine, a study in leather, meat and black licorice that offers concentrated richness and supple tannin. Black cherry and berry play secondary roles to the more savory characters, allowing for a varietal expression that is often hard to find.

title: MacRostie 2015 Dutton Ranch Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salty oak and brine mark the opening of this full-bodied white, which offers a sinewy texture of lingering Asian spice. Lemon meringue and apple contribute fruit-forward flavor around an herbal note and plenty of toasted oak.

title: Merry Edwards 2015 Olivet Lane Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a soft, velvety and lush wine, with bold, beautiful highlights of cranberry, orange and dark cherry. Medium in weight, it dances along a tightrope of fresh, focused acidity and savory black tea. The vineyard is planted with older vines that won't last forever, and the winemaker treats each vintage as if it might be its last.

title: Mirror 2014 Cimarossa Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: Quietly concentrated and very firmly structured, this opulent wine builds slowly from light mint, cedar and dark chocolate aromas to very ripe black-cherry and black-currant flavors blanketed by a velvety texture of fine-grained tannins. Enjoyed best after 2024.

title: Pellet Estate 2015 Unoaked Sunchase Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: From a vineyard that has since been designated as part of the new Petaluma Gap appellation, this wine shows the fog and wind influence of that gap, with a lush creamy center of full-figured mango, apple and vanilla that finds its way to bright supportive acidity and lingering oak spice.

title: Potek 2015 Mormann Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very light in the glass, this wine's nose is very expressive and ever-evolving, with stark aromas of white flowers, Key lime meringue, smashed kumquat, mango marmalade and a kiss of oak. It's very firm and tightly wound on the bright palate, showing lemon peels, yuzu and crushed sea shell flavors.

title: Y Rousseau 2014 Le Roi Soleil Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Blended with 5% Merlot and 5% Tannat, a variety the producer makes also on its own, this mountain-grown effort is soft, spicy and well-integrated, with fresh focused acidity. Black currant, cherry and leather play along the palate, dusted in cocoa powder and toasted oak. Enjoyable now, it'll do well in the cellar. Hide away 2024 through 2034.

title: Mueller Family Vineyards 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: From a site at 1,100-feet in elevation, this wine is impressive and memorable, rounded and full-figured, with a grippy backbone. Black raspberry and earthy tobacco come to the fore first, followed by toasted oak, clove and pencil. It lingers in clove on the formidable finish. This young wine can benefit from cellaring; enjoy best 2025 through 2035.

title: Chalk Hill 2015 Felta Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)
description: Beautifully aromatic, this wine shines in tones of salty mineral, crème brûlée and toasted oak. The texture provides complexity and grip, with lush, fresh flavors of green apple, fig and orange zest, all framed by vibrant acidity.

title: Freeman 2015 Yu-ki Estate Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Packed with black cherry flavor accented by clove, pine and forest floor nuances, this complex and concentrated wine is a beauty. The mouthfeel is broad and velvety, and the finish lingers nicely.

title: McPrice Myers 2015 Sel de la Terre Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Bright rhubarb and hibiscus aromas meet with wet gravel and spice cake on the nose of this well-woven bottling. The palate tightens up on an earthy rocky core, proving texturally unique and firm while delivering flavors of cherry, dried sage and baked bricks. A very structural Grenache that's built to last. Drink now through 2030.

title: Migration 2015 Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Pomegranate and raspberry aromas are enhanced with crushed slate, loads of turned earth and a touch of wood smoke that emerges with patience. There's a slight gamy touch to the palate, giving depth to the zesty flavors of freshly shelled pomegranate, crushed pencils, dewy thyme and lanolin.

title: Mt. Brave 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Small amounts of Merlot, Cabernet Franc and Malbec are blended into this impressive wine, which is reduced slightly on the nose. The flavors of cassis and red cherry turn juicy and tart on the midpalate before exposing complex lengths of tobacco and clove. This wine will be best enjoyed in time, so shoot for 2020 through 2024.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2016 Lester Family Vineyard Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: There's a compelling convergence of cinnamon, crushed mace and cola spice on the nose of this bottling, along with light red-fruit aromas of baked strawberry and rustic cranberry. The bright acidity pops on the palate, then settles into the background to allow flavors of crushed cranberry and pomegranate to mesh with nutmeg and allspice on the palate.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2016 Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: This appellation blend is a steal for the price, carrying much of the regional typicity expressed in the winery's single-vineyard bottlings. Zesty aromas of raspberry, hibiscus and a touch of caramel flow seamlessly into an energetic and fresh palate loaded with flavors of raspberry, anise, white pepper and fennel fronds.

title: Tercero 2012 Verbiage Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Winemaker Larry Schaffer has been very patient with this blend of 38% Syrah, 31% Grenache and 31% Mourvèdre, and it pays off. Dense aromas of black-currant syrup, packed violets, vanilla, baking spice and caramel show on the nose, and the palate brings further cohesion to those elements. Flavors of black plum, blackberry and dried herbs ride grippy, tense tannins.

title: Trombetta 2016 Indindoli Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Stony, salty and swimming in bright, focused acidity, this is a lovely white wine. Not overly ripe yet able to offer some heft on the palate, this shows an effortless combination of Meyer lemon zest, pear, pineapple and honeysuckle.

title: Birichino 2016 Besson Vineyard Old Vines Grenache (Central Coast)
description: There's a “wow” factor on the nose of this bottling of old vine Grenache, with fresh red cherry, cola, light licorice, rusty earth, rosewater and carnation all coming to the fore. The palate is loaded with wet gravel and river-stone minerality, which is decorated with red plum and pomegranate flavors. Overall light and easy yet complex and unique.

title: Bianchi 2015 Garey Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Cooked aromas of cherry, baking spice, vanilla and stewed plums show on the rather ripe and extracted nose of this bottling. Spice-cake and fruitcake flavors show on the sip, where the texture and acidity are decent but the flavors a bit heavy-handed.

title: Burnside Road 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Crisp, clear and moderate in structure, this wine offers a medium-bodied take on ripeness and body structure, allowing for fleshy flavors of guava and fig to present themselves with ease.

title: Mount Peak 2015 Rattlesnake Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Cherry-berry flavors are seasoned in pleasing accents of cinnamon and vanilla in this rich, highly ripe wine. The tannins are soft and supple, providing simple support without distraction.

title: Taft Street 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Floral muscat-like aromatics persist in this wine. This is a tight, firmly crisp in acidity example of the variety that is integrated and moderately ripe.

title: Allegretto 2014 Ayres Family Reserve Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: Dark boysenberry aromas meet with peppery spice and herbs on the tangy nose of this bottling. The palate shows a bit of balsamic sourness, with hints of boysenberry and blackberry fruit.

title: Barrelhouse 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This wine is well made in a soft supple style that highlights mild lemon and apple flavors and light buttery vanillin accents. Medium body and soft acidity keep it easy in texture, and although it was aged in Bourbon barrels for three months, luckily there is very little Bourbon taste.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2016 Estate Petite Sirah (Contra Costa County)
description: Relatively light and easy-drinking for the varietal, this wine is not too dark in color, has friendly berry and plum flavors and medium body. Some tannin does come through in the texture but the wine stays smooth.

title: Cinnabar 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: Roasted pear, light banana and baked-earth aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Muddled flavors of pome fruit, lemon peel and melon arise on the palate, which is a touch flat in texture.

title: Cline 2017 Ancient Vines Mourvèdre Rosé (Contra Costa County)
description: Fresh herb and strawberry aromas are followed by vivid raspberry flavors in this medium-bodied smooth and rather soft-textured wine. Being made from the Rhône grape variety Mourvèdre, it's an interesting twist on rosé.

title: Côte West 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky oak and a meaty component give this wine an interesting complexity amidst high-toned, tangy elements of rhubarb and strawberry. The tannins are thick and present.

title: Husch 2016 Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: This wine has fresh fruit and baking-spice aromas that lead to a supple texture and tangy apple-skin flavors. This medium-bodied wine is a sure crowd-pleaser.

title: J. Lohr 2017 Gesture Rosé of Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Quite showing on the nose, this Grenache-based rosé offers strong aromas of passion fruit, orange and guava juice. It tightens a bit on the sip, but that tropical-juice combo remains, proving very flavorful and likable for those seeking a pink wine with clout.

title: Meeker 2015 Hone Series #1 Sakura Red (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From two vineyards, this oddly blends Viognier, Carignan, Zinfandel, Petite Sirah and Grenache, cofermenting it all together before aging in French oak. The result is light in color and bright in acidity, with distinct flavors of sour cherry, cranberry and green apple.

title: Abbeyville 2016 Tanner's Passage Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: This is a good medium-bodied wine that emphasizes fresh fruit flavors and a smooth, natural-feeling texture. There's not much oak or butter to trick it up, so pure apple and pear notes take the lead.

title: Alara 2016 Grenache (Central Coast)
description: Woody aromas meet with primary dark-berry fruits and grape seed on the nose of this bottling. It's rather floral on the palate and offers very ripe berry fruits, yet is cut with strong acidity as well.

title: Bianchi 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling offers light citrus, burned toast and wet cement aromas. Sour Granny Smith apple flavors show on the palate, which offers a touch of tension.

title: Cline 2016 Cashmere Red (California)
description: Mild wood smoke and black pepper aromas give this Rhône-style blend a spicy start, while good broad black-plum and roast-beef flavors are framed by moderate tannins and acidity for good balance.

title: Crossbarn by Paul Hobbs 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Rich and round, the tannins in this full-bodied wine are sweet and elongated, with a midpalate of cassis, crayon wax and mocha swirling around one another and smoky, toasted oak.

title: Educated Guess 2016 Red (North Coast)
description: This full-bodied wine offers a ripe fruit aroma that is generously shaded by tones of vanilla, nutmeg, cedar and smoke. It has a touch of tannins that strengthen the texture.

title: Prima Materia 2015 Sangiovese
description: This maverick medium-bodied wine has leathery aromas, a touch of iodine in the sour cherry flavors and a firm, moderately tannic texture. The wine is big and brawny in mouthfeel and not very oaky.

title: Barber 2017 Kitten With a Whip Alegria Vineyard Rosé of Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Silky in texture, this is a lovely, memorable and distinct wine, given three hours of skin contact to retain plenty of color, and then fermented and aged in stainless steel. Lemon, strawberry and an exotic twist of wild game all figure into the crisp light-bodied mix.
designation: Kitten With a Whip Alegria Vineyard Rosé of

title: Brecon Estate 2016 Feral Underclass Red (Adelaida District)
description: Freshly smashed raspberries and boysenberries give an impressive freshness to the jammy nose of this blend of 57% Petite Sirah and 43% Zinfandel. It's thick and dense yet lively on the palate, with berry, fennel and mint flavors. The tannins are a bit sticky right now.

title: Cade 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Fragrant in white flowers, this wine offers sizzling freshness and stony backbone. Melon, lemon, lime and tangerine all play a part in contribution to its fruit-forward complexity and long-lasting appeal. Small amounts of Sémillon and Viognier are added.

title: Mill Creek 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Pretty in peach skin, jasmine and vanilla bean, this robust white is rich and layered, with supportive acidity that makes it seem fresh and lively.

title: Millésimé 2015 Le Jardin Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This wine, made from organic grapes by Brittany Rice-Claypool, whose family founded Sunstone Winery, starts with a nearly savory kick of aged goat cheese, saffron, nuts and dried orange peels. The palate is crisp with sunny flavors of lemon and pear, bolstered by well-integrated acid—an uncommon but intriguing Viognier.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 Classic Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft, round and richly constructed, this wine shines in integrated tannin and oak complemented by a wealth of jubilant blackberry, black cherry and mocha.

title: Paraduxx 2017 Rosé (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 88% Syrah and 12% Grenache, some of the fruit high-elevation grown on Howell Mountain, this is an intensely floral and citrusy wine. Lush on the palate, it's ultimately acid-driven and focused in cherry, strawberry and orange.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 D Block Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This bottling is a taste of California's Zinfandel history, coming from a block of heritage clone plantings that were collected from old vineyards around the state. Strawberry sorbet, framboise and hibiscus aromas lead into a crisp, acid-washed palate of red fruit, cinnamon and clove.

title: Pulchella 2015 City Slicker Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark espresso beans, turned earth, dried sage, and a blackberry backdrop show on the nose of this blend of 59% Zinfandel and 41% Petite Sirah. It's dry and dense on the palate, with roasted wood, black-currant and leather flavors.

title: Robert Renzoni 2015 Tempranillo (Temecula Valley)
description: Smoky on the nose, this bottling shows rustic red-fruit aromas alongside new leather and gingersnap scents. That leathery kick shows on the tip of the sip, and then come waves of red cherry, turned earth and more smoke, with a vanilla finish—a great barbecue wine.

title: Fighter Pilot Red 2016 Bailey Ranch Dry-Farmed Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Black-raspberry framboise, smoke, licorice and snapped sagebrush sticks show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is dominated by lovely floral flavors and framed by a chalky structure, offering boysenberry-candy and wild mint elements.

title: Good Vibes Only 2016 Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: This blend of 75% Syrah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon shows lots of lilac and cassis on the dark and juicy nose. There is great depth of flavor on the palate, for blackberry framboise to black currant, proving rather fruity but quite delicious.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Instinctual Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Slightly stewed aromas of red-cherry syrup meet with gravel and wet earth on the nose of this bottling. Baked cherry flavors are paired with vanilla and gingersnaps on the palate, where the acidity steadily rises.

title: Halter Ranch 2017 Rosé (Adelaida District)
description: A beautiful shade of plush pink, this blend of 64% Grenache, 26% Mourvèdre and 10% Picpoul Blanc offers classic aromas of strawberry, melon and bubblegum. It's tightly wound on the palate, but the cherry flavor starts to come through with strength toward the finish.

title: De Loach 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a great value for the quality, a smooth full-bodied appellation red that's bright in acidity and textured tannin. The fruit is dark, brooding and stemmy, with underlying tones of earth and cola spice.

title: Maddalena 2016 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Black plum, fudge, loamy soil and a hint of purple flowers show on the nose of this bottling by the Riboli family. The palate is rich while slightly tangy, offering flavors of black-plum pudding, plum skin, shaved chocolate and a hint of sagebrush.

title: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Sauvignon Blanc (Los Carneros)
description: This wine offers lively acidity broadened by flavors of fig, peach and green apple. Stainless-steel fermented, it remains crisp and focused in the glass, finishing in lemongrass, Meyer lemon and a hint of ginger.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Terraces Pinot Gris (Cienega Valley)
description: This wine has the slightest hue of pink in the glass, and shows aromas of chalk, tangerine pith and botanical elements on the tightly wound nose. The palate is zippy with acidity, offering both red-apple and citrus flavors.

title: Eric Kent 2017 Cuvée Renee Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Grassy with lengthy acidity, this is a robustly fresh, focused and fruity white, with highlights of kumquat, fig and apricot. The midpalate and finish veer into creamier, buttery flavors that provide a welcome lushness of mouthfeel.

title: Flying Goat Cellars 2014 Rio Vista Vineyard 2A Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite rich on the nose, this clonal selection from a vineyard on the eastern edges of the appellation shows licorice, kirsch and tangy sumac aromas. A baked sour cherry flavor shows on the palate alongside red-plum skins and orange rind.

title: Koehler 2015 Sangiovese (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Cranberry, white pepper, dried herbs and wet gravel make for a complex aromatic entry to the nose of this bottling. Bright flavors of red cherry, oregano and rose petals give depth to the lighter-bodied style and make it quite easy to quaff.

title: Martinelli 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Amped up in gritty texture and a big tannin profile, this is robust, richly concentrated red wine, able to deliver expertly on its style. Rich dark cherry, toasted oak and a thick thread of earthiness combine effortlessly and with a tenacity that's impressive.

title: Naggiar 2016 Estate Grown Root 49 Barbera (Sierra Foothills)
description: The tasty fruit flavors ring clear as a bell in this berry- and cherry-drenched and mouth-filling wine. It's grapey in a good way, very open and generous in character, and there's little or no oak to mask the fruit.

title: Townley 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Well balanced and medium bodied, this wine from a unique mountainside vineyard combines good elements of natural acidity for freshness with ripe apple and pear for flavor. A smooth, layered mouthfeel wraps it all up nicely.

title: Wente 2016 Coastal Selection Chardonnay (Central Coast)
description: A blend of grapes from the pioneering family's properties in Livermore and Arroyo Seco, this starts with aromas of pear flesh, lime skin, bright tangerine, honeydew and a touch of chalk. There is a tropical streak to the palate, but it's energetic and balanced, showing flavors of guava, mango and ripe red apple, all honed in by a tight pink-grapefruit-pith structure.

title: 50 Harvests 2014 Meritage (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of 75% Cabernet Sauvignon and 25% Petit Verdot commemorates the number of consecutive harvests by the Scotto family of Steele Canyon Cellars. Candied red fruit gives it broad, lasting richness that lingers across the structured palate.

title: Au Contraire 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: While steely in acidity, this wine offers a counterbalance of fleshy pineapple and mango flavors. It finds a balance between both sides of the equation and also shows great integration with the oak.

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Meaty layers of wild strawberry, peach and cherry shine in this well-integrated wine. It's light in ripeness and entirely refreshing in acidity.
designation: Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of

title: Bernardus 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey County)
description: The 2016 vintage is strong for this well-established winery's Chardonnays, and this twist-top appellation blend is a more affordable way to indulge. Broad, fleshy aromas of ripe Asian pear, sea salt and nectarine tart lead into a rich palate that's rip with lemon and yellow pear but defined by penetrating acidity and decent tension.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Pommard Clone Estate Selection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: A rose-tinged floral aroma opens this wine, giving way to a juicy expression of the grape that is velvety in texture and substantial in tannins. Black cherry and cassis flavors take on a liqueur-like richness, with a lingering tease of tobacco.

title: Castoro Cellars 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Paso Robles)
description: Very easy-to-like aromas of lemon rind, lime pith and light apple blossom make for a refreshing and pleasurable entry to this bottling. There is great grip to the sip, where wet cement minerality meets with grapefruit-juice flavors.

title: Crosby Roamann 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (St. Helena)
description: Big in luscious flavor and ample body and ripeness, this white shines in pear, honeysuckle and vanilla cream, fermented and aged in neutral French oak barrels. It is fleshy and well integrated, with a moderate streak of supportive acidity.

title: Epiphany 2015 Rodney's Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Thick, inky and almost chunky in the glass, this is a powerful wine, starting with aromas of tar, charred meat, oak and blackberry paste. The roasted and charred elements of the palate are balanced by blackberry jam, white pepper and dried herbs, with tarry, sticky tannins coating the entire sip.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Ashley's Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Smoke plays a large role in this wine, starting with the oak and hickory aromas that decorate the sour cherry elements of the nose. Baked cherry shows on the sip before the smoky aspects take hold, which are pleasing and would make a great pairing for a barbecue.

title: Fess Parker 2016 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Quite dense on the nose, this well-priced county-wide blend offers aromas of black currant, roasted berries, charred meat, and lilacs. It's thick on the palate, where the creamy mouthfeel reveals coffee and charred berry flavors.

title: Groth 2016 Hillview Vineyard Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Fleshy and full bodied, this wine shows a pronounced toasted-oak character, with swirls of pineapple and caramel contributing additional richness. Still, it retains enough acidity to offer a juicy core and lasting freshness amidst the fruit.

title: Ledge 2017 MCA James Berry Vineyard Rosé (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: A yellowish shade of pink, this rosé, which is 95% Counoise and 5% Cinsaut, starts with fresh aromas of pluot and bubblegum. The palate is very grippy, slowly releasing flavors of red plum, tangerine and a flash of bubblegum.

title: Neely 2016 Holly's Cuvee Spring Ridge Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Toasted oak, sandalwood, pine, lemon peels and dried apple show on the nose of this bottling from the appellation's northernmost stretches. The palate starts with the freshness of cut lemon before dwelling back on the intense and savory qualities of aged wood and sea salt.

title: Omen 2017 Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: For those who like a hint of sweetness and a ton of dark jammy fruit flavors, this wine is a no-brainer. A blend of 50% Zinfandel plus Barbera, Syrah and Petite Sirah, it smells and tastes chocolaty, berry-like and superripe, and has a velvety texture that soothes the palate.

title: Persona Non Grata 2015 Red (Lake County)
description: Very ripe and concentrated fruit flavors are framed by light oak spices in this full-bodied and round-textured wine. It has a generous mouthfeel, deep black-plum flavors and a good sense of richness, partly due no doubt to a hefty alcohol level.

title: MacLaren 2015 Atoosa's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: One of the coolest sites sourced by the producer, this vineyard produces tiny berries, and the wine is concentrated and complex as a result. Spicy turned earth and baked strawberry show first, followed by clove, black pepper and anise, the wine textured with plenty of acidity.

title: Azur 2017 Dry Rosé (California)
description: Acid-driven and bone dry, this is a thirst-quenching wine with a savory backbone of edgy grapefruit, lemon zest and stony minerality. Integrated and brimming in complexity, it's a fine example of how delicious this category of wine can be when intent and talent meet.

title: Bookshelf 2015 Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: Ripe and delicious, this wine loads up black cherry, blueberry and milk chocolate while a soothing, soft texture helps coat the palate. It's not a typical dinner-table red wine but it is definitely luxurious and flavorful.

title: Andis 2015 Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This dry, well-structured wine has firm tannins and persistent acidity matched by ripe and spicy blackberry and black-cherry flavors. It will shine when served with a roast or chop.

title: Brecon Estate 2017 True Acacia Head Albariño (Central Coast)
description: Tangy lime-skin aromas meet with yellow pear flesh and a touch of honey on the nose of this bottling, which gains nuance from the acacia wood treatment. There is grippy texture on the palate, where citrus acidity cuts through the Pink Lady apple flavors.

title: Caricature 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: A Port-like ripeness in the aroma leads to lush, chocolaty flavors that range from superripe black plums to blueberry syrup. The wine is full bodied, rich and viscous in texture, with mild tannins and soft acidity for balance.

title: LangeTwins 2015 Old Vine Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Tantalizing oak and rich fruit flavors vie for attention in this full-bodied, firmly tannic and well-structured wine. It has plenty of concentration with, boysenberry jam aromas, lush fruit and chocolate flavors.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Reserve Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Sourced from four vineyards across the county, this white offers concentrated aromas of jasmine and honeyed oak. Fully lush and high toned, it is robust in texture and grit on the midpalate, with a lasting taste of vanilla oak.

title: Donkey & Goat 2016 Ramato Filigreen Farm Pinot Gris (Anderson Valley)
description: Not at all what most would expect from a Pinot Gris, this wine is rosé in color, has plenty of body despite low alcohol and drinks almost like a Pinot Noir. The watermelon aromas and plummy, earthy flavors accompany a generous texture and nip of tannin. Biodynamic grapes were fermented with native yeast and not filtered.

title: Folktale 2017 Talking Animals Petillant-Naturel Grenache Blanc (Monterey County)
description: Very cloudy in the glass and exuberant with bubbles, this fun and whimsically labeled bottling from Mission Ranch Vineyard shows crisp apple, poached pear and a slight funkiness on the nose. Ripping acidity frames the wildly effervescent palate, where a steely minerality meets with Asian pear and grapefruit flavors.

title: Gibbs 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: A great value, this wine offers perfumed oak and notes of jasmine and white flowers. Salty caramel pretzel flavors accentuate a bigger, bolder take on fruit-forward freshness and voluptuous texture.

title: J. Lohr 2016 Wildflower Valdiguié (Monterey)
description: This bottling of an obscure grape originally from France shows crushed violets and tart boysenberry on the nose. Best served with a slight chill, it packs black plum skin, potpourri and marjoram flavors onto the palate. It is both refreshing and satisfying.

title: Kelleher 2015 Three Sisters Unfiltered Don Miguel Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Lush and expansive, with moderate oak and acidity, this is a big, bolder style of white, mineral in stone and rock, with exotic fruit flavors of apple and pineapple. A trace of green olive lingers on the succulent finish.
designation: Three Sisters Unfiltered Don Miguel Vineyard

title: MacLaren 2015 Drouthy Neebors Syrah (Sonoma County)
description: This combines fruit from Bennett Valley as well as several vineyard designates within the producer's portfolio. Bay leaf, eucalyptus and cool-climate tart red fruit accentuate the crisp focused acidity.

title: Monte Volpe 2017 Rosato of Sangiovese (Mendocino County)
description: This light copper-colored wine is crisp, almost steely, light-bodied and refreshing. It is bone dry, extremely appetizing, and offers lean raspberry flavors backed by good acidity.

title: Naggiar 2016 Root 49 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Sierra Foothills)
description: Complex aromas, concentrated fruit flavors and a firm structure add up to a very good full-bodied wine. It offers cinnamon and ginger aromas, adds superripe black cherries on the palate and has a lingering, baking-spice finish.

title: Newton 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: This is a robustly tannic and powerful wine, its entry laced in peppercorn and crushed rock-like dust. Pencil shavings, dried herb, cedar and clove continue on the savory theme. An underlying earthiness barely tames the cassis-like fruit.

title: Neyers 2015 Neyers Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the producer's home site, this wine opens with a tobacco-laden nose, leading to a palate with moderate structure and plenty of grip. Savory in character, this is defined by tones of dried herb, cassis and toasted oak.

title: Niner 2016 Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Roasted red-cherry and wet gravel aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the Jespersen Ranch. The palate is soft and mellow, framed by strong acidity and displaying tightly woven tones of red fruits and chaparral spice. It's mouthwatering into the finish.

title: Oak Farm 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Lodi)
description: Mouthwatering and crisp, this medium-bodied wine has bright aromas of kiwi and citrus. It's fresh and vibrant in character, backed by a tangy underscore.

title: California Roots 2015 Red (California)
description: A good amount of fruit concentration gives this medium-bodied wine likeable aromas and flavors, while a soft smooth texture and a dab of sweetness make it easy on the palate.

title: Line 39 2016 Excursion Red (California)
description: Plenty of grapey, jammy aromas and flavors fill this medium-bodied wine to the rim. It is lightly sweet, very fruity, and smooth and soft in texture.

title: Lucinda & Millie 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Chardonnay (Mendocino)
description: Delicate apple, pear and mineral flavors give a fruity but lean personality to this light-bodied wine. It makes good, basic refreshment.

title: Apothic 2015 Inferno Red (California)
description: A strong, smoky aroma and equally obvious oak flavors dominate this very full-bodied and fairly smooth-textured wine that was aged in whiskey barrels. It's a one-note song, recommended for people who really like that note.

title: Merriam 2014 Bacigalupi Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is somewhat dull in texture and elusive in fruit, offering a strong sense of oak and sulfur.

title: Eden Ridge 2013 Barrel Select Red (California)
description: This medium-bodied straightforward wine has good fruit flavors and a few hints of black pepper and tobacco to keep it interesting. The texture is smooth and only a light touch of tannin shows through.

title: Firefly Ridge 2015 The Red Flash Red (California)
description: This wine has respectable but generic fruit flavors, a soft texture and a touch of sugar to round off its edges. It is light to medium bodied and tastes low in acidity.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Small Lot Chardonnay (Sonoma Valley)
description: This wine is severe in acidity, with a somewhat jarring lack of fruit. Butterscotch and melted butter develop in the glass for a lingering richness.

title: Madrigal 2014 Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is slightly bittersweet and off-putting, with a dullness to the texture.

title: Trecini 2015 Merlot (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is extreme in bay leaf and green, herbal flavors, with a touch of oxidation.

title: Austin Hope 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Vintner Austin Hope, whose family is intertwined in the rise of Paso Robles, spent years working to release a wine of this caliber. Dark and thick in the glass, aromas of black currant and blueberry meet with roasted coffee, chocolate syrup and baked plum on the wondrous nose. The palate is soft and extremely expressive, with blueberry, black pepper, firm midpalate tannins and a finish that's redolent of cappuccino candies.

title: Crown Point 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A deep, velvety purple color in the glass, this bottling by proprietor Roger Bower and winemaker Adam Henkel shows dark-chocolate-covered black cherries, fresh blackberry, white pepper, violet oil, port reduction sauce and spice sake on the lavish nose. Firm tannins frame the palate, which carries black currant and roasted lean beef flavors through soy and pepper sauce into a finish of caramel and espresso grinds.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Allen Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine takes a light-handed approach, allowing its soul to speak quietly in a blur of perfumed rose petal, lavender and wildflower. The expansive, velvety palate offers highlights of pomegranate, strawberry and freshly squeezed citrus, with pronounced earthy sensations of crushed rock, salt and turned earth.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Rochioli Riverblock Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine offers incredibly inviting aromas and a fresh, vibrant fruit-driven framework which suggests long-term potential. Youthfully gritty tannins hide beneath a forceful foundation of black raspberry, rose petal and warm baking spice, with a hint of dried herb creeping in. Enjoy 2020–2025.

title: Daou 2014 Soul of a Lion Red (Adelaida District)
description: A sultry shade of dark purple, this luxury bottling by the Daou brothers shows freshly smashed black currant, gravelly minerality, black pepper, espresso and shaved chocolate on the nose. The palate is black to the core, from blueberry to dark chocolate to lava rocks, with strong yet polished tannins and well-balanced acidity. Decant now or drink 2020–2035.

title: Crown Point 2014 Estate Selection Limited Production Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Extremely dense in the glass, this epic bottling offers lavish and penetrating aromas of black currant and elderberry jam on the nose alongside seared beef, chocolate cake and a pinch of violet. Expertly balanced, polished tannins make for a soft mouthfeel yet firm structure, carrying flavors of black fruit, chocolate and grilled figs that lead to an espresso note on the finish.

title: Hall 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: Deliciously crafted and full-bodied ripe, this shows dense layers of blackberry and blueberry crumble succulence and richness, well-etched flavors that are wrapped in soft integrated oak. Juicy and earthy, it offers length and breadth, the tannins roundly structured. Memorable seasonings include chocolate and clove. Enjoy best 2024–2034.

title: Martinelli 2015 Bella Vigna Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Perfumed and meaty, this coastal wine offers strong elements of cured bacon and intense hints of smoke. The nose is additionally gorgeous in rose and dried herbes de Provence. Crisp, savory fruit gives it freshness and complexity, a succulent tartness that lingers a long time on the palate.

title: Pence 2015 Rosa Estate Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: One of the better Chardonnays tasted in recent years from the Central Coast, this bottling by proprietor Blair Pence is both brisk and warm on the nose, with lemon balm, crushed limestone and yuzu cutting through white peach and butter. The tactile chalkiness on the sip is remarkable, carrying flavors of lime pith, Asian pear, sea salt, shaved lemongrass and lime leaf.

title: Cinnabar 2014 Malbec (Red Hills)
description: Combining hyper-concentrated fruit flavors with enticing, sophisticated oak nuances, this wine is a gentle giant. The first thing to notice is the lightly spicy, toasted-baguette aroma, and then the palate floods with saturated, ripe and delicious blackberry and black-cherry flavors, while notes of dark chocolate and black pepper kick in on the finish. This wine ranks with the best yet from Lake County. Best after 2020.

title: Epoch 2014 Sensibility Paderewski Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Elegance, depth and power rise to the stage in this bottling by Jordan Fiorentini, who packs in aromas of concentrated red cherry, turned loam, bay leaf and packed rose petals. The mouthfeel is lavish at first, and then the tannins firm up, delivering flavors of cherry compote, orange rind and rosebuds. Zesty acidity runs throughout.

title: Longboard 2014 Savage Côast Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Made from four lots of Syrah and tiny additions of Grenache, Petite Sirah, Carignan, Malbec and Zinfandel, this is a blockbuster—thick and concentrated in tones of baked fruit, leather and black pepper. Viscous in wild notions of black licorice and dried herb, it retains fresh, vibrant acidity that counterbalances its innate strength.

title: MCV 2015 Rosewynn Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Matt Villard's focus on Petite Sirah delivers standout results in this voluptuous bottling, starting with a nose that's heavy in black currant and caramel ripeness yet cut by a savory core of charred beef, peppercorn and crushed slate. The palate matches the nose, with flavors of dense black fruit, more meat and white pepper riding lively acidity into the finish.

title: Nellcôte 2014 Rallye 76 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 7% Petit Verdot, this is a juicy wine, with tones of black cherry, sage and cedar. While hearty in structure, the oak is well integrated on the palate, giving it a soft, smooth feel and a persistence of bold flavors.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2016 Regan Vineyard Partners' Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Dense aromas of black cherry, lilacs and spice cake show on the hearty nose of this bottling from a vineyard in the Watsonville area. Polished tannins provide grip without being sticky, delivering flavors of alpine strawberry, black raspberry, lavender and sagebrush. It is extremely cohesive with fiery acidity.

title: Spottswoode 2014 Lyndenhurst Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: To call this a second label of Spottswoode's isn't quite fair, it's such a well-made, thoughtfully considered wine in its own right. Juicy black currant, tart cranberry, licorice and clove meet a wall of toasted oak and chocolate in a medium-bodied, approachable and properly balanced expression of the variety that will impress seekers of restraint and grace.

title: Williams Selyem 2015 Bucher Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smoky bark permeates the nose in this wine from a site along Westside Road in the heart of the appellation. While brooding in black cherry and strawberry flavors, it's also stemmy and earthy, with an underlying succulence and flashing acidity that makes it juicy and delicious.

title: Dragonette 2015 Radian Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Earthy, forest floor aromas of mulberry, damp sage, bay leaf and elderflower show on the unique nose of this bottling from a dramatically set vineyard on the southwestern edge of the appellation. There's an Old World sensibility to the palate, full of dried flowers, dust and wood spice, with elegantly dried, slightly tart berry fruit and a touch of caramel on the deep finish.

title: Epoch 2014 Authenticity Syrah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Thick in the glass, this bottling, which includes 11% Mourvèdre, shows deep black currant, crushed slate and black plum on the darkly spiced nose. The palate shows cracked pepper and a black-fruit sauce, but it is the texture that's most compelling, proving smooth, thick and plush, yet not overly tannic, with a boisterous acidity that rises into the finish.

title: FEL 2015 Ferrington Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This generous wine has abundant fruit flavors and a warm, broad palate-feel that makes it very welcoming and delicious. Red and black cherries and hints of vanilla in the aroma lead to rich dark plum and black cherry on the palate, while the texture is velvety due to mild tannins and full body.

title: Lava Cap 2015 Estate Bottled Reserve Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied, enormously flavorful wine offers potent blueberry and blackberry flavors and a sturdy tannic texture. A slight sense of reserve from the fine-grained tannins and good acidity make it especially appetizing and protein friendly.

title: Saldo 2015 Zinfandel (California)
description: This is a beautifully polished, full-flavored wine from the producer of The Prisoner. It has a captivating, velvety texture, mouthfilling blackberry and black-cherry flavors and a warm coating of perfumed but subtle oak permeating from the first whiff to the lingering finish.

title: Soquel Vineyards 2016 Partners' Reserve Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: Very rich aromas of black cherry pudding, vanilla paste and caramel are lifted by rose petals and purple flowers on the nose of this estate-grown bottling. The palate is framed by strong tannins and bright acidity, showing flavors of black pepper, black plum skins and more lilac-like florality.

title: The Hilt 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Oak-roasted black plums, nutmeg, pressed purple flowers and acai aromas make for a smoky yet floral nose on this bottling. There's a flash of sweeter boysenberry at the tip of the sip, and then it tightens around crushed rose petals and dark slate. Structurally firm, built-to-last, it is still a tad young.

title: Potek 2013 Mormann Vineyard Syrah (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Vibrant aromas of freshly plucked violets, lavender, black tobacco and white pepper make for a very beautiful and fulfilling nose on this cool-climate bottling. The palate is fresh and bursting with flavors of smashed boysenberries and rose petals, with a savory touch of rosemary oil.

title: Red Thread Wines 2015 Red (Howell Mountain)
description: This powerhouse wine combines 40% Zinfandel, 35% Petite Sirah and 25% Cabernet Sauvignon into a seriously big lush wine. Crayon wax, pencil and white pepper open things up before soft integrated tannins relax the palate, making way for blackberry, cherry and cured meat.

title: Ziata 2014 Mia Madre Red (Napa Valley)
description: This hearty red is driven by 61% Malbec, which is blended with 28% Cabernet Sauvignon, 10% Cabernet Franc and 1% Petit Verdot. Inviting in black cherry and blackberry, it offers lifted acidity despite its wraparound oak and robust mouthfeel. The finish lingers on black pepper and tobacco tones.

title: Dragonette 2015 Duvarita Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Crystallized lemon-peel aromas meet with nectarine on the pure, laser-focused nose of this bottling from a vineyard that's even more coastal than the nearby Sta. Rita Hills. Crisp apple, sea salt, butter and more lemon rind show on the sip, where tension gives backbone to the midpalate richness.

title: Etude 2015 Heirloom Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Juicy, tart and refreshing in acidity, this wine's core is defined in savory black tea and cardamom, and highlighted with bold swathes of orange zest and strawberry that linger around the spice. Medium bodied, it's well-integrated in oak and moderate concentration.

title: Grgich Hills 2013 Estate Grown Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Fresh and earthy, despite a complete embrace of ripeness, this complex red is lovely and memorable in a constructed blur of dried herb, wild strawberry and vanilla. The oak is integrated and supportive, helping to echo a delightful nuance of white pepper.

title: Kenwood 2014 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Bay leaf and cedar show up on the nose of this wine, which is juicy and brawny on the palate, with a savory edge of black pepper, clove and soy. Structured, it offers power and plenty of fruit-forward flavor.

title: Kitá 2017 Camp 4 Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Rounded and light aromas of apple and pear lean more sweet than grassy on the nose of this bottling. There is compelling texture on the palate, with approachable flavors of red apple, ripe pears and a flash of bubblegum.

title: Atrea 2017 Skid Rosé of Malbec (Mendocino County)
description: Made from Malbec grapes, this wine has a light peachy amber color, aromas like apricot skin and very dry, bracing and tart flavors. It's quite lean, restrained and tangy and needs an audience that values those qualities.

title: Barton 2017 Holiday Clairette (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: This is a brand new variety for the region and it shows promise in this early stage as a standalone grape. Aromas of tropical mango, papaya and ripe pear are framed by a chalky minerality, while the palate lands a bit fat, with flavors of Pink Lady apple, yellow pear and wet gravel.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 J.D. Hurley Merlot (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Strong aromas of cedar and pipe tobacco meet with dried cherry on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard south of San Jose. That pipe tobacco element is also heavy on the palate, along with wood spice and dark intense red fruit.

title: MCV 2017 Pink Rosé (Paso Robles)
description: A beautiful shade of rose-petal pink, this bottling offers tangy aromas of raspberry, cran-pomegranate and a touch of pink lemonade on the nose. That tangy pomegranate flavor sails into the palate.

title: R Collection 2016 Lot No 3 Chardonnay (California)
description: The richness of this wine doesn't become apparent until the flavors and texture hit the palate. It smells herbal and spicy, like white pepper and fennel, then tastes much more buttery and ripe and has a broad mouthfeel.

title: Sanford 2014 La Rinconada Vineyard Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling is quite shy on the nose at this point of its life, offering faint aromas of pear flesh, chalk and preserved lemon. There is fairly light acid on the palate, which shows pear, nectarine, vanilla and toast flavors.

title: Tangent 2016 Stone Egg Paragon Vineyard Albariño (Edna Valley)
description: Crushed lime, wild lime leaves, lemongrass and jicama also pick up a gin-like botanical aroma on the nose of this bottling. Sour lime-skin and green-pear-rind flavors show on the tense palate.

title: V. Sattui 2013 Reserve Stock Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a thick, full-bodied and herbal reserve wine, light in fruit while robust in oak, the elements integrated and textured. Cedar and dried herb coat the finish, with a lasting taste of graphite.

title: Christophe 2014 Explorer's Series Cabernet Sauvignon (Oak Knoll District)
description: Dusty in clove and tobacco, this is a full-bodied fleshy wine of sizable richness that offers a taste of blackberry cobbler and dark chocolate.

title: Gnarly Head 2016 Old Vine Zin Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This wine is very generous in fruit aromas and flavors, showing ripe and vivid red cherry, strawberry and plum, with light oak shadings and a smooth, almost soft texture. It's charming and easy to drink.

title: Heath Vineyards 2015 Pinot Noir (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Roasted black cherries, kirsch and vanilla show on the nose of this rather extracted take on the grape. Rich loamy flavors of cooked berries, vanilla and prominent oak appear on the sip, which has a decent tannic structure.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: There's a petrol kick to the nose of this bottling, along with aromas of dried grass and hay. It's tightly wound on the palate, with a citrusy freshness as well as wet grass flavors.

title: Le Casque 2015 Cabernet Franc (Sierra Foothills)
description: This handsomely oaked and nicely mature wine has aromas like cedar and sunbaked earth, and flavors like plums and mulled wine backed by moderate tannins and full body. The mouthfeel is broad and smooth.

title: Mad Housewife 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Great balance and tasty red-cherry and raspberry flavors make this medium-bodied non-oaky wine very attractive and honest-tasting. It has good concentration, a smooth mouthfeel and just a slight touch of tannin for an appetizing texture.

title: Baldacci 2014 Allwin Syrah (Carneros)
description: A 100% varietal wine from estate-grown grapes, this opens in crayon wax, dark plum and cherry, with a thickness on the palate that's both full bodied and overtly ripe. Concentrated and tannic, it's made in a big style that persists on the finish in oak.

title: Bliss 2014 Estate Bottled Zinfandel (Mendocino)
description: Nicely dry and well balanced, this is an appetizing medium-bodied wine that offers no-nonsense cherry and berry flavors and a lightly tannic, almost crisp, texture that will be a good palate cleanser.

title: Boatique 2017 Sauvignon Blanc
description: This is a lively thirst-quenching style of wine, like adult lemonade, that blends good acidity with a sense of ripeness or sweetness and relatively full body. It has a firm but smooth texture and appealing, subtle melon and fig flavors.

title: MCV 2017 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Somewhat exotic aromas of wild lime and Anjou pear show on the nose of this bottling. Pink Lady apple and riper pear flavors show on the palate, which shows decent restraint for this grape, especially in a warmer region.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 English Hill Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is boisterous and full of energy, featuring juicy bolts of strawberry and citrus seasoned in dried herb and plenty of earthiness. Bright and acid-driven, it's light and made in a style that will rightfully please fans of more restrained wines.

title: Le P'tit Paysan 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Warm aromas of baked red cherry and caramel grow more complex due to a gravelly minerality and hints of peppercorns on the nose of this bottling by Ian Brand. The palate leads with oregano and pepper, those spices overwhelming the fruit, and the rocky minerality continues, leading into a cocoa-laced finish. It is a lithe and lively style of Cab.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 Classic Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: A broad-shouldered, fruit-forward wine with plenty of ripeness, this is blended with a hearty 15% Petite Sirah. Cherry, blackberry, vanilla and peppery cinnamon take turns on the rich, concentrated palate, finishing on an oaky tone.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2015 Old Camp Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Pretty on the nose in floral freshness, this wine offers big bold flavors of smoked cherry, stemmy earth and a bite of citrus that keeps it intriguing and bright. Tart complementary flavors of pomegranate and strawberry persist pleasurably on the light-bodied palate.

title: Senders 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Oak Knoll District)
description: Stainless steel-aged, this delightful white shows high-toned floral characteristics of apricot and green apple, with a medium-bodied oomph of creamy lushness on the finish. It'll do well with food or on its own.

title: Six Sigma Ranch 2014 Diamond Mine Cuvée Red (Lake County)
description: This big but superbly polished wine shows a great sense of finesse along with abundant fruit and spice flavors. The aromas are at once bright, spicy and like new leather, while the flavors evoke black cherry, black currant and blueberry.

title: Tablas Creek 2015 Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: Dense aromas of black-plum syrup are fruit-forward and plump but not sweet on the nose of this bottling from the producer who brought this grape to California. A chalky, very full mouthfeel carries flavors of black plum, fennel and pepper.

title: Tercero 2016 Cinsault (Santa Barbara County)
description: Larry Schaffer isn't afraid to tackle obscure blending grapes and throw them in the bottle alone. This large grape produces a lighter, fresh wine, showing red plum skins, strawberry, rose petals, sumac and pepper on the nose, like an herbally enhanced fruit punch. The palate carries forth with juicy, rounded red melon and bubblegum flavors and buoyant acidity.

title: The Endless Summer 2014 Montfort Vineyards Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Extremely fruity and relatively light in body, this exuberant wine is easy to quaff. The strawberry and cherry flavors are so ripe and fresh they taste sweet, and the texture is soft and full with very little tannin.

title: ZD 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: Big flavors and a broad, mouthfilling texture help this barrel-fermented beauty stand out. Vanilla, custard and melted butter aromas lead to similarly rich flavors on the palate, where the wine feels layered and concentrated.

title: Big Basin 2014 Gabilan Mountains G-S-M (Monterey County)
description: The 49% Grenache shows strongly on the nose of this bottling, which also includes 32% Mourvèdre and 19% Syrah, with aromas of rose petals, hibiscus, fruit punch and exotic red spices on the nose. The palate is lighter bodied and very quaffable, with flavors of dark hibiscus and red plum. The tannins are a bit firm and need some time to smooth.

title: Drew 2015 Valenti Ranch Chardonnay (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This wine, from a tiny mountainside vineyard, has an especially deep gold color, bold aromas of orange zest and peaches, and rich but bright fruit flavors shaded by mineral and spice notes. It feels full in body and viscous in texture, giving a lot of palate impact.

title: Fenestra 2012 Thatcher Bay Vineyard Merlot (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine brings richness and ripe opulent flavors to the fore. Tobacco, cedar and black-plum aromas come before blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors while firm tannins and good acidity wrap around the palate for support.

title: Grgich Hills 2015 Estate Grown Fumé Blanc Dry Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This wine offers a lovely balance of dry, oaky substance on a well-framed, light body. The palate is fresh and fruity, with an exotic core of papaya, lemon and butter that's bolstered by succulent freshness and a lush backbone.

title: Jaffurs 2016 Thompson Vineyard Petite Sirah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Rounded aromas of black cherry, cola and vanilla meet with more intense expressions of violet and white pepper on the nose of this wine, one of the few Petite Sirahs grown in this county. Black-cherry syrup meets with savory tones of toasted beef and black pepper on the palate, which is framed by polished tannins.

title: Krupp Brothers 2015 Black Bart Syrah (Napa Valley)
description: Hugely concentrated and ripely fleshy, this big broad-shouldered wine features rustic and robust flavors of leather, black pepper and clove wrapped in black fig and berry. The tannins are thick but supportive, youthful in their integration.

title: 13th & Third 2016 Lily White (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 44% Grenache Blanc, 38% Roussanne, 11% Viognier and 7% Picpoul is tightly wound on the nose, offering soft aromas of ambrosia melon and a hint of daffodil. The wine is clean and easy on the palate, with delicately ripe flavors of stone fruit, melon and honey dust.

title: Ancient Peaks 2014 Petite Sirah (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Fresh violets and rose petals make for a florally dominated nose, but there's also blackberry sorbet on this bottling. Crisp flavors of violet, blackberry paste and blueberry make for a fulfilling sip.

title: Bonterra 2015 Made with Organic Grapes Merlot (California)
description: This elegant medium-bodied wine has everything in place, from fresh plummy aromas to warm layered flavors to an appetizing and moderately tannic texture. It has excellent balance, with a sense of freshness and depth that is compelling.

title: Cabana Wines 2011 Nebbiolo (Amador County)
description: Leather and barnyard aromas add complexity without taking over this rich, earthy, smooth-textured and full-bodied wine. Complex flavors like tobacco, rhubarb, black pepper and wild blackberry fill the palate and moderate tannins provide some needed grip. It's on the wild side, for adventurous drinkers.

title: Midnight 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Quite spicy on the nose, this bottling shows myrrh and cedar against rich black plum aromas in the background. That wood spice and cigar box element plays on the palate too, wrapping up the carnation, rose water and soft plum and strawberry flavors, The tannins firm up on the finish.

title: Midnight 2017 Chardonnay (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Broad aromas of poached pear and coconut oil prove fairly ripe but clean and inviting on the nose of this bottling. Ripe apples and pears show on the palate, along with another flash of coconut flake.

title: Rideau 2015 Enchevetre Rouge Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: Concentrated aromas of cherry syrup, new leather and turned earth show on the nose of this blend of 54% Petite Sirah, 23% Grenache and 23% Mourvèdre. The palate is surprisingly quite light and shy, with red fruit and a hint of pepper.

title: Sanford 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The somewhat shy nose in this appellation blend from a tough vintage shows earthy dried sage and sour red-cherry aromas. Fresh red fruit and red flowers arise on the mellow palate.

title: Covenant 2017 Red C Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: This wine starts citrus-driven and bright in acidity before evolving in the glass to take on more power and richness, a mix of stone fruit and melon.

title: Fess Parker 2015 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: The nose on this bottling is gamy and dank, with tarry aromas coating the lilac and black-currant scents. There's a caramel-like touch to the tip of the sip, where solid acid and tannins deliver mellow and easy-to-enjoy blackberry flavors.

title: Grey Wolf Cellars 2015 Alpha Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Loamy aromas, red plums and dried red flowers are rather restrained on the nose of this bottling, which includes 10% Malbec, 10% Petit Verdot and 5% Cabernet Franc. The palate is very clean and dense with red fruit and lifted by dried herbs.

title: Holme Estate Cellars 2014 Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: Relatively mellow on the nose, this bottling shows black-plum jam with hints of smoke, baking spice and crushed gravel aromas. Blackberry and more brown spice show on the palate, which is clean, fresh and easy to quaff.

title: J Wilkes 2016 Lagrein (Paso Robles)
description: A bit shy on the nose, this bottling of a rarely seen Italian grape offers earthy and rocky aromas as well as very dark fruit. The palate is very mineral-driven, with crushed black-rock flavors, dried berry fruit and tightly wound tannins that leave the mouth coated.

title: Andrew Murray 2016 Tous les Jours Syrah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Always one of the best Syrahs on the broad market for a fair price, this year's Tous les Jours is slightly less exciting than in years past, but still delivers the goods. Aromas of purple flowers and snappy boysenberry lead into a palate that's extremely fresh and vibrant with rounded berry flavors.

title: B.R. Cohn 2016 Silver Label Cabernet Sauvignon (North Coast)
description: This is an unoaky, medium-bodied wine that will please a lot of people. It has generous fruity flavors like blackberry and dark grapes, a nearly dry balance, soft tannins and a smooth texture.

title: Bella Luna 2017 Bella Bianca White (San Benito County)
description: Really taut and tangy on the nose, this blend of 50% Tocai Friulano and 50% Arneis shows lime peels, sweetgrass, green apple and brine on the nose. The palate is zippy, showing more tangy citrus rinds and underripe orange flavors—altogether a unique flavor profile.

title: Blair Estate 2015 Pinot Gris (Arroyo Seco)
description: Lemon cream, honeydew, honeysuckle and toast aromas show on the nose of this bottling. There is a citrusy boost to the palate, where orange-sorbet and lemon-spritz flavors arise.

title: Provenance Vineyards 2016 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Rutherford)
description: Bright and focused, this wine is full of gravelly minerality and wet stone grit, with vibrant shakes of lemon peel and grapefruit. The freshness hides a robust weight and full-figured ripeness.

title: Rideau 2015 Thompson Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Dark red fruit, red flowers and baking spice show on the rather subtle nose of this bottling. It's medium bodied on the palate, where smashed berry and cherry flavors are lifted by anise and finish on a vanilla note.

title: Roblar 2016 Stone Oven Red (California)
description: This is a very drinkable, easygoing wine, offering aromas of plummy red fruit, hibiscus and pomegranate. The palate tastes very much like the Mexican hibiscus-based drink Agua de Jamaica, proving fruity and simple but rather delicious and refreshing.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2014 Estate Vineyards Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This tastes of graham cracker crust and blackberry jam— a rich expression of the variety that offers a juicy and soft midpalate of rounded richness. The finish is slightly spicy in black pepper and clove, with a lasting note of smoke.

title: Sevtap 2016 Grenache Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light aromas of orange and apple show on the easy-to-like nose of this crisp bottling. There is a nice tightness to the sip, where lemon pith and tangy apple-skin flavors arise.

title: Silver Ghost 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: A wine made in tribute to the 1909 Rolls Royce, this offers hearty elements of smoke and oak alongside soft, muddled layers of blackberry and cured meat. It's powerfully ripe and concentrated.

title: Chiron Wines 2016 Los Hermanitos Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Roasted red-cherry aromas meet with dried herbs and a cedar kick on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows punchy flavors of red currant and red cherry, lifted by touches of tarragon and light pepper spice.

title: Parmeson 2015 Alegria Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From a field blend of mostly Zinfandel with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Alicante Bouschet and other varieties, this wine is surprisingly bright in red and black fruit, and with lifted acidity. Earthy elements of grilled mushroom, cedar and sage add complexity and seasoning.

title: Resign 2016 Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: Smoky oak and generous tannins coat the palate of this big-boned, concentrated wine. It is brimming in flavors of blackberry, licorice and lavender.

title: Westerly 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Toasty aromas of lemon rind, white flowers and a hint of smoke show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is quite broad, ranging from nectarine to citrus, which will please a wide variety of tastes.

title: Alara 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Stewed red-fruit flavors of strawberry-balsamic sauce and red and black licorice show on the nose of this bottling. Intense gingerbread flavors meet with ripe red cherry and mulberry on the palate, which is very ripe.

title: Ancient Peaks 2016 Zinfandel (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Muddled black plums, dark cocoa, loamy soil and Chinese five-spice show on the nose of this always reliable bottling from the southern end of Paso Robles. Rounded and nearly sweet flavors of fig cake and plum show on the broad palate, where acid persists lightly into the finish.

title: Bernardus 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rose petals, candied raspberry, watermelon Jolly Rancher and a touch of crushed slate show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate offers fairly ripe cranberry-sauce flavors that are cut by orange rinds and framed with decent acidity and tense tannins.

title: Castoro Cellars 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
