description: Blackened berries, tar, turned earth and caramel aromas show on the nose of this reliable and fairly priced bottling. Blackberry and black plum meet with wild mint and tobacco leaf on the palate, which finishes on a squeaky tannins.

title: Dunning Vineyards 2014 4 Hearts Vineyard Reserve Petite Sirah (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Opaque in the glass, this bottling shows extremely dense and extracted aromas of kirsch, chocolate syrup, caramel and a hint of mint on the nose. It is suave and creamy on the palate, yet rather thick with unctuous flavors of roasted black plum and coffee liqueur. Acid arises on the finish.

title: Easton 2014 Three of a Kind Ridgewood Vineyard Old Vine Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: An attractive oak element in the aroma leads to good, satisfying fruit flavors on the palate and some oak spice accents like vanilla and nutmeg. The wine is a Bordeaux-style blend with noticeable acidity and tannins and is full bodied.
designation: Three of a Kind Ridgewood Vineyard Old Vine

title: Girasole 2017 Chardonnay (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is very smooth and flavorful, on the oaky, buttery side of the spectrum but doing it well. Aromas like untoasted oak and butterscotch are vivid but not too strong and the flavors add in ample pear and baking spices.

title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Dry Rosé of Carignane (Lodi)
description: This is a very good dry wine that's quite fresh, well balanced and thirst quenching. Raspberry and watermelon flavors are buoyed by good fruit acidity for a tangy mouthfeel.
designation: Jessie's Collection Estate Grown Dry Rosé of

title: Kokomo 2016 Pauline's Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Velvety thick and pleasantly concentrated, this is a burly, big-boned and richly defined wine. It's also a celebration of blackberry jam that's accented in smoke and leather.

title: La Crema 2016 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a great value for a wine of esteemed provenance. It is tannic and savory with a delicately fruity profile of citrus, black tea and rose. Balanced, it shows varietal character for a fair price.

title: Mahoney 2016 Gavin Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Heady in vanilla brioche and sugary aromas, this wine has a steely midpalate that takes on a lushness toward the finish, a mix of baked apple and sweet cinnamon.

title: Meiomi 2017 Rosé (California)
description: Flavors like canteloupe and a full body to carry them make this a full-flavored and mouth-filling wine. It has a feeling of richness and weight on the palate that will pair nicely with bold foods like pulled pork and Thai barbecue.

title: Oso Libre 2013 Querida Red (Adelaida District)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon and 50% Merlot offers aromas of blackberry, purple flowers and a fig balsamic glaze on the nose. The palate is extremely tangy, offering fresh flavors of blackberry and peppery spice.

title: Robert Biale 2016 Basic Black Red (Sonoma County-Napa County)
description: The majority of the fruit for this wine comes from Sonoma County (59%), the rest from Napa Valley, the whole made from cofermented Grenache, Early Burgundy, Tempranillo, Syrah, Carignan and Zinfandel. Together they offer a touch of reduction, black fruit and leather around dried herb and cedar notes.

title: Terragena 2017 Abbassi Vineyard Rosé of Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: From a single site, this is a saignée of wine that is stainless-steel fermented and retentive in high-toned acidity. Peach-skin and lemon-peel flavors highlight a dry austere style that doesn't overwhelm.

title: Chandon NV Brut Sparkling (California)
description: Made from a majority of Chardonnay, with smaller additions of Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier, this wine is golden in color with accompanying flavors of golden apple, brioche and sweet peach. Likably round and just the right amount of rich, it will please a crowd.

title: Chandon NV Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: Dark in color, this is a richly rounded sparkling blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Noir and Pinot Meunier. Strawberry shortcake and peach play effortlessly along the light palate, exuberantly floral and fruity before finishing dry.

title: Peltier 2016 Black Diamond Estate Grown Rosé (Lodi)
description: Airy and delicate, this light-bodied wine made from Cabernet Sauvignon smells floral and tastes like strawberries and watermelon. A smooth, almost soft texture continues the gentle impression.

title: Row Eleven 2014 Pinot Noir (Napa Valley)
description: Raspberry and strawberry coulis meet forest floor, toasted clove and smoky oak in this full bodied, robust red wine. Around its core of concentration is a streak of tingling acidity that allows it to find a modicum of balance.

title: SeaGlass 2016 Unoaked Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Simple and light aromas of cut apple and apple blossom open up with time on the nose of this bottling. There is decent grip to the sip and a strong tactile sensation, giving depth to the flavors of tuberose and poached pears. It is a solid example of unoaked Chardonnay.

title: Suveg 2016 Viognier (Lodi)
description: Floral and citrus aromas meet almond and honeysuckle flavors in this medium-bodied, full-flavored and unoaked wine. It has the palate impact of a big Chardonnay but a different array of flavors to explore.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Nikiara Red (Paso Robles)
description: Strong, fruit-punch aromas of red apple, melon and berries meet with wood spice and pine chips on the nose of this blend of 67% Cabernet Sauvignon, 19% Merlot, 9% Malbec and 5% Petit Verdot. The palate combines hints of olive with wild berries, oregano, thyme, anise and dill, making for a compelling sip.

title: Lyric by Etude 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: From Etude's North Canyon and Cat Canyon vineyards, this fresh bottling offers guava and plumeria notes on the slightly tropical nose. The texture is taut and the flavors are ripe with more guava and Key lime pie.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2017 Dry Sangiovese Rosé (Lodi)
description: This is a lively rosé, with a unique personality. It smells like fresh strawberries, thyme and mint, and tastes vividly fruity, while the mouthfeel is smooth but still crisp enough to be refreshing.

title: Séamus Wines 2014 Attwood Ranch Vineyard Olde Sonoma Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma Valley)
description: Floral and bright, this wine is full bodied and extracted in deep flavors of dark cherry and cassis, the fruit presenting as somewhat sweet on the palate.

title: Carol Shelton 2016 Wild Thing Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Shy on the nose, this is a thick concentrated white blended with 7% Roussanne that shows big flavors of baked pineapple, papaya and melon. Broad shouldered, it was barrel-fermented entirely in French oak, and integrates the wood well.

title: Francis Coppola 2015 Kicker Cane Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This is well-made and layered in sage, mountain herb and cedar. Pungent herbal aromas dominate alongside pencil lead and cocoa powder, upheld by smooth polished tannin.

title: Integrity 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemongrass and orange wedge meet with a touch of damp wood and a hint of butterscotch on the nose of this bottling. Rounded flavors of apple, citrus and a kiss of oak show on the sip, which is framed by decent acidity and chalky structure.

title: Jessie's Grove 2015 Merlot (Lodi)
description: Good depth and concentration help this full-bodied wine stand out, and the chocolaty flavors are hard to resist. It feels rich and smooth in texture, spreads nicely across the palate and is backed by moderate tannins.

title: Andis 2013 Original Grandpere Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This gentle giant is full flavored, soft and expansive on the palate and not at all tannic. It's easy to appreciate the ripe strawberry and brown-sugar aromas, rich and slightly sweet fruit flavors lightly accented by oak spice, and plush mouthfeel.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2015 Rita's Block Red (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a classic old-style field blend, made from a majority of Zinfandel with smaller amounts of Primitivo, Alicante Bouschet, Syrah, Petite Sirah and Trousseau. Given more than a year in oak, 30% new, it's explosively concentrated and jammy thick in style, with accents of smoky plum, blackberry, leather saddle and violet.

title: Monticello Vineyards 2014 Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Oak Knoll District)
description: This is a bigger style wine, with sizable tannins present and a cradle of oak. Caramel and coffee come first to mind, as a softness of texture makes it pleasant on the palate.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Candlestick Red (Napa Valley)
description: Made mostly from Syrah and Grenache, this is a robust and concentrated wine, driven by strong flavors of blackberry, tobacco and smoky oak. A tease of dried herb appears on the lengthy finish.

title: Seven Angels 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Candied strawberry and nutmeg aromas make for a very inviting entry to the nose of this rich bottling. It's very hedonistic on the palate, where vibrant red fruit and cinnamon flavors meet with fresh fennel. The alcohol is well hidden, but it does become sweeter as it opens up.

title: Tercero 2014 Zaca Mesa Vineyard Roussanne (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This wine has plenty of potential, but needs considerable time to come around from its reductive state. It opens with aromas of roasted nuts, smoke, roasted white meats and petrol. The palate shows a bit of petrol as well but slowly opens to reveal lemon rinds, lemongrass and hay-like flavors.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Subtle aromas of condensed rose petals, dried purple flowers, boysenberry and roasted red meat show on the nose of this bottling. Clean purple-flower flavors show on the palate, which is somewhat single-noted but pleasing overall.

title: Violet-Green Winery 2012 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine was given 20 months in oak and another two or so years in bottle before release. It has a soft texture and lengthy tannins accented in earthy compost, graphite, red cherry and dark chocolate.

title: Babcock 2016 Eye of the Beholder En Tirage Rosé of Grenache (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This is an inventive and stunning bottling from Spanish Springs Vineyard by Bryan Babcock. A beautiful shade of hot pink and extremely cloudy in the glass, this wine shows lush aromas of strawberry cake, vanilla and caramel on the nose. The mouthfeel is creamy but the flavors are tangy with kumquat, and that compelling combo holds until baked goods arise on the finish. It is a really fascinating wine.
designation: Eye of the Beholder En Tirage Rosé of

title: Beauregard 2015 Coast Grade Vineyard Pinot Noir (Ben Lomond Mountain)
description: There's an intriguing and somewhat thick forest-spice element throughout this bottling, with juniper, pine and menthol aromas decorating the cooked red-cherry nose. The palate is also rich with herbaceous elements, offering bay leaf, black pepper and Indian spices against rhubarb, beet and stewed plum flavors.

title: Caliza 2014 Sympatico Tempranillo (Paso Robles Willow Creek District)
description: Star anise, caramel, black plum and black currant show on the rich nose of this bottling, which is enhanced with 12% Grenache and 12% Monastrell. There is solid acidic energy to the palate, lifting up the cassis and gingerbread flavors that ride polished tannins into the finish.

title: Amador Cellars 2015 Estate Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: This big-boned wine aged in American oak is spicy, very ripe and quite full bodied, so it has plenty of impact on the palate. Black pepper, anise and an almost jammy blackberry flavor give it complexity, and a good structure of tannins while acidity give the texture a nice bite.

title: Baldacci 2014 Elizabeth Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Bright and richly expansive, this wine is floral and gritty, a beautiful exploration of rose petal, forest floor and strawberry-rhubarb. Lightly spiced, it has a full-bodied figure of ripeness within polished tannin and structured acidity.

title: Groth 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Blended with 20% Merlot, this is a finely made wine that pleases in its granular texture and bright acidity. Sinewy in feel, it has fleshy aspects of red cherry and cassis that are complemented by a cradling of vanilla oak.

title: Hudson Vineyards 2017 White Study Estate Grown White (Carneros)
description: This is a blend of 33% Ribolla, 27% Arneis, 22% Friulano and 18% Albariño, all grown on the producer's vast Carneros ranch. Nutty and floral, it tastes and smells of white flowers, peach, melon and apricot, refreshing in its delightful lightness and lemony finish.

title: Joyce 2017 Cedar Lane Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Loads of cut pear, yellow apple rinds, dried lime skins and wet cement show on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. The palate rides a racy line of acidity and chalky texture to deliver flavors of red apple and Anjou pear.

title: Lumen 2017 Starry Rosé (Santa Barbara County)
description: A darker shade of reddish pink, this 70% Grenache and 30% Pinot Noir rosé is full of red-plum and raspberry aromas, with an orange-rind twist and warm baking-spice notes as well. It's very full yet tense and balanced on the palate, with flavors of raspberry gum and citrus peels.

title: Miro 2017 Chevalier Vineyard Grenache Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: This vivid lively wine made from a one-acre vineyard is hot pink in color, bright and fruity in aroma and saturated with peach and grapefruit flavors that light up the taste buds. It has great acidity, medium body and a good sense of concentration while staying fresh on the palate and finish.

title: Morgan 2017 Albariño (Monterey)
description: There's a very intriguing and inviting Asian pear extract element on the nose of this bottling, along with wet gravel, yellow melon and a barely ripe kiwi aromas. Light and bright flavors pop on the palate, from lemon rinds and grapefruit juice to rainy sidewalk, all wrapped in a very grippy texture.

title: Oakstone 2015 Reserve Estate Field Blend Petite Sirah (Fair Play)
description: This wine pits a mountain of tannin against a torrent of opulent extra-ripe blackberry and dark-chocolate flavors and comes out balanced. The saturated flavors soften the effect of a very firm texture for a grand and delicious taste experience. It has smoky, rubber-boot aromas, lots of dark fruit and subtle oak spices.

title: Rusack 2014 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Roasted red-cherry, coffee and star anise aromas converge for a very exuberant nose on this countywide blend by Steve Gerbac. The palate is fresh and vibrant with red-cherry and raspberry flavors and strong acidity that carries the relatively lightweight wine across the tongue with ease.

title: St. Francis 2017 Wild Oak Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma Valley)
description: Subtle in stone fruit aromas and a waxy apple tease, this vineyard-specific white is bright, fresh and layered with texture. Light in ripeness, it'll do well as an aperitif or companion to the table and a wide variety of fare.

title: Terra Valentine 2015 Merlot (Spring Mountain District)
description: Soft, supple and dusty, this 100% varietal wine is subtle in plum, cedar and graphite, showing a nice complexity on the midpalate of textured full-bodied ripeness. The tannins are present and polished.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Carsi Vineyard Semillon (Napa Valley)
description: With a copper tinge of color, this is both buttery and lush with a backbone of acid that keeps it fresh and midweight in the glass. Peach, pear and anise characterize the flavor profile, finishing with a creamy texture.

title: Wine Dark Sea 2016 Putnam Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker James MacPhail sources from a site he knows well in this project, a partnership with GrapeSeed Wine, a winemaker's collective based in Sonoma County. Thick, burly coastal density is delivered with abandon, a strong full-bodied concentration of wild strawberry and boysenberry at its heart. Earth and spice follow.

title: Baileyana 2017 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Freshly snapped bubblegum shows on the nose of this bottling, which also offers pillowy aromas of strawberry and rose petal. Fresh zippy acidity and a taut texture frame the sip, where the bubblegum flavors are cut by lemon juice and crushed chalk.

title: Barton 2017 Tiny Dancer Glenrose Vineyard Picpoul (Adelaida District)
description: Very light in the glass, this bottling of a white Rhône grape that's new to the region is quite aromatic, offering lemon spray, chilled pear and yuzu aromas. There is laser-sharp focus and racy acid on the palate, offering flavors of cider apple, mandarin zest and crisp Asian pear.

title: Cattleya 2016 Pratt Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Salted white peach, apple jelly, gardenia and brioche with lemon preserves show on the nose of this small-batch bottling from Sonoma County. Tangy lemon rinds, warm toast and candied melon flavors show on the palate, where the finish is quite lengthy.

title: Wilson Creek 2014 Double Dog Red Five Paws Vineyard Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This proprietary red blend, always a favorite of this winery's following, shows rounded and ripe aromas of cherries and red currants, with a hint of roast beef and grainy oak. The palate is boisterous and driven by decent acid, with ripe red fruit and more oaky flavors.
designation: Double Dog Red Five Paws Vineyard

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Cellar Select Teroldego (California)
description: This rarely seen grape seems to do well in the warmer environs of Temecula, starting with aromas of snappy black raspberry and dark chocolate on the nose. The palate offers muddled black plum and elderberry flavors with just enough acid to carry through to the finish.

title: Bel Vino NV Grand Reserve Cabernet Franc (California)
description: Rather joyous aromas of ripe red cherries and light licorice start off this bottling from a winery based in Temecula. The palate shows a bit more dark-red-plum fruit, and the black-licorice touch arises again, remaining fresh throughout.

title: Bernardus 2017 Rosé (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: A beautiful pink in color, this bottling shows cherry juice and wet gravel aromas on the nose. The flavors are clean and crisp, with more cherry and raspberry, and a touch of river stone minerality, with the texture becoming more compelling into the finish.

title: Carson Scott 2017 Pinot Noir (California)
description: This is a very good, straightforward wine with plenty of fruit flavor to fill out the medium body and balance out the rather firm tannins and acidity. It's one of several current good-value Pinots from the 2016 and 2017 vintages in California.

title: Cuvaison 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Los Carneros)
description: Crisp in orange and lemon, the acidity fresh and persistent, this is an unfussy quaffer with moderate structure and body. It impresses in its fruity exuberance.

title: Epiphany 2016 Inspiration White (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a slightly nutty kick to the nose of this bottling, with almond aromas playing alongside the lemon rinds. Those blanched almond flavors show on the sip as do tangy yellow-apple skins and lemon oil.

title: Folded Hills 2016 August White (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This is a refreshing white blend, tightly wound although quite subtle. Light in the glass, it shows aromas of lime skin, peach, dried honeysuckle and white lily. The palate is tightly wound and bright with delicate pome-fruit flesh flavors.

title: G & C Lurton 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Sonoma County)
description: Tart, thick and woody, this white presents as full bodied and richly thick on the palate, before slowly unfurling brighter, crisper notes of lemon verbena.

title: Highway 12 2015 Merlot (Sonoma County)
description: This wine blends in 15% Petite Sirah, adding to its dense, rich and rounded character. Aromatic in clove and black pepper, it tastes of blackberry cobbler and vanilla oak.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2015 Single Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Temecula Valley)
description: Subtle dark fruit aromas meet with licorice, wood spice and toffee on the nose of this bottling. It's rather thick on the palate with extracted fruit flavors as well as licorice, charred berries and burned caramel, ending on the slightest kick of menthol.

title: Mathew Bruno 2017 Rosé (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Hearty and orange-copper-colored, this is made from 62% Grenache, 26% Mourvèdre, 7% Syrah and 5% Zinfandel. Apricot and peach fuzz meet an intense earthy element that veers metallic, finishing crisp as a melon ball.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Tre Fratalli Meritage (Temecula)
description: Pepper and pencil shavings give depth to the ripe black-currant and caramel aromas on the nose of this blend of 40% Cabernet Sauvignon, 40% Merlot and 20% Cabernet Franc. Strong licorice and juniper flavors show on the palate alongside ripe elderberries and black currant.

title: Rancho Sisquoc 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: Subtle aromas of lemon bar, white peach, passion fruit soda and chalk show on the nose of this bottling, which comes from one of the region's older properties. It's very zippy and fresh on the palate, and that racy character fades into Pink Lady apple and mandarin orange flavors.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This blends in handfuls of Petite Sirah, Malbec and Petit Verdot, adding to the wine's thick concentration and full-bodied density. Reduced on the nose, it unfurls layers of leather, tobacco and plum within a larger context of chocolate and tobacco.

title: VGS 2016 Chardonnay (Mount Veeder)
description: Robust in pineapple and guava, with a generosity of oak, this is a concentrated, ripe and full-bodied white, that is fleshy and voluptuous in style. It offers a sweetness of tannin that emphasizes the ripe nature of the fruit.

title: Zotovich 2017 Viognier (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Peach and ripe apples meet with a strong kick of honeysuckle on the nose of this bottling, one of the few Viogniers from the appellation. There is decent tension to the palate, where more white flowers and pome-fruit flavors approach tropicality but are wrapped in a compelling texture.

title: Alara 2017 Pinot Grigio (San Benito County)
description: Very light in the glass with the slightest hint of pink, this wine's aromas are very shy, with just a hint of apple flesh. It's quite zippy and refreshing on the palate, but the flavors are also light, with hints of apple and lemon skin.

title: Alara 2017 Rosé of Barbera (San Benito County)
description: Light red-fruit and damp wood aromas show on the nose of this rosé treatment of Barbera, not the most common of varieties for a pink wine. There is a strong lime-skin tang to the palate with deeper cranberry flavors, making for a very full-flavored rosé.

title: Bianchi 2017 Rosé (Monterey County)
description: Made from the Cinsaut grape, the wine is a pale shade of pink and shows lemon rinds, raspberry and cold steel on the nose. It's quite textural on the palate, where subtle strawberry flavors are pleasant albeit a touch watered down.

title: Paradise Springs 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very light and clean on the nose, this bottling, which is overseen by proprietor Kirk Wiles and winemaker Doug Margerum, shows citrus blossoms and apple flesh on the nose. There is lots of zippy structure to the palate, which zings deep into the finish with green-apple flavors.

title: Pech Merle 2017 Rivino Vineyard Vin Rosé of Syrah (Mendocino County)
description: This crisp bracing wine has a pale-salmon color, vivid cherry and plum aromas and very good balance. Good acidity and almost the heft of red wine give it more personality than many rosés.

title: Prager 2012 Port (Napa Valley)
description: Bottled in 2015, this is made from 61% Petite Sirah, 36% Tinta Roriz and 3% Cabernet Sauvignon, then aged for two years in neutral oak. It has older characteristics of leather and sandalwood, as well as a savory backbone that's brightened by a rich, viscous contrast of black cherry and blackberry.

title: Ravenswood 2015 Old Hill Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: A strong aromatic element of eucalyptus and bay leaf permeate on the nose of this wine, which settles into a full-figured, lush and textured commingling of coffee, dark chocolate and berry pie, the finish brightened by a tease of acidity.

title: Rutherford Ranch 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This white is beautifully lush and delicious—a light bright explosion of fresh peach and grapefruit dipped in Tahitian vanilla.

title: Sol Rouge 2014 Cinsault (Red Hills)
description: Generous cherry aromas and gentle cherry flavors make this medium-bodied wine easy to appreciate. It has a supple texture due to mild acidity and light tannins and a sense of lightness that is almost delicate.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is thick and rich in cocoa powder, cassis and cedar, plus a slight note of blueberry in the background. Polished tannins give it structured elegance and a medium-bodied sense of ripeness that's welcome at the dinner table.

title: V. Sattui 2016 Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Spicy in honeyed oak, this full-bodied wine is bright in acidity and strong flavors of lime and lemon verbena. Balanced and integrated despite its complete embrace of ripeness, it allows for a brightness of acidity beneath grainy texture and grip.

title: Verde 2015 Sophie's Estate Red (Santa Clara Valley)
description: From a promising new Bordeaux varietal estate project in Gilroy, this blend of 46% Cabernet Franc, 31% Petit Verdot and 23% Cabernet Sauvignon starts with traditional aromas of oak, leather, black cherry, fig paste, tobacco leaf and cigar box. The tannins are a bit firm and grippy but well polished, carrying cocoa, dried herb and black-cherry flavors.

title: VGS 2016 Potelle Two Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a brawny blend of a majority Cabernet Sauvignon with smaller amounts of Petite Sirah, Zinfandel, Syrah, Cabernet Franc and Grenache. Tar, leather and cola ooze from a moderately structured, full-bodied core that's fleshy and rich, seasoned in currant and cedar.

title: Writer's Block 2015 Syrah (Lake County)
description: Very concentrated and layered, this deeply colored and full-bodied wine has a powerful mouthfeel and firm tannins underlying the saturated cherry, earth and game nuances that come out with each sip.

title: Capo Creek 2015 Grenache Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: Buttery oak and a whiff of sulfur blow off to reveal a light-bodied, ripe core of honey, apple and quince. A dried herb note gingerly lingers on the finish.

title: Comartin 2016 R-Bar-R Ranch Pinot Noir (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: The nose on this bottling from a vineyard located 1,100 feet in the mountains is very concentrated with roasted cherry, mulberry and hibiscus extract aromas, even showing hints of maple sugar. The palate is quite interesting, offering thick plum juice as well as sandalwood and crème brûlée flavors.

title: Davis Bynum 2015 Jane's Vineyard Pommard Clone Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, with a distinction of barrel and tar, this vineyard and clone-designate shows a richness of baked cherry and blueberry, as well as a lush earthiness. Integrated, the tannins are soft and easy on the palate.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Three Palms Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From the site made famous for Merlot, this estate wine shows the other side of the coin, more structured in tight tannins and a wealth of powerful concentration. Leather, baked plum and cocoa powder dominate the further components of blackberry and blueberry compote.

title: Etude 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: This 100% varietal wine is pillowy in texture and tannin, with structure to spare. Herbal and grippy, it exudes plenty of rich black fruit, leather, cedar and clove.

title: Hanzell 2016 Sebella Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This coastal wine is juicy in black fruit, black tea and a pronouncement of oak, while the body is big-boned, savory and thick in up-front tannin. There's an underlying earthiness that's hard to resist and likably integrated with the highlights of strawberry and rhubarb.

title: La Folia Winery 2016 Vermentino (Sierra Foothills)
description: This remarkable wine is rather rich and creamy in texture, has mild herb and mineral aromas and a green-apple flavor that slowly opens and deepens on the palate. It's medium bodied, well-balanced and has good acidity without being overtly crisp.

title: Lucie 2016 Dutton Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: High-toned in fleshy peach and apricot with a nod of Good & Plenty licorice, this big-boned, structured and lushly crafted wine stands out with its complement of rich concentrated fruitiness and toasty oak.

title: Marcella's 2016 White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Featuring a label painted by renowned Central Coast artist Chris Potter, this is a blend of 53% Viognier, 34% Grenache Blanc and 13% Roussane. Aromas of melon, yellow peach, lemon rind and chalky minerality lead into a palate loaded with ripe stone-fruit flavors that are balanced by citrusy acidity.

title: Boekenoogen 2016 Garrett's Vineyard Dry Land Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: This wine comes from a remote patch of earth that Garrett Boekenoogen farms without irrigation, which concentrates aromas of Bing cherry, herbs, turned earth and barbecued meats. The palate combines rounded red fruit with wild thyme, crushed slate and balanced acidity.

title: Chappellet 2015 Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: A good 15% Cabernet Sauvignon is blended within this wine, as well as 4% each of Malbec and Petit Verdot. Impressive, it offers rich notions of dark chocolate and graham cracker that present as round and richly soft. A bright streak of acidity contrasts well, refreshing the palate under cover of creamy oak.

title: Daniel 2015 Laguna Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a tiny production wine well worth seeking, savory in forest floor, black tea, sage and mushroom, with a soft, round midpalate that presents as equal parts silky and velvety. Exotic and earthy, it has integrated barrel presence and tamed tannins, with a succulent finish of baking spice.

title: Davies 2016 Piedra Libre Vineyards Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Succulent in brambly cherry and berry with an effusive, taut and persistent thread of acidity, this is a lovely, memorable vineyard-designated wine, coastal in its bright embrace of freshness and delicate layering. Additional elements of forest floor and black tea provide a nice contrast to the fruit.

title: Lynmar 2016 Anisya's Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earth and sandalwood greet the nose in this soft, velvety and textured wine that's made in an expansive, succulent style. It is effusive in fruit, a mélange of blueberry and black cherry flavors, with a bright refreshment of blood orange and tart pomegranate.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Rosella's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rose petals, cranberry and dust show on the nose of this bottling, which grows more intense on the nose as it sits open, offering riper fruit. Dried sagebrush and baked earth flavors show on the sip as the red fruit and floral components arise with grace.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Soberanes Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Plum, black cherry and raspberry meet with cardamom, tomato and slate on the dynamic nose of this bottling. It's fresh and taut on the palate, with more raspberry, a hint of charcoal and caramel flakes on the finish. Tightly wound tannins will unfurl with patience. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Migration 2016 Running Creek Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a classic wine from the appellation, bright, lush and spicy in cola and cardamom. Full bodied and velvety smooth, it offers dense layers of strawberry, raspberry and blood orange with a wealth of rich toasted oak and brioche.

title: Benovia 2016 Three Sisters Chardonnay (Fort Ross-Seaview)
description: This is made from the spectacular coastal vineyard farmed by the Martinelli family, showing the cool-climate grip of tart, tangy acidity. Flavors or apple blossom and Meyer lemon custard give it an unctuous quality that's hard to resist.

title: Cinnabar 2015 Malbec (Red Hills)
description: This is a sophisticated, complex and smooth-textured wine that has a mellow, spicy, moderately oaky character and lots of ripe berry and black cherry to fill the middle. The body is full, the tannins are abundant but soft and the mouthfeel is rich and plush.

title: Clendenen Family 2013 Le Bon Climat Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Though already five-years-old, this bottling is still very fresh, showing aromas of honeysuckle, toast, lemon balm, gardenia and sandalwood. There is a flash of tart lemon on the sip but it's leveled immediately by smooth nut-butter and brioche flavors that power into the velvety finish.

title: Daniel 2015 Grand Vent Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This has underlying smoke and char that works well to bring out the lithe, cool-climate silkiness of texture and tart high-toned fruit. Cranberry, pomegranate and a squeeze of citrus appear on the intriguingly bright, delicate palate as white pepper develops on the finish.

title: Daou 2016 Cuvée Lizzy Red (Adelaida District)
description: An intense elderberry aroma meets with an equally powerful scent of toasted oak on the nose of this blend of 63% Malbec, 23% Petit Verdot and 14% Cabernet Franc. The elderberry-oak combination carries into the palate as well, where it also picks up blackberry jam and pastry flavors, layered with polished tannins and light acidity.

title: Diora 2016 La Petite Grace Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: This is an expertly delivered steak house Pinot Noir, with big, booming aromas and flavors. Concentrated, intense tones of Bing cherry and boysenberry are lifted by star anise and a strong floral character on the nose. The palate brings flavors of boysenberry pie and vanilla, with bright acid and smooth but hearty tannins.

title: Gary Farrell 2016 Russian River Selection Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a blend of iconic sites, like Rochioli, Hallberg and Martaella, this opens with thick, dense and concentrated tones of dried cherry and cola before unleashing a wealth of white pepper and black tea. It finds a balance between the fruit and the forest elements on the midpalate, finishing in silky brilliance.

title: Joseph Jewell 2015 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: From a sloping hillside at 1,000-feet in elevation, this is a beautiful vineyard-designate and ambassador for the variety: shy in fruit at first, which only allows its floral, earthy aspects of ash and rock to shine. Black pepper and leather boost an array of tangy cherry, raspberry and plum that remains tart and fresh.

title: Matias Wines 2015 Sierra Mar Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Aromas of red-cherry reduction sauce meet with mud, clay, purple flowers, peppercorns and herbs on the dynamic nose of this single-vineyard bottling. The palate is quite dry and herbal with flavors of fennel frond, anise, and thyme, but there's a solid mulberry and exotic red-fruit core.

title: Rockpile 2016 Rockpile Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: With an addition of 5% Petite Sirah, this wine is brooding in a berry fruit tone that mingles with brown sugar, baking spice and coffee. Lifted acidity does a good job reining in the fundamental power and concentration at its core.

title: Ryan Cochrane 2016 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Bright and energetic aromas of pomegranate, light thyme, marjoram and rose petals show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard that lies near the Santa Ynez River. Strong herbs show on the palate, from oregano to wild mint, giving depth to the mulberry flavors. It's all framed by persistent, well integrated acidity.

title: Sanford 2013 Founders' Vines Single Block Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This is a rare look at the original vines planted by Richard Sanford and Michael Benedict in the 1970s. Aromas of candied strawberry and red currant lead into a dry palate, where cranberry, rose petal, thyme and dried sagebrush arise. The integrated acidity and tannic structure are most compelling, along with the lingering hint of dried flowers.
designation: Founders' Vines Single Block Estate Grown

title: Rococo 2016 Sur Lie Chenin Blanc (Santa Barbara County)
description: From 40-year-old vines in Los Alamos comes this crisp, lovely wine, which shows nectarine, Meyer lemon spray and grapefruit peel aromas on the nose. The palate is crisp and grippy, with light stone-fruit flavors alongside crushed white rocks and a slight citrus tang.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Anthony & Dominic Chardonnay (North Coast)
description: A combination of spicy, fruity and savory flavors, as well as a suave texture, make this wine quite impressive. Subtle nutmeg and vanilla aromas lead to fresh pear and white peach flavors, with a touch of minerality for a tasty but not extreme personality.

title: Sojourn 2015 Proprietary Cuvée Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a nicely put together, complex red, brimming in smooth layers of integrated black fruit, plum, cinnamon and clove. The robust ripeness is well-managed and in check, with a welcome smoky touch to the lengthy finish.

title: Stag's Leap Wine Cellars 2014 S.L.V. Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Estate-grown, this wine is juicy and expansive, with an approachability that makes it instantly pleasing on the palate. Black currant, graphite and dark-chocolate flavors meet brushy dried herb and toasted oak, integrating into a lengthy finish.

title: The Calling 2015 Fox Den Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny and full bodied, this earthy wine shows a generosity of forest floor, cardamom and cola, before unveiling integrated layers of bright strawberry and citrus.

title: MacRostie 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: A muted nose of toasted oak and brioche leads to an expansive and fleshy midpalate of apple and peach in this moderately structured, medium-bodied and balanced wine. The finish is lingering and vibrantly bright in acidity.

title: Banyan 2017 Gewürztraminer (Monterey County)
description: This is a fascinating wine at all turns. The color is not darker than water, and the aromas are extremely juicy with orange blossom, poached pear, bubblegum and gardenia—one of the most aromatic bottlings around. The palate is bone dry with a chalky flavor and backbone, yet hints of bubblegum and plumeria give warmth.

title: Black Stallion 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a bright fresh white that shows a nice complement of dried herb and lemongrass with juicier, more concentrated flavors of white peach and melon. Elegantly crafted, it has a lushness to the palate that's lengthy and complex.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Di Domenico Tannat (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated black plum and slightly sour blueberry aromas met with dried earth and leather on the nose of this wine. The palate is dense and heavily weighted, with an acidity that slowly rises through the soft tannins, carrying flavors of dark fruit and peppery spice.

title: Left Bend 2016 Fiz Nat Rosé of Syrah (Santa Cruz Mountains)
description: A good pét-nat combines funk, foam and fun with tart fruit and a full body, and this succeeds on all fronts. Cloudy in the glass, this shows aromas of watermelon soda, strawberry, cherry Jolly Rancher and yeast. Albeit focused on primary flavors, the palate is tart with raspberry candy and sour bubblegum, offering quite a voluptuous mouthfeel.

title: Flanagan 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Bennett Valley)
description: Tightly wound layers of woody cassis, cherry and cedar combine nicely around a robust midpalate in this hearty full-bodied wine, pronounced in tannin and oak. A floral finish of violet sparks a bright, lingering finish.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2014 Grist Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Mixed with small amounts of Syrah and Petite Sirah, this is aged in both French and American oak, and it shows a richly woven palate of grainy leather, tobacco and cedar. The ripe succulent fruit is jammy in blackberry and dark chocolate.

title: High Valley Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (High Valley)
description: This well-balanced wine from high-elevation Lake County has everything in the right proportions: fresh herb and citrus aromas, lip-smacking, crisp fruit flavors, a generous texture and lingering finish.

title: Hoopes 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: Sanguine and crisp in cranberry, currant and violet aromas, this wine is bright, expansive and integrated in oak, with accents of cedar and graphite. The full-bodied ripeness holds its own.

title: Ilaria 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: From vineyards in St. Helena, Atlas Peak and Howell Mountain, this is a well-made, relatively restrained wine, smoky and earthy up front. Broadly structured, it features fine highlights of black currant and pencil lead and will work nicely at the table.

title: Jessie's Grove 2016 Sin So Cinsault (Lodi)
description: An elegant, almost delicate wine, it has floral and cherry-like aromas, delicious cherry and pomegranate flavors and a gentle texture with good acidity and very light tannins.

title: Lyric by Etude 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Light on the nose with hints of cranberry, crushed gravel, wet slate and rose petals, this affordable bottling gives a good sense of minerality at a fair price. There's an herbal background to the bright palate, which offers tart pomegranate and hibiscus flavors.

title: Maddalena 2016 Pinot Grigio (Monterey)
description: This wine is clean, crisp and tasty. Aromas of honey, lime peel and rounded mango lead into a palate that's zippy in bright acidity and grippy in structure. Racy mandarin zest, yellow melon and wet stone flavors carry the palate.

title: Outlot 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: Stainless-steel fermented, this is a red that's ready to drink, blended with small amounts of Syrah and Pinot Noir. Thick, leathery, structured black fruit stars alongside dried herb and earth before a long, juicy finish.

title: Peloton 2015 Criterium Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark black cherry, hints of thyme and tarragon and a flash of crushed gravel show on the nose of this blend of 34% Cabernet Sauvignon, 33% Cabernet Franc and 33% Merlot. Firm, upright and nearly sticky with tannins, the palate shows stewed plum and mulling-spice flavors. Needs a bit more time to reach its prime.

title: Walt 2015 Clos Pepe Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark as night in the glass, this lavish take on Pinot Noir, which would work great in a steak house, shows black cherry, licorice, black sage and crushed asphalt on the nose. Lush tones of black cherry and creamy caramel also show on the sip, but there is earthy minerality, roasted meat umami tones and vibrant spearmint touches as well.

title: Bruliam 2015 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This robust medium-bodied vineyard-designate is complex and lengthy, a showcase of reduced oak, black cherry and berry and well-defined aspects of white pepper, Asian five-spice and black tea. The finish brings some heat that settles on the palate to show power and grace.

title: Central Coast Group Project 2013 Captain Kierk AKA The Knightwalker Larner Vineyard Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Extra-long macerations by winemaker Scott Sampler add intriguing complexity to his wines, including this bottling from Larner Vineyard. The nose combines a wide array of herbs with white pepper dust, gamy meat, condensed purple flowers and dark fruit. There's a touch of balsamic to the sip, where coffee, black currant and blackberry flavors meet with leather and roasted beef.
designation: Captain Kierk AKA The Knightwalker Larner Vineyard

title: Hendry 2014 Blocks 7 and 22 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: This is a delicate spicy wine despite its robust ripeness and brawny underside. Compost and brambly brush combine with blackberry and an undeniably delicious streak of white pepper, making for a complex, complete wine that's enjoyable from start to finish.

title: Jaffurs 2014 Bien Nacido Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Lush, rich and lovely on the nose, this bottling shows vanilla, black currant, chocolate cake, cola and teriyaki aromas. The texture and flavors are much softer and mellower than expected from the bombastic nose, with smooth black plum, sweetened espresso and purple flowers.

title: Bouchaine 2015 Hyde Vineyard Chardonnay (Carneros-Napa Valley)
description: From the highly sought-after site a stone's throw from the producer's own estate, this white is lovely and invitingly floral—its aromatics undeniable. Unctuous and boldly ripe, it offers intertwined flavors of baked pear and pineapple with a persistent lift of fresh stony acidity.

title: Carlisle 2015 Montafi Ranch Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: Brawny and expansive in dusty minerality, this dry wine is velvety thick and floral in violet aromas. Blackberry, cherry and an herbal undercurrent of menthol work together seamlessly to provide complexity and bold swathes of persistent flavor.

title: Patz & Hall 2015 Burnside Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From a site expertly farmed by the Martinelli family, Burnside is leathery and earthy, a deep dive into mint, cedar and pine as well as pungent rose garden. Spicy cardamom and black tea are supported by a grip of oak and tannin that tastes bold and big, yet finishes in balance.

title: Seagrape 2015 Mermaid's Pearl Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Appealing aromas of mint, charred pine and forest floor decorate a core of mulberry and dried cherry fruit on the nose of this wine by Karen Steinwachs. Similar flavors show on the sip, where pine needles and moss meet with minty black raspberry, presented on a lighter fresher body.

title: Stolpman 2015 Estate Grown Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Very rich and lush aromas of black currant that are zesty rather than overripe meet with hints of chaparral, cherry wood smoke and sweet lavender on the nose of this wine. There's a strong sagebrush quality to the sip, with blackberry sauce and peppercorn husks in the midpalate. The acidity is prime, the tannins are just sticky enough. Drink now through 2030.

title: Theopolis 2015 Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Layered and intricate, this plush and complex wine is a beauty. It starts with enticing aromas of black cherry and clove, while more cherry and spice character unfolds on the palate and a broad, rich texture coats the mouth. Everything is smooth, well integrated and tasty.

title: Walt 2015 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: For fans of rich and lavish Pinot Noir, this appellation blend gives a taste of what Winemaker Megan Gunderson is all about, without the soaring price tag. Black cherry, chocolate chip cookie dough, crushed slate and light mint show on the nose while the soft, lush palate is creamy in black-plum pudding and coffee cream flavors as well as hints of bay leaf, black tea and juniper.

title: En Garde 2014 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Deliciously well-integrated, this is a rich, vibrant and intense wine that is lengthy and broadly expansive in baked strawberry, rhubarb and dark cherry. Cardamom and black tea make appearances within the fruit and brawny oak.

title: Foley 2015 Rancho Santa Rosa Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Lemon cream, beeswax, sea salt and chamomile tea aromas combine for a very compelling and complex nose on this bottling. The palate is creamy at first and then sizzles with sea salt and lemony acidity, finishing with more ocean spray flavors. It's savory, yet fresh.

title: Grassini 2015 Reserve Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: This richer, Bordelaise-like take on Sauvignon Blanc is a compelling change of pace for a region that leans more toward fresh and racy. Aromas of ripe nectarine, lemon oil, yellow flowers and marzipan are set against a steely core on the nose. The palate offers oak smoke, creamy pear flesh and distinctive butterscotch on the finish.

title: Barton 2014 Danger Zone Tannat (Adelaida District)
description: It's a shame only one barrel was made of this wine from Glenrose Vineyard, for it's a lavish and delicious wine. Aromas of coffee, espresso and dark chocolate meet with black cherry, lilacs and caramel on the nose. Deep yet bright black-currant fruit shows on the sip, along with zesty blood orange before finishing on the richer coffee-cream notes.

title: Pali 2015 John Sebastiano Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very intriguing aromas of cinnamon, cedar, garden herbs and tight raspberry show on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard on the eastern side of the appellation. The palate is extremely elegant and tightly wound, with bay leaf, Earl Grey tea and potpourri elements flavoring the pomegranate background.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Sangiovese (Sonoma County)
description: A lovely wine, this is soft and layered with complex notions of raisin cake, cranberry and dried cherry. Soft and supple in texture, it has a lasting grip of leather and coffee. Full bodied, it holds its ripeness well, showing complexity and balance.

title: Sanguis 2013 Loner R13-C Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite dark in the glass, this appellation blend combines dense layer of mulberry and black plum on the nose with aromas of wet loam, packed rose petals and a hint of mint. Layers of rose petals and purple hibiscus show on the earthy sip, where a soft texture presents dark fruits and slight hints of caramel and vanilla toward the finish.

title: Whitcraft 2016 Pence Ranch Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Very chalky on the nose in a Chablis-like style, this bottling, which is made in a warehouse just blocks from the beach in Santa Barbara, shows aromas of lemon blossom and Gravenstein apple. It's extremely tightly wound on the sip, with a savory salt character as well as lemon balm flavors. It's texturally intriguing and compelling.

title: Tolosa 2016 Primera Edna Ranch Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Lush and plump aromas of vanilla, black-cherry sauce, roasted rhubarb, strawberry and slate show on the nose of this producer's top-tier bottling. The palate is soft at first and then the oaky tannins arise to give structure, which is required for the plush ripe baked strawberry fruit. The flavors still need time to come together.

title: TW Ferm Co. 2014 Malbec (Paso Robles)
description: A broad black currant aroma leads the way on the nose of this bottling, of which just 17 cases were made. There is impressive density to the palate and a creamy mouthfeel, with flavors of black plum jam and peppery spice, with acidity that races into the finish.

title: Côte West 2015 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Fermented in stainless steel and then aged for 15 months in French oak, only 30% of it new, this wine shows a nice grasp of restraint and acidity, offering honey, rock and toast against a backdrop of Meyer lemon and waxy apple. Bright, persistent acidity rules the day, cradled in just the right amount of structured oak.

title: Friedeman 2016 Dichotomy Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Creamy and bright, this is a nicely made white, attractively priced. Medium bodied, it's lengthy in integrated oak with fresh focused flavors of quince, orange and white peach.

title: Grgich Hills 2014 Miljenko's Selection Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Earthy in compost, this wine is tense in focused fresh acidity, which buoys and complements its otherwise hearty structure. Black and red currant feature on the palate, seconded by tobacco, clove and leather seasoning that works well with the fruit.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Old Vine Zinfandel (Sierra Foothills)
description: Subtle oak aromas, layered fruit and spice flavors and a creamy texture make this wine a standout. While full bodied, it feels gentle and rich on the palate, and slowly unleashes more raspberry, blackberry, mint and vanilla with each sip.

title: Martin Ranch 2014 Therese Vineyards Griva Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Red cherry, sagebrush undergrowth, damp thyme and eucalyptus leak aromas show on the nose of this bottling from the heart of this wind-whipped appellation. The menthol-like character shows prominently on the sip, which is fresh and framed by structural tannins. Sage, raspberry and dried mint carry long into the finish.

title: MCV 2015 Gemeny Vineyard Petite Sirah (Paso Robles)
description: Crushed elderberry, lilac, violet, black pepper and teriyaki arise on the nose, although in a reserved manner, for this single vineyard expression. Roasted blackberry and chipped asphalt flavors show on the dark, brooding sip, with slightly tough tannins and level acidity framing the palate.

title: Mengler Family Wines 2014 Alegria Vineyards Dolcetto (Russian River Valley)
description: This light-drinking wine is exotic for this neck of the woods, soft and dusty on the palate with a mix of Mexican chocolate and black-pepper spice. Plum and dark cherry add to its easygoing fruitiness and sophisticated approachability.

title: Montage Vineyards 2013 Unity Red (Malibu Coast)
description: One of the better red wines to come out of Malibu so far, this blend of 70% Syrah and 30% Grenache shows rich black currant, black licorice and gingerbread on the nose. There's hearty blackberry on the palate, alongside baking spice and lavender flavors, as well as strong acidity.

title: Montemar Wines 2013 Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: There's a purity of darkness to the nose of this appellation blend, with aromas of black currant, tart black plum, white pepper, dried thyme and wet concrete. The sip is immediately bright and fresh with boysenberry and elderberry flavors, lifted by hints of wisteria and peppercorns. It's very firmly structured.

title: Paraduxx 2014 Red (Atlas Peak)
description: This blends 55% Cabernet Sauvignon and 45% Sangiovese. Together they combine for a robust, full-bodied and ripe experience marked by red currant, raspberry and smoky oak. Soft and smooth in texture, it has a kick of heat that persists on the finish.

title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Beefy, roasted aromas and superripe fruit flavors highlight this full-bodied, expansive and well-structured wine. The concentrated fruit tones offer dried plums and raisins while the texture has a lot of grip from tannins.

title: Mueller Family Vineyards 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: With 4% Petit Verdot, this mountain wine is a study in tension and weight, fully expressive of oak and grippy tannin. Baked plum, currant and blackberry provide a subtle well-integrated fruitiness to the bold swathes of tobacco and dark chocolate.

title: Chalk Hill 2015 Wright Creek Chardonnay (Chalk Hill)
description: With a voluptuous nose of caramel, this wine is fleshy yet offers integrated acidity and oak. Layers of lemon meringue and ginger snap flavors carry the palate, offering richness and ripeness in a balanced context.

title: Cordant 2015 Wills Hills Vineyard Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of alpine strawberry, framboise, cola, root beer and vanilla give this rich single-vineyard expression a heady spiciness. It's a solid example of how a heavier Grenache can still retain boisterous acidity and compelling grippy texture, amidst flavors of cooked cherries and tangy cranberry sauce.

title: Cottonwood Canyon 2010 Sharon's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: This wine is at its peak, showing aged hibiscus, rusty cranberry, sandalwood and hints of vanilla and clove on the nose. The palate hints at its age, and fades within a few hours, but upon opening shows lovely crushed carnations, more cranberry, star anise and beef jerky flavors.

title: Darcie Kent Vineyards 2013 Stone Patch Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: This enticing wine spent 30 months in French oak and has a spicy cigar-box aroma and complementary flavors combining herbs, tobacco and black cherries. It has well-integrated oak nuances, lots of concentration, a full body and a moderately tannic texture.

title: Etude 2015 Fiddlestix Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Dark red cherry, turned earth and bloody iron aromas show on the extremely soil-driven nose of this bottling. The texture is rounded on the tip of the sip, and then comes the pop of piercing acidity in the midpalate, carrying flavors of dark red fruit, clove, cinnamon and crushed rose petals. The acid needs some time to mellow.

title: Iron Hub 2014 Estate Bottled Syrah (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Very rich in flavor and very warm in mouthfeel, this is an irresistible wine that blends a mildly spicy oak component with ripe, almost raisined fruit flavors and a broad velvety texture.

title: Peter Cellars 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Softly tannic, this is a simple juicy wine, lightly ripe in blackberry and black currant. Secondary flavors come to the fore in the midpalate, dipped in milk chocolate and soy.

title: Treasure 2012 Joseph Proprietary Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a blend of two barrels and it contains a strong lingering notion of cured meat and Italian delicatessen. Thick green tannins spark ongoing flavors of cedar and tobacco within a full-bodied concentrated package.

title: Arbor Bench Vineyards 2014 Estate Malbec (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This wine has a grip to it that hits hard on the palate—a somewhat astringent turn to the tannins. Red fruit and violet work hard to integrate within a full-bodied concentration.

title: Ben Ish 2016 Ben's Select Santiago Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Mokelumne River)
description: Sweet-seeming oak aromas and cherry-jam flavors dress up this bright, pleasant and rather light-bodied wine.

title: Terragena 2014 Seppa Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a lightly ripe wine, possessed of pungent compost, black tea, sandalwood and mushroom aromas that follow through on the palate. The end is simple and tannic.

title: Truth & Valor 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Smoke, red cherry and a hint of rubber show on the nose of this bottling. There is a tangy black-plum flavor on the palate, with hints of dried chile pepper and beef jerky.

title: Jon Nathaniel 2014 Skull Ring Red (Napa Valley)
description: A blend of 67% Syrah and 33% Petit Verdot, this wine is robust and brawny in tobacco leaf, bitterroot and an intensity of tannin. The majority grape contributes savory bites of cigar and leather.

title: Nine North Wine Company 2015 Chasing Lions Pinot Noir (California)
description: An assertive butter and spice overlay makes this otherwise lean wine a little off-balance, but it's not hard to enjoy the vanilla and cedar aromas and crisp spare fruit flavors.

title: SomeWine 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This light to medium-bodied wine has a piney aroma, light cherry and blueberry flavors and very soft tannins. It's a pleasant, pop style of wine with a suggestion of sweetness.

title: Grayson 2016 Lot 10 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Quite oaky in style, this wine starts with menthol and charred-wood aromas followed by flavors like smoked meat and marinated black cherries. It has full body and a thick texture that helps it cling to the palate.

title: Freelander 2016 District One Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Candied cherry and charred oak flavors tumble through this jazzed up medium-bodied wine along with cherry-syrup flavors and a candied impression on the finish.

title: Iron Hub 2015 Estate Bottled Sauvignon Blanc (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: This thick-textured wine has light melon aromas and muted fig flavors. It feels full bodied and emphasizes an oily mouthfeel.

title: Iron Side 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: A smoky dried-meat aroma and rich fruit flavors make a bit of an unusual combination in this medium-bodied smooth-textured wine. It has an element of oak spice and a hint of sweetness too.

title: Oak Mountain 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Temecula Valley)
description: Wet concrete and Anjou pear rinds show on the nose of this bottling. Ripe apple flavors and cut green grass show on the sip, where the flavors are a bit wild and sporadic.

title: Ousterhout 2013 Nance's Vineyard Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: This wine has an oxidized sensibility that makes it feel flat somewhat on the palate. Flavors of tobacco leaf are the strongest

title: Austerity 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Baked red cherry, brown spice, wet gravel and sweet vanilla show on the nose of this bottling. The flavors trend toward muddy clay, bay leaf and light red currant.

title: Kings' Range 2014 Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Really flat on the nose, this shows aromas of black cherry and cedar. The palate offers bland cherry and blackberry fruit with a hint of pepper and leather.

title: AuburnJames 2013 La Cerezas Vineyard Malbec (Napa Valley)
description: This is a leathery wine, a bit thick yet soft in texture, with a full-bodied ripeness of cherry and oaky vanilla.

title: Member's Mark 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Central Coast)
description: Charred cedar, peppercorn and hints of pasilla and ancho chiles show on the nose of this bottling. The pyrazine-powered chile-pepper flavor is very strong on the sip, ranging from crushed green peppercorns to mole sauce, set against a background of plum, boysenberry and coffee.

title: Girard 2015 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Plush and round, this is a simple wine, offering ripe flavors of melon, sweet pear and green olive.

title: Azios 2017 27 Angels? Agua Dulce Vineyard Rosé of Zinfandel (Sierra Pelona Valley)
description: A pretty mauve in color, this rosé starts with rounded and somewhat ripe aromas of cherry, strawberry and plum on the nose, but with a complex backdrop of wet slate and vanilla pastry. There is zesty acidity to the sip, where the red fruit and stone-fruit flavors are strong but refreshing and clean.
designation: 27 Angels? Agua Dulce Vineyard Rosé of

title: Cedarville 2015 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (El Dorado)
description: Full bodied and concentrated in flavor, this wine matches rich, almost jammy flavors with hints of black pepper and toasted oak while firm tannins give it plenty of grip on the palate.

title: Chronic Cellars 2016 Purple Paradise Red (Paso Robles)
description: This blend of 79% Zinfandel, 11% Petite Sirah, 6% Syrah and 4% Grenache starts with aromas of candied strawberry, smoke, clay and slate. There are intriguing notes of mulberry and cherry on the palate, with thyme and dried sage elements that are framed by leathery tannins.

title: Eden Rift 2017 Griva Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Fresh, clean and crisp aromas of Granny Smith apple peels, cut grass and lime rinds show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is fresh and tangy with grapefruit pith and more cut-grass flavors, proving almost puckering and proving very tightly woven.

title: J Wilkes 2016 Pinot Blanc (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Quite a solid wine for under $20, this bottling shows rounded pear flesh, ripe nectarine, yellow-grapefruit pith and a chalky touch to the nose. Crisp lemony acidity defines the sip, where broader apple-flesh flavors also emerge over time.

title: Refugio Ranch 2015 Barbareño Syrah-Petite Sirah (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Very tightly wound on the nose, this bottling shows crushed black rocks, charred wood and roasted lamb on the nose, with berry fruit lingering in the background. Charred blackberry and lilacs show on the palate, where the tannins are prominent and wood spice decorates the entire sip. This is a young wine, likely to improve with time.

title: Larner 2017 Rosé (Ballard Canyon)
description: Aromas of dark strawberry, grenadine and a hint of baking spice show on the nose of this bottling. There is great tension to the palate, where chalky flavors of red plum and pomegranate arise.

title: Mahoney 2014 Las Brisas Vineyard Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: Smoky strawberry and rhubarb accent a velvety full-bodied expression of power and grip in this vineyard-designate, which adds forest floor, black tea and Asian spice to its hearty repertoire.

title: Pulchella 2016 Witness Red (Paso Robles)
description: Rusty aromas of turned earth, damp wood and dark boysenberry make an intriguing entry to this blend of 71% Grenache, 17% Mourvèdre and 12% Syrah. Ripe blackberry kicks off the sip but then comes more nuance via thyme and dried sage, all cut by vanilla on the finish.

title: Roar 2016 Chardonnay (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Lemon peel, red grapefruit pith, butter and a touch of sandalwood show on the nose of this appellation blend. The entry to the palate is clean and crisp with apple and nectarine flavors, broad in the midpalate but racy with acidity, and finishing on a pound-cake warmth.

title: Roblar 2016 Ottimo Syrah-Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Barbara County)
description: Elegantly layered aromas of blackberry and black-cherry sorbet meet with a hint of clove on the nose of this blend of 70% Syrah and 30% Cabernet Sauvignon. It's clean and soft on the palate, where roasted meat, red cherry, lilac and black-plum flavors arise.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very mineral-driven on the nose, with aromas of chalk and wet gravel, this bottling also shows scents of lime and pear rind. The palate is very tangy, with pomelo-pith flavors, but there is also a more rounded touch of cut pear and orange rind.

title: Stephen Ross 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Loads of purple-flower aromas meet with wet slate and black raspberry on the nose of this appellation blend. There is a welcoming freshness to the palate, where zesty flavors of boysenberry and sumac collide.

title: Ancient Peaks 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Margarita Ranch)
description: Crisp aromas of honeysuckle, Anjou pear and green apple lead into more layers of grass, nectarine and wet stone on this bottling, which evolves quickly in the glass. There is strong tension to the palate, where floral flavors meet with honeydew and lemon zest.

title: Calerrain 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Boysenberry and black plum meet with black pepper, cocoa and leather on the nose of this bottling. Roasted meat arises on the palate alongside similar flavors to the nose, with tannins that rise on the finish.

title: Jamie Slone Wines 2014 BoRific Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Aromas of rusty earth, cherry liqueur, dried herbs and roasted meats show on the nose of this blend of 57% Merlot, 22% Cabernet Franc, 14% Cabernet Sauvignon and 7% Malbec. Chalky tannins frame the palate, where muddy clay, dark-cherry and cranberry flavors arise.

title: Millésimé 2013 Bleu Saphir Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Fresh aromas of cherry and cherry blossoms meet with peppery spice and dried tarragon on the nose of this blend of 76% Cabernet Sauvignon, 14% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Franc. There's a strong herbal kick to the palate, with oregano and more pepper, as well as a hint of roasted pasilla chile, but the core is mulberry and exotic plum.

title: Opaque 2015 Darkness Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dense and gooey aromas of blackberry, black plum, blueberry jam, roasted coffee and caramel show on the nose of this kitchen sink blend of six red grapes. The palate is all about heavy hedonism, with rich caramel, fudge and blueberry-jam flavors that are cut by good acidity.

title: Palumbo Family Vineyards 2014 Catfish Vineyard Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Candied-black-cherry aromas are lifted by hints of anise, dried mint and turned earth on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. Cranberry and earthy herb flavors show on the sip, which is framed by chiseled tannins and a brick-like minerality.

title: Paradise Springs 2015 The Roshi Red (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Rounded black plum and concentrated purple flowers make for a somewhat fruity although inviting entry to this blend of 56% Petit Verdot, 18% Cabernet Sauvignon, 18% Merlot and 8% Malbec. Boysenberry-juice flavors show on the palate, which is surprisingly lighter weight.

title: David Arthur 2014 Meritaggio Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Sangiovese, 8% Cabernet Franc and 2% Cabernet Franc. Pretty and inviting, it's bright and grippy, highly enjoyable in its fleshy mix of strawberry and mocha, with deliciously good structure.

title: Dierberg 2015 Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Black raspberry and underripe boysenberry meet with dark gravel on the very focused and dark nose of this single-vineyard estate expression. The wine is tightly woven on the palate, with dark strawberry and plum flavors lifted by a strong floral kick. All the aspects will converge even better with patience. Drink 2020–2035.

title: Dierberg 2015 Ty Drum Canyon Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Named after Jim and Mary Dierberg's first grandson, this bottling is built to last and still young. Aromas of black plum, slate and toasted oak lead into a smooth but grippy palate of mulberry and black pepper. Time will allow more flavors to emerge and coalesce. Drink 2020–2030.

title: J. Lohr 2014 Cuvée Pau Red (Paso Robles)
description: Dark blackberry and blueberry aromas meet with milk chocolate and cocoa beans on the nose of this bottling, which is deep in both color and aroma. There's a soft, lavish entry to the palate, which is rich in firm tannins and cut by proper acidity, showing flavors of berry sorbet, chocolate, vanilla and baking spice. It's still a tad rigid, so drink 2020–2029.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 30th Anniversary Estate Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: The nose of this special anniversary bottling offers a toasted blackberry aroma and a light whiff of lavender oil. The palate is smooth and packed with fresh berries that are slowly consumed by firm tannins and persistent acidity. Very dry and elegant. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Peachy Canyon 2016 Vortex Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Bright red-currant aromas meet with earthy tones of composting red and purple flowers on the elegant nose of this bottling. Herbal seasonings of thyme and anise decorate the palate, where elegant amounts of red and purple fruit prove intriguing.

title: De Loach 2015 Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Hugely concentrated and full bodied, this shows the appellation's cool-climate aromatics and dense, crunchy red fruit well. Nutmeg, cola and dark cherry complement a stretch of dried herb and black tea.

title: Flanagan 2016 Ritchie Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Brioche, honey and matchstick open the door to lush, voluptuous and full-bodied layers of flavor and tension in this bold wine. Toasted, integrated oak accents the rich fruit.

title: Kobler 2017 Rosé of Grenache (Russian River Valley)
description: Textured acidity contrasts well against this wine's backdrop of lushly round body and a ripeness of cherry and strawberry fruit. A floral element of rose and lavender adds complexity and a beguiling quality to the nose.

title: Marimar Estate 2017 Rosaleda Doña Margarita Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Beautifully aromatic and inviting in scents of lemon peel and rose petal, this is a bright, acid-driven wine. Watermelon, tangerine and cherry flavors mingle effortlessly in the glass, with undertones of minerally wet stone.
designation: Rosaleda Doña Margarita Vineyard Estate Grown Estate Bottled Rosé of

title: JCB 2015 N° 3 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: The producer unusually mixes grapes from both California and Burgundy's Côte de Nuits in this red. It's deeply expressive in tones of licorice and lavender. Powerfully structured tannins provide support to a dense, velvety texture as waves of dark cherry and boysenberry impart richness.

title: Longboard 2015 Ledbetter Family Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Soft, round and approachable, this 100% varietal wine is bright in strawberry, blackberry and vanilla, both tart and brambly. It offers structure and a lasting impression of white pepper, the oak well integrated and supportive.

title: Longboard 2015 Rodgers Creek Vineyard Syrah (Sonoma Coast)
description: A 100% varietal wine from the great cool-climate site reveals subtle power around velvety waves of dark cherry and blackberry flavor. Elegant and complex, it leans savory into dried herb, lavender and garrigue, with a lasting finish of white pepper.

title: Paradise Springs 2016 K III G-S-M (Santa Barbara County)
description: This fresh, zesty and eminently quaffable blend of 60% Grenache, 20% Syrah and 20% Mourvèdre is quite a steal for the bicoastal winery's entry-level wine. Aromas of black cherry, hibiscus and rosewater lead into a lively palate of joyous red fruit, chalky textures and poppy acidity.

title: Refugio Ranch 2015 Escondrijo Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Soft, pleasing and rounded aromas of black currant, violet, açaí and lavender show on the nose of this blend of 57% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 8% Petite Sirah. The palate is very full and lush with polished but firm tannins, offering roasted blackberry, grilled beef and an array of purple-flower flavors.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2014 Astral Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: There's an elegance to the nose of this bottling that combines charred wood with purple flowers and boysenberry jam. It's still very structured and somewhat rigid on the palate, where espresso bean flavors meet with black currant, charred beef and light mint. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Baileyana 2016 Firepeak Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: There's a strong flinty note to the nose of this bottling, which meshes with smoked apple and dried lemon-peel aromas. The palate is wound up tight, and the smoke and flint show again, but fall in line behind the nectarine, white peach and lime zest flavors.

title: Camlow 2015 Magna Porcum Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: Smooth in cherry cola and vanilla, this wine has a spicy backbone that gives it balance and complexity, a crunchiness of red fruit and texture that intrigues.

title: Dierberg 2015 Dierberg Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There is a lot of pent-up energy on the nose of this fresh and zesty bottling, which shows aromas of key lime, tangerine, wet stone and a hint of nectarine. The palate is overloaded with citrusy flavors, from Meyer lemon peel to grapefruit pith, but there is also baked-apple warmth at its core.

title: Eden Rift 2016 Dickinson Block Zinfandel (Cienega Valley)
description: From a head-trained block of Zinfandel planted in 1906, this is a great wine even without that history. Elegantly earthy aromas of sage, dried red plums, vanilla brioche and black cherry Popsicle lead into a deep rich sip, where blueberry and tart black-plum skins decorate the creamy palate.

title: Zotovich Cellars 2016 Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Stewed cherries, baking spice and cranberry-laced fruit-punch aromas show on the nose of this bottling. Cooked watermelon, plum jam and pomegranate reveal themselves on the plush palate, which lacks a bit of zip.

title: Ca' Momi NV Heartcraft Sparkling White Sparkling (California)
description: This frothy wine is very fruity and lightly sweet, with a strong effervescence and pleasant apple and peach flavors. It tastes bright and lively, very fresh and straightforward.

title: Carson Scott 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This medium-bodied wine has lots of fruitiness in the aromas and the flavors, showing golden apple and Bosc pear in the nose, and richer, almost-sweet yellow-peach flavors on the palate. It's on the soft side in terms of acidity, and has a plush texture.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: Elderberry, wood smoke, charred beef and baked soil show on the nose of this bottling from a region south of Hollister. There is a lot of earthy flavor on the sip, with wet soil adding to the tangy black plum skin and smoke qualities.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 The Immigrant Red (Paicines)
description: Slightly sour cranberry fruit meets with dust and uncrushed peppercorn on the nose of this mostly Merlot bottling. The tangy red-plum-skin fruit shows on the sip too against a backbone laced in dried garden herbs.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2016 Pinot Blanc (Central Coast)
description: A very pale yellow in color, this bottling shows aromatic pear and lime juice on the broad yet sharp nose. The texture is a bit flat on the sip, and the peachy flavors are quite strong, with yellow pear in the midpalate and a slightly vinous touch on the finish.

title: Jessie's Grove 2013 Front Row Earth Zin and Fire Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: This is a well-behaved wine that should please a crowd with its easygoing plummy flavors, smooth texture and soft acidity. It's medium-bodied and fresh-tasting.
designation: Front Row Earth Zin and Fire

title: Ca' Momi NV Heartcraft Sparkling Rosé Sparkling (California)
description: A bright pink color and unusually toasty spicy aromas are followed by bright raspberry flavors and a heavy layer of oaky spices, like cinnamon and ginger. It's a rosé with attitude.

title: Carmel Road 2014 Panorama Vineyard Pinot Noir (Arroyo Seco)
description: Pomegranate and fennel frond aromas show on the nose of this bottling. The palate has cranberry and more pomegranate, with a crushed slate and gunmetal minerality.

title: Rolling Plains 2014 Reserve Merlot (Monterey County)
description: Dark plum, mulberry, wet river stones and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this bottling. Candied pomegranate and baked red plum arise on the sip, with strong vanilla and baking spice flavors. The tannins are oddly both thin and chalky.

title: Zinsane 2015 Zinfandel (Lodi)
