description: This is a very smooth, gentle wine, offering plenty of lush strawberry and cherry in the aroma and flavor while not going overboard in body. It feels supple and lightly sweet on the palate, and has very mild tannins.

title: Clos La Chance 2015 Reserve Primitivo (Central Coast)
description: Fruity and flowery aromas of black cherry soda, dried strawberry and hibiscus show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is somewhat thin, with flavors of berry jam, anise and a pinch of thyme.

title: Gershon Bachus 2013 Anteros Red (Temecula Valley)
description: This blend of 50% Cabernet Franc and 50% Zinfandel shows pepper, plump purple flowers, candied berries and Concord grape on the nose. There is piquant boysenberry fruit on the sip, as well as candied violets and lilacs, but the wine still tastes very young and needs more resolution.

title: Eagle Eye 2013 Estate AlphaWolf Vineyard Reserve Cabernet Franc (Napa Valley)
description: Brawny and rustic, this wine is sizable in tannin and oak, making for a big presence on the palate. Spicy clove is met by leathery tobacco and varietal aspects of cedar and dried herb.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Pinot Noir (Monterey County)
description: Rustic cherry, rhubarb and turned loam, along with a touch of fresh thyme, show on the nose of this fancifully labeled twist-top bottling. It's a bit thin on the palate, with sour red fruit, bay leaf and anise flavors.

title: Kendall-Jackson 2014 Vintner's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: This wine pulls from all over Sonoma County to create a tannic, oaky and fruity combination of lush black cherry and cassis wrapped around vanilla and dried herb. Bold and brawny, it holds its ripeness in check.

title: Nine North Wine Company 2014 Hullabaloo Zinfandel (California)
description: Wood smoke aromas and flavors give a spicy edge to this full-bodied, moderately tannic and perhaps slightly sweet wine. A toasted oak element is behind the smokiness, and it provides good counterpoint against the almost syrupy fruit flavors.

title: Owl Ridge 2015 Sauvignon Blanc (Central Coast)
description: Cut grass, wet cement and lemon wedge show on the slightly reductive nose of this bottling. The palate is sour and almost bitter with more cut grass and strong grapefruit-peel flavors.

title: Paris Valley Road 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Mild fruit flavors and subtle spices give this medium-bodied wine a low profile. The aromas are vaguely appley and the flavors bring hints of vanilla, while soft acidity and a light buttery finish complete the picture.

title: Pra Vinera 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (California)
description: Quite aromatic and equally flavorful, this medium-bodied wine has a sense of sweetness from the strawberry and sandalwood aromas to the marinated cherry and maple syrup flavors. The texture is rounded and soft.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Petris Vineyard Bien Nacido Clone Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: This wine has stewy plummy flavors of dried and baked fruit that's dusty and textured on the palate. Sanguine, soft and simple, it lives up to its varietal character within a full-bodied voluptuousness.

title: Atlas Peak 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this is a thick, rich wine hearty in black fruit and tight dusty tannin. Full-bodied in tobacco and oak, it finishes simply.

title: Bellante 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated fig and strawberry-balsamic aromas are quite syrupy on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers rounded mulberry fruit and peppery spice, but the vinegar aspect remains dominant.

title: Bailarin 2016 Rosé (North Coast)
description: A smooth texture, good acidity and mild fruit flavors make this full-bodied wine from a new Sonoma County producer easy to sip and enjoy.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Gabriel Barbera (Contra Costa County)
description: Sleek and lean, this wine blends raspberry aromas with almost-tart raspberry and red-cherry flavors. It is medium bodied and light on the tannins.

title: Carol Shelton 2016 Piazza Ranch Old Vine Pizazz Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Heavily influenced by spicy oak, this wine smells like maple syrup and blackberry jam, tastes like ginger cookies, and is a touch sweet.

title: LangeTwins 2013 Single Barrel The Eighty Vineyard Teroldego (Lodi)
description: An extremely deep, dark color makes this wine stand out at first glance, and then it gives up equally vivid cedar and oak aromas followed by thick and potent blackberry and pomegranate flavors on the palate. Very firm tannins and some astringency finish the picture.

title: Las Positas 2016 Estate Rosé (Livermore Valley)
description: A bright pink color and cherry candy aromas are followed by a dry palate and flavors almost as vivid as in a red wine. Herbal, savory accents join tart red cherry in this rather full-bodied wine.

title: Fallon Place 2016 La Cruz Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Stainless steel fermented and then aged in neutral French oak, this white is light, ripe and simple, wrapped up in confectionery hints of peach, apricot and melon supported by subtle wooden tones.

title: Fenestra 2015 Sangiovese (San Francisco Bay)
description: Earthy, herbal aromas and a considerable amount of oak flavor drives this full-bodied, relatively soft-textured wine. It has black-plum and raisin notes on the palate and a broad mouthfeel.

title: Reyes 2009 Cabernet Sauvignon (Los Angeles County)
description: Concentrated black currant, cola and balsamic-fig sauce show on the powerful nose of this bottling. There is a fresh boysenberry-juice flash to the palate with a touch of black pepper, with roasted fruit and caramel on the finish.

title: The Lost Chapters 2013 Zinfandel (Oak Knoll District)
description: This wine is stewy in black cherry and baked plum, with a density of big ripeness and oak. The finish has a dash of black pepper on offer.

title: Alexander Valley Vineyards 2015 Estate Merlot (Alexander Valley)
description: This medium-bodied wine has a dusty grip of clove and tobacco, savory elements that play well against a backdrop of soft expansive dark cherry and cassis.

title: Member's Mark 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Tightly tannic and brimming with oak flavor, this full-bodied effort shows a wealth of vanilla and cherry-cream flavors, as well as a strong streak of baked bread and dusty clove.

title: Tanner 2014 Estate Grown Carignane (Sierra Foothills)
description: Very fruity and supple, this medium-bodied wine has a baked plum aroma. The smooth palate brings a brighter Bing cherry tone, with a good lick of acidity and soft tannins.

title: The Blending Lab 2015 eCS Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Balsamic-cherry reduction aromas meet with woody herbs and a pinch of pyrazines on the nose of this bottling. It's somewhat green in character on the sip as well, with a wide variety of dried herbs sprinkled over cooked strawberry fruit.

title: Meeker 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Blended with 15% Syrah and nearly 8% Cabernet Franc, this hearty full-bodied wine is sizable in leather, cedar, pencil and sage. The fruit is elusive at first, taking its time to impart shades of black cherry and currant.

title: River Road 2016 Reserve Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Stemmy in earthy rusticity, this wine is light bodied and somewhat thin in texture, offering a balanced taste of baked strawberry.

title: Chalk Hill 2016 Windy Ridge Sauvignon Blanc (Chalk Hill)
description: Exotic in a nose of lemongrass and papaya, this medium-bodied white becomes slightly sweet on the palate, showing an overripe succulence accented in spritzy acidity and freshly cut grass.

title: Jessie's Grove 2017 Steel Chardonnay (Lodi)
description: Light peach and honey aromas lead to very ripe, full fruit flavors and a hint of sweetness on the palate. This unoaked wine has medium to full body and a rich soft texture.

title: Aver Family Vineyards 2014 Heritage Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Dark and deep aromas of black currant, black plum and kirsch meet with shaved licorice on the nose of this bottling. There is chalky tannic framing and decent layers of acid on the sip, where milk chocolate and caramel meet with cassis and black-cherry flavors.

title: Clark-Claudon 2014 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Soft and rich as a chocolate brownie covered in raspberry jam, this is a decadent exploration of 100% Cabernet Sauvignon, aged two years in French oak, the majority of it new. Rich and dense, it has round approachable tannins and a lasting flavor of mountain-grown blueberry.

title: De Loach 2015 Van Der Kamp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Mountain)
description: Tart and tangy, with a high-strung streak of acidity that's fresh and focused, this wine traffics in forest pine, strawberry and a lasting linger of orange rind.

title: Hearst Ranch 2016 Bunkhouse Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A refreshing approach to the grape, this bottling offers red currant and black plum alongside an earthy elegance of gravel and wood on the nose. It's well balanced on the palate, with flavors of ripe red fruit, wood spice, dried herb and tobacco.

title: Roadhouse Winery 2016 Platinum Pinot Noir (Yorkville Highlands)
description: Generous fruit and oak-spice flavors fill out this full-bodied and plush-textured wine quite nicely. It has an attractive earthy, figgy aroma, and ripe warm baked-cherry and baking-spice flavors with good depth and length.

title: Schramsberg 2015 Brut Rosé Sparkling (North Coast)
description: This elegant and well-balanced wine has a brilliant copper color, tangy cherry and apple-skin flavors and a mouth-filling mousse. It tastes nicely dry and a bit lean and nervy in character.

title: Star Lane Vineyard 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Very rich and deep blackberry aromas meet with smoke and crushed herbs on the nose of this still very young wine. The palate is balanced in structure, showing flavors of pepper, dried herb, elderberry and dust. Drink 2020–2030.

title: Sanford 2017 Estate Grown Rosé of Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Slightly darker in color that most pale-pink rosés, this wine offers aromas of ripe watermelon, strawberry, cherry and red plum, proving quite aromatic. There is great tension to the palate, where zesty citrus and red fruit flavors are fresh and vibrant.

title: Alara 2017 Grenache Rosé (San Benito County)
description: A light, citrusy aroma of lemon pith meets with tones of strawberry and wet cement on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows a clean line of river stone, with a rounded sense of plum and light cranberry.

title: Claiborne & Churchill 2016 Runestone Wolff Vineyard Pinot Noir (Edna Valley)
description: Light aromas of rose petals, raspberry sorbet, carnations and hibiscus make for a snappy, fresh entry to this bottling, which is an ode to Nordic legends that the winery's founder once studied. It's tart and tangy on the sip with red-plum-skin and cranberry flavors, lifted by thyme and bay leaf.

title: Côte West 2017 Mounts Vineyard Rosé of Counoise (Dry Creek Valley)
description: This is a fresh lovely wine made entirely from the variety, fuzzy in stone-fruit flavors and a companion of red grapefruit. Strong in acidity and wet stone minerality, it's impressively fresh, focused and imminently enjoyable.

title: Dry Creek Vineyard 2015 DCV7 Estate Wallace Ranch Single Vineyard Series Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Big, lingering tannins give this wine impressive complexity against a framework of tart blackberry, dark cherry and a dusty mix of savory spice. Supple layers of chocolate caramel and mint add more to the story, finishing in an impressive balance of rich fruit and bright acidity.
designation: DCV7 Estate Wallace Ranch Single Vineyard Series

title: Foxen 2016 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This appellation blend offers a more affordable way to see what owners Bill Wathen and Dick Doré were up to in 2016, and the results are delicious. Aromas of fresh raspberry, gravelly earth and sagebrush lead into a palate loaded with tangy, vibrant and fresh flavors of tart red fruit, pepper spice and flower petals.

title: Gloria Ferrer 2010 Extra Brut LD Reserve Cuvée Sparkling (Carneros)
description: Creamy and lush, this late-disgorged blend of Pinot Noir and Chardonnay has a slightly metallic edge that adds earthy complexity and intrigue to the medium-bodied mix. Flavors lean into green apple, pear and strawberry with ease.

title: Lichen Estate 2017 Les Pinots Noir & Gris White (Anderson Valley)
description: This is an elegant and beautifully balanced white wine made in an unusual way by combining the juice of Pinot Noir grapes that are pressed right after picking with Pinot Gris juice. It matches crispness with smoothness, has fresh apple and white peach flavors, light body and low alcohol.

title: MacRostie 2016 Charles Heintz Vineyard Chardonnay (Green Valley)
description: Olive, fig and candied lemon peel provide an exotic complexity to this vineyard-designate, from the famous sandy Goldridge soil-site in Occidental. Salty oak and sea spray add a minerality that's welcome against a full-bodied palate flecked in tart, light acidity.

title: Toccata 2014 Riserva Red (Santa Barbara County)
description: There is a pleasing roasted black-cherry aroma to the start of this wine, but then come more elegant touches of gravelly minerality and dried soil. On the well-rounded palate, the blend of 65% Cabernet Sauvignon, 20% Sangiovese, 5% Merlot, 5% Freisa and 5% Petit Verdot offers fresh cranberry, cherry, plum skins and roasted beef flavors.

title: Bell 2016 Syrah (Sierra Foothills)
description: This is a very attractive and well-oaked wine with spicy-sweet aromas backed by nicely ripe plum and cherry flavors and a smooth medium-bodied feel on the palate. Aged in French and American barrels, more than half of which were new, the wine is hard to resist for its spiciness, fruitiness and plush texture.

title: Emeritus 2015 Hallberg Ranch Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: In a vintage that saw early bud break an uneven fruit set, this shows ample concentration and thick tannin. Velvety on the palate, it features voluptuous flavors of lavender, orange, cherry and strawberry around a backbone of distinctive acidity.

title: Girasole 2017 Pinot Blanc (Mendocino County)
description: This wine balances flavorful, ripe fruit flavors with subtle acidity and a smooth, polished texture. Light hints of flowers and pistachios add complexity on the palate.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dark berry fruit, loamy soil and dense purple flowers make for a pure straightforward nose on this bottling from the longtime producer. The palate shows pleasant flavors of black currant and black cherry with hints of vanilla and anise-laced biscotti. The tannins are chalky, tough nearly chunky, and will smooth with time.

title: Lion Ranch 2015 Two Lions Red (Central Coast)
description: Blackberry jam, tangy plum skins, pepper and sagebrush show on the nose of this blend of 60% Grenache and 40% Syrah. The palate reveals tart hibiscus, cranberry and the slightest dusting of dried herbs, all presented with decent acidic energy.

title: Markham 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hearty version of the variety, blended with 12% Cabernet Sauvignon and 2% Petite Sirah. Black licorice, Dr. Pepper and densely rich, extracted black cherry and blueberry accent a full-bodied softly textured palate of approachability.

title: Napa Cellars 2015 V Collection Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: This wine is fruit-forward and layered in powerful swathes of grape and cherry flavor, with aspects of earth, forest pine and cardamom seasoning throughout. The structure is moderate and the texture fleshy, with oak pronounced.

title: Pear Valley 2014 Distraction Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black cherry, tarragon, toasted coconut and anise show on the nose of this blend of 26% Cabernet Sauvignon, 25% Cabernet Franc, 24% Merlot, 16% Petit Verdot and 9% Malbec. The dark palate offers black currant, black plum, cocoa, light mint and crushed gravel on the finish. It's well structured.

title: Porterhouse Winery 2014 Williams' Reserve Red (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: As ode to his family's butchering past, this red blend would go very well with one of the fatty steaks that winemaker Adam Comartin's relatives once cut. Aromas of licorice, sandalwood, lilac and jammy fruits lead into a palate loaded with clove, nutmeg, thyme and pepper spice, all set against a backdrop of boysenberry fruit.

title: Cambiata 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Rounded red-cherry fruit meets with aromas of potpourri and caramelized oak on the nose of this fairly priced bottling. The oak is very prominent on the palate, lending vanilla and hickory flavors to the red currant and clove base. Acidity washes into the finish.

title: Luna 2015 Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: Made from 100% of the variety, this is expectedly dark in color and big and weighty in tannin and oak. Inviting aromas of cinnamon, mushroom, graphite and cedar give it more of a savory profile, searching for fruit, which appears in the form of black currant. The finish is bitter in leather and black pepper.

title: Occasio 2014 Telos Red (Livermore Valley)
description: Spicy oak combines with ripe black grape and black-cherry flavors in this bold and nicely tannic wine. Paired with a beefy dish it will be just right. Best after 2020.

title: Trenza 2013 Obispan Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Roasted blackberry and caramelized fennel bulb show on the nose of this blend of 53% Cabernet Sauvignon, 42% Syrah and 5% Petite Sirah. Prominent licorice spice shows on the blueberry-laced palate, where tannins stick to your teeth and the acidity holds everything up.

title: Leverage 2015 Acceleration Red (Paso Robles)
description: Deep black plum, vanilla, star anise and a touch of caramel show on the nose of this blend of 71% Grenache, 15% Mourvèdre and 14% Syrah. The palate is fairly rich and nearly sweet, with sugar plums and dark-brown-spice flavors, all balanced by a compelling texture and bright acidity.

title: Parducci 2014 True Grit Reserve Red (Mendocino County)
description: This wine is packed with black cherry, dark chocolate and espresso flavors that coat the palate with a nicely thick texture. It's not overtly fruity, though, and has lots of fine tannins to shape the mouthfeel.

title: Di Bruno 2013 Sangiovese (Santa Barbara County)
description: Tangy fruits of pomegranate, strawberry and orange rind meet with dried ginger and Christmas spice on the nose of this bottling. It's light and easy on the palate, sailing through with bright red fruits and hints of herbs.

title: Franciscan 2014 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a well-made approachable wine, aromatic in black cherry, cola and plum. Thick ripe flavors are highlighted in brick, black pepper and toasted oak.

title: Mount Aukum 2015 Viognier (Fair Play)
description: This wine oozes fresh fruity, floral aromas and has light bright flavors to match. Touches of honey and orange come out on the palate, where the texture feels just right between a touch of richness and liveliness.

title: Tolosa 2016 Poletti Edna Ranch Chardonnay (Edna Valley)
description: This is an unctuous tale on Chardonnay, very much in line with the classic Californian style. Aromas of baked Asian pear, oak, butterscotch and caramel show on the nose, leading into a broad, buttery and viscous palate of lemon balm and coconut cream.

title: Bonny Doon 2016 Grenache (Monterey County)
description: This blend of three vineyards, including one in Santa Barbara County, offers intriguing sweet-and-sour aromas of dried sage, bay leaf, forest floor and olive tapenade. Dried berry fruit shows on the sip alongside chaparral, and it tastes much older than its young age.

title: Cambridge & Sunset 2016 Chardonnay (California)
description: This is a solid-quality wine that tastes good and fruity, has a nice blend of acidity and richness and a rather full body that coats the palate. It's enjoyable to drink and seems to have everything in good proportions.

title: Chacewater 2016 Chardonnay (Lake County)
description: Earthy, buttery aromas join good fruity ones in this medium-bodied and mineral-tinged wine. It has firm acidity and a slightly astringent texture that give it a lean, bracing quality.

title: Donati Family Vineyard 2014 Ezio Cabernet Sauvignon (Paicines)
description: Dense soil aromas, leather, olive, charred beef, roasted wood and crushed asphalt make for a very dry and savory nose on this bottling. There's a tarry character to the palate that shadows the black fruit, allowing the black olive and black pepper to take the lead.

title: Briceland 2014 Ronda's Vineyard Pinot Noir (Humboldt County)
description: This lively, rather lean wine has enticing spicy aromas and exotic fruit flavors on a frame of good acidity and firm tannins. Light touches of spicy oak add some complexity, and the texture is robust enough to pair with very rich proteins.

title: Annabella 2014 Special Selection Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This is a hearty, full-bodied wine with some age on it. It is robust in a popular style that offers bold layers of anise, baked peach and pineapple.

title: Barton 2015 Forever Young Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: Aromas of lemon rind, pink grapefruit skins and apple flesh are somewhat reserved on the nose of this bottling. The palate shows apple rinds, seared nectarine, guava skins, lemongrass and a strong cut-grass flavor.

title: La Follette 2015 Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: This attractive wine smells fruity and spicy, almost liked mulled wine, and has a broad warm texture that makes it easy to sip. A deep color and soft finish complete the picture.

title: Lorenzi Estate 2013 Estate Grown Cabernet Franc (Temecula Valley)
description: Freshly pressed raspberries and boysenberries meet with cherry syrup, baking spice and distilled rosewater on the nose of this bottling, which is interesting if not particularly Cab Franc-like. Though framed by somewhat wobbly tannins, the palate is lighter than expected, with licorice, lavender and boysenberry flavors, plus a touch of pepper in the background.

title: Chesebro 2015 Cedar Lane Grenache Blanc (Arroyo Seco)
description: Very light in color, there's a yeasty quality to this bottling, with aromas of sourdough showing alongside green banana, wet sand and muddy clay. The palate picks up a brioche touch and rides a compelling chalky texture, making for a very interesting take on the grape.

title: Coniglio 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty red currant combines with toasty oak in this structured integrated wine that holds its ripeness with grace. Bright acidity supports the overall weight and concentration.

title: Cutruzzola 2015 Riven Rock Vineyard Riesling (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Light in color, this bottling shows lemon rinds, orange blossoms, lime zest, wet concrete and the slightest hint of petrol on the nose. The flavors are very rounded and botanical in nature, with gin-like touches of lime skin, apple blossom and a sweet juniper touch. It offers great tension and acid.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2015 Emilia's Cuvée Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Perfumed in apple and orange blossom aromas, this is a robust, fleshy wine that leans into an intensity of apple, melon and pineapple flavor, finishing focused and steeped in oak.

title: Frank Family 2014 Zinfandel (Napa Valley)
description: Brambly blackberry, black cherry and black coffee intermingle in this full-bodied richly ripe and robust red. Thick in tannin and oak, the fruit finds its balance and has its day.

title: Kopriva 2016 Ricci Vineyard Unoaked Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: This no-oak white is well-integrated in acidity and offers layers of flavor and texture. Highlights of white peach, lemon curd and vanilla bean give it a fruity substance within a refreshingly crisp, clean context.

title: Midnight 2013 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of plum, spice cake, dried ginger, loam and purple flowers make for a dense entry to this heavy-duty bottling. Ripe flavors of dark strawberry meet with star anise and clove on the sip, where a chalky tannic structure almost hides the slight sweetness.

title: Paskett 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Lodi)
description: An element of spicy oak helps give this medium-bodied wine some extra complexity, and blends well with the moderately ripe black-cherry flavors. The mouthfeel is smooth, making it easy to sip and enjoy.

title: Pegasus Estate 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Light and pleasant aromas of red cherry and cedar are lifted by peppercorn, dried herbs and the slightest hint of dried chile on the nose of this bottling. It's a lighter bodied and easy to enjoy wine on the palate, with red cherry, dried herbs, roasted cocoa, a touch of pine needle and a bit of wood smoke.

title: Press Run 2014 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: Herbal fennel meets a steely nose of tart, taut acidity and well-defined flavors of apple and melon in this straightforward, enjoyable white. Firm and fleshy on the midpalate, it finishes with that same steeliness with which it began.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Preserved lemons, lime pith, cold cement and a hint of honeydew show on the nose of this bottling. The palate is very rounded with yellow apples and cut-grass flavors, upheld by a chalky texture.

title: Scheid 2016 Albariño (Arroyo Seco)
description: Vibrant lime blossom and grapefruit-spray aromas meet with warmer pear and nectarine scents on the attention-grabbing fruit-forward nose of this bottling. There is a good zing to the palate, where the Key lime, crisp pear and kiwi flavors converge against a compelling texture.

title: Anonymous 2013 Red (Napa Valley)
description: This blends Cabernet Sauvignon, Petite Sirah, Merlot and Zinfandel into a brawny, decadent whole. Juicy in blackberry, it is softly approachable and robust in brown sugar and chocolate.

title: Bokisch 2016 Terra Alta Vineyard Albariño (Lodi)
description: Light body, fresh and tangy fruit flavors and crisp acidity make this a lively, refreshing wine to sip before or during a meal. It resembles honeydew melon and green apples in the aroma, and stays fruity but not heavy on the palate.

title: Bonterra 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This light-bodied wine made from organic grapes seems earthy at first whiff but settles down to crisp citrus flavors, good cleansing acidity and very fresh herb and melon flavors. It's just the thing to pair with light appetizers and seafood.

title: Oso Libre 2014 Nativo Primitivo (Adelaida District)
description: Elegant baked fruit aromas and gingerbread spice make for a powerful entry to the nose of this bottling. The palate is ripe and rich with black currant, roasted berry and grilled fig flavors, dusted with ample baking spice, and cut by a slight acidity.

title: Raymond 2015 LVE Red (Napa Valley)
description: This is a burly blend of 65% Petite Sirah and 35% Merlot. Brimming in jammy blackberry and black cherry, it has a touch of clove and cinnamon within its folds of soft plush fruit.

title: Sarah's Vineyard 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Clara Valley)
description: From the estate's Dwarf Oak Vineyard, this bottling shows rounded red cherry, pomegranate, fruit punch and cinnamon stick on the nose. It's lean and racy with high acid on the palate, proving tart with a compelling texture although not much strong flavor on the palate.

title: Stolpman 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Ballard Canyon)
description: Fresh lime and wet stone meet with reductive grassy aromas and a touch of pear on the nose of this bottling. It's very tangy on the palate, showing citrus and apple cider elements.

title: Theorize 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This white has a Muscat-like quality, a sweetness of peach, fig and apricot that's exotic and pronounced. Jasmine plays expertly on the nose.

title: Wilson Creek 2016 Cammi Ridge Vineyard Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: Dried blackberries, pepper-crusted meats and dried lilac aromas make for a lively nose on this bottling. The palate combines roasted meat with plump berry flavors, proving quite juicy, and even veering into candied red-apple and melon flavors.

title: Acumen 2014 Mountainside Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Blended with 7% Merlot plus smaller amounts of Malbec, Cabernet Franc and Petit Verdot, this well-made wine is understated in its rich rounded smoothness, decadent in black cherry and a caramelized taste of vanilla.

title: Balletto 2017 Estate Grown Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: This is a crisp, clear and freshly focused wine, direct in its lemon freshness and strong flavors of grapefruit, green apple and tenacious acidity.

title: Bel Vino 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: Freshly smashed red fruits meet with hints of pine oil and herbs on the nose of this bottling. It lands somewhat sweetly on the palate with ripe red cherry, and then comes a wave of light, pleasant herbs.

title: Broadside 2016 Margarita Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dried berries, loamy earth and dried mint show on the nose of this fairly priced Cab that's great for everyday sipping and versatile with a variety of foods. The palate combines dried plum flavors with a strong sense of dried herbs and earthy elements.

title: Buttonwood 2016 Merlot (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: This fresh, twist-top bottling makes for a great weekday table win, starting with aromas of light red fruit, oregano and damp wood. There's a strong herbal kick to the palate, which gives depth to the tangy cranberry fruit and lighter texture.

title: Collier Creek 2017 Crafty Fox Merlot (Lodi)
description: Red cherry aromas and a creamy texture highlight this medium-bodied, well-priced and certified sustainable wine. It has good concentration to keep your interest and very smooth tannins for easy drinking.

title: Dante Robere 2015 Petite Sirah (Livermore Valley)
description: Strong woody aromas like cedar, oak and wood smoke are carried through in the flavors of this big and firmly tannic wine. Oak and baking-spice notes dominate the taste while the full body fills the mouth and releases blueberry and blackberry on the finish.

title: Draxton 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Polished and generous tannins wrap around elusive fruit and more up-front notions of clove and forest in this older vintage wine. Underlying succulence saves it from tasting too broadly flat or undefined.

title: Draxton 2017 Rosé of Pinot Meunier (Napa Valley)
description: Tasting like a cherry-orange Creamsicle, this wine from an unusual variety is pleasing in freshness and lighthearted body weight, an easygoing quaff that many will enjoy.

title: Flanagan 2014 The Beauty of Three Red (Bennett Valley)
description: A proprietary blending of 80% Cabernet Sauvignon with 15% Syrah and 5% Merlot, this is a big-boned, considerably ripe expression of blackberry, black currant and soy with a soft rounded structure and finish of cocoa powder.

title: Maddalena 2013 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: A bit faint on the nose, this bottling offers aromas of candied blackberry, lilac and a touch of balsamic glaze. That tangy balsamic character shows on the sip as well along with a pinch of dried herbs.

title: Markham 2015 Cellar 1879 Red (Napa Valley)
description: Smooth, structured and easygoing in red fruit, this offers decadent chocolate undertones within well-integrated, softly elegant structure. The richness is offset by bursts of black pepper and gamy meat.

title: Mietz 2014 Claret (Sonoma County)
description: This blends equal parts Merlot and Petit Verdot seamlessly into a moderately ripe, structured wine, high-toned in dried herb and red currant, with a grippy oaky finish.

title: Oso Libre NV Grande Red (California)
description: Very concentrated on the nose, this thick Bordeaux blend shows raisin, black currant, milk chocolate and caramel on the nose. Blackberry paste and prunes arise on the sip alongside baking spice, clove and licorice.

title: Judge Palmer 2014 Vintage Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Sonoma County)
description: Eucalyptus, bay leaf and mint accent an herbal entry of earthiness before thick robust tannins surround concentrated ripeness and power that's subdued in fruit. Tobacco, clove and mocha shine through.

title: Rock Wall 2016 Heringer Vineyard Aglianico (Yolo County)
description: This is a lean, nervy wine with firm tannins and edgy acidity backing the raspberry and cranberry flavors. It's medium bodied, lively and dry.

title: Scotto Family Cellars 2016 Anthony & Dominic Pinot Noir (North Coast)
description: An extremely dark color and pronounced oak notes in both the aroma and the flavor make this a dramatic and rather simple wine. It has a sense of sweetness, like caramel and chocolate and a rich mouthfeel.

title: Talbott 2016 Kali Hart Pinot Noir (Monterey)
description: Reserved aromas of dark red fruit and damp soil show on the shy nose of this bottling. The flavors are also a little flat, with wet clay, red fruit and sharp acidity most prominent.

title: The Crusher 2015 Merlot (California)
description: This medium-boded oaky style of wine has baking-spice aromas and sweet-seeming flavors like blackberry jam along with moderate tannins.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Wynonna's Vineyard Syrah
description: Earthy dusty barnyard elements blend into the dark-fruit flavors of this medium-to full-bodied wine. It has a good base of black plum and a nice sense of smoothness and maturity on the palate.

title: Fogline Vineyards 2013 Hillside Block Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy in compost, this wine is oaky, tart in acidity and slightly reduced, taking a medium-bodied approach to ripeness and rich cherry fruit.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Viognier (South Coast)
description: A ripe take on an already unctuous grape, this bottling shows tuberose, lily, ripe white peach and fresh nectarine on the rich nose. The palate is also very ripe with flavors of Bosc and Anjour pear, baked apple and strong honeysuckle.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2015 Chardonnay (California)
description: Very shy on the nose, this bottling from the family's Malibu estate eventually offers slightly sour lemons with patience. The citrus flavors are strong on the sip as well.

title: SeaGlass 2016 Pinot Noir (Santa Barbara County)
description: Oak smoke, red cherry and cranberry aromas show on the nose of this widely available bottling. Thin but clean cranberry-juice flavors mix with hibiscus, cola spice and more smoke on the palate.

title: Sergio 2014 Arcano Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is from a vineyard in the foothills of Atlas Peak, as well as Howell Mountain, blended with 4% Malbec. Soy, leather and tart dry tannins define it, with a present herbaceous quality that may need more time to resolve.

title: Y3 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: This is a light, bright and 100% stainless steel fermented and aged white, grassy and herbal in lemongrass and fresh peas. The acidity is focused and spritzy.

title: Barefoot NV Merlot (California)
description: Spicy aromas, good concentration and an off-dry flavor make this wine robust while staying rather soft and friendly for people who don't love aggressive tannins.

title: Sobon Estate 2016 Barbera (Amador County)
description: Floral perfumy aromas meet ripe, almost raisiny flavors in this medium-bodied wine. Spicy oaky earthy notes come out on the palate.

title: Bogle 2015 Merlot (California)
description: This wine smells sweet and spicy like ginger cookies and tastes relatively light, fruity and off dry. It's medium bodied, has a touch of good tannin and a lot of oak influence.

title: Paso Ranches 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: Dank herbs, damp cedar and black-cherry aromas show on the nose of this bottling. That forest-floor element carries to the palate with juniper berries and a cherry-reduction flavor.

title: Urban Legend 2014 Holland Landing Vineyard Tempranillo (Clarksburg)
description: This wine is ultrasmooth, mellow and almost sweet, like a dessert wine. It has nutty raisiny aromas and flavors backed by some deeper plum notes, and a broad texture with soft tannins.

title: Bennett Valley Cellars 2013 Bin 6410 Pinot Noir (Sonoma County)
description: This is a reduced, quite oaky wine up front, with a stemmy character of earthiness that presents as slightly odd. Black cherry defines the fruit component while a richness of caramel marks a background note.

title: 786 Wines 2016 Merlot (California)
description: Spicy aromas and jammy flavors make this medium-bodied wine exuberant and rich, turning off dry on the palate where the texture is velvety.

title: Rued 2014 Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: There's a lot of oak at the heart of this otherwise light-bodied wine, and after the oak is more oak. Lacking complexity, the flavors tend toward one-note versions of cranberry, red currant and pencil shavings.

title: Markus Wine Co 2015 Domo Red (Lodi)
description: Mellow flavors and a smooth luxurious texture make this medium-bodied wine easy to enjoy. Plum and cooked plum aromas lead to red cherry and black cherry on the palate.

title: Seven Oxen 2015 Grenache (Paso Robles)
description: This wine is very floral on the nose with rose petals and hibiscus, as well as plush strawberries and framboise. The palate is loaded with plummy flavors, proving both somewhat light and very extracted at the same time.

title: Tangent 2016 Paragon Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Edna Valley)
description: There's a strong flinty aroma that kicks off the nose of this bottling, giving intrigue to the squeezed lime and citrus skin scents. The palate starts with an apple cider-like flavor that's lifted by pine oil and a touch of wood smoke, all of which become more cohesive as the bottle opens up.

title: Truth & Valor 2014 Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Candied black-currant and licorice spice aromas meet with loamy soil and sarsaparilla on the nose of this wine, which is a tad overextracted. Cooked blueberry and prune flavors show on the sip alongside roasted chocolate and charred meat.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Limited Release Voltz Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This 100% varietal wine is herbal and brushy, with a hint of celery root. Hugely tannic and creamy thick on the palate, it features layers of cherry, vanilla and sweet oak.

title: Esser 2014 Sauvignon Blanc (Monterey County)
description: A slightly richer expression of the grape, this bottling shows ripe Asian pear, blanched almonds, baked apples and a slightly alkaline touch. The palate starts slightly sweet, with lemon-laced apple-pie flavors and finishes the same.

title: Francis Coppola 2014 Kicker Cane Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa County-Sonoma County)
description: Grippy and thick in extracted flavors of blueberry and black cherry, this wine ultimately finds a lighter side to itself, ending simply in soft mellowed tannins and well-behaved oak.

title: Harmony Cellars 2015 Sangiovese (Paso Robles)
description: There's a strong earthy swath of wet clay and mud on the nose of this bottling along with dried cranberry and carnation petals. The palate is lacking a bit in acid and tannins, but the mellow flavors of light cranberry, pomegranate and gravel are quaffable.

title: Jalopy 2016 Guns N Rosé (Los Olivos District)
description: A slightly orange shade of pink, this bottling, whose label features both guns and roses, shows dried orange and tart watermelon on the nose. There's a tangy aspect to the sip, which is somewhat sticky in texture, with orange peel and apple flavors, with cherry and vanilla rising on the finish.

title: Atlas Peak 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Reduced on the nose, this is a thick, rich wine hearty in black fruit and tight dusty tannin. Full-bodied in tobacco and oak, it finishes simply.

title: Bellante 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Concentrated fig and strawberry-balsamic aromas are quite syrupy on the nose of this bottling. The palate offers rounded mulberry fruit and peppery spice, but the vinegar aspect remains dominant.

title: Naggiar 2016 Mistero Estate Grown Red (Sierra Foothills)
description: Medium bodied, smoky and fruity, this wine has lively acidity and light tannins that carry the raspberry and red-cherry flavors well without any noticeable oak influence. It's leaner than other recent vintages. Best after 2020.

title: Pedroncelli 2014 Wisdom Vineyard Estate Cabernet Sauvignon (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Muted aromatics open slowly to unfurl herbal components of cedar and dried herb in this estate wine, blended with 4% Petit Verdot. Medium-bodied highlights of graphite and cassis are strong.

title: River Road 2016 Chardonnay (Sonoma County)
description: This is majority stainless steel fermented, offering a highly floral experience that's steely and stony on the palate. Vanilla and melon flavors expand on the broadly defined body of the wine.

title: River Road 2016 Reserve Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Fermented in both oak and stainless steel tanks, this wine invites in jasmine and apple blossom aromas before offering supple and substantial layers of creamy vanilla, baked apple, melon and oak.

title: Rolling Plains 2014 Reserve Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Extremely fruity and relatively light in body, this exuberant wine is easy to quaff. The strawberry and cherry flavors are so ripe and fresh they taste sweet, and the texture is soft and full with very little tannin.

title: Sculpterra 2016 Viognier (Paso Robles)
description: Aromas of Bosc pear, fresh citrus and a pinch of chalk show on the nose of this bottling. The wine hits the palate with a riper sweetness that washes into zesty wild lime rind flavors.

title: Vie Winery 2014 Petris Vineyard Bien Nacido Clone Syrah (Los Carneros)
description: This wine has stewy plummy flavors of dried and baked fruit that's dusty and textured on the palate. Sanguine, soft and simple, it lives up to its varietal character within a full-bodied voluptuousness.

title: Europa Village 2014 C'est La Vie Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Napa wine by a Temecula producer is very fruity on the nose, with smashed red fruit and stewed blackberry aromas most prominent. There is decent acidity to the sip, but the flavors lean toward prunes and very extracted fruit flavors.

title: Hawk Watch Winery 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (South Coast)
description: Clean aromas of ripe nectarine and Anjou pear skins meet with lime pith, cut grass and cement on the nose of this bottling from the San Diego area. An impressive texture grabs hold of the palate immediately, then gives way to baked apple and dried pear flavors that go down easy.

title: Montemar Wines 2014 Vogelzang Vineyard Sauvignon Blanc (Happy Canyon of Santa Barbara)
description: A very reductive take on the grape, this bottling shows lawn cuttings, guava skin, tangy green orange pith on the nose, but also hints of an oily underlying structure. Those aromas come together on the palate, with dried grass and citrus skins proving rather pungent.

title: Old Soul 2016 Petite Sirah (Lodi)
description: Aromas of charred wood and black pepper meet concentrated flavors of black cherry and blackberry in this full-bodied wine. A hint of sweetness rounds its edges on the palate and gives a jammy note to the finish.

title: Raymond 2014 District Collection Cabernet Sauvignon (Howell Mountain)
description: A tightly wound framework of bittersweet tannin and oak dominate in this mountainous red, which exhibits pencil shavings, cedar and sage around ripe full-bodied black cherry and plum.

title: Reyes 2013 Ryan's Blend Red (California)
description: Black fruit, dark lilacs and wet earth show on the nose of this blend of 54% Cabernet Sauvignon, 22% Merlot and 24% Petit Verdot. Elderflower and elderberry flavors show on the sip, which is tight and sticky in texture and could use a little more mellowing.

title: Whitehall Lane 2015 Tre Leoni Red (Napa Valley)
description: This affordable blend combines Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot, Syrah and Zinfandel. Elusive and thick in concentrated black fruit and leather, it offers massive, assertive tannins and a lasting imprint of dried herb.

title: Campos Family Vineyards 2015 Gigi's Blend Estate Red (Contra Costa County)
description: This medium-bodied, dry and spicy-tasting wine has a relatively light color, aromas like cedar and cinnamon and lean cherry flavors. A definite touch of tannin adds grip to the mouthfeel.

title: Castoro Cellars 2015 Reserve Barbera (Paso Robles)
description: In terms of sheer hedonism, this is a successful wine, full of oaky aromas of vanilla cake, caramel and plum pudding, loaded with crème brûlée and ripe fruit flavors. But the oak winds up feeling single-noted by the finish, and the grape seems lost in the seasonings.

title: Flowers 2015 Seaview Ridge Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Exotically floral, this wine is extreme in spicy acidity and robust earthiness, a mix of rose petal, citrus and black tea that struggles somewhat to find balance and fruit.

title: Mignanelli 2015 Pinot Noir (Central Coast)
description: Light rose buds, dried potpourri and tart cranberry aromas show on the nose of this appellation blend. The palate is a touch thin but with decent grip, and delivers easily likable flavors of cranberry and cinnamon.

title: Oak Grove 2016 Family Reserve Petite Sirah (California)
description: This wine is very fruity in flavor and almost sleek in texture, but still has the varietal's typical firm tannins and hints of black pepper in the generous black-cherry flavors. It's medium bodied, not too heavy or too astringent, so it will be more versatile than many.

title: Pali 2016 Riviera Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Earthy forest and mushroom belie a hearty, dense and velvety expression of rich dark cherry and huckleberry in this full-bodied powerful wine.

title: 5 Wine Co. NV Red (California)
description: This is a nice, juicy wine that has interesting fruit and earth aromas, good ripe berry flavors and an easy-going texture. It feels medium bodied and tastes not too strong and not too weak.

title: Black's Station 2016 Chardonnay (Yolo County)
description: This full-bodied wine is loaded with aromas of pear nectar and grilled baguette, and very ripe fruit flavors. It has a warmly oaky personality, showing vanilla and coconut in addition to generous pear notes.

title: Boeger 2015 Milagro Red (El Dorado)
description: Interesting bay leaf and clove aromas are followed by focused and bright black-cherry flavors and a vivid texture shaped by firm acidity and moderate tannins. It has a lean and lively feel and no oakiness.

title: Caricature 2015 Red (California)
description: Effusive aromas of strawberry and raspberry lead to rich, equally fruity flavors and a velvety texture that balances some tannin with a touch of ripeness. It's a full-bodied, mouth-coating and smooth blend.

title: Eagle Eye 2013 Estate Reserve AlphaWolf Vineyard Petit Verdot (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is tannic and dusty, a big, dense expression of a formidable grape that leers into smoky, dark and brooding territory. Blackberry and cherry drip from an herbal backdrop of intensity.

title: Summit Lake 2012 Sophia Lynn Petite Sirah (Howell Mountain)
description: This is a velvety thick and oaky red, aged some time in bottle. Somewhat herbal in clove, cedar and graphite notes, its texture is defined more by leather.

title: Vinum 2016 Chardonnay (Monterey)
description: There's the slightest pink tint to the color of this bottling, which shows baked apple and poached pear aromas on the ripe but pleasant nose. The palate is also quite ripe, showing more cooked pome fruit and squeezed lime, with a decent texture.

title: Windrun 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: This bottling is very mellow and shy on many fronts, though it emerges from its shell with patience. Light aromas of red fruit and dark spice lead into a palate with a full mouthfeel, carrying flavors of raspberry, rose petal, loam and eventually sharp baking spice.

title: Avensole 2013 Sole Serenade Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Baked licorice leads the nose on this blend of 74% Merlot and 26% Cabernet Franc, along with thyme and stewed elderberries. The mouthfeel is lighter bodied, carrying flavors of exotic marjoram and red currant.

title: Pull 2016 Estate Grown Chardonnay (Paso Robles)
description: This is a compelling wine at a good price point, showing warm aromas of hazelnut and baked bread along with fresh sprays of orange zest and honeysuckle. Toast and blanched almond flavors on the palate are lifted by citrus zest and gardenia.

title: Ruby Cellars 2013 Colson Canyon Vineyard Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: Black-currant sauce, concentrated violets and lilacs, milk chocolate and a hint of Dr. Pepper show on the nose of this bottling. The fennel spice extends through the palate, where candied Concord grape and blackberry-syrup flavors also arise.

title: Tessier Winery 2017 Zabala Vineyard Riesling (Arroyo Seco)
description: Aromas of ripe key lime and nectarine meet with edgier elements of pomelo pith and tangerine rinds on the nose of this single-vineyard expression. There's a clean, stony note to the palate, which also offers lime rind and lemon-cream flavors as well as a tense texture.

title: The Winery SF 2014 Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Winemaker Bryan Kane of Vie and Sol Rouge is behind this wine, which succeeds in offering fleshy, savory cranberry and Asian spice around a light delicate core that's balanced in acidity and style.

title: V. Sattui 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Napa Valley)
description: Floral and brimming in citrus-laden acidity, this is a creamy, lush example of the variety, with a strong peachy flavor and aromas of apple blossom.

title: Volker Eisele Family Estate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The 94% Cabernet Sauvignon and 6% Merlot were sourced from the producer's Chiles Valley estate and organically grown. Dried herb and olive present first around full-bodied notions of crisp cassis and red currant, finishing in a swath of nutmeg oak and firm tannin.

title: Zinke 2015 Roussanne (Ballard Canyon)
description: Almost a mustard yellow in the glass, this viscous, age-worthy bottling shows extremely nutty aromas of toasted walnut on the nose, along with dried lemon peels, beach sand and caramel cream. There is richness to the palate but the acidity holds it in check, offering flavors of crushed cashew, macadamia nuts and lemon rind.

title: Murphy-Goode 2016 Pinot Noir (California)
description: Delicious cherry and plum flavors are accented by touches of black tea, rhubarb and forest floor in this complex, medium-bodied wine. It's slightly soft in feel, but has light tannins and enough acidity to give it some snap.

title: Black Stallion 2014 Limited Release Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Dust and sage accentuate the oak and depth of flavor in this wine, which is soft and supple on the palate. Succulent flavors of black cherry, plum and anise carry well through the finish.

title: Bonny Doon 2017 Vin de Glaciere Viognier (Santa Ynez Valley)
description: Made by freezing the grapes prior to extraction, this dessert wine shows candied red apple, dried honeydew and a hint of tuberose on the nose. The palate is viscous but balanced by zesty acidity that penetrates deep into the finish, offering flavors of lime spritz and apple syrup.

title: Covenant 2014 Solomon Lot 70 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Perfumed in lavender and sage, this is a richly supple Kosher wine, exuberantly laced in dried herb and dark chocolate with a full-bodied background of polished tannin.

title: Gainey 2016 Limited Selection Chardonnay (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Soft nectarine flesh is cut by key lime and a touch of brioche on the nose of this bottling. It's relatively light and tightly focused on the palate, where poached pear, red apple, cherimoya and the slightest hint of butterscotch flavors arise.

title: Gundlach Bundschu 2017 Rhinefarm Rosé (Sonoma Coast)
description: Dry and made from older-vine Pinot Noir grapes, this wine is pinkish orange in hue, with crisp, firm flavors of strawberry, raspberry and cotton candy. Moderately structured, it has a welcome plushness on the palate.

title: Highway 12 2017 Pinot Noir Rosé (North Coast)
description: Nicely tangy and appetizing, this medium-bodied, absolutely dry wine smells like citrus blossoms and tastes like pink grapefruit. It has great balance, zingy acidity and good flavor concentration underneath.

title: Hoyt Family Vineyards 2012 Tempranillo (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated black currant is livened up with hints of espresso, olive and moist earth on the nose of this bottling. There is strong acid and decent tannins on the palate, framing the dark berry and baking-spice flavors.

title: Joel Gott 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (California)
description: This full-bodied wine is delicious, layered, complex and well balanced. It is compelling from the first whiff of melon and fig to the rich, concentrated palate.

title: MacLaren 2015 Samantha's Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Peppery and briary in brambly black fruit, this wine is varietal in all the best ways: complex, thick, concentrated and earthy. The sweet compost and wild strawberry elements are dipped in lingering aromatics of violet and rose.

title: Matthew Gibson 2013 Estate Primitivo (Sierra Foothills)
description: Concentrated ripe fruit flavors are well matched by spicy oak accents in this full-bodied firmly tannic wine. It has a darker than usual color—a combination of raspberry and black cherry flavors—and a gripping, mouth-filling texture.

title: Moniker 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This wine from Mendocino's Thornhill family offers a classic example of the variety. It shows tones of black cherry, wet earth and leather, framed in firm tannins and touches of sophisticated oak without being too full bodied.

title: Obscurity 2015 Estate Paso Vista Vineyard Petit Verdot (Fair Play)
description: Grapey, rich and ripe, this very fruit-forward but full-bodied wine from one of the Sierra Foothills' best sub-appellations is drenched in black fruit from the aroma through the finish. Hints of dark chocolate and oak spices chime in as the almost thick and lightly tannic texture floods the palate.

title: Bolero Cellars 2014 Garnacha (Temecula Valley)
description: Aromas of dried cherry, iron and smoke are set against a mineral-driven backdrop of volcanic soil, wet gravel and slate on the nose of this bottling. The palate is a bit like sucking on gravel at first: very schist-driven and flint-like. Then come waves of pomegranate, carnation and, on the finish, vanilla.

title: Bonny Doon 2015 A Proper Claret Red (California)
description: Fresh-pressed boysenberry meets with jammier plum-sauce aromas on the nose of this blend of 40% Merlot, 24% Petit Verdot, 21% Cabernet Sauvignon, 11% Cabernet Franc and 4% Malbec. This wine offers light herbal, spice and wood aromas while the palate proves very versatile and lively, with bright, tart pomegranate flavors and a touch of purple flowers.

title: Cambria 2015 Mesa Terrace Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Rich and hearty black cherry, clove, star anise and vanilla team with a bit of crushed slate minerality on the nose of this block-designated bottling. Dark berries, cola, chaparral herbs and white pepper show on the sip, where squeaky tannins arise toward the finish.

title: Davies 2015 Hudson Vineyards Pinot Noir (Carneros)
description: The second release from this site from this producer, Hudson provides bold, rich flavors of cherry coulis and blackberry, and a hint of chocolate-covered orange giving it both a decadent feel and a hit of freshness. Rose petal aromas add a pretty profile to the length and balance of acidity.

title: Kokomo 2015 Gopher Hill Peters Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a soft, smooth and decadent wine, gritty in texture and firm in structure. Candied cherry pie is seasoned in cinnamon and clove with dried herb adding a savory twinge between the medium-bodied layers.

title: Kokomo 2015 Winemaker's Reserve Timber Crest Vineyard Zinfandel (Dry Creek Valley)
description: Brawny and fully ripe in knock-down layers of tobacco, leather and baked dark fruit, this wine succeeds in its embrace of thick concentration and velvety luxuriousness. Richly robust, it finishes dusted in black pepper and cinnamon toast.

title: Leonard 2014 Branham Vineyard Zinfandel (Rockpile)
description: This wine is predominately Zinfandel, with 10% Carignane, 6% Petite Sirah and 3% Alicante Bouschet. Smoky bacon, cherry, citrus and watermelon all meld in this broadly structured, full-bodied red.

title: Pomar Junction 2014 Grenache (El Pomar District)
description: Cherry compote, warm cinnamon bread, plump raspberry and a hint of star anise make for a rich and spicy nose on this bottling. The palate shows similar character, with plush, soft and warm tones of red cherry and light clove spice.

title: Trombetta 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: There is an intensity of oak that greets the nose of this wine, leading to baked-fruit flavors of apple and pineapple, with and nutmeg offering nuance. Bright, persistent acidity cuts through the rich palate and complements its creaminess.

title: Lumen 2014 Sierra Madre Vineyard Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: There is a strong floral character to the nose of this single vineyard bottling, with pungent carnation and violet as well as red currant, black raspberry and incense. The sip is energetic with tart acidity, yet the mouthfeel is soft, creamy and nearly chalky, showing cranberry and cherry tomato flavors.

title: LXV 2015 X Reserve Cira Vineyard Merlot (Paso Robles)
description: Concentrated aromas of black cherry, earthy rust, cedar and warm vanilla make for a very pleasing and standard nose on this bottling. There is a lot of baking spice on the palate as well as plums, black cherries, sandalwood and a hint of cocoa, making for a complex sip.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 777 Clones Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine has a fresh carbonic liveliness on the palate—a burst of bubbly cherry and pomegranate flavor that is supported by sturdy tannins. Toasted oak is complemented by Asian five-spice and pretty aromas of rose.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Campbell Ranch Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This wine is juicy and broad in tannin, with a gritty layered texture of black cherry, blackberry and minty menthol. Cola spice rides along the palate with ease, providing a savory touch within a light-bodied weight.

title: Papapietro Perry 2014 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: This blends together the grapes of several vineyards within the appellation, including single-vineyard sites like Leras, Peters and Nunes. Brightly layered, it shines in strawberry and pomegranate tanginess, complemented by fresh acidity and a persistence of rose.

title: PreVail 2013 West Face Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Alexander Valley)
description: Perfumed, this 66% Cabernet Sauvignon and 34% Syrah blend showcases both varieties well, allowing a generously succulent, fleshy mouthfeel to impart flavors of cherry, vanilla and smoky oak. Made in a rounded approachable style, it retains acidity and complexity, nods to its mountainous beginnings.

title: Robert Biale 2014 Like Father Like Son Syrah-Petite Sirah (Napa Valley)
description: This blend of Petite Sirah and Syrah is beautifully structured and complex, robust in black cherry, blackberry and a bite of lasting tannin. Succulent secondary characteristics linger into black leather, pepper and earthy root.

title: Stolpman 2015 Originals Syrah (Ballard Canyon)
description: Smashed blackberry and mulberry mingle with black pepper and beef char on the nose of this bottling. It's still extremely young on the palate, not quite ready to release its bounty, but flavors of seared beef, tar, crushed marjoram, white pepper and forest floor indicate a compelling future.

title: Addendum 2014 Stagecoach Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Atlas Peak)
description: Soft, round and approachable in its fruit-forward succulence and full-bodied richness, this is a well-made complex wine. Red cherry and vanilla dominate secondary elements of cedar, leather and cola, finishing with a length of clove.

title: Archimedes 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: With 21% Malbec, this is a robustly impressive wine, smoky in oak, with teases of brick, cola and baked plum. Softly plush, it offers lasting acidity and freshness within a context of ripe power.

title: Azios 2013 Paradise Road Syrah (Santa Barbara County)
description: There are ample amounts of cola, stewed black cherry, star anise and sarsaparilla spice on the nose of this bottling from a vineyard deep up the Santa Ynez River. Black currant and violet flavors kick off the sip, which is framed by firm, sticky tannins and lifted by crushed Tellicherry peppercorns.

title: Idlewild 2017 Flora and Fauna Rosé (Mendocino County)
description: Piedmontese-inspired owner and winemaker Sam Bilbro, born, raised and based in Sonoma County, picks selectively to make this light, refreshingly complex wine, cofermenting 47% Nebbiolo with 28% Barbera and 25% Dolcetto. It holds its acidity well, balancing it against a backdrop of fruity tangy grapefruit and orange, with a mineral stoniness that's hard to pin down.

title: Newton 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Mount Veeder)
description: Dusty leather and an Old World savory and feral nose, are accented by dried herb and pyrazine in this sinewy red. Pencil shavings, cedar and black olive stay on the classic theme, with plush, expansive tannins gripping the palate with finesse.

title: Risk 2014 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: This memorable wine opens with a touch of noble reduction and diesel, showing complexity before opening in the glass. Dusty tar and chalky, polished tannin follow alongside dense, concentrated layers of black fruit, coffee and dried herb.

title: Rusack 2016 Santa Catalina Island Vineyards Chardonnay (California)
description: Very chalky and tight on the nose, this bottling from the extremely challenging vineyard on Catalina Island is a powerful success, also showing Meyer lemon sorbet and Asian pear aromas. It's tightly woven on the palate, with crushed white rock and key-lime spritz flavors, reminiscent of Chablis.

title: Shadybrook 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Coombsville)
description: A soft entry greets the palate of this well-made wine, complex in its earthiness and supple, polished tannins. With breadth and length, it shines in clove, leather and cedar, ending on notes of toasted oak and black cherry.

title: Stags' Leap Winery 2014 Audentia Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Stags Leap District)
description: A fine varietal wine blended with 20% Petite Sirah, this tastes of chocolate-covered cherry with sprinkles of white pepper. It's truly balanced in its youth, with a lasting grip of tannins that are pierced by fresh acidity.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Gap's Crown Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is linear and fresh, with a youthful intensity of tropical flavor and oak. Fennel, lemon peel, stone fruit and stony minerality are met by high-toned acidity that buzzes beneath the power and richness. This wine unravels slowly and with complexity.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Origin Durell Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: Brioche, hazelnut and a touch of apple skin rise on the nose of this lovely, rich and high-toned wine. Tart acidity presents as crushed rock and stone with a balanced sense of concentration and ripeness that makes it deliciously ready for the table.

title: V. Sattui 2015 Amador Ridge Vineyard Zinfandel (Amador County)
description: Effusive fruit aromas and flavors are well matched by complex wood, smoke and black pepper accents. The berry and cherry components taste quite ripe, and the oaky, spicy and gamy characters doesn't overwhelm the fruit. A generous mouthfeel completes the profile.

title: Hertelendy 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This is a big and billowy red, offering plenty of concentration. But its soul delivers underlying elegance, the tannins polished and lengthy, complementing the dark brooding plum, cocoa powder, marshmallow and coconut that meld together seamlessly.

title: Benovia 2015 Zinfandel (Sonoma County)
description: Generously rich and layered, this wine is also lovely in aromas of rose petal and lavender, its texture soft and supple. Dark cherry and red licorice give it fruity savory flavor around a full-bodied ripeness that will please a broad array of palates.

title: Levo 2017 E-99 No. 2 White (Santa Barbara County)
description: Winemaker Bret Urness isn't afraid to break with Old World traditions, and this atypical blend of 41% Chardonnay, 41% Roussanne and 18% Grenache Blanc shows why. The complex but seamless nose combines aromas of lemon, plum flesh, mango and a brush of almond. There is a toasty quality to the palate but also crisp lemony acidity, offering full flavors yet a tight texture.

title: Chateau St. Jean 2015 Le Seul Vineyard Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: The third release of this celebration of the Sonoma Coast, sourced from Gap's Crown Vineyard in the Petaluma Gap, this imparts lemon curd and apple skin in a robust body of concentrated richness and rounded texture. Tart, fresh and focused acidity balances the wine's larger-than-life tendencies.

title: Daou 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (Paso Robles)
description: This is a great way to experience the richness of Daou without hurting the bank account too much. Hedonistic aromas of candied black cherry, caramel, vanilla cake and cola lead into a rich and powerful palate that's soft in texture and lively with exotic plum and black currant flavors.

title: Davies 2015 JD Estate Grown Cabernet Sauvignon (Diamond Mountain District)
description: A substantial 16% Malbec are 8% Petit Verdot are blended into this tribute to the late Jamie Davies, doyenne and cofounder of the estate. Perfumed, thick in pillowy tannin and bright in acidity, it offers a supple texture extended in mocha, black pepper and clove, with strong, lasting flavors of chocolate-covered cherry.

title: Hestan 2015 Vincent Christopher Walala Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Turned earth and forest floor provide a savory context for this boldly ripe, rich red. Dark cherry and raspberry flavors are hearty and complex, complemented by an array of gritty mineral and layered texture.

title: Meeker 2015 Hone #2 Shimmer Christensen Family Vineyard Syrah (Russian River Valley)
description: Raspberry and blackberry aromatics are strong and inviting in this wine, alongside streaks of violet and white pepper. Dried herb and a mix of Asian and baking spice combine for a welcome complexity and length of power in this full-bodied 100% varietal wine.

title: Michael David 2015 Lust Zinfandel (Lodi)
description: Lust is one of the seven deadly sins, and this tiny-production wine from Michael David is a fitting adjunct to the winery's Seven Deadly Zins offering. Spicy, perfumed oak aromas and equally spicy oak flavors accompany deep tones of black cherry and dark chocolate. The wine has a thick coating of tannins that helps support all the richness and elevated body.

title: Noceto 2015 Riserva Barrel Select Sangiovese (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Elegant, almost delicate, this complex and inviting wine from a Sangiovese specialist is medium bodied, well balanced and offers mostly subtle flavors that weave nicely through a supple and lightly firm texture. It has dried cherry and cranberry aromas, tangy fruit flavors and fine-grained tannins.

title: Oakstone 2015 Reserve Estate de Cascabel Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Fair Play)
description: This wine from the Sierra Foothills is a minor classic, showing the textbook black-cherry and black-currant flavors, accented by hints of mint and cocoa, wrapped in a very firm but velvety texture of fine-grained tannins. Owner Steve Ryan made it from dry-farmed vines and aged it in French oak barrels for 22 months. Best now–2022.

title: Dolin 2015 Chardonnay (Malibu-Newton Canyon)
description: Elliott Dolin's wines continue to make the strongest case for the potential of Malibu viticulture. This bottling shows rounded aromas of lemon rind, white peach, tangerine and a touch of butter. There is great energy and grip on the sip, where nectarine flavors meet with sea salt and sandalwood.

title: Dutton-Goldfield 2015 Angel Camp Vineyard Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Rich in fruit and oak flavors, this medium to full-bodied wine has cinnamon and cedar aromas, ripe black cherry and red-cherry flavors, a firm and rather tannic texture and an oaky spicy finish. A sense of warmth and sweetness makes it hard to resist.

title: Foley 2015 JA Ranch Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: The inviting nose on this bottling combines rich black cherry, zesty raspberry, allspice and dried ginger aromas. The palate delivers big fruit flavors of baked boysenberries and ripe cranberries, which are balanced by a bit of tartness.

title: Foursight 2015 Charles Vineyard Clone 05 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: This wine is more full bodied and rich than first glance would suggest. It has a rather light red mahogany color. Generous strawberry and red-cherry flavors on a mouth-filling texture show light tannins and relatively soft acidity but plenty of viscosity. It was made from 100% Pommard clone vines and aged in 60% new French oak.

title: Furthermore 2014 Gloria Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: Smooth on entry, with a gravelly texture that develops in the glass, this wine welcomes with a strong perfume of rose petal and strawberry. High-toned, it integrates healthy portions of oak into the savory fruit, with a persistence of acidity on the finish.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Devil's Inkstand Winemaker's Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Alexander Valley)
description: This blends in 13% Petit Verdot and 6% Syrah, strong, powerful varieties that contribute power and dark color. Blackberry, chocolate and coconut ride a rich wavelength of soft mellowed tannin and fig flavor, finishing in a bite of graham cracker.

title: La Pitchoune 2014 Chenoweth Vineyard Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From a great site, this tiny production wine is dark gold in color and oaky on the nose. Baked caramel apple, lemon chiffon and nutmeg all play a role—bold flavors that highlight this well-made effort that offers a throughput of bright acidity.

title: Lumen 2015 Sierra Madre Vineyard Chardonnay (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Fresh lime-spritzer aromas meet with whiffs of smoke and wood ash on the nose of this bottling. The palate is extremely zippy, with sea salt and lemon-zest flavors on the forefront and more complex Brie rind, cashew cream and dried apple toward the finish.

title: Dashe Cellars 2015 Todd Brothers Ranch Old Vines Zinfandel (Alexander Valley)
description: Peppery, this old-vine wine is well integrated and thickly restrained, with a lip-smacking taste of blackberry cobbler and dark chocolate. Gritty tannins give it texture and ample weight, while a freshness of acidity persists.

title: Duckhorn 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Dusty plum, tobacco and dark chocolate play against a soft texture in this varietal wine with a Merlot-like sensibility. Black and red currant and cherry mix well on the fruity palate, seasoned in appropriate measures of cedar, black pepper and clove.

title: Eric Kent 2014 Las Madres Vineyard Syrah (Carneros)
description: Sanguine and smoky, this wine has a welcome herbal component that keeps it fresh and complex in the glass. Thick and densely concentrated in blackberry and plum, it persists in an underlying vibrancy that helps balance and complement its more luxurious tease of dark chocolate.

title: Ferrari-Carano 2013 Tresor Red (Sonoma County)
description: This classically styled Cabernet Sauvignon-driven blend shows power and structure in equal measure, with a backbone of integrated oak. Raspberry, black cherry and cassis flavors are succulently displayed along a carpet of thick concentrated richness.

title: Geyser Peak 2013 Reserve Alexandre Winemaker's Reserve Meritage (Alexander Valley)
description: Fully concentrated in dusty black fruit and tobacco, this blends 79% Cabernet Sauvignon, 15% Petit Verdot, 3% Merlot, 2% Malbec and 1% Cabernet Franc. Mellowed in terms of ripeness and body weight, it offers sizable tannins that provide structure along the midpalate.

title: Landmark 2015 La Encantada Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a potent smoky character on the nose of this bottling, with hickory and oak aromas wrapped around the strawberry and plum flavors. The palate is fresher in a note of red plum, yet smoke, salt, peppercorn and oregano tones pervade. It's savory without being rich, showing a strong backbone of acidity.

title: Nelle 2015 Maniacal G-S-M (Paso Robles)
description: There are loads of sagebrush, thyme, peppercorn and dried oregano aromas on this blend of 50% Grenache, 35% Syrah and 15% Mourvèdre, all set against a baked boysenberry frame. The mouthfeel is easygoing and airy, with flavors of tart berry, plum skins and more garden herbs. A peppery spice extends through the finish.

title: Oakville East 2014 Harter Family Double H Ranch Cabernet Sauvignon (Oakville)
description: A tiny production wine from a backbone site, used in many of the producer's other wines, this is brash in coconut and black currant, the tannins grainy and firm, given additional heft by the ripeness and generous use of oak. Velvety smooth, it's densely packed in black pepper and clove.

title: Paris Valley Road 2014 Merlot (California)
description: Mint and violet notes accent a dense black-cherry core in this full-bodied, juicy wine. Light touches of baking spices and dried herbs add complexity and play into a layering effect on the palate.

title: Ron Rubin 2016 Pinot Gris (Russian River Valley)
description: With a waxy nose of peach and apricot—both dried and fresh—this is a dry, light-bodied wine that dances on the palate in moderately high acidity. Fermented entirely in stainless steel, it remains softly textured and vibrant from start to finish.

title: Steven Kent 2014 BDX Collection Cabernet Franc (Livermore Valley)
description: This is a beautifully balanced wine with medium body and nicely firm tannins supporting fairly rich black fruits and herbal accents. It is sleek and agile rather than big and rich, and its appetizing texture should make it really versatile at lunch or dinner.

title: Topa Mountain Winery 2015 Bien Nacido Vineyard Reserve Pinot Noir (Santa Maria Valley)
description: Earthy aromas of pepper spice, roasted meat crust and red cherry sauce show on the nose of this bottling from a new property in Ojai. The flavors are clean yet pleasantly rustic, full of cooked herbs, dust and rounded cranberry. It's light in body, soft in texture and easy to drink.

title: Carlisle 2015 Bedrock Vineyard Zinfandel (Sonoma Valley)
description: This is an abundantly earthy wine, full of meat and black and white pepper. Cedar, pencil shavings and big-boned black cherry add to the intrigue, with a hint of black olive and substantial tannin that suggest aging. Enjoy best 2025 through 2028.

title: Carlisle 2015 Carlisle Vineyard Zinfandel (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's home vineyard in the heart of the appellation, this is dusty in plum, raspberry, black licorice and tobacco, with a lift of floral aromatics and grippy structure. It includes 12% mixed black and white varieties, from Grand Noir to Malvasia.

title: Le Vigne 2015 Cuore Della Vigna Red (Paso Robles)
description: Stewed pomegranates and red currants are lifted by vanilla and baking spice on the nose of this blend that's named after the “heart of the vineyard.” Rounded cherry and mulberry flavors show on the palate, which gains complexity from the licorice and red-flower flavors. This is easy drinking and boasts smooth tannins.

title: Lorimar 2014 Syrah (Temecula Valley)
description: This new winery is showing a lot of potential, and this bottling, which includes 5% Petite Sirah, is the strongest showing yet. Aromas of fresh-pressed boysenberry, licorice and baking spice head into a weighty palate loaded with mouth-coating polished tannins. The stewed berry and spice-cake flavors finish clean.

title: Hahn 2016 SLH Estate Grown Pinot Noir (Santa Lucia Highlands)
description: Ripe cherry fruit is cut by touches of rust and turned soil on the inviting nose of this bottling. The mouthfeel is thick and grippy, carrying rounded berry flavors, a hint of baking spice and some dried thyme on the back end.

title: La Barge 2015 Albariño (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Intriguing and unique aromas of lemon oil, sandalwood, incense and sea salt make for a distinct take on the grape from the Central Coast. The palate is racy while also nutty, showing Meyer lemon pith, hazelnut and a kiss of wood. Very savory and interesting wine.

title: Opolo 2015 Forte Reserve Collection Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: This reserve bottling takes some time to open up, but is quite elegant when it arrives. Aromas of muddy earth and dark fruit lead into a dense, lavish palate framed by firm tannins. Red plum and strawberry sorbet flavors rise above the loamy, clay-like elements at the core. Cocoa spice and a soft texture unfold with patience.

title: River Road 2016 Stephanie's Cuvée Pinot Noir (Green Valley)
description: With a bright, fresh and floral nose, this is a succulent and pleasurable wine, elegant and balanced, the fruit components layered in cherry, raspberry and strawberry.

title: Samsara 2014 Pinot Noir (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: There's a dark red-fruit element that starts the deep nose of this wine, but then come brighter red cherries, carnation and vanilla spice. Tart red cherries and nutmeg show on the sip, where a grippy texture and just enough acidity make for a solid appellation blend.

title: Tamber Bey 2014 Deux Chevaux Cabernet Sauvignon (Yountville)
description: Robust in tobacco, cocoa powder and black currant, this is a structured, integrated and ultimately balanced wine, softened by small additions of Merlot and Petit Verdot. It shows structure and grace within a wall of blackberry and vanilla.
