title: Verve 2015 Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: With a waxy, floral nose, this wine is made in a big style with power and concentration, its fruit profile marked by a wealth of raspberry and dark cherry. Present oak is spiked in persistent spice.

title: Vie Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Lake County)
description: This wine yields ripe citrus, melon and vanilla aromas, along with waxy minerally notes that add delicious complexity. It's technically light-bodied in terms of alcohol but fills out the palate nicely and lingers on the finish, echoing oak spice and mineral tones.

title: Blue Victorian Winery 2016 Sauvignon Blanc (Suisun Valley)
description: Lively fruit flavors and a little richness in the texture make a good combination for this full-bodied wine that tastes lightly oaky while balanced by a flood of grapefruit and lime. Made with 15% new oak and 8% Verdelho grapes, It is mouth filling and refreshing at the same time, which is a great combination.

title: Carol Shelton 2016 Wild Thing Damiano Vineyard Viognier (Placer County)
description: Ripe tropical fruit in the aroma, fresh clean flavors and a rich texture buoyed by good acidity make this medium-bodied wine easy to like. Barrel-fermented in mostly neutral oak, it's smooth and fairly broad on the palate, and stays nice and dry and firm on the finish.

title: Cast 2015 Bacigalupi Vineyard Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: From the famous site along Westside Road, this red is medium bodied and sultry, with a backdrop of Asian baking spice. Tangy pomegranate, orange and rose petal fill out its entry and midpalate with exotic fresh flavor.

title: Clos Solène 2016 Hommage Blanc White (Paso Robles)
description: Plumeria, honey and poached pear aromas show on the rounded, ripe and yet somewhat reserved nose of this blend of 75% Roussanne and 25% Viognier. The palate is both tropical and extremely fresh, with pear flesh and light guava flavors wrapped up in a bountiful acid and grippy texture.

title: MC4 2015 Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: A 100% varietal wine from a one-acre vineyard site, made in small amounts, this impresses in waxy cherry and vanilla flavors dipped in toasted clove. Soft, round and pleasantly approachable, it offers a touch of grip on the finish.

title: Peachy Canyon 2015 Bailey Zinfandel (Adelaida District)
description: A rich expression of the grape, this single-vineyard bottling shows hearty aromas of black currant and concentrated violets. There is a chalky structure and turned loam minerality to the palate, with Indian spice, pepper and cardamom enhancing the black plum core.

title: Pellet Estate 2014 Pellet Vineyard Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Elegantly soft and succulent, this wine is polished in tannin and integrated oak, with dark brooding flavors of black cherry and sage. Powerfully concentrated, it impresses from first sip, with a length of black pepper and clove.

title: Seven Oxen 2015 Reserve Zinfandel (Paso Robles)
description: Strawberry and raspberry sorbet meet with sweet wood, cherry blossoms, earth and leather on the nose of this reserve bottling. Herbal tones of oregano and marjoram frame the sip, surrounding the framboise and root beer core.

title: Medlock Ames 2016 Lower Slope Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged and fermented in stainless steel and in the barrel, this white is richly concentrated in baked flavors of quince and pear. Up-front in its intensity, it opens to reveal floral aromas and bright acidity midpalate and through a lengthy, lightly spiced finish.

title: Merryvale 2016 Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: Pretty in jasmine on the nose, this wine offers juicy stone fruit within a rounded, likable framework of balanced richness and lingering acidity.

title: Opolo 2014 Fusion Cabernet Sauvignon-Syrah (Paso Robles)
description: The aromatic background of this wine is full of blackberry, black plum and black-currant paste, but the foreground shows dill, spearmint and tarragon on the nose, with a hint of chocolate richness. The palate is dry, showing dark red fruit, leather and earth, with a tight tannic weave that will last for years.

title: Roberts & Rogers 2014 Louer Family Cabernet Sauvignon (St. Helena)
description: Somewhat reduced and tightly wound, this is a robustly ripe wine. The full-bodied palate offers soft layers of dense baked-fruit flavors, a dusty texture and considerable oak.

title: Strange Family Vineyards 2015 Blanc de Blancs Sparkling (Sta. Rita Hills)
description: Quite aromatic on the nose, this bottling begins with honeysuckle, lemon, Asian pear and orange-rind aromas. The palate is more tangy with grapefruit-rind and dried lemon-peel flavors, leading into a doughy finish.

title: Tablas Creek 2017 Dianthus Rosé (Adelaida District)
description: This pink blend of 49% Mourvèdre, 39% Grenache and 12% Counoise makes for a deep, almost rusty shade of pink, and delivers an intense nose of kirsch, clove and iron. The palate is full flavored with cherry and red-plum skins, making for a strong lively rosé.

title: Talley 2015 Pinot Noir (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: Pretty aromas of pomegranate, red-rose petals, carnations and hibiscus make for a fresh and juicy entry to this appellation blend. The relatively lighter-bodied palate is richer than expected, with deep pomegranate and hibiscus flavors.

title: Tamber Bey 2016 Sun Chase Vineyard Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: This Petaluma Gap-grown wine is stemmy in earthiness and a strong bite of tannin, its core juicy in red cherry and boysenberry, with a savory edge of forest and Asian spice.

title: Tognetti 2015 Aloise Francisco Vineyards Chardonnay (Los Carneros)
description: Pungent in nutty oak, this wine is hearty and reduced, with a steeliness on the palate. Mango, pineapple and brioche figure into the richness, while the midpalate tacks on a lemony brightness with moderate complexity.

title: Writer's Block 2015 Malbec (Lake County)
description: This is a sturdy, well-balanced and firmly structured wine that will pair nicely with birds and beef. It has enticing, light, toasted oak aromas, tasty black-cherry and blackberry flavors and an appetizing, moderately tannic texture.

title: Writer's Block 2016 Roussanne (Lake County)
description: A biscuit and almond aroma gives way to tangy but ripe lemon and apricot flavors that are subtle and satisfying. This medium-bodied oak-aged wine is on the austere side, but in a good way, as it compels continued sipping to get to the bottom of its complexity.

title: Matchbook 2015 The Arsonist Red (California)
description: This is a concentrated and truly dry Bordeaux-style blend that has a blackberry aroma and flavors of black cherry and dark chocolate. Firm tannins and good acidity give it plenty of structure, so it will easily stand up to steaks, chops and ribs. Made from Petit Verdot, Malbec and Cabernet Sauvignon.

title: Migration 2015 Dutton Ranch Pinot Noir (Russian River Valley)
description: The grapes for this wine are all from the cooler Green Valley area, grown in Goldridge soils. It's exotically earthy and robust in red berry, citrus and rose, with a density to the body ripeness and elongated tannin.

title: Nottingham Cellars 2015 Wolfe of Livermore Red (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine is deep in color, bursting with black-fruit aromas and juicy, almost chewy blueberry and blackberry flavors that it wraps in a firm layer of tannins. Made with 50% Merlot plus Cabernet Sauvignon and Cabernet Franc, it tastes dry in a good way and grips the palate nicely.

title: Poseidon 2015 Boon Fly's Hill Chardonnay (Carneros)
description: New oak shapes the texture and heavily dominates the flavors of this firm and spicy wine. It shows vanilla and nutmeg in the aroma, and crisp apple flavors seasoned with ginger and cinnamon. Good acidity and a touch of tannin make it snappy on the palate. Aged in new Hungarian barrels, it needs some time to mellow. Best after 2020.

title: Pride Mountain 2014 Vintner Select Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This hearty 100% varietal wine combines clove, cinnamon and blackberry pie within a highly aromatic introduction teased in violet. Intensely spicy and baked in flavor, it finishes in black pepper and pipe tobacco.

title: Three Sticks 2016 Pinot Blanc (Sonoma Coast)
description: From the vineyard made famous by Pinot Noir and Chardonnay, here is an aromatic white, steely on the nose in lemon oil and white flowers. On the palate it is lushly layered and velvety, bright with heft.

title: Vasco Urbano 2015 Norm Marina Ranch Grenache (Livermore Valley)
description: This full-bodied wine pleases the palate with great balance and a nice combination of fresh fruit and light spice flavors. Hints of new leather and sunbaked earth temper strawberry and cherry notes, and mild tannins add some good grip to the texture.

title: Vigilance 2016 Chardonnay (Red Hills)
description: Lots of butter and baking spices waft from the glass before lush pear, apple and butterscotch flavors coat the palate. This full-bodied wine is very nicely crafted in a big smooth style that emphasizes viscosity and ripeness.

title: Beringer 2014 Private Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: The reserve-worthy wine is made from vineyards across the valley, with the majority coming from Howell Mountain and St. Helena. It reflects the power of mountain fruit with dense sweet tannins, black-inky color and swathes of toasted oak, the big body accented in sanguine currant and cassis.

title: Round Pond 2015 Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Rutherford)
description: Woody cedar, toffee and coffee highlight a soft, richly concentrated core of full-bodied power and brawny tannin in this reserve-level wine. Black fruit has a smoky edge of toast and oak and is intensely concentrated.

title: Sangiacomo 2016 ViMaria Pinot Noir (Sonoma Coast)
description: Named in honor of Vittorio and Maria Sangiacomo, the producer's forebears, and made in small amounts by winemaker James MacPhail, this is a hearty, impressive wine sourced from several sites, including Roberts Road. Soft and silky in strawberry, pomegranate and orange, it is floral and powerful, lingering on the finish in chocolate-covered plum.

title: Santa Barbara Winery 2017 Chardonnay (Santa Barbara County)
description: One of the original bottlings from the region, this is always a reliable and classic coastal Chardonnay. Tangy aromas of grapefruit, orange and chalk lead into a tense palate where racy acidity frames apple rind and lime flavors.

title: Shannon 2015 Home Ranch Reserve Cabernet Sauvignon (Lake County)
description: Ripe in flavor and brawny in structure, this full-bodied wine offers enticing aromas of oak spice, sunbaked earth and olive. Blackberry and plum flavors glide along the palate, with moderate tannins and firm acidity to keep it grippy and balanced.

title: Skinner 2015 Six Horse Zinfandel (El Dorado)
description: This full-bodied wine has a high ripeness factor and also a solid structure of fruit acidity and moderate tannins to nicely support the jammy raspberry and blackberry flavors that are so tempting.

title: Swanson 2015 Merlot (Napa Valley)
description: This is a fine wine, blended with 12% Petit Verdot and 9% Cabernet Sauvignon. Perfumed in violet and sage, it has grip and expansive weight flavored in red currant and plum. The finish is soft, lush and dusted in cocoa powder.

title: Talley 2016 Chardonnay (Arroyo Grande Valley)
description: This appellation blend is a very down-the-middle style of classic California Chardonnay, with ample amounts of oak, butter, baked lemon and ripe apple on the nose. The palate pairs golden apples with buttercream and a light brush of vanilla, with acid that powers deep into the finish.

title: The Calling 2014 Our Tribute Cabernet Sauvignon (Moon Mountain District Sonoma County)
description: Brawny, expansive and dipped in leather, this robust red shows big tannins and a soft velvety texture. The flavors meld together seamlessly in a celebration of blackberry jam, toffee and pepper.

title: Townley 2015 Alder Springs Vineyard Syrah (Mendocino)
description: Intense in structure, this is a tightly wound wine with powerful tannins and full body. It smells like black pepper, blackberries and oak, and tastes dry and firm, as the fruit elements are blanketed securely by tannins. It will need time to mellow. Best after 2023.

title: Winery by the Creek 2015 Reserve Delfino Vineyards Primitivo (Fair Play)
description: Extra-deep and ripe fruit flavors pack this full-bodied wine to bursting, from black cherries in the aroma to floral and grapey notes on the palate. It's full bodied and has moderate tannins for a nice grip in the mouth.

title: Thirty-Seven 2016 Pinot Gris (Sonoma Coast)
description: Grippy, floral and meaty on the palate in stone fruit and key lime, this is a thirst-quenching, dry and deliciously balanced white that's perfect as an aperitif or at the table.

title: Ancien 2017 Sangiacomo Vineyard Pinot Gris (Carneros)
description: Light, soft and creamy on the palate, this wine is richly layered in floral aromas of apple blossom and jasmine. On the palate expect high-toned acidity and lovely flavors of honey, apricot and quince.

title: Balletto 2016 Estate Grown Estate Bottled Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: This wine is a dry, expansive and fleshy expression of lemon, lime and Gravenstein apple. The oak is supportive and lightly toasted, giving it a warm, inviting undertone.

title: Bee Hunter 2015 Mariah Vineyards Sauvignon Blanc (Mendocino Ridge)
description: This late-release wine has an attractive buttery aroma, baked apple flavors and a nicely rich texture. It expands into canteloupe and light fig on the midpalate and those flavors linger on the finish.

title: Bee Hunter 2015 Pinot Noir (Anderson Valley)
description: Powerful fruit flavors, a firm structure and light oak shadings make this full-bodied wine enjoyable on its own terms but also a great pairing for roast duck or pheasant or simply sautéed mushrooms.

title: Benovia 2016 Chardonnay (Russian River Valley)
description: From the producer's Martaella Estate Vineyard, planted to heirloom clones, this is a lovely white, buttery in texture with a crisp backbone that balances the lushness on the palate with freshness. Green apple, blood orange and toasted oak mingle effortlessly and with a touch of spice.

title: Binz 2015 Sleeper-Crain Vineyard Barbera (Shenandoah Valley (CA))
description: Deep dark fruit flavors are matched by oaky spices in this dark-colored, full-bodied and moderately tannic wine. It has a touch of the varietal's usual acidity underpinning vivid cherry and blackberry flavors, while fine-grained tannins give a velvety feel to the texture.

title: Bishop's Peak 2017 Chardonnay (San Luis Obispo County)
description: This twist-top bottling is an excellent choice for affordable, crisp style of Chardonnay that would go well with shellfish. Aromas of pear flesh and chalk lead into a grippy palate that's full of wet stone minerality and citrus flavors.

title: Bouchaine 2016 Las Brisas Vineyard Riesling (Carneros)
description: A waxy nose of apricot leads to flavors of peach and lime on the palate in this fresh, fleshy white. The moderate acidity enlivens and elongates the finish.

title: Broadside 2016 Printers Alley Red (Paso Robles)
description: Black plum and black cherry meet with dried fennel frond on the nose of this blend of 50% Cabernet Sauvignon, 30% Merlot and 20% Petit Verdot. Wrapped in a chalky mouthfeel, the palate brings broad red-fruit and baking-spice flavors with a hint of dried herbs.

title: Van Ruiten 2016 Pinot Grigio (Lodi)
description: This light-bodied wine has a lively, slightly spritzy texture and lots of vivid canteloupe and peach flavors accented by earth and white pepper. It's definitely better than your average neutral-tasting Pinot Grigio.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Garcia Ridge Red (San Luis Obispo)
description: Black plum, black grape, fresh purple flowers, lavender and Dr. Pepper aromas show on the nose of this blend of 50% Zinfandel, 40% Merlot and 10% Cabernet Sauvignon. Those somewhat primary flavors also show on the fruit-punch-like sip, with is candid and joyous but nearly cloying with sweetness. Sharp acidity rises on the finish.

title: Big Vine 2013 Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: This wine is a tad disjointed and hard to define, lacking in structure but big on vanilla bean and baked-apple flavor, with a hint of honeysuckle on the nose.

title: Ca' Momi 2015 Rosso Red (California)
description: A strong charred-oak element dominates but doesn't overwhelm this medium-bodied and firmly textured wine. It has smoky beefy black-pepper notes over some mild blackberry flavors.

title: Charles Krug 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This Cabernet Sauvignon is bolstered by small portions of Petit Verdot and Merlot. Graham cracker, plum and dark cherry characterize the full-bodied, ripe flavors that ride along a smooth approachable texture.

title: Gibbs 2014 Three Clones Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: This wine includes small percentages (5% each) of Merlot, Petite Sirah and Petit Verdot. Altogether the experience is confectionery in marshmallow, mocha and blueberry, with a perception of sweetness amid its soft pillowy tannins.

title: Martin Ranch 2015 J.D. Hurley Zinfandel (Santa Clara Valley)
description: Charred cedar is strong on the nose of this bottling along with sweet black cherry aromas. The palate is also very woody, with damp forest and pine oil flavors overcoming the tangy red fruit.

title: Roth 2015 Chardonnay (Sonoma Coast)
description: This is a robust oak-driven white, rich in baked and concentrated apple, melon and pineapple flavors. The structure is moderate if not somewhat muddled, with a nuttiness that comes through on the finish.

title: Sonoma Port Works 2012 Petite Sirah (Clarksburg)
description: Large doses of smoky oak and sweet spices light up this powerful full-bodied dessert wine, which is very sweet and has an almost thick, viscous texture that coats the mouth.

title: Vintage Cowboy 2015 Manchego's Fate Red (San Luis Obispo County)
description: Densely packed rose petals, red currant and boysenberry syrup and a hint of sagebrush make for a fruity and ripe nose on this blend of 60% Merlot, 20% Cabernet Sauvignon and 20% Zinfandel. Tart dusty wild red fruits meet with pepper and lavender on the palate, which is a little disjointed.

title: Hanna 2017 Sauvignon Blanc (Russian River Valley)
description: Aged on lees in stainless steel, this wine presents as reduced and somewhat closed, with a green bean and jalapeño component that distracts.

title: Havens 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Napa Valley)
description: Barbecue smoke and sweet baked plum combine somewhat disjointedly in this simple take on the variety, which finishes in a strong taste of tobacco.

title: Mt. Konocti Winery 2015 Rogers Vineyard Zinfandel (Lake County)
description: Very ripe and fruity, and quite sweet, this full-bodied wine oozes blueberry and blackberry jam, and feels soft and luscious. The sugar element is high enough to relegate this wine to dessert.

title: Oak Grove 2015 Family Reserve Winemaker's Red (California)
description: Very fruity and moderately sweet, this medium-bodied wine has a smooth texture and a generous array of crushed raspberry, strawberry and blackberry flavors.

title: Sobon Estate 2014 Cabernet Sauvignon (Amador County)
description: Heavy oak aromas and flavors drench this wine with wood smoke, camphor and clove for an extreme personality that will divide consumers. It's medium to full-bodied, moderately tannic and finishes with a sweet sensation from all that wood.

title: Sanglier Cellars 2014 Boar's Camp Proprietary Red (Sonoma County)
description: This medium-bodied blend of 42% Syrah, 29% Grenache and 29% Mourvèdre is earthy, floral and pungently rustic, with a kick of greenness on the back palate.

title: Callaway 2015 Calliope Red (Temecula Valley)
description: Light in color, this blend's red-currant and cranberry aromas meet with mossy earth and a bit of barnyard funk. The palate is sour and gamy.

title: CK Mondavi 2014 Scarlet Five Red (California)
description: One of the sweeter red blends, this wine is made from the five red grape varieties traditional in Bordeaux and has nice grapey aromas and juicy fresh blackberry and raspberry flavors. Best to serve it lightly chilled.

title: It's a Headsnapper 2015 Radiant Red (California)
description: Spicy oak accents meet jammy grapey fruit flavors in this medium-bodied, richly textured and lightly sweet wine.

title: Ca' Momi 2016 Heartcraft Chardonnay (Napa Valley)
description: Sweet, honeyed and confectionery, this wine is for fans of the style: light-bodied and tasting of baked tropical fruit.
